V1: Staff very friendly and helpful  Impressed with the professionalism of the staff  Everything had quailty.

international menu was very limited  I found your tours on offer did not cater for the single person,only couples or groups.  The music coming from Oasis was to loud in the evening,familys like to sleep around 9.00pm.  building site noise constant from 7.00am to 10.00pm,very irritating to say the least.  Should of a time limit for working being so close to a Hotel.  Not Hotel fault but driving me NUTS!!

Third time we have visited this hotel. excellent service and fabulous spacious rooms. Would recommend to friends.
Kids club needs to be functional. back gate needs repairing so you can get easy access to beach. Really pleased you have made internet freely available as this was problematic in the past.

The room was basic clean and tidy on arrival. The catering staff were very pleasant, efficient and helpful as we purchased most of our own food on occasions and they cooked it for us

The carpet in the room was stained from a previous flooding from the bathrooom which also needed som regrouting of the tiles.  The ventilater extractor did not appear to be working.  The television was old and some fascilities did not work on it but we didn't go there to watch television.  The food in the restaurant was limited and repetitive . I asked on our application for " Soya " products due to a dietary problem with Dairy products but no notice was taken of my request.  So I obtained all products from a local supermarket within 200 yards of the hotel. I would suggest the Management staff spend a night at the Ramada Viking Hotel in Waterford and sample the breakfast and food on offer and the attention of the staff in every detail as the cost of a stay and for the food on offer is about the same but the difference in vast.

rooms were nice and clean. house keeping staff were very good. the gardeners did a wonderful job with the gardens keeping them well maintained. enjoyed out free on arrive spa. the staff attended to our request quickly.

Amazing hotel near the centre. The hostess was extremely friendly and helpful - she really made the stay special. Would definitely stay there again!

Very nice reception, easy to fined, only 15-20 mins drive into Liverpool 30 mins to Manchester, good parking spaces. very clean, no bath, but large walk-in shower was excellent.

The only negative was the bed and pillows, I found the bed hard, but that is a personal choice, the pillows were flat and hard and I asked at reception to have them changed, but nothing happened, I was only there 2 nights so it was not a great deal.

Absolutely outstanding in every  possible. We've stayed at a number of five star hotels around the globe and this experience was by far and away the best. Perfect in every ! I don't normally do surveys either, but simply had to for Grosvenor House!

Absolutely outstanding in every  possible. We've stayed at a number of five star hotels around the globe and this experience was by far and away the best. Perfect in every ! I don't normally do surveys either, but simply had to for Grosvenor House!

The hotel  may not be modern but it has character and charm.  The room we had (superior) was small but adequate.  The bedroom and bathroom were clean, the bed was comfy, there were coffee making facilities in the room, free wi-fi - what more do you need on a city break.  The staff were pleasant, anything you need you only had to ask.  There was a good variety on the breakfast buffet - cereals, yoghurt, fruit, meats, cheeses, salad, breads and croissants, and of course Danish pastries - and all of good quality.  The hotel allowed us to leave our luggage on the day of departure and we came to collect it just before we needed to leave for the airport.  All in all, I thought the hotel was lovely and really enjoyed our stay here.

Very nice hotel. Clean rooms, nice swimming pool and good facilities.

The breakfast is not up to standard to this hotel. The fried eggs are only warm when put in the tray, the bread isn't fresh and the toaster only has a timer end no control for heat. It happened more than once that the water for tea was not available anymore and the staff to refill was nowhere to be seen.
Very nice hotel. Clean rooms, nice swimming pool and good facilities.

location of the hotel is great, very central and close to the tube.

The double bed was 2 singles pushed together.. which were very uncomfortable and very unsuitable! when booking a double i would expect a double bed to be standard!!  We paid extra for the full English breakfast which i would not recommend, not very tasty at all. the bacon was the cheapest streaky bacon and the sausages were like beef sausages i think?? quite vile!!

Expensive.  Was upset that i was not allowed to go to the Pa;ace to take pictures.  Was on my honeymoon, was not made to feel special at all.

Sagging room toilet door sagged and cannot close, was not fixed even on the day of check out.  Air-conditioner was not effective  Maids come to clean the room but did not replace fresh towels after removing the soiled one.  Taxis outside hotel are daylight robbers as they operate without meters.  I have to get hotel staff to book metered Golden bird or AA taxis and I have to board the taxis at the basement carpark as I was told these taxis cannot pick up passengers at the hotel driveway.  Buffet breakfast need improvement as the buffet spread looked unappetizing and lack choice. Service staff need more training to manage the guest
Room clean and comfortable, staff helpful
Bar ran out of draught beer and bottles of white wine
The hotel has a good location, staff are friendly and helpful. Only stayed one night the beds were comfortable and room was big.
The hotel has a good location, staff are friendly and helpful. Only stayed one night the beds were comfortable and room was big.
The front desk, concierge and housekeeping were great. I loved the breakfast. The hotel was accessible and I loved the garden.

The wifi was below Starwood grade, in fact it is substandard even for room wifi that was complimentary for spg gold members. I chose wifi instead of points that was useless even when you added a wifi modem, the problem was the weak source. You have to keep up with the times. I came from Barcelona w hotel and what a difference when it comes to wifi, the fact that it is free will not cut it.

The hotel was great we were in the heart of the city and man that checked us in was fantastic he gave us lots of advice. The rooms were of a reasonable size good shower and very clean.What made it for us was the little pool and sun loungers up on the roof.All the staff were very friendly and always had a smile o the their face.Breakfast was good as they had everything you needed to start the day.
Very cheap, clean rooms within a few hundred meters of a metro stop that could take you into central Shanghai.

No internet in the room, only in the lobby.  When asked, the staff said it was broken.  No laundry facilities either.  There was a small dryer and a small dishwasher, but that didn't work out as something I was willing to wash clothes in.  The surrounding area is not nice but did not seem dangerous.  A few local restaurants and a Chinese Walmart will keep you going in between your trips to Shanghai.  I would stay in the French Concession or Bund if you can afford it.  If not, this is a clean, cheap place to stay.

The staff in the main restraunt (buffet) where always helpful and polite.  Sofia, who worked the on the grill in the mornings was always helpful, polite and a pleasure to talk with.
The telephone was not working and we could not use room service or request assitance when the bathroom was flooding and our products ruined.  We had to call the front desk on our mobile phone.
Beautiful decor, pleasant and helpful staff, great cocktails!
The hotel, look professional, comfortable and had a nice calm relaxing environment for everyone. the bedroom view was outstanding.
The shower did not work in room 245  I did not eat, so why I have to mark?

Newly refurbished rooms to a high standard. Amenities were great aswell as cleanliness. Facilities in the room were great especially the 42" tv and the rainfall shower, robes and slippers and excellent touch.   The breakfast which was included in our rate was top notch! Food was hot and plenty of choice, great  to start the day.  They even remembered it was one of the party's 60th birthday and surprised her with a complimentary bottle of £27 sparkling wine! An excellent touch!

Very helpful and friendly staff, warm atmosphere, fabulous continental breakfast especially the blueberry muffins! Room was clean with good facilities. We even got a free upgrade! Couldn't wish for a better hotel!
The sun loungers don't have adjustable reclining difficult when reading.

Staff very friendly and helpful - a credit to the hotel. Breakfasts were very good and plentiful. we had 2 evening meals which were also very good. Bedroom cleaned daily - sheets also changed daily.  The GHA experience was worth joining, providing a daily paper and free wifi which otherwise charged at 15euros per day!!
Outdoor pool MUCH TOO COLD and disappointing that it is hardly used.  Our room was on the 6th floor and really could do with a refurbishment.
The rooms were very clean.

Did not feel welcome at all as we had our 2 teenage boys with us, we felt watched all the time. Would never recommend anybody to this hotel.   The bolier in the breakfast area is dangerous, this hotel needs money spending on it to inprove.

The hotel is beautifully positioned with views across a lovely bay.   Room was clean and well appointed.  Staff were extremely polite and attentive.    The cleaners were excellent with regular refreshes and a turn down service.
We booked half board but were unable to enjoy the Sunday lunch buffet as it was fully booked.    This was a disappointment as I didn't expect to have to book a meal with a half board reservation.

great stay, with seaview from balcony..apart from the large tree spoiling some of the view.

swimming pool changing room locker keys most did not work and needs to be more spacious and cleaner. parking needs to be more spacious for each bay..more tables for breakfast time and trays to put plates on as plates too hot.
Dinner menu choice of only 2 mains courses disappointing
Dinner menu choice of only 2 mains courses disappointing
The hotel was amazing. Felt that the staff were professional, friendly and had a good understanding of the hotel. I would stay there again

I have no negative comments about the hotel, but I do about hotelopia. We called your call centre to look into if it was possible to change our booking, which copthorne had the room to do, but found the phone assistance from your corporation very abrupt, not at all helpful and  at one point we had to ask her to listen to what we were trying to ask as she didn't give us a chance to talk. I felt from her there no customer service at all. I will stay at the copthorne again and have recommended it to others but I will not use your wed site again or recommended it to others it will in fact be the opposite.
The hotel was amazing. Felt that the staff were professional, friendly and had a good understanding of the hotel. I would stay there again

I have no negative comments about the hotel, but I do about hotelopia. We called your call centre to look into if it was possible to change our booking, which copthorne had the room to do, but found the phone assistance from your corporation very abrupt, not at all helpful and  at one point we had to ask her to listen to what we were trying to ask as she didn't give us a chance to talk. I felt from her there no customer service at all. I will stay at the copthorne again and have recommended it to others but I will not use your wed site again or recommended it to others it will in fact be the opposite.

The room itself was spartan but clean and the air con worked well. There were no blankets, however, and although the manageress said she'd switched on our cooker and fridge from reception, they did not work. When we tried to remedy this the next morning and also get the WiFi key, we found the office closed. The manageress finally opened up at 11am, her excuse was that she opened so late because she had a headache.   In summary, a nice place in an excellent location, spoiled by poor management. Thank goodness we got such a good deal from Hotelopia, it's not worth paying the full rate - 90 Euro - to stay there.
For the less than 50 euro’s per night it’s a very good deal (value for money)
The hotel is located between the airport and the city. If you go early in the morning or late afternoon to the center, then it takes you at least 30 minutes to get to there.
Nice poolarea whith sunbeds . Cleen rooms, free wifi near lobby, lovley wive from the pool. Quiet at night.
Friendly staff, nice view, clean, at walkdistance to Biograd.
Great location by harbour, great staff. free secure car park. lovely pool. Free wi-fi in reception.

One end of the hotel is very close to a roundabout and a road runs behind as well. There can be traffic noise because of this, I found weekends worse as there were more noisey motorbikes.  Some of the hotels room furnishings are a bit worn out. Self catering facilities fairly basic (but all clean).  Don't let this put you off, for the price this is a very good hotel and without exception the staff are all lovely.

I was very disappointed. Upon entering the hotel no one was there togreet us, never mind help us with our bags. The rooms were very dated, smelt very musty and the chair in our first room was torn. I phoned reception to complain and waited for twelve minutes but no one picked up. Evenjtuly I went downstairs to complain.  After waiting ten minuss to see the manager i witnessed that no one else was greeted or helped with their bags either, including a man with disqbility. We were shown to another room which wasn't too much of an improvement on the first.   For the price we paid I was shocked at the standard of the service and the rooms.
The nicest staff I ever met in a hotel

A lot of facilities. Good information and help at the reception. Very usefull that gasts can book a trip at the reception. Good information for trips in many languages. Friendly staff of all people working in the hotel. Very good food for a reasonable price. Good service in the dinningroom, good and quick technical service. Very quick respons after our message that the tv was not working in the room. Warm water in the swimmingpool. Enough sunbeds and place around the swimmingpool. Large appartments with good equipment, a large bathroom and balcony. Always warm and enough water in the shower in the appartment. A hairdrier and safety box in the appartment. Free internet all over the hotel!

The only important thing we can mention is that it is a pitty that the bedroom in the appartments is located just next to the corridor. This can be very disturbing late in the evening, when people are walking and talking through the corridor. Another negative thing is that there is no window which can be opened in the bedroom. We are used to sleep with open window. After the first night with disturbance, we moved our beds to the livingroom / kitchen, which was a good sollution! So we had a good sleep after all during the rest of our holliday.   A less important complaint is that you have to pay 1 euro to use the scale to weight your luggage. This should be free. The weight from the same luggage was not the same at the airport, so it did not help us much to use the scale.   The instruction (in signs) to use the safety-box was not clear, since we could not mannage to close the box. It would be helpfull to have an extra written instruction.

The apartement was nice and big with lots of light. It also had a nice view of th garden, even though it was located one floor below  street level. We felt imediatly at home there. We would stay there again.

Some of the furniture (kitchen) was a little worn, but still working fine. While the rooms were generaly clean there were some places the cleaning staff obviously missed (between sofa and chair coushins, under the sink). The facilitys were all right. Unfortunatly the shower only dispenses cold or slightly warm water. The radiators only seemed to function randomly so the appartment was a little cold.   All these points didn't bother us too much, since we only stayed 3 days. We didn't mention any of this to the staff either. For a longer stay this might have been more of a problem.
Hotel smart and tidy and well run. The pool is a added bonus and very clean and staff very helpfull.rayd
No view, surroundings are not very smart. No outside space for drinking and relaxing in the sunshine.
Final tax de jour and parking added on booking out (30 Euros). This was not made clear early in booking process.

The activities, food and hotel were amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone. The quality of the food and the choice was excellent. There was a great and amazing selection. The animation team were great! The room were spacious, the set up of the hotel was amazing...

The staff need to highlight the fact that the hotel is far away from the city center, there is a shuttle alright but it only brings to the Jmal Ef Fnaa place. The cost of taxi fare is 18eur a go. The hotel reception staff were friendly but not really professional. Each time we asked a question the information was uncertain or confused. We asked for room service and we had to wait 1h to get the food which arrived cold. We were told to be patient...as we rang twice to find out what was the status of the order, that was 45 min after we've ordered.... Also the cost of the food is expensive if you don't go all inclusive. The buffet cost needs be mentioned to guests when booking B
Beautiful hotel ,fab food and lovely staff

Fully deserves all its previous good reviews and more. Service was impeccable. General manager Andreas always around and very accessible and helpful.  Food very good and plenty of it, buffet menu had a different theme each night.
No real negatives for us.  Some guests may not like the cats, there are a lot about the hotel.

The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived and throughout our stay. The hotel was in a very peaceful location and had a lovely large swimming pool and outdoor cinema. The buffet breakfast and dinner was very good with a large selection of food to choose from.
The hotel could have done with a variation of evening entertainment. It only had a couple of beach bars in walking distance no town near by so needed to hire a car or get a taxi.
Staff knowledge of local restaurants. Directed to not particularly nice area with no family  places to eat which was what we asked for.
tasty food, sensational chef
unpleasant and waiting for tipping service  small, cramped rooms, no rooms with a single bed
Friendly stuff, great animation team ,theatrical good. Amazing breakfast, good fruits,salads, everything  The stuff take care of you all the time.
the breakfast just simple, not grand at all.
Staff were great very friendly and helpful. Great location near to all the nightlife.

Beware the prostitutes/pickpockets on the corner by buddies bar. They surrounded my friend and by the time he realised what was going on they had stolen his gold chain from around his neck. I know this is not the fault of the hotel but I would not stay there again for this reason.

This hotel was very good considering the Price. I was very please with my comfy bed and the location.  Extremely quite and signs everywhere asking for quite after 11pm.   The restaurants were very reasonable and the Japanese restaurant was excellent.  The staff in fantastic. Young pleasant and full of fun. Loved there attitude. Went out of there  to make life easy. Exceptional. Thank you.

I only have one and that goes for all hotels.   Wish there was rooms for a single traveler. We pay for two for everything.  I wonder if there is any  you can divide bedrooms so a bathroom can be shared by tow single.??
Overall very clean room, good facilities with gym and swimming pool.
Detect some cockroach at kitchen area. No free wifi.

Very friendly staff, extremly helpful with any questions, reservations etc. the rooms are big and modern, only the traffic smell from the man road is a little disturbing if you want to one the window. Overall, very good!
The overall presentation and location of the hotel was excellent.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The pools and slides were wonderful but crowded.  Shuttles were convenient and helpful.

We were unimpressed by the on site restaurant choices and dined at other locations.  There were no late night food choices at the bar other than an over priced Round Table pizza that I would have had to wait until it was delivered from across the street.  There was a large gap at the bottom of our room door that we covered each evening with towels to keep the light and noise out.  We had late night noise issues outside of our room with loud music and talking on two out of our six night stay.  Staff addressed it when we made a call to the front desk. It would have been nicer if the slides were open for longer periods of time for our children to enjoy.  We had to go to another hotel to pickup and drop off our Dollar rental car. Hawaii's inflated prices for most everything drained our entertainment budget.

Had booked hotel through hotelopia and had paperwork to show booking and payment. Arrived at 11:00 P.M. Staff on hand did not have anything indicating that I had payed and previously and would not accept my paperwork. They indicated to me that hotelopia had not sent them anything though I had a reservation but it showed it had not been payed. They asked for my card and said they would call Hotelopia to confirm my payment. When I checked out they had not called anyone and had charged me 52.00 for the nights stay. I told her the story from the night before and she could not confirm my payment either. So when we got home our records showed we had indeed payed for the room at time of booking with Hotelopia. So now we start the process to get my card credited. This is the   second time this has happened to us. Last time it was at Red Roof Inn. I would like to see these hotels be more diligent in there communications with these hotel sites to receive confirmation of payment as well as reservation.

EXCELLENT!!! Beautiful immaculate hotel, they upgraded us to a 4 bedroom suite due to birthday from one of us,which was SPECTACULAR! Lots of attention and courtesy from all staff since we arrived till we left. This hotel is not your usual Ramada, this is a luxurious property in an excellent location on JBRWalk and Dubai Marina. and a block from beach. They gave us 3 free alcohol drinks vouchers at arrival! Will definitely stay here again and again! Hotelopia had the best nightly rate including half board that can't be beat by any hotel close by in this area in Dubai. Definitely a plus to include the excellent buffet bkfast/dinner, which by the  were tasty and a lot of variety well prepared delicious food. Short 10-15 minute walk to Jumeirah Lakesmetro station and gorgeous view of the Marina on the  to the metro station. Overall this hotel is excellent for the location, price, courteous staff and all the pampering since you arrive. Loved it and will definitely will return again.

The only negative is that we were on a rental car and the drop off was at the hotel, which we can't find were the Dollar Car rental drop off was, and asked and they say inside the multilevel underground parking, but no signs or anything to direct you to Dollar Rent a Car, which after 20 minutes driving in circle inside the parking, I found out that is in front of the parking hotel entrance (no Dollar rent a car sign of any kind). and the car rental desk is inside the Ramada hotel. I guess this is not a Ramada hotel but the car rental to blame. I told the Dollar car rental representative about it, and he just said that everybody said the same thing! I told him well, you should put some signs or fix it for future travellers. He looked at me like he didn't care or any response at all. Other than this, this hotel is excellent!
The staff are so nice make you feel very welcome room ok only stop one night when traveling from france to Spain but have stopped 3 times now have just booked again
The new building were we stayed was very nice and clean. Close to the private beach.  The pool was superb, and also very clean.  Quiet surroundings made it a perfect place for a relaxing vacation.

The variety of the buffet food could have been better.  Only one night a week with live dancing music was disapointing. ( Yes i know about the disco, but it was not appealing to others than teenagers.)

GORGEOUS!!!  This is not your usual Holiday Inn hotel. Is fabulous!!! Excellent courteous attention since you arrive till you depart. Great soft sandy beach with Dead sea mud buckets for guests use. Great staff on front desk, golf carts, pools and beach. The views are SPECTACULAR! Such a peaceful and awesome place! The hotel pools are beautiful and so clean. The landscaping is beautiful as well. The drinks a little pricey but I guess that's everywhere on resorts like this in the area. Very Nice to have free complimentary soft drinks on the room fridge. We felt so welcome all the time and staff were super friendly all over the hotel. The room overlooked the pool and had a nice balcony with chairs and table. Bed was very comfortable and cold A/C. The breakfast buffet was simply AWESOME and TASTY!!! We didn't have dinner but had a delicious burger at the Chili Ways restaurant. Is like a fast food burger place, but better and delicious and not expensive. Just 5 minute up the hill from Holiday Inn hotel Dead Sea. Overall this hotel is great, sandy beach, sparkling pools, gorgeous views from rooms and the Dead Sea and is the first hotel on your right after check point on service road. Excellent hotel!

Pricey drinks but I guess that's all over Jordan with alcohol drinks. We had a glass of wine one evening by the pool and I can say that it didn't taste like a good quality wine, and they poured less than half the glass with wine.   Other than the drinks, the hotel is gorgeous and the best price/quality compared to nearby hotels.

From the moment we arrived we were made to feel special. The staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful. I have stayed in 5 star hotels in London that were luxurious but the warm friendly atmosphere was nothing like what was present here. The spa was superb and the room fantastic the attention to detail and cleanliness second to none. As Arnie said "I'll be back"!!!
the only thing that i think was negative was that we had to pay the parking and also the internet and these services weren't specified to  be paid on the hotel website!!
Time to renovation and renew all the furniture and bedding,it was to old and dirty.
Location is great ski in
Great for families with young kids.
Nothing about the hotel itself, but the Thomas cook reps/entertainment was too loud and constant.
Our room was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel was situated in a good spot. We would have no quarms in recommending this hotel to friends and family.
Staff have excellent manners. Very good scenery and decor, though it's quite old

The toilet door chipping at the bottom. The sink gets choked as the lever unable to push up the sink stopper. We had booked a taxi upon departure at 1.30pm at $30 to berjaya times square. A staff called us at 1pm to go down immediately saying its better we take this taxi which charges by meter. But in the end the taxi fare was $47 as it was six seater ,and it goes on highway all the  from the mines to berjaya times square. We felt cheated.
very pleasant people, a large pool, direct output to the beach, clean rooms, no experience
Good location. Place was clean. Staff were friendly and helpful.
The booking was with english breakfast but the hotel thought we were only entitled to continental.  They did give us the english breakfast once we proved it.
Holiday too few feeder bus service, only one class.  Business hotel, did not provide sanitary products is hard to accept.  Poor sound insulation of the room! Result in poor sleep quality, sleep.

Staff are all helpful, pleasant and friendly. We had a great expeience at breakfast room where they are so friendly and it made the start of the day very pleasant. Nicson james, faroq, alex, leonard, made extra effort to make us feel very welcomed! The staff from downstairs entrance always help us with our travel queries with good attitude and smiles. Something we rarely saw in UK.

There should be a separate shower room rather than shower on bath. The tour company based on hotel (desert dream) is not good. We had very bad experience with desert safari with them. No air cond in car. Driver is not safe. 2 near miss accidents on highway. Tried to squeeze in as many people as possible in car with cheap rates once they got our booking earlier in week with high price and we ended up squezing in the very back of the car despite paying more than others. Hotel should consider whether they should give them a desk in lobby  and let them monopolize the guests when there are many tour companies out there.
Orange juice a bit yukky at breakfast and was not over impressed with the reception staff but they were okay.
Great location, nice sea terrace, lovely views from main hotel.

Some of the waiters/ bar staff had surley attitude. Appartments were not as pictured on internet. Limited evening entertainment. Ice creams for children not included during the day and prices inflated for purchase of goods and services in the hotel.
Excellent location, facilities and staff.  New management   can do real miracles!
Very good position, easy walking into the centre, near lovely parks and the river
approachable friendly staff
The room was fantastic. Large and luxurious. The bathroom was also very big and everything worked well. The staff were friendly and courteous. Good value hotel, well located.
The breakfast could be better.
The staff were really helpful and friendly and the apartments are very well thought out, providing everything that you could need.

Some of the friendliest happiest staff I've come across in a hotel. Evening Entertainment needs improving to appeal to families. Children bored in the evening. Very good range of drinks on offer for both adults and children. Information missing on check in (booking of hotel bus, sports facilities, what the all inclusive program includes) would have benefitted from a more detailed information booklet. Would consider a future stay and would be encouraged by any repeat visitor offers/discounts.

Room not clean in arrival. Other peoples personal hair all over the bathroom. Made me uncomfortable in the room and I need to clean all the floors myself before I was happy to walk on them. Other than that, although basic the rooms were large and comfortable if a little cold in the evenings. The only negative I can think if is that the football pitch, an excellent facility and one of the reasons I booked the resort (my 14 yr old is football mad) was locked unless the entertainment team were present. A complete waste of an excellent facility which would keep teen boys occupied for most of the day.
apartment was lovely clean was in good location very happy with my stay would return
prices for items inside the hotel too expensive. For example one espresso at the coffe shop 03.29 JOD

I only stayed the one night as I was in transit, however all interactions with staff were extremely postive. Requiring an international power adaptor was not am issue and even brought it to my room. From initially checking, breakfast through to helping with my bags and hailing a taxi.   Totally impressed and will be making every effort to choose the Hilton wherever I travel in future.    Please pass in my thanks to all staff in Singapore  Regards    Steve Meurs  Melbourne   Australia
lots of noises because of construction.
Great location and food. Good sized rooms for central London. Very good value. Executive room had a large bed and a two seater sofa.

We were given an executive room. The decor was a bit tired. However, we have stayed at this hotel previously and the standard room was in excellent condition. Air Conditioning didn't work very well in this room.
Seriously awesome location up on the hills in Bodrum with great view of the city and sea. Lovely pool and staff. Great service.

Breakfast was great, with loads of choice...but the choice could have been a bit more varied each day, especially in relation to the hot food. Also, as you would expect from a place like this, drinks / food was a lot more expensive than one should reasonably pay - kinda put us off staying there to eat / drink much. On the other hand, it was great to go out in town instead.
Clean beds and good staff
Carpets in our room not so clean.
Clean beds and good staff
Carpets in our room not so clean.
Very clean and the staff are very helpfull.
Parking is tricky if you have a large vehicle such as a transit sized van as the hotel parking is height restricted.
Very clean and the staff are very helpfull.
Parking is tricky if you have a large vehicle such as a transit sized van as the hotel parking is height restricted.

Great location - was much closer to the city centre than I realised from looking at the map. Also very close to the Shudehill tram exchange and bus station. Shudehill has a direct line to the Etihad Stadium which was great as we were staying for a concert at the stadium.  24 hours parking opposite the hotel at Total P carpark only £9 if you buy voucher from hotel.  I could see my car from our room.  Would definitely stay at hotel again for a few days break.

It was perfect. I committed to write a review when wegot home  , but we are still in  Krakow enjoying the facilities. We tried to book some friends this week but all tooms were booked. I would give 5 out 5 for value,old world feel , and totally responsive staff - keep up the good work

This was our second visit and as on the first occasion we were very happy with most aspects.  Louisa (sorry about spelling) on reception was particulary knowledgable, efficient and very pleasant also.

There was a large party of us and service at the catering facilities was very slow on each occasion as there was usually only one person doint all eg taking orders, serving, cooking and taking payments.  This resulted in us finally using outside facilities which we would rather not have done and I'm sure you would like to have received the business.

Beautiful garden terrace, nice view from the room and clean bathroom  No doubt it is an historical Hotel that is worth to be in, at least once

Although we arrive at 16.30, and the room has been booked a month in advance we had to wait at reception for 20 minutes to have our room assigned  main swiming pool was not available for use (was being filled up with water)  Main dinning room was reserved for an specific group
Friendly staffs, fast repond on call and services.
Friendly staffs, fast repond on call and services.
The staff were lovely and very helpful.

3pm check in is quite late when flying overnight from Australia without sleep, suggest taking an extra night before so you can go straight to a room as we fell asleep in the lobby by 2pm and were awfully jetlagged - no fault of hotel, just a suggestion to flyers from down under.    Only negative comment is our room was corner room and whole of one side was entirely loover windows wind howled constantly through them when closed and road noise was very loud even though we were on floor second from top.  I wore ear plugs to get around this :-)

Internet - business centre unstisfactory.  Your access to internet via your computer is appalling.. This influenced my rating above for facilities.  I spent HOURS trying to get it working and your staff could nt get it working
Nice then some of the Resorts I have stayed at in the area.

There was no noise in my ground floor room and was cleaned to perfection and linen changed frequently.   Plenty of parking was provided free.       I have no qualms about recommending this hotel to anyone.
the bar is perhaps a little expensive.

Somewhat worse hotel I have ever been on.  Wondering if anyone has actually been there and assessed the hotel to be part of that deal. A little more information about the standard of the hotel would be good. Even the hotel's own website does not say everything, but it can be understood. So my recommendation is to not even check in. We left after some hours.

Great location, 15 mins walk from the Duomo or a Metro right outside.  Worth trying the spa, currently two hours free for hotel guests, a lovely haven in the basement with sauna, steam, small pool and relaxing area. Would definetely stay here again when I return to Milan.
You can hear the rumbling of the metro from the rooms but they don't run during the night so didn't find it a problem.
It is a good hotel, with nice clean rooms.
The breakfast was not so good, there was a lot of choice but the quality...... The location was a little bit in between of city center(20-30' walking) and playa d'en bossa.
Available facilities were great. Rooms a decent size. Brilliant location. Committed staff.

Staff on reception desk were so unproffesional, like they are working for free  or it's my fault that they work here. Also they were giving people internet which they know it doesn't work... I needed to find solution and ask people around to give me password to connect to their private network which worked only... Last day when I was leaving I paid about 12 eur more because I didn' book through the web page that last day, and first day when I came they said don't worry, you don't need to book you will pay the same amount for room when you leave hotel.   ALSO SHUTTLE BUS WAS LATE ALL THE TIME AT LEAST 30 MIN, I MEAN WHAT'S THE POINT TO SAID HE WILL TO SAY THAT HE WILL COME EARLIER AND THEN PEOPLE ARE WAITING 30-40 MIN AT LEAST FOR NOTHING.
Inside of bathroom door had severe water damage. Not very nice impression.
Inside of bathroom door had severe water damage. Not very nice impression.
Restaurant food was superb. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Atmosphere was very relaxing.

Visited this hotel a couple of years back and felt some of the decor and furniture was starting to look a bit tired looking.   A bit of a refresh would bring the overall feel and quality of the hotel up in value.

My daughter and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel as the rooms were very spaceous and the facilities catered for all needs. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the central location of the hotel made it easy to walk to many local amenities or access all forms of public transport to explore all that the city has to offer. I would happily recommend this hotel to others and would book again if I returned to Melbourne in the future.

The staff were friendly and professional.  They extended themselves to be helpful.  The hotel atmosphere is fresh and welcoming.

The evenings can be noisy around the pool.  The schedule of the shuttle to the airport needs to be updated and changes (temporary or otherwise) should be communicated effectively, especially to the staff on the different shifts.

This hotel is excellent value for your money, very close to city centre which has a great selection of shops, pubs and restaurants.  Had a great weekend,   Many thanks to the great staff  regards MR/MRS NILES
The exterior of the hotel is very well maintained, and looks clean. Beach is clean and free from rubbish, while sports facilities are still adequate.

Rooms are badly maintained, while necessary utilities for the rooms such as heater, air conditioning and lights are broken. Friend's shower area was clogged and flooded after showers. Hotel staff were very much incompetent, and apathetic especially during meals, where the buffet line was not refilled in the adequate space of time.
Tea and coffee at breakfast was undrinkable. Coffee in room was poor. Crockery and cutlery was not clean. Observed the waiter topping up and hence diluting the breakfast orange juice with water.
Quality of the room, small hotel-will be doing a review on trip Advisor too

Fantastic pool! Very clean and beautiful design with a swim around island under two bridges...gorgeous waterfall and mini cave that would keep kids entertained for awhile.   Hotel staff very friendly, polite and very accommodating.   Nice and quiet hotel, good aircon and great size rooms with good storage for hanging clothes etc...Close to W Hotel and Potatoehead if that rocks your boat...

Hotel rooms looking a little tired and need to improve quality of the safes as i had numerous problems having to call the engineer to open each time when it kept failing.   Need taller showers in bath and perhaps build a step up to the bath for shorter people! to step into bath.   Other than that a great stay!
Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast, nice and  spacious rooms.

In this day and age, for such a nice and quite  costly hotel, it is poor that wi-fi is not complementary. Wi-fi is in fact  quite expensive at your hotel. As a foreigner, this may be a reason for  not choosing this hotel next time.
great location
bar area clean but very sterile , needs  to look more like a bar and not a canteen. but in saying that its still a very good place to stay.

very pleasant stay- we are considering bringing our families back to cliffs of moher hotel.

This is a beautiful, traditional hotel.  The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The Landmark Restaurant was five star in quality, service, and ambience.  My suite was spacious, had updated televisions, and attractive.      The location allows for walking to a variety of restaurants--ranging from fast food to moderately upscale restaurants.   The neighborhood is beautiful and surrounded by beautiful trees. It is only a few blocks from a fire station and siren-blaring trucks are frequent thought the night.

The closet  space was a bit sparse for a suite.  This was my mistake for not carefully checking the amenities before I booked this hotel--but there was no Spa or pool, which was a serious disappointment and oversight on my part. With no balcony or outside patio, I was confined to my room if I was at the hotel.  Again, a disappointment.

We found the staff very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is run very professionally and efficiently.  The hotel and beach club are both kept really clean. Staff really seemed to enjoy working for the Company and we were impressed that they were all provided with lunch and dinner in the hotel.

Not impressed when the transfer bus dropped us in middle of Calella with vague instructions on how to walk to hotel.  Whilst that was ok for ourselves as we were fit enough to pull our suitcases through the town to the hotel this would have been very difficult for elderly people.

The staff were very friendly and helpful with everything we needed. After a very long coach journey with delays we just wanted a takeaway and rest when we arrived at hotel. They were more than happy to provide us with cuttlery and crockery for this. In regards to breakfast we were just expecting your usual continental but were offered full English which was very nice plus if that didn't fill you up you could have anything that was laid out too. The staff were very helpful and friendly and it is a great shame they ate closing next month :(
Nothing negative other than them closing next month die to the college over the road buying them out.

Poor choice of food for the breakfast. After the evening show at Disney Land (11.30pm)  there was a lot of people at the shuttle bus, and not everybody could come in the bus. It could be nice if the bus frequency is increased during pick hours.

WARNING!   1.This hotel has no "standard double" room, all standard rooms are TWIN. Should you complain about it you get an upgrade offer for Suite double!!  2.None of the "standard double" (ie Twin) rooms has a window. Should you complain about it you get an upgrade offer for Suite double!!  3.All "standard double" (ie Twin) rooms emit an unbearable mold odour  4.The ventillation system at night and the extremely noisy hotel staff in the daytime make this hotel (which is otherwise located in a tranquil pedestrian area) unsuitable for sleep or relax in its dark rooms

Room 327 was clean but basic. No wi-fi or trouser press as advertised.Our room had 2 cut off water pipes sticking out of the floor. the door to the room had been damaged along the the hinge side and the paint was missing. The lever to operate the shower was missing and had been replaced by a bolt which had a rough edge and made using the shower difficult. the bathroom light was stuck to the wall with brown tape, but the worst thing was probably the most uncomfortable bed I have ever been in . Below our room was the ventilation equipment was gave off a continous loud humming noise , all the corridors smelled of food and the hotel public bar was to say the very least rowdy with shouting and swearing going on into the early hours of the morning  all 3 nights of our stay, as we checked out other guest where complaining about the public bar but the receptionist just told them to ask for a room at the other end of the hotel next time. Sorry to be negative but I would not go back to this hotel. The Bar food was revolting and we ate elsewhere after the first night. this is my first ever negative report about a hotel and I suspect that as we booked a deal through your company at a cheap price w got the worst room allocated to us.As I suspect the room was given to us because of the deal I will probably have to book direct with hotels in the future as this room was nothing like the images seen on the website.

Toilet brush filthy which detracted from the high standard of everywhere else. She apologised however and stated that the holiday company should not have included this facility. It was their mistake and not hers for challenging it.

Our flight was earlier,  we requested an early check-in , the reception were very compliant, we paid a token fee of £20 in order for a room to be available.     The room was clean and tidy, it could have done with a hoovering, we were both tired from the night time flight so we didnt complain it was a small issue anyway.  The following morning we had this carried out by the hotel cleaner.  We asked for more pillows and  more tea bags they were delivered to our room very promptly.  The location of the Hotel was ideal only a few minutes driving time from Airport.    The transport to and from  airport and railway systems was excellant, staff very friendly and helpful in any questions that may have arisen about the area of Manchester.

The design of the front reception, being set back quite a bit from front doors , and no signs above or below your staffs heads, that mentions the word reception, this would be more comprehensive and more friendly and appealing.  Thursday 31st of May 2013, I experienced a stomach migraine, I could not go for my breakfast, I said to my husband why dont u go on down for breakfast, he didnt want to go on his own.  There was no literature that stated that u could book breakfast to your room, as at the weekend , breakfast was served until 11.00 am.  The towels for bathing were very small, they were more like drying for your face and hands, than a full xxl size bath towel.

Better than my first stay. Ask for a room at the end of the hall obviously. Skip the food, it may be cheap but its worth less (I hate undercooked bacon). Besides for 5-7euros there is a restaurant right around the corner.

The only niggle is the parking, you get a discount for using the Arena car-park, but you have to cross a busy road using a few pedestrian crossings. Might be a pain if it's raining, but that is the only negative review I can think of.

The hotel was absolutely great, very comfortable and clean, the food was plentiful and the staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful. It's right next to the station so ideal if you have an early connection eg to St Petersburg but  was surprisingly quiet. Only a short walk to the old town with all it's restaurants and shops and a lovely outlook over the park and old town. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone particularly as it is very very good value for money.
Staff really friendly and helpful, rooms modern and clean

In beach bar food and drinks could be better...
Clean and friendly, excellent place to stay

Ambience very relaxing.  Wifi should introduce to rooms also.
Good price, big room with a great view, breakfast was good quality, staff were very professional. I would definitely stay again.

Everything about this hotel is 5 star, the room was amazing and the treatment we recieved was second too none.  I cant wait to visit this hotel again. The west restaraunt was amazing also, top quality food and service.
The only thing that this hotel has missing is a swimming pool, otherwise it would be a 5 star.
A good hotel.  Perfect location. Congratulation to management.
we found the hotel great ,spacious rooms ,very clean, modern facilitles, all round a great hotel ,convenient for adelaide
Very good hotel. Situated central, within walking distance of Cardiff Bay. Right by railway, but I wasn't kept awake by trains.
staff very friendly and helpfull, hotel close tothe beach, boulevard and mainroad to the north.
Don't book for the breakfast becouse it's dreadfull and there are better choices nearby.
Good location next to shopping mall.  Clean hotel.
Supposed to have free Wi Fi to the room but the connection was terrible and hardly worked.  Food good but could be cheaper.
The pool closed at 9pm, which I thought was early, usually its 10pm at other hotels.
Location: Pretty much right at the beach.

Well, we were kind of disappinted after we got there. The Hotel was built in 1926, which is great and was not the matter. But unfortunatly instead of keeping the old flair and restoring it to make it into a special place. Even if it went thru a restoration not to long ago, as the Hotel page says, I could not see it. Whe weired thing about the Hotel is, that there is 2 receptions. Obviously there is 2 different Hotels in one, which makes it really confusing if you try to book it, which we discovered too and did not find out about it until we arrived.  The Hotel is located just across the beach which is great and just above an old and run down mall which was probably the place to go in the 70th and 80th. unfortunatly that whole building is run down and not jaust that the whole Hollywood Boardwalk was run down and filthy. The beach is nice, nothing to say, but everything around it is not so nice. Just drive up north a south a bit and it"s much nicer. So we were glad just to sepend only one night in the Hotel. The rooms were ok. Not fancy, somewhat clean but alright.  We would not come back and we were kind of disappointed by the so highly recomended Hollywood Beach Boardwalk area.
Very nice Riad/Hotel. We had a great experience. The manager was very competent and spoke several languages, including English, French, Spanish and Arabic. We can highly recommend this Riad.
The rooms were very clean. There was satellite-tv and all the rooms have a nice view on the ocean.

The hotel is pretty far away from the centre of Havana. The breakfast is very mediocre and can't really be called continental if there's nothing to put on your sandwich. The swimmingpool is allright, but the foto's on the internet of the hotel were probably taken before the revolution, because nowadays the building looks ready for demolition. The cleaning-staff is very anoying, because every time you see them they come and ask you for things such as money, which almost makes you want to avoid them.
Excellent location, very polite and helpful staff. The negative comments below are only minor and I feel constructive and they would go no  put me off booking this hotel again
Would benefit from drinks facilities in the room.  Breakfast was quite poor considering it was served from a nearby restaurant having toast available would have enhanced the service.

This was a truly fantastic Riad. The staff could not have done more for us. We were two young girls in our twenties and they helped organise everything for us. From tours, to taxis, to dinner and even brought us to some of the best places to get all our Moroccan beauty products. The Riad itself is beautiful. It is so clean and everything we imagined a Moroccan Riad to be. The breakfast was fabulous and we had dinner there one night too. The food was first class. I could not recommend this place any more, we had a great trip.
the hotel was centrally located , very clean and friendly staff.
the hotel is very comfortable, clean, and cheap.  Very close to the sea, very convenient
improve the breakfest

Clean and central location. Staff were very accommodating given that we were leaving early on the day of departure. Great views and large balcony. We had everything we needed and therefore would happily use again (although upgrade to a bedroom if longer than the 4 night stay) Large pool although we didnt use it.

Fridge was warm and very pointless! Slats continually fell out of the pull out sofa bed (a double bed in this space would be better suited as it would be more durable. Plus there is already a seating and table area!) Sofa was hard and uncomfortable but ok for such a short break. Deposit a bit steep for such a very basic room (and for a couple)! Not sure there is much to break worth 150 Euros.
Very friendly and helpful staff

Lovely atmosphere and style, friendly and helpful staff. Room was a little small but comfortable and clean and certainly fine for a one night stay pre flight stay. Much prefer this hotel to the other more corporate style hotels on the airport and will definitely stay here again.
I love the 24/7 shop :) and McDonalds is close :)

Nick named crap regancy, even tho I was a in-house guest I still had to pay entrance to the rest the facilities, the pool was always full with non-residedents, the sky bar sold no beer what so ever, I paid 250paso to go up there to a empty bar, no tiger like advertised, crap restaurant, if u buy anything you get suprised with hidden charges, elevators always full, loads of beggars outside and a dead dog

This hotel is situated in a quiet location in the village of Lapta, nestling between the sea and the mountains.  It's about 15 minutes' walk to the nearest public beach, which is small and sandy - likely to be crowded in summer.  Other beaches are accessible via a short car trip.  The keys to this hotel are the welcoming friendly family atmosphere - just the right amount for comfort, the informality, the excellent food - sourced locally, the lovely pool, and the garden - where everyone can find a corner to relax in their own .  Clean. It's a good centre, and a place to relax.

As we experienced elsewhere in TR Cyprus, standards of maintenance are not the same as in the core countries of the EU.  It's quite hard to find, and if we had followed Google street map, we would have ended up in totally the wrong place. Make sure you get clear directions.

arrived on a Saturday evening, was told no meals served after 7pm, but a coach load of Dutch were served a great looking meal after this time????  Had to decamp to local pub. It's a shame you lost out on our custom, we had been travelling all day and would have preferred to stay in.

The staff are most courteous and helpful.  They make hotels guests feel welcome.    Parking facilities are more than ample and breakfast is good with long enough serving duration to please the late risers. The room is big enough without the feeling of claustrophobia.  The toilet is equally spacious and shower is good.  Normal hotel guests with reasonable expectations cannot ask for more.
Bacon is absent on breakfast table.  Respecting religion, chicken bacon can be provided as in the East. Besides scrambled egg, eggs with sunny-side up would be another welcoming choice for many.

Great hotel - modern spacious rooms, nicely fitted out - lots of very welcome freebies - free internet, free breakfast (delicious), free tea/coffee in room, free tea/coffee in lounge, free transport to/from airport, very professional and friendly staff. Nice view over park and golf-course from rooms at back.

Long journey by public transport into downtown - bus journey, then subway journey - but that's the same with all the Toronto airport hotels. (55 dollars by taxi. to downtown).  A receptionist misinformed me at one point - this caused me a problem - he should have checked out my query rather than give me a wrong answer.
Well located as a cheaper alternative to New York which is only about 20 minutes away on the PATH train, 5 minutes from the hotel. Large rooms, reasonable breakfast, excellent and helpful staff.
Needs updating as it looks a little tired. the area around the station isn't particularly nice in the evening with homeless/drinkers.
I love this hotel, the staff are helpful, the location is fabulous for a relaxing break. This was my third visit and I am returning again in September.
A coat of paint in a few places and a little updating would help.
Very good hotel .Very well located in Kyoto.
Staff very attentive, facilities excellent
Modern high quality hotel in a good location. Short walk to pinxos bars and not far from the old town or Gugenhiem. Room was excellent - lovely bathroom and shower, great bed.

The air con only seems to heat - it wouldn't cool. Could do with more staff on reception - when we checked in we had to wait nearly 15mins while the one staff member took a very long phone call, and on exit there was just one staff member on at peak check out time. But those are just minor issues - I would certainly still recommend staying here.
Excellent all round performance by all staff. Enjoyed a couple of outstanding meals in the restaurant. Staff member Thai Becker was especially helpful with local knowledge.
If u want to ease and relax then u will have a phantastic place to go. There were more spanish and old couples. No Party People.
Not that much Entertainment for Kids, not the big variety of fruits could be more. The big pool is not heated was not ideally for my little daughter to swim.
Clean, good staff and good food
TV didn't work and as we were on route to Holyhead we just wanted to relax with some entertainment in the room.  As radios do not appear in rooms we were disappointed and no compensation was offered.

great hotel with a wonderful pool area,amazing staff who 99% of the time would go out of their  to assist you.  definitely will be returning to this hotel for another vacation  thank you OHANO WAKIKI WEST
elavators very slow,lights in room very dim which hid a lot of deficinies
nice ocean view, beautiful beach, spacious room, not bad food

This hotel is just a maximum 3 star hotel, not 4 star. Though the hotel deco and interior seem to be luxurious and some staffs were kind and thoughtful, many staffs(reception, restaurants etc) were lazy, surly and never friendly. There is even no doorman at this hotel! They should learn to smile and deal with customers' requests more professionally and quickly! Almost all facilities seem to be too old and there were so many mosquitos in my room. And the price of food is exorbitantly expensive!
The poolbar has been facilitated by Spiro Kulla and Lambrini Zitsi. They ware very nice, and the food was very good and fresh every day.  It was a pleasure to meet them!

Great oceanfront balcony room with views along Waikiki.  Central location and across the road from the beach.  Comfortable room.  Good wi-fi and Hawaiian coffee machine.  Undercover parking reasonably priced.
Air-conditioner in wall a little noisy.

I will do a more detailed Facebook review but thought the hotel and rooms were very modern and clean and of a pretty decent size. Giant size bath-tub and housekeeping staff were very friendly. :-)    Great to be able to have an extra bed     Nice decor - good lighting, large TV

A little far out of town  Bad wi-fi connection inside the room (only picked it up in the hallway)  The front desk staff - I had such problems when I called up to find anyone who spoke good enough English (and I spoke to about 4 or 5 diff people. One lady told me it was a 20 minute taxi cab ride from the Eurostar station!!!!!)  And recommendations were very hit and miss - there is no dedicated concierge and everyone just recommended Barbue d'Anvers and other just recommended the restaurants along rue de Rihour and other touristy places. Sometimes someone would suggest rue de la Monnaie or Gand but not actually give specific restaurant recommendations. (There were one or two staff who at least brought out the book of recommendations that u have but the rest were very poor and that was the biggest let down, given that you are a 5* establishment.  There were no porters or taxis outside the hotel  The spa and gym were very new but small and just felt like they had been added to check the box
Very good position. No frills hotel but reasonably clean.
Corridors smelt damp and musty. No real window in our room only small single pane  back alley. Room very dark.

I booked this hotel through Hotelopia and received both a confirmation email and a receipt email from them. When I arrived at the hotel I was told they had never heard of me and had received no notification of my booking from Hotelopia. I then found my own accommodation independent of Hotelopia and paid for it in cash. Regardless of this incompetence by Hotelopia, they still charged my Visa card for my booking. I am presently trying my hardest to recover my money. I believe Hotelopia is a dodgy and/or incompetent agency.

Hotel very old rooms get a lot of outside noise, moved twice but still noisy.  Wouldnt stay here again, stayed at the Standard last time and was awesome.
Very modern, clean and easy to locate. Staff were attentive.
The hotel was some distance from Zagreb centre, a negative for tourists. Also, no restaurants in the vicinity as an alternative to the hotel restuarant
Good welcome.  Room clean and comfortable, well-equipped.

The rooms were not as advertised. We were booked into a Superior suite which we were not given. We pointed this out to the management and they then showed us the Superior which smelled and had ripped and dirty carpets. We stayed in the room given. It was disappointing and not what we expected.

Our bedroom leaked when it rained, all of our clothes were wet as were our cases. We advised reception and were given another key no-one was interested in helping us. The new room had a puddle of water in the middle of the room. Another couple had water coming down through the light fittings. We left after two nights. No offer of refund for the third night was made.
distance to disneyland
towels were like sand paper and definitely I mean sandpaper have never had them so bad
Only the distance to Disney

The carpet is filthy we have to use the towels to walk in the room because is nasty and the room is very small for 4 people  And the girls  on the lobby  are almost  indiferent  to you  very  unfriendly  customer  service. So bad and sad  won't  come  back ....
The Hotel is in a great location and the rooms facing the river Clyde are very peaceful, and  hearing the river is quite calming.  The rooms are well furnished and our beds were very comfortable.

Fantastic value and the staff were excellent. I will be re-booking without a shadow of a doubt, As I was unable to walk very well, and use a stick the bar staff were very helpful at carrying my drinks to the poolside

Pity about the road works, which are beyond the control of the hotel, but it must detract passing tourists from staying the night as they are unaware of the noise levels from the works.  Also why is there no toothbrush holder by the washand basin in the bathroom, nor tumbler for drinking water or the taking of tablets, when asked the staff did supply one ?  The breakfast was boring - but typical of the Algarve Hotels.
There was a nice pool.  TV service was OK.  Receptionist were well informed about local traffic and attractions.

Premium WIFI couldn't be applicable on our devices.  Free WIFI was extremely slow.  The view of the room was a white wall.  When the window were open it was too noisy: kitchen located to the neighbor building.  It was noisy even with closed windows: construction noises from a close apartment from the same hotel.  The walls were so thin that we could even hear others having showers, going somewhere.  DJ and singers had performances in the hotel during the evenings which could be listened even in the rooms making us unable to go to bed before 10/11 pm.  In the dinner we had to pay for even juices, teas or water.

Booked a compact room - was expecting a very small box room - this was not the case at all.  We were given room 301.  Not a massive room, but has a window (booking confirmation said there was no window) and is ample space for two people.  Ironing board/iron, coffee machine, kettle and TV all in the room.  Clean.  Much better than a Travelodge!

Bathroom very small (but this was a compact room!).  Reception not staffed in the morning until 8am and as we need to leave at 7am there was no one to leave the room key with.  But this would not stop us from staying again.
In the center of down town

There is no restaurant to serve breakfast in the hotel if booking room with breakfast u have to other hotel nearby to your breakfast !!  I suggest to prepare the roof to service breakfast in the hotel .
It was soooo nice to stay in an old hotel so well kept. Clean, spacious and very nice people working there.
No air conditioning. We were lucky enough to enjoy a very nice hot day with a very hot white night. You may not be that lucky :P
Excellent staff and quality of the food was toppppp
Great location. Good breakfast.
Room could have been cleaner.
Spa area not very clean, Traffic noise in some rooms.
No problems excellent hotel.  One exception waiting to move into room after long flight.  Should be able to use room once arrived on account of exhaustion one experiences after long plane journey  .,
Heart of down town , friendly staff , this hotel service for you more than what you  pay for it
Hard to get location .

My fiancé and I had such a WONDERFUL time at this resort! We spent most of our time by the pool and I can't emphasize how lovely it was. There were a total of 3 salt water outdoor pools, a private sand beach, and a small rocky alcove in which you could jump in and swim in the sea. All of the locations had PLENTY of sun beds so we never felt crowded and were always able to find the perfect spot to catch some sun. Our stay was at the beginning of the high season, June 3rd-7th.     We did not purchase the all inclusive package but were very pleased with the food at the resort that we ate most of our meals there. We did, however, have breakfast included in our board and thought the buffet was absolutely excellent. The lunch service next to the main pool was good overall, although a little pricey. I enjoyed the crispy chicken wrap with salad which was approximately 10 euros not including french fries. For dinner we only ate at the resort once and made a reservation at Alang Alang which was absolutely perfect! My fiancé and I had bruschetta starters and the steak fillet for our main course and the chocolate and hazelnut tart for dessert and we had no complaints throughout the entire meal! We ate dinner at the nearby Riviera Resort one evening and found that the Alang Alang restaurant was MUCH better quality for the money and the atmosphere was one in a million with the beautiful outdoor sea view. I will say though, on windy evenings the location may not be the best but we were lucky enough to have the perfect weather.     The room was exactly what we expected. There were two twin beds which we ended up pushing together, a small TV, a mini fridge, full bath, and a balcony. We had a decent view... 1/3 of which overlooked the sea, 1/3 a private patio beneath and 1/3 the rooftop. The room was clean and spacious, the shower leaked a bit from the faucet but didn't bother us at all. Air conditioning didn't seem to keep the room too cool but keeping the balcony door open with the curtains closed did the trick at night.

The resort photographers were pretty pushy. If people rejected their services they would still try and entice them to have their pictures taken. My fiancé and I didn't especially mind them but noticed some that did.

This hotel is shocking... Not ready for anything...Looks good on photos but thats it.. Big disappointment... Hardly any staff and guess...Its like a ghost hotel...Never Never again....
Friendly staff and very good and quick service good quality food
Good value for the price , great location , close to restaurants and stores .
The suite was a little dark , needs more lighting , and could use a little updating.

Fantastic place to stay, spacious, well appointed rooms with all the expected amenities.  The gardens and pool area were well maintained  Staff were very friendly and helpful  The restaurant served up good quality breakfast
A DVD player in the room would be nice.
Great looking....good position......good staff
Food left a lot to be desired

Hotel very well situated for the Llamberris attractions. Our first room was clean and tidy but faced into courtyard.  We moved next day to our requested mountain view. This was a very large room with seating.The staff are friendly and helpfull. The Hotel restaurant is good value and worth considering as eating in Llanberris is limited and London  prices for not much choice. Would use this hotel again if coming to this area.

This Hotel has seen better days and is in need of some TLC to return it to it's former glory. Do not let this put you off  unless you want 4* flunky service. You can get some good deals via hotel booking sites and pay a lot more in town  without the grounds and location.
Very good personal attention  Nice and confortable room

From start to leaving we were impressed with this beautiful hotel, the bedroom was exquisite and the food was excellent. All members of staff were kind thoughtful and attentive to all our needs the facilities and cleanliness were superb.Excellent value for the money.  Look forward to returning in 2014.
Nice and efficient
We had problems with the shower mecanism    It was not that easy to see the hotel, we came walking from Airport

great! constant calls from manager inquiring about our stay etc. clean rooms, had WI FI etc. IPod dock etc. good resort, eg. pools etc. friendly staff, felt welcomed here, good service. walking distance to the Marina and nightlife eateries etc. Staff at entrance took care of us very well,  by taking the taxi number and gave cards in case we got lost, specialy in a strange country.
In a good 10 minute walk from London eye. Easy to find and out of the busiest areas

Stayed in this hotel many times perfect location and great value for money. Already recommended to many friends and family

Hotel now quite shabby.  Cut backs - no paper hankies!   Food could be better.  Ran out of fried eggs on Saturday morning, they were not replenished.
The hotell and hotell area were nice.
The furniture in the rooms were old and ugly, the bed were stone hard.   And the Music from the night clubs outside the hotell was hurrible! You could hear it all night!
Good location about 15 mins walk from cruise harbour / main market. Room size is good and superb Pool

Missing are basic amenities such as iron board, steam iron (on call), electric kettle in the room to make tea / coffee, dental /shaving kits in bathroom which are kind of standard items in most 5 stars across the globe.

Free WIFI, staff pleasant, location good for Paddington. Towels in the bathroom were good quality. Breakfast waitresses were very nice and food choice was ok. The reception manager did his best to offer me a room change but the hotel was full.

My room was in the basement and was supposed to be a 'renovated' room. It still looked very tired and the curtain was hanging off the rail. The small wardrobe was crammed with spare duvet and blanket, making it unusable, I didn't unpack my case as a result. The noise from the road outside kept me awake most of the night - not helpful when you are working.

Reasonable size room for a city hotel - bed comfortable. Bathroom very small, but shower was excellant! Only about 5 mins walk from Termini station - but still a reasonably quiet location. Good base for walking round the city

Could not fault the hotel. Clean, modern, helpful friendly staff, good selection of food at breakfast and to top it all excellent value in comparison to other hotels in area. Would definitely pay a return visit.
Ideal situated with in the midle of modern Fez.  next to the trainstation with perfect swimmingpool, petit taxi takes you to de medina (souks)  within 10 min. for 10 dirham.
Extremely noisy! We cannot even reach to the beach, construction everywhere.. The worst hotel we've ever been. Stay away from this place!!!

Friendly and helpful staff, willing to help e.g. we wanted to change the room and we got better one without additional charge, they let us to keep our stuff in the room till 3pm etc.   Good and pleasant bar and breakfast service. Good breakfast. Swimming pool is cleansed on daily basis. Hotel management is currently fixing all minor technical and decorative faults.Good daily room cleaning. Good distance from hustle and bustle of Tangier which is easily accessible by Petit Taxi (15-20 Dirhams = £1 – £1.5). Hotel interior and exterior is reasonably clean.   I was satisfied price and service.

In need of: some decorative work, better lift, fixing some door handles, sound insulation of water pump for swimming pool - noise can be heard in some rooms (our reason to change the room), cleaners frequently forget to put fresh towels in the room after they have removed the old ones (ask them/remind them and they will be happy to put them in your room). Important: Hotel usually provides only two towels and it is advisable to bring couple of your own!  But, that’s Moroccan (a bit sloppy) ‘way’ and if you are annoyed by that, I suggest – choose five star hotel. Everything has its price.
Location is nice. The room was spacious. The food was good.

The staff response was terrible, room supplies were not complete.  We were under the impression that the internet is free but were surprised with the cost for both internet and phone calls ( ~ times the normal price per minute)

The only negative feedback we have to complain about were all the UK kids playing around with green lazers, which should be completely prohibited in the hotel area as they can be harmful to your eyes.

very happy when we arrived at the hotel, we had a three bedroomed suite that was very big and the ensuite bathroom was very nice in master bedroom. modern kitchen with full use of all amenities, very handy with washing machine and tumble dryer meant for once we went home with clean clothes. the kids loved the pirate pool and made full use of the gym. on site shop very expensive but that to be expected and seeing as there are plenty of supermarkets close by this is no real problem, food and drinks very good in irish pub and with the shopping complex next door, we always had something to do. overall a great hotel for families and I will certainly book again when I visit Florida next.
We were delighted with the level of service from arrival till departure - a world class hotel on our doorstep which I think many of our locals are  unaware of.

Bit surprised to discover that after we had paid our accommodation and booked for our curry buffet dinner that there  was a cheaper package available that included all that and a treatment in the spa. All but one off the desk staff were unfriendly,unhelpfull to the point of being downright rude.We had to pay daily for the use of sunbeds,which there were very few off,there was no option of a late checkout "which we would have greatfully paid for"there was also no option of  a courtesy room or anywhere to properly wash before leaving.Love Benelmadana but would never go back to the Alay apartments nor recomend it to anyone else.

We were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The first impressions from outside were not great, but inside it is well invested and very modern. The rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean and the roof top bar / restaurant was superb with excellent views of the river and castle.

Excellent hotel with polite, friendly, professional staff. Modern hotel - bedroom, bathroom and public areas very clean and well looked after. Good-sized powerful shower. Decent breakfast buffet included, as was WiFi throughout. Hotel also has restaurant if needed. Good location in quiet, safe area. 3 minutes walk from Lepanto Metro (maybe 5 with a suitcase). 15-20 minutes to St Peters/Vatican. 15 minutes will get you across the river to either Piazza del Popolo or Piazza Navona. Very good value.

Not all rooms have a bath (not a problem as shower was great). Rooms slightly small with no clothes drawers (but have wardrobe hanging space). Limited restaurant menu (but fine on quality); not too surprising as never seemed very busy.
