Bathroom: good. Shower: excellent. And complimentary water: very welcome.

This hotel seems to have placed all of its effort into looking funky, modern and stylish, and lost sight of its main aim: to provide a comfortable night's sleep, a good breakfast, and to make the guests feel welcome and valued. :(    Arrival from Prince Regent DLR station was confusing, as it brings you out on a higher level than the Reception Desk. Signage to the Reception Desk is missing, and left us floundering for an entrance for a bit.    Upon locating Reception, of the two staff on duty, One was busy assisting a customer with a lost(!) booking (didn't bode well), and the other just completely ignored us! So we tried the auto check in computer system, which froze up, and was useless. So we waited. And waited.... We absorbed the acrid smell of chlorine presumably coming from the swimming pool which we couldn't see. And we waited...in the heat...(turn the air con on in Reception, please!) And waited...    Eventually we got our room.     The large front facing windows  the car park immediately raised the issue of lack of privacy. In order to not be looked in at, it was necessary to close the blackout blinds, but then, having lost broad daylight outside, we were plunged into gloom by the inadequate bedroom lighting.    Don't choose this hotel if you want room service - that is not on offer. Oh and the alarm clock was stuck at 6pm - despite the real time, and there was no (obvious)  to correct it. Thank goodness my mobile phone had an alarm on it.    It did contain a hairdryer. (It would have been nice if the website had confirmed that - save me dragging one with me in my luggage).    The worst thing was the pillows. Thin, foam, pillows that squashed utterly flat when you put your head on them, you might as well sleep without a pillow for all the support they provided. I got bad neck ache.    The second worst thing is breakfast, Advertised as "continental", I expected croissants, bread, cheese, meats, cereal, yoghurt and fruit. Basically, a reasonable savoury option, as well as sweet (which I don't eat). But I struggled to find anything suitable, and ended up with the only option on the menu: bagel and cream cheese. Additionally, the breakfast was confusing. You get a choice of any three items plus a hot drink, but some things (e.g. butter, jam, sauces, etc.) do not count as "items" - but that was not clear. And again, staff were slow to respond to their confused customers. I seriously suggest there is a training issue here! My husband doesn't drink hot drinks, and felt discriminated against as he had to use one of his "items" to pick a fruit juice.    Lastly: check out. We tried to use the computer check out system, but that wanted to charge us £1 to check out!! Confused (as we hadn't bought anything for a pound, and the room was already paid for), we went to the desk to be told grudgingly that the £1 was a "suggested donation". WHAT?? A donation to what? Who? Why? It was just listed as a charge on the computer. The receptionist said she would remove it from our bill if we didn't want to pay it. Talk about hidden charges!    Shame. The place is brilliantly located, and lovely in terms of décor. But they really need to review it through the eyes of their customers.
Bathroom: good. Shower: excellent. And complimentary water: very welcome.

This hotel seems to have placed all of its effort into looking funky, modern and stylish, and lost sight of its main aim: to provide a comfortable night's sleep, a good breakfast, and to make the guests feel welcome and valued. :(    Arrival from Prince Regent DLR station was confusing, as it brings you out on a higher level than the Reception Desk. Signage to the Reception Desk is missing, and left us floundering for an entrance for a bit.    Upon locating Reception, of the two staff on duty, One was busy assisting a customer with a lost(!) booking (didn't bode well), and the other just completely ignored us! So we tried the auto check in computer system, which froze up, and was useless. So we waited. And waited.... We absorbed the acrid smell of chlorine presumably coming from the swimming pool which we couldn't see. And we waited...in the heat...(turn the air con on in Reception, please!) And waited...    Eventually we got our room.     The large front facing windows  the car park immediately raised the issue of lack of privacy. In order to not be looked in at, it was necessary to close the blackout blinds, but then, having lost broad daylight outside, we were plunged into gloom by the inadequate bedroom lighting.    Don't choose this hotel if you want room service - that is not on offer. Oh and the alarm clock was stuck at 6pm - despite the real time, and there was no (obvious)  to correct it. Thank goodness my mobile phone had an alarm on it.    It did contain a hairdryer. (It would have been nice if the website had confirmed that - save me dragging one with me in my luggage).    The worst thing was the pillows. Thin, foam, pillows that squashed utterly flat when you put your head on them, you might as well sleep without a pillow for all the support they provided. I got bad neck ache.    The second worst thing is breakfast, Advertised as "continental", I expected croissants, bread, cheese, meats, cereal, yoghurt and fruit. Basically, a reasonable savoury option, as well as sweet (which I don't eat). But I struggled to find anything suitable, and ended up with the only option on the menu: bagel and cream cheese. Additionally, the breakfast was confusing. You get a choice of any three items plus a hot drink, but some things (e.g. butter, jam, sauces, etc.) do not count as "items" - but that was not clear. And again, staff were slow to respond to their confused customers. I seriously suggest there is a training issue here! My husband doesn't drink hot drinks, and felt discriminated against as he had to use one of his "items" to pick a fruit juice.    Lastly: check out. We tried to use the computer check out system, but that wanted to charge us £1 to check out!! Confused (as we hadn't bought anything for a pound, and the room was already paid for), we went to the desk to be told grudgingly that the £1 was a "suggested donation". WHAT?? A donation to what? Who? Why? It was just listed as a charge on the computer. The receptionist said she would remove it from our bill if we didn't want to pay it. Talk about hidden charges!    Shame. The place is brilliantly located, and lovely in terms of décor. But they really need to review it through the eyes of their customers.

I got upgraded to a premier room - which was amazing.  The hotel is bright and fresh looking and so clean.  The staff were so friendly.  Location is perfect for overnighters in Singapore as its so close to the airport with a free shuttle bus. And theres a great shopping mall next door.  The bed was huge and so comfortable and a lovely big deep bath for a bubble bath.  Great in room facilities also.

The hotel was spotlessly clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  In a great position.
The corridor was so dark you had a problem seeing the room number and getting the key in.    The rooms are very basic.

The reception staff were very friendly and gave alot of good information. The hotel was in a good central location.
The walls of the room were filty. The bed was not comfortable. The breakfast quality was poor as was the service.

Very affordable, great value-for-money. Good sized rooms. Excellent staff professionalism - very friendly and helpful.
The food was mediocre, however, I have heard that this is case in several hotels in Dubai. Apart from this negative, a very sound hotel.

Relocated to a lower quality hotel due to over booking.very disappointed.

Great place to stay enjoyed every minute of it!
Great place to stay enjoyed every minute of it!
Excellent value for money and rooms were quiet large. Very central location also close to the beach no hills to climb.
Excellent value for money and rooms were quiet large. Very central location also close to the beach no hills to climb.
Excellently located for ExCeL.  Clean, modern room and very comfortable bed.  Good aircon and free wi-fi.  Iron and board in room.  Staff friendly and helpful.

No guest book information in room.  Cardboard cups provided, not proper mugs.  Lack of privacy with blackout blinds raised.  Stingily, only permitted three small items   hot drink for breakfast.  Restaurant prices extortionate.

Beds very uncomfortable,only one door key between five guests,great view but beware if you dont like heights !! we were on 31st floor and hotel is on a hill not a problem for us except for one of our party who would not leave the room, we are sure we saw a plane pass below us...........or that may have been an after effect of a great night out in Benidorm !!!

I stayed here for my Stag do with 18 others. We booked 5 aparytments which were amazing. The balconys were huge and the pool was excellent. All the lads were amazed how nice the apartments were. You do need to pay 100euro deposit but we got this back on deparrure, as long as the place isn't wrecked they are fine. We broke a few cups and just paid for those.  The hotel is located near the casino and is a 5 mins walk from the beach which is ideal.   The staff were class and very friendly.
Hotel bedrooms clean and well equipped. Very comfortable. Check in and out very easy.

Staff not very helpful at times. Got drink orders at the bar completely wrong and struggled to understand what was needed to rectify. Even though only two drinks had been ordered. Bar was quiet so not rushed off their feet but seemed to be under each others feet. Not very professional at all. Breakfast staff rude and unhelpful.
Hotel bedrooms clean and well equipped. Very comfortable. Check in and out very easy.

Staff not very helpful at times. Got drink orders at the bar completely wrong and struggled to understand what was needed to rectify. Even though only two drinks had been ordered. Bar was quiet so not rushed off their feet but seemed to be under each others feet. Not very professional at all. Breakfast staff rude and unhelpful.
Fantastic Hotel with perfect location and extremely friendly service.  Very nice rooms and the ones on the top with a beautiful lake view
The pier at the lake is not yet operational

This hotel was under major construction and I feel very let down by Hotelopia that you did not notify me of this at the time of booking you only mentioned that the pool was closed!      The ceiling in our bathroom fell in on our last day there as the work for the re-modelling was taking place on the floor above us from 8am that morning.  I immediately made a complaint to the management  who have said they will be contacting you regarding a refund for our stay.  I have tried calling your customer service  line today but it's engaged.  I would appreciate acknowledgement that you have received this complaint and will be dealing with the re-fund when you hear from the Hotel Management. My email is carol.orr@trintech.com  my phone number is 0y7932 674540. I was extremely disappointed with this hotel, it had a very musty smell about it, the decoration was dirty and torn in places.  The only good thing about it was the location.

Great base for a night or weekend in Cardiff - on past experience I know it can be very expensive to stay there. This certainly ain't the Ritz, but it's clean, comfortable and a damn sight cheaper than most places. Very close to town too. Also has a 24 hour bar which can't be bad!
Parking on site is nigh on impossible - however only £12 for a 19 hour stay in the NCP car park at St David's 2 across the road, so not too bad.

We had a wonderful stay and the staff went above and beyond to be friendly and helpful. Super room, very clean and well appointed. We can't wait to return!    Lovely pool but too cold to swim in, sadly.

Not really a negative but there were no English Breakfast or similar (Liptons etc) tea bags and the water in the lobby was usually only tepid and impossible to brew a good cup of tea - essential to us Brits!  A trip to nearby Walmart soon sorted the tea bags, but water was more difficult.    Another washing machine and drier would have been really helpful, too as only one meant a queue at times.    Neither of these things spoiled our stay! Had a great time.

We had a wonderful stay and the staff went above and beyond to be friendly and helpful. Super room, very clean and well appointed. We can't wait to return!    Lovely pool but too cold to swim in, sadly.

From the moment we arrived the staff were very helpful and attentive to our requests. The position of the hotel was very central to both shopping, dining
Excellent hotel. Staff very friendly, hotel clean, great location and the most comfortable bed we have ever stayed in. We will return to the New Yorker next time we are in town.
Excellent hotel. Staff very friendly, hotel clean, great location and the most comfortable bed we have ever stayed in. We will return to the New Yorker next time we are in town.
close to where you need to be in blackpool
the hotel is basic but clean, in a great location for shopping and concerts with parking onsite and a brilliant price  stopped for one night with my wife and 3 year old and have no complaints
Very spoiling room and very clean
Excellent stay.  Check in was very quick and the room was exceptional.  I will definatly be back
Staff were lazy and had 2 b drilled for answers and were not very clear and forthcoming in giving information
Room not ready on arrival even after notification  of arrival time twice once in person by my daughter prior to arrival.

I found the value for money and exceptional customer service at the reception the best part.  The rooms were very clean and tidy, even the pen on the writing pad was perfectly placed.  This showed real pride in their service and gave a homely feel.
The buffet breakfast was included in our stay however I found the selection could have been more wider and the hot buffet should be and look more fresher. Otherwise a good stay.

I found the value for money and exceptional customer service at the reception the best part.  The rooms were very clean and tidy, even the pen on the writing pad was perfectly placed.  This showed real pride in their service and gave a homely feel.
The buffet breakfast was included in our stay however I found the selection could have been more wider and the hot buffet should be and look more fresher. Otherwise a good stay.

Situated right on the beach and behind the best priced "on the beach restaurant "- "Champlung" - the facilities, hospitality and awesome location made this a memorable holiday for us and our 2 boys. The hotel organized tours, were helpful with queries and were warm and professional. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned out everyday.  The clean spacious pool has a" built in  sunken bar area" and the ample gardens are very pretty, treed and have a small play area.   The airconditioned rooms had comfortable spacious beds and fridge, coffee , tea, kettle, television and Wifi access. The patio proved to be invaluable spot to put out all our surf gear, wet towels etc.     Overall - it was the best deal we found on the web and my kids who never normally like the beach got right into it as it was right on our doorstep...They even learnt to surf!  For those who like to be "seen" the upmarket Cocoon bar/restaurant is a 5 minute stroll away!

The first 3 nights were very peaceful  but the last 4 were spoilt a bit by an intake of very noisy group of people who took up 3 rooms next to and opposite us - my husband and I did not complain but I am sure the hotel would have moved us to another room if we had.      Suggestions to hotel : Breakfast was ample but it would have been nice  to provide an even greater variety of your  local fruits in the morning and had a few more breakfast cereal choices (such as muesli etc ) and  offered flavoured yogurts for kids. Changing the breakfast choices a little bit more each day would be awesome!!  The combined bath/shower was handy but the bath too small for an adult to lie back in...the bath towels, though obviously a good quality and clean, could do with replacing.  The pool noodles could do with replacing and providing a trampoline for kids  and/or an outdoor chess paved area  would make this an even more versatile and family friendly hotel.

Very friendly and helpful staff, nice big rooms, bed was very comfortable, everything as per description.
Room could have been cleaner

The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Facilities and food were fantastic. No limits on the drinks, including branded spirits. Gym was also well equipped if you needed some exercise to build up your appetite for the next meal on offer! Loved the water taxi that took you to the other hotels in the group.

Minor niggle that the bathroom could do with modernising and there were several large groups at the hotel whilst we were staying, so would not be the right environment for a cosy, intimate  holiday. Our room was close to the evening activity which continued til 10.30 which may be a problem for those with younger children. Ask for a room further away.
Perfect room, perfect price and perfect service. The South African lady on front desk was the most polite person I've dealt with in along time. Class act and hotel.. Would highly recommend
They were very helpful with everything we needed.
The only drawback is that it{s in an older part of towm. Don{t wander around after dark.

Microwave in the villa did not work  Bedding was of the quality of a three-star hotel  Bathroom faucets were broken  Overall quality of the villa was poor even though it was spacious; for that quality, it was ridiculously over-priced  There was a charge for everything;even the shuttle to the shopping area, which is a complementary service at most hotels

could not fault the facilities at the hotel, coffee available 24/7, afternoon snacks and lemonade provided and the breakfast had enough choice for anyone. reception staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times. We travelled a long  to stay for the CMA fest and would definately choose this hotel again. Location to downtown was reasonable walking distance but for the less mobile a shuttle bus goes back and forth downtown e.
location is excellent, the service is first class
the gym and sauna area / and exercise  machinery, is all needing refurbished,  when seen by guests would put a negative   outlook on the hotel
No assistance with Multiple bags to the room  Breafast was not good
Great experience, wonderful location, leaving relaxed.
While you do get value for money in this hotel, the price is not competitive to comparable hotel elsewhere in Europe or the World.
Good and central location.
clean room with fridge, nice swimming pool  bus stop to Lindos or Rhodes 50m away
All very good :).Close to everything.
All very good :).Close to everything.
Rooms are good     with safe   trouser press    kettle etc
No noise,  "black out" curtains and excellent bed. Quality nights sleep - biggest problem - getting up.
Excellent location, friendly staff, lovely view from room and restaurant.
Room service was excellent and all staff were very kind.  Food was excellent. Very relaxing.  One could stay a week without having to travel outside the grounds.

The beds were very uncomfortable...very hard and noisy at the slightest move.  We could hear everything in the room next door eg. television, toilet flushing, voices and every time they moved in their beds.

My husband and I had four wonderful days  at Finca de son Palou. The hotel is  beautiful with a special charming athmosphere, the staff very nice, friendly, helpfull and ptofessional, fantastic food,beautiful surroundings, extremely quiet - you only hear a sheep now and then and birds singing all day long. We enjoyed every minut of our stay.

Great hotel perfect size . The hotel was full but didn't feel over crowded. Very modern pool area with great facilities including a children's pool, normal pool and a hydro contact area. Great value for money and the Customer service pays a large part of the hotels attraction
The Balcony area on our room wasn't very generous and felt a bit secluded facing the kitchens .and never really got much sun,  however the apartment it's self was a generous size
The roof bar was a very pleasant area where we were able to have a drink in the summer sun - although I'm not sure where thats gone now!!

Moved hotels as over booked. Wasn't asked was told. Always use this hotel. Terrible communication with hotel staff. Complained several times.   Other hotel is part and was called caribbeanBay. Lack of all facilities. I have 5 days booked in Oct and hope I don't experience the same again.  I probably won't use this hotel after this unless there is dramatic changes. Also I won't reccomend this hotel to others as don't want them to be disappointed.   PalmaBay complex on the other hand is FAB. Close to everything and good value for money.   Disappointed to have been told its because I only stay for 2/3 days a time. (At least every 6 weeks I visit mind you).  Food in main complex is fine along with the bar. Very friendly along with the entertainment team.
Very welcoming atmosphere. Staff on reception and bar should be commended for their friendliness and helpful approach
very good 2nd stay in 2 months. Intend to go back in autumn
hotel should consider loyalty awards for frequent visitors
Restaurant food - both chose fish all of which tasteless, wines we chose not available.  Plastic cups for hot drinks in room - odd when real glasses provided for water.
Very well located in the old quarter opposite the museum with short walk to metro and ferries to souks. Staff gave good advice on tourist activities and were very friendly. Shower was excellent!
Room air conditioning a little noisey and did not respond to control console. Wi- fi reception variable.
Having stayed at the accommodation previously I can with no doubt say that the exceptional standard of cleanliness comfort and customer care is being maintained
Staff very pleasant and helpful.  Room immaculate.  Excellent location.
Should have all inclusive breakfast and wifi and use of unmanned facilities eg pool.

Excellent service throughout our stay from all the staff who were always polite and very informative. Lovely large room and bathroom, spotlessly clean with everything you needed. This was our start for a tour of Spain and it set us off in a very happy mood which made all the difference. Great location in the city within walking distance of many shops, bars/restaurants and lovely tapas bars. We loved Santander and the Silken Coliseum and will definitely return again soon.

Beautiful resort, professional and social staff who speaks good English, stunning beach, comfortable rooms, always warm water, tasty drinks, popular club on the premises with free entry for guests.     It is kind of neat that they have different color arm-bands depending on where you're from, blue for Europe, red for USA, green for Canada.

The food is varied with some things being great and others not, showering in our room left a puddle of water on the floor, salesmen at the resort make it hard to completely relax but will be good for your self esteem because they will tell you you're beautiful, the system for WiFi is unpractical and expensive - we went outside the resort and found free WiFi for quickly checking our emails, so no one should expect to be connected while at the resort unless willing to pay too much for it.
very basic, small rooms
The room was very nice for the price. Nice view and very close to the city center.
Good price, good food, room oke and also outside everything allright.

loved everything about the hotel, the food was great, the best by far i've had in any of the dominican republic. the pools were lovely and everywhere was clean, i dont really have any complaints about the hotel
Lower level felt muggy humid and the fan provided didn't really help
Didn't find anything positive about the hotel.

Not a very good location.   Stinky lobby and rooms. Filthy bathroom.   Toilet flush not working properly. Poor quality soap provided.   Fresh towels were stinking. Always had to wait atleast 10 mins to be served at the front desk.   Reception would never answer your phone. Ordered pasta which was not good at all.   Hotel staff said they do complimentary airport drop offs but when asked said no we don't you will have to find your taxi.   Staff not very knowledgeable, asked if train goes to the airport and they said no only taxi however train goes directly to the terminals.   Very disappointed. Had worst stay at citrus.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!  Bar shut at 10.30pm.  Morning paper ordered but none available.  Breakfast not available on first morning as we were told we were too late 9.10 am we were told 9.30 am finish. Breakfast on second morning was disgusting - bacon so crispy could not be cut.  Beans must have been in pan all the previous week.  Tomatoes not cooked and extremely hard.    Noise from air conditioning unit kept me awake nearly all night.    Our stay was Sunday 9th and Monday 10th June.    We stayed at the Best Western Weston Hall Hotel in Bulkington on Saturday 8th June and this was FIRST CLASS.    I was told by friends that the Best Western in Northampton was being closed.  THE SOONER THE BETTER.
very pleased especially for the price! The males at teh desk were nicer than the females and all of the employees from the maids to the repairmen to the food servers were super nice!

they had to close the hot tub twice and the man at the desk when i called told me if I let them know by monday at noon that i wanted to check out a day early I wouldnt be charged and when I went to tell them at the front desk that I wanted to check out on Tuesday inseatd of Wednesday i was told i still had to pay for that night.  i did check out on Tuesday as opposed to Wednesday  the reason I had to check out early was due to a death in the family.

The Holiday Inn Express on broadway in Nashville is in a great location - an easy walk from the downtown area but just far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be peaceful. Staff were all fantastic, rooms were good without being great, and the facilities covered pretty much everything you'd expect from a normal hotel (except a bar)! Breakfast was fresh and plentiful, every request was fulfilled without any fuss, and the compilmentary wifi was a real bonus. An all round great experience.
good location, The rooms is new and clean.My family
Cool hotel, quirky rooms. AC in rooms and looked clean.

shower/wet room. When the shower is on the whole room is under water, shower, sink, toilet and bin! Took 2 hours to fully drain and even then the floor was wet which was annoying if wanted to use the sink or toilet.

Nothing. This was the first time I paid for 3 persons and turns out you still have to pay again for an extra bed. I am guessing the Triple Rate only entitles a third person to breath in the air and no place to sleep.

This was the first time I paid for 3 persons and turns out you still have to pay again for an extra bed. I am guessing the Triple Rate only entitles a third person to breath in the air and no place to sleep. Despite clearly stating the occupancy as three adults, and paying a higher rate, the hotel did not provide an extra bed. They charged us by force, i.e refusing to let us check in if we did not pay for an extra bed.
just perfect ,  top friendly staff.well done to all at hotel.
nothing negative to say about hotel.
Good location with two metro lines nearby.  Pleasant staff.
The hotel bill was not properly done.  Taxes on lunch were calculated double.

Great, great staff at Hotel Fiume. Our booking managed to get lost in translation (not sure if it was booking agency or hotel who were responsible) but staff at Hotel Fiume could not have been more helpful. We were given a room in another lovely hotel nearby with all arrangements made for us and transport organized. We then came back to the lovely Hotel Fiume for the rest of our stay. Comfortable, lovely and clean and a great breakfast to start us off on our days of exploring Rome.
Nothing negative to say. Great stay.
Good location - close to beach, transport and town
Overall a lovely place to stay, although take brolly if walking to tram station, which is around corner
Unfortunately we had some VERY loud
Kind staff at reception
Cleaning was so and so, staff
Very pleased with the hotel and its close location to the Hbf

The quality of this lovely hotel is 5 star in all ways.  Staff are smiling helpful and clearly aiming to please and eliminate any initial small teething problems.  The restaurant clearly uses high quality ingredients.    Not a criticism but an opinion, The restaurants are beautifully modern and functional, perfect for families, however less appropriate for couples who want an adult atmosphere and intimacy at dinner.

I have stayed at the Coconut before and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.  The staff are friendly, the rooms are small but very clean.  Its only a 5min walk to the beach, the pink line is 2min away, there is an ABC store on the corner for drinks, snacks etc.  Its the perfect hotel but remember it is a hotel not a resort - so the pool is small, the rooms are small but its exceptional in every other manner.

Location is awesome, the hotel has everything you need if you cannot find it onsite it is close by. Being on the beach was great having cocktails by the water another perk. The food at the cafe on site was great and Starbucks is here my kids loved that.
Gaya has a very nice pool, but it's a pity that the sun isnt there in the afternoon.
When we booked back in dec they were renovating the pool due to be finished in may,however still under major reconstruction, so we only had access to a makeshift pool!  Very disappointing
Central location. Very helpful proprioters .

We were lucky to chose this hotel. The hotel location is perfect. If you do not want to pay $25 for valet parking. A public parking for $15 per day ( free in and out) just next door. You can walk to beautiful shopping center and market place and the beach. We got the early check in at 11:00am instead of 3:00pm. The breakfarst are very nice, not luxory but you get everything you need. Also they provide afternoon refreshment which is a very good suprise. The room is well presented and clean. Stuff are super friendly. Our kids enjoyed the swimming pool very much. The 24/7 restaurant is so convenient when you don't want to go out eating. We had wonderful 5 nights there.
Lovely hotel with a fab location
Everything was positive except

1 negative review.    When we checked in we were offered a river view room for an extra payment per night (£30 instead of £50) which we declined.  When we got to our room we had a river view room anyway which was lovely, but I do wonder what I would have paid an extra £30 per night for if I'd said yes to a River View.

The hotel staff was great, we had trouble finding a parking spot in the car park and they helped us to find one outside, the staff at the reception desk was very nice and friendly, I forgot to bring my own plug adapter for my electric toothbrush and they happily found one for me. The room itself and the bed was comfortable and clean.

The bathroom is generally quite run down, the wash basin was moslty cracked and the cracks have turned black which I thought should be replaced for hygiene purpose. Some tiles in the shower area was the same. The shower was very very weak no matter haw far you turned the taps. However, i was very disgusted with the towels. Nearly every towel had hair on it, long ones, short ones, and they are not mine as I haven't even used them. I almost thought that it was used to wipe the floor and folded back up and left on the bench.

We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was handy for the shops and the Pavilion and its gardens. As it was adjacent to the Dome we  were able to enjoy the Spa and not have far to go given the weather. On another occasion we would attempt to organize ourselves better to enjoy all the facilities the hotel and Buxton have to offer, including the Opera House. Given the inclement weather we appreciated the warmth in our rooms and the fact we had booked an evening meal, also that we could sit in comfort in the bar with  our coffee and drinks.
Great landscape, nice lobby, friendly staff!
Very relaxing and nice time away.  I will definately go stay there again.
My hotel package didnt include breakfast which was a pitty.  My friend stayed the first night in another single room and she got a lastminute deal for $100 including breakfast.

Very nice hotel, clean friendly staff nice little gym and sauna, secure as late at night gates are closed and only access is via the security guard.Easy to travel into Barcelona and surrounding areas via local bus which stops 2 mins walk from the hotel. would definitely recommend staying and I would definitely go back.
Location is good
Noisy and dated.
Good value for money, close to the beach and local amenities
Noise from disco and from children running along the corridors late at night
We had a great time at this hotel. It is central, near the beach and near center of town. Really recommend this hotel, we will be back :-)
I have only good things to say. Close to the airport without being noisy - perfect!
Building decor and facilities tired.
Hotel near mall so plenty of food options
had a room only, no meals.  spacious well equipped room, good beds.
none, personally i prefer smaller hotels than this one but difficult to find at equal price/ quality at st martins.

Arrived at the hotel to be informed that they were fully booked and they could not understand how I had managed to make the booking on-line.  They found me another hotel about 5 miles away which was almost impossible to get to because of roadworks in the center.  I eventually got to my room at around 11.45 pm hungry,exhausted and above all very frustrated.  I therefore will not be using this facility in the future.

Appartment was very clean, clear instructions were left for us with regards to emergency contacts, internet etc due to our late arrival. Owner came to meet us in the morning to ensure everything was OK with the facilities and did we need anything. Beautiful views.
Apartment is at the top of a hill, so not suitable for people that are not good with walking.   There is transport though into the town from just outside. (local bus)

Good location, spacious room with the option to cook if no wish to go eat in a restaurant alone; the room was quiet (except for the people in other rooms).   Balcony with a spavious view on the backsides of buildings, interesting.   Good breakfast (buffet style, variety).   Friendly staff.

The walls of the room are quite dirty and paint is peeling off in some places, so the walls need some cleaning and refreshing.   Also, some dust on the floor next to the couch, and a few short hairs in the bathroom when I arrived.   People from rooms next door and upstairs are heard very easily.  The receptionist who checked me in didn't tell me that a magnetic card attached to the key has to be inserted into a slit in the wall behind the door in order to have electricity for the light switches. Maybe frequent travellers know this already, but it should be explained to every guest on arrival in my opinion.
Near beach and town centre

All request before going ignored ....asked to be as high as possible away from lifs and noise ....we were put on 1st floor over the entrance which was very noises at night ...right next to the lift and stairs ....so not only did we get the noise of everybody in the hotel come in the entrance we also got it from people going up the stair ...out the lifts ....then we tried to book a safe and we were told to come back twice as they were changing shifts ??? ......defo won't book this again .......not enough sun beds for such a big hotel complex ...had to be down at 7 to get one if you were lucky
This hotel is in a fantastic location, right by Piazza San Marco. The staff were very nice
Breakfasts were very good.  Staff friendly. Comfortable, quiet accommodation.

We got the impression that because we received a discount on the accommodation, we got the worst room in the hotel.  Really small compared to other rooms.  It was also in a block far removed from main center. On checking in, it was not queried whether we wanted a non smoking/smoking room and no one on hand to take luggage to our room. I do not believe that even with a reduced price we got great value for money from a hotel of this class.
Staff was very friendly. Comfy beds and very quiet. I would stay there again.
Everything was just as we wanted it to be. Great breakfast, helpful staff, clean area in and outside.   Free wi-fi - very nice.     Very good position at the beach.
If there is anything to complain about it must the the cost of sunbeds, 8 € pr day... The neighbor offers sunbeds for 6€ ;)) - the hotel is a beach hotel, so beach towels would be nice.
The hotel location was near from the sea

The bed was not clean, the shower holder was broken. During the night neighboring doors close and open a lot because there was a nightclub in hotel. The  nightclub attendance was used hotel room for spend nice time with prostitutes, this is my thinking. I not recommend this hotel for any tourists.
lovely staff , always happy to help .! ..   great food .
1) hotel room balcony requires lighting .   2) hotel room require tea /coffee facilities   3) bar at the pool not open very many times , meaning that you have to walk to the beach bar to get a drink
Very well located from Ohare. A small park lake nearby great to stretch your legs after a long flight. Shuttle bus is available from Ohare. However you may have to call hotel to ensure collection.
Nice room over-looking courtyard, very generous breakfast, staff friendly. Good value for money. Hotel had character. Was very pleased to have chosen it.
Not sure why photo ID requested, but they were happy to waive this when I had none.
Housekeeping needs to do a better job, especially in the bathrooms, bathroom could have been fresher:
For best stay ask for a room overlooking the canal, this gives a real feel for Venice.
Very beautiful hotel and the staff were amazing.

I ordered my starter, not available.  Ordered a new one, not available,  ordered a certain wine, not available. The dinner was okay but not amazing and not worth the bill or the wait. Also aircon was far to loud but without it its far to hot.
Very clean, great views of Bran Castle
Bag carrier did not fit the lift and staff did not offer to help.

I upgraded on arrival to get a sea view.  The room was full of insects and I reported same to reception on arrival.  Nothing was done.  The room seemed actually dirty.  The stairs and corridors were filthy and never cleaned while we were there.  I stayed three nights even though I paid for seven and booked into a different complex for my last four nights so I ended up very much out of pocket.  I only got a refund of 48 euro being the 12 euro per night extra for last four nights.  I certainly would not recommend this complex to anyone and am very disappointed at being left out of pocket.  I will not be booking through Hotelopia again or recommending same to any of my acquaintances.
We were very pleased with the hotel.  It was in the centre of town and the facilities were excellent.
great position close to city centre. good value for money.  free parking a bonus.

Unfriendly and unprofessional staff. Used 3 different rooms, not one was adequate : either the telephone or the TV or the air conditioning not working. Fridges not working in any of the rooms. Great location , great staff

It had 1 of the biggest private Jacuzzis and uninterrupted views (rm 19). The afternoon receptionist helped us book everything including an amazing day sailing. We had breakfast 1morning in our rm out of the 4
Nice location, and nice view over the sea

Nice small hotel. The room was clean, with a wardrobe and plenty of hooks to hang your clothes and towels. There was a also fridge. The bathroom was also fairly big and very clean. The staff was friendly and very helpful.
The bread and croissants at breaksfast were disappointing (tasteless), but the buffet offered a wide variety of coffees, teas, fruits, and jams.
Everything!

The room was amazing. We had a mini-suite - two toilets, two showers, a seating area, a kitchenette and a balcony with a fantastic view of the Bellagio Fountains.

This is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. The room had a kitchenette however it had NO utensils, no coffee-maker, no kettle, no nothing. Apparently everything had been taken away a year ago (to make more money!). It would have cost 5 DOLLARS to get room service to deliver hot water to the room for coffee / tea!! Can you imagine a 5 star hotel in London, or anywhere else for that matter doing that?!    Also, our room was not serviced on day (out of three), instead a note was put under our door saying we had displayed the Do Not Disturb sign. We didn't have a do not disturb sign!!! So we complained and somebody came to service our room at 23:45... ridiculous!

The Bali Dream Villa Suite was perfect for what i required for this holiday. The villa was spotless, the staff friendly and helpful and the food was reasonably priced and lovely. I would recommend this place to anyone that wanted a quiet, relaxing stay away from home for a week or so. It was just a lovely place to stay and i would definately stay there again.

If i had anything negative, it would be the location. It is slightly off the beaten track. But having said that, as you come out of the villa, there is a small group of cabs that will take you anywhere you need to go. It was just a small inconvienence, but nothing to really create any problems or dramas.

the apartments are in a quiet area of albufeira although a few minutes walk to the 'shopping area' where there was a mini supermarket with essentials and a coffee shop/ bakers/ newsagents then another minute to the marina where there are many bars and restaurants. plenty loungers and several parasols around the pool area.  the place was immaculate and the kitchen appliances were all in working order although we really only used the kettle, coffee maker, fridge and washing machine.  it is a nice15min walk to 'old town albufeira' although easy to get a taxi or bus to there too. Found that the tv had several british tv channels.
only get wifi in the reception area (3g everywhere else).

ther apartment itself was very clean and tidy and should the things I've mentioned in the negative were fine it would have been a pleasant stay.

Hi      Regarding this apartment - i am sorry but we were not that happy.      We picked up the keys from Hotel Plaza Nueva but were not informed that we had to switch on the boiler for hot water. On top of that the air conditioning was not working. There were no shower gels provided, and no toilet rolls.

I have booked a roomw/ a garden veiw  for 2 adults and 1 child 10 yrs. old. when we arrived they said that they have upgrade our into a superior one. I can't see any garden in our room and not only that, my son has no extra bed. I thought tha if you book for 3 persons, the extra bed is already included just like all hotels in Europe and some of other asian countries. they said I have to pay extra  for the extra bed and I argue and they told us tha they are giving free  an extra bed as a complementary. I have called them many times but the complementary bed was never  been delivered. We end up sharing a double bed which made our stay very uncomfortabel :-((. It's very noisy in the lobby. Never again Manila Penisula!
Fantastic Location Loved our stay!!

I stopped over on the  from Australia to UK. I just wanted to relax and had 2 nights  The hotel was near the airport. Accommodation very comfortable. Room and bed spacious. Restaurant excellent both breakfast and evening meal. Staff friendly and helpful. Pool and health spa excellent.   I'd recommend this hotel

My husband and I are retired motel owners and were very impressed with the service, quality, cleanliness, manicured grounds, and intend to return when we can  stay longer. The location and beach area is ideal.  We couldn't have enjoyed our stay more.  Sincerely,  Ron
please improove lobby

Perfect for an overnight stay whilst flying into or out of KLIA.  Hotel is generally clean however we have noticed room cleanliness standards dropping in recent years.  This could be attributed to the very large turn over of guests.  Some guests are ignoring the NO SMOKING rules which makes is very unpleasant for other guests, however the reception was very quick to give us another room when this happened on one of our recent visits.  We use this hotel regularly and would recommend it but suggest that guests don't make their expectations too high.  It is a transit hotel with pool and gym and a decent reataurant, convenitenly situated to both the KLIA and LCCT airports, with free transfer from KLIA and transport for a fee to the LCCT.
Friendly atmosphere and close to all you need.
The hotel was spotless. Spacious rooms.  Pleasant staff.. Good value.
Swimming facilities great, breakfast good, clean enough, very cheap so good enough for the price
pipe in toilet constantly running, shower has poor flow

Have to pay extra to have coffee in the room, did not expect that from a 5 star category hotel.  Some plastic covers that sorround the swimming pool was broken in multiple areas, very hazardous. The handle to get in and out of the pool was also broken, but overall we had a wonderful stay, will definitely consider it again in the future.
Very happy with the quality of this hotel and would definately go back without hesitation
Beautiful lobby upon entering, staff very polite and helpful.  Food was lovely for the half board deal, very good value for money!

Parking price at £7 at day for their own car park, was a little unfair.  Our room was definitely not at 4 star standards! There were nails sticking out the side of the bath panel by an inch or so, paper peeling of the walls, lime scale on the radiator from leaks, which had tried to be repaired with green stripy electric tape! The room had an awful smell,  we had to leave the windows wide open the whole stay, as it made me feel ill.  The mattress was stained badly, we could see it through the sheets. I was very disappointed with what I found as the reviews where so good. I know we had a good food deal and of course expected a cheaper room, but to be honest I have stayed in 3 star hotels with standard rooms much more 4 star than this.

Hotel had recently been refurbished, everything was very clean. Staff were very helpful. Our special deal through Hotelopia included breakfast. At first the hotel did not recognise that, but after showing them a copy of my booking, they agreed and issued complimentary breakfast vouchers for the duration of the stay.  The accommodation was actually a terrace house with 2 bedrooms
Great facilities (great beach, swimming pools, water slides and water park), the quality of the food was very good and the location of the beach.

The facilities appear run down and in need of repair.  The cleanliness of the rooms could much be improved.  There were no face towels and insufficient other towels.  The beds creacked and were of low quality.  Most of the staff either looked tired or were disengaged with service.

current roadworks make locating access to the hotel difficult with GPS - thi is not a fault of the hotel

The food itself was really really nice, good tasting and not as dull as we have experienced before in all inclusive hotels. The location and the view from the hotel was fantastic too. I also found the staff to be much better in english then I had gotten the impression off from other reviews, in fact there was only two people during our complete stay that didn't talk english that well (the cleaning lady and one of the servants that took away dishes from the tables).    I would definitely recommend this hotel since we had a very nice stay (even if we don't consider this to be a 5 star hotel)

I would certainly not rate it a 5 star hotel since there were many things that was broken or in need of restoration. For exampel lost pain on the walls, 2 out of 5 heated marble beds were working, the steam sauna was out of order, Under a bridge that crossed the pools there was broken wooden planks that you had to avoid when going under the bridge. There are tons of these kind of things and since we came here at the start of the high season then you would expect that these kind of things would have been fixed during the low season. Also there were long queues to the beverages during the dinners due to the fact that they didn't place out the regular soda machines (coca cola etc) so people could serve themself, instead you had to queue to ONE bar to get a glass of coca cola.    Things like this certainly doesn't give the impression of a 5-star hotel and I would only rate it a 4 star hotel.    Also they fail to utilize the two most amazing locations they have on the hotel which are the rooftop bar and the terrace with a waterfall where the tables and chairs are put into the shallow water pool so you can sit there. During our stay they didn't serve any beverages at the rooftop bar except for on a saturday and no beverages/food at the terrace. Since these are the two locations that we found to be really cool and unique then it's sad that they were pretty empty of people since there was nothing to do at the locations themself

The food was the only thing I was not to keen on but that could be down to my  pallette
staff very polite and friendly

door handle to bathroom was hanging off so could not close door just in case we could not get out, no security lock on the main door, bath slip mate needed replacing was very old and stained, taps sprayed everywhere other than in the sink.
location, walking distance from Arc de Triomphe

There where three of us staying her for a weekend and i have to say the staff where great the door men when we came in in the mornings were just hilarious. Eric and Bartholomew (well thats what they told us) where so friendly and made sure we were looked after.  the beds are probably the most comfortable ive ever slept in. location is perfect for walking distance from the center of liverpool

on the friday we decided to have lunch in the Hotel my fish was pretty bland and the chips where extremely under cooked  my friends chicken burger was tasteless her chips also under cooked they got my other friends order wrong and when it was rectified she was given a stale roll again her chips also under cooked. but pizza express is right outside so we didnt go hungry.. all in all we had a great time and we were looked after extremely well
Helpful and friendly staff. Excellent facilities clean modern rooms.
Very clean great food friendly helpful staff will return again enjoyed our stay. More than I expected for price
This is a beautiful old building nicely converted.

We missed the fact that there weren't any "little extras" that you might expect in a high quality place, eg we were charged for a newspaper, no bath robes, etc. The tone of the information in the room was rather "preachy" for instance telling us that we must wear footwear to breakfast (we were not planning to go barefoot!). On several occasions there was no-one at reception and no bell to request someone to come.
Excellent staff attitude and very helpful.  Hotel is close to main Metro line.
Bathroom supplies were low (shampoo and body wash) and no tea making facilities.  Otherwise fine.
Staff were so friendly
Poor nightly entertainment. No a/c in rooms.

Very dark hotel with no sunlight. I received a small room where you look directly on a wall which was also dark. So I changed the hotel as soon as I could. The hotel does not have an proper website in English, my written request for a room with a seaview was not answered. Luckily, the staff was very helpful and put me into the hotel "Las Arenas" which is oviously cooperating with the management of Nautic Hotel.
very clean and professional.  Non-slip mat in shower.
revolting items found in safe (which had not been cleaned).  Shower head fixed above so could not shower as I could not get my ear wet (after recent operation).  Only one shampoo, body lotion
Beach area is very nice.  Good that it offers free wifi

Food is very poor, no fresh coffee in dining room - have to wait for main lobby bar to open at 10 am to get a fresh cup of coffee!  Many drunk guests while we were there so had to keep moving children out of harms  as tables went flying - even early in the morning!

This was a last minute holiday and I booked not knowing much about the hotel, however all my worries were quickly over when we arrived and were greeted by very friendly staff and a lovely bar/pool area. We were promptly shown to our room which was very clean and had all the essentials needed (sink, fridge/freezer, kettle, small work top hob) there was ample clothes storage space in x2 wardrobe/drawer units and a small table with mirror. There was no TV which I liked as you don't go on holiday to watch TV anyway. The bathroom has a shower area in the corner (and yes there is no shower curtain which wasn't a problem but for some reason british reviewers online always seem to cry about it! Just close the door it's no problem!) There was a lovely little balcony which looked out  the pool area and was fairly close to the bar... This was very nice in evening as we could sit on our balcony and just hear the music and people enjoying themselves in the bar (we heard one couple complain about the bar noise once) however I think they must have been very boring people with nothing better to moan about because our room was literally right next to the bar and it didn't bother our sleep once and infact gave a lovely sense of atmosphere in the evenings. The hotel had a good range of breakfasts, snacks or meals on offer which were available throughout the day, all food we had was very good value and nice size portions. We went as bed and breakfast so had the choice of breakfast from the menu upto €4.50 each every morning which basically included every breakfast option bar one which was €5.00 euro but if you wanted that you just paid €0.50. We had a lovely English breakfast or omelette or other things on toast which I thought was great value for money and all nicely cooked food. The cleaners were very good and I think over the week stay we had 2 maybe 3 visits while we were out to clean the room, change sheets, towels, bins etc they were too very friendly and helpful. We spent most days out and about travelling the island and eating out but when we did stay at the hotel we used the pool area which was very nice and well cleaned by the older gentleman that seemed to do most of the pool duties, it was treated and cleaned everyday that we were there so I would disregard other reviews that say otherwise. There were ample sun loungers and umbrellas and two pools (small shallow pool for little ones, and a larger deeper pool for us big ones) we only went as a couple and it was ideal but i can also  imagine it would be great as a family hotel too as it was easy to keep an eye on little ones (we are planning to go back next year with family) they have a policy whereby you can only eat/drink items bought at the hotel by the pool which I had no problem with and infact didn't mind doing as I know they need to make a living too and there was a small shop with most essiensials attached to the bar/eating area which saves you walking to the supermarket in the centre anyway and in my eyes I would rather help out the hotel I was staying in than a supermarket in town. The bar was reasonably priced and had a good variety of beers, wines and spirits, soft drink and hot drinks. It is also a short walk to the beach, about ten minutes, and about 5 minutes to the main strip, so is easy to experience the beach and other bars/resteraunts that Alykanas has to offer (many great ones may I say- try millennium bar out very friendly place, great cocktails! And levante restraunt-best food we had all week!) I am 22 and stayed with my partner (also 22) for one week and really can not find fault with the stay I would like to say a big thank you to everyone that works at the Elpida for making my holiday a great one!

don't use the "limousine" transportation from the hotel.  Payed 10 Euros (more or less 100 Egyptians Pounds) to go to Naama Bay while the real cost should have been half price (50 E.P.) .The car they gave us had a broken tire and broke on the  out, had to share another cab with an egyptian family....on the  back we had to wait 30 minutes and the same cab that had the tire problem bursted it 1 km from the hotel...and we had to walk...  Mr. Sherif who organizes the trips offered us only 20% discount on the next trip....that we did not accepet.    The Pharmacy near the hotel asked us 20 Euros (more or less 200 E.P.) for 2 medicines that we discovered costed 14 E.P. instead...  Thanks to the general manager Mr. Gamal we had those 20 Euros back..    Long queue to get soft drinks and "crepes" (only one person serving...)

The bathroom was not even remotely clean.    The staff left our room unlocked one day after replacing towels.    The male stuff were very inappropriate and made us feel very uncomfortable as two women staying at the hotel. This included them sending us notes trying to take us out at night, chasing us to our rooms and knocking on our door very late at night and very early in the morning.

bathroom was not cleaned well with very dated bath and WC and sink, the shower head was filthy, with black dirt all over the showerhead blocking the holes and I had to clean it to be able to have a shower, the shower curtain was filthy with stains all over on the inside.  I asked for a double room and booked it online, however the bed was no double bed but two very small single mattresses placed together. I was unable to get any sleep at night as I was ending up falling into the hollow space between the mattresses.  The room I was given was right next to the boilers and the fans and they were on all night and quite loud so I could not sleep most of the night and was exhausted the next day as I had an early start, so barelly slept 4 hrs and that too with interruption as the noise from the boiler room and fans was rather loud.  I wanted to pay for the hotel but the receptionist said he had already taken money out of my debit card when it clearly said on the hotelopia.com website that payment would be made at the hotel no payment would be taken from the debit card which was used only to reserve the hotel room. I was surprised that the receptionist said he had already taken the money out from my debit card!

The Villa Jerkan is the ideal place for a nice and relaxing stay around Split. The facilities are simple but perfectly well-looked after. Our room (N°12) had a gorgeous view on Dalmatian Sea and was under the shade of a splendid palm tree. Each room has got its own kitchenette and you can purchase food from a mini market (open until late) 300m away.   The Villa car park is not located on site but is just over 400m along the main road.  From the Villa, walking along the beach you will find some good restaurants. We tried "Jure" and "Mario's". Both were simply good and very good value. The beach is literally on the Villa's door step. Don't forget wet shoes as the beach is made of gravel and pebbles. The sand start about a meter from the shore. Sunbeds are provided by the Villa for free and a big barbecue is also available. Free wifi.  The owner, Jerko, is a great character, he will make you feel warmly welcome and will give lots of good advice. Split centre is just 20min away by car. They are also buses running all day long.
The best thing that can be said about this hotel is that is EXACTLY as it looks on its website - the architecture is superbly idiosyncratic and the rooms very spacious. A wonderful stay.
Although I had flagged well in advance that I was a vegan, no provision was made for my dietary requirements.
The staff were super friendly and attentive.  They went out of their  to accommodate.  I would definitely return!
Excellent location for Corfu Town, excellent sea views. Great breakfast.

Staff were very welcoming and efficient and the breakfast was very good. The room was a good size and spotless. Overall very good value for money. The discounted fare arrangements with a local taxi firm, Cab Co, for travel into Canterbury were very useful, the service was quick and their drivers very helpful.

Complained about leaking toilet, it was dismissed as water leaking after using shower, floor continued to be wet and foul odours started, requested a look again and it was found the toilet had been leaking after all, was Lil upset as my children were exposed to unhygienic conditions after disputing it was shower water. Leak stopped then after they investigated second time. Overall their response to maintenance issues were extremely prompt
Our second visit because the first one (last year) was so enjoyable. Prime location. Excellent breakfasts. Comfortable beds. Lovely pool.
None this time.

The hotel staff were very accommodating which is just as wel as they did not receive our booking. This meant due to a cancelation we were out in a double room rather than a twin and had to share a bed. Not ideal but the staff were very helpful and apologetic for your mistake. I would definitely stay in the hotel again however it is unlikely that I would ever book through your company again. Apart from the cancelation the hotel was fully booked and we could have ended up with nowhere to stay. Well done to the sleeperz hotel, shame on hotelopia for your mistake.
Nothing bad to say about the actual hotel, see above for complaint with hotelopia.
need improove lobby

Just loved our experience. It is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at (and have stayed at some lovely hotels, including the Four Seasons). The room was fabulous, the amenities in the room were almost perfect, and the staff is welcoming and helpful.
I wish there had been a coffee maker in the room. I like to have a cup of tea before bed and when I wake up. It was very disappointing!
Thin wall makes it very noisy when you stay at the same time as uneducated people...
Nice swimming pools, delicious food and very friendly staff.
We were told it was full, although we do make a reservation from the internet, and moved us to another hotel for the night.
It is near to the famous Jamaa el Fna square, but that's about it.
food, wine, staff, proximity to the national park
no insulation, you can hear all en suite. bad beach dirty sea.
1. Lovely big rooms  2. Very spacious public areas  3. Good feeling of service and quality
1. WiFi access was very erratic and slow, As my partner was emailing with business it was very frustrating.
Nearly bech, nice crue, quietplace and good situated. We want go back again in september,
Litle taired hotel, but the hotel is under restaurering hole time. So al in al, the hotel is very good.
Nice facilities, close to the city center, very helpfull staff and management, nice pool area
they need to improve the bath towels and pillows. The towels were threadbear and the pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable.

Transportation to nearest train station . There is no shuttle service after 23 o'clock and taking taxi is expensive. The hotel better provide 24 hours shuttle bus services if it want to attract customers!

1. The room had no refrigerator to start with nor any complementary drinks or water. For as much as the hotel is charging per night, these should be a standard part of was is provided.    2. I have stayed in hotel in many countries in the world and have never met a ruder staff. The staff should be retrained to realize that it is the customers who pay their salaries (through patronizing the hotel) and not the other  around. A few staff member were very wonderful but overall the rest were just plain RUDE! If I had my  I will not recommend this hotel to anyone but I hear this is the only hotel of its start status in Maseru so I guess one is at the mercy of this type of services.
very good position for the city centre shops
we had the buffet which was Pork dinner but NO apple sauce was available although shown on menu???  we had to wait

As a world traveler and  editor in chief of various lifestyle magazines below my opinion about Expo Hotel Valancia (based on price and quality):    The hotel rooms are clean and basic but good for a few days. The staff is very friendly and the service is excellent. Good breakfast. The location of the hotel was very good nice area and a good starting point to explore the city). There is an nice big shopping mall next to the hotel and you can park your car right in the area.  There is a nice pool on the roof (with terrace), with a beautiful view of Valencia. I recommend a room between the 7th and 11th floor to take. For a good restaurant you have to go to the city center.     We will definitely come back here!  D. Stam
It has a great swimming pool which was excellent for cooling off after lots of sight seeing. The staff are friendly and professional.
You can't charge pool drinks to your room, there's no tea coffee facility in your room and the room cleaning staff are noisy in the morning.
Great location, very clean, helpful staff, nice pool and bar area.
Lack of access to Internet.
Great place to relaxs and enjoy with family.  Loads of exciting activities.Pub and Bistro staff   Are great, they really make my wife's birthday surprise   A memorable one.

Hotel's taxi over priced, from resort to Tanjong Uban Speedboat jetty cost us S$40.  It is like from Jurong to Changi in Singapore and from Sekupang to Nongsapura in Batam.  Even we wanted to go and buy some tidbits outside the resort, they charge us S$30 per  for a 10min drive.
Good and clean hotel, good location and personnel.
The iron sometimes was needed to pay 1 EUR for using, which was not prescribed.
did not receive my wake up call which could have been a disaster and caused me alot of stress and rush to the airport on checkout
Well positioned

This had the worst bed I had ever attempted to sleep on!  We were first put into an adjoining room, so the people were able to be heard, word for word... we were given a different room, which had no adjoining door...but the bed :-(
It was an absolutely pleasurable experience for an absolute bargain price!! Will definitely use again!! Brilliant facilities and brilliant staff!
Very clean, very helpful staff- nothing was too much trouble. Fantastic facilities. Highly recommended.
Fab throughout - and great location.
Very good,service excellent,food lovely staff friendly ,all in all I would say 8 out of 10, close to Regents Park,and close to Oxford st. And close to 3 subways.,well recommended .
Some of the downstairs rooms are too close to the subway noise...no sleep there !
Nice hotel good position within 15 mins walking time to the centre  highly recommended
One slight problem the air conditioning did not work properly and the room was extreemly hot day and night
Large suites, pleasant and quiet rooms, convenient beds, prestigious district
The Bahamian Club restaurant was very average in all aspects, the food, the service, would not recommend eating there!
Great hotel near Thor AirPort.  Restaurant, professional staff, pool, great rooms. Good value for the money.
dissapoident because when i arrived the manager mr SPANOS told that there is not room for me and he send me to another hotel

We found Club Hotel Falcon adequite. It is not a 4 star hotel as per the european standards. It a good 3 star hotel.   Anyway we enjoyed our stay. The location is brilliant- breathtaking, peacefull and very enjoyable.  Close to Old Town of Kalechi- 20 min ride by bus KL10. The same bus goes to the first Lara beach. There are 10 beaches.   Food is oriented for eastern ueropeans. We liked it :)  Facilities are good. Guys from animation are friendly.

Housekeeping cleaned the room during the stayover only once after the complaint to the Reception. They usually change towels if they are left on the floor, and make the beds daily. But don't dream about the shower/sink being cleaned!
Very good location, it's in the middle between beach/old town and 'strip', very clean.
Not enough sunbeds at the swimming pool. You have to get up really early and leave your towel there if you want to get one. Could be more kitchen equipment.

The room is spacious and clean. Nice design and cozy. It is just above shopping centre and is just next to Mahkota Parade, Within walking distance to Jonker Street. My room is facing the pool and partial sea view. The pool looks simply beautiful in the night. Definitely will choose this hotel for every trip to Melaka.
The lift is always occupied and the restaurant is always full. Need to queue for breakfast.
None really..... just the pillows for the bed.  One was not enough and the continental was too big to actually sleep on.
Professional and friendly staff, beatuiful facilities, good and varied breakfast ,2 pool areas,many activities for the children, close to the beach. Will certainly come again
The matresses was hard and bumpy

Comfortable hotel - only complaint is they have a lot of double doors in the hallways which are not easy to get through with large suitcases.  Surprisingly quiet considering location to the airport.  Easy to get to airport although Hoppa bus takes a while, if you have only small luggage you can catch a red bus for free at the stops outside which are much quicker. Breakfast was good and included in price. Car rental nearby but note that car rental only provide shuttles to the airport so if not going straight to airport get rid of your bags first.
Very clean and great staff
Shared bathrooms and location was far from the city center

This has an impressive foyer but the rooms are fairly standard (think mid-low range chains i.e. Holiday Inn, Days Hotel etc). It is fine if location is your primary concern.  It is noisy as a result of the location but not too terribly so. It's clean, the staff are pleasant and it was great for easy access to the train station - I had an early journey.
Clean, well presented and spacious.

Hopelessly hot with no air conditioning (We stayed in June). We barely slept at all due to the temperature on night one - even with two fans going full pelt. On the second night we moved the mattress into the living room so we could have the window open. Suggestion for the designers of the block: If you're going to have internal bedrooms with no windows you really should install air conditioning! For this reason alone, we are unlikely to go back.
Great location, friendly staff!!!

Very helpful owner called mantha. Good communication before we arrived organising transfer from airport. Very quiet surroundings which was fab in the evening with little ones. Short walk to main shops/restaurants/beach.  Clean and friendly, highly recommend

All the staff at the hotel were excellent from the driver who met us at the airport to the manager of the restaurant. The reception staff were able to deal promptly with a problem regarding our booking through a third party.
Very comfortable and very clean indeed. Value for money.

Front of House staff are brilliant and could not do enough to be helpful. Very clean and simple hotel with everything you need to stay overnight. Flat for wheelchairs but has a step into shower but if you bring your own shower seat you easily use the ground floor rooms. Cobbled pathway okay if you have good wheelchair skills.
Breakfast is not great - very basic but really this hotel is good value for money.
the rooms are dirty and old. carpet is disgusting , how can you classify this as a 5 star hotel!!! 2 stars maybe..will never go there again

There was a great variety in the selection of food for breakfast. Location: not too bad. Took us about 10-15 mins to the night market, Bt Ferringhi beach where we did our water sport activities. If you don't want to take the taxi, you can take bus service 101 (bus fare RM1.40) which ply outside Hydro. Staff service was not too bad. Would be nice if the other staff especially those at the restaurant would smile more. We requested for a change of room and staff tried their best to accommodate our request. The scent of lemon grass upon entering the toilets was nice.

We booked 4D3N at Hydro.The room assigned to us, the toilet facilities was not functioning well. I had to wait for about 10-15 mins to get the water closet flushed. The safe was not working for us to store our valuables. There were no face and floor towels in the bathroom. The hair dryer, too, were not functioning well. Needed to get a replacement. There were no glasses for us to use to rinse after brushing our teeth. Staff from housekeeping came knocking on our door wanting to make the room when we were still in the room. That disturb our rest The room were not made up even after we put up the "Make up room" door sign. That was why we requested to change our room.  In the new room, everything seems ok with the facilities in the room. However, we requested for a change of towels the next day, only the bath towels were changed but not the face and floor towels. The wardrobe doors almost came off and made it difficult for us to open and close the doors. One of the morning we wanted to have breakfast but most of the tables were full with guests. We waited for a while, when we managed to get an empty table. One of the hotel staff changed the table cloth other table and to our shock, the table cloth was stained with white patches all over the top. It was unsightly and unhygienic.. We decided not to find another table.  Suggestions for improvements: TV programs were boring, outdated and the same programs were repeated. Should install hooks or hanger in the toilets for guests to hang their bags on the ground floor and the lobby (I had to place my bag on the floor which was slightly wet at one point). Maybe place the scents (lemon grass) like those in the toilets in the bathrooms in the guest rooms. Don't mean to complain, just giving constructive criticism for improvement. That is all.
