Easily found, free parking and a pleasant walk into town alongside the Roman Aquaduct.
Good location and fairly easy to find by car, the rooftop terrace was open until late, popular with young locals -good atmosphere and reasonable prices. Nearby parking for about 13euros a day.

Room with hotelview are nice. the area and the hotel is NOT for push-chairs and the ealderly!  It's a 2 star but in my opinion worth minimum 3 star. Rooms beautifull, kitchen is perfect! Staff is friendly! Nice location, shops, beach supermarket on walking distance ( but it's up and down the hill)
The kids area is small and old. I would not come here for all-incl. holiday with children.. You have to go out and spent more.
Cheap  1km from the beach  Wireless in the rooms
Staff  Breakfast   Toilet hygiene  Pool area and pool dirty
Standards same always very consistent and helpful friendly staff.
well staffed, ideal location
room needs some TLC and the windows need replacing due to drafts and noise. Breakfast needs to be ofa better quality from a hotel of this price.
Clean and peaceful place. We stayed four nights and we had a nice moment. Full security and surrounding is good compared to other places in joburg.  We enjoyed the complimentary apple everyday
Great no frills stay everything you need  for a comfortable stay.
Some of the showers are getting a bit tired and dirty.

Staff where friendly , room basic in 5 days towels where changed once in the room , food was quiet poor not much of a selection at all .  No air con in rooms as stated there was and at 31 degrees it was needed.
The staff were fabulous. We were upgraded (it was our wedding night) and it was a beautiful surprise for us that evening and made nor stay even more special!

Breakfast at the conservatory finishes too early so if you have a late check out or want to enjoy the room, you have to compromise breakfast  room service is a bulbous ( have had it previously) bit not everyone wants to eat breakfast on their room.
Clean and tidy, staff quite friendly.
Small Room with limited facilities, breakfast poor.
Hairs in bed and bath, not really clean
Breakfast much choice and fresh and garden around swimming pool beautiful  Lunch in garden hotel super
not any , only last night have neighbours making much noise
Very helpfull and friendly staff, good value for money.
Can not think of any !!!
more info should be given about hotel fcilities as free shuffle to klcc and places of interests.
Very nice hotel lovely staff really pleased with booking nice clean beach
I will not be recommending this hotel for business. Maybe for tourists who want budget style aaccommodation.

The staff are whith high self-esteem,samotimes root,bill me for mini bar thwth i nver used,entre the room even ,wen i sad No,the only good thing is the swiming pool,The food in the italin restorant is desent ,but the waiters are slow .ome times in the lobi to pay the bill you have to look for the staff,Valey and the bell man a maiking there rools.I am relly hapiy from this hotel.sorry
Reception staff were very friendly and offerred plenty of advice about things to do, places to visit.  the courtesy transport to and from the airport and around abq was very helpful
This was my second visit, and the experience was as positive as the first.
Very good location, nice to have access to a swim in the sea. Nice and friendly staff.

A minibar where you have to order things one day ahead is an unconvenient minibar. Also there are quite a few inconvenient structures, too many forms to fill in and too many deposits to pay. The menu (what is offered at which time) at the Tiki Bar changes so often it is impossible to plan for.
I had a lovely stay at the hotel. Stayed bed
The reception staff we're very kind
Polite and professional staff.  Lovely room.  Valet service very quick to return car, and not much more than parking in NCP yourself (if you can navigate around Bristol!)
Took an age to get a lift in the mornings (only 2 so in constant use over 17 floors).  Cooked breakfast ran out very quickly.
Excellent hotel facilities and staff in an area we like
I was very disappointed that the hotel was overbooked and my reservation was not honoured. I will not be making any more reservations here for this reason.
Great location to everything.
Well I  would not want to have duvets in sheets when it is so hot - hope you go to a sheet and optional blanket system. This affected my decision not to come back in July when we return.
very polite staff who really seemed to want to help. Customer service is lacking in alot of consumer areas these days so was very impressed.
positioning of the TV ut not a hardship to move it.
Modern, close to railway station
We returned to our room at approx 3.15pm and our room was still not cleaned/made up
The rooms were ok despite the not so welcoming exterior.
Hardly any facility.  Not a hotel, more like a well mentained high class motel.
Air conditionning not working well (too hot)
The hotel had over booked and therefore couldn't accommodate me.
Felt very welcome and enjoyed our stay
The hotel was very clean and staff very friendly and helpful also food was great.....x
Hotel was flexible to allow a slightly early check-in for wedding preparations to occur on time.  This was appreciated.
Unfriendly staff not willing to help.

On the website is showed towel are included but when I got there I had to pay for it.  It was quite noisy through night, because almost all the guests were teenager and were running and talking throughout the hall and knocking the doors including my door.  It was really annoying
We always enjoy every experience at the Oyster Box . Being able to have our small dog with us is an extra pleasure.

Room had all facilities, even air conditioning!  Although fronting the main road it was quiet and generally comfortable.  Food was very good although choice limited in the evening.  Plenty of plugs for phones, iPad and laptop, no juggling tv/kettle/bedside lamp etc as is sometimes necessary in some very up-market places.  Sufficient for my purposes.

Very tired old Georgian building.  Steep stairs and no lift, wouldn't want to lug a suitcase for two people for a week  up to the second floor!  Carpet in reception area looked like it had been retrieved from a skip.  Twice.  Suspect owners now are in the trap: to charge more you need to invest, to invest you need to charge more.  If you use this hotel, do not expect to be stunned by the decor but do expect to be pleasantly surprised at what you get for the price.

Absolutely fabulous value. Huge room with everything you need. Stunning location with views of the sea and the mountains. Staff were all friendly and extremely helpful and greet you at arrival with a glass of Kir Royal, perfect after a long journey. Excellent choice of food. Especially at breakfast. Lovely grounds and great facilities. The spa had an offer on for a massage or facial with all-day entrance to the spa's facilities which I opted for. Best massage i have ever had followed by a complementary iced water, chocolate truffle and glass of cactus liqueur. Marvellous. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Some noise in the rooms with people coming back to their rooms with no consideration for those already in bed, but sadly this happens everywhere! Sunbeds could be a little more comfortable (a metal bar towards the back made them uncomfortable to sit or lie on in a number of positions), but these things didn't really detract from our overall enjoyment of our stay.
Hotel was bright and clean. Small but functional rooms. Great value for central London.
Breakfast was toast, slices of cheese and meat, with cereals on offer. Disappointing. Atmosphere was somewhat chaotic at breakfast with no instructions on what to do.
Great city centre location, great staff and facilities.
King size bed is 2 singles zipped together which makes for an uncomfortable or separate nights sleep !

This hotel was ideally situated in Santa Eulalia in a very quiet location close to the Marina and not subject to traffic noise. It offers a full range of facilities and the staff are very friendly and approachable.

1.Although the rooms are perfectly adequate,the walls are very thin and do not offer much privacy.  2.On arrival we were asked to sign a declaration that we would not reserve sunbeds or hang towels over the balcony. During our stay these rules were ignored by a large number of residents which made it difficult to find a sunbed and parasol.The management made no attempt to remove towels from reserved beds which encouraged the practice even further.There are insufficient parasols for the number of beds.     3.Hotel prices were reasonable,but the cost of Wi-Fi was not - for a hotel of this size and stature free Wi-Fi should nowadays be included in the tariff.
I like the location ,it's so close to the beach.all resturant's and caffee are near by.
One of your staff really stood out, all the staff were friendly and helpful but Nicholas exceeded all expectations
One meal consisted of COLD chips
facilities  value for money clin  prof,staff
The staff tried,at every stage, to deal with a monolingual client.
Availability of an iron and board for travellers would have been an asset.
Rooms are dates / tired.  Need updating of the furniture and the decor.  Air Conditioning terrible.  Also. 24" CRT tv's - not even flat screen version of only TV sets.  Also, only 10 TV channels?????
Good location  Excellent staff in the reception
The cleaning of the room could have been better
Good location,  good size.

Our room was available when we arrived at 1:30pm. We needed to attend a reception at McGill at 2:30 pm. Your staff was not willing to try to accommodate us until I offered to upgrade to a suite. Even then, your staff was not willing to confirm the same room for the rest of my stay while I Kept saying that I would pay the difference. I only had the same suite confirmed the next day upon my inquiry.  The lobby was so crowded and with people eating lunch boxes when the hotel had a function indicating your facility is very insufficient.

The hotel is well priced compared with many others on Langkawi and we found the room cleaning staff really efficient but that is really where the positives end. The pool is large, but everything badly needs renovated - rooms and pool area are old and tired. (There is a new pool being built at the moment which is a positive, it's nice to see that they are injecting some money into maintenance projects, however until it is finished there is no beach view, just some blue tarp to hide the building work and bear in mind you can hear the building work while swimming/ sunbathing)

In hindsight, we would have been much better off to choose a more expensive hotel which had a good standard of service, rooms etc and probably would not have been much worse off financially, when you take into account that Holiday Villa charges extra for just about everything they can: no free water in rooms, pay for wifi, pay for tea and coffee sachets in the rooms, very expensive breakfast etc etc....    The staff at reception are disinterested and unhelpful. We left a bag at the Langkawi ferry terminal and ended up hiring a car and driving to the ferry to enquire in person whether the bag had been handed in (it had and we got it back safe and sound) however the hotel staff couldn't have given us much less assistance in trying to locate our lost luggage. In the middle of changing currency one of the reception staff quoted the exchange rate (which was incorrect) then simply walked away, mid conversation, out of the hotel door and off up the driveway on a break with another colleague, no explanation, did not hand over to another staff member - just disappeared half  through dealing with a guest!    We booked a deluxe room, the original room we were given was on the ground floor, it was dark, depressing and badly in need of a refit. The whole place has the air of a resort which was quite nice 20 years ago, but somewhere along the lines they stopped caring, maintaining, servicing and helping..... what a shame.

Hotel ticked all the right boxes. well maintained room gardens and swimming pools

Staff were extremely helpful, hotel decor was good, the seaview outside our room was absolutely amazing.  Free Internet thoughout the hotel was an added bonus. Our price included dinner in the Rosewater which was a lovely restaurant with endless choice.  Free turtle chocolates were left for us on our beds in the evening,which was very cute.
Terrific location,  good value for money definitely.  Very personable, professional and helpful staff.  I'll definitely use this hotel again.
Close to Airport and parking good
1. Large puddles in carpark very deep, so bad water control when built.  2. No "Key Drop" box, for key return outside "Limited Office hours.
Everything was fine for a budget style hotel  Close to bus, monorail and rail station  Plenty of eateries nearby
Great location, small boutique hotel, great staff.
Limited facilities if you are looking for a large chain hotel
Location, Clean, friendly staff.
4 starts is much more that the hotel reality.
fantastic hotel where i was made to feel very welcome and staff were all very friendly. meals were great with a very good variety every day.
just the steep hill to get to it but the views were worth it..
The staff were excellent and friendly.  The hotel and rooms were clean and looked impressive.
Room cleaners sometimes moved luggage on floor and interrupted things that we had laid out.
Pretty good location.

Lift not working. Only the cold water tap worked on the sink. Toilet flush was hanging off the wall. Shower didn't drain away and dripped for an hour after use. Paper thin walls with constantly noisy pipes. Not even a bed-side table, just a phone on the floor. Get what you pay for I guess.
Beautiful apartment. Huge and very clean. Very quiet location of resort. Excellent children's entertainment.

Reception staff were efficient but not very attentive or welcoming but Alexandria on breakfast was the most wonderful and friendly staff member!   No mini supermarket to buy any provisions.  If you don't have a family then not really ideal for couples as lots of children.
Excellent location for Heathrow Airport. Great customer service and room size. Very celan and modern. I enjoyed my stay with Premier Inn.
I would recommend that you have iron facility in every single room. Breakfast was nice, however scrambled eggs were not nice. I felt like I was eating grass.
Enjoyed my stay good location brilliant staff best reception staff i have been to and i have stayed in top hotels
Great location near city yet only yards from beach. Very attentive staff. Great breakfast buffet
friendly staff
Hotel was clean and location is excellent as it is situated near the main tourist area.
Food was awful and there wasn't much of a choice. My recommendation is to take B
Nice, calm and much space for a wonderfull holiday.
The hotel was clean, comfortable and quiet, with a totally relaxed atmosphere. The staff were helpful and polite. I was most impressed
Some confusion as to the floor numbering. We stayed on the 7th floor but, in reality, there were only four!
I went with a group of 18 ladies,we were celebrating my sisters 60th birthday,the hotel
The hotel was in a great location with the beach right out the front and a large number of places to eat alone the street. Would gladly stay again!
In the middle of  nowhere, an ugly great barn of a hotel, rather dated.
constant mouldy smell in the room.
Friendly hotel staff.   Clean rooms.   Close proximity to subway.
More of a boutique hotel (no swimming pool).

The furnitures were nice. Front desk ladies were very friendly compare to the men. The men were not as inviting than the women. The front lobby was nice and the pool area had a lot of sitting area. There is always a place to sit.
The pool was not clean and not strong enough chemical for me to swim in. The locals got serve before the foreigns. It's unfortunate.

Studio room size is big attache with an oversize bathroom which is modern and clean .twinbeds are big and can fit in 2 adult and 2 kids . I believe they only refurbish the rooms but not the lobby . Only free wifi is available in the lobby whereas you have to pay for it in the room .Camerron hotel are all not convenient u have to drive around so as to reach the places of interest Location is right up on a mountain , weather is great good for families food wise so so but can be improved in Jim thompson terrace . It has a beautiful view from there

5 stars hotel.  Outstanding.I own 2 hotels in Buzios,and I was really surprised for the extremely high quality of the service,decoration,comfort,location (we arrived by train)  The restaurant bistro was delicious and waiters very kind indeed and profesional.  Very pleasent stay.Congratulations

The hotel is WONDERFUL! Two big outdoor pools, SPA with 2 indoor pools, Sauna, Steambad, Hammam, jacuzzi, and incredible amount of massages and beauty treatments. Very big rooms with balcon. Beautiful, elegant. The bus stop is one street away, and very close to the Azure Window. Definitely this is an experience that you have to live! As a couple in a relaxing holiday, WE LOVED IT! :D
The hotel is good value for money and close to city centre. The only thing I would say is that we asked to borrow an iron and there was none available. This was the fourth hotel/B
Location of the note is great   If room facing the lake its great n light.  Furniture is classy   rooms are clean  parking is provided which is very helpful.

Five star hotel and you pay for your own tooth brush,not really 5*.  If room is on street side very dark n noisy.  Breakfast is nice but take time to replenish stuff too long  Staff(breakfast waitresses)should smile and be friendly,they need to show that they are happy to work there

We loved the old fashioned charm of this hotel - and our room was more like a suite than just a room!  The food was extraordinary - at an amazingly reasonable price.  The Head Waiter couldn't have been more accommodating. Reception staff were extremely helpful.

We had a lovely relaxing stay in an idyllic surrounding.   One staff member kiat was extremely helpful and organised us a boat trip of the island which I really recommend.   Perfect for relaxing but also great snorkelling.
it was great for the special action price...
good because of the special price i recieved
friendly, knowledgeable and efficient staff. Would recommend the hotel to any of my friends and acquaintances.

Very nice hotel with a fresh greak buffe, something available for every taste and a kids buffe as well.  Dishes changed every day.  Pool bar available all day long, not only drinks and ice cream, also piza slices and similar.

Nothing negative about the hotel but the beach closest to the hotel is not very nice.  A rental car or something is recommended.  Also mail the hotel to get description where it is if you drive, someone (not the hotel) has wrongly pointed out the hotel in Google maps.
sometimes staff forgot to replace the showergel and glass.

Staff very unfriendly   Breakfast very very very limited  Electricity cut outs during the day and can take a while to come back on.   Pay extra for room safe  Lack of hot water at peak times for showers   Pool dirty and small  Hotel located in a construction area of other developments  No proper beds if theirs more than one person. Others have to use sofa beds  Smoking throughout the hotel is allowed
Not for families  Pool dirty  No safety measures  No security  Unclean hotel
well priced; friendly, knowledgable, eager staff; great location
Only one outlet in entire room. breakfast scrambled eggs tended to get full of fish broth. old, creaky beds.
Very clean, perfect, well done!
The hotel might need some works on toilets, a new ones, but can't complain everything was good, is just a suggestion.

My wife is an event coordinator and cannot help but review hotels and venues even when we are on holidays.  She was very impressed with the level of professionalism from the staff, the excellent facilities and immaculate grounds.  The food was great and housekeeping very helpful and accommodating to our requests. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
Staff at reception are very helpful, rooms are nice and clean and very modern
Remainder of staff are somewhat surly and give the impression that everything is too much bother.
Great Location

i asked for a double room i got a family room with a double bed and a single bed you could not move in the room i dropped my change when i bent down to pick it up all under bed was full of sweet wrappers was the worst hotel i have ever stayed in will never return to jurys in again everrrrrrrrrrrrr
lovely small
Size of room was very big and provide daily newspaper. Buffet breakfast was satifactory.
Water pipe under washing basin was leaky. The cafe service is not professional.
Good, clean hotel, well situated.

We booked and paid for transfers from Palma Airport  to hotel and return from hotel to airport.  The hotel did not receive any notification regarding what time we were to be collected from the hotel to go to airport.  The hotel receptionist tried unsucessfully to find out details from Hotelopia.  I made several calls to Hotelopia helpline but was kept waiting on hold incurring expensive call cost.  We did not receive any assistance and had to take taxi to the airport at additional cost of 16 euros.
Small swimming pool is 3.5m depth. Room service cannot reach standard.
Free wifi provided and near monorail station.
I always choose this hotel when i am in glasgow because i know i will receive good service and a comfortable clean room. great loation. would highly recommend.
Very Clean and nice location. Friendly staffs.
No swimming pool. Fitness center was small without proper cooling systems.
Very good two bed appartment in a good location and spacious
Good deli breakfast , good location, nice restaurant

Charged me $10 for ringing the super shuttle I did all the talking you just rang the number and charged me. I would not recommend this hotel for that one reason.  They did not explain to me the cost just received my account with it on.  I could have used my own cell phone if they just gave me the number.
A lot of construction going on right next to the hotel. But the sound does not bother you. The seaview is ruined.
They did great job for Deaf Device (Clock Alarm with vibarate) for me
I did called them before I reservation, some questions - when I arrived - they said no or not available. I did asked them - they said yes as we have! They lied to me - but others  I am happy.
Nice place to stay, comfortable, situated in the city centre of Arkhangelsk.

Fantastic value for money, the Staffa were really helpful and friendly.  We were a group of girls and felt really safe especially with the 24hr reception, they were quite happy for you to come back late after nights out too. The maid came everyday and left the apartments with clean towels everyday.  The food in the restatuarant (and free welcome cocktail) was really reasonable, fresh and tasted great  Reception happily book taxis for you to go into town, really nice to be that bit further away from the bustle of the busy San Antonio
Nothing really, take beach towels as they don't supply them

I have found that my credit card has been accessed . I used it to pay for the hotel accomodation before I went and did not use it any other time while away. When I came back I have found that i have three entries on my credit card not mine. The bank cannot say exactly where the problem started but only overseas payment I have made was to pay the hotel account.

All the staff at the hotel are really nice and helpful. I would like to say a special thank you to Ibrahim, Mustapha, Tarek, Mohammad and Lubna who i personally dealt with and were of great assistance and made me feel very comfortable. The hotel staff are amazing. The breakfast was really nice and had a good range of buffet selection.

The hotel facilities can be improved. We had 2 rooms. There was no mini bar in one of them so had to ask for one. Both the minibars were working poorly. When we arrived at the hotel we were not given any water even though it was really hot outside and we had we were tired from our travel. We were also not given a map or information about the city. The hotel should at least offer water to arriving guests, give them a map of the city and some information.
good location in centre of sorrento.good access to other places on the coast.nice pool area.

charged for having a fridge in hotelroom,no free towels for pool.breakfast was very basic and not much choice,coffee also not proper Italian coffee,just instant!balconys not very private(you can see your neighbours)
Very clean and in good shape.Breakfast good and fresh.Staff obtained drs. number for my wife's medical situation.

We had to check out early due to an unexpected medical problem.Asked for 2 days credit.Told by front desk staff that since we booked thru a booking service,had to contact them.When we contacted booking service,was told that was NOT true.Hotel could have given us credit.
Lovely building in a very central location.

We had only booked for two nights, first night we were not able to stay in the hotel supposedly due to an electricity problem. We were provided an alternative location which I have to say was well below par right down to the very dirty bed sheets that had simply been turned around with the last customer.
We were very pleased with front desk staff (a pretty
Having to pay a service charge for ordering 2 coffees, even tho they took just shy of 15mins to get to us.
Good position for visiting meziquita and old quarter also walking distance of botanic gardens and zoo.  Staff very helpful and seemed to always be smiling which always makes for a happy stay.

clean, spacious, comfy room and bed - saubere, geräumige, komfortable Räume und Betten  TV/radio/pool... very good!  good choice of affordable retaurants - gute Auswahl an günstigen Restaurants  good connected and easy to find - gut erreichbar und auffindbar  more than enough room to park the car - ausreichend Platz zum Parken dank Parkhaus  friendly and professional staff - freundliches und proffesionelles Personal
could have done with  more pillows and bigger towels
very chief but almost good clean, pleanty of room, pool (pool is small but clean)
too hard to find (the lacation is not good)   very good for the traveler that he know well bkk but not so good for frist travelr
Not all of the showers on the 1st floor were working, although there were builders working, so they are probably being updated/repaired
Great location, very good breakfast, clean rooms and very helpful staff! Highly recommended!

I had a very nice stay at the hotel. The room was a very good room. Staff were professional at all times. The reception staff seemed very efficient. The younger gentleman concierge was very helpful and I felt went out of his  to welcome us.

The food was good but although the menu was different every night the flavours were very similar for every day. After a few days of similar tasting food it seemed bland.    I also noticed there was a roof terraced which was closed. This would have been a very nice place to view sunset.    The TV picture quality was not very good and only there was only one channel for English language.
Excellent location right in front of the beach and close to a supermarket. Lovely balconies overlooking the sea. Very reasonably priced for northern-Europeans.

Tiny bathrooms with a toilet squeezed in - hardly place to turn around in the shower. Non-descript decor, showing signs of wear and tear and positively ancient television with little to offer in terms of channels.
What a terrible hotel. It should be a 1star or a hostel
Beds broken, bathrooms dirty, changed rooms 3 time due to bad terrible odours, management terrible.     We had a terrible experience  over priced never will I stay in a hotel like this again.
Good hotel to spend holidays with a partner!  Nice location along the sea to enjoy day
Reasonable facility with reasonable price.  Better ensure room service during 24 hours.

I booked for several of my colleagues through your website and they have advised that check in was a very long process as they did not appear to have the bookings, even though they has the vouchers with them.  It appeared on average to take 30 - 40 minutes to check in.  One of my colleagues arrived at 4.30 pm and was told that her room was not yet ready - this is not the service that we would expect.  This applies to all 9 - 10 rooms that I booked with you last week.

We had 1 of the 7 sea facing rooms which we had booked which had a lovely view  the swimming pool and ocean.  These are self catering units which have a lovely little kitchen which is more than adequate. The public beach is a mere 50 meters walk from the hotel where you can get chicken Kebabs and chicken curry for 100/150 Mauritius rupees from the locals. Also close to the hotel 100/150 meters are some local restaurants, limited supermarket and a place to exchange money. The bus stop to Grand Bay is practically out side the hotel and it is only 4.5 kms away at 22 rupees one . Grand Bay has many restaurants to choose from, tour operators and the Super U super market has got everything you would need. this is also where the night life happens. So overall I can highly recommend the Mont Choisy Beach Resort and would definitely go back there again. Sadec and his team off staff are to be well complimented.
Extremely clean place, friendly and helpfull staff, nice pool.Quiet location a 15 min. walk or a 1€ taxi ride from the medina.I recommend the place.
very welcoming and friendly
Great SPA and Aurveda section particularly!
Gazebo restaurant menu could be improved.
The hotel met all my expectations and they made all efforts to ensure that we had a comfortable stay.  I would stay at this hotel again
Very pleasent stay, the staff was always very helpfull and smiling.
Free upgrade to a suite.  Outstanding breakfast and service.  Staff friendly but professional.  Rooms cleaned to a high standard.

The Fixed Air Conditioning in the room was not working and a free standin unit had been placed in the room with venting through an open window.  Maintenance not of the highest standard with light bulbs requiring replacement and some tubes flickering.  Greater attention to detail required.
Very nice refurbishment of the hotel since 2010. Nice staff in reception. Great location very close to Lancaster gate hotel.

BIG MINUS - very hard beds. Had pain on hips every night from sleeping. Staff said all beds where the same and we put an extra blanket underneath the sheets, but not much difference. Old building so all sounds are loud, even from lift ouside in the corridor to next door room. Creaky floors.
The only negative, the bed mattresses are far to hard for any lengthy stay.
able to check in early-parking nearby at reasonable rate.great location
I did not have any food as I had an early train to catch on Sat morning
Really friendly and helpfull staff, good location near the airport.
Wifi shuold be much improved
1. Located in the south of the Strip,  not as noisy as other hotels alongside the strip.  2. Convenient to airport, bus station and all other places

1. Swimming Pool time is bad.  2. No wifi.  3.  Operator services need improvement : when asked if there is wifi, the answer was 'no' and hanged up. But phoned again and asked 'is there any pint net services?' the answer was    'there is an Internet cable next to the tv (of course you have to search all over the places near the tv - and found the cable hiding at the back of the 'drawers'), and can only connected to a computer !! (try a D-link 505 (or similar function equipment, it can turn the signal to wifi)

Stayed at this hotel several times and we have always found it to be a good experience. Staff are always available without being intrusive, it offers all that you could want for a short stay and is very convenient for the city centre. Will use again in the future. All areas including the dining room were very clean and the room was well prepared.

Arrived to be told we didn't have a room for the night as they had closed some rooms off. They had booked us into a hotel in Eastbourne , some 20 minute drive away which was not acceptable as we were attending a 25th wedding anniversary party in Lewes and wished to walk to NOT to take a taxi.  We found alternate accommodation eventually and original hotel paid most of the difference. Cannot believe we were turned away at the eleventh hour,so it was not a very pleasant experience!

Nice hotel. Very spacious rooms with some lovely views. Staff were exceptional as they were extremely helpful, prompt in dealing with any requests and were extremely friendly and polite. I Was really impressed that staff remembered me by name after only speaking once, considering the size of the hotel and the number of guests staff must interact with each day. Handy location in Downtown Miami with regular bus services to South Beach and north to Aventura Mall.
in specification it should be a studio with the kitchen
The rooms are nice and of a good size in London.

The staff at the reception could have appeared more professional and passionate.    A twin room was booked. It was requested to have a quieter room not facing the street on the day, the staff arranged a double bed room without taking into consideration of my booking preference nor notice of change of room type. At the time of my check in, only one staff was at the reception desk. She was multitasking with phone calls and different enquiries of guests which was quite under staffed.     It's also worth mentioning that the luggage storage service could have been arranged in a better . I was advised to fill in a tag, put it on my luggage and enter the luggage room all by myself. The helpfulness of the staff and the security issue could be improved.

We found it to be a warm friendly hotel. Staff extremely courteous and helpful. The location and proximity to shops perfect. Rooms spotless. Would recommend for any category of guest ie person travelling alone, business person, family etc. The hotel felt very safe and secure and represented excellent value for money. We would definitively stay there again.
brand new, very spacious and luxuriouse rooms
Room was tidied each day and staff were courteous and helpful. Rooftop pool was nice, location of the hotel very good, and of course, it was very cheap.

Clearly in need of some updating - various staining on walls, ceilings, shower curtain etc... TV didn't work, bedside lamp had no bulb.. curtains were half hanging off the rail. None of these major problems, but clearly room for improvement.
Very good value , near to the airports , friendly polite staff .

Fantastic customer service. Dave was excellent, had a traumatic time being caught up in the floods and thought would never make it to jasper but they kindly extended my stay and moved my booking with ease.   Room-clean, very comfortable bed,lovely toiletries. Easy to park. close to everything. Reception staff all very helpful and approachable. Fridge in room.
Only negative is only a coffee maker in the room, can't really get hot water for tea, but am sure reception would offer one if really needed, I never asked. no safe in the room either.

The only positive is the Front Desk Staff, "Mr. Iamtakin" (don't know correct spelling) - and the bellboy (wore glasses) very very helpful and helped change our room (3) times to accommodate us - since the initial rooms had broken air conditioners, poor condition of bathrooms etc.  Also their inside pool was damaged and the initial hotel front desk staff gentleman helped in using the pool next door.  Excellent staff.

Very poor conditions entirely.  The bathroom atrocious - it had broken sliding doors, bolts sticking out of the shower wall.  Hotel elevator broken buttons.  Hallways smelled of cigarette smoke.  The air conditioning was poor. I would recommend that this hotel be refurbished.
we really enjoyed our stay at carna bay hotel,great value for money,very clean ,had a front room loved the view,we had our evening meal and breakfast great service great food
Very clean, great view of loch Ryan
Very friendly staff, who smiled when greeting etc. That one thing makes so much difference.
Hotel and staff very friendly, good service and clean rooms. Breakfast also included which is a plus.

No negatives about hostel but NEGATIVE ABOUT HOTELOPIA. They had not let the hostel know of our booking so we did not get our rooms we asked for, meaning that we did not get ensuites and my friend was left in a room with no windows. Hotelopia have not even bothered to reply to my letter of complaint, DO NOT BOOK THROUGH HOTELOPIA BOOK THROUGH HOSTEL. Will not be booking with hotelopia again.

Maria - Incharge of the kids club was outstanding. It helped a lot that she knew English very well and 5 more languages. My 8 year old and 5 year old daughters really enjoyed the stay at Miracle Resort.    Also, the gentleman incharge of the fitness center was very pleasant and very nice with my family as well. He really makes us feel welcome. He sometimes helped in the Spa as well and my daughters got an unforgetable Turkish bubble bath.     If in the future I have to travel to Turkey again, definitely I will choose the same hotel. Hoping I will see the same two persons that make my family trip more pleasant.

The only negative review is regarding the night entratainment. Some of the programs depending on the day should be specified to be for adults only. We took our two girls to see some night shows on different days and we end it up leaving the theater due to inapropiate language or body movements.
Lovely place to stay. Nice clean rooms
Good staff. Close to the famous Ladies Beach. Nice pool. Good value for money!
Rooms are getting a bit outdated. Needs a restoration.
The staff were really friendly and helpful.  There is a lovely ambience and friendly feeling in the Generator Hostel, Great Decor aswell.
detestable "suite junier", one side view on the antennas other side view on the road full of motors !!
On check-in the staff were very friendly and efficient. The staff in the Castaway Bar were lovely, very helpful and welcoming.

On the night of our stay (Friday 21 June) there was a fire in the early hours. My daughter and I had a very scary moment when we were coming down the stairs towards the fire exit and could clearly smell smoke. I was surprised that there didn't seem to be anyone in charge when we were waiting outside the hotel. There were too many people under the front canopy for us to shelter from the rain there, so we took shelter in a doorway, but I couldn't see anybody taking a roll call and, if there was, they certainly didn't bother to come to us. I only knew the cause of the fire because somebody near me asked a fire officer and when we were allowed back in no explanation was forthcoming from a member of staff. In the morning, when we checked out, no mention was made of the fire! Every friend and colleague I've mentioned it to since has been surprised that I didn't ask for a refund but I think at the least I could have expected an apology for a very disturbed night. My daughter was rather shaken by the experience and it left us very tired for our busy day on Saturday. It's such a shame because I liked the hotel and the staff, but they didn't seem prepared for an emergency.
The staff were extremely helpful in particular the girl who we checked in with she was great. Breakfast was good although it was not all you can eat as we had to order it.
The room was really dusty could have done with a more thorough clean. Abit disappointing

we had a very enjoyable stay in the hotel staff were very nice and helpful .breakfast vas very good ..restaurant was a bit expensive for dinner but was lovely .overall a very nice hotel to say in will visit it again.

Beautiful accommodation with high standards of cleanliness, rooms serviced every day with fresh towels.  Gorgeous pool area and food and drinks reasonable priced  The staff very helpful with queries and called taxis when needed and offered early check in.  Fantastic!

It's 10mins drive into centre and not feasible walking so a bit misleading in review. No problem as it was perfect accommodation just would have like to have been prepared.   The complex definitely needs a super market or on site shop because if distance from centre.

Arrived in London in the morning and knew our room would not be ready but introduced ourselves and the lady receptionist was super spoiling the grandchildren and allowing to park so we could go off and explore London,  Room was spotlessly clean,
When we did book in later that day the reception was busy and the gentleman receptionist was a bit harassed and did not explain very well where our rooms were,  would of liked hot drinks in room,
nice hotel and i like very much would want to live there again.
An amazing view from the top of the hotel. Its also in a good location, with good facilities nearby. The hotel room was cleaned regular, and staff generally friendly.

The air conditioning in the hotel pretty much dosen't work. You'll need to complain and get a fan from reception or deal with 28 degree heat in bed. Try and get a sea view as our small box indoor view was just that. Having a sea view and a balcony door will probaly make the hotel a much more pleasant stay.
Only problem that my girlfriend said was the bathroom doors are see through, which she did not like.
Staff were very friendly and helpful
Our room was dirty and we had to he moved.
Nice clean comfortable room.
No tea or coffee making facilities.
The reception staff were very helpful and friendly.
Breakfast very very limited  Dirty hotel in communal areas  Reception staff very unhelpful and lazy  Ants in rooms  No hair dryer   No extractor fan in bathroom
Location is good. Good value for money.

After all the negative reviews we were worried about the hotel but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The staff were fine, the room was clean and the pool area had a good view over the sea. Reviews said there were thefts from the rooms so we got a safety deposit box behind the desk for 15 euros and had no problems.

By the pool you get harassed by shot girls and people asking you to buy drinks/food all day. They also let people selling bar crawls etc into the pool area where you get harassed even further when you just want to relax.

Hotel needs a refit the rooms are very tired and the furniture is dirty and stained, the sink in the bathroom we stayed was cracked, no hairdryer, the ceiling light had three bulbs one was not working and there was a huge cobweb linking the bulbs, the carpet in the room was just minging....and all the edges of the dated furniture were caked in dust, and whoever chose the depressing pictures in the room must be a nutter
A very comfortable and elegant hotel
needs to revamp a bit looking a little tired in some areas

Excellent value for the money.  Plentiful breakfasts (range of hot and cold foods, drinks, breads, small cakes and fresh fruit) even if it would get boring after several days.  Room and bathroom spotless with easy hot shower.  Reception staff generally helpful. Hair dryers available at desk. Position perfect - 15 mins walk max to Main Square in old town.  3 restaurants including vegetarian almost next door. Supermarket only 5 mins away.

In hot weather, windows need to be open and traffic noise can be bad at night since hotel at a junction with buses/trams stopping too. Bottled water provided in room on first day.  Pity this was not every day.

Great location with affordable, undercover parking. Management are First Class (responded to minor food issue promptly). Best value hotel in immediate area. (I've tried 5 others in this location in the last 18 months) Will use again.
An amazing hotel in a lovely setting, staff were superb, food and drink all excellent. A pleasure from start to finish.
Very expensive, nice as a treat!
We had a good time in this hotel.  Everything was very good.  We will tell this to everyone who wants to visit Londen.  We both will come back at this hotel.
uncomplicated, near my destination, we had a very good offer of hotelopia, the normal prize is to expensive for this house
not enough breakfast food at just 8:30, no eggs, no butter etc. We had to ask for every little bread. The reason was not enough personal.
Very friendly and helpful staff throughout. We had dinner which was excellent both in quality and presentation.  Bed very comfy and very quiet for good sleep.

My single room was cold, dark and depressing. I found it very clausthrophic .The T.V was old fashioned and very bad reception. I could not see any Air-conditioning in the bathroom and there was no bath. There were two chairs but no table. I would not have stayed any longer than one night in that particular room.
Courtesy attitude of staffs and bell boys  Also adequate facilities in rooms  Overall, room was comfortable,and good location with well transports

Inadequate cleaning before check in.  Dirty kitchen without cleaning and been drinking water can be founded when we arrive the room.  Also the elevator always cannot react by the room card?I thought that it was the problem of card sensor.
Good location, near lots of shops and restaurants. Nice service. Very clean.
Bed was uncomfortable. Room was quite warm and could not change temperature. Repairmen had to enter room for maintenance duing our stay.
Il Mulino and STK were fantastic!
The hotel is desperately in need of upkeep and maintenance.
Lovely room 2 x double beds with additional room with sofa
Convenient location, well presented, nice rooms, firendly and professional staff
Room was very warm when we returned in the evening and outside was too noisy to leave the window open.
Good location, and nice room

Over-priced with respect to similar hotels and bars.  Your website said the hotel had internet.  It did not..other than purchasing an access card from a boutique which was never open.  The price of internet was ridiculous ($9 per hour) which is unheard of anywhere else on the globe.  I cant return until there is internet as my businesses suffer significantly without communication.  Front desk staff were difficult at times and we always felt like prices were escalating here and there.  For example the exchange rate would be 0.87 one day and then 0.80 the next day.  We would challenge this and the clerk would revert to the better rate!!! (how does that work?).  The hotel has not maps and not much help in planning a day of sightseeing.
Very good location, close to the public transportation
Carpet should be renew.
A basic clean hotel. I found the manager and his wife very friendly and helpful. The Hotel was as we expected for the price we paid.
Good value for money. Only 20 min to St Marco

Personnel very friendly and accommodating. Comfortable bed. Quiet environment. Separate bedroom very much appreciated when two couples in unit. Outstanding breakfast. Well equipped kitchenette. Convient location.
Pool hours. Would be nice to close à 10:00pm instead of 8:00pm. TVs could be replaced with flat screens.
NA
Very good Hotel, nice and clean, the staff were very friendly,welcoming and helpful. Great location, Would stay here again,
Great location for theatres, river, shopping and 'doing London'.  It says what it does on the tin!
Bit of noise overnight but what would you expect in London?
Value for money, breakfast included. Central location.  Very close to transportation, when moving on to next location  while travelling. Clean linen.

Too many stairs when travelling with large ports. No help available, no lift.  Building over railway station and shook with vibration from trains journeying thru station. Reception staff communicated incorrect times for breakfast, so was unable to obtain a cooked one. Kitchen staff did apologise for the mix up though. Room needs brighting up and though beds were clean were a bit old. Poor quality pillows. But still value for the money paid,
The staff in the restaurant was extremely friendly and accomodating.

At 3am we were woken up by people talking loadly and banging.  At 3:30am I called reception and asked them to shut the noise down.  The next morning when I asked whether I enjoyed my stay, I explained what had happened and asked for compensation.  I was told that the hotel is not responsible and would not provide any compensation.  The don't care attitude was extremely disappointing.  I would not recommend this hotel, it is overprised and the carpets in the hall and rooms are very dirty.
The staff were very friendly and they spoke English

Located in the heart of London, in the prestigious Portman Square, The Hyatt Regency Churchill offers a high standard of basic facilities both in room and and throughout the hotel.  Although like so many London buildings built in that era, the exterior is architecturally unattractive, however he hotel's interior has been renovated to a high standard of opulence without gilding the lilly.    SMOKING ROOMS AVAILABLE!!!!! Nothing worse than not being able to do the things one can at home when away    The staff were professional, friendly and polite!   The Food was, as expected, Hyatt's usual world class standard.  24 Hour (paid) Parking is available  We certainly recommend it for a business or shopping trip to London!
Nice and quite , lovely views , spacious appts. and very nice helpfull staff.  Hotel is about 15 - 20 min driving to Puerto Banus and Marbella which reasonably accepted.
Large room, great view on river Clyde, iMac in room, extremly good value for money
in the outskirts of Glasgow (but ideal to visit Auchentoshan distillery), about 20 min by car to city centre
Everyone to everything was a dream come true.  If ever there was to be another great value to stay at this resort I would  jump at the opportunity.

Room was badly maintained  Booked a castle room and they placed us at the hotel lodge and refused to change booking  Food and drink were overly expensive  Staff were rude and unhelpful  Headboard fell out of the wall in the middle of the night  Late check in time  Early check out time
Lovely hotel with a great location. Happy and friendly staff and a wonderful pool complex
Close to the centre of london.
Friendly and helpful stuff. They helped us to change the room because it was so high noise level on our floor. Nice view from the rooms!
So much noise in the night/early morning, because all this groups! So it was hard to have à sleep. The beds were very hard, not comfortable at all.
Very comfortable beds; central location; kitchen and laundry facilities in room.
Pleased with room
Noisy in the night-think there was a group of men on a stag weekend which woke me up at 4am on Sunday morning
The hotel can be good if a better management takes care of it especialy cleanness, facility, staff conduct, and braekfast.

1. I found that the reception staff had a problem with booking from internet agency and that only certain rooms can be given.  2. the room is not clean at all especailly the bath room. The housekeeper though nice did not have time to do it as she said.  3. If you want to rest and relax this is not your hotel as so much noise later at night.  4. the room has so many mosquitos and other insects. Be raedy to be itching all the time.  5. TV: few local channels.  6. braekfast. I advise to do without it. Almost nothing two days in arow in 2 different times. The second time I found the dishes that supposed to be clean are very dirty with food left on them and put as clean dishes. The person working there is very unclean. I left the place once I saw the dishes.  7. Elevator: simply does not work.  It is a pitty this hotel has a nice location and some rooms with nice views but with worst services and faciolities and realy unclean. I wounder how it could be 4 stars. This is misleading and you might want to mention this to whom it may concern. I have much more to say but all negative so this is enough.
very central; lovely balconies overlooking all the action. Extremely kind and helpful staff.
The hotel has a great view to the ocean and its own Marina.

Where do I begin? 5 stars, what a joke. First of all the "all- inclusive" package is not all-inclusive. The restaurants and cafes the hotel claims to have are in fact private and cost extra. This is only made clear upon arrival which was very decieving!!! There are so many extra costs that they can't be listed. The service is horrible! Most of the staff are about 16 years old and have no idea how to provide quality service. Throughout the hotel I found only two personnel who could speak English. The food that was all inclusive was edible, but that is about it. The buffet was always the same, the food being recycled from day to day and becoming old which you could taste. Do not go to this hotel expecting 5 stars...3 stars is more appropriate.
good sized standard room for single. very clean. good wifi. affordable rates. near food and transportation. cool courtyard to relax with friends and drinks.
limited parking. only 2 at one time in front of the hotel. mrt working nearby so u get confusing roads and signboard.
For ~55 euros a night it was a great value for money. polite personel. location is superb and great vistas across the sea. very quiet. if you use the hotel only for sleeping, it is a good choice

Not suitable for kids and families, although did provide baby cot when requested one. lifts work until 22.00, not all places have access with lifts. lift to the beach not working. tv not working. wifi not working in the rooms.arrived for brekfast 30 minutes before closing and were limited options to choose from e.g. no eggs.  poor facilities.

The staff is very nice but did not feel like a respectful guest - more like someone who had to be treated nice in order to keep their job. Generally, the food was made without affection and corresponded to a two-star tourist hotel. Very noisy restaurant because staff cleaned tables and used large garbage trolleys in front of people eating quietly. Stressful. Cooking chef in restaurant had fingers and nails of that of a car mechanic - no immediate effect when told to the manager.
Great location.
They charged me extra  80 Dirham for 2 nights  and I was not aware of the charge when booked
its a nice hotel to stay.
the hotel is overpriced in relation with its quality.

Many pools including a lagoon. Good quality shops and resturants although a little expensive. Great health food shop next to tapas tower pool. 4 water slides in 1 pool was graet addition for kids and or adults. Close to Alamona shopping centre largest outdoor shopping centre in the world, massive food court. Fire works display every Friday night.

Great location, clean and spacious rooms, good food and a very nice and a very friendly and courteous personell. guided tour to the Ganga arti which was wonderful. What more can I say. This hotel does not disappoint you.

The staff were excellent, working long hours but always with a smile and a good word. The continental breakfast far exceeded other hotels, that I have stayed in. Yes, it has the basics but the chef also put an extra on each morning so I can't understand others that complain about it. Request a sea view room with balcony and you couldn't  ask for more...the view is fantastic. This hotel is certainly value for money.
The internet is expensive and very bad!
The room are clean and good arrangement.
Difficulty to get car park, swimming pool not suitable for kid and can't extend check out time even one hour.

The hotel is really lovely and our room was superb, and it was lovely that they took note of my request for a quiet room as it was for my husbands birthday and they even left a card and a lovely little bottle of wine all wrapped up for him - that was a lovely touch.  The evening meal was excellent and great value - wine list good too and not overly priced for a hotel of this quality
Good breakfast and not much to moan about!

Bath towels too small and no fan / aircon made the room stuffy.  Parking should be included in the package.   I don't expect to pay to park when I stay at hotels!  It's a Ryanair  of doing business that finds every chargeable extra to levy on Customers who have little choice at the time.  You may be losing business by charging for parking but may attract more if you advertise it as FREE.  I can understand having to pay for holiday long stay but a real put-off for a one nighter!
Friendly staff! Nice view! Very clean hotel! Everyone is attentive! It's a lot of stars! Very very good!
There appeared to be a lot of stains on the carpets throughout the corridors also the internal doors within the apartment could really do with some kind on latch on them as they bang like mad.
the room was very small and had no drawyers to put things in, also only a tiny wardrobe. one of the bed lamps was loose and the electricity socket where the kettle plugs in was also loose.
Fantastic staff especially shuana and the rest of the bar staff would definitely book to stsy there again
some of staff a bit rude
nothing really. Not enough boiled potatoes to many chips.
Clean.  Reception staff welcoming.  Hotel bar charges for food/drinks/tea/coffee etc very, very reasonable prices for a hotel. E.g. cup of coffee 1.60 euro (hotel) v 1.50 euro (beach cafe)
Disappointed that there was no tea/coffee making facility within hotel room.  Could be order/bought in hotel bar at reasonable
Excellent staff, good level of cleanliness, good exterior territory, comfortable and friendly atmosphere.

Room attendants , bar staff , lounge staff and restaurant staff very friendly and polite .  Superb breakfast , executive lounge very good at happy hour 6-8pm with nibbles and drinks .  Executive check in very good .  Roof top pool superb with good staff .
Front end staff at main reception very frosty , a few niggles at the hotel , staff try very hard but I feel that the management team let the hotel down and need a good shake up .
Bright sunlight in the morning, I would recommend a sleep mask and maybe earplugs for an excellent nights sleep.  Dodgy lock given to me for the locker.
One of the best hotels I have stayed in, all staff are so friendly,
Nothing negative to say,
Warm welcome and friendly staff.Complimentary glass of champagne is a lovely touch.Great location and wouldn't need to look anywhere else to stay.
swimming pool   situation in namaa bay

A beautiful hidden paradise very near to the beach, supermarket. Away from noise and crowds. The dolmus to Bodrum passes by in front of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpfull and most of them speak English. The breakfast is very good with a large variety of food. They also have a Greek/Turkish restaurant wich I haven't tried. All the rooms are situated around the pool. I loved it there.
Good location with functional rooms and a great breakfast. Friendly staff
Very nice hotel, well situated in the city, friendly staff, excellent pizza baker!
No WIFI in the rooms

Booked a privilege room, really worth the money! Private terrace area to eat away from the hussle and bussle in the restaurant, free entrance to spa area, private area with private sun lounges by the pool, complementary fresh beach towels given to you each day.   The hotel itself was lovely, deep swimming pool which not found often nowadays, quiet, relaxing.   Only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Quite a far distance from BCN airport (average 1hr20 on coach)   Food was a buffet so a wide variety of choice, from spaghetti, pizza and fish to salad, fresh fruit and vegetables.

Staff in the restaurant do not speak much English, much confusion about drinks served in the evening. Just to clarify that you do have to pay for your drinks. Although our first night we were not billed for a bottle of wine when I asked for a glass however my boyfriend was charged for his beer.     And if you order any food during the daytime from the bar area the staff do not tell you that you have to take the receipt yourself to the kitchen area. Sat for 40mins waiting for our food to be then told by a waiter who spoke a little English that we didn't take the receipt so the chef doesn't know about the food order.
Everything you expect
Had to pay a lot for parking even with the discount. Also had to organise my booking when arrived as it haven't been done correctly and cost me £9 in calls from a mobile.
It is simply SUPERB and stunning. Very clean and beautiful location. Would go again
Gem of a hotel, staff very pleasant, helpful and Professional sorted a problem out with our  toilet within a couple of hours most apologetic would definitely go again and most certainly recommend it.
Nice lunch and breakfast. Very frendly staff. Very clean romms and public area.
Dinner not soo good. Almost the same food as lunch - but it is not dinner.
brilliant location for concert and shopping!!!!Car park available and this was an added plus for me.
The hotel was very nice, yes the rooms are a little smaller than I have come to expect however, I was there for the sunshine and the beach so it was of little importance.
I have to say this hotel is one of the best hotels I have been in  Very clean very new and friendly stuff and good location A
Very central location right near bus and train stations. Excellent value for money - I have stayed here previously and would definitely stay again!

We only stayed for one night but would definately recommend it to family and friends.  We arrived in the middle of a wedding but the reception staff could not have been more helpful.  They put us in a beautiful room far away from the wedding so it would not be noisy for us.  I had read some not so complimentary reviews on Trip Adviser as was slightly worried but I do not know what rooms these people stayed in as ours was clean, very well furnished and the bed and bedding were superb.  We will certainly book this hotel again.
nice atmosphere
just menu for room services is very bad
The best green site in Windhoek!   Professional and friendly staff. Better service than most direct competitor hotel in Windhoek.
Shuttle prices to city and airport.
Very good location. Very clean. Good price/quality.
No airco in the room. Quality of breakfast can be better.

Brilliant central location, nice quiet rooms, large super- kingsize beds, good bathrooms and powerful shower. Staff so polite, efficient and willing to help with anything including reservations for restaurants and airport taxi shuttle which is very reasonably priced.  Minutes from the beautiful Danube river, hotel is in lovely art deco building, inside its quite alternative and very modern. The bedrooms have giant mirrors with tv incorporated inside them. Beds are a tiny bit hard but it di not stop us having a great night sleep. The place is truly immaculate. Breakfast are good and served until the civilised time of 10.30am. The staff even let us keep the room for late check out. We could not have asked for more. Its a very boutique style and definetley something different. 5 stars! and Highly reccomended
perhaps a sun terrace would be nice.
Rooms are excellent, confortable, clean etc. Staff very friendly.
exactly as advertised, we stayed here last year and returned without hesitation

Breakfast very poor, items on buffet menu not available on buffet table, also bacon almost cold, sausages overlooked,fresh fruit salad consisted of melon only. Breakfast is served until 10.00 we went down between 8.30 and 9.00 so we were not late going.
Nice managment on beach.  Good manner of all stuff.  Well prepared room equiptment.
I found the staff generally helpful and friendly: the room was modern, clean and very pleasant overlooking the garden. The Bedford is an excellent central place to stay in London
I had an evening meal in the restaurant. The vegetarian dish was almost inedible.  Service at breakfast is erratic.
Hotel is nice and in a great location, the room was large and clean.

We stayed at the Hotel Del Consoli so after check in we had to walk to our actual hotel. It is rather confusing having to check in at one hotel and then make your  to another carrying all your luggage. There is a reception desk at the hotel so not sure why this cant be used when there expecting people checking in.
the hotel room had no view to speak about. maintenance needed in the room. a little more attention to cracked paintwork
Much russian people, but were not a problem

I stayed in this hotel for 3 days 4 night and truly speaking it was wonderful experience. It was delicious food, Great Room Service, excellence rooms and pool.its well furnished with white colour n great for whole love white specially me. It is located in beach. Staff is very friendly and caring...We will definitely have our next stay here in near December.the park holiday beach resort see you soon.Thanks for care.Regards,HUSAIN SONI

My wife and I spent eight days (June 2013) at Hotel Hacienda Puerta del Sol, near Mijas. This is a 4* hotel, so we weren't expecting luxury or fine dining. The hotel was super clean, staff very friendly/helpful. 'Reception staff' spoke excellent English. Breakfast and dinner was buffet style and quantity/quality/choice was really good. There was a good choice of wines/alcoholic drinks at exceptionally reasonable prices.     The hotel is in a scenic area. It is quiet - average age of guest 55  (although a few young couples/families were there during our stay). The hotel trades heavily on bus tours with an overnight stay/early depart. This is an advantage to other guests as the hotel/poolside is never congested and it is easy to get a sunbed by the pool. There is no loud music anywhere in hotel (even around the pool in daytime) -a massive plus! No-one diving into pool either - so you can relax and enjoy the sun. There was no entertainment at night when we were there but guests enjoyed evening drinks on the terrace after dinner and basically chilled out.    A car is a must if you want to take trips around the area. The hotel is not well sited for walking. Mijas, by car, is five minutes away. There is a regular bus service during the day to Mijas/Fuengirola - leaves from side of hotel and costs a few euro.    In conclusion, this hotel is ideal for a quiet, relaxing, peaceful holiday in very pleasant surroundings.

The beds/mattresses in the hotel are basic (but very clean). There is some tolerable (unless you are neurotic!) road noise during the day which can be heard in the gardens/ pool area, as the side of the hotel is close to the main road from Fuengirola to Mijas. Traffic lessens in the evening and the noise disappears.    There is an absence of notices (or badly placed notices) advertising hotel services eg that Wi Fi is available, where pool towels can be obtained etc.
Very pleasant hotel in good location for Valetta. Short transfer to airport.
Lovely well kept hotel in nice surroundings. Helpful pleasan staff,  Anniversary night away and we were upgraded to a suite which was   Brilliant thank you .
Nothing negatives to say.
The hotel was well located. Room was spacious. Staff very friendly.

Improvement in cleaniness required as previous occupiers belongings found under bed by cleaner which should not have happened. Coffee facility inadequate. Mini bar and breakfast over priced. Car parking fees need to reduced.

Good value for money. Staff very proofessional who provided a ***** stars service (carry bags to the room, hold the door, get you a taxi...etc). Very helpful and smiling. Just a pleasure!  Place and rooms clean properly and sheet changed everyday. Also get every morning around 9:45am a free shuttle that goes to a beach. Internet access is free and very speed! Airport is at about 15min driving by taxi (don't get a white taxi as they're the most expensive!!!). Restaurant close from the hotel. At the gas station (5min walks to the right) you'll find two cash machin if needed (one inside and one outside). And the city center is at about 15:20min driving! Taxi are cheap so not a problem to be out of the touristic zone.

The hotel is far away from the touristic zone, in what they call ''the old town" in the Indian/Pakistan area. On arrival at the hotel for the check in, they kept our passeport for no reason. 4 night clubs on the ground floor...so a bit noisy on the evening. Was on floor 4 so wasn't disturbing that much for us. Also unable to have a guest coming in your room without the authorisation of the reception guys (ID needs to be shown!). Felt really bad for my friends who came over in our room to get a glass of water. Staff followed us to the floor, then knocked at the door to ask our guest to get out the room and stop by the reception for an ID check.
Location was excellent, It is cheap and good value for money paid.
Basically needed a good paint in the rooms - good clean around with disinfectant to freshen up

Very friendly and efficient staff, always smiling and very pleasant  Room was very modern, clean. Staff would constantly be checking if   You required fresh towels or bottles of water. They were very happy to assist.    Great views all around hotel.    Food was was good and there was a good selection.  Dinner served till 11pm, this was good as you didn't have to rush back to hotel.    Free shuttle service to mall was good - make sure you get to pick up point early as this  Service is efficient and runs precisely on schedule!    Excellent hotel, clean, friendly staff great beach and pool area.
Quite simply the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Truly awful in every possible
For €77,- it was just okay, not good and not awfull.  The normal price is around €120,- and that's  too expensive for this quality.
Dirty sheets, a lot of stains in the carpet.   Bed not very comfortable and just horrible pillows!
Very clean and well maintained
TV was horrible /limited cable stations   Breakfast foods were not that good
There is nothing to do in San Agustin.     The mattress was very hard.
Great hotel with brilliant facilities.  Very child friendly and ideal for families.
Pillows could be better and television a bit bigger. Also they had some new towels and not washed enough, so the peels/cloth was all over my body and because the towel was so new it did not dry.
found the hotel to be very pleasant and clean. staff on the whole were acceptable but wish they would smile. I know its probably their culture but very off putting
Very kind and helpfull personals. Nearby city and nearby underground.

We arrive the hostel 5 min before closing. But it take one hour before we get any room because of hotelopia. Our room was not booked from hotelopia, and the personal have a problem with allready booked rooms. so thank you staff that fixed it for us. I will never book trough Hotelopia again.....
New-clean-location-staff

We booked superior room. Excellente. View on a ocean. The best decision. Other rooms are back in the hill with no view at all.   You have a nice beach 70 meters away from the hotel. A nice power walk cus its downhill and back uphill. On the right side of the beach you can explore the near village. Good beach.   Bus stop directly at the beach and you can visit Mahe.     Hotel has also Other hotels on the other islands. You can island hoop them arranged free of charge of hotel if you exchange sleep over during your stay. For Praslin, For La Digue you need to add some money.  La Digue the best island, but hardcore waves. Praslin also nice. Mahe also nice :)    Hotel Restaurant: very good food. Prices better than any other Restaurant.
Nice simple and small hotel close to the beach and the city. Hospitality and service are given in a pleasant . A good place to be.
Extremely unprofessional staff-rooms were not clean and even the doors were unfunctional-I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone.
Hotel is in good location - Maspalomas, tons of activities. And Jumbo center entrance. Friendly staff. Good food.

To the hotel: Please, write a warning, about TONS of GAY'S is visiting and living you'r hotel. I was with my wife, and it's not very nice, that i did'nt find anywhere info about gays activities.   Small pool. Hotel is old, and I don't think now it's 4 stars. Thank you, and good luck.
Being frequent travelers - always return via this hotel in Bangkok - we enjoy our stay here so much!  World class!

It's always a pleasure to stay in your hotel. The location is absolutely one of the best in the city. It is very easy to get around from the Sabana. I really liked your updates. It has been a few years since I last traveled to Costa Rica.I was not disappointed by my stay at your hotel. The prices are still great, the rooms comfortable, the breakfast excellent, the parking garage a real bonus, the security top notch and the staff helpful. Thanks for changing our room to a downstairs one due to my difficulty with stairs. The French soccer group although slightly unpleasant were just being French and at least were interesting. The other groups and guests from several countries were delightful and friendly.  We had a great time. Thanks for remaining one of the very best hotels in Costa Rica.

The building is wonderful - historic house owned by the Queen Mother's father.  Furnishings etc are extremely fine.  The location is excellent and quiet.  Staff were extremely helpful and professional.  Breakfast plentiful.

London rooms are small, but this was RIDICULOUS.  Partner had to sit on the bed just to allow me enough space to edge sideways around it.  Due to the size of the room there were no facilities like an ironing board - just as well as it would not be possible to put it up.  The room was prone to be hot so we slept with the window open - the only air conditioning would be from an electric fan which was in the cupboard serving as a wardrobe (which I had to sit in to put on my shoes as there was no space anywhere else!), and I cannot see where it could hope to be plugged in without overbalancing.  This is only a 4* hotel due to having a concierge desk and 24 hour reception.  Better described as a nice 3*

Staff and the hotel complex itself was excellent.  Beatifully landscaped gardens and close to the beach and Porec town.  Very calm and safe environment for families with enough facilities (massage, gym, indoor outdoor pools etc) that there was plenty to do.  Breakfast was really fantastic.

The beach and particularly the sea closest to the hotel was dirty with a significant amounts of litter (plastic bags etc) but also see weed washing up on the beach each day.  It was occasionally cleaned away by the staff but not frequently enough.  The water might not contain polluntants (blue flag) but the litter was really an issue so in the end we found a nice pebble beach 10m drive up the road that was much better.

Absolutely beautiful hotel, clean and extremely professional staff. A     food.  Great location in Jumeriah Beach (construction going on across the road but this didn't have any impact on sleeping or other activities).  Would highly recommend to everybody, extremely happy with the quality and service received.

An excellent apart hotel with friendly staff, good facilities and a high quality of cleanliness. My studio room was large, well equiped with air conditioning and daily maid service. I stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was very good ranging from continental to an English fried menu. Ideally situated for the Strip in Albufeira and close to many good bars and restaurants.

Unfortunately my stay was spoilt by the rowdiness and unacceptable behaviour of large groups of 'British' youngsters staying at the hotel, clearly intent on enjoying themselves at the expense of other guests. The hotel and/or holiday companies MUST address this issue as I am sure that returning holidaymakers to Albufeira will avoid this and other hotels that continue to accept bookings from large groups of young idiots.
Hard to find - better signage nearby and instructions online would help.
A handrail in the pool (villa) would be great, as it is difficult to get out of

Very nice almost new apartments, very clean, nice balconies (yes 2 in our case), lovely gardens, free aircon (it was hot at night in early June), nice pleasant helpful owners, Short stroll to pebbly beach, town

For the price we were super pleasantly surprised. After 5 nights in a turtle bay beach cottage we picked this as a low cost option but it was fantastic. Perfect location, less busy but gorgeous beach out front, quick walk to main shopping strip, bars and restaurants in the building and block, supermarket and coffee downstairs, bus around the corner... Comfy king size bed, perfectly clean bathroom. Will definitely stay again!
Nothing. Didn't go check out the pool since beach is across the road!
Good position to tourist attractions and shopping. Very friendly and cooperative staff.
It was a very pleasant experience to be guest at the Manukan Island resort! Everything was just fine.

Everything about this hotel worked well for us and we would definitively return. Represented great value for money. My parents endorse this positive response who also stayed at the same time . The hotel was very clean in all respects.The staff are extremely efficient, friendly and helpful. It's a great location with a lovely atmosphere and we all felt  very safe and secure there.  The hair dryer is nice and powerful . Next time there will be no need to bring our own hair dryer.

Great location in the heart of Madrid. Rooms stay cool even in heat of day, plus the history of the hotel adds to the ambience of it all (1862). Staff was helpful and spoke English (so my bad Spanish wasn't a problem). Restaurant was great, fast service and good food ( you could tell by the locals there).
Elevator (lift) wasn't always operating at its best; bar down street was noisy (but hey, it's Spain and part of the local flavor) as I heard it from my room.
The only view was of a large ducting pipe outside in a very narrow outside space within the confines of the hotel
very good entertainments at the pool, professional animators, very good place to go on holiday with children.
no negative emotions :)
Really eased with how attentive staff were, particularly the phone call 5 mins after settling into our room to check it was all ok.
Could do with having safes in each room rather than just a few safety deposit boxes behind reception.
Nice bed and pillows
Parking too expensive
Let us have late check out at 5pm with no xtra charge.  Very nice new, clean and large room with free upgrade

This was an amazing value for my money. The place was roomy with a large kitchen/living area. The tub was huge in the master bedroom. Everything was amazing with minor hiccups. My friends and I didn't want to leave our little paradise in Kissimmee.

The toilet outside the guest bedroom had a mind of its own and decided if it did not want to flush or not. But not a huge problem. The setup for the apts was a little strange. If I'm in apt m-19, it can't be accessed in the same hallway as apt m-4 (just an ex). I wish I could just walk across like regular apartments. And lastly, there's no door between the master tub and the master bedroom so if I have a guest in the master tub, I can see them from my bed. All very minute problems that had very little impact on the great time I had here, just things I noticed.

Hotel well situated only 2 subway stations away from central Catalunya place. Helpful and kindly staff willing to make you feel like at home.
