Affordable room rate, high quality breakfast, comfortable beds and clean room. Only 2 stars hotel but it definitely deserves a 3rd one..    Gracia area, where the hotel is located, is a nice area to walk in or eat something. I strongly recommend you this spanish restaurant, great food only a few meters away from the hotel :  http://www.tripadvisor.de/Restaurant_Review-g187497-d2719760-Reviews-La_Porteria-Barcelona_Catalonia.html
Noisy and busy street in front of hotel but we could sleep well nevertheless. Painting in the room could have been refreshed and a small furniture was missing in the bathroom to put our things on
The hotel is in an excellent location near the city center so you don't need a car during the evening.
The hotel did not have beach towels for the swimming pool which is surprising for a 4 star hotel
Very comfortable bed
The hotel is very much in service of your needs. Food is plenty and staff is uber friendly

To our taste, it was a bit too touristy, catering to large groups. For couples you might want somewhat more intimacy, not eating at the buffet everyday (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Extra's would cost you big time - like going for an intimate dinner (45 USD p.p. extra), picking you up from the airstrip (45 USD  p.p (one way) - and there being no other  to get there).
Near Paddington station
They demanded to borrow £10 for security reasons. We shall get it back one day. Noisy.  Never again.
Loved the gardens and animals our 2 year old was in heaven, loved the size of the rooms and the swimming pools view from room of rainbow tower.

Too many rooms based of one infastructure I.e check in took forever, outdated movie system, no kettle in room or champagne glasses or milk, walk to the happening part of town. Only little things... We did really enjoy our stay
Nice swimming pool, good location, cheap restaurants just outside the hotel
Great location and good for all ages. .  Staff really friendly and hotel very clean.  Had no problems finding sunbeds every day.  .
Food a bit disappointing from the last time we came 4 years ago, but adequate.

This 2-night, 3-day stay in your hotel was simply superb! From the moment we arrived until we picked up our bags from the concierge our experiences at every level of service were second to none. Be assured we will be back!
None whatsoever!
Lovely service. Decor a bit dated but definitely compensated by the service. Have already been back a second time and planning a third visit.
Old furnishing, air condition, fridge, safe have to pay extra. Also you can't use the air condition when you are out. Not recommend!!!
- on good position, peace  - clean rooms
maybe some vegatables could be served on breakfeast (like salad, cucumber,tomato) instead of much sucker pies
Not nearly enough sun loungers, food hit and miss, a dress code for dinner which is not adhered to, only very few english speaking guests in hotel.
Great hotel and very friendly staff. Bright rooms, lovely garden-pool area and very clean. Breakfast buffet has a good variety of breads, cereals, fruits and sandwich fillings.
The bed mattrasses are very hard. A Ikea Sultan topper mattrass would make them much more comfortable.

If the room would be equiped with refrigeretor, it would have, according my opinion, increase the popularity. The maids didn´t clean the room every day, i.e. the sama issue. It is not  complains, just remark.

Absolutely superb hotel - modern tasteful rooms in old but beautiful building - lovely location.  Terrace restaurant lovely setting and good food.  Superb value for money. If the hotel was in Mardin would be twice the price - but it isn't that far away!
Public areas are attractive and location fairly good for The old town. Take bus number 1 or  M  into town.

Room set up for 1 person and we had to request  a second    chair and more towels. TV was old and square.   Bathroom  smelled  damp with  low  quality toiletries. Breakfast orange juice too sweet and artificial taste .
Probably the cleanest hotel I've stayed at for a long while. Congrats to the housekeeping staff!
Good location - 7 minutes walk from Euston station.  Nice, clean hotel.

This is a very good resort, on the beach, with good facilities. The Valet Parking is great. The rooms are good, well maintained, and the quality of the infrastructure is good.  Helpful and friendly staff.

Te Internet is far too expensive, so therefore I didn't use it. Drop the price and I would have paid for it!  The Buffett restaurant is average in quality.  The location of this hotel is excellent for the beach, but a long  from the co of Fujairah.
The location, food and staffs are good.
little bit of cleanliness, for double bed two single beds are placed together, room is small according to the star of hotel.
Very much needs an update, particularly the room
Staff- very friendly, professional, always there to greet you   Service- 10/10  always somebody available to help   Overall best hotel I've stayed in 9.5/10
Location excellent, cleanliness very good, staff efficient.
Water in the mornings was discoloured.   An oven would have been good.
Convenient location, reasonable value for money and friendly and helpful staff.
WiFi not available in room, very limited toiletry items with no facial tissues, face towels or hand towels, thick dust on bathroom door panel and desk drawers.

The suite 208 was very quiet overlooking the convent. The location of the hotel was also very quiet yet only a short walk from the old town square. Nearby there were plenty of bars and restaurants. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, providing recommendations for eating and drinking. I would certainly stay at this hotel if I was visiting Prague again.

Whilst there was an excellent selection on the breakfast buffet the hot breakfast was not hot, the warming dishes need some attention. There was a charge of 40 CZK per coffee pod in your room, I think this should be complimentary.
Polite and friendly staff  Good breakfast and value- for- money reception service
Smallest bedroom I have ever encountered in a London hotel

The room is very spacious with a big balcony offering a great seaview. The staff at the reception are very friendly and helpful, allowing us to check-in early on arrival at 8 am, and offering us tips and maps on what to see and where to go.
The breakfast is meagre, orange juice, croissant or cake and coffee.
Friendly staff, nicely situated. Quiet surroundings. Very nice garden. Supermarket in the neighbourhood. Direct busconnection to the centre.

From arrival at the main entrance , through the reception  and check in the staff were professional polite and friendly. The hotel from entering exudes a friendly, authentic and calm atmosphere congruous with the anticipated Havana style.    The room was well equiped, clean and perfect for the duration of our stay. The concierge was most obliging and patient when quizzed on the practicalities of travelling around Havana. The restaurants, food and staff could only be described as excellent and this is ignoring the general tourist trade in Havana. The onsite site store and money exchange made for a self contained stay without the requirement to obtain essential supplies elsewhere. Not forgetting the roof top pool and bar which which made the location all the more impressive when admiring the views over Havana.    The main lounge during evening times was impressive with a great bar, fantastic drinks and cigar selection enhanced by the authentic surroundings and professional staff    Overall an excellent hotel and enough to warrant seeking our next vacation at an Iberostar Hotel, somewhere different.
Over our 2 night , 3 day stay there was nohthng which could be added to improve our stay.
Good location and friendly staff

There was no hot water in our cabana.       There were two ceiling lights in our cabana, neither was working until a staff member was able to manipulate the fluorescent tube and get it working.  This took some time,  after some time
Loved the farm in the garden! Excellent breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff. Pleasant south facing patio.  Definitely would stay again.
friendly an helpful service

We arrived at the hotel and with out any warning or notice, we were chucked into a taxi and headed to a new hotel because the pool was broken!   Me and my friends booked this hotel because it was so good the year before, and to have to walk an extra 15 minutes to get to the main strip is pretty annoying! Especially at night it didn't seem safe to walk back, we were forking out for taxis! So overall I'm not happy with the holiday, I thought either you guys or the cosmopolite could have emailed me and perhaps let us choose another hotel rather than bein chucked into a crap hotel!
Nice staff.  Good facilities.  No problems at all.
nice suite with swimming pool, friendly and very helpful staff
internet is a catastrophe and does not work most of the time. Would not reccomend this hotel to business  people.  in general there is a lack of proper management.
very authentic; friendly personnel; good food; good location for fish river canyon.
Location was excellent although the narrow roads did concern us slightly with the car.   Staff very helpful especially with parking.
Staff on reception and in restaurant very welcoming.
Excellent staff, clean and efficient.
The rooms were a little warm even with air con, but then again people can always open a window!
Friendly staff, and very helpful, rooms were nice had basic essentials that needed.
Not a lot of parking only small car park at front
The hotel was lovely and was exactly what was described. The room was a little small, however we spent all our time sightseeing. Staff very friendly. Ideal location to sights.
nice and clean.

I asked for a room street side on my booking form   and was put in a room overlooking an ugly car park.  Shift manager didn't check properly and asked how I intended to pay when my bill had been settled online,  Some staff at the front counter seemed pissed to be worling there.  Ugly surrounding.
Wonderful hotel. Location is great, close to restaurants, shops and the beach. Staff is super friendly and very helpful.
Difficult to find it. No visible signs on the .
The staff was helpfull and serviceminded.
Hotel is on the beach, if you are looking for sun see and sand. Compound can be a little noisy, if you are ok with that.
Carefree atmosphere for children-Very lively evenings-Exellent food-Great service-Unmatchable Guest Care.
reasonable price, easy to get to

The service at La Quinta was excellent , very professional and attentive , the hotel is perfect if you want a quiet and relaxing time , perfectly clean throughout and the food was very good quality and enjoyable .

Menorca is a very pleasant and quiet island , but the resort of Cala n Bosch is ok but not particularly special , we have stayed before in Cala Galdana , if this hotel was in that resort it would be perfect !!
Efficient, friendly and helpful check-in. Speedy bell-hop service in and out of room. Clean, quiet location. Nice property. Swimming pool lovely.   Free internet that worked ok.
The TV in the room is old. Phone in bathroom falling off wiring.
Food (both breakfast and dinner) and Spa was very good. The staff was very profissional.

Well placed In centre of Nice near Place Massena and close to bus and tram routes-short walk to Old Nice and Promenade des Anglais.  Friendly and attentive staff. Clean. Some refurbishment carried out in last year.
No air conditioning and en suite facilities can be cramped but perfectly adequate. You would pay much more for these facilities so-on balance-really good value for money.
Nice and clean , staff very friendly.

1) Rudeness of staff at reception    2) Did not get room i ask for at booking - asked for room with bath in quiet area of hotel.  When we got to room it offered it did not have a bath so went to reception
The bungalow was nice, we had one of ekstra good quality. Good size and nicely renovated.
We did not like the evening buffet, so we tried different restaurants in the area instead.

Many MANY issues with the room.  I've stayed at Showboat many times before and this time was by FAR the worst experience I've ever had.  It will make me think twice before booking another room in this hotel.  The pillows were paper thin, the tv remote didn't work, the electrical outlet is a fire hazard as it spits out any plug you put in it, and the room didn't even have a desk in it.  I've never been in a hotel room which was this disappointing.

Heating didnt work. They wheeled in a portable heater. This was completely unacceptable so we requested a room change as it was a very cold Melbourne night. I was shivering. The room they moved us to was right next to an elevator so we heard that all night. Seriously, I paid good money for a brick wall view in a room smaller than my bedroom n suburban Melbourne. It is out dated, the carpet was worn. The bathroom flooded everywhere as the shower is only separated by a flimsy curtain. It really was poor form and another reason I am fed up with the rip off that is the Australian Hospitality industry. I would rank this as two stars. It wold have been cheaper and better if we just caught a cab back to the suburbs than waste money here,
I really enjoyed the hotel and Graceland experience I would definately recommend it to anyone.
very old. no fridge, no safe, you could easy hear the  talking.The door very unsafe
Only the food and close to the beach.
Everything. Dirty. Staff not friendly. 3 times changing to a other room. Still dirty. Never ever again.
Very satiesfied with my stay and haven`t nothing to complaint at. It`s really a 5 star hotel with good facilities and a nice beach. Will also mention the staff who was serviceminded and friendly.

Toilets were filthy.  Shower did not drain.  TV reception was poor.  Most international flights into London arrive in the morning. We arrived at 6.30 only to be charged 60 pounds for an early check in. This hotel needs to acknowledge that people will arrive early and not charge an extra night to check in early.

Nice modern good value hotel with good rooms, facilities and good food, its in a good location just out of town with very pleasant surroundings, good transport connections to town centre, but only 15 minute walk  /- !

When we arrived at the hotel to check in they couldn't find us on their system which worried me a bit, but they pulled out all the stops to give us a room for the night, and breakfast wasn't included in the price even though the receptionist said it was, which I thought was rare ?

Very conveniently located for those travelling by car or coming by group travel. On a ring road outside the tightly packed city, it was a restful oasis. A modern large facility, there is some distance to the rooms, but an economical  stay overall.
Friendly hotel, lovely facilities, clean
Nice in old city every thing is near don.t need taxi even
Location and facilities

No amex accepted.  Need to ask many times before being able to obtain simple services, such as charging extras into hotel bill for settlement at the end of stay, as hotel operates mostly for groups on all inclusive basis, this is an uncommon request which requires many authorisations from different departments,  so make it clear from the beginning that you will pay at the end in order to avoid delays when checking out if you are independent travel.  No email or contact details to inform hotel of lost and found after my departure, can anyone help me with that?

I was pleasantly surprised by Jurys Inn hotel near Heathrow. I basically wanted an hotel, not one that would break the bank, near the airport for an early morning flight. But also links that would take me to central london pretty quickly. Hatton Cross tube station is just round the corner, and has a straight picadilly line connection which doesnt require much changing. But I was surprised at how fresh and new the hotel looked, the room was good, beds comfortable (though i must say the pillows left something to be desired - too soft). The staff were competent and friendly and seemed to know what they were doing. All in all, good experience, and would recommend.
Great location...very clean ...lovely staff obliged straight away to change the room due to noise outside.
Our first room located on front of building was very noisy ....
staff is very serviceminded, and the rooms, lobby, restaurant, etc, is like living in a fairytale!

Guests are mostly Russians, witch behaves incredibly rude, selvish and unpolite in every .  They just push their  through the queue everywhere without caring about anything else.  in front of elevators, buffets, bars, reception, any doors: if there's a Russian coming, whatch out, 'cause they don't!!!
Cleaning, animationteam and the lunch at the beachrestaurant!
The staff at the pool bar and in the restaurant were not service-oriented. Some of them ignored us and did not take up our orders. It happened serveral times.

Accommodation King Jason Papos 12th to 26th June.  As a result of the services received at the King Jason justice demands we convey our experiences of the service received.  The success of the King Jason is predominately due to the professionalism of the management and staff particularly Andreas, Maria and the Balinese chef but it was in fact all of the staff.  The management and staff understand fully a service business and each and every guest is treated with great dignity, young or old, of any gender, colour or creed.  The management of the King Jason could be used as consultants for other hotels such is the professionalism demonstrated.  We make this judgment having experienced “premium” hotels such as the Istana in KL, Howard Plaza in Taipei, Sofitel in Melbourne and Shangri La on Sentosa Island Singapore to name but a few.  Further my work history is one of General Management overseeing 1200 employees trying to get all singing from the same song sheet like the staff at the King Jason is not easy to achieve and maintain.  Good food and amenities compliment the service offering and results in high value package.    The above comments were expressed by all other guests we conversed with and there were many.    Overall many thanks for all the kindness shown and wish all stakeholders of the business and all Cypriots much prosperity in future years.    Highest Regards  Veronica and Gerry Walsh

The only let down is the internet service which requires urgent correction as the demand on this facility will only grow with time.    Another constructive comment would the generation of a strong room for luggage with a security tagging procedure(common in many hotels) as this would allow guests to be more comfortable on the last day as a results of some having many hours to kill between vacating room and leaving for flights.

The purpose of our visit was to meet up with family and also to celebrate my niece's birthday! !  We had a fabulous time and appreciate the welcome package of chocolates and card! Hazel enjoyed her spa treatment which was a birthday gift! The food' staff and room were excellent! We will definitely use the Hotel again!! Hopefully sooner rather than later! Thank you all so much!!
The lobby is grand and the history is really interesting.

My room smelled like Mildew and the sheets in the bed were damp and seemed like they had not been changed for a long time. The shower leaked all over the floor in the bathroom although the shower pressure was good.
Good location for visiting and sightseeing.  Good value for money considering central location.
Small rooms  Not enough wardrobe space  Noisy due to badly fitting windows  Badly designed breakfast rooms
The rooms Worre very cold due to the very old vindues

The staff were very kind and helpfull, eventhough there was a little mistake with a special request they tookcare of it instanly and gave us a nice compensation. The breakfast was amazing with a wide veraiety of food. Very quite a peacefull place.
The minigolf court was very poor and broken with no maintaince.  The price that was writen on the website was without the vat and wasnt nice to know at the check in that we need to add more money.
It's a good hotel, the proximity to the center it's a good value.
The price for parking is too expensive
Very clean. Charming receptionist and very helpful.
Untidy and messy garden with litter and rubbish at the front outside so a bit daunting when you drive up to it but inside really neat and clean.
Lovely big room, well lit, splendid view. Reception very helpful, and food and waiting staff excellent.   Lots of parking available.
I can’t understand why are the dogs aloud in the hotel.  The cleanness and the noise is affected.  Sometimes I can’t simply rest

this comments just in view of the hotel being a 5 star hotel. hence it should be without coments.  slightly noisy, hearing conversation from other rooms.  elevators function randomly... i.e. no logic to when or which elevator will appear.  swimming pool sligthly to hot.... warm... not really to cool down.  if you order a cocktail at the swimming pool area the quality should be the same all the time, regardless who is making it.

I was quite happy with the service I got, the apartment was kept tidy including all necessary facilities, plus there were two swimming pools from which one was 70 m long, pretty impressive and handy for people interested into getting some training out there. The hotel staff was was kind and spoked English well.

On the down side I found it quite far from the main beach thus felt cut out or locked there. Night life there was down to zero, me doing many activities during the day and coming late back just in time to get a dinner prevented me from experiencing any entertainment which happened there. BTW from what I saw I learned that the entertainment targeted small children so as to give the numerous families deserved rest from the kids. Next things I was missing there were recycling facilities on the hotel and soups in the bathrooms. Apart of that it is a place where everyone can enjoy themselves if they chose this place for the right reason.
The location is great and breakfist is very testy

Wow! we really could not fault the professionalism of the staff at our hotel. We had originally booked to stay at the Newcastle Centre Jury's Inn, however due to a problem with external providers (Hotelopia) the hotel was double booked. The staff assisted us by transferring us to the Quayside Jury's Inn, this turned out to be the better of the two and even threw in complimentary breakfast. We shall be returning very soon. Thank you for such a positive experience.    And oh my word...! The shower was amazing :D
Ironing facilities could use some improvement.

The room was clean and tidy. The toilet did not flush properly, the shower curtain was coming apart? and the Tv did not work correctly (Server was down). Funny enough this is the same excuse the last time i stayed so the girl on reception telling me that someone will come and have a look at it was just lip service which was unnecessary, all she had to say was its not working. We had breakfast in the morning and it was very tasty however the person who thinks deep frying a potato scone and having them oozing fat when you cut into them is acceptable should be fired. Absolutely disgusting. What was more worrying was the foreign guests seeing this disgusting mess, scottish folk dont eat this muck. Theres no  hes a scotsman and its certainly not Nick Nairn. Tell the chef to stop being lazy and cook them properly. I have seen this in other hotels also.  Your costs for wifi are horrendous also, £15 for 24 hours. You guys need to get with the times. You want to attract a certain clientel you should be providing free wifi like any other hotel i have stayed in. The blue rinse brigade that I seen at your hotel would probably not be too bothered about not using wifi but other guests using smart phones, games consuls and laptops and ipads etc would be well miffed at your fees. Fortunately due to my tv not working i was given free access, so why not provide it free to start with? A connection fee of £2.50 per guest would more than  cover your anual fees for any maintainance. (A charge would still be unnecessary)  Your charges at the mini bar are also scandalous. Fair play you want to make an extra couple of quid on the goods in the room but £2.50 for a single caramel waifer, £5 for peanuts and jelly beans, come on, are your really that desperate to exploit your guests, seriously?. This is just desperate and really is a throw back to the bad old days of out of date hoteliers. Just because you are part of the Hilton chain doesnt mean jack these days, your competition is fierce and truthfully i have stayed in much better hotels for less and had free wifi, complimenary snacks etc. Sorry i forgot about the free complimentary hot cookie on arrival. Not sure what that was for but im sure someone at senior management thinks its cool and trendy? The last time we stayed at your hotel was when it was being renovated and it wasnt great then. We only came back due to you being the only hotel in the area we needed to be in with a pool, and even that looks like it could be doing with a freshen up. I think you are still dining out on the glory days of the old "Dunblane Hydro" but sadly your compettitors have surpassed what you offer. Remember this is only my opinion so good luck in the future but i doubt i will be back.   To sum up, if you want a hot cookie, big thumbs up, If you want to have your wallet looted for wifi and snaks in the room, give it a miss.

Very helpful, professional staff. Immaculately clean,modern Hotel. Free Wi-fi very useful.
Nowhere to sit outside.

These apartments are just on the edge of the village of Skala in a quiet residential area only 5 minute stroll to the main street and 10 minutes to the beach.  There is an off road parking area for the apartments which is really useful if you hire a car.  The apartments are serviced daily by the cleaning staff and the bed linen and towels changed twice weekly.  If you need any help the owner is on site in the evenings or you can contact her by phone and she comes immediately. You can pick a lemon from the trees in the parking area for your evening G
Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed.
No lift to upper floor and no air conditioning(climate control) in room!
Its is nice, lots of swimmingpools. The beds are not so good.
The apartment in Fuham was clean, spacious and good location if you were actually looking to be in the west London area, not so good when you book to stay in East London

Terrible experience with Hotelopia, extremely disappointing weekend due to your errors.      We booked to stay at GoNativeStratford East on 29th June for one night. Upon arriving at the hotel at 2.30pm we were told that we were unable to check in until 3pm but we could leave our bags at reception. We explained that we had a busy schedule and were unlikely to be returning to the hotel until 10pm.      When arriving back at the hotel at 10pm we are asked to produce our booking confirmation which we did. We noticed that our bags were left in exactly the same place in the lobby area, when they invited us to leave our bags there we (stupidly) assumed that they would be kept in a locked room or at the very least behind the reception area. The hotel receptionist simply said there is no booking in your name, we have no rooms available and you will have to take it up with Hotelopia! We waited over an hour for the hotel to admit that they had a responsibility to find us a room somewhere. The solution was a room in Fulham, West London!! The taxi journey was over an hour.   Not once did the hotel offer an apology or show any sign of empathy with our predicament. We finally got to west London at 1.30am.      We drove to GoNativeStratford East and parked near by, because I had a couple of glasses of wine with my evening meal I was unable to drive that evening to the new offered apartment in Fulham. So we were now in West London, the complete opposite side of London to where are trip was centred around (Olympic Village) It took a taxi and two trains to get back to East London the next morning, all of which I had to pay for.     Complete shambles from start to finish, very stressful and expensive
Very good breakfast, although overbooked and crowded.

KEYSTONE KOPS vs FAWLTY TOWERS !!!!  1. Had to complain about semi comatose drunken guest's antics outside our room at 1.30 a.m. then desk staff kindly called us back at 2.00 a.m. to inform us all was well, the drunks were just having trouble with their room key!!!  2. Severe problems understanding and getting the staff to understand us due to their poor command of the English language.  3. Overpriced and quite shabby overall but I suppose we were paying for the seafront location.

The staff, especially the reception staff were wonderful. I became ill while at the hotel and needed to see a doctor.  The lovely lady at reception found me a wonderful doctor close by, there was a taxi waiting and within a couple of I was back enjoying my holiday.
The stairs are a  bit steep and I think I would have preferred the bed up stairs.

This hotel boasts excellent value for money and totally suitable for those holidaying to see the place, rather than to spent the time in their hotel and room. It is therefore very good for backpackers, couples and individuals and maybe groups, depending on the situation.

It is definitely not surgically clean but that does not mean it is dirty, just not spotless. Not so great for Families, since there are very few relaxation areas (e.g. no pool) where you can keep the kids in check. Warning: you need to climb the equivalent of 2-3 floors of steps to reach it.
They cleaned the rooms everyday.
I paid for brakefast but had to go to another hotel to eat. The rooms are old. My wife got biten by some insect and we had to rush her to hospital.
Great hotel and staff
Too noisy from the bar. Design flaw with the hotel that the open areas either side of the stairwells allows noise from the first floor bar to filter up to the bedrooms. Pity!
Good quality for money very helpful staff

We only stay in the hotel 1 night but could not fault the staff who were very pleasant and friendly and our room was spacious and clean.  Great location.  We have stayed at this hotel before and would not hesitate to stay again and recommend to friends.

Beautiful hotel on a wonderful island, 5-10 min drive from the citycentre.  Nice, clean room and bathroom. 2 enormous infinity pools overlooking the Nile, 1 relax pool.  Beautiful big well maintained garden with exotic plants and flours. Friendly staff, good food... Relax and enjoy!!!
Location was very good, close to town
Only one member of staff was not very pleasant but she was only there for one morning breakfast. She really needed some people skills.

We had a fantastic time.  Ignore the negative comments about the hotel, the hotel is old and charming, refurbishing it you could lose its charm.  The breakfast was fantastic and no problem asking fore gluten free.
room was small  Bathroom sink was in need of replacing (was all cracked and peeling)
The guests I encountered were all pleasant. Some of the staff were friendly.
The window ledge next to the bed was dusty and dirty. The hand drier in the toilet was weak and kept going off. The light was left on in the dorm for much of the night.
room view and beach
Good location and good quality facilities. Nice room

We were very pleased with the level of cleanliness and the facilities at the hotel (Madeira theme night in the restaurant, billiard tables, table tennis, racketball court). Breakfast, both the food and service, was excellent.  Stunning views of the ocean.  Loved the large size of the rooms, and appreciated that the hotel staff honored our request for adjoining rooms.

Unfortunately, we have to report that on one of the days between June 25 and June 27, a cell phone, that was my father's work device, which was located in the inside pocket of his travel bag, was stolen from our room.  The only other valuables left in the room/that bag were passports, as we had carried all the currency with us.  We believe that the phone must have been taken during the short time we were at breakfast, because we would generally lock the bag in our suitcase when we leave for the day.  There was no other items of value left in the room.  We noticed the phone was missing only when we got to our final destination as the phone was switched off and not used for the entire duration of the trip.  While we do not expect that you will be able to locate the cellphone, we felt it prudent to report this incident to you so that you are aware of it and can take appropriate action, particularly if multiple complaints of this nature have been received in the same wing of the hotel.
Did not honor "Breakfast included" in our voucher but gave us coupon for the first day. HOTELOPIA should update their hotel descriptions.
There is nothing positive about this hotel very amateur and unprofessional staff
We were told that we had no reservation and that they were fully booked. This is a scam as money was taken from visa. Be aware and don't book here as you will ruin your precious vacation time!!!!

As above - really upset and dissapointed at the poor booking sertice we had and the poor apology which didnt even address the fact we had to try and find another hotel at such short notice which ruined our lovely day or the extra money we had to pay for this hotel ( we had no options)which was another 20 minutes away.  Would not recommend your service again due to the poor customer service in thinking another hotel was avaiable or the high price we had to pay.
Good location and not bad food (especially the desserts)

We booked this hotel, but we lived in Club Dena. Staff hotel Irmak moved us to Club Dena in first day without any conversation. After few days we understood that we were in love with Club Dena, stuff and people who lived there. Club Dena has a large swiming pool and spacious grounds. Irmak is very tight and people don't have enough space.     When it was only two days befor our leaving from Marmaris, girl from reception Irmak told us to move from Club Dena to Irmak. We explained what we don't want to move any there and just want her to leave us. After that all stuff from Irmak insisted that we have to move. We had very bad conversations that you don't want to have in your vacation. Finally we won, but now we can't recommed this hotel for anybody.

The staff was amazing.  From the valet to clerks.  Davon was the bellman and helped us so much and always with a smile. I loved the fact that it had a nice seating area as you walked into the hotel.  There was a nice with a bar towards the back of the reception area which catches your eye as soon as you walk in.  That tells me "welcome, have a drink and relax".  And we did, in the nice comfortable chairs., restaurant and coffee bar.  Very accommodating.

The air conditioning, or lack thereof, was terrible.  There was a little vent close to the ceiling and a small vent in bathroom.  It was not blowing out cool air at all.  It was as if it were on "fan".  It had two settings, low and high and no matter which button you pushed it stayed the same.  Unless, of course, you hit the "off" button.
I have filed a complaint as i didn't get to stay at the hotel booked, and the hotel i was moved to was dreadful.
Everything.
Firendly staff and polite at all times, clean room

On arrival took some time to find my booking on the system , also i changed my mind about the breakfast and requested this at the reception but went down in the morning i found out that that this should have been paid for and given a voucher. and was told i was going to have to pay £10 for breakfast which i found expensive to say the least as my name wasnt down on the list.
Great value for money and rooms cleaned every day.
Very clean and nice hotel...
Thank you very much for  a lot of pleasure in Laguna Mitsis Resort and SPA .Unbelievable time for me and my friend in the end of June!Fine service  in the hotel.
Its a nice stay,only need metioned that hot water noly warm even cold
The Enzo restaurant was nice, the meals were excellent.

The staff in this hotel were rude and obnoxious, the room was dirty with cigarette burns in the carpet and curtains. The window would not close so it was noisy all night (there's a mini motorway in front of the hotel), and the whole hotel is in need of refurbishment and renovation. For the price you pay here, you can get a much nicer place in Amman, and that's a guarantee. This Hotel, Le Meridien, Amman, is NOT recommended. Stay elsewhere.

Nice rooms, with a good view over central Amman, with good central heating and a great shower. The beds were comfortable, and the staff very helpful. And free WiFi.  The food was nice, but a bit pricey.
The pillows were very flat!  The buffet dinner is expensive for what you get.
The location is very good, only 2 minutes from the beach.  Everything are excellent!!!

we booked 3 rooms in agroup booking when we arrived 2 rooms were close to eachother the 3rd room was on the floor below which wasn't acceptable for a group booking. We were also not advised when we booked or on the confirmation that £100 bond needs to be paid per room which resulted in £300 we needed to pay on arrival for our booking. The car park was also chargeable £10.00 for 24 hours and we had 2 cars, these should all be displayed clearly when making a booking!
The hotel was just O.K. not my cup of tea. The price per room vs quality is a disconnect in other words I believe the price per room is to expensive for a two star hotel.
Spacious and clean everywhere.  Rooms are particularly comfortable with top quality linen.  Power shower is awesome!
It looked nice in the pictures.
Very pleasant and helpfull staff. Rooms were very clean. There was nice, welcoming atmosphere in the hotel. Very nice view on the old town. Food was delicious - I´ve never eaten such tasty bacon :)
Best hotel I have ever been on! The staff is great and the rooms are beautiful. If you ever need help, the staff will always help you.
Have a very large swimming pool and located to Sungai Petani town. Has a hyper market nearby and looking for food is not a problem.
Room are very old and soundproofing is very poor. Noise can come in from the front door and room next door.
Clean and nice hotel with a nice pool. The service was good and the staff was very friendly. Dinner was healthy and with a good variaty every day.
The waiters could not speak any english wich made it hard to communicate. Poor information about what "halfboard" really included. The wifi did not work at all in our room.
Staff reacted positively and to my satisfaction to an issue I had to raise.

Location is brilliant and staff is super friendly. Rooms are a bit dated but in perfectly acceptable condition (clean and well maintained). The choice of breakfast is quite limited but things that are available are excellent.
The only thing I found a little bit annoying was the airconditioning which was super loud and couldn't be switched off (at least I couldn't do it). It's not that hot in London ... switch it off!
Had everything you need in room - air con, hair dryer, iron and board
Cooked breakfast not that great as scrambled eggs were almost white and didnt taste of much and no mushrooms
Friendly staff, central location and I would recommend to family and friends
Nice and friendly staff, great room. Really just a nice quality hotel.

First room we was given had a smell of curry. We asked to be moved and we was given another room straight away. We had i repeat had to pay £5 to park over night. You don't usually expect to have to pay in a hotel car park.
Apartments are spacious and excellent value for money, with great views over Little Lake Bryan or the Downtown Disney area from the upper floors. Large swimming pool.
Breakfast, surrounding area
The room was very nice and clean.   Nice view to the sea outside the window.   Bed was comfort.   Quality furniture.

Ancient CRT TV (with analog reception?)  Few parking spots!  Poor noise isolation, when the cleaning stuff was doing the rooms next door you could hear what they was talking about.  There is no concrete covering part of the path you cross when turning from the road to enter hotel's parking, so the car goes through unnecessary bumps and furthermore this caused a lot of dust in the air, especially in windy days.
Unfriendly front staff and a bit dirty room.

Once we were check-in, a staff sent us to the wrong room (212) but actually they set room 214 for us !!!  Then we had have to move from 212 to 214.  Once again, when we entered to room 214. We found that there had damped smell around the room and the floor was a bit dirty.  We asked to move, finally we moved to room 313. This room no had damped smell but again the floor was a bit dirty!!!

Could improve breakfast for Vegetarians, which most people do for both health , religious etc. Have to keep up as food is big ticket in Malaysia. Why not think out of the box, if there is a cost issue, like offering a la carte or pre order
Staff very Helpful and warm welcome
Room service not listening as it should be, they made several errors (food sent to an incorrect room, not the right food asked for etc ...)

We were denied access to the transit hotel as an onward boarding pass was not available to us until the morning. We were not made aware of the requirement to have such a document. I presumeded that access to the transit hotel  would be available after clearing customs and immigration. We were accommodated at the Protea Airport Hotel which is what I thought I had booked, at extra charge. Not happy.
Friendly staff and excellent facilities. Right near the town centre

Disappointed at the cost of a single room. I can understand the cost being higher for single occupency for a double room but my room was a single room with a single bed so would have thought the cost would be half a double room.
Great location and ocean views.. will Definately be coming back next time we are in Oahu! Highly recommended!

Hotel was situated very nicely for sightseeing, although some taxi fares varied.    The Hotel staff were very nice, and did everything possible to make our stay as comfortable as possible.    Breakfast was lovely, so was afternoon Tea.
Rooms could have done with freshening up,  but very clean.

The hotel was so great, staff was very friendly. On  breakfast we had a different dishes and snacks. Next positive reviews is that the hotel was so nearly to beach. If somebody want spend cheap holiday I recommend this hotel.

Awesome location! we used the MRT regularly. Staff work hard and are attentive. The rooms were beautiful, with finishing touches well thought out. Food at kitchen was amazing. Selection like you wouldn't believe.

Sound travelled! The rooms are clearly not insulated as we could hear the phone ringing next door......clearly! We also had neighbors who consistently came home in the early hours of the morning and had complete disregard to those trying to sleep. Noise just travelled up and down the corridor  to much considering what you pay per night. The lack of and the interrupted sleep definitely impacted on the quality of our stay there. I feel they need to have a strict noise policy in place and make all guests aware that noise is a problem. I think this policy should be regularly policed by staff making routine checks. Surely when a bunch of drunk men come in, they see this when they walk past reception?
good location. nice pools. good sized apartments. 24 hour reception. friendly, helpful staff.
some apartments are reached by steps only.  not enough sun parasols for shade around pool area, especially as there were no sunbeds and parasols on beach.
So friendly , great location and so relaxing been 3 years now and will hopefully go again soon , lovely owner and staff x
Could do with music near pool , Turkish of course
Staff very friendly and helpfull
No lift to upper floors
Very nice staff, excellent breakfast and beautifull views.

Beautiful gardens, beautiful bedrooms, pleasant and helpful staff. Very good food, always presented with thick starched white linen and beautiful cutlery. Excellent gym. Lovely ambience. A hotel to suit all purposes.
Breakfast is good but there is no variation on the breakfast buffet from day to day ( we stayed 12 nights).
Close proximity to beach - fantastic friendly staff - rooms very clean.  Would stay here again
Rooms are basic - but when you are staying at beach location you don't require state of the art luxury - just cleanliness and good air con which La Niña has.
Staff, breakfast and local
Old rooms and kitchen
good servces and facility , clean room
The reception staff were very friendly and helpful with information when asked
No coffee and tea making facilities in our room.

Good clean facilities and pleasant, efficient and helpful staff. Good secure car parking. Can't comment on quality of food because we ate at other restaurants.  Good central location with easy access to visitor attractions.

Dear All at the Hotel Mc aranciaHotel,  We would all like to say a BIG thank you to all for such an enjoyable stay at your hotel. All of you made us so welcome and were kind and helpful.  A special thank you to Animation LEVENT, who gave us some fantastic information about ALANYA places to go out of the city - that was fantastic.  We will certainly be recommending your hotel to our friends and hope that we can return some time.  Many thanks again  Salih ATIK
Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Hotel was very clean and in an excellent state of repair
Breakfast was a bit of a free for all and the quality wasn't brilliant, but it was included in a very reasonable room rate so hard to be too critical

The outstanding person in the line of duty is Ms Gitte Aterskov who made sure we were happy with our change of room and other inquiries. Whilst other front of house were either disinterested or just more concerned about their appearance then doing their job. The only positive is the central location of the hotel!

The hotel does not rate a 4 star rating, the first room given had a skylight that cannot be covered right above the bed (room 333?) and we had to change to another room the next day.  Changed to room 425? which faced the Main Street and it was very noisy from early evening to late because of a dance club and youth hostel on either side of the hotel.  Anyone who is a light sleeper or need peace and quiet should avoid this place, even a 3 star rating will be kind on my part!

1. the room key no function and have to came down twice only managed to check in. it was due to the staff key in wrong room number. funny.    2. Internet wiring problem and recommend to use wireless but very slow.    3. Check out ask to make payment again even being told alredy paid online.Lucky one senior staff came to solve the problem.    4. The key to scan out of function when wanted to left the parking gate. Lucky with the help of security only managed to went out from the hotel.

There was a complete and utter confusion about the time of our arrival at the hotel because we were forced to delay due to unexpected circumstances. In other words they didn't want to wait for us after 23:00 a.m. because there were no receptionist at that time!
Best view,strategoc location to city centre and within walking distance.it is easy to find this hotel for a new comer.
Very nice place, but the hotel is very old and it needs renovation

I have stayed in Prescott on 15 to 17 June and returned on 26 June 2013.  I am very impressed with the professionalism and hospitality of the hotel.  On the first two nights, I was upgraded to a suite although I booked through a third party website and was offered free breakfast.  Miss Melissa, the front desk manager was very helpful and pleasant.  I felt so welcome after a 19 hour flight.  Thank you Hotelopia for giving me the hotel comfirmation number and I have no problem checking in.
The location is outstanding.. very close to the beach and the center of Magaluf.. clean apartment with almost all the appliances needed.
One receptionist in the afternoon shift was super impolite with us but I take it as a individual act that does not represent the hotel.

Location of the hotel is very convenient. Bus stops right at the corner and is 2 stops to central Reykjavik, or walking its about 15 min. Breakfast was good (not spectacular but edible). We had a triple room that had a view of the mountains and water, very nice. Heavy duty curtains for nights when the sun doesn't actually set. Staff was friendly and helpful. There is a luggage storage available if you are checking in early or checking out before you actually need to leave.

Paid internet. No ventilation in the bathroom so it gets a bit stuffy, and the windows only open so much. From what I noticed there is heating for the winter but we were there in summer and didn't need it. Didn't do the most spectacular job cleaning our room as all that was really done was a making of the bed. Otherwise, definitely worth the price we paid for it.
Very clean,spacious apartment within an exellent neigborhood.Nice and calm,the owners stayed there,too.
all excellently
no the Negative coments

Food was very good. The size of our room(villa) was really ok. My SPA visit was very nice and they had ok prices. You could take your dinner and drinks to your room if you wanted. The area was Clean and nice.

Beachtowels for rent was really bad and you could only change thoose on mondays, wednesdays and fridays. Russian visitors all over the Place. And they really dont know how to behave and stand in a line. Loud Music during dinner every night. Our visit at the Italian restaurant wasn´t what we expected. You couldn´t choose at all what you would like to eat. And no one told us what we could expect getting of food. Although the food was really tasty and good.  Life guard at the pool was sleeping several times so dont put your Children alone.  Staff was really bad in speaking English, we did manage but I Think that you can expact staff to speak and understand English.
Good service overall
Newly built bad views around the building
The food was great and also the staff serving us drinks ! House keeping (cleaning of room) good. Also very clean outside and inside all facilities (beach, poolarea restaurant etc). Friendly staff.
To many non English speaking people. Aircondition in the room did not work as good as we would expect but we never reported it since it was good enough.

This is a very stylish hotel which also has a lot of substance. The staff were extremely helpful and professional. Our room was comfortable and was pretty quiet, so we could sleep well. Breakfast was excellent, as one would expect in Germany, and the dinner we had on our last night was also of very good quality. I would recommend the hotel fully.
Great location within walking distance of clubs and Bora Bora beach.
Location was really good, easy accessibility to the beach and amenitites. The grounds of the hotel were really nice and peaceful and the pool was very good. Breakfast choice was also excellent.

Not good value for money, the rooms were overpriced for the size given.     In general, the staff were not very accomodating, helpful or friendly when dealing with extra requests. We have a 4 month old baby and had issues around the high chair at the restaurant and towels at the pool.
The 3 th beth was not a normal bed, but it was OK.  The airlink bus to the airport is very close to the hotel and also the bus to the centre. There are some restaurants and shops very nearby.

Not negative, but clients have to know walking to the centre is aprox. 10 - 15 minutes walk, but you can also take the bus to the centre.  It would be nice if you could also order eggs in the hotel for breakfast, this was not possible even if you wanted to pay for it.
Near to the beach
Terrible breakfast. And it wasn't the lack of things, quite the opposite. But I couldn't eat a thing but the toasts.
staff freindly and helpfull

the bar near the pool was not open and you had to walk to the main bar to get any drinks in the daytime.  selection of food was really poor and so we did not use the all inclusive facilities that we paid for as the food was appalling

never ever recommend no one to stay at this tortured place of hotel Guest  specificaly if young polite highly educated  girl ,, Recptionist ,tourtered Guests at one oclock after midnight  shouting  in face of tired young daughter I paid fully in advance  on line ,,,,hotel already got the confirmation ...,,her only sin got no printed voucher in hand Receptionist ,promising to call police,, disconnected  the lift and enforce young girl of 22 years to jump 3 floors after long driving trip of 8 hours ,,to enforce her to come back to reception to copy her ID ,,disconnect paid internet ,,checkin takes 35 minutes of pure disgusting face ,,,,,,sauvage sauvage and only Sauvage ,,,,please never ever advice any young girl to live at this hotel ,,,sadism  of treatment of Recepcionist is realy just painfulllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll and unhuman and Disgusting

We ordered 1 double room, when we arrived we received 1 single room with 2 extra beds, when we absolutly not could accept this we got a little bigger ingle room with 4 regular beds, but this wasn't stil not a double room.  The hotel claimed that they didn't have double rooms?!?!?   Also it was  to clear that they had split people up in "classes" - how have paid most .. This is a bad signal to sent the gusts.   When this said we had a nice vacation, but next time we will make sure when we order 1 double room we will have a double room (2 rooms in one) .  Please comment on this !   Thanks Marianne - juulp@youmail.dk
Good location with it being only a couple of minutes walk from East Croydon station
Disappointed that there was no room safe considering it is a four star hotel. Also the tv channels  would benefit from having Sky Sports news as a minimum.
Very comfortable beds and pillows, on bus route for exploring East London, City and beyond
Basic room but if all u want is a bed for the night and shower in the morning then it's perfect for that. Breakfast was very basic.....
Reception staff were patient and accomodating. Piers in particular has an air of diplomacy.

That your buisness is not your own. I found this part ofTurkey to be an especially gossipy location. The hotel is far enough to escape the busy beach and club scene. But, near enough to get home safely after a good nite out.
You can smell the bleach this hotel is so clean,  great large pool area and lots of activities for the kids. Food fantastic and caters for all tastes.
Swimming pool is deep, there is a kids ankle splash pool, but main pool has no shallow end
hotel is the best !!!!
The hotel and staff were excellent. Towels and bed linen were changed regularly.  Located centrally in the resort. Had a lovely holiday. Would recommend.
Good service,nice room and location...
Pool closed too early....

Poor service - no hot water for 2 days in the middle of winter!!!! Management were not very interested in rectifying the problem.  We were asked to go shower in another room.  Walking down cold corridors in the middle of winter in our pajamas - certainly not my idea of friendly hospitality!    Parking in the building was terrible     I will never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anybody!  It makes a mockery of the great people it is named after.
Near of the beach  Near of Ocean Drive
We really loved our visit in Amazones Village. It is beautiful, quite and lovely. A wonderful place, with a family atmosphere. We will come back and take  friends with us. Thanks!
The bed is too hard.
lovely from start to finish
Central to all touristsights and old city.
Staff friendly, great next to the beach, clean and well looked after.. Great holiday
Very nice hotel, in a great central location
Kind staff,  restaurant is excellent. The maid was very polite.
The desserts need some improvment, and anyway was not to our taste.
Perfectly situated in a quiet location but close to the West End and Euston station, so perfect for us.
Best place and very good rooms   then ramada 5 star hotel
It was wonderful stay with my boyfriends, food was nice abs weather was nice even during raining season.   We enjoyed amazing pool which access from my room directly.

We felt some different service between Europian guests and Asian guests.  Also we requested private and privacy room, but next our rooms are Chinese family who have small kids between our room and they were talking so loud since morning.  The kids were running in front of our room and swimming always, also however there was no ash tray, we requested smoking room when we made booking.

A pleasantly appointed room in an ideal location. Wonderful, helpful and friendly employees from reception, to the cleaning staff and restaurant staff. There were many functions on whilst we stayed and everyone from business, tour groups, weddings and families we spoke were extremely happy with this hotel. Even though my parents are from Kalamata and we have plenty of family and friends to stay with, I would chose Pharae every time.

Well where do I start.... NO HOT WATER, girl at the reception evening/night very apologetic and good manored, girl in the morning...... No comment. After I let her know that there was not hot water in the morning as well the only thing she said was a plain "yes". When I asked for some compensation again a plain "no" was the answer.  I did not had time to ask for the manager as I had a boat to catch from Le Havre but it was a very disappointing experience. NEVER AGAIN in this hotel
Amazing the staff the room the whole experience
No salsa music or dancing in the hotel at night.Problems with the shower, air conditioning and tv.
Nice hotel. People at the reception were pleasant and professional. Nice pool and great location.

The room was nice but the shared bathroom was only accessible from one side ,which meant the third person had to enter the other bedroom tom access it.  The evening dinner menu was very limited.  The person at the door of the breakfast room made us wait outside even though there were free tables inside.This is very controlling and unwelcoming behavior. It is totally unnecessary.  Several times , my Cuban mother-in -law as questioned at the lift if she was a client of the hotel.This is RACISM and I do not accept. Either question everybody or nobody ,or if it's that much of a problem, make every guest wear a wristband.  We were also questioned one evening at dinner if that was included in our booking. I think this could easily have been clarified at reception without embarrassing us.
housekeeping service not good. called twice to get extra pillow, but waited 1 1/2 hour also never came

Young lady on reception on our arrival was lovely and very helpful (no name tag so cannot indentify her). Brought ice to the room, explaned how to connect to the internet via Ipad etc etc.    Had a meal in the Bistro which was excellent quality and very good value for money. Staff very good and reasonably price wine list    The Tweed Room (used for breakfast and optionally for dinner) was very well appointed with lovely views.    Would definitely stay again but maybe for more than one night to fully appreciate the facilities, grounds and general location    Would definitley stay again but maybe for more than one night to fully appreciate the facilites, grounds and general location.    The hotel was warm, which is a major consideration for us.

Breakfast was not quite as good as the evening meal. I had the full cooked breakfast, fried eggs were undercooked which is a pet hate of mine. Haggis obviously had been in a warmer for some time as the outside was crusty (middle fine). Coffee was very good.     Choice of breakfast though very good.

I found the staff in the dining room quite unfriendly in fact I did not observe them to acknowledge or speak to the many customers that spoke to them on the  in and out of restaurant.   The reception staff seemed more interested in cashing up rather than attending to clients.

The front desk was especially friendly and helpful with finding our  around Washington DC. They were always checking with us when we entered or left. How was our trip, could they do anything for us.  Hey did you know this is happending in the city. Etc.
The hotel is beautiful. The room was clean and comfortable.

Check in was to be at 3pm. The yankees were in town and the hotel was booked. There were 100's of guests in the lobby waiting for their rooms. We waited until 4:30 for our room to be available. This made it difficult to make dinner before the game.
Excellent choice... Love the location
Wifi is only in public area.
Please reorient you front desks staff especially with the policy of your hotel.
Strategic location very close to Finance Centre metro station and one stop from Dubai mall. Decent breakfast.
Mostly patronized by Arab and middle Eastern clients. Hotel needs to be refurbished with a multicusine restaurant.
The reception by staff was exceptional
Front staff willingly to help!
No european power outlets in the room or hotel
Beautiful site-everything seemed professional and effective-great breakfast and a very friendly staff,who would do anything for you.I would look forward to coming back
Peerless Hotel with near perfect service and staff, couldn't fault it at all - wouldn't want to.
Excellent and very spacious rooms. Good breakfast.
Not the best beach in Crete (always windy and causing waves). Too crowded on the beach and children screaming.
the hotel not talk us that the parking cost and we pay a lot , the hotel not in the centrom ,
Very relaxing well organised 5 star hotel, will deffinately be our first choice for Estoril / caiscais. Breakfast is amazing, very good selection of food.
We booked standard triple room through Hotelopia but we got twin room with small camp bed. We were expecting a normal extra bed and hoping for a bigger room.
That there happened on calle de tablada de españa
The receptionist was extremely kind and helpful
The staff are really nice and friendly and do their best to be attentive and caring.
Location and service was excellent, highly recommend. Good value for money, 4 stops by metro to The Mall of Dubai and on a Airport line.
Excellent views. Great pool. Great location just 3mins from the beach. Most guided tours pick u up from front door.

This is a German hotel which isn't stated when booking. All the entertainment is German, the staff speak to u in German, if the menu has special options its usually German food.   The rooms are small for the price and the beds are sofa beds. I expected a lot more for the price.   More 3* in my opinion.
I have been staying in the hotel a few times and I was really surprised this time with the improvement done since last my visit.
Very friendly staff made you feel very welcome at all times, anything you need they will try and accommodate to make your stay easy
Amazing facilities and amazing location - very near to praia de mos.
Situated near the beach.rooms are located on the courtyard.opposite the royal garden for.Very tasty breakfast.
A woman who works on reception is unkind.
Very good and not expensive at all!! I went there with friends and i really recommand this hotel because it's good situated: between the beatch and the bar street!!
Welcoming owners  Good breakfast  Easy to find  Very clean (rooms were cleaned daily)
Showers were not very practical  Not as easy to access by walking at night (as said on the descriptionprovided)
Amazing location, very nice atmosphere.
Rooms could be better. Price was ok. Decent hotel for the price.
Outdoor pool closed even though not raining  Waitress in restaurant not very helpful, unsure of what she was doin
Location was great

Room size was sufficient but duvet was thin and TORN. Pillow was ripped at the zip and fastened together with a safety pin!   Was disappointing.    No one checked if we paid for breakfast. Those who didn't could just enter and eat for free. Food was always running out and choices was just sufficient.

Enjoyed my stay. Breakfasts were very good and well presented with a good selection of foods.   Hotel reception excellent as was the friendliness of all staff particularly the staff servicing the rooms.  Excellent views from the terrace and pool area.
It is little bit far from the center, 15 min walk, but it can be done on foot well connected to airport by train 1 minute t station walking.
Places are clean and tidy.  Staff are polite and very helpful to the visitors.  Price is reasonable.
Should inrease the varieties of food in the breakfast.
Nice place, good beach and sea.
Food is not very good. Especially the deserts. Leftovers from a day before.
Great sunset view, good beach, very good kitchen, food is superb! And last but not least. Animation is fantastic! Aspecially the two sisters Yildiz and Hatice..
Rooms are very small and not clean at all. The housekeeping is very bad.
Very comfortable, excellent food and friendly staff.

It is ok for what you pay, needs refurbishing particulately as its placed near Disney and the concierge was extremely helpful. Reception staff are a little slow at times but I understand it was busy at time we were there.
Clean hotel with good central location
Room service - The meal i asked for came incomplete, the person who brought it up acknowledged the error but never came back to rectify it, very disappointed with the service.
Its an OK hotel for the price.

I rested at the hotel with her two daughters 16 and 13 years old. we loved the hotel. My children and I are very happy. warm, intimate atmosphere in the hotel. big thanks to the guys from the animation Natalia, Enes, Tanya, Clements. the next year we will come only in this hotel :).
Access from car park poor especially in the rain  Small double bed   Noise from traffic - main road outside and windows were old and not very sound proof
Near to everything. beach ,nightlife, public transport, shoppingcentre, local bars.  it was a gayresort, but it was a very positive, nothing about " see mee and  ? "
Hotel is very centrally located on the board walk and has direct access to the Pier.

Relatively unfriendly staff . Long lead time for room service and no variety for food options . We had booked an ocean view premium room by paying extra . But we were told that it is not available . Eventually we got one with a partial ocean view on a lower floor with dirty windows. The hotel corridor had torn off wall paper at several places that left a bad taste . Long ques for checkout . Overall a very dissapointing and unsatisfactory service . Not recommended at all!!
Horrible plastic laminate is not welcoming and beds slide around on this surface
Room very clean and peaceful.  Slept well
Breakfast experince very poor  Had to wait for a table  Had to ask for tea cups
Very dirty all over. Tooo long queue at breakfast.
Staff was very frindly and helpfull and the location of hotel is very good
Ther was no luandry servise. The gest must do it his self and it  takes time
it's a very nice resort for family gather and chillout.
staff of the front desk seems not really willing to help but the rest of the staff and even the boss of the resort are very friendly and nice.
perfectly situated,really a heaven of confort,good food,kind service what do you need more ?
Excellent hotel, great location.

The staff were lovely as they are all over Cuba, the hotel is situated in the back streets in the Old Town of Havana, and on arrival looks like something out of Beirut!! However when you go through the front door it is AMAZING, so historic and beautifully decorated, taking you really back in time. We felt completely safe at all times throughout our stay in Havana and a great place to mix with the local people in the local bars and restaurants... Fantastic stay, Thank you Hotel Raquel Boutique

Excellent hotel in Great location.  Lovely rooms with excellent service.  Staff at reception were the most helpful we have met.  Helped uswith getting  to beach. Places to eat. Help with further travel.  An outstanding hotel

Just the first Hotel where I have been, everything was so perfect :). Especially cleanness    Even they clean my lap top out side just the top there was some fingerprints :). Really thoughtful from cleaner. Such a small thing can make customer happy ^_^.     So thanks again for everything!!
It was relatively cheaper compared to other hotels, but that was on the expenses of other negative things (please see negatives).

It was stated on the website that it has (free Turkish bath and free wifii)-none of these are true. The Turkish bath is NOT free and when I asked them what its said on the website they said  (to go and lie to relax in the heated room is free, but to use water, message, peeling ...etc is chargable) and the price was much more than other places. We had 2 iphones and laptop-we could not connect to wiffi and the staff were not very helpful with this, they told us (the wiffi in the hotel is not compatible with UK IT system. I was not convinced about their explanation. I had to go and use other internet café in the town. The food, breakfast was realy bad,the only good thing was there was boiled egg. It was exactly the same every morning. Luch was made from whatever it was left from previous days. THe dinner was good and there was a variety of salads. When we booked, it stated that we had a good deal for British Citizens. We met some Russien people and we found out that whet they paid was significantly less than what we had paid. The other point was it was all russien and few polish. There were daily shows for children, they were disgusting and ridiculous-It was the worst holiday experience we have seen and I do not want any other British People to trap in this hotel, like we did.

Lovely hotel, in a quiet location on the water's edge.  Don't expect loads of nightlife as it doesn't happen around this hotel.  But then that is only a short taxi journey away.  Staff are very friendly.  Rooms are very clean.  I would definitely recommend it.
Food is expensive within the hotel.  But there are plenty of other places to eat not too far away.

Arrived at 2100 to be told the hotel was overbooked and had to drive 10 miles to find another hotel  Neither the hotel or booking site contacted me to offer an alternative  Would not use either in the future.
The Staff were friendly and helpful and in difficult circumstances tried to make the stay enjoyable.

The fact that the head waiter and manager left just after i arrived did not help and although the rooms were adequate my room was cleaned once in the week and my friends was not done at all which is not very good . The food for breakfast was fine but the half board option was extremely limited with little or no options so if you did not like curry you were stuck !
Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean with plenty of room.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to philidelphia.

Dirty room.   Small bathroom.   No warm water, only during some parts of the day.  Low quality of breakfast.  Slippery floor.  Only 7 TV channels (CNN, RAI 3 plus Greek channels).  Noisy environment.  Towels with holes.
Very beautiful hotel. Nice facilities. Beautiful sea view.
Transportation is not convenient
Very central and closed to Time Square!
High sound from A/C. Interior from the 80´s. No refrigerator in the room.
relatively easy to find. very clean and tidy room, nice lounge, very comfy bed, good tea and coffee facilities, old fashioned but nice,

noisy corridor where people slammed the doors a couple of times, and could hear people talking as they walked to their rooms, could also hear the TV in the next room. Parking is a bit of a problem, but once we had a parking space this was ok (it was unclear where we could park the car, no signs clear enough to show us where we could park. The chap was on reception, European chap not very chatty to the point with check-in
Friendly and helpful reception staff  Good location
freindly staff and very clean rooms

The hotel is centrally located, easy to walk into the Old Town, plus on the promenade.    Majority of staff are very friendly, pool area is very good and plenty of sunbeds for all  Buffet breakfast very good, with an excellent selection.  Also dinner buffet was very good value for money  Very

The first impression was not too good as the reception staff did not seem particularly friendly, helpful or welcoming at check in.   Fortunately this attitude was not universal and the majority of staff were helpful and pleasant
Very good location for the price in the busy season, quiet and friendly.
ideal location to get into London as well as Wembley too. Transport links are great.
Nice terrace, with view on the surroundings, where at dark with à lamp game is attracted.

Excellent gym, pool, front office staff helpful, doorman and luggage porters very helpful however housekeeping slow and not thorough only left one towel after housekeeping, did not replenish tea bags however on request to housekeeping problems were rectified promptly.
Service excellent  Help at hand by IT to fix problem with IPad   The Traders Club  Location very convenient  Being a Traders Club member is value for money

Plenty of good beer! On the whole friendly staff. Food that is not of restaurant quality but is certainly not bad either – plenty of it and a nice variation. Nice big pool. Some of the rooms (3/4 bed) were of a good size. Good value for money.

Needs just a little TLC - small things could be done to vastly improve the hotel: fix things like the shower holder so the shower actually stays still! Sunbeds slightly uncomfortable and not enough parasols to go round. Pool area could do with the occasional rinse down with a hosepipe (to remove drink stains and bird droppings). More outside seating needed for the evening. Wifi range could be extended – if nothing else at least to the bar area. I am being picky - these are all minor points and did not affect our stay significantly.

-  The bed was quite hard: a thin mattress on a wooden plank  -  There were only a few tea bags and coffee sachets, one sugar and no coffee milk, while we stayed two days with two persons.  -  It was quite difficult to get the key out of the door of the room.
Superb staff and classical feel about the hotel which  lives up to its name "Grand".  Superbly positioned for the main square and attractions.
The chef's omelette is not as we know it.   May be a bit noisy outside at times due to inconsiderate revellers.
The hotel is well located close to the station, supermarket and restaurants arround and just 15 minutes from the city centre.
Reception staff can improve the english language.

Location was excellent. Only 3 minutes walking to the metro station and 1 minute to the city tour bus stop. The hotel was good for what we wanted. Prices were excellent for two people because we paid in dollars to Hotelopia less than $700.00 US for 4 nights and a full breakfast. For two friends going 1/2 and 1/2 ($350.00 US each) it was a real bargain for England were everything is so expensive. (Not in pounds that was so expensive at the time of our trip). , Breakfast was good with fruit, meat, eggs, oatmeal, coffee, te, juices of all kind, and bread. The hotel has also an currency exchange booth, store for souvenirs and basic needs, concierge, bar, and best of all WiFi  FREE of charge as long as you use it at the lobby, which was fine with me. Room service was excellent, we asked for a blanket and in less than 5 minutes some body was there with the blanket.  Same happened with the old fashined TV control that was not working very well, as soon as I reported it, somebody came with a new control that worked very well. If all you want is to be in the center of everything and just go to the hotel to sleep, this is a perfect place for the money.

Hotel seems like a market a certain hours because there are young people coming and going all the time. Personnel is so overworked with so many demands of all these people that sometimes there were not very friendly at the front desk. At the restaurant, they were so many people too and they wanted you to carry your boucher all the time saying the type of breakfast you had paid for, English (full breakfast) or Continental (basic things only). If you wanted to change your mind and change from Continental to English, you had to pay $5.00 extra pounds per day. Twin beds did not have a good mattress but the sheets were changed daily, which made things better. Another thing that bothered me was that our room did not have an airconditioned unit at all. You just have to leave the windows open with the hope that the weather will be nice enough for you to get a nice night rest. The weather in June was OK, thanks God no rain at all, but at night it was a little uncomfortable as we went to bed, later on it got better as it got late.
