very nice, very welcoming
mattresses are very hard

Our stay at Corte dei Greci was great. We arrived very late due to a transportation "issue" but the desk was ready and very accommodating. The room was very large and beautiful. The hotel is on a small side canal but it is very easy to get to and convenient to Piazza San Marco. When we come back to Venice we will definitely stay at Corte dei Greci again.

Lovely staff, great food. The room was perfect with a great view, the bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked perfectly. There was hot water all day and the staff who make up the rooms work around you which suited us perfectly.
Fantastic rooms,friendly staff and excellent facilities. We had a lovely time and it was a perfect location for us. Will definitely come back.

The only negative that I have is with regards to breakfast. We ordered seperate toast on one occasion and beans on another, and both were overlooked. It would be much easier if the order was written down!

Good Parking facilities, out door Pool and seating area, beautiful village near by within 10-15 min with a local bar and lovely church,the hotel is also surrounded by local allotments and vineyards, it really is a pretty area to stay in. There is a retail park close by too, Friendly staff and the evening meal was lovely with the exception of the steak (too chewy) but the rest of the food was nice. Tea and coffee facilities in the room and TV, great air con, double bed was a bit small but very comfortable, Good generous buffet breakfast with good choices. Would definitely recommend

Roadworks on entry of the hotel meant we had to do a diversion around the village, which was ok in the end as we realised it was an ideal area to have a lovely walk. Chinese tourists were a little noisy in the evening and early morning but not too bad. Situated on a main road but our room was at the back, so we were not bothered by noise.

Hotel is lovely, I was disappointed that when I arrived, there was a mix up with my booking, I thought I had  booked two king rooms and one double twin room, but the booking was only for one twin and one double, the receptionist didn't offer any compromise or solution
Food is not good.. Not easy Enrace and exit to hotel as it is crowded with cars
We enjoyed our stay on the beach, the coffeemaker in the gives the extra point, thanks ??
Beautiful hotel in a great location, our large room had a lovely view of the canal.

The hotel is hard to find as Venice isn't great at signposting! Also the staff were friendly but more keen on trying to get us to take a water taxi at €70 than providing useful information on the vaporetto. The breakfast rooms are also not big enough to have all guests seated, and we had guests with plates of food standing in the middle of room waiting for us to vacate our table while we we still eating which wasn't great.
Great location. Very friendly and helpful staff.

We did require one double bed in our room for my wife and I but when we got our room (305) it only had 2 single beds pushed together. This was a little disappointing for my wife and I. Our children shared the other room (308).
We upgraded to take advantage of the amazing views and the extra money was worth every penny. The room was clean and tidy, and the beds very comfortable.

I think the hotel is showing it's age and heritage in the public areas - carpets and wood are feeling very dated. Staff are efficient rather than friendly, and breakfast wasn't great - staff didn't bring my order and the food quality wasn't good enough for a hotel of this grade. Also there were conferences on the whole time we were there, and large groups meeting river cruises so the lobby was always busy and full of luggage.
Pleasant staff, willing to assist and supply helpful information.  Room clean and comfortable, plenty of choice for breakfast. Ideal location to explore the "older" part of Dubai.
perfect room for the price, u had everything! nice kitchen, beautifull balkoney, clean bathroom with even a tiny bath an the beach 10 meters from the appartments.
Very good location
Room was comfortable and had a nice atmosphere
Very good food selection at breakfast. Staff pleasant
the roomwas big and spacious.The cleanliness was quite alright but not top class. The location of the hotel was perfect for tourists.
The breakfast was quite cold at times. The front desk staff was OK but not as friendly and at times temprimental at times when asked for help.
The choice of food was excellent but unfortunately it was never hot enough, most times it was Luke warm.
Clean and new rooms
Free wifi, good location, clean, friendly staff, complimentary tea and coffee.
No swimming pool. Rooms a little on the small side.
love the unique design. smart but not pretentious, very good location
The hotel was excellent .. The breakfast buffet was amazing   Great location. Overall every thing was fantastic :)
The check in took a long time :(
Spacious room with good facilities.
great staff , hotel lovely ,good food ,great facilities.The room was very clean and your domestic staff are a credit to the hotel

the room was tired and needed a paint , new bed linen and some maintenance this would not stop us returning but  we heard every part of our neighbours conversation due to the very thin walls and that would prevent us from returning. we were unable to sleep due to the noise ,the room was very stuffy and the window did not open very wide .
Excellent location.  Smart staff and excellent service at front desk.
Very nice staff. Location was very good; not to far from the KTEL busstation and near the ancient ruins and archaeological museum.
The hotel did not have any swimming pools, in contrary to the provided information about the hotel.

The next morning, my husband told the reception staff they would have to move us as we could not tolerate the heat in the room.  They kindly moved us into a lovely suite for the second night of our stay.

Air conditioning did not work in our room despite attempts by staff to fix it.  They should have offered us another room as it was boiling hot.  The staff member gave us a couple of fans but these were not sufficient to cool the room.

The view is so beautyful,I never stay to the swimmingpool,but here so very nice,not all day music is screaming, the beach is also nice,sand and you can walk so easy in to it,allways sunbed everywhere,never have to wait for taking your food,the people who work there are all friendly,Whole hotel is very clean,I  like this hotel very much and we sure come back!!
Only one thing ,the price for drinks is littlebit expensieve
Everything was superclean, room, lobby and the breakfast room.  Friendly personal, specially at breakfast. Great location near Paddington and the tube.  I would certainly come again!
Good location for busy nightlife area of benidorm.

I've stayed in 5 different hotels in Paris over the last 10 years and this was by far the best. It is a clean, modern hotel with unusually large rooms for a Paris hotel. The décor is stylish and modern, very comfortable beds and the bathrooms are exceptional. The hotel was quiet, had very good free Wi-Fi and 2 lifts made a difference when I was staying on the 5th floor. The position is perfect if you are arriving by Eurostar or wanting to catch a train anywhere, including the airport (CDG). The area is a bit rough round the edges but certainly not dangerous.

The front desk staff were basically fine, but a bit gruff and not overly welcoming - but experience tells me that this is more of a Parisian trait than something specific to this hotel...have stayed in much more expensive hotels than this in Paris and never yet set a front desk employee smile!
The hotel is in a great location, close by to restaurants, bars
Sometimes a bit noisy early hours with doors slamming. Maybe walls are too thin between rooms. Not much else negative about this beautiful hotel!
Very friendly staff, hotel room very clean and comfortable. Easy to check in and out. Impressed with quality of hotel.
Fire alarm warning woke us up at 3.58am to very loud ringing noise, definitely disturbed nights sleep. Then woken up again at 6.30am by noise from room above.
Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location and views.
Bathroom could use a remodel
Lovely room, set in lovely grounds. Great SPA used to relax in. Food was excellent in Restaurant.
Difficult to find. Signs were not clear. Although staff were excellent in the Restaurant, the service was slow.
Service and facilities were high standard
Living area was small and the two small balconies were disappointing
Convenient location to shopping centers and amusement parks!
Very good size of rooms and very co-operative staff.
Breakfast can be improved.
It is a really good hotel, offering large and modern rooms. The staff is friendly and professional.
The neighborhood is not exactly the best, but it is not far from the city center and the main train station and not really dangerous.
Good location close to city centre
Ugly building. Cost of car parking
Children not allowed in pool.... Old man who owns the place wery negativ. Long  to the beach.

The Reception Lady was rude, onprofessional and didnt passed the hospitality services. Everything about her was not good, and cant speak english so good. This is a 4 star hotel, so you need to speak good english and have to be nice with your customers. Dont recommand this hotel ever and never will be go back.
It was advertised as value of $690 for $398 this is False !  Poor attitude of staff and service, condensending attitude  The room did not meet expectation  2 star at best !

We were impressed by every aspect of our experience, from easy access and car parking to the stylish room and the breakfast choices. We were grateful for the air conditioning and effective soundproofing in our room.
The hotel surpassed our expectations and we were made to feel welcome throughout our stay
very good staff, friendly and helpful
So clean and the location is quite good.
hotel was very clean,near to shops and station and the staff helpfull
problems with keycard
Lovely rooms and a great location
very convenient location within walking distance of many attractions, yet quiet enough not to be disturbed. Very pleasant terrace. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming.
Good position
Dirty floor in the room, very slow at responding to requests or not even getting back to me
A lot of the staff have bad attitude and only a few speak English.  This hotel is great for Russian and Turk people, the rest should stay away.
were upgrade to no cost to deluxe room due to the full occupancy of standard room. very nice and big room

Wonderful location and view. Our room was an amazing deal for the outstanding quality of furnishings and the amazing bed which was situated specifically to face the castle.  Wonderful experience - highly recommend.

I booked the hotel through the Momondo website. I searched for dates in late July, but somehow in the midst of my booking the dates changed in the system and I booked for the wrong dates by mistake. The booking was non-refundable and no one was willing to help me change the dates. Momondo said they had no responsibility, the hotel referred me to HotelOpia and HotelOpia referred me to the hotel. I lost my money and the opportunity to visit Copenhagen. I could never recommend a hotel with such bad and inhuman service.
Quality, service, friendly, clean and good food!
Clean, friendly staff , close to the beach and busstop, good breakfast.
Lack of space to hang and store clothes.
staff courteous and helpful, room comfortable apart from comments below,

Fantastic location, particularly if you need to be close to Victoria. We chose it for it's location with regard to the Apollo Victoria Theatre, this was perfect only a 10 minute walk away. The hotel was clean and well kept, and the staff were more than happy to help you. Despite being in the basement level, there were no issues with light or even noise from the road. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and would visit again.

The only downside to this stay was the bathroom could do with a bit of an update, but was very clean and well stocked. Also the dining area was slightly cramped and could do with the air conditioning being utilized; however it was not an issue that would deter me from staying again.

Good location, convenient to airport, on beach and easy walk to local shops bars etc.   Lagoon swimming pool very large and fantastic for children, small pool at beach side of hotel little quieter ur also very nice. Both at a nice temperature!  Evening entertainment appeared to be enjoyed by all. Half board clients can choose between lunch or dinner which is very useful.

Checkin / reception rather slow. There is a vast amount of food at meal times though it wasn't kept the warmest   The vast majority of guests are Spannish and everything very much geared towards them.    If the hotel wants to do something really useful, work out and publish the local bus timetable. The busses appear to be random and chaotic with often waits of 40 mins at the bus stop.
small issues made the room seem in need of tlc. otherwise it's all good
The most perfect hotel to stay at in Hawaii. The history, service, facilities and rooms are second to none.  I will most certainly be back!

My only negative review would be having to pay for beach lounges! Working in hotels myself, I understand the cost of beach towel hire. However, I cannot justify having to pay $20-$25 for a sun lounge on on the beach when youre alreay paying top dollar to stay at a luxury hotel. That is ridiculous!
We travelled Central Europe for 16 days, and A
The hotel was very good. Very pleasant and helpful staff, including the chamber maids. Perfect position for the beach, nearby shops, and the local bus station.

My girlfriend left this hotel totally devastated about our stay. Soon after checking in we got rudely interrupted by a member of staff who simply walked into our room without permission from us. My girlfriend was in the shower at the time. This alone was terrible for her but to make matters worse this happend a second time whereby my girlfriend was naked in the room. This was a male member of staff who entered the second time and the reasons we were told at the time was to check a leak in the bathroom. This is totally no acceptable and we feel the need to tell you. We tried to seek a manger at the time but there was no manager on.
Hotel is in a great position, with many great restaurants and bars in the area. The room was clean and the staff were very polite and helpful.

breakfast was very poor, I have stayed in many hotels including many budget hotels and it was the worst breakfast we have ever had, had to make your own tea by putting a tea bag into a cup of warm water - awful.
Great location and excellent restaurant
SOME receptionists were less than friendly
ok food,lots of drink,good sea and pool
Very BIG - beacuse no free wifi ,i have to pay 25 euro for 1 week,very bad
The view from the room was amazing, and you upgraded our room choice which was very kind.

The air conditioning did not work, the room was 27degrees day and night and no opening windows which made our stay very unpleasant.  We booked half board, but the restaurant we had to use was closed when we arrived and did not open early enough for us to eat before we had to travel to the O2, and was closed when we returned. So we paid again for another meal in the pizzeria, which was bland and the drinks were overcharged, I have never seen such a small bottle of coke!  And at 2.75 for 100 ml!  The electric socket in the room sparked when you put in or took out a plug!  So my birthday weekend was not the best on account of not being able to sleep in 27 degrees.
Surely the hotel doesn`t deserves 4 star as the quality of service is really unsatisfactorily!
Bedrooms old and dated. Furniture /decor badly worn damaged and needs replacing.  Carpets heavily stained and dirty.  Not much of a beach at hotel.

Booked a double economy room and expected a double bed, however this was not the case. There was no window to outside so the room constantly smelled mouldy.   Dont understand the red light district look of the corridors.

The Holiday Inn was in a good location as far as access to the city eas concerned. The food on the lunch and dinner menus was great.  The Conceirge was knowledgable and very friendly as we're the majority of wait staff.

Rooms were not vacuumed every day. Dirty glasses, plates and cutlery were not removed from the room, table not wiped.  The breakfast was mediocre and rather like being in a cafeteria, lukewarm coffee and no choice of breads for toast.

Good location. It's not really in the center, but it's really close to the metro station and bus station (where two night buses stop - n1 and n20). There's a supermarket across the street and other shops nearby, such as McDonald's. The breakfast is basic, but good. Wireless works well. Good value for money.
Don't expect a 5 star hotel, but it's pretty good. The only negative aspect was that the cleaning ladies talk too loud and start knocking at your door really early.
Decent breakfast
Stained bed sheets and no air con.

Everything perfect. We recommend

It was totally enjoyable even though it was only a short stay. The booking experience was easy and efficient.

Absolutely beautiful hotel, perfect location to the airport and beach, perfect for a weekend away.
Really need more sunbeds on roof terrace.

A home away from home. Small and very nice place for relax.
Thank you: no hesitation in returning/recommending Brisbane Marriott
Thank you: no hesitation in returning/recommending Brisbane Marriott
Staff were friendly and check-in was fast

We flew over to celebrate my son's 21st and when we checked into our room, despite our booking saying 2 double/queen beds, we had 1 bed only. My son had to sleep on a roller bed. Very disappointing ESP since it was our first nite in the US and a gift for my son.

Hotel Manager very very helpful in every  we needed help. His staff are excellent very friendly, helpful, and always happy to speak and lots of friendly faces. My daughter visits Egypt a couple of times a year and she recommended this Hotel to us we would visit again

This is not really a negative view its just our opinion the hotel had mainly Russian guests and the entertainment was always in Russian every night for the English and French this was hard going maybe a choice of entertainment. Another venue for different entertainment we only stayed for a week and two weeks would have been hard because it became boring with nothing to do in the evening!!

Very central location, friendly staff.

Hotel management and staff did nothing to curtail the noise by other guests from 2-4am on the firday night. Clearly these guests had a party and on return made alot of noise from their room with no consideration for other guests.    One would expect night staff to have enforced some policy in order for other guests to have enjoyed their stay and not lost sleep.

Fantastic service, excellent rooms, highly recommend.   All the staff was so helpful. The room was amazing, clean and had everything going for it.  We stayed 12 nights at this hotel in Dubai. Breakfast and dinner buffet has almost everything and it's so fresh and tastey. Hotel is very close to the Mall of Emirates.  Very helpful and NICE staff, especially on restaurants !!  Highly recommended !!!     Greatings  Grzegorz, Agnieszka, Maks, Tropiszów, Poland

Restaurant had a gourmet menu which didn't seem to match style of accomodations and was a little too pricey for families.

This hotel was simply horrible! The room and the beds were dirty; I do not even think our bed was cleaned at our arrival. We even slept with our clothes on, in order for our skin not to touch the sheets... The toilet was not working properly and also the bathroom nor the towels looked like they were clean. After we had a walk to the beach we came back to find faeces (!!) in the middle of the hallway of the 1st floor!!  The pool didn't seem really clean, breakfast was not that exciting (but after all the dirt, we did not manage to eat anything). Wifi connection wad poor... Believe me, I could go on and on enumerating all the bad things of this hotel, as I cannot really remember one thing that was actually good!

This hotel was simply horrible! The room and the beds were dirty; I do not even think our bed was cleaned at our arrival. We even slept with our clothes on, in order for our skin not to touch the sheets... The toilet was not working properly and also the bathroom nor the towels looked like they were clean. After we had a walk to the beach we came back to find faeces (!!) in the middle of the hallway of the 1st floor!!  The pool didn't seem really clean, breakfast was not that exciting (but after all the dirt, we did not manage to eat anything). Wifi connection wad poor... Believe me, I could go on and on enumerating all the bad things of this hotel, as I cannot really remember one thing that was actually good!

Very clean, felt safe and near tube

Recently stayed at the hotel and was somewhat disappointed for the room rate was expensive for what was provided. We found the pillows very hard and uncomfortable, there was a penny pinching attitude as allowing only two tea bags, very few coffees per day and only one water bottle on arrival – there were two people!! The TV was appalling with in effect no picture – why did you even bother? – was it a joke at the customer’s expense- literally? The bathroom was so small! And the soaps were difficult to operate. Regarding the breakfast the queues were appalling – as if being on some nasty cruise liner. If the price had not been so high I would have been less inclined to complain for the quality of breakfast was decent – but those apples were just shocking. The cleanliness also was appreciated and the feel of safety was good – but just the overall feeling left us as being ripped off, for the price paid and consequently we are asking you for compensation and some refund. Please appreciate our feelings and need for recompense.

None really - nothing that would put us off coming again. Excellent property with great location at the foot of the Palm Jumeirah. Numerous facilities with plenty of space by poolside / beach to find a sun lounger. Very friendly staff across the board. Room was clean (spotless) and spacious plus had a lovely balcony (sea view). No noise from neighbors. Breakfast was hearty and highlights were the Hammam pools in the Spa and the tea room. Gym facilities also top-class. Plenty of F

Although very clean, the bathroom could be bit more modern, (although rooms in the main block are due to undergo a refurbishment shortly). Can be problematic trying to get to the local Metro station (Dubai Marina) as taxi drivers don't want the short fare and it's too far to walk in the heat.

Room Very clean. Rest of hotel also clean. friendly staff.  Excellent food quality. (always wondered why the lunches better than dinner.)  Like the new hotel layout. We came here in 80, 81, 84 and 1986. still felt as we remembered it.  We would go back to the Puelbo

Only negative is the entertainment. although the staff are friendly and hardworking quality was not very good.  The quiz night, karaoke, Mr Pueblo etc are not entertainment. We never got to see the programme this week but it looked better. If you were sitting more than half  down the seating area you cannot hear what is being said and even hear the music properly. We did notice it being turned down a couple of times. The inclusive drinks option ends at 11:00pm but the entertainment sometimes finished well before 11 and started to pack up. Why is there no music played after? That would encourage people to buy more drinks at he bar. Also we came back to have a drink late at night to find the bar closed although it was supposed to be open till 1:00am. These comments are meant to help improve your facilities. We enjoyed our stay with you.

Cosy and nicely furnitured hotel in the very center of Riga.

It was the longest waiting time for check in I have ever experienced. They had problems with their system, so it was probably the reason.   I was told I could have a lunch in the hotel's lobby bar. There was no staff at the bar, and after I have asked receptionist twice, the waitress has appeared. The only thing, she could offer me for lunch, was a sandwich with ham and cheese. In my opinion it's a rather poor choice for a four star hotel.   My room was lovely at first sight, but it was too small space at the desk, so it was almost impossible to sit there and work. It was very easy to hit your head when getting up from your bed or arm-chair because of really low sloping ceiling.

I loved the buffé breakfast and dinner. My room was constantly clean and was nice to stay in.

One problem that we had encountered was that the staff had always inflated the price in regards to taxi services and tours. We had found tours for a third of the price by just visiting the omnibus terminals and asking one of the taxis drivers. To me, it showed dishonesty from the staff as they had lied about the standard price. Also, the hotel is situated far from the Santa Clara city centre. To some (including myself) it is problematic, if you prefer to do many activities within a short period of time, to some others, it's fine as it provides a seclusive vibe.

A really lovely hotel with beautiful garden surroundings. The rooms are basic but have comfortable beds and are very clean. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and will do anything to help, nothing is too much for them. Breakfast is included, however, meals can be ordered from the hotel kitchen at any time until 9.00pm for a reasonable price and all cooked fresh. This hotel offers peace and relaxation, whilst lively restaurants and clubs are a short walk away if you want a change of tempo - perfect!

The only downsides to this hotel are that the showers do not work very well when placed up on the wall meaning that it was necessary to hold the shower head to get a decent wash, but not a massive problem. Also it would be nice if the hotel provided drink making facilities in the rooms.

All in all, stay here if you are desperate but otherwise don't waste your time and money.

Location near to Cornelia Station of Metro Line A. There are small shops nearby for convenience items and some restaurants including a McDonald. This former vineyard provide grounds and gardens to give a good retreat. The daily masses available at the Chapel. the Santuario St Jean Baptiste De La Salle, are most convenient for the pilgrim. There is also a small museum about the life of St Jean Baptiste De La Salle  who dedicated his life for education of the poor and as patron saint for teachers. It was occupied by the Mussolini government and the Germans and used as a hospital. Breakfast included and set lunch and dinner menu available with advance notice.

There are no clear directional signs from the Metro Station to Casa La Salle. From Leonardo Da Vinci airport the train and metro cost under 10 euros. There is a  shuttle service (about 30 euros) and taxi costs 40 euros for the 30 -40 minutes  ride. There is no Gym or swimming pool.

Could be a nice hotel. Cheap price to stay there. Staff work very hard and are pleasant (reception, restaurant, cleaning) though bar staff could generally do with personality enhancement!

it was overcrowded, queue for everything, all meals involved queuing to access the restaurant, early morning queue to access pool area (door to pool area opened at 9am) and if you didnt queue early you simply couldnt get a sunbed. On all-inclusive the last drinks served at 11pm and typically from 10pm onwards there was a queue to obtain a drink (limit 2 per person so that if 3 persons in group two had to go to bar). Restaurant was overcrowded at meal-times and not relaxing at all. In  other words a stressful and unpleasant experience and not to be recommended. Advantage to be a pushy person!

Would never stay again which is a shame as I like to go to concerts at the lg arena and this hotel is perfect for that.

We enjoyed our stay.

Absolutely fabulous.  The staff were so helpful and professional - all were there to make our holiday that extra bit special.  The room  - no 2 was in great location as the hotel is large but very intimate because of the layout of the numerous houses which comprise the hotel.  Our room was spacious and beautifuly decorated.  Loved the wooden beams. Bathroom with seperate toilet, bidet and shower was fantastic.  The dining room was fabulous and the breakfasts superb.  Location great - in a lovely part of Seville.  The patio areas were beautiful and roof top pool was a haven for a swim and sun bathe with superb views over the rooftops.  We shall return - there was not one negative.  Thank you to all the staff who helped to make Seville estupendo.  Muchas gracias de Londres.

I thought that the hotel was lovely, clean, pleasant and I had no issues.

My fiancé and I booked our car in to the car park for an eight day stay.  I felt that on our return journey that one (seven seater) bus every fifteen minutes is unacceptable.  I had to eventually order a taxi to get myself, my fiancé and my 78 year old mother back to the hotel.  This is because we waited for half an hour to get back to the hotel and my mother was becoming increasingly unwell with standing in a queue for this length of time.  The receptionist gave my fiancé a plastic bag within his car key in, but failed to explain that the exit ticket for the barrier was in it.  We ended up holding up quite a few cars as we did not know how to get out of the car park.  A stranger had to tell us - a job for the hotel receptionist.

Very old facilities and bad quality of furniture at rooms. You had to pay for the refridgerator and it was not operating properly. No porter. Lunch had a very limited variety. We had All-Inclusive status and we were forced to eat out. The water that was served at the restaurant was awful, plus we were not allowed to bring bottled water from out of the hotel. Internet was provided only at the lobby. No mini-market. Very small elevator. The hotel shouldn't have 4 stars. The hotel should have 3 stars at maximum.

Great staff and a great property. I enjoyed my stay.
Great staff and a great property. I enjoyed my stay.

The driver who picked us up at the airport was so lovely, even when we were late (he had to wait an hour and was still pleasant and smiling)  When we arrived, we were welcomed with the drink - which was refreshing, all the staff were lovely and professional, the girl that served us at the start we saw throughout our stay, and always had a big smile (she was the best! I wish I asked for her name!)  The cleaning staff were also lovely, and always smiled - all staff did, which felt welcoming.  The breakfast was very nice, the male cook made excellent scrambled eggs! The options were good, only thing for me was that there were no hashbrowns (but I probably have enough of those!) otherwise always had a great selection. Aparently the croissants were a little frozen/stale some days and needed better warming up? Such a small thing though.  I loved the room service, I would say it's reasonably priced, I liked the Margarita Pizza and sometimes the chef would include a little plate of hot chips - yum! Adds a nice touch, like getting really good value.  The pool is the highlight, from the minute we saw it, it made it feel like a real holiday - it utilises the space well and has been tastefully decorated - I really think the architect has made a beautiful pool area.  The location is fairly central, about 5 minutes to the beach, a bit further to get to Jungceylon (15minutes). My boyfriend went to Maximum Gym during our stay which was about a 15-20minute walk along the beach.

Not much except the rack to wash your hands on the hand towel was positioned over the bath so you had to lean - hardly anything bad!    And would have liked hashbrowns at breakfast, but they did have a 'One Day Potatoe' hot dish with some herbs that were a nice alternative! Loved their guava juice..heard some reviews complain about the breakfast, but I'm pretty fussy about food and had no problems with selection!    Our only problem was that I forgot what day we checked out until that morning and wanted to extend the stay but would have had to pay full price for the room we were upgraded to (Pool View instead of City view) which was 2800baht per night! They weren't aware of the Hotelopia pay 4 nights, get 4 free offer and would only discount the room an extra 20% - which was nice of them, but not within our budget! So it's really great value if you get a good deal, but otherwise you gotta be rich! (sigh!)

The situation of the hotel is superb! It is close enough to walk to Oxford street for shopping, has numerous restaurants close by and Kensington Gardens and Hyde park are next door. You can even hire bicycles very close to the hotel for a round in the parks. The staff were very nice, offering a fine mixture of relaxed friendlyness and professionalism, giving our two young sons a special breakfast treat: cocoa served at the table, every morning! We had booked the English breakfast menu, and it was delicious and varied. The atmosphere in the hotel is charming and the price is very nice for a family on a medium budget. I would love to come back and will happily recommend the hotel to anyone I talk to who wants to go to London!

Nothing, really, given that the price is so good! Yes, the family room we stayed in was not exactly luxurious, and one of the closets looked about to collapse, but the beds are good, it is clean and there is plenty of space.

From the moment we pulled up we were greeted and helped out of our taxi by friendly staff. The hotel had been booked out, so we had been upgraded to a family suite over looking the Harbour. All staff without exception were professional and helpful at all times and between their excellent customer service and the hotel itself, both exceeded our expectations of our visit.   The Harbour Grand will definitely be top of my list for our stop over when we fly Australia to UK later in the year. The kids loved the roof top pool, what a great  to break up a long haul flight. Would highly recommend.

First time used apartments instead of hotel. Was very impressed by the facilities.  Will definitely use again. All you need is within walking distance.    Rose street is brilliant.  Very helpful staff. No problems leaving luggage both on early arrival and collecting later after checkout.

Only negative point is if staying in rooms at the front, cars are whizzing down street and was very noisey. Traffic calmers are definitely required.   Seems that cars are using this street as a short cut.

The first thing that struck us when we opened the door to our hotel room was the heat in the room. It turned out that the hotel had no air conditioning. In the closet we found a fan, but it did not help enough so we asked the hotel staff if we could get an additional fan, but we were told that all the rooms were booked and that it was not possible to get an additional one. This meant that we could not could stay in the hotel during the day because of the heat - we had to wait until it was evening.    The hotel rooms have a much lower standard than indicated by the pictures available on the internet. The TV was so small that we started laughing when we saw it. To view the TV picture from the bed, it was probably necessary to have a pair of binoculars. Once you have flushed the toilet, you need to wait 25 minutes before you can flush properly again.    One day we asked for an iron, but then we got the answer that they did not know where it was. Apparently they had just a single iron and they had already lent it to someone else.The hotel should have more than one.    Staff were not particularly helpful. They told excuses, but they did nothing practical to help us.
The hotel had a good location and was close to several restaurants och public transport stops.

The first thing that struck us when we opened the door to our hotel room was the heat in the room. It turned out that the hotel had no air conditioning. Arrived late at night to be told our accomadation that we had booked two months prior was not available. We then had to pay an additional nights fee to saty for  the night (after already paying for a weeks accomadation). The room we were put in was filthy and that night (4am) there was a storm and the whole room leaked, we were ankle deep in water and the water was also going throught the electricals (TV, air con). We then had   to ask for another room. We left the next day to find accomadation elswhere as the Sitio would not help us. We are still trying to get our money back for the weeks accomadation we never recieved (2 months on). We are very unsatisfied with the whole experience and will not ever recomend this place. Does not paint a great picture of Boracay. Travellers be warned.

Very quiet and safe hotel with own garden. Good transport connection with main places of interest (Metro Line A station Cornelia, bus lines ? 46 and 916). Direct Cotral bus line connects the hotel with Leonardo da Vinci Airport (FCO). It costs € 3.50. Cotral bus stop is very close to hotel gate. Continental buffet breakfast is not reach but substantial. Very friendly and professional staff. Highly recommended!

Great four star hotel Well worth the money.

Myself and my husband have just spent 4 nights at the Kossak Hotel in Krakow.  This boutique hotel is well situated for walking into the old square, the castle, the river and the jewish quarter.  It has fantastic views overlooking the castle and the river from the rooftop restaurant and we enjoyed several excellent meals there.  We particularly enjoyed one of the chefs special tasting menus - you need to order this the day before .  Breakfast in the dining area on the ground floor was excellent,  lots to choose from .The staff were helpful, friendly and courteous and only to happy to suggest places to see etc.  Had a super visit and would certainly return to stay at this hotel.

Mod cons such as tv and/or hard driers and/or shower gel /shampoo were not present but, for the price and courteous service (once hotel found) it is really value for money and you can be in the centre of the city with just a 10 to 15 min walk. On 07/08/13 when we got to the hotel after a five hour drive. The first thing we wanted to do my family and I is take a shower and visit the parks. There was no water and the restroom smelled awful. I went to the clerk and asked to clean restroom while taking a walk, when we came back around 10 p.m. the water was back but the restroom was still the same.We couln't stand the smell and I asked to cancell my reservation, but the clerk told me that they would not refund my money so I asked to be moved to other room. The other room had the same smell and the a/c wasn't cold enough. We had to leave early in the morning and come back late at night to be in the room the less time possible. I will definitely never go back to this same hotel again.

the staff were excellent. the room was on the whole clean and well-appointed. we were brought a fan as soon as we requested one (the room was very hot but we were visiting during a heatwave!). room was spacious (we payed a little extra for the executive room which in my opinion is worth doing) and the bathroom was also large with a good powerful shower. the hotel is also in a good central location with very easy access to transport. overall we had a comfortable and happy stay :)

there was a problem with the flush in the toilet, and a couple of grimy spots in the shower door seal could use some attention. we used the pool in the gym next door and although we appreciate it's out with the hotel's control, we found the standards of cleanliness and repair there to be a little lacking. the hotel lift was out of order for the duration of our stay. the location can be a little noisy however it's probably fine with the windows closed (due to the hot weather we had the windows open all the time).

Perfect location. Very quiet and relaxing. Beach is a thirty second walk away with a shop and a few restaurants the same then just 3 or 4 minutes walk away you have the rest of playa blanca.  The apartments were fabulous. Really really lovely for a nice relaxed holiday. We spent one week here then moved on to costa teguise for our second week and immediately regretted it. We would have returned to limones bungalows but they were fully booked!!

Hotels around could be very noisy on a night in particular the one directly behind. And the bar iteself on playa limones didn't really get much custom so if you like to go out on an evening you would have to walk into town

This is not a five star hotel, rather two. The room was old and dirty, the bed incredibly uncomfortable, housekeeping was beneath contempt. Staff  and rude. Food was ok. But! the dining room was horrible, like a garish canteen. We only managed to eat there twice in two weeks.    There were not enough sunbeds for everyone. Which created a daily war between the guests. Daytime they played horrible old techno at top volume. Evenings even louder-kids music. Very strange.    I love Marmaris and I've been here many times(and will come back) bet never ever to hotel "Elegance"!

We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in celebration of my partner's birthday - it's a lovely, luxurious hotel, tucked away in a really convenient location.  We had booked a junior suite but were upgraded to a full suite when we checked in without asking.  The suite had a separate bedroom, living room, huge bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen, plus lots of wardrobe space!  The suite was on the ground floor therefore no great views and a little dark but this didn't matter as we didn't spend too much time indoors.  The weather was glorious so we were able to make use of the courtyard bar which gave us a true feeling of being out somewhere on the continent rather than Central London!  We had breakfast included in our rate and this was served in the library - a small intimate experience rather than the usual buffet style you tend to get in most places these days.  A good selection of cereals, fruits, meats and cheeses were available to help yourself to and a basket of bread was delivered to the table and the hot breakfast was cooked to order.  We booked for a massage on the morning of our departure - this was a really enjoyable and relaxing experience.  All in all, a really pleasant stay with professional staff who had attention to detail to ensure guests were treated as individuals rather than a number.  I would gladly recommend this hotel and hope to return again some day.

A slight mix up on check-in (possibly on our part) however, we headed out for a meal and on our return, we had been left a card of apology and a plate of complimentary chocolate treats.  This was an unexpected gesture but shows the high level of service they expect to give to their guests.

Was just down in Dublin for a concert at Phoenix Park and stayed at this hotel as it was last minute and my normal choices for accommodation in Dublin were already booked up. I was really impressed by the hotel in terms of location (so close to St Stephen's Green and Grafton Street, and the area surrounding the hotel is beautiful), and also the quality of the room for the money. I will definitely be staying here again and I think it will replace my previous hotels as my 'go-to accommodation' in Dublin!

The hotel is situated in a wonderful location of Gozo and the layout of this hotel is one of a kind with bungalow like rooms.  Simply beautiful. Great venue with stunning views of cliffs and of the parent Island, Malta.  It is a great place to chill out and relax with family and friends.  It is an all year round hotel - great in summer as well as in winter.  Spa pool is perfect!

The outdoor pools badly need a refurbishment as most of the tiles are either broken and therefore black with dirty and mould or are rusty.  Also the rooms in particular the bathrooms also need a refurbishment.  Using the bathroom is not the greatest of experiences, being a 5 star hotel !!

We had a great experience at this hotel.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The property is very well maintained, clean and the elevators are very fast.  One side of the hotel faces the water park and the other has a spectacular view of the pool, beach and ocean. Access to the property is closely monitored by the staff, only people staying at The Cove or The Reef can use the pools and beach.  This keeps the crowds down and ensures you can get a chair at the pool or on the beach.  If you can only put up with the crowds in the water park for a few hours a day, The Cove is a great place to remind you that you are in the Bahamas!

For what you pay it's great value for money. The rooms are very clean, a bit on the small side but there's so much to see and do you only use the room for sleep. The centre is about a 15min walk, the Marina about 20mins and the beach about 25mins. Pleasant walks with lots to see. The Santa Barbara Castle isn't far either and is a must see, the views are brilliant! I went with my mum for a long weekend so this hotel was perfect. Half board, the food was great, large portions and the staff were extremely helpful. If you want to keep it cheap there's also a bus stop about 10min walk away that goes to and from the airport for €2.90 (single ticket).

My husband and I have stayed in Per Avel in 2008 and a young woman was managing the place. The quality for the money was appropriate and the staff was friendly.   All in all we enjoyed our stay. For our holiday this year we had chosen the same hotel. When we arrived the current owner of the hotel was at reception. She told us she does not have our reservation. We explained her how we booked, for how many people, for how much and for how many nights. She was not willing to accept that we would have payed such an amount as the price would be wrong. Already frustrated as her behaviour was very unfriendly and even close to rude. My husband took out the confirmation from you guys. She looked at it and said she had never heard of it. My husband is Indian and surprisingly she would not even listen to him. The lady thought I am Russian and treated me much more polite. My husband asked if he could speak to the owner and she confirmed that would be her.   As we both work in 5* properties in central London (Jumeirah and Corinthia) we gave her enough time and options to check everything and were very polite, but there are limits. We had to ask her several times to call the number on the confirmation.   Even being on the phone she repeated: "Oh, I have confirmed the reservation?"  During our stay the police came and took the owner for 2 days into arrest as she was underpaying her staff and not treating them right. That was very disturbing and we left a day earlier, not even thinking of a refund as we felt awful for the employees.  After we came home we checked trip advisor - unfortunately we were not surprised.   If your company believes in moral you should take Per Avel out of your list. It is not worth it the money.

Basic room with a double bed. The room was very clean, particularly the bathroom, and the bed was more comfortable than we thought it would be. The free wifi was also a nice little perk, as we were expecting to have to pay for it.  Good location, quite close to Heathrow Airport.

The hotel is set in beautiful grounds that are kept immaculate. The overall feel is of a tropical oasis. The choice and variety of the breakfast is the best I have ever experienced. Nice friendly staff too.

The bedrooms are small and too basically furnished for a 5*. They were definitely functional rather than luxurious, the worst problems being the incredibly hard mattress on the bed. The design of the room is also poor as you have to squeeze around the tv to get out of the balcony door. The open plan bathroom may also be appealing for singles or honeymoon couples but for those with families it becomes an unnecessary nightmare. The simple solution would be to fit a separate toilet door. Final moan is that the patio doors fit badly so let Mosquitos and a whole lot of noise in.

It was a warm welcome from the first Minute until the drop off at the Airport. Many Thanks to all, especially to the bar keeper, we had together a really enjoyable conversation to a drink to finish a long lasting day (night from July 2nd to 3rd).

It was a warm welcome from the first Minute until the drop off at the Airport. Many Thanks to all, especially to the bar keeper, we had together a really enjoyable conversation to a drink to finish a long lasting day (night from July 2nd to 3rd).

Long wait at reception to book in. When we were unpacking a lady walked in as she had a key card for our room. This was a lack of care and poor security on the part of the reception. Errors do happen though but what annoyed us was the  the problem was handled. Nobody in reception either understood our problem when we phoned down or they just were not listening. It took nearly an hour for them to change the key card for our room and the lady had to wait another hour for them to locate her room as her husband had already booked in in a group booking but they hadn't listened to her explaining this. I actually took this up with the manageress on duty as the staff were rather abrupt and off hand with us when we told them we had missed the racing that night due to the fiasco.. She was very efficient and kind and hopefully the staff will have some further training in listening to guests. Unfortunately that same night when we returned to our room we could not get in. We had to trail down to reception, wait until other guests were booked in and then the night receptionist told us that the key had been cancelled again!! He sorted us out with another key immediately.  We went through the next few days without problems due to not being in the hotel much and eating out, but on our last morning , with check out time at noon, we were disturbed at 9.15 am  by the maid coming in to change our room!!!!  Why would she want to change the room and have us able to still use the room until 12?!    We have stayed there once,  before a special occasion in Dublin and  booked there again for memory sake but we have decided we will not return to this hotel.

Location, fantastic. Pool area lovely, hotel was fully booked and we didn't struggle to find sunbeds.  Our sea view room was a great size, balcony and view were amazing. The daily maid service was great and everything kept very clean.

The reception desk was appalling.  Only two computer terminals and the simplest task took FOREVER.  If you speak Portuguese you can apparently just shout over people who have been waiting 30mins to be served and get your issue dealt with first.  They answer phone calls while the queue is out the door and often two or three people will be standing doing nothing.  On check out I gave up queuing to check out after 20mins and simply left. If I hadn't I would have missed my transfer.  The breakfast selection was wide but not consistent from day to day.

- While we booked a double bed they gave us a twin.  - They refused to change it to a double saying that the hotel is full.  - Front Desk Manager told us that it is not their problem but a problem between us and the agent (hotelopia), he did not help us at all.  - We stayed at the twin room for a night and been moved to a double only on our second day of our holiday.  - No compensations offered for this.  - Believe it or not, they even charged for the phone calls, they made from the front desk to the travel agent in Turkey (Tantur Turizm).

The hotel was outstanding. I was bitterly disappointed however, when I arrived they told me that there were no apartments available for my two daughters and I, they advised me that they had allocated two rooms to us. As my daughters are quite young, 14 and 10, I was not comfortable that we had to stay in two rooms, but we had no choice. The reason for this mix up is that they said they have never dealt with Hotelopia and that your booking system is not linked to their booking system. The confirmation that is sent through to them did not contain my contact information, so they could not warn me in advance. I would highly advise that you sort this out as the hotel is of superior quality and a true gem in Pretoria.

On arrival I went to my assigned room to find it was already inhabited!  When staff were queried, they explained that when the hotel is almost fully booked, the booking system (due to one of their systems being down and the other very slow) takes time to register people who are already checked in and therefore their room appears as available on the system.  The only  to ensure the room is not already assigned to another guest is to call head office.

The hotel and staff were wonderful. Zach, in particular, made us welcome and looked after us throughout our stay. The Courtyard by Marriott has much to offer. Unlike some of the stuffier resorts, Courtyard has a very laid-back feel to it. The pool and spa area were never too crowded and poolside staff were very helpful. We were lucky to get an upgrade from a garden view room to a pool/ocean view room which literally made our stay. Free Wifi was extremely useful as we were able to book tours and confirm flights using our iPad. Every night, the concierge desk would offer free Mai Tais to get guests started on Happy Hour. We made good use of the gym facilities which offset great meals enjoyed from the pool bar and restaurant. The hotel is within walking distance of a shopping mall and restaurants - very practical! All in all, we were very impressed with the Courtyard by Marriott and wouldn't hesitate recommending it to family and friends. Oh, and did we mention Zach at reception? A real Gem! As a famous Austrian once said, "We'll be back!"
At first, the daily $14 parking rate can seem a little steep. However, considering there is no resort fee and Wifi is free, it's really not all that bad.

Although the hotel was probably grand some years back it is now tired and worn and in need of a makeover. Everything is dated.   The loud music from the promenade went from early in the day until midnight and somehow found its  to the 12th  floor. I would ask for a room facing away for the promenade.

Very clean, friendly and definitely value for money. Good location, near some excellent shops, cafes and restaurants (especially on Calle Verdi). Walking distance to Sagradia Familia and Parc Guell and very close to a metro (Lesseps).

Not much really, only thing is if you're out late in Ramblas/Gothic Quarter the metro closes early on weeknights so you'll need a taxi back (around €10). Also be aware that as this is more of a local area shops/cafes close in the middle of the day for a siesta.

As mentioned I stayed with family for my daughters graduation. We all had a very pleasant and comfortable visit, including my brother in law, whom has a problem with his back, and finds it difficult to sleep in a bed.  However he was very impressed with the mattresses on the beds in the Crown  Plaza  in Manchester. He said its the first time in years he was able to sleep in a bed. I remember years ago staying in the Crown Plaza in New York and reading about the mattresses, pillows and we even had a room spray, to aid relaxation. So all that research paid off it certainly is one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in

This hotel was better than expected. We arrived late at night and the restaurant was closed but still they made some food for us which showed that the staff was very polite and helpful. The rest of the week they ensured that it wasn't just that time, they were really helpful and we had a great time staying at this hotel.   The rooms were clean and bright, good size and a very big balcony with seaview and view of the sunset.  The breakfast was good, perhaps not the biggest buffé but it was enough. They had good food in the restaurant as well and beautiful view of the ocean.

The negative was that we didn't have a refrigerator, but there was some smaller stores close to the hotel where you could buy beverages and snacks. The location was maybe not the best if you don't want to walk to get to other restaurants but it wasn't that long, maybe 10 min walk to get to restaurants and smaller shops.   The beach that the hotel has is not very big and if there are many visitors you would not fit but if you walk along the water you find other places where you can swim.

Very Clean throughout, Towels were lovely and fluffy and white. Great leisure facilities. Nice touch having the fan in the room in this hot weather. Lovely food.

On arrival after traveling 3 hours we went to the bar and was extremely shocked at the cost  of 2 pints of lemonade it was over £6 !! If we were to stay again we would bring our own to have in the room and just ask for ice! The staff put us in a smoking room, they did not ask if we wanted this. We are non smokers and this wasn't the ideal start to the stay so that needed to be sorted (very inconvenient). The mattress needed to be replaced as you would roll into the middle of the bed (very annoying) neither my husband or I had a good nights sleep.

The staff tried to be helpful.

I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.  The bed was horribly lumpy.  I did not dare look at the mattress for fear of what I might see.  The CRT TV did not work, I rang reception who apologised and sent a chap up to fix it.  Not wishing to discredit the man in anyway as he did nothing wrong, I felt uncomfortable being a female alone with an man, unknown to me, in my room.  He said 'when this happens we normally swap the TV for one in another room.  As the hotel is full tonight we can't do that. Sorry'  so I understand it was not unusual for the CRT TVs to not work.  He failed to fix the TV.  As I had paid £115 for the room for the night I was very disappointed that I could not watch the program I wanted to.  When I looked at the TV remote control it was so filthy I wondered which diseases I may catch from it.  The phone was also very dirty.  There was a row of tiles detached from the wall in the bathroom and some others loose.  The carpet by the bed was threadbare, the tv cabinet was filthy. The chairs in the room were very worn and faded.  Most of the bathroom was clean but the sign about re-use of towels was thick with dust.  I did not search out the cleanliness of every nook and cranny believing I would be horrified by what I might find. Had I not paid for the room in advance I would not have stayed there.  In the information it said that wifi was available free in all the public areas.  It turned out to only be available in reception.  there were 3 or 4 people trying to find where we could use wifi.    When, on the first night, I could not use the tv I spoke to the chap on reception explaining how disappointed I was when the night before I had paid half the money for a room in a hotel offering so much better facilities.  He said he would speak to the duty manager in the morning and perhaps I could have some money refunded.  When I spoke to another receptionist the next evening she knew nothing.  I gave up in despair.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  It may have been nice in about 1970 when I guess it was built and the furniture installed.
The staff tried to be helpful.

Located at very nice beach. restaurant service staff is professional. They gave you a feeling you are in a luxurious restaurant. There are some nicer hotel around but while sea and beach is the most important thing if this hotel price is much reasonable can be considerable.

When we arrive to hotel, reception informed they didn't receive our booking. They called general manager of hotel and we waited 30 minutes after long trying trip.  Due to I complain they allowed us to settle in a room. Our booking was all inclusive, GM informed they dont sell "all inclusive". What I could say: I had a confirmation and all paid and came from another continent for pleasure. Than I understand that GM was ok with full board but not all inclusive this is why she was trying to talk some people in Italy. Difference with all inclusive and full board is alcoholic drinks. We are already not alcohol drinking family. When I told this she sad its all ok now. What if if we were alcohol drinking family and we have prof in our hands. Hotel behavior was not good. If customer  has full document in hand and paid all service already hotel supposed to provide all promised without forcing customer 30 minutes wait.     I locked my safe locker in my room and than somehow I couldn't open it. It was app. 21.00. When I called reception a hotel staff came tried and couldn't open. He told me he will open tomorrow morning by getting key from GM office. When I asked I need urgently and why I wait for it the answer was "General Manager" having dinner I can not bother her. So I understand clearly from two approach hotel management is not customers we as customers for hotel management.    Food options and breakfast was limited. Due to Italian Hotel every day one course was pasta.

We were living in 2 room apartment, we are very pleased with it. Very fashionable hotel, clean and wide rooms with new facilities.

After the first meal at the restaurant we got sick and poisoned, had terrible problems with stomach. It was caused by dishes not being washed properly. Vegetables and fruits are not washed at all. Fish and meat meals were not cooked well enough. Hotel management should reconsider the  those things are done, as during our stay a lot of other customers had the same problems. Our stay was totally ruined by the stomach problems and the only thing what was used from the restaurant afterwards was chamomile tea, therefore we do not suggest to use restaurant at all. It is possible to feel the smell from river next to the hotel what is not pleasant at all.

Rooms very tired and run down, needs modernisation. The beds are so uncomfortable and definately should not be rated as 5 star accomodation. I complained to the reception staff about the quality of the beds and sleeping arrangements for the children, who have to sleep on a settee, and nothing was done to rectify this.   The bathrooms are tired and shower faciltiy is poor.   The balcony was very dirty, ants everywhere, complained and were left with an ant spray to deal with the problem ourselves. I thought this was very poor.    The hotel grounds although still nice, are also looking tired and not to the usual standard that have experienced on previous visits to this hotel.  We will not return to Insotel in Menorca as a result, very disappointed with the hotel.

The hotel was clean and fresh and the staff around the pool we very friendly.  Unfortunetly the weather was not great however staying at the royal James made it a lovely break until we where notified that our belongings where not found.

Unfortunately we left behind a pair of puma trainers and holster belt and white rha earphones in our room.  We have contacted the hotel and they have told us they have not been found.  I find this very hard to believe as we are 100% positive that we left them in our rooms.  We stayed in room 1636 and 1533 at your property.  Unfortunates what was a good break has turned out to be not so good one due to not receiving these items which we accidentally left behind.

Food was like home made and quality of indegrients the best. The first course was so generous we could hardly touch the main course. Everytime we asked for a change (I have 2 small children). The cook was kindly offering to prepare whatever they wanted! The quantity was also massive and the price excellent.Tidyness was remarkable. All the staff were brilliant with the children, so that the kids never wanted to go outside of the hotel! There was also a nice surprise, having a singer with his guitar every evening. I recommend this hotel to everybody. I also recommend the restaurant to the locals.

What a superb little hotel is the Sunny Garden at Nilufer  - very clean,   - gloriously peaceful with views over the sea  - pool and terrace bar  - great friendly staff (including the owners)  - fantastic home-made evening meals from the hotel Chef  - great location, just short walk to the beach and hire boats and local restaurants  - cheap taxi-bus to local town/airport from outside Hotel front door  Forget the souless, multi-story 'modern' hotels and noisey so-called 4**** resorts, this is a haven for people that want a good family-run hotel and a holiday without hassle.

The hotel is set in a beautiful location with lovely grounds. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The interior is beautifully decorated and the lounge would be warm and welcoming in winter as there is an open fire. It was very hot when we were there and the outdoor seating area was comfortable with lovely views over the grounds. The nesting house martens were a plus!  The breakfast was substantial and very well cooked.
We did not have any negative reviews apart from forgetting to bring our wine with the dinner! Soon rectified.

Nice pool area and good entertainment.

Waited 90 minutes for checking in, just to be told, that our room was not available and that we had been 'upgraded' to another hotel. Reason was, that a russian airline was bankrupt, and that the russians on the hotel therefore couldn't check out and go home.    We were sent to another hotel, where we had to start all over in the checkin process. It took appx. 90 minutes extra to get the room on Magic Life Water World Imperial in Belek.    Only after 48  hours we were able to get the room we had booked at Pegasus World. Makind day 3 a travel day too.    Our daughter had the worst birthday (8 years) ever at the hotel. We arranged a la carte restaurant on the day, and ordered special birthday ice cream for her (and her younger brother) - 5 Euro each ice cream. First of all the birthday ice cream was exactly the same, as the ice cream that was all included to me and my wife. Second it was just placed on the table in front of her. 5 minutes later the waiters turned of the light, and brougt in a cake with fireworks into the very small restaurant while singing a birthday song - for another kid. The whole restaurant applauded afterwards.    My daughter asked us sadly why they didn't sing for her. These things matters a lot when youre only 7-8 years old.    Things went even worse, when yet another kid was celebrated on stage to the kids entertainment show after the dinner (we hadn't thought of that possibility).    All in all it was a terrible evening and my daughter also commented it as 'the worst birthday ever - when are we going home?'.    I'm not very impressed by neither the reception staff nor the restaurant staff.
Nice pool area and good entertainment.

Al hacer el checkin nos informaron de los horarios y donde se ofrecía el desayuno, con lo que supusimos que estaba incluido en nuestra reserva. Cuando hicimos el checkout nos reclamaron 12,5€ por persona en concepto de desayuno. Los precios no los tienen publicados en su Vouchure, pedí hoja de reclamación y me dieron un folio en blanco, solicité hablar con el responsable del hotel y la recepcionista me dijo que era ella y no había posibilidad, a la vez que me reconocía que quien hizo el checkin fue una becaria y que podría haberse confundido. Dado que estábamos de ruta no pude perder más tiempo en esperar a la policia pero me hubiese gustado.    A parte, las habitaciones están llenas de mosquitos, moscas y arañas.    ¡¡NADA RECOMENDABLE!!    ***************************************    Upon checkin we were informed of schedules and where breakfast was offered, so we assumed it was included in our reservation. When we made the checkout they complained 12.5€ per person for breakfast. The prices are not published in their vouchure, claim form asked and got a blank page, I asked to speak with the director of the hotel and the receptionist told me she was and there was no chance, while she recognize that whoever made the checkin was a trainner and could have been mistaken. We were not able to waste time in waiting for the police but I would have liked.    In addition, the rooms are full of mosquitoes, flies and spiders.    NOTHING holiday!

1. Efficient friendly reception - arrived early and we just asked if we could leave our luggage in the luggage room until later. Rather than that though, the young lady checked the booking system, found a room was ready and we were able to check-in immediately. Very much appreciated as we were able to shower

Only negatives :  1. Air Con wasn't too powerful. Granted the weather was exceptionally hot, but I have had better Air Con in other Holiday Inn properties.  2. Lighting in bathroom a bit dim. Could have done with a light directly over the mirrored wall for shaving purposes.

Great location and clean facilities. Staff were very helpful in assisting us with existing tour bookings - assisted us with changing a date and following up on late pick-ups via telephone which was most appreciated.

Great location and clean facilities. Staff were very helpful in assisting us with existing tour bookings - assisted us with changing a date and following up on late pick-ups via telephone which was most appreciated.
Very helpful and friendly staff. They gave us clear and concise directions to various tourist spots and were quick to help my partner when she hurt her foot.

Lovely modern hotel, spacious room, super comfy beds, lovely bathroom. professional and courteous staff with nice pool. Really enjoyed my stay and felt the standard of the rooms and service was very good. Good value for money.

I was sent an invitation to have a complimentary cocktail at the bar, however i did not take the invite with me (as it did not say i needed to present it to redeem the complimentary drink). Upon checkout the hotel charged me for the drink, and when i explained i didn't realise i had to take the invite with me, the hotel staff member then advised that i would still be charged unless i provided her with the original invite, as it had a unique code. Thought this was a bit silly when they could have noted it on my room notes that i was given this, rather than me having to "prove" this. Small hiccup in an otherwise lovely stay.

The Tivoli Marina Hotel is excellently located to the Marina and the gorgeous beach.  This enables you to enjoy long walks along the beach during the day and relaxing on a sun lounger to enjoy a good book, while enjoying the peaceful sound of the waves.  At night the Marina comes to life and is nicely lit up.  The hotel enables the ladies to wear their high heels as everything is on your doorstep.  The Marina spoils you for choice of places to eat as there is no shortage of really good restaurants.  The swimming pool at the hotel is excellent and you can enjoy a relaxing day sunbathing.  The room service staff are very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are kept very clean on a daily basis.  Towels are replaced regularly (twice daily).  The breakfast buffet is extremely good, we really enjoyed a freshly cooked omelette every morning, fresh fruit and cereal.

The decor was a little dated and could do with some updating.  The balcony in rooms obstruct your view, which is a little disappointing.  The price of alcoholic drinks by the pool were very expensive, too pricey.  Drinks in the bar were also too expensive.  Would have liked more entertainment in the sidebar.  Music finished at midnight.  The hotel use to have a saxophone player or a pianist which was very enjoyable.  We feel the side bar has lost its original lively atmosphere of years gone by.

This Hotel is basic and what you would expect of a 3 star. I stayed here with 3 friends and my boyfriend for 1 night. We were all on a budget and needed somewhere central in London to stay so that we could go shopping during the day and go out that night. We only used the Hotel for somewhere to leave our bags and shower and sleep. And it was perfect for that!!!I would not go here if you are looking for a luxurious Hotel with great facilities.....perfect for people on a budget though who still want somewhere clean and to be in a central location. The staff were friendly and allowed us to check in much earlier than 2pm so we could go shopping and they also took care of our bags til the following evening until we checked out.

Hotel and staff were excellent. When we turned up they didn't have a record of our booking but the staff were nothing but courteous. We were offered a complimentary drink whilst we waited on them sorting it out then when it was time to check in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a delux room! The room was lovely, very spacious with all the usual amenities. The location was also excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if we can get as good a deal as last time we would definately go back to this hotel.

The hotel manager (Jeffrey) was very accommodating and clearly wanted every hotel guest to enjoy their stay.  Despite it not being clear on hotelopias website that check in at the hotel is 3pm, we had arrived at 0930 to discover this news.  He kindly checked us in ASAP at 1230.  The food available in the all inclusive package was fantastic. We had a basic room and it was very comfortable, clean and of great size.  It was clear that all the staff (cleaners, entertainers, reception staff, chef, waiters) at the hotel enjoy their job and take pride in doing it well.

There are 3 pools at the eden andalou hotel, and one of them some distance from the other 2 pools.  But despite this, the main pool, when playing music, during their poolside activities was Unbearable! For those who wished to relax, yo couldn't.  There was no escape from this intrusive loud music.  Fortunately each "blast" of music only lasted 30-45mins and ear plugs were enough to dampen out the noise.  I understand that not everyone wants to switch off and relax while away, but of this music was only quieter, I think there would be no complaints!

I thought the Riad was amazing. The staff did everything they could to be helpful. Our room was beautiful and comfortable, with a good hot shower and effective air conditioning. There are numerous beautiful shady rooms to sit in inside as well comfortable sofas and tables to eat breakfast on the terrace.  Overall this was fantastic value for money.

First visit to scotland and very enjoyable stay. Large, spacious room and bathroom, very clean and comfortable. Ordered room and tray service which arrived promptly. Excellent leisure facilities. Rooms are very clean and are equipped with everything you need for a short business stay. Bed was very comfortable and selection of firm and soft pillows excellent. The TV had a good selection of channels which is useful when travelling on your own. The location of the hotel for me was fantastic, so close to where I needed to be.
Rooms are not particularly big. Hot breakfast was pretty inedible, but the selection of cereals, juices and pastries made up for it.

Very fresh hotel with amazing water-slides and pools. They have a lot of water-slides for all ages, from the youngest to very fast ones. Your kids will just love them.    Beach was clean and plenty of space.      Food is very fresh and excellent, the best kebab (in the small restaurant) was one of the best I ever have had. They have an amazing wall of amazing desserts.  You should definitely try their home-made Turkish delight, you will not regret it.     Personnel were polite and professional.

The hotel had been open for 2 weeks and they were short on personnel on occasions.     The main dinning room could be a bit chaotic due the large number of guests. The guest being mainly Russians didn''t help either. They should redesign the dinning-room in order to minimize the queuing.

The outdoor pool area was nice. The attached restaurant to the hotel was delicious. The staff were very nice. I really liked that they had a complimentary instant coffee/espresso machine thing out in the lobby for the guests, along w/ ice water.

I was travelling w/ my husband and 5 month old baby. The "crib" that this hotel provides is a Graco Playard. It wasn't overly comfortable for my daughter. I'm glad I brought my own that had an attached bassinet. When I had called to ask what kind of beds they had to offer for babies, I was told they have cribs. I was expecting a wooden crib with locking wheels or something. Maybe the staff can be informed to describe the provided "cribs" as play pen's. Not a huge issue, just one thing I wasn't overly thrilled about. I'm assuming most hotels use these for their baby guests.    We also had an issue w/ our bed the first night. I guess they had just changed their mattresses and our was apparently missed as it felt like we were sleeping on an air mattress that wasn't blown up all the . My husband and I kept on rolling in to the centre. I wasn't about to go complain in the middle of the night to change rooms as my baby had JUST fallen asleep after an hour of screaming her head off. In the morning, I informed the front desk of this issue, and they quickly got us a new room, a much better (larger and nicer) room, plus they gave us complimentary breakfast and free parking for this inconvenience. So, they definitely fixed our problem accordingly.

loud music by the pool- we were the only guests at the pool so i asked for it to be turned down and it was, so wasnt really a problem.

I like a few days in Valencia after the FIB festival in Benicassim and is an easy 75km travel by bus or train. I found this hotel 3 years ago and have used it for a 2/3 night stay each year since with friends and my children. Its location for a traveler is faultless, 300m from Colon metro station which in turn is a 20 min metro ride straight into Valencia airport.Value for money it most certainly is, a great base from where to explore the city, located in the old city just round the corner from the main historic sights. Friendly and helpful hotel staff, and clean rooms with adequate facilities. Having found this hotel for the money I do not intend to use any others when visiting valencia.

Possibly the worst hotel ever. Booked a double room and got put in a twin. Despite repeated complaints to staff they refused to do anything and were incredibly rude. The shower had bursts of incredibly hot water which caused a scalding injury to my girlfriend. Anyone incapable of jumping out of a bath would suffer severe burns. Operating the tv required a launch sequence more complex than the space shuttle and even the person sent to fix it struggled to work it out. There was no complimentary water and a small bottle from the minibar cost 7 soles. We attempted to book a taxi to the airport and they said the charge would be 25usd, compared to just 15 soles we had been charged at another hotel. When we asked the concierge whether she would pay that much for a taxi to the airport she laughed. Do not stay here.
