We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel! Very spacious, and a great location - walking distance to Paddington and to Notting Hill. We'd read reviews that suggested requesting a room with a view of the park and on one of the higher floors (to avoid the road noise), and we were granted our request so were very impressed with that. Breakfast was also very pleasant. Good selection with a continental breakfast as well as the English breakfast we had included.
People walking outside our bedroom in the morning woke me up due to the creaky floors, but the age and character of the hotel was quite nice, so we didn't mind the tradeoff.

Good sized rooms, clean and well equipped. Good off-road car parking. Very efficient organisation of paperwork and key pick-up. Overall we were impressed and would stay in the Spires appartments again.

The hotel exceeded our expectations so we do not really want to provide negative views. However, we realize that you are constantly trying to improve so we provide the following comments:  1) We were surprised that the bins in the yard did not allow separate disposal of glass, tins, paper and general waste. You should endeavour to improve your environmental signature.  2) A few more coat hangars would be useful. 4 each is not really sufficient for a week  3) Though we did not expect to have a TV in the bedroom it was frustrating to find that the aerial was insufficient to provide a good picture on any channel. Suggest you either upgrade the installation or remove it.

I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the room given the fairly cheap character of the accommodation. I have stayed in more expensive places that are of the same standard so it was a pleasant surprise. I think we got value for money and the staff were very obliging and friendly. The food was excellent and we were well looked after because we had no major issues to deal with so all in all it serve its purpose of a short stay, very well.

There is clearly a management issue however. On several occasions the lovely lady on reception was not only managing people checking in etc but also serving drinks at the bar and ealing with all number of problems around the hotel, totally alone. Also the restaurant was staffed by friendly people who you felt were dealing with a situation that had taken them by surprise. There were frequently occasions where a lot of people wanted to dine or sit and have a drink and the staff was not able to cope. This hotel clearly attracts a lot of visitors for its convenience but this should not be a reason for neglecting the fundamentals of customer service i.e adequate numbers of staff on reception, the ability to order a drink on a very hot night after 11pm or food for that matter. I witnessed a family group of 8 Swedish tourist wishing to have dinner. Upon the father turning away to talk to his wife, two staff members commented on the clothing he was wearing. Not nice or necessary given that the customers are paying and perfectly polite. ( not to mention it is totally unprofessional) I feel that some management could really address some of these issues because the basis is there with very friendly staff already.

Beach and pool are phenomenal. The beach is sandy with a few pebbles when entering the water, and after that just sand, and the pool is saltwater. There is a pool for children and a small slide. What we like best is that there are no crowds and dinner is fantastic, local cuisine. There are opportunities for many sporting activities: billiards, table tennis, basketball, soccer, volleyball. A beautiful place for a peaceful holiday.

lift was faulty upon our trip which wasn't a nice surprise as one would imagine being stuck in a lift for few minutes!:-). until common sense prevailed and we peered the lift door open only to find that the flashing lights and sudden halt in the lift didn't even venture past the original floor of entrance !?, so we peered ourselves out of the lift by opening the gap the door and found ourselves on the original floor where it had started!?....  On our first night, the windows seemed to not block out noise from the busy streets very well?, but with the volume of the tv or soft music in the background, we soon were able to have a peaceful sleep. The rest of the nights our busy adventures/excursions had during the day,  just tired us out so the minute our heads were on pillows, it was all lights out ! :-)  NOthing very major anyways, just honest feedback.

Nice room with a cnd Iomfortable bed. Really powerful shower! Nice massage

The service at this hotel is unfortunatley not that of a 5 star hotel. At breakfast they do not replenish food very often and we had to ask for plates, then bowls, then milk at the buffet breakfast. When we arrived we asked at reception for an ice bucket for our champagne we had bought with us - it didnt arrive and we rang to chase it up 45 mins later. The staff at the pool were very slow to do what I presume they are paid for which is getting your towels and drinks when required. If they had been more attentive then we would probably have spent more money on snacks and drinks however youneeded to find one and try and catch their eye or go up to the bar area. The first night we didnt get their till about 10pm and they told us that the pool bar was doing food till 11pm, they didnt look pleased to see us though when we turned up at 10.30 and we were just left standing their while they chatted and grumbled to themselves then gave us a table. They then got our drinks order wrong (left the rum out of the rum and coke) and forgot then to bring the next lot of drinks and we had to go and find the waiter and ask him if he was going to bring them - he had forgot. The hotel is quite a nice building but does not have 6 restuarants as it is marketed as having. One restuarant we knew was going to be closed but even with that one I still cant make it anymore than 4 places to eat?  We always try and go to a 5 star/luxury short break once a year and unfortunatley the staff here let this resort down and make it feel more like a 3 star. I would suggest that the manager visits the Four seasons in cyprus and experiences the 5 star treatment and service there and keeps a closer eye on what his staff are doing/not doing.

Well situated close by the Atlantis centre for shopping or attending shows at the Zenith venue. If there are any other free hotels in London, book that one instead for this hotel. First night when we arrived, they gave us rooms in the cellar without windowsor aircondition! The extra bed was placed on 2 differentfloor levels in the room so the middle part was standing in the air. Of course we complained and next morning we got other rooms. In one of the rooms, air condition was stuck and it was freezing the whole time. In the other room air condition was not working at all and it was  30 degrees the whole time. Thank good we had a window! We complained about aircondition every days, their staff visited the room and said they were going to fix it - but nothing happened. They always had an excuse to blame someone else. We stayed at this nightmare for 5 nights - never again!

Great hotel, as you'd expect. Comfortable room and very clean. Our room had great views of the city.    The staff were great but a very special mention needs to go to the doormen. We had no research going down there while waiting for a taxi the doorman engaged us in conversation. We left with the knowledge to get pretty much anywhere in the city and what bars and restaurants were worth visiting.    While we didn't get to them all any recommendation he made was spot on. Wanted to thank him but he wasn't there the next day. But another guy was and he was just as helpful. I will be going back and also recommending the place to friends and family.

A very positive comment on staff in FC Edinburgh: we left FC Morrison very early this morning (4:30) and dropped the key in the internal dropbox. On our  to the airport we recognized that my wife had forgotten her glasses somewhere in the apartment. Off the bus, into a cab and back to the reception in Grove Street. Momentarily we got stressed as noone was there. However, our call at the phone number given was immediately responded and the FC watch person asked us to come to Morrisson at once. Apparently, he stayed there - when we arrived he had already located the glasses and met us in the door to the street. My wife was happy, and we reached the plane without further disturbances. Thanks, to the guy who helped us out!    Best wishes  Lars Brian Krogh

I phoned the hotel directly to ask about booking a room, as on the website it states that room only for one night is £180. It also states on the website that it is £150 for DBB. That's why I rang. The information that I got from the hotel further confused me, as I was told that the prices for room only were right, and that it was an extra £20 for B B. So £190-200 for B B, or £150 for DB B? Regardless I booked the room through a different website and got the room for £100. Even after speaking to them directly and asking what the prices were, 5 mins later I got the room almost half price online. All I can say is that from now on I will not deal with them direct, but go through an agent. Shame really ;(

Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel! Went for wedding reception but only going to evening do. Arrived just after lunch and the two reception girls were wonderful. Big welcoming smiles which made me feel happy straight away. They had seen the wedding room set up and were raving about it and we did check it out and it was fabulous! Our room 229 was large and had good quality mattress on the bed. A tiny tad dated but everywhere was immaculately clean so couldn't have asked for anything more. All the staff at the hotel appeared happy and all courteous. I also thoroughly enjoyed the vast selection of food for breakfast. You certainly would not go hungry here. All in all I had a great overnight stay. I did not use the leisure facilities unfortunately due to time. I am pretty sure however, that I will be back!!

Great location with fantastic views of Danube. Beautiful pool big enough for families but small enough that it doesn't disturb the guests enjoying the peaceful outside seating ares adjacent. The breakfast,which was included in our booking, was superb and had such a variety that after a 9 night stay We still hadn't tried everything that was available. My sons favourite was freshly prepared pancakes with maple syrup and hot chocolate to drink but full cooked breakfast, fresh fruit, cold meats and cheese, various fresh breads and rolls, cereals  and pastries were all available. The hotel was located five minutes walk from main station which took you to centre of Vienna in ten minutes. There was also Prater park which was a seven minute train ride or a 25 minute walk from the hotel. This was a free to enter fun park with rides, places to eat and attractions like Madam Tusons all at reasonable prices.

A main part of the hotel restaurant was closed during our visit and this may have contributed to the very limited restaurant menu that was available. The Hotel restaurant was very expensive for what you were being offered and eating out was a much better option. 20.5 euro for two glasses of fresh orange and lemonade was the final straw for me.

the royal Park ,we tried to get on the tennis courts and no body seemed to know how to go about it,there was a list of people on the gate of the courts, yet there was no one on them all day and the same case on the putting green no one around to get putting equipment, the putting green its self was in disrepair from a food point of view, it was  like a mass scramble from what seemed to be at a guess 98% russian people, they showed no manners what so ever, they acted like they had never been fed for weeks, they pushed through in the cues , piled there plates as if there were feeding there hole family, the food that was wasted was criminal, I have never experienced anything like it in my life, because of that my family and i including my sister and brother we all ate in other places off the complex after the first two days, it also appeared that all the food was catered for the russians. having paid over £900 compared to under £400 for my second week at the Land B i felt i would have been far better off staying half board sum where else,and using the money to feed my family instead of going all inclusive. the main reason i booked in at the royal park because a friend stayed there sum time ago and he recommended it to me, he also stayed there at a similar time to me and he was also bitterly disappointed,

The room I had was ok for a 3 star hotel. the bed had clean sheets and the W/C had been cleaned to the best of someones ability. This really is the best I can say about this dilapidated hole that relies too much on its dated and badly repaired decoration to hide the fact that it is poorly ran with almost no service.   WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU ON THE SITE!  Parking is on a first come first served basis, so be prepared to hunt down a parking area (as the staff won't help you).  So what if you booked a room 2 weeks ago.You'll need to find a parking space yourself (even if you are differently able, like me). It took me 45 minutes to walk back to the hotel from the parking space I found, as I'm on crutches and walking is difficult.  Graffiti in a hotel? Not even the good artsy kind either.  Because the clientele is not vetted, Don't expect a good nights sleep either.  I didn't actually sleep in my room as I couldn't face the noize. I collected my bag from my room and left the hotel in the early hours of the morning.

During our stay the hotel lost power three times, there was communication from the staff as to the reasons.  The location of the hotel on the web site lead you to believe it was within walking distance to the beach, this is not the case.  The hotel did provided a shuttle service to the local beach, but the drop off and pick up times left you with little time. You were able to hire a car from the hotel but this was quite expensive when you are only staying for a few days.

the bungalows had a nice aspect and pleasant safe atmosphere....the central swimming pool was clean and well maintained. the bathroom/toilet was of a modern high standard with excellent lighting whilst the bed was comfortable  and the bedroom nicely spacious. With no air conditioning units available keeping windows open was an important consideration, so the stylish security scrolling over the windows was reassuring. The close proximity to the Yumbo centre, it's shops,  bars, clubs,restaurants, transport/bus/taxi links is a major plus.

The kitchen facilities/units are very old and badly need modernising.....I don't understand why a  microwave oven isn't seen as an essential in a self catering facility. The lounge space needs better lighting.A modern wall mounted TV was nice to see yet only streams all Spanish channels......increasingly I expect to see,(as a courtesy) some English language conent and that means the BBC. In darkness the paths around the bungalows are in pitch blackness and some low level guide lighting would be a good thing.  I arrived at the complex after midnight and called out a receptionist to let me in.........a small welcome note/pack would be very helpful.

We booked through the web site Trivago. It had worked fine for two weeks in various parts of Italy. So we trusted that the hotel was supposed to be located 0 kilometres from the city centre, We even checked the street name on a map. When we finally found the street in the centre of Cagliari a friendly policeman explained that there existed a street with the same name, that was located about 50-60 kilometres from the city centre. So the hotel had pretended to be in the city centre, using the fact that it was located on a street with the exact same name as the street in the very centre of Cagliari. We were tired and close to the airport so we booked another hotel by the airport and slept there, as we had an early flight to Edinburgh the next morning. Pretending to be located in the very centre of Cagliari is a fraudulent and despicable  to fool unsuspecting customers. The hotel owner and staff should be ashamed of themselves. Worst thing is that they took payment from our credit card, even though we never found their hotel or slept there. Be warned!!!!

Staff at reception during check in/out were both cold and curt. The hotel rooms are in need of a refurbishment, the decour and facilities are extremely dated. Charging £13 a night for parking in a hotel on the outskirts of town is extortionate. Debuting £1 from my card  a "for charity" donation without bringing it to my attention first, but after, is fraudulent and dishonest. The hotel seems to be under the impression it can hide under the brand name and get away with a service that is less than satisfactory. I will not be staying at the Sheraton in future and will discourage others from doing the same. The entire stay was a disappointment .

The hotel has a very large campus with a number of great large pools and is very good for families with young children. It looks new as it has been recently renovated after being an casino.

There seems to be a lack of attention to detail at the hotel which made our stay at times irritating:  1) Often the staff would say we are closed or technical problem if a machine (e.g. coffee machine) was broken rather than trying to find a person who could fix the issue (perhaps there is a focus on speed, not quality of service)  2) The restaurant has long queues at peak times which could be alleviated by encouraging the creation of multiple queues for food (e.g. by having two dishes)  3) Often the kitchen staff did not start preparing the (e.g. grill) food until the dishes were empty, rather than continuously monitoring the food level leading to long waiting times for the food.  4) Quite often the labels for the food were wrong in the restaurants- e.g. the label said skewered egg plant with beef, but it was chicken (this is just one example).  5) When the prepared food had finished (e.g. chicken on a skewer) it was replaced by a food that was easier to make, e.g. grilled chicken  6) There seems to be no checking the staff of the states of the juices, milk in the restaurants. Quite often these were not replaced when they were empty for sometime  7) The opening times for the restaurant did not hold as the food in the main restaurant was removed approx 1/2 hour before closing time (especially for the evening meal). Also, if things ran out, e.g. percolated coffee, it was not refilled if it was within an hour of closing time.    After our stay at Bodrum imperial last year where the service was fantastic, we were disappointed by the service at seven Seas.

For two nights we could hardly sleep because of running and shouting and loud TV in the room above us. We specifically asked for a quiet room to get a few days of rest and then this. We were very annoyed, it ruined our stay. Why not put families on the ground floor?

Fantastic hotel for longer vacation stay. Beatiful garden and excellent pools. Good food and places to sit down and relax (outside your room) both inside and outside. Very friendly people and good service. Convenient location for just about everything in the Orlando area.

Rooms are under renovation. Looks like they still will keep this setup with the wash in the “bed”room (not in the bathroom). Dirty everywhere, cleaning almost not existing, Aircondition running, but not working at all (There is a regulator in the room, and our was on the coldest choice, 8 degrees celsius, all the time, but the room temperature never got under 28 degrees. The staff can adjust the aircondition from the reception, so you will never be able to reach the temperature you like). We were offered another room, but after talking to other guests we discovered that it was the same all over the place. Old bread for breakfast. Stayed for 18 days because the room was prepaid, and we couldn't get back our money. Same dust on the table during these 2,5 week.... Worst hotel ever in our 30 trips to greece, and we wont recommend it for anyone...

Girls on reception friendly and helpful.  Most of the porters provided a good service, except for one individual with an Aussie accent who was as  as sin.  Definitely not a 'people' person, had no customer service skills whatsoever - far from suited to the job!

Breakfast was a joke - inedible sausage and bacon.  The breakfast waiters were plain rude.  See one of them wipe a use plate with a serviette and then put it back on the table to be reused.  He also swept cornflakes back into the container with his hands.  The hotel appears to be being used by the local authorities to house the homeless, so various individuals just hanging about/wondering around, making the place look like a doss house.  I asked for a quiet room - the noise was unbearable with the 'riff raff' continually shouting and balling.  Best thing about my stay was GOING HOME!!!!

We arrived to check in at around 7:30pm.  There were 4 people in front of us waiting to check in and only one person on the check in desk so it took a while.  There were no comfy chairs or drinks so we just stood there with all our luggage.  In this time, we saw that 2 people got a free upgrade and 1 was given a room overlooking the harbour whereas we received nothing - just the basic room - I'm not sure why.  We were not given the code to access the Wi-fi and had to go back to reception to ask for it. We ordered a wake up call but insted they knocked on our room door as apparently the phone wasnt working though it looked totally normal and this obviously wasnt our fault.  We mentioned we were getting the ferry in the morning and no directions to the ferry terminal were offered - this was not expected but would have been a nice bonus.  Breakfast (full english) was £15 with an additional £5 to have it in your room! Crazy price for a relatively budget hotel so totally put us off at that price.  We got the same thing on the ferry for £5 (small) or £8 (big, including tea or coffee).

Hotel itself was really nice. Rooms were a good size and the pool area was lovely.

Sadly the food, entertainment and attitude of some (not all) of the staff was awful. I have visited Tenerife 14 times and I have to say that this was the first time I have had such a negative experience. The queue at the bar was terrible and only being aloud 2 drinks at a time was unacceptable. You cannot class showing birds with the intent to get photo as entertainment and the food was of such poor quality that we had to eat out on numerous occasions. Our 18 year old sons did not eat in the hotel at all as the food was so bad.   The hotel itself was really nice and it could easily be turned around. Additional staff on bar and possibly a drinks machine where people could help themselves to soft drinks (safe staff time), real entertainment with singers and dancers including a proper childrens disco with lights etc. For the food have some themed nights and in addition work out a better system for queuing.  Until these issues are resolved I would not recommend staying within this resort as it is not good value and you end up returning home disappointed.

The Connacht Hotel in Galway was a perfect place to stay for the Galway festival. Far enough away from Galway to be quiet and yet near enough to walk in to town if required (it took 30 minutes) or get a taxi (12 Euro). It was a much better standard than we expected and free use of gym, leisure and swimming facilities was a tremendous bonus. Really good cleaning in the room and throughout the hotel with lots of cheery and friendly staff. Hard to fault and for £125 a room (not including breakfast which was 10 Euro 50) during the Galway festival it was tremendous. Outside of the festival I noticed it was even cheaper so would be a complete bargain then
Not too strong a negative really, but we couldn't check in earlier than 2.30 although we could leave bags if required

Filthy bathroom and cold/lukewarm water in the shower!    On Hotelopia website we had a choice between €50 shared bathroom and €70 en suite room. We booked the en suite but got "standard room" email confirmation instead. The hotel staff claimed it was Hotelopia's fault not theirs. We got a room with a shared bathroom. Very unpleasant surprise.    No info about the check-in time (neither on the confirmation that I received nor Corrib Village website). It turned out to be at 4pm !! We arrived around 12pm and I had to change and do the hair and make up for the races in the toilet in the games room.    When we arrived to pick up the key in the evening we were directed to a room that was already occupied. The staff at the reception reacted as if I was making this up when I went back to tell them about it. However, they did apologize and found us another room quite quickly.

Our room was stunning with a breath-taking view!  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  We liked the green voucher program that rewards you for re-using your linens.  The location is perfect:  easy access to all the harbor front as well as Union Station.  Everything was spotless.  When we needed to use the free wifi in the lobby, there was plenty of comfortable seating.

Of the 6 nights we stayed there, there were 3 that were really noisy.  We could hear other guests in their rooms.  The lack of free wifi in the room is a problem when you're in a new place and trying to get information about where to go, what to do. The $16/day wifi fee is too much.

It's closer to the city centre than I have expected. As there are quite a lot of luggage, I took a taxi from Waverly Station to Chancellor's Court directly and it cost me only about 7 british pounds. Looked like a buffet breakfast but it was simply normal scottish breakfast. Be frank, not very tasty when compared with any cafe/resturant outside.

This hotel was great in every respect. Prime location with the sea right on its doorstep - wonderful to fall asleep and wake up to the sound of the waves outside. My first time in Gran Canaria: I will go back and will use this hotel again.

When I booked the hotel online I was told to pay a certain amount, a week before I arrived I emailed and was told it would be a different amount, when I arrived, yet again, it was even more than what I was told in the first place, I handed over the money after arriving  and I was short changed. Went to our room, it was two single beds, after paying for a double bed, no fridge, no kettle. A balcony over looking a side street. Really disappointed with this hotel, will not book again or recommend to anyone!

The whole experience was beyond any expectations. We had the most wonderful during our stay. We had a jacuzzi pool deluxe room which was lovely, nice big clean room, our large 7' wide bed looked  the pool and jacuzzi. Nice modern tiled bathroom, lovely large shower, big mirror in bathroom as well as bedroom, plenty of electric sockets, safe, fridge, large modern Samsung TV unfortunately no world BBC news channel.Nice white bed linen changed every 2 days, room included 2 pool towels as well as the usual which were all changed daily.

The breakfast is open till 10.30, we were normally there about 9.00, the first thing you have to do is find a table that is not taken or filled with used plates and cutlery, when you find one you then have to set it with your cutlery, but then there will be no knives or forks or spoons, so you have to get a member of staff to get cutlery, when you do get these you then set your table, then you go for fruit juice, these will be empty, get staff to refill, they will then put in a couple of litres which is finished within a couple of minutes, so dont bother thinking about a refill, you go for a glass, no glasses, ask staff for glasse, take juice back to table and somebody has taken your cutlery because there is none available, I would have toast, the first day trying to get butter was an absolute joke, there were guests screaming for butter, staff would bring out 2 or 3 portions, these were away within seconds, went for beans to put on my toast, none, ask staff, they were put into their containers on the hot bath, stone cold, I did'nt know this until I tasted them, guests were helping themselves to stone cold beans. Fancy a coffee, if your lucky there might be a cup.  There is an abundance of fresh fruit available in Thailand and its cheap and beautiful, not here tho, when its put out its away within seconds because not enough is being put out, I had 7 breakfasts and managed to secure fruit twice, it was only watermelon at that, no dragon fruit or mango here.  The staff wander about chatting to each other as if there is nothing to do, tables are needing cleared, food is needing replenished, there doesn't seam to be a leader directing the staff.

Fancy a coffee, if your lucky there might be a cup.  There is an abundance of fresh fruit available in Thailand and its cheap and beautiful, not here tho, when its put out its away within seconds because not enough is being put out, I had 7 breakfasts and managed to secure fruit twice, it was only watermelon at that, no dragon fruit or mango here. Funky, modern and stylish. Compact rooms (known as cabins) very cleverly thought out and designed by those skilful people who create the seats in the pointed end of aeroplanes... and it shows, with their clever use of space and the attention to detail that so many hotels don't have; such as a tray in the room so you can carry your complimentary drinks and muffin back upstairs; a strap to hold the lid of your suitcase open when it's on the stand, built-in alarm clock, storage space under the bed and mood lighting which activates when you enter the room. No super-frills like a shower cap and small bottles of useless toiletries, but the large, refillable bottles were great as they show an environmental awareness. No brewing-up in the room either, but each floor has a 'galley' with cold drink vending and as much free hot tea, coffee and chocolate that you can manage to consume. The beds in the smaller rooms fold upwards to make a daybed-style sofa which is pretty neat. I have to mention the luggage storage area in the main lobby: a fantastic robot which whisks your bag away into a safe and secure wall with much more style than a concierge could ever manage! All-in-all, I would definitely recommend this hotel for all the points already mentioned, plus the fact that its location is perfect for everything that NYC has to offer.
The extractor fans on 'Four' could do with a clean! The area smelt pretty badly of fried food at one point - not great...

Reception staff were v friendly and helpful.  Most of the porters were also v helpful, with the exception of the Aussie guy who was on when I arrived - he had a degree in rudeness and bein !!  There was also a Spainish porter on duty.  He was very helpful.  The bedding and towels were clean.

The breakfast was horrible - inedible sausage and bacon, plus the waiters were horrible - they also were very rude/surly and definitely didn't suffer with job satisfaction!!  They also had some bad hygiene problems - I see one of them wipe a used plate with a napkin then place it back on the table for another person to use.  The same guy also swept up some split cornflakes with his bare hands and then threw them back into the container.  The best thing about my stay was GOING HOME.

Really didn't like the idea of time share that everyone tries to push on you. The fireworks on Friday night would be much better is guests didn't have to pay additional fees for the poolside seats that are normally included in resort fee. Lovely character to rooms, great sea view and excellent value. Excellent location. Leisure club and parking facilities a welcome bonus.

Breakfast was organised but there were frenetic amounts of activity from the waiting staff that made it difficult to relax and eat calmly.Waiters were running up and down the aisles collecting plates, and with hot pots of liquid too. Waiters were walking so fast to replenish food stocks that I witnessed 3 guests getting bumped into by accident but quite forcibly. and frequent spillages of juice from the waiters around the cereal section. My father is disabled and he was told the breakfast room could not accomodate his mobility scooter so he would have to transfer to a chair at breakfast. My father is paralysed in his lower body and could not possibly do this. He was offended to be told at breakfast time that he could not be accomodated and it was apparent that the breakfast greeter was not aware of disablility issues. The breakfast room needs to be less tightly packed with tables/chairs and more provision pf space made for guests who are disabled and in a wheelchair or mobility scooter.  Also at breakfast I asked for vegetarian sausages which I had to wait 20 minutes for - my father had to wait the same length of time for porridge too. Would it not be better to have an urn of porridge for self service and to have a small amount of vegetarian sausages on the hot plate that are replenished when low.

This hotel is very clean and extremely comfortable.  All staff are friendly and helpful.  Rooms are large with extremely comfortable beds for a great nights sleep.  In the room a fridge, microwave and tv are provided a walgreens store is directly across the road to get supplies of drinks.This hotel has it's own private beach which is relaxing and has clean powder white sand, the water is clean and shallow and  safe for children.  Plenty of activities like jet skis, floats, canoeing, parasailing are available  but don't encroach people on the beach.  If guests want to go to the larger clearwater beach it is 2 minutes walk along the road, here you can walk for miles along the sans, but you will quickly appreciate the quiet beach at the hotel.  Would definately recommend this hotel, perfect location.
I could not say anything negative about this hotel.

Good hotel. Service was excellent. Very clean pool area. Good location, directly  the beach. A la carte resteraunts were a welcome break from the standard buffet. Staff could not do enough for you. The animation team worked tierlessly to enage with their guests.   All in, Very impressed !

Like most all inclusive hotels, the buffet (although good standard and plenty of choice) does become repetitive each night so would advise to make use of the a la carte resteraunts to break up your stay. Entertainment in the evening in the ampitheatre was inconsistent, some nights were good other nights were poor. Likewise the after show entertainment was good on some nights such as the beach parties but other nights consisted of a couple of cheesy singers around the pool bar. Only small issues, overall great hotel!

Hotelopia wrote that there was free wifi and 24hour reception. There is no reception and no wifi in this apartments, but there is 100 meters from there, in Hotels Goya where you have to pick up the key when you arrive(no info about that). We bought transfer through Hotelopia that was delivered by TUI. The busdriver lost a suitcase from another customer because he forgot to close the doors on the side of the bus. When people yelled, he just closed them while still driving.  He didn't know were Monaco was and asked a man in a bar and then droped us off in the middle of the street so we had to ask  in some stores.  When we finely found the Apartments Monaco there was no reception, but a sign told us to go to Hotel Goya. We were told it was overbooked and had to change to another Hotel 10 km. from there for 2 days. We stayed there for 1 day and then got our apartment. The closed smelled so bad that we could't use them. The bed in the livingroom wasn't made so we had to ask the cleaning people for an extra pillow and pillow case. The bed in the living room was broken, so we had to put the mattress on the floor. We showed it to cleaning people and hope it is fixed for the next family.  Nice holiday for 12 days. A lot of noise in the night. Will we go again ? Yes we would, because now we know what we are coming to.
You get what you pay for. Close to the beach.

We spent 21 days in big apartment (2 bedrooms   living room with kitchen). It was probably the best apartment and it was OK (the first, offered after arrival was depressing and we asked immediately for another one). The cleaning service (what is very importnat for us during holiday) was good. Very good swimming facilities (3 pools) aand no problems to get sunbeds and umbrelas any time of the day. Free Internet available in the lobby, it was also possible to connect the network from wnother hotel when being in our apartment.

Four stars hotel has to provide not only laundry service (which is offered), but also something for self-service. And there was no iron and iron board available for the guests in the whole hotel. It has   The deepest pool is in practice not available for the people with reduced mobility - there is stair to the water with 3 steps (olny). It is not a problem to get into the water, but it is very diffivult or even impossible to get out of the pool when the lowest step is about one meter above the bottom.

The location was lovely looking out  the water with easy access from the bridge.  Staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly the wait staff who attended to us in the morning at breakfast.    The rooms were very clean and the bedding and towels bright white and crisp.    The rooms were very quiet and the breakfast was excellent. The Prince William Hotel in Paddington London is definitely one to be avoided. From the moment you walk through the doors you are greeted by unprofessional staff who have very little customer service skills. The room was horrendous with badly broken laminate flooring, plug sockets hanging off the walls, water stained ceilings and walls and an unpleasant damp smell! We were left with no flushing toilet for a whole day resulting in having to walk four flights of stairs in order to use the toilet as the very dated lift took around 10 minutes to use! Very, very disappointed- ABOID AT ALL COSTS! This hotel, and I use the term loosely, has serious safety issues!

The hotel may be excellent, I will never know as hotelopia told me my reservation was booked, I printed off the voucher, got on the plane. Sent an email to hotel direct about a minor room request and was told hoteltopia had been sent an email to say the room was not available. Hoteltopia did not contact me then, nor since. They cannot be contacted by email, which is pretty hopeless when you are already travelling. The hotel after a day or two emailed back and said they could now fit me in and were very pleasant in their correspondence, but by that time it was too late I had to book elsewhere. I get the impression from hoteltopia reviews that others have had this phantom booking problem too.... Look up the poor reviews.   I don't know about this hotel apart from our emails, but they seemed to try to help. Hoteltopia have not communicated with me yet, other than this odd request in an email to judge a hotel that they failed to book me into.  I have some major reservations about Hoteltopia and its non existent customer service and would suggest you think carefully about booking this hotel through them, especially if they are showing room availability that other web sites are not showing.

Nice clean hotel.    Perfect food on the beach restaurant.    Very good location, next to the beach, near bus stops.     Easy (and cheap) access using the bus to Chania town center.

The hotel does not provide double beds because they do not have any. In every room there are only single beds that are pushed together to create a double bed......with single bed sheets!!!! (they do not have double bed shits).     The TV was an old fashion one that received only few channels!    They should put a hook on the bath so anyone who wants to take a shower can use it.     Removing the key card from the card slot disables all electric facilities of the room, including the fridge. They should make the necessary arrangement so the fridge can stay on all the time.     During our stay we realized that one of the two toasters at the breakfast buffet was broken. None fixed it, and every day was put out to the buffet broken.     The toast bread was also stale....we never manage to make a toast.    Also you advertise the hotel as a 4 star but the hotel documents shows that is a 3 star hotel!

The Hacienda is convenient to LAX, the food in the restaurant is quite good, and the bellmen are always cheerful and helpful. If it were not so, I would not have been a satisfied client for decades.     The newly refurbished elevators in the South wing make it much more agreeable to be assigned a room there. Last year it was very difficult to attain or quit the room.

A minor negative: the restaurant is no longer 24/24, a loss for travellers who are many hours out of phase with California. I was awake a few hours before the 5 AM opening hour, and would have liked to be able to eat, as I used to do.

The hotel is very easy to locate and you can easily walk there from the Santa Lucia Train Station, this is definitely a big advantage for hotels in Venice. It is surrounded by loads of restaurants and souvenir shops and it is very close to the Grand Canal.
The WIFI system has been a little bit complicated and annoying, you have to keep logging in in order to navigate online.

Molos Bay Hotel Kissamos - Crete: The hotel is a real 4 stars and even better. All was above expectations. Rooms are big, clean comfortable, quiet. The beach is in front of the hotel. The water is clean. For the first meters is shallow and is safe for children. The facilities at the beach (umbrella, beds and towel) are included in the room price like many other services like the safe, satellite TV and wifi. The swimming pool is also very nice. All  you need is available to make your vacation excellent for the best relax and comfort without unexpected hidden costs. The food is also excellent with a large and quality choice both for cold and warm dishes and dessert. Most of the food is typical of Crete/Greece, but you find also more continental/international type of dishes. Large is the choice also for  breakfast. The yogurt is really unforgettable. All product are really fresh and cooked by experienced cooks. The hospitality is above any other hotel/resort I have visited in more than 30 years. The personnel is always available to make your vacation the best. The Hotel Manager is indeed doing an excellent work. Special evenings are organized like the Cretan evening that was a very nice opportunity to taste Cretan food and experience typical music and dances. The hotel is also very nice located to 5 min walking distance to the center Kissamos village with its shops and restaurants. It is also favorably located to reach in 20 min by car the beautiful Falasarna beach and  within an hour the Balos beach (one of the most beautiful pristine in all Greece). Elafonisi beach (also one of the most beautiful) is a perfect destination for a day trip. Highly recommended to everybody for a perfect vacation or also for team building.
I do not see points that are negative!

Very Clean and nice hotel. Friendly staff in the reception but a bit stressed staff in the restaurant on the terrass. A Clean and nice gym as well thought lack of heavier weights. The heaviest one was 10 kg.

There are no hangers in the rooms so you don´t have anywhere to hang your wet bathing suits or your beach towel. Also the rooms lack litter bins accept from one tiny in the bathroom. In the shower you have no where to put the shampoo except for on the floor. The shampoo and soap you recieve on the rooms does not include conditioner so you must bring your own if you have long hair.   Also entry to the spa is not included but you get a discount and then it costs around 17 EUR but it should be included for that price you pay for the hotel.

Breakfast well, be there early or it's a total bun fight including the non English speaking uncooperative staff. Overall I am very disappointed and there was no attempted to rectify these issues upon complaint the morning after. Please avoid.

At arrival at the hotel, they couldn't find our reservation. Was told hotelopia hasn't sent the reservation through to them.  So I had no room. 4 hours later I got a call that they made a mistake and it was under my first name and not surname..  Lucky I had to go to a meeting for few hours but that's not the point. As I was so stressed out.  So then they gave me a room. But had upgraded me to a suite, and extended my stay for few hours and sorting my parking out.  Overall this hotel is very impressive, Raphael the manager and his team were brilliant and made sure I was compensated and looked after.     Hotel is abit far from Stratford cost £15 my taxi. But 25 mins by DLR which is very close.    The sauna, pool and steam room was amazing.    Breakfast is abit let down as its grab n go style.     But u can have full English breakfast in the fede restaurant for £12 per head!!     They are professional and made our stay very pleasant.  Will defo go back.
Can't say anything negative except the checking in process what they did to me on that day.  But they made up for it.    Do highly recommend this hotel.

Booked a twin queen bed room.  Plenty of space for me and my friend and the additonal features in the room such as the fridge, microwave, ipod/ iphone dock and filter coffee machine were great.  Bathroom was decent sized for NYC with good pressure on the shower and complimentary toiletries.  Dreamspa beds were just what we needed after over 7 hours travelling, very comfortable! Room was spotless. Complimentary breakfast available is just right to set you up for the day - bagles, toast, yoghurt, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, doughnuts, cereal, boiled eggs, tea/ coffee etc. no frills and plastic cutlery but that didn't bother us. There is a restaurant at the hotel which we didn't get a chance to try but always seemed fairly busy. Didn't get a chance to try the fitness facilities but free wi-fi was a boost.  Staff were helpful, arranged a cab for us to the airport and stored our luggage for the day when we checked out which saved us trailling it around the city.  Closest subway is just a couple blocks up from the hotel entrance. Would definitely stay here if I was in NYC again.

In my opinion there were no negatives, perhaps if you were looking to stay very centrally although as I say subway is close and it's only about 10-15 mins to get into the touristy areas.  Again, perhaps if you were looking for a luxury break but perfect if you are just looking for a room for the night whilst exploring NYC.

I couldn't make my weekend away due to my partner bein ill.. Tried to call from the Wednesday to cancel it to get full refund but couldn't get through on the phone eventually come the Saturday I had to give it up as a bad joke. Will never recommend this hotel to anyone as I am now nearly two hundred pounds out of pocket. I chose this hotel because it stated you could cancel before a certain time and date to get full or half refund, it would help if they would answer phone to you, so all in all I feel very let down by this hotel think it's a disgrace. I one very angry customer. I refund wouldn't go wrong

We were put in a room right at the end of a corridor. Not a good view of lake. Had to ask for another mug for coffee station. Sugar and coffee not replenished next morning. Which was reported and not dealt with water was still tepid the next night which happened to be a cold and wet night.. Buffet was mediocre and more than one guest complained that food was cold.  There is no attention to detail and guests are not made to feel special or welcome. We have stayed at other resorts and been treated better. Not a recommend. A staff member was having a squable with another which was aired. Just bizarre.

Highly recommend.

Ambience, Climate, location, setting, décor, space, room furnishings, jim Thompson terrace are all a very memorable experience. Will definitely revisit Cameron and no doubt stay at Strawberry park.

Food: While the chefs are good with the local delicacies, they may need to improve their skills on serving not so familiar dishes, in terms of portions , presentation which need to be appetizing.     Staff: while are courteous and I applaud them for that, need to improve on their customer handling skills especially in awkward situation. They need to be able to be confident in handling complaints, etc. Give you an example: food at JT terrace runs out (cos its a buffet) the rate of replacement has to be measured well, tables have to be cleaned at double quick time or else guests get irritated and scold the staff unnecessarily.  And guests may make the tables more messier, in the process there may be spill overs to the floor, broken cookware, etc.

The hotel is fantastic, fresh and good looking. The facilities are phenomenal with pools, pool areas and bars. Very nice ambience. Possibility to eat at the other restaurants is a big plus.

The service was well below expectations. Getting a beer food or a coffee could take forever. At the same time the used glasses could sit on your table the whole day with nobody picking them up. Getting the check took also forever. You would actually need to go the counter/bar to pay in 8 times out of 10. There was some people that really tried to provide good service (Anastasia) but if one tries but the rest doesn't it really doesn't matter.  The service is far, far from the 5 star hotels I stayed in the past.     Secondly, to have a 5 star hotel and not provide adequate wireless Internet is a big NO. In the era where everybody is connected at all time this was far below my expectations. Not having even wireless in the rooms was also really bad. If you come to this place to also try to do some work in the afternoon it's was impossible. The existing wireless Internet is really poor.     Personally, I'm not a fan of buffets so the "food for everyone" is not for me. Visit the other restaurants of the hotel where they can serve you food made for you or the Greek tavernas in Paralia instead like Bambi's

Hotel is a fair distance from Barcelona centre but very close to the Metro station and just €2 journey. The hotel is modern and clean, the room was well proportioned and had effective air conditioning. We found Rambla de Poblenou around the corner which has cafe's, restaurants and shops in abundance so no need to travel daily into town for the highly commercialised (and expensive) La Rambla - go for the atmosphere but you can find all souvenirs on Rambla de Poblenou at half the price.. Staff were very helpful, professional and courteous, they all spoke good English but were patient when we tried to speak Spanish. Despite the few negative comments (below), we enjoyed our stay and would return to stay there again in the future.

The Gym is very sparse, we specifically chose a hotel with a gym and were very disappointed, it has one treadmill, one elliptical trainer, an exercise bike, a very tired multi-gym and just two pairs of dumbbells (9 kg's and 10 kg's). If you want to run, the beach is just 5 mins away and full of people of every age and size running, roller-blading or cycling so go there and enjoy the view. The roof-top pool is lovely, great sun-worship areas, nice dip pool and a shaded area, however it is far too small for all the guests, if you don't get there early you'll not get a sun lounger - find a space on the concrete floor and lie on your towel! Hotel restaurant is expensive, 2 mins walk away Ramble de Poblenou is much better with wide range of choice and atmosphere.

Brighton not to far away. range of young travellers, close to amenities, good buses, felt safe. I showered early as to have hot water, but 4 of us had one and was still hot, get down for breakfast at 8 am as gets busy.

Bear in mind it is a hostel not hotel so basic facilities but for one night it does the trick,  May have to share even if you booked a dorm for your specific party.maybe ring the hotel firstly if booking through hotel rep. bring ear plugs ad eye mask as walls thin so you can hear talking etc. and windows have no curtains but are frosted out, make sure you bring cash as your be charge 5% using cards. no parking so again bring change as parking £5 11 hours.

Lovely little hotel in great location on edge of old town, tucked away in an area still developing but don't let that put you off. none, who would pay for this?

this is supposed to be a 4 star and I thought it was a deal for $50/night  It is up high on a hill so I assumed there would be a view, not so.  Apparently this is a con they run, in the lobby there is a sign saying you can "upgrade" to 3 types of better rooms with prices from  18€ to  50€ per night for "superior" and "premium" rooms  There is not a bus or metro stop close so you have to hike up the hill with your luggage or pay for a taxi. there is no airport shuttle  the wifi internet access required that you login to a captive portal to get access to the proxy. it would prequently log your session out while you were still active. Once "connected", more often than not there was high packet loss and connectivity/bandwidth was so poor (seriously, worse than dialup) that it was next to impossible to do anything (I had to write this review from another connection) the proxy would occasionally cause certificate issues with ssl sites too...  Packets: Sent = 279, Received = 212, Lost = 67 (24% loss),  the first room they checked me into was a matchbox and the phone and TV didn't work  night manager even admits the place is a dump and all rooms have problems like this  even all the vending machines in the lobby didn't work...  walls are so thin you hear everything going on in the adjoining rooms  rooms are cramped  beds are uncomfortable  bedspreads were stained  power plugs had no ground (aren't there building codes in Spain?)    additionally, originally I had booked for several nights but as soon as I checked out the room, I knew I didn't want to stay more than the night I was already stuck there. There were too many customers needing assistance so I spent 20 minutes twice waiting for one of the 2-3 employees at the front desk to try to help me.  Additionally, the manager refused to cancel the additional night and refund me so I had to take other recourses to get my money back  in short, the whole ordeal was a disaster...
none, who would pay for this?

The Hotel (in my view) caters for people on a short stay - waiting to catch a cross channel ferry from the U.K. and hence the difficulty on being able to access the North bound lanes of the A.2 road, this needs a detour of at least a couple of miles each time you leave the hotel wishing to travel north bound, and of course vice versa when arriving at the hotel from the south.

Hotel position is what attracts so many disabled and scooter plus wheel chair users.  Cant blame them for choosing the hotel. It's ideal for their needs.  The car parking is very good with plenty of parking spaces. Reasonable cost of £3.00 per night.  Excellent cabaret in the evening. Really first class.  Only stayed on a bed/ breakfast tarrif. The breakfast was quite good with a reasonable choice of food.

Overall cleanliness is'nt up to the mark. The outside area was in constant need of cleaning up after the smokers.  The dining room was not the cleanest with sticky tables and not very clean cut'lery. Some staff uniforms needed cleaning  Hotel management did'nt seem to care about looking after the evening floor shows in respect of children going  on to the floor while the cabaret was on. We felt sorry for one girl singer who was trying to give her best with two  young children dancing round and pawing her. Sorry but we wont be comeing back.

Needs some TLC. The room looked clean at first but on closer inspection there were old ear plugs in quite an obvious place that a cleaner should not have missed. The pool area had rusty brackets and looked drab.  We only stayed one night as a stop over before carrying on our journey. It was the first time in our Canadian holiday that it felt like we were on the tourist route. There was a constant stream of coaches of tourists arriving. The hotel was as I'd expected it to be, fine for a stop over but I couldn't imagine staying for more than one night. Went to Lake Louise and was really dissapointed. It's been spoilt. My advice would be to skip lake Louise all together. It feels like a tacky amusement park with a nice backdrop.

Hotel can be rated as good because of its employees only other wise I will rate it as bad. Staff are amazing and duty manager is always available to support her guests and to go the extra miles. She will mAke sure that you will have a nice stay.

Opinions are always subjective and depend from one person / nationality to another. For people who are seeking luxury and privacy have to avoid station 1 and 2 and have to go to Shangri-la hotel. Most of the tourists coming to Boracay are Asians hence there are no variety in the food which is mostly Asian food. Buffet and food provided should be international but in boracay and in most of the hotel it's not the case other than Shangri-la. The good thing about Astoria that is you just need to raise your concern to them and they will do the needful. I stayed 5 nights in Astoria and 2 nights in Fairways which is the biggest resort in Boracay having its private beach with very good value for money but I would say that I liked Astoria better because of the professionalism of the staff and especially the food.

I've never stayed at a hostel before but I expected it to be much worse. I saw a comment on a review online right before I stayed there and it complained that the pillows were too thin. The second night I was there, they changed all the pillows out for big fluffy ones. I quite honestly didn't have a problem with doubling up the thin ones, haha... Anyway, the staff were almost all trilingual and helpful. The place was cleaned frequently (and believe me it was necessary - some people are pigs) My personal opinion is that it is a great place to stay for a short while and meet interesting people.

Something they don't tell you is that internet access is ONLY available in the lobby which was the biggest bummer for me. The internet access itself is good though and you don't have to deal with a captive portal cutting you off every 5 seconds or 50% packet loss or shitty bandwidth. The A/C was too loud and only had ON and OFF so either you had to wear a sweatshirt to bed and ear plugs or a speedo and sweat it out. (this was August) The location is not that convenient for going to most places in BCN. Pere Tarres, if you're listening, suggestions in order of importance: 1) Better lockers, please, use those digital locks you already have on all the room doors and use metal lockers. Being able to open everybody's locker with everybody's key is rediculous. 2) Laundry detergent dispenser - you can even make a killing like with those vending machines you have! 3) You need at least 2 more elevators or at the very least program that fucker better so it doesn't always go to timbuk2 when somebody actually has luggage they need to take up to their room.

we stayed in the suite which was very nice. the hotel is located on Ornos beach which is well organised. we did not like the fact that we had to pay 12 euros for the sunbed/umbrella per day, given that we were hotel residents.

our reservation was an overbooking and we were very disappointed by the  handled by the Hotel's staff. They presented this overbooking as an 'upgrade' to a suite under the condition that we had to change a room after 2 nights. We had complained about this immediately and told them that we preferred to be given a 'normal room' in order not to change a room after 2 nights (given that we were there only for 3). But on the 2nd morning a rude brunette receptionist woke us up twice asking as to leave the room 'immediately'. The Hotel's manager showed very little consideration when we complained about this and she offered us some sort of 'help'. When we refused the 'help', she finally walked away threatening to charge us more for the 'upgrade' we had not requested. Finally, Hotelopia got in touch with them and asked them to stop bothering us. The same rude receptionist walked towards us the 3rd morning while we were having our breakfast to 'remind' us that we had to leave the room by 12 pm. We did not want to save any money, we just wanted not to re-pack, un-pack and re-pack in 3 days we stayed there and all we wanted is to get a good sleep/rest and breakfast without being bothered by the Hotel's rude staff.

We had a lovely clean apartment that was just the right size for us and our 10 month old son. The kitchen was clean and had most of the basics needed. The location was great - 2 mins walk from the underground and a bus stop right below our window plus several supermarkets within 5 mins walk. We also found a great park just around the corner with a brilliant kids play area.  Our shower head was cracked but fixed just a few hours after reported. Also the kitchen was missing a few basics (baking tray and oven gloves) but we were given them immediately when we asked reception.

The main downside was the lack of air conditioning. We were unlucky enough to stay during a heatwave and according to our sons room thermometer the apartment was 24C by 6am despite having all the windows wide open.  It's also very noisy as it's on a main road but that's the price you pay for staying in a city. The police sirens and nightclub noise made us feel at home as we live in a city centre back home haha  Also, remember you're staying in an apartment, not a hotel room so dont expect fresh towels every day or a maid making your bed. However we were given so many fresh towels at the start it really didn't matter.

We found the hotel was very classy, spotless, ample parking and the staff were very helpful and friendly.  I had requested a quiet room and I got one.  The bathroom was spacious and had both bath and shower facilities.  The decor throughout the hotel was lovely.
I would like to see more of a selection for the continental breakfast, such as fresh fruit salad, cold meat and cheeses, a selection of breads.  The cooked breakfast was very nice.

I would like to see more of a selection for the continental breakfast, such as fresh fruit salad, cold meat and cheeses, a selection of breads.  The cooked breakfast was very nice.
The rooms were large and clean. Nice with two large swimming pools and beautiful lobby/reception.

You are not allowed to bring in your own food/snacks/drinks or even water from outside the facility. The hotel won't even offer you free water, it costs 30 dirham for one bottle of water! The staff professionalism is really poor, it seems like nobody really wants to work hard in Morrocco... The laziness is seethrough and really bad service. We ordered a taxi for 07.30 to the airport for 100 dirhams which was a 10 min drive away apparently and the hotel packed us together with a different group in their minibus at 08.00 instead... The breakfast is really poor. Continental, so all you get is croissants and coffee. There was some scrambled eggs? that were mixed with milk and tasted like sugar.. Really bad breakfast so we skipped it after trying it twice. Not worth getting up for. I would recommend this hotel for people who have the energy to smuggle in food in bags, dont care about the service at the hotel and just need a nice looking room and pool. However this is NOT a 5 * hotel. More like a 3 *.

The hotel is clean and comfortable, very close to the train station which was ideal for us. The room itself was clean and we were more than satisfied. The hotel is very central so is ideal for all Southport attractions.

The breakfasts were a little disappointing as the food seemed to have been sitting on a hot plate for a while, meaning that it was perhaps not as tasty as it should have been (for the cooked breakfast options) however, we were happy with the pastries and cereals offered. The music from the bar was excessively loud on the Thursday night, so may be a problem for light sleepers or those with younger children.

We booked a family room, and ended up with two double beds, not exactly family oriented I think. The staff were unsympathetic when I spoke to them about the problem of having to have two opposite sex teenagers expected to share a bed.  I asked for more bedding so one child could sleep in a makeshift bed, the staff seemed uninterested in helping saying they had no spare bedding at all!    I asked where a local care hire place was the next morning, only to be told 'we don't have that type of information'. No sorrys, no let me find it for you, nothing.    The radiator was jammed on in the amazingly hot position, in an already hot August.     There was no air conditioning, just a rickety old inadequate, noisy fan.    And the wi-fi was laughable, working only in fits and starts.
The room was very clean and well appointed.

I asked where a local care hire place was the next morning, only to be told 'we don't have that type of information'. No sorrys, no let me find it for you, nothing.    The radiator was jammed on in the amazingly hot position, in an already hot August.     There was no air conditioning, just a rickety old inadequate, noisy fan.    And the wi-fi was laughable, working only in fits and starts.

Lovely hotel.  Very comfortable bed.  Excellent shower. very comfortable sun beds.  Towels for swimming/sunbathing provided.  Pool heated perfectly clean but quite heavy on the chlorine.  Toiletries quite nice but no hair conditioner.  Hair dryer OK.  plenty of hanging space.  Free wi-fi very welcome also two destop PC's in reception for free use.  Breakfast delicious with good choice of meats, fruit, cheese, tomatoes and bread.  Coffee machine with proper coffee, juice and water also.  We had one meal at the bar which was very nice.  Walking distance to city 15 minutes.  near bus station if you want to go to the beach.  The staff were all very nice and helpful, the common areas and the rooms were spotlessly clean.  The air conditioning leaves something to be desired though which is my only complaint.  I would stay here again and recommend to anyone.
Air conditioning not very effective

Centrally located hotel and easy to explore lower Clearwater attractions.

Ideally suited to young adults who like loud music whilst sunbathing on the beach. The 'private' beach was not so private as the live music attracted boats and jet skis from the local area. There were far too many boats anchored to swim and this made the water taste of petrol. Our booking was for 2 days, Saturday and Sunday nights, and throughout our stay the beach was very busy. It wasn't the relaxing, tranquil stay we were hoping for.

1. Location  - A short walk to the nearest Metro Station, about 5-10 minutes. Situated near plenty of Supermercats, where you can get basic groceries till 11pm. Not much traffic noise, but be careful when crossing roads as sometimes a green man walking doesn't mean it's always safe.     2. Rooms  - Spacious Rooms. Having two toilets were very handy and the balcony had a nice view.    3. Facilities  - Modern facilities available. Basic cooking utensils too as well as towels and some toiletries.    4. Service  - Excellent service: staff were friendly - happy to help. Easy to contact.   - Towels and bed sheets were changed every 2nd/3rd day, as well as a resupply of toilet roll.  - Granted permission to leave luggage temporarily at a secured room.    5. City Tax  Came to 17 Euros for 6 people. This amount will vary from place to place.    6. Other Comments  This is not to do with the hotel, but I feel it's worthwhile mentioning but be -very- wary of pickpockets when travelling by rail. Upon our arrival on the first train we got on, a group of girls tried to pickpocket us whilst we were boarding with our heavy luggage. This seemed like their normal "working area" as the confusion from scrambling on the train gives a perfect excuse to get close. I was fortunate enough to notice my pocket being felt that when I made a noise they scrambled off the train as the doors were closing leaving one of my friend's bags open. Luckily nothing was taken but the potential was very high. Two of the ladies were very youthful, they were also accompanied by an older lady.    It's also better to check the official website for this apartment as I believe they do offer Breakfast services when ordering on their site. Out of courtesy, I had given the category food 5/5 as the average score would've dropped if I had left it blank.      Overall, we enjoyed our stay here. The apartment is very modern, all European plugs, with not a bad location to begin exploring. There just needs to be some improvements towards the facilities, such as a lift to accommodate for heavy luggage, a stable temperature for hot water, additional seating and extra cooling/ventilation upon the other rooms.

1. Location  - Takes about 2h 30 to get to Girona airport via metro, train line and coach.    2. Rooms  - Air conditioned in the living room only, meaning other bedrooms were stuffy. No instructions in how to use the AirCon.  - Only four chairs available (excluding sofa) which made seating difficult, ultimately just sat on the sofa bed to compensate. One chair in particular felt very unstable and vulnerable to breaking.  - Double Bed was literally two beds aligned, as oppose to a King-sized bed.  - Lighting was fine everywhere except the living room, it was dim and ambient.    3. Facilities  - Intermittent hot water: was perfectly fine during the first day but after a while the water does have some trouble maintaining heat. Not just in the shower but in the kitchen sink too; when you want hot water you can hear the boiler beside the sink start up, but it takes about a minute before feeling any temperature. And then shortly after you can hear the boiler power down. Which means that you got about another few seconds -of hot water left.    - Similar situation in the shower, in occasion will it turn cold suddenly. But you just have to wait another 10 seconds for it to heat up again and within another minute it would repeat.    - Small bathroom toilet not fully secured in place, leans forward when you sit down.  - Lack of a lift made walking 4 floors difficult with luggage. Although there is a rope where you can tie your luggage to wrench up to the top floor, but it's a bit dangerous to operate.  - TV often had poor signal, and channels not accommodating for non-Spanish guests.  - Little washing up liquid available.

We really liked this place. There are two pools and both are kept spotlessly clean. The gardens are nice too. The rooms are basic but clean (the cleaner comes every day, tidies up and leaves fresh towels).  We found all the staff friendly, kind and helpful. We stayed half board and although the food was a little similar each day, it was always enjoyable and plentiful. The overall atmosphere was calm and relaxing. The hotel is only a few minutes from the beach and shops, yet quiet enough at night. The Turkish Night was good fun and the boys enjoyed the pool table and hotel cats!  We would certainly stay here again.

The Three Great Things About Elly Beach Hotel.  The first one is the Location, definitely one of the most beautiful views on the island.  The second one is the Location... and  The third one is... ques what?! No, it's not the location, it's Maria from the reception desk. She was very helpful and kind.   But that's all...

Food was terrible, it will have to pass quite a long time before I start eat pasta and minced meet again, I had it enough for two weeks, every day. It was basically the same choice of food every day.   Although the sunbeds belong to the hotel, they still charge 8 euro (no discount for the quests).

Nice pool with shallow end for children. Wifi worked fine. Tinghir had an interesting little market, and nearby you can see the walls of the old town, which are very impressive. A good place to stop because it is near the todra gorge where we all had a very pleasant paddle in the river! (To get here we rented a car and driver from Rostom Badrane tours - very happy with the trip (and their professionality), and we certainly recommend having a driver if you can find a good price. For 5 days from Fez to Essaouira prices seem to oscillate between 500 and 900 euro incl. petrol, car and driver). We were here during Ramadan but this wasn’t a problem at all! There were very few tourists and we would recommend it!

This hotel is like a brand new ferrari. It has all the makings to be a great hotel, however  it just needs some fuel to run, and the fuel in this case is the service.
