Bar prices  over the top. It's the only real downfall apart from the evening entertainment being a bit average at best. On the facilities we felt that the pool was sometimes dirty and gym under equipped. Not a 5 star hotel in our opinion but not far away.

Bar prices  over the top. It's the only real downfall apart from the evening entertainment being a bit average at best. On the facilities we felt that the pool was sometimes dirty and gym under equipped. Not a 5 star hotel in our opinion but not far away.

There were a lot of good things about this hotel.  Room is spacious and has a good layout, staff were accommodating (allocating us a room on a high floor when we arrived to check in, (although they had ignored 2 previous email requests for this), rooms were made up every day when we returned, valet parking guys RUN for your car, buffet breakfast was lovely (omelette station, fresh made waffles and pancakes, fresh fruit, cereal, etc, etc) and a good deal for us as the kids ate free with vouchers we got at check-in - $40 - $50 for breakfast for 4, Starbucks serves ice cream up to 10pm (yum), food at pool bar is good, choice of pools around the lake (there are 5 - one with a lazy river, one with e water slide), view of Epcot fireworks and the lake itself is a lovely sight.  We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek the previous 3 years and considered the Wyndham Grand because Hilton had increased room rate and added a resort fee, which doubled the cost.  I wasn't disappointed and we are planning a return trip to the Wyndham Grand next year.

Pool at hotel is small (compared to the Hilton), so can feel quite crowded when it's busy.  They could also use a few more parasols (they are few and far between).    Some of the sun loungers look like they have some mould developing on them (black spots) and some of them need to be protected from birds doing a bombing raid (the Hilton has some artificial bird noise that keeps them away - the Wyndham Grand does not).      Some of the pool side activities are more successful than other...glitter tattoos - good, pool side dancing - bad.    I don't know if there is an issue with sound proofing or if we just had rude neighbours, but we were twice woken early by a screaming child in the room next door (not a distressed child, a spoiled child) who was also running about the room and slamming doors.  On the second morning I called reception.  I don't know if it was co-incidence or if it was their intervention (they said they would send security), but the noise stopped.  We also had a noisy upstairs neighbour on one Saturday night - only 20 minutes but again, the issue for me was sound proofing.  Other than that no noise in a 15 night stay.    After 15 nights we wanted a late check-out (1pm instead of 11am) before our long return flight to the UK.  We were told we could have an hour.  That was cut to 30 minutes on the day of departure because the hotel was full.  Maid service works to 5pm, so I think if they had made a little effort they could have accommodated us, and they didn't, and that was disappointing.  In the end we left the room at 12.30pm and the maid hadn't appeared to make up the room, so it could  absolutely have been accommodated.    Food in the evening in the Tesoro restaurant is expensive - I'm sure it was $32 for a steak, didn't check-out the other restaurants on site, but you are 10 minutes in a car from hundreds of good places to eat, in all price brackets, so it's not an issue with staying here.    I hate the resort and parking fees, added $500 to our bill, but we knew it was coming.  Only place I have ever paid a resort fee and car parking charge.  Car parking in particular is just a money machine for Wyndham, and they're only able to do this because of the location of the hotel and the fact there are no other parking options.  It feels like they take advantage of you.  Whilst this won't put me off booking and staying again (I know the cost and it is what it is) it damages my loyalty to the brand.

There were a lot of good things about this hotel.  Room is spacious and has a good layout, staff were accommodating (allocating us a room on a high floor when we arrived to check in, (although they had ignored 2 previous email requests for this), rooms were made up every day when we returned, valet parking guys RUN for your car, buffet breakfast was lovely (omelette station, fresh made waffles and pancakes, fresh fruit, cereal, etc, etc) and a good deal for us as the kids ate free with vouchers we got at check-in - $40 - $50 for breakfast for 4, Starbucks serves ice cream up to 10pm (yum), food at pool bar is good, choice of pools around the lake (there are 5 - one with a lazy river, one with e water slide), view of Epcot fireworks and the lake itself is a lovely sight.  We stayed at the Hilton Bonnet Creek the previous 3 years and considered the Wyndham Grand because Hilton had increased room rate and added a resort fee, which doubled the cost.  I wasn't disappointed and we are planning a return trip to the Wyndham Grand next year.

Pool at hotel is small (compared to the Hilton), so can feel quite crowded when it's busy.  They could also use a few more parasols (they are few and far between).    Some of the sun loungers look like they have some mould developing on them (black spots) and some of them need to be protected from birds doing a bombing raid (the Hilton has some artificial bird noise that keeps them away - the Wyndham Grand does not).      Some of the pool side activities are more successful than other...glitter tattoos - good, pool side dancing - bad.    I don't know if there is an issue with sound proofing or if we just had rude neighbours, but we were twice woken early by a screaming child in the room next door (not a distressed child, a spoiled child) who was also running about the room and slamming doors.  On the second morning I called reception.  I don't know if it was co-incidence or if it was their intervention (they said they would send security), but the noise stopped.  We also had a noisy upstairs neighbour on one Saturday night - only 20 minutes but again, the issue for me was sound proofing.  Other than that no noise in a 15 night stay.    After 15 nights we wanted a late check-out (1pm instead of 11am) before our long return flight to the UK.  We were told we could have an hour.  That was cut to 30 minutes on the day of departure because the hotel was full.  Maid service works to 5pm, so I think if they had made a little effort they could have accommodated us, and they didn't, and that was disappointing.  In the end we left the room at 12.30pm and the maid hadn't appeared to make up the room, so it could  absolutely have been accommodated.    Food in the evening in the Tesoro restaurant is expensive - I'm sure it was $32 for a steak, didn't check-out the other restaurants on site, but you are 10 minutes in a car from hundreds of good places to eat, in all price brackets, so it's not an issue with staying here.    I hate the resort and parking fees, added $500 to our bill, but we knew it was coming.  Only place I have ever paid a resort fee and car parking charge.  Car parking in particular is just a money machine for Wyndham, and they're only able to do this because of the location of the hotel and the fact there are no other parking options.  It feels like they take advantage of you.  Whilst this won't put me off booking and staying again (I know the cost and it is what it is) it damages my loyalty to the brand.

Good staff can be the making of a hotel, and the quality of the team at the Villa di Piazzano was absolutely first class.  This delightful hotel was the perfect choice for 14 days of peace and tranquility in the Tuscan countryside, ideal for relaxing by the pool or in the peaceful gardens, or for walking and exploring the beautiful surrounding area.  The food was lovely, and the whole ambience was idyllic. I am sure we shall return one day!

Waited at ferry terminal for over an hour in the pouring rain with no shuttle pickup as promoted by hotel. Caught Lisboa Hotel shuttle instead. On arrival at Beverly Plaza Hotel, staff were not at all sympathetic nor concerned that we had difficulty getting to the hotel.  For a so-called 4 star hotel, the bed was hard and uncomfortable, there were no bathrobes and no coffee/sugar/creamer available in the room.   The shuttle back to the Outer Harbour Ferry Terminal deposited us on the side of a busy driveway and we had to make our  through parked buses and moving traffic - quite dangerous.  On checkout at the end of our stay, there was not even a simple "thank you" from the staff for staying at their hotel. We could just as well been invisible.  We will definitely not stay there again nor recommend tis hotel to anyone else.

We think this hotel is a find.  We prefer it to some of the glitzier airport hotels where you must tip every time you do anything and it takes a major procedure to order your car - pay $30.00 each time and plus the tip.  Here we just walk 100 feet to the parking lot next door and get our own, just $8 a night.  The lobby area is lovely, and we enjoyed the restaurant, as well as the dancing lessons they present every single night! It has a much homeier feel and the price was definitely right.  The bathroom was bigger than usual and you could actually take a real bath in the bathtub. The shower was a cut above.  No big slabs of granite, but more well designed, and actual hooks on the doors. Everybody we met was really nice and has worked there for many years - a good sign.  A good feel to the place.

There were a few minor problems - lightbulbs burned out (corrected immediately), major light on a timer that was set for  too short intervals.   Only thing not corrected during our 6 night stay was the dripping hot water faucet in room `1481 - we'll try again.  Please fix it - I'm a fan of the Owens River and hate to see it wasted like that.

I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Because we had booked through a third party and not directly with the hotel, we seemed to get lesser accommodations and meals.  Our first room  had a badly soiled and stained carpet, and warm water was only provided at certain hours of the day.  The lighting was bad, and only a trickle of water of cold water came through the shower.  We complained and  were moved to a much nicer room overlooking a gorgeous court yard -- no stained carpet, better lighting, decent water flow and hot water.  Our breakfast was only white bread toast, jam, coffee, and juice.  No eggs, fruit, or other offerings as we had had elsewhere in Peru.  The hotel had no useful maps or tourist information to give us.   The lobby and general areas are gorgeous. Overall, this hotel needs to:  upgrade the inferior rooms that have not yet been upgraded, provide a full breakfast to all, and have maps and other information readily available.  With these improvements this lovely facility would easily earn a "4."  The hotel is convenient to MALI (Museo de Arte de Lima) and to the lovely downtown plazas, and to the rapid metro system near the Sheraton which goes south to Mira Flores and other points.  Unfortunately, however, tourist oriented restaurants in this area are quite limited..

Very good hotel, big studios with comfortable accessories. Clean, without ants and without cucarachas. Free Wi-Fi access. Personal very polite and helpful. Very good director.

Sometimes the price is good, but often is expensive (it's a 4 star hotel!). Wi-Fi access only in reception area. Not good position if you want reach the beach by foot: you always need a car. Port de Pollença is a "normal" beach; the most beautiful beach "Es Trenc" is very far from here (on the south coast of the island).

The walls of the room are paper thin. We could hear our neighbors talk and when their TV was on. The beds were kind of lumpy. We also heard trash trucks early one morning, around 7 am, and other cars leaving the hotel parking lot. Basically, wear earplugs if you're sensitive to sound. We were required to pay a passport fee of $10 every day we stayed at the hotel, which we did not know about when we booked. The passport included a coupon book, internet access (which is usually free at hotels nowadays), a free 2 hour bike rental and some other things. It wasn't worth $10 a day. We ended up eating at Humphrey's one time because of the coupon book in hopes of recouping some of the cost.

I was given a room in the basement. It felt that I was in a prison with dark corridors. Even during the day I had to have all curtains drawn as otherwise people walking outside in the street could see through! Breakfast was also not very nice. In my opinion the description of the hotel was misleasding and no  I would rank this hotel as a five star.   When I checked out I was told that there was nothing to pay ( I had hotelopia voucher). When I got home there was a charge on my credit card. When I called and asked them about it and questioned why I was not told and given the invoice when I checked out , I was told that this was a mistake and they would E mail me the invoice ( am still waiting to receive). It is interesting that the charge they made had included government tax , addirional amount for something like charity and also a charge for using my credit card ( GB credit card) . I should have  been informed about all these charges at the time. A very bad experience with this hotel. I have travelled 15 times in the last 8 months and had always stayed in 5 star hotels and this was by far the worse hotel I have ever stayed in !!!

Nice rooms, well equipped, quality feel. Very clean, Staff friendly and professional. Great pool. No audible aircraft noise. Take free frequent public transport buses to London Underground station Hatton Cross (don't use Hotel Hoppa which costs GBP 4.50 pp one !).

The payment for parking (GBP15 per day) is high. But can't escape this in London it seems. Central London on tube is GBP8.90 for a day ticket and takes about 40minutes "door to door", including bus from hotel to Hatton Cross.

These apartments are in an ideal location, with only a short 5 minute walk to the beach and local restaurants. Close to local bus service which is cheap and very frequent to all locations including the Airport. Apartments are a decent size with most facilities you would require although a toaster or grill would be nice. The pool is a good size and kept clean with ample sun beds and umbrellas. The food is good value and quality although more of a snack menu not for an evening meal except for the barbecue on a Saturday night which is beautiful home made food especially the wine/sherry which tastes nicer after 5 or 6 glasses.

The rooms are kept clean although bedding only changed once in two weeks. Although I am sure if asked Maria, Theo or any member of the family would have changed it. We were a little surprised in having to buy our own toilet rolls, something we have never experienced before despite staying in similar quality apartments.

It is convenient to the airport, inexpensive, has parking (useful to me as I usually have a car delivered to the hotel the day of my arrival. I get the keys with no fuss about half the time, but always manage to procure them). Restaurant is basically Mexican, OK if not great. I have used the Hacienda satisfactorily for 20  years, will likely continue to do so, on arrival in LA, and the night before departure. Not a hotel I'd stay in more than one night at a time, though. The bell staff is very good, and the airport shuttle fine, every 15-20 minutes 24/24.

Reservation was not recognized, had to get out my portable computer and show that the reservation was made, and paid for. They tried to get me to pay a higher rate, and when I mentioned that I'd stayed there twelve days earlier, they insisted that I had been a no-show a day earlier, denied that I'd been there. A frustrating arrival on 21 August, let us say. I have used this hotel for more than twenty years, yet remain unknown to them, given little consideration. But it is a good deal, convenient and when things go right, worth knowing about.

Fantastic location and the beach was perfect. Short  to the city centers of Alacati and Çesme where the shopping areas are. The hamam was superb and the general facilities were great.

We had prepaid for a room with sea view which we didn't get, and they said that all the rooms in the deluxe section were the same, with barely any sea view at all. We had to stand at the balcony and lean forward to see the sea at all. The staff explained it to be an info error caused by the travel agent Hotels.com. But the worst of all was that a family came into our room with their own room key while we were setling in our room, much to our shock. They left in a second but not once did we get any apology from any of your staff. That shouldn't be possible. And finally, at the dinner we were horrified that we had to pay extra to get water to drink, since the dinner was included in the whole package. From all our travellings to a number of restaurants, that's the first time we ever had to pay extra for water. Unprofessional. We saw several times that the cutlery and cups and plates were not cleaned properly.

The hotel have too few elevators. The constant waiting for available lifts was dreadful! This is why I rated 2 points on facilities. It was very hot in London during the stay, and the lack of aircondition in the room was making it hard to sleep. I also find paying for wifi in 2013 unnecessary. The "superior" room seemed only to be classified as such because of the presence of one bucket chair.  The paint on the window ledge was peeling; the duvet contents moved away from the sleeper of their own accord; one bathroom wall had extensive mould on it; the silicone seal on the bath was peeling away; and, worst of all, the hot washbasin tap spat out boiling hot water machine-gun like at the unwary user.

The room was very nice and the hotel facilities met expectations for a 4* resort. The pool and spa facilities are a definite plus. The breakfast staff were accommodating to dietary needs (eg request for soya milk due to dairy intolerance). Our flight was was late in the afternoon but we were allowed to continue to use pool, shower, spa facilities even after check out.

Overall the staff at the hotel are rude and sullen, except for one staff member in particular. Despite being a non-smoking room, our room stank of cigarettes and was only treated with aerosol one time after we complained. We had the suspicion that it may have been the cleaner who was smoking because the smell seemed to return every time we got back to the room in the evenings.

This is an exceptional hotel and my favourite, I have stayed here before and I love it.  It's hard to stay anythere else after being in this beautiful hotel.  There aren't a million people floating around like the other big hotels, the grounds are magnificent and the staff are courteous and helpful.  I love the fact it has retained it's charm and hasn't been modernised. The Mai Tai makes the most amazing cocktails and is generous with tastings as well!  A lovely place to chill out or chat.
I would love to see a courtesy hotel shuttle to and from the airport.  I also do not think the hotel should charge fees for the beach lounges as this should be included in the daily resort fee.

the cleaning staff were really friendly and helpful - they went out of their  to say hello and help when we asked for directions, where to go, transport links, etc - they also gave us very valuable advice on where to go and where to avoid.  Breakfast was very nice, and there was a good choice of different options. Staff were attentive in there.

On arrival at the hotel, the receptionist wouldn't accept our booking invoice/receipt that we had from hotelopia, which clearly stated the price agreed when we made the booking - they insisted we paid a higher price. This resulted in numerous phone calls to try and sort it out. Hotelopia were very helpful, however, Swallow Hotel were not, and it took 2 days until they agreed the price that we had booked through hotelopia!   When we got to the room, we thought the key was broken, because when we'd unlocked the door, it wouldn't open by merely pushing with our hands, and we had to 'shoulder-barge' the door to open it. The room smelt musty, decor was very dated, there were damp patches, a hairball on the carpet, mould around loose tiles in the bathroom, and very noticeable handprints above the headboard of the bed.

Very little in terms of positive reviews. Rooms are fairly spacious. The room temperature control was working well although noisy. The water was flowing well. The staff although friendly communication in English was hampered, therefore complaints could not be acted upon promptly. Staff only speak French and some very little English. Beddings were fairly clean apart from towels which were very old and they need replacement. Wi Fi connection was available but only at reception so one had to move from the room to the reception area which did not have enough sitting space. The location of the hotel is in the CBD of Ouagadougou which is okay. The entrance is always crouded with hawkers. Security was good generally.

The rating of 2 star was exagerated. The bath water could not flow away fast enough so I bathed standing in a pool f water. At one time the towel was missing so I sued the sheet to wipe off water after bathing. I was joined by a fellow participant whom we met at airport and he had not booked. So he ended up paying after negotiation he paid 40 U$ compared to mine 66US$. This annoyed me so much and they refused to negotiate and refund me who had paid through my credit card saying the owner was in Cote Devoire and he could not be reached by phone. My room was Bed and Breakfast but one day when it was raining in the morning there were no staff to make breakfast for me and no refund of course. It is supposed to be rated one star not two and the cost of accommodation at around 30US$ per night. I feel cheated at 66US$ per night. My stay in Ouagadougou was good with friendly people.

Most hotels in Varadero are not comparable to hotels in other holiday destinations. Remember this is Cuba. But even compared to other hotels in Varadero, the Palma Real was not very good. We didn't like the food and also the staff was not very friendly. We stayed only 2 nights and changed hotels after that. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

We stayed at 2 different apartments - Janececk and one on the top floor (can't remember the name).  This was because we extended our stay an additional night at the last minute so the original apartment was already booked.    Very spacious with full accommodations in the kitchen.  Clean and quiet for the most part in a fairly nice area of town. Quick shopping and lost of restaurants nearby.  The staff was very good and worked with us to extend our stay.  They even offered to move our stuff from one apartment to the next!  Internet connectivity was terrific and they even gave us extra logins for our many devices!    The apartment on the top floor had more than enough room for our 3 teens and us with a roll away bed.  If it weren't for the top floor, I think I would recommend it over the Janaceck apartment just because you wouldn't have to hear the footsteps from the apartment above.

The location of the office where you have to get the keys is about 15 minutes from the actual apartment which can be exhausting after having traveled the entire day.  One of the cleaning people was quite rude on the day we were checking out.  We were about 30 minutes late getting back from a last excursion and he was very abrupt at telling us to get out.  The other person was very understanding and didn't seem to think it was that big of deal we were a little delayed.    U and S were a 15 minute walk so not exactly nearby.     No AC and the courtyard had a lot of noise late into the evening.

You get not the apartment you paid for. We paid for 5 persons and received an apartment for two.  After complaining they could only offer us an apartment with one bedroom with one two persons bed and two couches. The couches where metal staves stick out, which is very painful to sleep on.  After using the shower the floor outside the shower was completely wet which is very dangerous to glide. After complaining several times and after four days we could move to another apartment and again with less beds then we booked. For the breakfast you have to wait 50 minutes and was not served at once and not complete. (first jus d’orange 10 minutes later warm drinks 15 min later bread and croissants ) many times you have to arrange cutlery and serviette.  The equipment of the apartment is very bad. All the electrical devices (Airco, fridge and tv) are out of order.   The hot plates, water cooker were not available in the apartment and if you get one it is not working.  The towels are not available, you have to complain and beg for and get not one towel per person.   The towels are grubby and gabble.   Cleaning of the room was not done before 17:00 pm first you have to complain. Sometimes after 19:30 pm we have to complain that the apartment was not cleaned and the towels are not available.  In the hotel are vermin (cock-roach and lizard).  There is noise nuisance till late in the night.   The service is very bad and they do not provide you the service you ask for. When we ask for toilet paper or soap it takes more than half a day and you have to ask again for it before they arrange it.  WIFI was not available, we complain the first day and days after and after three days they fixed the WIFI and it was not always available and not steady.  The Airco in our bedroom was not working we complaint several times but they took no action. On our last evening they came and want to fix it which is too late after 9 days of complaining.  Several times a day we had no electricity in the whole hotel. They told us that the capacity of the electricity meter cupboard is not sufficient. Then on an Saturday morning there was no water in the whole hotel from 9:00 am till 15:00 pm. The hotel guests revolt and the police, representative of the ministry of tourism and a representative of the local authority came. The guests hand over their complaints.  Our Conclusion a very bad hotel. The manager and the hotel owner don’t provide the space (apartment and equipment) and service the guests paid for. This is Fraud!

You get not the apartment you paid for. We paid for 5 persons and received an apartment for two.  After complaining they could only offer us an apartment with one bedroom with one two persons bed and two couches. The couches where metal staves stick out, which is very painful to sleep on.  After using the shower the floor outside the shower was completely wet which is very dangerous to glide. After complaining several times and after four days we could move to another apartment and again with less beds then we booked. For the breakfast you have to wait 50 minutes and was not served at once and not complete. (first jus d’orange 10 minutes later warm drinks 15 min later bread and croissants ) many times you have to arrange cutlery and serviette.  The equipment of the apartment is very bad. All the electrical devices (Airco, fridge and tv) are out of order.   The hot plates, water cooker were not available in the apartment and if you get one it is not working.  The towels are not available, you have to complain and beg for and get not one towel per person.   The towels are grubby and gabble.   Cleaning of the room was not done before 17:00 pm first you have to complain. Sometimes after 19:30 pm we have to complain that the apartment was not cleaned and the towels are not available.  In the hotel are vermin (cock-roach and lizard).  There is noise nuisance till late in the night.   The service is very bad and they do not provide you the service you ask for. When we ask for toilet paper or soap it takes more than half a day and you have to ask again for it before they arrange it.  WIFI was not available, we complain the first day and days after and after three days they fixed the WIFI and it was not always available and not steady.  The Airco in our bedroom was not working we complaint several times but they took no action. On our last evening they came and want to fix it which is too late after 9 days of complaining.  Several times a day we had no electricity in the whole hotel. They told us that the capacity of the electricity meter cupboard is not sufficient. Then on an Saturday morning there was no water in the whole hotel from 9:00 am till 15:00 pm. The hotel guests revolt and the police, representative of the ministry of tourism and a representative of the local authority came. The guests hand over their complaints.  Our Conclusion a very bad hotel. The manager and the hotel owner don’t provide the space (apartment and equipment) and service the guests paid for. This is Fraud!
Breakfast ans location were very good. Upgraded to s superior room which was very spacious with a great bathroom.

We stayed at this hotel last week for 5 days, The room we had was basic enough, probably could do with a make over very soon, no tea or coffee making facilities if you fancied a cuppa, It was fairly clean the maid came every morning and left it clean and tidy. The food was very very good, lots of variety and good selections of everything. We went half board and had a choice of lunch or Dinner on a particular day. The shows were ok for kids at night but did come on really late from 10 - 11 at night.

I found the staff here very unfriendly and their english was very bad, The reception staff seemed to have an awful attitude and quite abrupt at times,There was one guy in the bar part where the shows took place was very helpful and friendly, I heard he was there quite a long time he was the only person there that was friendly.  If you wanted your fridge turned on in your room you had to pay 21 euros including10 drinks, you would think this would be included inyour room price but not with this hotel. Their werent enough sunbeds at the pool either, their was a running match at 7.30 in the mornings to reserve sunbeds and you would never get one if you left it later, although the lifeguard would have lifted towels from their beds if they were empty for an hour but not very often.  The pools were quite deep also, Their is a baby pool as well although a lady told me she wouldnt let her kids into it as it doesnt be filtered.    We were checking out on saturday and our flights werent till late so we asked could we keep the room for a couple of hours, The guy on reception was so uptight and abrupt it was a definite 'NO'  staff altogether.    In general its just an ok hotel if you can speak spanish you'll be ok. Food was lovely and rooms were ok but clean and thats the main thing i suppose but I definitely wouldnt go back to this hotel.

Dewani Villas is like a mushroom villa'd fairy tale.  On arrival I was welcomed warmly and shown to my gorgeous villa, with huge round bath and private terrace.  The room was massive and cool with airconditioning.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at Dewani.  The free shuttle is a bonus, and Keobokan is peaceful, yet not too far away from all the happenings in central Kuta or Seminyak.  The oustide pool was so relaxing especially after a long day at the beach.  I stupidly forgot my bikini at the villa, and asked my hotel at Sanur to call Dewani to see if they could post it to me.  Dewani actually dropped it the very next morning by 10am via scooter.  This was very surprising and I was so grateful that they would go to this trouble, as I'm sure it was more than 40 mins away.  All in all my stay here was a wonderful  to start off my adventures in Bali.  Thank you Dewani Villas.

Average score should be 4.4!! We did not eat in the hotel, therefore I did not rate it. But the system calculates it as a 0 and lowers the average score.    It is very well located: 10 minutes walking from the beach; 2 blocks from the metro L4 (yellow) and 3 from L1 (red); Bus lines that goes directly into town centre (Placa de Catalunya).  The hotel is very spacious and has a good infrastructure.  The room is has good facilities (clean bathroom with shower in the bathtub, toilet and bidet), HD television (not that you need it!) and an air-conditioning that works.  The staff is friendly and always ready to help!

At check-in a deposit of €50/night was requested. We did not have this amount nor a credit card. After negotiating with the manager we were able to settle for a deposit €50 in total, but they emptied the mini-bar and we were not allowed to put anything on the room (pay for the drinks at the bar).

Most unfriendly staff I've ever experienced, to the point of surprise on almost a dozen occasions. They are very friendly to other Cubans however and not all of them were unfriendly, Kareina, at the front desk, was very helpful, everyone else however seemed to be stoned and extremely disinterested, they never said thank you or even handed requested documentantation/change etc to me in person, they just put it on the desk and walked off, leaving us feel like we did something wrong each time, we always spoke Spanish to them and were very mannerly so there was no problem from our side. If you're European/Canadian expect to be treated like dirt at the front desk. I would suggest Almeria Americas instead, we also stayed there for a week and it was far friendlier, and better all round.

Room was really clean, and cleaned every day. My room was spacious, with a flatscreen TV with several channels (CNN, moviechannel in English, French and German TV). The pool is beautiful. Traditional decor of the hotel. Breakfast is adequate. Typical French pastries, coffee, watery juice. The pancakes are really nice and there is yoghurt. Eggs looked unappetizing (watery).

Location is ok. Taxi to the medina is only 10-15 Dh and it only takes 10 minutes. I liked being able to escape the hectic medina at the end of the day. Stay at a Riad at some point during your trip, but then a hotel such as Fes Inn is a nice break.   The pipes in the hotel were really loud. Whenever anyone flushed it would sound like a camel moaning. Not a good sound.   Pool is only open from 09:00 to 19:00. It should be open after 19:00 so you can swim after you've done your sightseeing.

At check-in we got upgraded to their honey,moon "suite" (the name is misleading, it was really just a room). But it was beautiful, with an octagonal ceiling, and a round bed, large tub and separate shower, separate toilet etc. Really good views around and all. So if it were just about the room itself it would have been great. Maybe with the exception of the bed which was super soft (some people like it, we don't).     Unfortunately, the room was in a tower - on the corner of 2 busy streets. We heard trams, scooters and cars, as well as loud shouts from the nearby pubs all night. My partner could not sleep at all. Th next day we asked to be placed in a room in the back. Which was very quiet. And also very nice - if smaller, with a bathroom in a separate room (some rooms I heard have the bathroom and toilet "in" the room - divided up with glass only. The bed was also very soft ad i found it uncomfortable, despite us having removed the even-softer mattress cover.     The breakfast was EXCELLENT, in their hip restaurant MOMO. Our rate included it, otherwise it costs 23 EUR pp which is a lot, but that breakfast was worth it. Very wide spread of cheeses, cold cuts, made-to-order eggs and so on, excellent coffee, pastries, fruit, local dutch sweet specialties. Very very good and in a cool environment.     All in all, i really liked that stay. Cool, modern, hip place in a REALLY good location close to all the action. If i were to stay there again I would really ask for a room in the back.

We received a complimentary upgrade on arrival to a top floor ocean view room in the Tapa Tower, although this is one of the older more dated buildings in the complex it was still quite nice. The 35th floor has high ceilings so the room felt very spacious, and the small balcony had wonderful views of the beach and coastline. There were lots of renovations in the main lobby during our stay, and this impacted a little on the chaos at checkin, but wasn't anything major. The Village is HUGE and there is lots of food choices (although the more convenient to-go options are very overpriced), and the japanese we had was fresh and good value. The ability to quick-check-out and not visit the front desk saved us a lot of time, and we generally found staff helpful and friendly. Overall a good stay.

Our Studio was very spacious, clean (though the bathtub could have been a little cleaner) and equipped with everything we could have needed. There were no double beds but nevertheless we slept comfortably. The location is convenient, only a few minutes from city centre and close to psalidi beach. A big plus for us was the fact we didn't have to deal with the usual kos madness and enjoyed a relaxing weekend. However, our favourite thing about the hotel and the reason we would most definitely go back and recommend it to others was the staff who were friendly and very helpful.

The breakfast was a little poor though it included the basic ingredients of a continental breakfast. The TV in our room had no reception but we were not fussed and never mentioned this to the reception. The decoration in the room is very 90s but as seeing as everything was comfortable it made no difference.

Honeymooner request - no special treatment at all...   We asked for info about trip to Marocco - no information from the receptionist. She said she has never been there... Training to Front Office department strongly advised!  additional 1 Euro plus on the bill - when we asked they said this is a special fee for the environment - it would have been better if they asked before! Or book a room withour see-view   poor English knowledge of the staff

The swimming pool was nice. And the blond lady at the reception was very nice and professional.  The cleaning and working people were very nice. The manager and the reception people except the blond lady were very unprofessional.

Management problem... During my check in 3 different people were complaining about their bills when they were checking out. They were being extra charged for services or food.   I prepaid my room but when I checked out they asked me to pay 50% more because they said the rate I booked was wrong. This hotel has a management problem and they will try to scam you. Make sure you don't let them take a deposit from you or scan your credit card. They will scam you.

The hotel was well located with a minute walk from the bus stops to/from Venice and to/from the airport (it's up to 10 min bus ride from Marco Polo Airport). Staff was very friendly and the room was good size and clean, with a balcony to relax in the hot summer evenings. Breakfast was good. Overall a good price value hotel.

The hotel doesn't serve food in the evenings but there is a bar round the corner where you can get some food really cheap, plus a couple of more places around, not far away from the hotel. There is also an ice cream shop 5 minute walk from the hotel very convenient :-) We had a couple of minor issues but they were resolved quickly and efficiently by the staff.

Excellent staff and spacious, clean room. Hotel is well situated near several excellent restaurants The Adega Do Ze, only yards from the hotel is amazing value at 7.50 euros for a meal with wine, coffee and a small port. The hotel is close to a lovely beach with several shops and bars. There is a frequent bus service to Albufeira, but a taxi only costs about 6 euros to The Strip. Breakfast is excellent, a good choice of continental breakfast, and lovely views from the rooftop restaurant.

Only slight negative would be the showers in the room are not always great, and could do with some tables and chairs around the pool to sit for snacks and drinks, as sunbeds are not always best for this.

These apartments have to have a near perfect setting with views of the beach and sea from our balcony. This was my second stay. And certainly not my last one.   The location is perfect, the sevice is good and the staff is wonderful.

The hotel should however be vigilant with some malicious technical staff who could ternish its image. Two "painters" (not the wonderful room cleaning staff) asked my spouse to pay them money so that they could clean the bathtub. The rooms are ageing; an upgrade might be necessary to keep the hotel's standing.

Rooms are basic, however they are comfortable, spacious and are always cleaned to a very high standard 6 days a week. This was our 7th visit and we will certainly be visiting again next year. The staff are very very friendly.  Nothing is too much trouble.  The food is beautiful, plenty of selection.  A salad bar for starters, plenty of warm options for main course and the selection of puddings is also fab. The pools are cleaned every day and are kept spotless, never a problem getting a sun lounger!!   A fantastic place for families with children who want a quiet and peaceful holiday without bars

WiFi is now being charged for at €20 per week (per device) or €10 per 3 days.   Children are being restricted from having inflatable lilos in the pool.  Only a little gripe but kids don't want to spend all day swimming and like having a little play!

Loved the quiet atmosphere, a calm niche in the hubbub of busy, busy Edinburgh central and so well placed. Liked the guest corridor - likened it to being on a cruise ship - but so quiet. Room set up excellent and looks fabulous.  Really enjoyed the snug bar and rooftop setting, so much so that we invited our friends to join us there before the Tattoo - they live in Edinburgh, and were well impressed. Staff very, very helpful. Most comfortable hotel bed ever slept in

Food a bit basic, but not priced accordingly. That said we only had a snack and a full breakfast.   Would have preferred a room with a real view and not just overlooking the garden from the side. I think most other rooms look over Carlton Hill/Observatory but sadly ours didn't as it was in a corner.

I stayed at this hotel for one night. The room is clean and spacious although there is nothing to see in the area and there are no restaurants around. However I was very disappointed in the attitude of the staff at the reception. I booked the room online and I have received the confirmation and the receipt after using my personal credit card. I checked in the hotel in that day and after 2hrs I received a call from the reception telling me that I had a FRAUD issue with my credit card and that I have to pay the price of the room again with cash. I explained the situation and showed the receipts, and instead of solving the issue with the agent they asked me to call numbers and send emails by myself claiming that they have no relation to the agent and that is entirely my problem. I was about to have a very important interview that day, so I was very upset they were bothering me every 2 minutes with the same topic instead of doing their job. Finally I agreed to pay only to get rid of sending emails and wasting my time and they asked me to pay the room AT A HIGHER RATE than the one I paid initially. The problem was solved finally, but they kept giving me a suspicious stare which made me feel very uncomfortable. Very very bad attitude towards clients....

It's in a great location, only a short walk from Bayswater underground station. The rooms varied a lot in size, we were on the ground floor which was adequate, but only just. Our friends upstairs had a much larger room. They were all very clean and pleasantly decorated, we were very impressed for what we paid for carnival weekend in Bayswater. Staff were friendly and helpful.
The continental breakfast had enough variety, but I found the pastries were a bit on the dry side, with such a short walk to the local shops I wouldn't pay the extra to have it included again.

I stayed at the hotel during a business trip. The room was very spacious and very clean. I liked the fact that there was a proper desk and an office chair as well as a reading chair in the room. Also the lighting was very good and the wireless internet worked very well.  There was no fridge in the room, but I asked for one of the complimentary mini-fridges and got it the same day. The business centre was very good. Also, the gym and the swimming pool were very nice.   I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Have used this hotel a few times now and like it a lot.  Always clean and tidy and staff are always curteous and willing to help. Food is good and drinks not too expensive.  I look online at various sites to find cheapest rate, then email it to manageress who matches it.  Couldn't ask for more.

The hotel is located in a pleasant neighbourhood of NYC, not only 2 blocks from the 79th street subway (line 1) station making everything easily accessible. Although there is renovation work being undertaken on the lobby and bar, the temporary check in desk was sufficient and it meant that Wi-Fi was free during our stay (usually a charge). The rooms are industrial but extremely clean and spacious. We had a room on the 2nd floor which was good. We had a view of the street but it was not noisy. We also ate in the restaurant one of the nights and enjoyed the food. This hotel is great value for money and lives up to its 4 star status. The open area on the 16th floor is a must at night.

Location is good. The room was nice and cleaned daily. Having a private drop pool is great!

On arrival we were told that 'there is a problem with your room so we will need to put you in a different room for the first night'. This was not what we wanted to hear on the first stop on our honeymoon. The worst part was that we were downgraded to a family villa - which meant we had to share our compound with another couple - not ideal for the first night of a honeymoon! That was very disappointing! We were moved in to our correct room the following day and it was much nicer. Because I had booked and paid in full prior to arrival there was nothing I could do to get a refund for the first nights downgrade.

1) Before I  went, I sent email to ask for the transportation of going to the hotel.  They did not reply.  2) During the stay, we found odor smell in the corridor.  We did not know where it from.  Unfortunately, the situation was getting worser and finally we can smell it  in the room.  By the end, we asked  the front desk.  The smell is from the pesticide.  I figure it out everyday they sprayed it outside my room and along the corridor.  If I know I will not stay in the hotel.  Pesticide is harmful to human being.  I don't want to take the chance. They should post sign and let the hotel consumers know that.  I am paying money to stay in a place that will put my health at risk.  That's rediculous.    3) By the end,  I demanded the hotel to give me an explanation.  So far they did not respond.     I won't stay in that hotel again as I don't want to kill myself .

We arrived at 2.00 a.m. and the staff were there to meet us with a welcome drink.  Our first impression of our room was wow.  It was a large room, and the staff had left a display on our bed made from orchids and palm leaves, welcoming us to the burasari.  All staff were very friendly and helpful.  All the girls- (Koy, Goong, Bum, Da da, Khau, Nid and Pin) in the breakfast area were so helpful, and got to know us quite well before we left.  My husband needed to go to the doctor, and the staff at the front desk arranged everything, and even took us there in a car.  Great service.  A very nice hotel to stay in, also close to the beach and  shopping area.

I can't say anything good from the hotel, the only thing is the location but it doesn't worth it. We felt ripped off. I will never come back.

The level of the hotel and rooms are very very far from the pictures and description. That's why they have not even 1 star.  The room should have air condition and strongbox and air condition didn't cool and no strongbox. Staff said a/c was working properly. We ask to move to another room and had the same problem, we realized the air condition is set to work always in fan mode, no cool mode, you can't change it. We had to sleep with the window open, much noise and mosquitoes.  Cleaning lady (or somebody) drank a water bottle from minibar and tried to charged to us.  Breakfast has always lots of flies over the food. I don't drink coffee but I couldn't see anybody drinking coffee in 5 days...  Sheets were smaller than the bed. No blinds. Poor light at the bathroom.
I can't say anything good from the hotel, the only thing is the location but it doesn't worth it. We felt ripped off. I will never come back.

Reasoably pleasant, but the quality of the room and beds were below what was expected after reading the "brochure" provided by Hotelopia

Hotelopia said that most properties had a sea view, this is not true ! Only a few about 8 properties have a sea view! This is tantamount to misrepresentation and possibly "actionable". There is no children's play area and as to the fitness room (Gym) well if you call a cross-trainer that was broken and a bike and rowing machine a "fitness" room, you are stretching the imagination a little. The equipment in the room was lacking an as to the studio bed in the "living room" well they were so uncomfortable, we had to put the very thin mattresses on the floor. The area is quite remote and there is no shop site, the closet being a small shop, without much in it, about a mile and half away. There are no restaurants, except a pizza place and a bar that sells crepes, which are both ok, but provide little variety. I have to say, I was disappointed, with the lack of facilities for the children, and spent a lot of time looking for things to do, so that they did not get bored. I was expecting to get a TV included, however, when I arrived I was told that it was not included in the price, after checking the website it says " Satellite TV socket included " !!!  Which is very misleading All in all, I will not be going back there.

Very Impressive, Newly built hotel, well trained staff's, very clean. Really, no major complaints, will I stay again? YES.  Free bus shuttle from Mall of Emirates to the resort. Was celebrating my 10th year wedding anniversary, hotel delivered a cake and a bottle of champagne for free. Thank You.  Anne at reception was very polite and was always willing to help. My daughter loved the Rixy Club, The beach was nice and clean. We also had a complimentary Water Taxi Ride to Dubai Marina Mall. That was nice.  Taxi from Resort back to my hotel in Diera was 85 AED. The shuttle bus was full so we had to take a taxi.  So in summary, yes, all went well.   One more thing, breakfast was really nice. Dinner was good, no faults but some space for more intercontinental variety.  Kudos Rixos ....... Any questions, pls ask me: otunbajesu@gmail.com

Fantastic place to stay; the attention to detail was outstanding!  I can't stress enough how well designed everything was.  An incredibly well designed place to stay with great location for a train out of Gare du Nord or l'Est.  Everything was super clean and quiet.  The breakfast was brilliant as well.  We will definitely be staying next time we visit Paris.

Easy check-in, polite staff and very quiet which we all liked. The pool was a bit on the small side considering the size of the hotel, but this really didn't matter as the majority of occupants were at the parks it seemed! Breakfast was plentiful every time we visited and well stocked with eggs, sausage, fruit (bananas and oranges), toast, cereals, yogurt, pastries, bagels and make your own pancakes ! Excellent location with Sizzler, Ponderosa and McDonalds to name a few in walking distance, and approx 10mins drive to Disney area ! Would use again but upgrade to a suite, just to enable us to put children to bed and for us to be able to sit down and relax.

Top Notch.... Had a great time in the Hotel....despite all the issues in Egypt at the time the hotel made us feel safe and secure. The staff were great and the children absolutly loved it...infact out of the three hotel we stayed at during our trip to egypt recently the kids put this at the top of the list despite the other hotels having pool slides etc..

Due to the issues in egypt with Curfews etc we found it difficult to go outside and eat hence we had to eat from the hotel restaurant, whilst the food was not that bad paying full whack hotel prices meant that my budget expanded more than I would have liked.

Poor customer service.  Our room had half used hot chocolate in it, no replacement was offered we had to do without.  At breakfast we waited 25 minutes for toast and were only given it because we asked. apparently if you do not drink tea or coffee you don't get toast.  We waited a further 25 minutes for our ordered breakfast to no avail, on asking we were told there had been a mistake, we were forgotten about and were getting nothing.  we eventually did get breakfast and it was meagre in portion, one sausage, one slice bacon, one small teaspoon of beans, they forgot the tomato.  Certainly not worth the money that is paid.  they also claim to give you free wifi but it was unobtainable in our room and we had to move down to reception to get it, which defeats the purpose.

For the price we were able to book this hotel at - it really is hard to beat in Plymouth. The location is very central and within easy walking distance of the harbour, shops and university.  This is the ideal stopover point for anyone wanting to enjoy the nightlife that Plymouth has to offer or to drop off a student studying at the Uni. We have stayed at a few other places and this is the best all round for value and location.

The hotel is getting a little tired and could do with a refurb in some areas. The food is so-so and if you are eating there are lots of better places down at the harbour to choose from. Car parking is a bit of a pain - there is a small car park adjacent to the hotel and another behind the hotel across the road. You have to pay for parking at a cost of £7 for 5pm to 11am and then £1 for each hour outside this. Factor this into your hotel costs!  A tip - arrive well before 'bingo' hours as there is a bingo hall next door and finding a parking place is much harder at this time.

Stayed at the Park Inn for one night for attending a concert at the MEN Arena. Check in was efficient and staff helpful and friendly. Room was spotlessly clean with everything that you would need. Breakfast choice was excellent. Location for the MEN Arena could not have been better.

My only grumble would be is that the bar area was extremely busy at the end of the concert and it would be better if an organised queue was put in place at these busy times. Approximately 25 guests were attempting to be served at the same time and this could have been organised a little better.

The room was good enough, spacious and clean. Our air conditioner was making a lot of noise for the first 2 days and it eventually broke on the 3rd. It was then repaired on the 4th.   The pool area was great and so was the restaurant. The staff there were brilliant, very friendly and helpful.   The hotel location was perfect for what we wanted, very centrally located, close to the beach, the bars and restaurants and the old square.

We were very disapointed at the reception staff. Contrary to the restaurante girls, the reception staff were unfriendly, and not very helpful at all. They could not give us complete information about a lot of things, sometimes it felt like we had to interrogate them. One of them was particularly rude to one of our friends who were also staying at the hotel at the same time.

Very nice campsite with lots of trees. Nice pool with toddler pool, good clean facilities.   The bigger villini are the newest and are nice, but the tent sites are also nice, with the ones near the "observation point" having stunning views.  Private beach is great with private access and good facilities. Sand is a bit silty, but still good for sandcastles. Water is warm, shallow and clean with pedaloes, canoes on the beach are free to campsite users.  Kiting, Windsurfing is good with flat shallow warm water, but wind can be a bit light some days. The locals all use big gear (can rent on the beach or have lessons)

Swimming hat needed in the pool and rigourously enforced..   Beach is 4-500m away. can drive or walk.  Campsite shop, cafe, ok and perfectly adequate with fresh bread, croissants and cheese/meat, and swim hats, but Fontainville has a bigger Coop and eSpar.  Not many English speaking people go here, but that is part of the charm ! Basic Italian combined with many staff who speak English was fine.

My wife and I stayed at Gloria hotel for 3 nights. We arrived at about 9am and were shown straight to out mini suite on the 34th floor over looking a busy rd and heard no noise at any time. The suite was all we wanted and needed, very clean and with a separate bedroom all that we needed. Th pool was a great place to cool down and relax and the restaurant was a great place to eat. The staff at the hotel went out of their  to make our stay a wonderful experience. Also people have stated that the elevators were slow but we found this to incorrect as we only waited about 2 or 3 minutes for an elevator at any time.  If we are ever back in Dubai we would definitely stay at the Gloria.

Very clean hotel with spacious rooms and very friendly and helpfull staff. Food was good and lots of choice. The pools were very nice and clean, although they were not heated. It was not difficult to get a sunbed. The gym is ok, but not great. It takes about 35 minutes to walk to the center of Playa Blanca where you find most of the restaurants and shops. But there are a few closer to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay and would book this hotel again if we go to Lanzarote again.

Nothing but praise for the staff, who were very helpful and welcoming.  They did their best to deal with issues as they arose (some of which could not have been anticipated, such as low water pressure throughout the city), checking with us to make sure these had been resolved or dealt with as well as possible.

There were some plumbing problems and the restaurant didn't have quite a few of the selections on the dinner menu.  Hairdryers would have been welcome.  On our final day the lifts didn't work.  Compared to dinner, breakfast was overpriced.

Room was great we had 4th floor with view over the river and the church on the square behind was very nice! Room was always clean, beds turned down everyday, new towels each day, brand new lift so feel a lot better that you won't get stuck. Breakfast room was bright warm quite refreshing with seems like traditional decoration. The most important things here are: you are 10min casual walk to Old Town Square, about 15min walk to New Town, about 10min to Charles Bridge, there is an off license on the corner and the shopping centre with a HUGE transport hub right underneath it, literally buses, teams, subway, and an easy link if you wish to the overland rail. Fantastic location for this hotel we are planning to go again.

Ok it's hard to pick negatives so il be a bit picky just to be fair on both sides. Duvet was slightly small for a 6'1 male. Pillow isn't fantastic but I had some of the best nights sleep ive had in months in that bed. Now if there is 1 thing I could be picky with..... It is breakfast. It is adaquet. It fills the gap. Needs a bit of improvement, especially on hot food, I don't like cold mushrooms with my toast and sausage and egg. So a few extra hot options would be good, as it's only toast and the local sausage which is Beef for anyone wondering had to check at a local shop. Oh 1 big thing which isn't that big. When you check in there's this form which encourages you to use the safe, we didn't (had no trouble) it's just the form is scare tacticstheu want you to hand in the pick everytime you leave the hotel but really with the bad reviews of the City with crime we took ours everywhere just to be safe, hotels always have a master just in case you'd lose it, and there is no name on the key so you don't need to worry about losing it and your room being ransacked. Overall great hotel.

The Hotel is run down and staff morale is the lowest I have seen in any hotel I stayed in in Kenya. It reminds me of the Tanzanian hotels during socialism. We booked and fully paid for four days, but by the second day it was intolerable. We sasked for a refund and we were told we should seek it from Hotelopia. We believe we have lost the money we paid for the fourth day and we vowed never to use Hotelopia for online booking. We shall advise our friends and acquiantances to watch out for this hotel booking site.

Good facilities, very good location, and very good value for money as all the food and drinks are included.  Staff are in general very friendly and helpful.

Not a 5-star hotel, not even a 4-star one.  There is no hand towel, and the ventilation fan in the bathroom did not work, and I was told that the fans did not work when I complained.  The drain of the bathtub did not work properly, but did not improve after I complained and people were sent to try to fix it.  Housekeeping don't seem to wash the used glasses in the room.  Apparently the hotel does not have down pillows but some staff members told me that they did have, and it took me some time and several phone calls to find out.  A kettle in the room would be very useful.  There were only two English speaking TV channels, so not much choice if you speak only English.  Lunch hours (between 12pm and 1:30pm) is a bit short.

The hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the famous Sagrada Famillia. The staff are fantastically helpful and provide great tips and advice about Barcelona. The room was fine, although on the street-side, and the shower was amazing.

The walls between rooms are very thin so could hear hotel room doors slamming, showers taken by other guests, talking and general movement around the rooms - so sleep can be interrupted. Also there was no little fridge in the room which would have been great to keep water cold and also a kettle would have been good.

The hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the famous Sagrada Famillia. The staff are fantastically helpful and provide great tips and advice about Barcelona. The room was fine, although on the street-side, and the shower was amazing.

The walls between rooms are very thin so could hear hotel room doors slamming, showers taken by other guests, talking and general movement around the rooms - so sleep can be interrupted. Also there was no little fridge in the room which would have been great to keep water cold and also a kettle would have been good.
The room was nice and clean. However, there was no place to store our clothes. We only stayed for one night so it was not a big issue for us.   The patio smoker's area is also very nice and pleasant.

The buffet breakfast has a lot of good options but the staff seated us at a table far away from all the food even though there were no other tables occupied. That would have been OK but this was right next to the station of the bus-boys/girls so basically we ate the entire breakfast with someone standing less than a meter away and staring right at us! It was very unpleasant as there was no privacy whatsoever.   I also did not like the check-in process. I've lived in the UK for more than 3 years but still they asked me for my passport. I don't understand why as this rule only applies to foreign tourists - I tried to explain this to the check-in girl but she did not understand and she wouldn't let me check in until I showed her some sort of ID.   Also, the hotel is not that close to the city centre as you might think - there's a good 10mins walk before you get to the big shopping areas and there are no shops (not even a tesco) anywhere near the hotel.   In the morning, the staff bothered us twice even though we had the do not disturb sign on the door: once to see if they can clean the room (???) and once to make sure we'll be checking out on the day (???).

The bathrooms were a bit dated, and the bed was small; double.  The customer service was apalling!!! The first night, we arrived at midnight, however they couldn't find our reservation and made us pay for the room again even though WE had the proof with us. The following day when i asked a question about when we could expect our refund now that our reservation was found, the clerk cut me off mid-sentence. Finally after she said what she wanted and was thus ready to listen to my question, she then Turned to me to ask what my question had been. Several staff members repeatedly walked off mid-enquiry without any mention as to why. I have Never come across such rude behaviour!!

Really lovely hotel and had a great stay here. The location is brilliant, particularly if, like us, you like a bit pf peace from the busy tourist areas. Lovely roof terrace and the breakfast was good as well as the helpful staff.

Wonderful family run apartment, complimentary gifts throughout the stay of cake, pastries, tomatoes and fruit. Centrally located for supermarkets and tavernas with sea view (apartment 12) well stocked kitchen with proper cooker and full size fridge/freezer. Warm, friendly family staff who couldn't do enough for you, invited to drinks with the family in the evening and Smaragda brought out freshly cooked octopus and plate of ham, cheese, tomatoes and cucumber/melon fruit to eat as companions with her husband jorgo, daughter despina and son in law dimitris. Proper Greek atmosphere, excellent relaxing holiday.
The toilet bin was only emptied once throughout the week (this was not a problem as we did this ourselves most days)

Very much enjoyed staying at the hotel. From checking in with the excellent (Manatelli - apologise as not sure of spelling but she is from Belgium) who gave good information and was always very pleasant to talk to and smiling as we entered or departed from the hotel. She also set Wi-Fi up on my iphone which worked well in the bedroom.The other reception staff were also very good too. Breakfast was good and Alice in particular here was always welcoming and excellent in the breakfast room working hard yet still smiled.    The bedrooms we had were spotlessly clean so the housing keeping was top notch. Our rooms faced the back but were so quiet we slept very well. The TV offered many channels and BBC1, 2 and Channel 5 if you wished to see what was going on in the UK.    The big plus for the hotel is the location, making it convenient for the Old Town, the sea front and airport bus.     On day of leaving the hotel has a baggage storage area like many other hotels, but at this hotel they also offered a room to freshen up and change clothes in prior departing which was very welcome.    A hotel to stay again in the future although a little pricey.
No lounge area to sit in but was not important as it was probably unlikely it would be used owing to the location of the hotel.

The hotel sits on an impressive vantage point to view the valley and ocean below it.   The grounds of the property were tastefully decorated and well maintained.  The pools are amazing.  We were on the all-inclusive plan and thought it was good value for the money.   The rooms are large and tastefully decorated.  The restaurant and the staff were pleasant and the food I thought was of good quality and nicely prepared.  There was a huge selection but they had was well presented and tasted good.  Plenty of free parking which is a nice change.
They need to have free Wifi.  This the only major negative about the property.

We were dealt with very quickly upon arrival - very nice and professional.  The room was a very good size, compared to continental standards.  Room cleaned on a daily basis, with beds made.  The hotel location is excellent, right around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie, and twenty minutes walk up Wilhelmstrasse to the Brandenburg gate, with alot of the museums/memorials along that route and then shopping on Friedrichstrasse.  Good breakfast (part of the package) in the morning to keep you going.  Would definitely recommend this hotel, and would certainly return if in Berlin again.
The only issue and it is minor, was that the wi-fi service was not great, even in the reception area.  And there are only two computers for use in the reception area.

I was travelling alone, and they put me in a 4 person room in the basement (?). Yes, the BASEMENT. There was a tv on the wall, but it didn´t work. My phone didn´t even work down there! I then had to cross a small corridor with an emergency escape door to get into the toilet / bathroom. The staff were impatient and not very friendly, took some persuasion to get them to show me exactly where the room was after having wandered around the maze-like basement. The breakfast was a very limited choice and the coffee was awful, a cup full of coffee grinds. Overheard 4 different guests complaining about failing air conditioning, to unresponsive front desk staff. Will definately not stay here again.

Situated about 15mins walk away from the harbour, the hotel is very quiet, right on the beach with mountains all around. The Elounda Beach is 5mins walk away through hotel complex. Staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. We booked a Deluxe Sea View Room and were upgraded to a bungalow with shared pool with sea view....room 91, on arrival. There were 2 other bungalows in our block sharing our very decent sized pool but we were the only ones to use the pool. I would recommend paying a bit more for a room like this. I don't think we would have enjoyed our stay as much if we had our deluxe sea view room. Rooms were clean and very pleasant indeed (we rarely moved from our private sun deck for our stay) but probably more like 4 star than 5. Having said that we wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel and room, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

The only option available at this hotel was half board. The food was really the only thing for us that let the hotel down. Both meals were buffet. Breakfast was fine but only fine not great. For example the pineapple was tinned not fresh.....that's not 5 star. I understand the hotel has to cater for international cuisine so there were different themed nights. Again there was nothing the matter with it, it just wasn't 5 star. So even though we had paid for half board we ate out......we wondered down to the harbour to it's traditional tavernas with local Cretan food which were fabulous and reasonably priced and got a taxi to Agios Nik and Plaka a couple of nights which were also great and only a few mins away by cab. Don't let this put you off going, we would definitely still return....buffet food and all.

I had to change rooms 3 times; once because someone had been smoking in the room; second time because the TV didn't work.  The 3rd room was OK.  The food at dinner was very expensive and not very imaginative.  Hot salmon on cold lettuce does not work and the new potatoes were in the singular.  I went down to breakfast at 6.00am and the food was bearly hot and the plates for the hot food were cold.  I should have had a freshly cooked omlette.  Hopper buses ran very early and I could have been informed about this when I booked a taxi.  Instead I paid £15.00 when  I could have only paid £4.50 for the bus to Terminal 5.      All in all I was disappointed.

Room cleanliness: The room was quiet clean and bedsheets and towels were changed where requested.    Hotel location: Very easy to commute to city centre in very short time.

Internet: Although advertised as having wifi available in the room, the was no reception in the room whatsoever. Wifi was only available in the lobby.    Staff: Although we had called after making the reservation to request for a double bed as opposed to two singles and being assured by the lady on the phone that it was not a problem, upon our arrival we discovered we were placed in a room with a double bed on which two single mattresses were placed next to each other. We arrived late after our trip around 10pm and were not pleased we had to go back to reception to ask for a change of rooms but luckily they served us quickly and our room was switched to one with a proper double bed.    Furthermore, on the one out of the seven nights we decided to stay in, we discovered that there were no English channels on the TV apart from the news (BBC I think). We thought that we could rent a movie so we called the reception to ask whether the hotel provided  that service. When someone picked up eventually (on the second try), we identified our room number and instead of being asked how they could help us, the person from the reception who answered the phone said "What is your question?" in a tone like we were actually bothering him!    Room location: Our room was located next to the street which made it extremely noisy. Unfortunately there was no option of closing the window since it was quite hot in the room otherwise.

Large beach when tide is out.  When it's in, there are prettier beaches.  This one can be accessed by visitors to Damai Central, a collection of small shops a cafes which is becoming increasingly popular with locals and is so close to the resort that you do not feel 'secluded' by any means.  Recommend some of the nearby jungle treks, especially the ones you can do with a cheap day pass at Permai Rainforest Resort.  The Sarawak Cultural Village is worth a visit too - short walk away. For a real slice of life in a (poor) Malay fishing village, spend a few late afternoon hours at Kampong Buntal, about 10ks away.  The villagers are so friendly and great food s served at a large Chinese seafood restaurant there.  Very basic surroundings, but good to watch the sunset with super food.  Don't go if you do not like to stray outside your comfort zone and prefer to eat in hotels.  Do go if you like local experiences.

Stayed for last 2 nights of our fortnight's trip. Glad it wasn't any longer. Staying on Santubong Peninsula is a must, but if you will only be staying at one resort there, make it the Permai Rainforest Resort not this one or Damai Resort and Spa.  The latter two are trading ln their names.  The Damai Beach Resort is 3 star at best.  They were doing some refurbishment work to one of the pools when we stayed and building in another area, which I have disregarded for this review because we knew about this work beforehand.  That said, the facilities and front area of this resort are nothing spectacular.  Stayed in a beach cabin which was dated, but large - very 1970s.  Note that you do not get a detached chalet to yourself.  There are 3 to 4 cabin rooms per detached chalet, which are basic.  They do interconnect if you are a family group.  Only 6-8 cabin rooms have uninterrupted views of the beach - if you can't get one of these, don't bother.  You will simply be staring at other chalets.  Better off with a hilltop room which would afford a sea view from a distance.  Also note that some cabin rooms are larger than others.  No. 313 is big, no. 314 is much smaller.  Our bed was old and sagged a bit.  Pillows were hard and uncomfortable.  Air con was good.  No real hot water.  Buffet breakfast was just okay if you pick and choose.  We had a poor quality meal in the hilltop restaurant.  Hotel has too many 'don't do' notices and makes you feel uncomfortable.  Don't know what sort of guests they attract, but you certainly feel as though they don't trust/respect you.  There's even a notice at breakfast which threatens to charge you 10 RM for every 100 grams of food you don't eat!  Staff were friendly and helpful, but lose marks because they must be aware of these issues.  All in all, I wouldn't stay again or recommend you do.  No problems with Hotelopia's service.

A few days prior to arrival we asked the hotel if they could arrange breakfast for my partner as she was doing the Pedal for Scotland which was due to begin before the breakfast opened on the Sunday morning. The duty manager arranged for a member of the night staff to get the continental breakfast items ready which allowed her to have a good amount of food and drink before her ride which was more than I have experienced at some hotels in the past. Furthermore, this Premier Inn has had its in-room facilities upgraded with a 40" flat panel LCD TV on the wall rather than the 14" CRT that you used to get in the rooms which is better to watch in the room as well as this you can connect your PC to the TV now so can use a wireless keyboard and mouse from your bed if you so wish.

I was given a room beside the cleaners cupboard and that's all I could here. The walls were paper thin so I could hear every thing the staff were talking about. At one point I counted four different voices. Their conversation and all the banging that they seem is necessary to their job, was not a comfortable experience.    On the Saturday there was a wedding and all the service staff seemed to be running around doing something for that. I had been told that the hotel does not do room service. I asked for some lunch at the bar and after a long wait I was given the snack menu. I saw the lunch menu on the website before I went downstairs, but when I asked for it I was told that snacks was all they had. The restaurant was being used be the piper to tune up. I had a sandwich at the bar. The staff were very friendly and professional, but lost and inexperienced. The correct training in all departments would help the staff and let the customers feel safe in their hands.   When the music started for the wedding I was already preparing for bed. I had to work very early the next day. The music was very load and I had to sleep. There was a lot of people and children outside making a lot of noise. Luckily I had earplugs, and I was able to sleep.   For a quite out of town hotel, it was on of the loudest I have stayed in.

we stayed here last year and were quite satisfied with hotel. Thought was ok. Staff were friendly in dining room and service was good.

You  could feel the springs through one of the beds. We had to turn the mattress over. Sunday morning went down to breakfast, had a job to find a clean table. Sat down near window with breakfast where i realised the plate by my space was dirty and had just had a clean serviette put on top so i moved it, when waitress came over she  moved the plate to other side of table saying had to be there cos she didnt want to make me left handed!! I explained to her that the plate was dirty and thats why it was there. It was obvious by her manner after that, she was not happy with us. She asked us what we wanted to drink but never offered a refill and was quite off putting. The next morning we made sure we were sat in a different part and were served by a much more pleasant person who made sure we were satisfied. We do not normally complain as this often leads to bad feelings and spoils a weekend away but we will not be using this hotel again. Certain staff members need to be better trained.
