The Hotel is ran by a family of very friendly professionals. The hotel has big clean rooms, and all our requests were fullfilled at once. I chose bed only option - due to my tight schedule going back to the room for a meal at specific times was actually out of schedule- thus I can't rate catering options but I do rate kitchen facilities with a 5: all I needed is there. Well situated, quiet in a great environment is the perfect rest place. The view is spectacular; a great mix of hill and sea. Should you like to experience a more vivid evening Faliraki is more or less some half mile away - walkable distance.Thank you for the pleasant stay Despoina and Anastasia. keep up the good job!
There is no elevator in the hotel therefore if you experience issues with stairs you should choose a ground floor appartment,

Very well presented hotel with polite professional and friendly staff in good location.  All hotel amenities were excellent and couldn't have wished for any more.  The food was excellent.  Previous reviews had said that the breakfasts were really good and that was true.  So much choice of food also when we ate in the hotel's Admirals Landing restaurant (buffet) in the evening. Lounge area really lovely place to relax in the evening with great views and even some entertainment, but also there were lots of other places to sit and relax if you wanted to.  Pool areas were good and never too busy either.  Definitely recommend this hotel and we would return to if we holidayed there again.

Hotel room was had no view - literally had the view of a bastion wall.  Asked if we could be repositioned but was told that no other rooms available but could be upgraded if we wanted to pay extra so we stayed put. Room toiletries were not all replenished daily, air conditioning in room could have been more powerful.  Meat in the evening buffet was over cooked and therefore tough and chewy.  Bashed my leg on the indoor swimming pool steps - I think that these could have been lit up to help avoid this.

Do not be fooled the castle has few rooms so expect to stay in a building situated round the side of the castle.  These rooms require major refurbishment and hotel generally needs a good clean.  On arrival hallways where littered with dirty dishes from rooms and some rooms not even ready by 4.30 pm.  Staff seem worn out and not the most welcoming. Reception quite frosty we where attending a wedding and had evening gathering the night before which reception had no idea about and where not interested in getting the required information. Our room had holes in the linen and hair all over the shower.  Be warned if gettting married there ask to see rooms out with the castle as you may have some very disappointed guests.  This hotel generally lacks the basic quality you would expect when paying over £100 per night even in the bar area light bulbs out. Dinner waiting staff  seem to huddle round the till rather than be pro active on the restaurant floor.
Food is okay of average quality and fairly priced.

Whatever niggles I might have about the staff, the hotel always had a warm atmosphere. The setting, as just about anyone who has visited will testify, is beautiful. Dog friendly, which is unusual.

Maybe we're just not that good at service in this country. I was once a waiter - I would never have stretched over one diner to serve another! My waiter approached the table, looked at my dish and asked 'Beef? Pork?' It was beef...  If you were kind, you'd describe the décor as careworn. If you were harsh, you'd just describe it as worn.  (Why do hotels - not just this one - not give a discount for a second night when they don't have to change the towels, supply fresh sheets or replace the soap and other toiletries?)  I didn't pay full rate, but if I had, I would have felt well and truly done.

We felt most welcome from the moment that we arrived. The hotel has impressive public areas. Reception and concierge staff were attentive and helpful. Our room was spacious and well equipped with an excellent bathroom. An excellent standard of cleanliness was maintained. The breakfast buffet offerred a generous selection of hot and cold food with the option of freshly prepared omelette, fried eggs, pancakes and waffles made to order. Staff in all parts of the hotel provided a friendly and efficient service. The pool area provides a peaceful enviornment for recreation and relaxation.

Negative reviews, sorry !    My friend and I stayed at The Oxford Hotel a few days ago, on arrival we went to check in at the desk. The young man was unsure of that day's menu and suggested we take a look at the restaurant to see what was on. He also had no idea of the bus route and bus stop into Oxford or, if there was a bus that could take us to the railway station on departure.   We then discovered there was no lift or elevator to get the cases up to the bedrooms, difficult for elderly guests. Our bedroom was perfectly clean and my only complaint was the net curtains were in need of a good wash. O.K. it's end of season, but the standard must be kept up. The other thing was not enough milk provided for two people, one needs a little more than one tiny capsule per cup.

Now for the Positive reviews,    Excellent breakfasts, clean and reasonably spaced rooms, quiet, walls thick enough for a decent sleep and courteous overseas staff. Morning papers provided, room service. Plenty parking spaces, oh ! and far enough away from the busy roundabout. Freebie fresh apples at the desk : )

Check in was friendly and efficient. Concierge service excellent. They also have baggage storage, which is very handy if you are in transit and want to spend some time seeing the sights.

This is a very tired looking hotel. I stayed here about five years ago and thought the same then. Nothing has changed. The beds are uncomfortable and the general decor is unpleasant.   The other thing worth noting is the pungent smell of smoked fish in the restaurant. It overwhelms you whilst you are eating and even permeates into the lobby. It spoilt my breakfast.   Overall, this place needs some money spent on it to bring it up to modern standards. Until that happens, I shan't return.

I cannot find fault with this hotel. Staff were very friendly, helpful and professional.  The hotel is located in a National park area and a minute walk from the Victoria Falls (Zambian side). You will save $10 if you stay at this hotel and wish to visit the falls. The hotel provide you with free passes to the falls.  This was good for us as we planned to visit the falls more than once to do the various trails (3) in between other activities. As the hotel is in a national park area you can easily spot Zebra, Giraffe's, Monkey, Baboons etc. There is a large pool area and cocktail bar.  The bar area sells snacks but there is also a restaurant, cafe and pub on-site so you have a choice of food and price.  There is also a shuttle service to its sister hotel which is also worth a visit. Shuttles are frequent and free and can be arranged at the reception desk. There is also a travel desk next to the reception desk where you can book as many or few activities as you wish. Wifi is also available. There was a mixture of friends, couples and families staying at this hotel. I would highly recommend staying here, we were not disappointed.

This all inclusive hotel is defenitly value for the money. Two pools, friendly staff, nice food (there's something for everyone) with lots of local specialities  and just across the street to the beach. They also produces their own electricity and 85% of vegetables served! So don't hesitate! Book it!
However, the beds could be a little more comfortable. That's why the room didn't get the 5. As a egg and bacon man I  missed real bacon. But really, that's not a big issue!

As the family resort it's 10 from 10. Definetely will return next year with both our childs! Territory, food, sport activities, pool slides, pools themselves, magic club (!!! - we didnt hope a lot that our 3 years old child will spend there several hours each day), magic club (not by mistake i mention it twice))), evening shows and all, all, all)).

Not smth to remember about... May be only lazy girl in the beach bar). You need to call her in order to get smth. She does not look at the guests may be hoping that they will change their mind to ask for anything)).   And one more thing. I requested late check out 3  weeks before our arrival as the flight was at 22:00 we were going to leave hotel at 19:00. Yes, i understand that this is the subject of availability. But i hoped to get some definite instructions during arrival: smth like - you need to come to reception on the day before the last one and to refer to the person named.... at the time.... I mean that i didnt want to spend much time to this issue in the last days of my holidays. In the result i came in the day before last. Reception stuff asked all the details (number room, time and so on) and then asked to come next day after 09:00. I came at 09:00 then waited for 20 mins for manager arriving then we spent 30 mins more in discusiions is it possible to orginize late check out or not. In the end they gave to my family another number till 17:00 (for additional payment - but thats is absolutely ok). The only my complain is the time i spent - about 1 hour in total. This issue is needed to be better orginized - i suppose that i am not the only who requested this service.

Staff from moment of check in made us feel welcome. Any request was met with friendliness and efficiency. This is a family owned hotel and no corporate indifference here.   This hotel is part of a group of three properties: Miramare e Castello , Terme Mareblu and Giardino Eden. We took a taxi boat for a hotel rate of 10 Euro to Giardino Eden where you are able to swim in clear water and enjoy all the facilities. Highly recommended!
Rooms are small and air conditioning may seem not powerful enough for American taste .Do not let this deter you from enjoying these wonderful properties.

We have been coming to this hotel on and off for 20 years and since our last visit 2 years ago the hotels seems to have really gone down hill.  Everything is falling apart, tatty or extremley dated.  It doesnt come with alot of the things you may expect of a 4 star, IE fridge in room (my parents had to pay 5euros a day for one, and to their surprise then had a full size refridgerator dumped in the middle of their room) safe you have to pay for at 3 euros a day, no WIFI, the TV we had in the room was ancient and the remote was kept together with duck tape, where as my parents had a brand new flat screen.  We were sat outside in the evening and at 11pm promtly we were asked to go inside......it was like being told to go to bed when i was a child!  All in all i dont think we will be staying here again, for the money you pay per night there are much better quality hotels out there!

It was around the same price as other hotels located in the Bayswater area (i.e. expensive), but the money does not appear to have been re-invested.

We wanted a hotel with easy access to the West End and this really fitted the bill. We used the whirlpool and the steam room and had both to ourselves. Gym was pretty small but as we spent all day walking around London we didn't need any extra exercise. We were able to leave our bags securely both before check-in and after check out the day we left. Staff all very effieicent and friendly.
The twin beds were right next to each other without a space which was a bit cosy for a mother/daughter combo.

I asked for a wake up call on the day of my departure, but never received the call.  I nearly missed my flight.  My room was not cleaned on one day and when reaching the hotel at 4 PM, I had to request for a cleaning.  The internet never worked in the room and on the day of my checking-in (around noon) the IT dept took more than 4 hr (around 4 PM) to generate an internet password for me (not practical if you are on a business trip)  The room accessories are quite old.  In summary, it's a huge hotel which needs a lot of refurbishment and renovation, and staff can be trained to be more customer oriented.

Location is great, close to all public transport stops. Rooms on the fifth floor are attic rooms and have very low beams I prefer the lower floors. Breakfast is available from 3.30 am, useful if you need an early start. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom had a bath as well as a shower. Staff speak excellent English and are very helpful. This was my second stay here and I am likely to return.
Kitchen utensils can be a bit sparse. If you think you might need a can opener, corkscrew, potato peeler or kettle, bring one with you to be sure.

The villa we stayed at was dilapidated, dirty, and moldy.  There was a large dead bug on the top of our bed.  The towels were threadbare and both showers ran out of hot water after 2 minutes each. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights.   I had to travel to an athletics competitions at the Alexander Stadium and one of the girls on reception gave me bus numbers and exact details on how to get there.  Only took about 20mins.  Perfect. Hotel close to town about a 10min walk.  There is plenty of pubs that provide food only 1 minute walk from the hotel.  Surprised that it was only a 3 star.   Breakfast was nice and early on Sunday morning as I had to leave at 8am to head to the track.  Everything you would want and cooked was nice and hot.   Definitely stay again.
Not really any negatives although some people might not like the self service breakfast but suited us as time was at the essence.

the prefessionalism of the staff lef alot to be desired.  upon arriving my brother and his wife had already checked in with their two toddlers and were having something to eat we went to join them with our two toddlers.  my sister-in-law warned us that it was near impossible to get something to eat as they had to beg for a menu and my brother had to get the cutlery for the table!  we had to ask 4 different staff memebers for menus before we ordered a sandwich and two baby dinners 25 minutes later still no sign of food, had to then speak to a manager who informed that the food had just been put up...this was not the case as the children could eat it straight away without having to wait for it to cool!!  spoke with a manager who did offer us dinner that night as there is no where else to eat in this town we accepted with reluctance as we did not want to have the same experience as lunch!  the food was fabalous and dinner could not be faulted staff somewhat redeemed themselves but i do wonder if we were the customers that did not complain would service have been very different?!?  in the morning we went for breakfast and checked out as i had booked the rooms i was told that everything was fine nothing outstanding on the bill.  a couple of hours later when my brother checked out they were charged €40 for our breakfasts that were included in the rate.  i had to contact the hotel on 4 seperate occassions to asertain why this had happened and when were they going to refund the money.  the managment in this hotel need to look at themsellves seriously in this day and age that this is the type of service that their hotel is delivering?  it is a shame that it is the staff that let this hotel down as it is fabalous and very family friendly.  unfortuantely due to staffs lack of professionalism we will not be returning.

A positive point about Oaks Festival Towers is it is close to everything, being in the heart of Brisbane everything is walking distance away.

I booked a 2 bedroom apartment and ended up with a 1 bedroom very small "apartment", i felt ripped off as soon as i entered the room. The staff, I found to be very rude and the hall ways to the room smelt really bad! it was classified as after hours at 9 am and there was no where to park the car to check in so my husband had to drive around the block while i ran in. then they took the credit card to hold money, i didn't mind that but as i was checking out they needed the credit card again so i could pay for the parking (something they didn't make clear to begin with) and left me wondering why they needed to hold the money to begin with. i was very disappointed with Oaks Festival Towers and wouldn't recommend staying there. I have stayed in much nicer places in Brisbane and got great value for money. in this case it definitely was false advertising.

Hotel was clean, and despite having lots of guests and being in central London, it was very quiet at night.  Front desk staff and breakfast room staff were very nice. On arrival we were asked for an additional £25 deposit (refundable) which was not expected. When we checked out the receptionist asked for payment of the room, questioning whether we had paid online even though we showed her confirmation paperwork. She then wanted to telephone booking agent for confirmation of payment, causing delay. She was unable to get a reply and asked us for further contact details. It was an uncomfortable situation.

Hi, although the Senator Suite room with extra bed has old furniture, my family liked it alot due to the space of the bedroom, the living room and the bathroom- clean and with no molds. The beds including the extra one was comfortable. The view was amazing too. and like the idea of one flat screen in the bedroom and one for in the living room.-there is even a DVD player altho we did not use it.        Breakfast is not bad especially at rm23 per pax. Get the extra breakfast when you check it as it is more worthwhile rather than walk-through in the morning ( they charged rm 37 per pax if your do). Like the roti canai station and the sambal of the nasi lemak is quite good too.    Swimming pool is a bit chilly, and the ambiance is a like in the 70's- but atleast it is clean.    Overall, it is not a 4-5 star hotel in a real sense, but an acceptable 2 and half start joint. may be a little pricey but it is convenient with the attractions nearby and with lift connected from room floors to the carpark basement.    I do like the convenience and like to stress it is acceptable if you are not fussy and I might be the lucky one to have a good room :)

Carpet could use some cleaning and washing,tho as we could feel some dirt whenever we walked barefooted in the room.  As for apartments, i observed would be difficult for those with wheelchairs or baby strollers as there is no lift for the 2 floors apartments.

Room well presented. Lovely wide corridors. Staff helpful and friendly. Well located for shopping and sightseeing and only a few minutes from York rail station. Would certainly recommend the hotel,however we did not eat in (only one room service see comments in negatives) as we were on business and time was essential.

No real negatives only silly niggles. Lack of plug points in room which made it difficult to use the hair dryer near a mirror. Razor point packed up on last morning (one of those things) so couldn't shave. Arrived late due to train delay,checked in but were not shown to room (5 star?), ordered in room food but found it bland and lacking flavour hence only fair rating for food quality. Despite these little niggles would certainly stay again.

So close to the airport which is handy with night flying, very cheap taxi to and from the airport.   Hotel offer a free shuttle bus to Abu Dhabi city and yas beach so getting around is not a problem. Also there is the yas island shuttle to get between all the attractions in the island.   Very informative staff about tours and things to do, Andrea was fantastic.   All staff friendly and eager to help.   Late checkout easy to obtain with full use if hotel facilities and bag storage after checkout a bonus.  Buffet breakfast best I've had, so many options and very fresh, always hot and good coffee constantly filled by eager staff.  Room comfy and spacious, shower head choice a nice touch.

Although a smallish family run hotel with an official Greek listing of 2 stars this hotel pulls above it's weight. Lets be frank this is a relatively cheap hotel booked through Hotelopia so perhaps a not a lot should be expected but it includes an internet access point, Air con in public areas and rooms, 24 hours staffing and service, is very friendly, and demonstrates a will to please and advise customers. Breakfast is a buffet with a good selection of cereals, fruits, breads, meat, cheeses, jams, honey etc. and drinks that beats most breakfasts that would be charged well over 5 Euros each for an inferior offering at other places - at the Silvia it is all included. All that plus a bar, a lounge area for relaxing a lift to all floors and a central town location in a non too busy Rhodes street. Location handy for the main harbours (short cheap taxi ride if you've cases), close to the edge of the old town, a cafe (serving great and cheap souvlaki/gyros) and a supermarket. Very much a budget hotel but great value for money.

Rooms are small (but clean) and showing their age so some refurbishment is in order but all facilities worked (I experienced two rooms on separate stays). Shower/toilet adequate but cramped and perhaps a motto of 'our doors are always open'  might be adopted! However sufficient for an overnight or short stay (stayed 3 and 1 nights at beginning and end of a holiday).  Not really located in a tourist area so no good beaches close to hand (if that's what your looking for).     Not a downfall of this hotel but useful info is airport taxi to/from here is 22Euros and to Mandraki harbour (the furthest from the hotel) 8 (prices 2013)

Well situated particularly if you take the Dublin Bus 3 day ticket which allows use if the Docklands tour, and which stops opposite the hotel. Also convenient for the 151 service to O'Connell Street just across the river.  Facilities excellent, a well-presented room and a comfortable bed. Free ( and easy to access) wi-fi  Good bar and public facilities

We were a bit surprised to find that one of the two rooms booked at the same time was charged at over €20 more a night than the other, despite their being adjacent and identical. However, we had paid thr total in advance, so the difference did not become apparent until we checked in

The buffet style fried breakfast provided generous quantities of warm but not hot, average quality food remeniscent of school dinners -  this was offset however by the excellent, attentive whilst unobtrusive staff.

Hotel Lobby and entrance were impressive, with shops, bar and dining area, a large swimming pool and walking garden; hotel aspect was attractive, near the water with great views from the upper balconies; common areas were well kept and very clean. Reception staff were helpful and spoke English.  We liked it but there were problems.

The room we had on the fourth floor was adequate in terms of size, nice balcony and views, but many things did not work e.g. lights, bathroom tap, no plug in sink, no internet connection, and the cupboard fittings were old and peeling apart.  There was a safety box in the room but it was 2 CUC per day to use it (unheard of!). The lift did not work going down - it would not stop at your call - we had to walk down 4 flights every time.  The dining area was not open for evening meals, so we had to go outside to more expensive places next door to eat.

There was a broken radiator in our room that could not be turned off and the room was far too hot and uncomfortable.  Fixtures and fittings were in a poor state - drawer handles missing, lightbulbs not working.  The bed was uncomfortable and the smoke alarm situated above the foot of the bed had two red lights that flashed every second or so.  These were not noticeable in daylight but the constant flashing above your head in the darkness of night was not what you wanted to see when trying to get to sleep. The room was not particularly clean and there were hair clips from a previous guest on the floor in the bathroom. Overall the hotel felt very tired - it was the cheapest we could find in the area and my conclusion is you get what you pay for.

When we arrived to our room, it was HOT and I couldn't adjust the air conditioning. I've called the reception 2-3 times and although they had promised to send a technician, nobody arrived. The restaurant was the noisiest experience I've ever had in my life. The staff were racing their carts through tables to carry dirty plates around and  the volume of the music was just terrible. The guests, mostly Russian, were walking around the reception hall with swimwear and laying around on leather chairs which I consider not appropriate at all. When I mentioned to the staff at the reception, their answer was that, "This is a spa hotel and the guests can behave as they like". Totally, just 1  night only was more than enough and wouldn't recommend to anyone, if the hotel doesn't change their attitude.

The Place is an oasis in a very hectic part of the Town, that is for sure. It is a wonderful building, Beautiful Moroccan architecture, serene, a nice pool in the middle of the building, very cosy and very comfortable. The staff is very nice and they really go out of their  to be of assistance. The terrace is Beautiful, you can have your breakfast there if you want to and enjoy the view - it is really great.

The breakfast could have had more variety, I Think, it consisted only of pancakes, some pieces of bread, and cakes. So, if you are on a healthy diet you really need to take care of your own breakfast. If you are a woman and travelling with a female friend, like I was, you need to Think about some vital things when you are going out at nights. In the Medina, where the riad is, you cannot "easily" go out at nights. The area is poor and of a lower class, people (men) stare at you and you have to cover yourself - at nights you have to be more careful. People, Tourists and even Moroccans, go out in Gueliz area, where all the nice places are (restaurants, nightclubs etc). If you want to put on a nice dress on to go out at night you need to Contact a driver/taxi driver and make sure that he comes to the front door of the riad and Escort you to the main road where he parks his car. There is a small road (2-3 min walk) from the main road (Kasbah street) to the riad where it is difficult for a car to drive in. You don't want to walk on these streets with a short skirt on, for instance. So, make sure that the driver comes to the door to pick you up and Escort you. Whatever you do, make sure that you agree on the price BEFORE you enter the car. Taxi drivers have a tendency to "forget" details. My advice is to find someone that you Think is ok and call him every time you want to go somewhere by taxi, they will be more than happy to assist you then.

Before booking, I read some of the comments, and I was slightly put off. but most of the comments were  so I booked it anyway. I was right in doing so. I found the staff friendly, the room only facility I booked was clean and comfortable. Sure the room was a little bit noisy due to the sash windows, sure the floor was a little uneven in some places. This is a really old building and you should expect the quirks that come with that. I found it exceptional value for money even cheaper than the double room we stayed at at a local hostel. I would definately go again.

I don't have any negatives about the hotel, only the booking company Hotelopia who didn't make my reservation, after I had booked it online. It was a pure fluke of chance that the hotel had a double room spare, and were very accommodating for me.

The apartment is really difficult to find if you're driving to Seville. I had read these comments and thought it wouldn't be that difficult using a Sat Nav. It took us 1 hour to find the apartment once we got to Seville as the streets are all one  and very, very  narrow if you end up driving through the old town!! I would advise anyone driving to park the car first in the recommended car park and ring the apartments to send someone  to meet you.

Beautiful building and a great location. The room was nicely modern, but not large. Free Wifi is a nice change from some rip-off hotels. We had robes and slippers as well as free soft drinks and snacks in the Deluxe room.

The large rectangular wash basin was very attractive, but totally impractical, it took up almost all the counter top and was only about 1.5" (37cm) deep, so very hard to use. The breakfast buffet was all cold and a very limited choice, one of the poorest I have had in a long time, you could pay extra for cooked items. We ate in the restaurant one evening and found the menu to be limited and the meal was really mediocre with no side dishes served with the main course, on top of which I got a mild case of food poisoning, I suspect from the four skinny prawns which formed part of my starter.

super service, good staff, nice beach. Great bath room in the palace. Rooms are big enough and I like the design and style.

when you stay in the palace you may encounter less tranquility as you expect. A lot of events with noise. Sometimes the beach, reserved for palace guests only, is blocked. They don't have "rest hours". So everyone can be as noisy as they want until enough others complain. Very strange. Also, as the GM stated: 'In September, you will not find any tranquil place in Nusa Dua or you must go to a bungalow resort which costs'.   Also, in high season, not enough lounges, so you may find yourself on a mattress in the grass.   In former times they had a big wooden board with all the acitvities they execute, and executed them.  Nowadays, the board only, is left. Or as the GM stated it: 'I cannot hire an employee for beach volleyball only'. In Jan-Feb, we played almost daily, low season. Now, with much more customers around, we played twice in three weeks.  And other activities are not happening anymore.  Also, because of the lack of enough lounges for regular customers, the customers used the lounges of the palace.   The tourists told them to move away, this is for special customers only. The hotel rarely did this.  Last: In the palace, it takes 5-10 to get warm water. It is a waste of water.
super service, good staff, nice beach. Great bath room in the palace. Rooms are big enough and I like the design and style.

They don't have "rest hours". So everyone can be as noisy as they want until enough others complain. Very strange. Also, as the GM stated: 'In September, you will not find any tranquil place in Nusa Dua or you must go to a bungalow resort which costs'.   Also, in high season, not enough lounges, so you may find yourself on a mattress in the grass.   In former times they had a big wooden board with all the acitvities they execute, and executed them.  Nowadays, the board only, is left. Or as the GM stated it: 'I cannot hire an employee for beach volleyball only'. In Jan-Feb, we played almost daily, low season. Now, with much more customers around, we played twice in three weeks.  And other activities are not happening anymore.  Also, because of the lack of enough lounges for regular customers, the customers used the lounges of the palace.   The tourists told them to move away, this is for special customers only. The hotel rarely did this.  Last: In the palace, it takes 5-10 to get warm water. It is a waste of water.

Position on the hill is excellent for views and the chalets are beautiful and thoughtfully set out to give privacy. The standard of the lodges are excellent. The roominess is excellent and so too is the quality of furniture and bedding. Well  thought out design to incorporate excellent bathroom facilities, bath and shower. Linen and towels changed as often as required and rooms made up beautifully twice a day.

Quite a trek over a dirt road to get to the gate house from a main road. We were glad that we had obtained clear directions from a source other than the standard site information.  Some of the guides were better than others. We thought that some management of the safari trips would benefit customers so that they knew in advance the expected animals to be seen on each trip to avoid duplication and holding back more seasoned travellers. The caves were listed as starting at 9.30 a.m. but actually commenced 7a.m.

The restaurant managers attitude and manner very unprofessional and rude, same as the rest of staff except a few. Asked for a map upon arrival but did not receive at all thoughtout my stay. Won't  recommend at all as there many other options available for the same price if not cheaper. It's the worst hotel experience I've had in Morrocco and I'm marrocan too so I know the country and people well.

Very unique and small hotel , ideal for couples for a relaxing holiday. Pool was nice.

Roof top bar or poolside not open and looks like it hasn't been open for a long time. Maybe the recession has hit visitor numbers to warrant not opening the facilities. Breakfast was cold on a number of days; keeping the burners alight under the food is all that is needed, but this was often overlooked which meant the food was cold. Otherwise the breakfast was good with a great choice.   Some parts of the hotel are in need of remedial work, like chipped tiles around the pool and missing tiles. Little things like this impact on the overall image of the hotel.

The hotel is a electric shock death trap! My cooker did not work for cooking but for electric shocks. Even after I told them, I doubt they will have changed the cooker rings and taken them off. The kitchen is not really equipped even for simple cooking, like scrambled eggs. There weren't any bowls for example, so you can't have cereal either  Sauna did not work, probably has not worked for some time. Air conditioning in the gym is pointless.   I think the service staff are worked too hard, I want to know that even if they are not well paid, that they get enough time to rest.     Being asked to wait 2 mins for them to check the mini bar is demeaning. Hardly going to give a hotel with dangerous facilities more profile by spending in the mini-bar!!!

This resort is very well laid out and in a localised design which makes a refreshing change from the concrete blocks further along the beach and is in a fantastic location.Good value for money.    The grounds and pool (resort exclusive use) are well maintained and it is literally 2 steps  the beach with sun loungers at the end of Alona so very limited passers by.

The room was simple but kept clean- a few niceties such as a second towel, shelf in the bathroom, local information pack etc would really elevate from the "budget" category.    The only let down was the food in the restaurant- fine, but there are much better options 2 mins down the beach, and the helpfulness of the staff. Whilst they were eager to help, information you would expect to be readily available i.e. whether we had already paid for our room, up to date times of local boats to Cebu etc was not to hand and took rather too long to obtain. This resort has so much going for it, again just needs to work on a few areas to make it an exceptional recommendation.

From my arrival to departure, I enjoyed almost everything about the hotel, from its value to its cleanliness.

They use the "sleep number" system, but apparently, no one had checked the remote control because the bed did not change per my attempt at adjusting it, OR they need to provide better instructions to guests on how to use it. Also, an 8-inch pepperoni pizza with diet Coke from room service (I arrived around 1 a.m.) tasted good, but when you add California sales tax, a delivery charge AND a tip, the total came to $26! Insane.

The hotel has a central position in the center of Warszaw. The lobby is large and welcoming in style and specially the   breakfast-restaurant is nice and impressing. An other good thing is that we could check in earlier than what is usual, and hold the room to 12 o'clock the day of depart.

But what help is all facilities if the hotel is noisy in the night. The noise was turbulent, not only in the later evening, but till 3 and 4 o'clock in the night. Young people smashing doors, and the knocking and sounds from overlying rooms tell also much about the construction of this hotel. I had reserved three rooms lying in 2., 3, and 4. floor, and these problemes were commun for all of us. We contacted the reception many times withou result. Ironically: On the table in all rooms were we met with this welcome: WE GIVE GUARANTEE THAT YOU WILL BE 100% SATISFIED AT OUR HOTEL

We stayed two separate nights in September 2013. The first night, the bathtub was clogged and would not drain when my child took a shower.  Maintenance had to come in and plunge the tub.  Gross.  The second night, my child again went into the bathroom to shower, and there was a USED tampon applicator on the floor that had blood on the tip.  DISGUSTING.  If the room was cleaned, how on earth was that missed?  We reported this to the front desk, who ensured us it would be passed along to the next manager on duty, but of course we never heard back from anyone about it.  We will definitely not be staying at this hotel again.

Stayed here for a week the end of September this year.  We had a room in the annex which was round the corner.  Room was massive with four beds (there was only two of us) we had a fridge also which apparently the rooms in the main hotel don't have.  Very clean! Got fresh towels every day! Had to pay 30 for air con and got back 10 which we thought was fair.  Also had to secure a 50 deposit which you got back at the end of your stay.  Staff were friendly enough just don't get on the wrong side of the night guard! Good value for money and would deffo stay again! Also plenty of sun loungers to go around which has been an issue with other hotels iv stayed in. We were room only so couldn't comment on the food.
Location is very close to strip but down streets which all look the same. Once you get your bearings it not so bad!  Deffo don't let this put you off though.

Wonderful location in the middle of nowhere (you absolutely need a car..). Arcos Gardens Resort has wonderful facilities (we stayed in a townhouse villa): a wonderful place to rest, golf, swim, fitness, spa facilities. And you can even arrange some archery lessons. In the near vicinity we went horseback riding. The town of Arcos is within 5 min distance by car, Jerez 30 min, Sevilla 45 min. Our stay has been worthwhile!

We cannnot express how much we enjoyed staying at the Samaya. The staff were some of the best we have ever met - so very kind and professional, they just couldn't do enough for us. Dewa was our host and was so friendly and helpful, and we also enjoyed chatting to the hotel manager and all the lovely waiters and waitresses in the restaurants, including Sudomo who was lovely at breakfast. Our villa was spectacular and they went to a great effort to make it extra special for us as we were on our honeymoon.     Unfortunately I was unwell during our stay (nothing to do with the hotel at all) and the staff were incredibly helpful in bringing me everything I needed to recover, which made a huge difference - including baking me food that I fancied specially to help build up my strength. I had also registered with them as gluten free and they always remembered to check and ensure that my food was correct.    The free shuttle bus service they provide is also a real bonus - they will take you to any part of Ubud and come and collect you at any time, with very short notice.    We would really recommend the Samaya to anybody thinking of staying there - we loved it.
We have nothing negative to say!

The worst days in I've stayed in the beds were so high I couldn't get on the bed by myself my grandson had to help me on , there was no fridge and no microwave in the room and we were there for 5 days I was told at reception that it would cost an extra 10 dollars. a  day  just for a fridge, the funny part of it was when we booked in we were told they would give us a disabled room because we were staying 5 nights we would have more room, I think they forgot to tell housekeeping because every day they only left towels for two people and we had to go to the desk and ask for more. Enjoyed a one-night stay here, visiting family in Lancaster.  Didn't expect too much (going by some online reviews) but was pleasantly surprised.  I had a spacious double room at the back. Not troubled by noise tho the window does not open - for health and safety reasons I understand from the hotel's online comments.  Clean, plain, good decoration.  Firm comfortable bed. Staff I met at reception and (lovely, light) dining room were friendly and professional.  Good clean towels provided, plus soap, shower gel, shower cap, and other lotions.  Information pack said I could get more on request.  My feedback, on departure, that the bathroom door was ill-fitting and would not shut was met with a polite and professional response that they would get someone to fix it. It was not really a problem for me.    Only had cereal and toast for breakfast so cannot comment on the cooked breakfast.  The b

As with other establishments I have stayed at, the room was too warm.  I solved this by throwing off the bedclothes unitl I cooled down   :)  Only a little quibble about breakfast: no choice of teas (I don't drink the standard Indian tea), and would have liked a non-sweetened muesli.  All the cereals provided were things like cornflakes, weetabix etc.

Enjoyed a one-night stay here, visiting family in Lancaster.  Didn't expect too much (going by some online reviews) but was pleasantly surprised.  I had a spacious double room at the back. Not troubled by noise tho the window does not open - for health and safety reasons I understand from the hotel's online comments.  Clean, plain, good decoration.  Firm comfortable bed. Staff I met at reception and (lovely, light) dining room were friendly and professional.  Good clean towels provided, plus soap, shower gel, shower cap, and other lotions.  Information pack said I could get more on request.  My feedback, on departure, that the bathroom door was ill-fitting and would not shut was met with a polite and professional response that they would get someone to fix it. It was not really a problem for me.    Only had cereal and toast for breakfast so cannot comment on the cooked breakfast.  The b

As with other establishments I have stayed at, the room was too warm.  I solved this by throwing off the bedclothes unitl I cooled down   :)  Only a little quibble about breakfast: no choice of teas (I don't drink the standard Indian tea), and would have liked a non-sweetened muesli.  All the cereals provided were things like cornflakes, weetabix etc.

Hotel 28 is located on the outskirts of Kamara village about 10 minutes walk from the beach and well away from the noise and bustle of the beach front area.  The swimming pool is clean and surrounded by 16 double sun beds.  This should be ample for 28 rooms but some people still insist on going out early to reserve a bed.  Five of the beds are in permanent shade whilst the others are in the sun either in the morning or afternoon.  There is a pool bar open all day selling drinks and snacks at typical Kamara prices.  The garden area is small.  There is plenty of space for parking.    Breakfast is a buffet of fruit, cereal, scrambled or hard boiled eggs and either bacon or small sausages plus bread and toast, cake, fruit juice tea and coffee.  It can be eaten either inside or out on the balcony.    The rooms are a reasonable size, painted white and nicely designed with a sink in the bedroom and the shower and toilet in the bathroom.   The wardrobe has plenty of clothes hangers and shelf space for clothes.  The air-conditioning is effective and quiet.  All 28 rooms are in a single block on three floors.  The ground floor is partly below ground level.  Views from rooms on one side are of the pool and the other side of a small holding (farm).     Most guests seemed to be on their second, third etc visit.  I suspect the reason for this is the three front of house ladies, Aggie, Dimi and Joanna who are always cheerful and willing to do everything to make your stay a happy and memorable one.  Thank you girls.

Unfortunately the concrete construction of the hotel does transmit any noise and the door locks seem to be designed to make it impossible to lock or unlock without making a noise so overall it can be a bit noisy.

The apartment is totally equipped with everything you need, so there is no worry about dishes and easy to wash your laundry when needed. The aircon is working very good even on very hot days. The staff in the reception are very helpful.

Internet is quite expensive. I was told it was not possible to have wifi in the apartment but only in the reception which is not really an option unless you will spend most of your holiday in a reception.  The bar/cafe in the pool area is very slow and noisy on the service during the day, and the servants do not even know their standing offers on drinks so they try to charge you full price every time unless you notice. If they improved their overall service there, it would make more people stay for a snack or a drink on a daily basis.

The customer service was appalling,much worse than any other UK hotel I have ever stayed in. The reception desk was unmanned at the busiest times, with members of staff walking behind the desk ignoring the queues of people trying to check out. I missed public transport connections because I had to wait for over 10 minutes just to speak to someone to remedy the fact that my key card did not work and then had to wait again to check out. Staff simply could not care less that people were waiting and were finding anything to do rather than serve them. I will never use the hotel chain again and recommend to my friends and colleagues that they do not either.It was completely farcical, given that the only reason the hotel exists is to serve guests.

I am pretty angry at both hotelopia and G Hotel for overcharging me, so I do not have much positive to write.

The pool is not open right now, and this hotel and this website does not guests about that beforehand.  Since I wanted a hotel with a pool, I checked out early.  I told the hotel minutes after checking in that I wanted to check out because it has no working pool and they left me waiting for a long time and told me to call hotelopia myself.  When I used the customer service number provided on this website, they were closed.  I checked out early and emailed hotelopia twice.  The hotel now claims that I did not check out early and I have not received my money back, even though the invoice for check out was printed on the actual day I checked out.      I asked the concierge for help in getting a visa to Thailand, which is a service that most travel agents in Penang will do and I have done through many hotels in Penang.  The concierge told me that this service does not exist; I asked if he knew any travel agents on Chuia Street, and he told me that I have to go to the embassy myself.  It's one thing to not know, but I found this unhelpful and rude.  When I went to Chuia Street, the first travel agency I saw was able to provide the service and they said they would have gone to the hotel to collect my passport which would have been nice because EVERY taxi in Penang will overcharge foreigners and refuse to turn on the meter.    Overall, I found this experience frustrating both with hotelopia and G Hotel.  If I was provided with what is promised and what is standard for a hotel, I would have enjoyed my stay.  But, I see a couple of months of arguing ahead as I am not going to pay for nights that I did not spend in a hotel that advertises a pool that is closed... You cannot swim on the beach at the hotel and I was not interested in spending six days at the mall.

I used to stay at this hotel years ago and it was a fabulous hotel....definitely worthy of the 4 star rating. I was disappointed and shocked at the current state of it. It's quite dirty (carpets, baseboard, walls) and has a very musty smell, despite the rooms being cleaned on a regular basis.  The staff at the bar seemed inconvenienced that we were there and the bar nuts were so stale that they were inedible.     We were originally put on a smoking floor in a smoking room (despite indicating an allergy to smoke) and the staff tried to convince us that you could not smell the smoke. It was like walking into a bar at 4am....with years of smoke seeping through the walls.    Thankfully the hotel is being made into a Doubletree at some point. Until such time, I would not recommend this hotel at all. Sad to see what was once a great hotel weathered by age and neglect. But then again, as my friend said "Yeah, I used to be a 4 star ten year's ago also" :)

Wonderful. The staff are friendly and professional .

Nothing negative to say apart from the fact that the hotel complex closes at the end of September, until the beginning of June. I would love to go throuout the winter, but unfortunately will have to stay elsewhere, because these apartments would be my 1st choice.

Hotel staff were very helpful and all spoke good English. Breakfast was excellent with a huge choice. On site taxi drivers were brilliant , we used them every time we went out ,arranged pick up times with them and even visited auchwitz by taxi. Return to the centre was about  £10 and the trip to auchwitz was £55 and there were 3 of us so the prices were great and the service was great. On arrival we upgraded to a suite which was excellent with a small kitchen ares and loads of storage. Overall a brilliant hotel.

Hotel was slightly out of the  and a taxi or bus is necessary but so cheap that it's not a problem also worth it because the hotel really nice with nice grounds that you wouldn't get from a hotel in the centre.

We were allocated a disabled room (room 921) which was not asked for. No vanity in bathroom just a hand basin. Had to put makeup case on the floor!!! Very, very poor clothes hanging space. Great location, clean, friendly staff, good food. We couldn't have asked for anything else- right in the middle of shopping, transport and the harbor. Highly recommend.
Great location, clean, friendly staff, good food. We couldn't have asked for anything else- right in the middle of shopping, transport and the harbor. Highly recommend.

the rooms are very large with plenty of cupboard space fridge aircon and tv the food the food in general was very good but very similar every day breakfast was good 3 cereal orange hard boiled and scrambled egg lots of bread and croscents and freshly cooked pancakes while you wait etc dinner every day one fish one beef and one chicken in different sauces always melon and great selection of salads plus 3 deserts cut in small peices pool area very good but chairs do not have cushions so not very confortable ;pool towels supplied by poolman as the hotel does not have a drinks licence no acholic drinks allowed in dining room or any where in hotel except your bedroom this is a very busy hotel and gets large groups it is good value for money most staff very friendly and helpful if you have booked please go you will enjoy it is in a good position for town and beach just informing you what to expect so enjoy and have a good time

This is quite an old Hotel that needs updating we stayed here 13 days on a Half Board basis I will give you a True account of this Hotel Firstly be prepared to pay 35 Dirums roughly £3.oo a day for the Room which the hotel collects for Government Tax we was not informed by our travel agent when booking also on their website it stated there is a coffee maker in room this is a mistake as there has never been supplied in any room take your own kettle also it states there is a lift this is only in the main part of the hotel which does not have balconys if you go to the other section be prepared for loads of stairs all over the hotel so not for disabled people when we arrived we saw 3 rooms and finaly setted on the one on same level of reception the rooms are very large with plenty of cupboard space fridge aircon and tv we had a swarm of ants which cleaner sprayed room and left us a spray it took 3 days to eliminate the room was never cleaned properly she used the same water to clean floor from all the other rooms you could see the water was black also the tv and pictures was very dusty this applied all around the Hotel even in the restaurant I saw birds flying around and ants and flies around the food the food in general was very good but very similar every day breakfast was good 3 cereal orange hard boiled and scrambled egg lots of bread and croscents and freshly cooked pancakes while you wait etc dinner every day one fish one beef and one chicken in different sauces always melon and great selection of salads plus 3 deserts cut in small peices pool area very good but chairs do not have cushions so not very confortable ;pool towels supplied by poolman as the hotel does not have a drinks licence no acholic drinks allowed in dining room or any where in hotel except your bedroom this is a very busy hotel and gets large groups it is good value for money most staff very friendly and helpful   entertain team are a joke there is 3 of them and all they do is turn the music up loud round the pool from 10am to 6pm had to keep getting up to ask them to turn it down sometimes one of them plays water polo when he gets a few people but most of time is round the bar talking to the rest of staff most of the day who congregate round the bar that sells soft drinks water and food This Hotel does not have its own beach so you can go to the private beach which charges 2.5 euros per day for chairs if you have booked please go you will enjoy it is in a good position for town and beach just informing you what to expect so enjoy and have a good time

Well presented, clean and friendly hotel minutes from central Valletta. Easy check in and check out, excellent facilities and a good overall experience.

Terrible coffee! For a five star hotel, you expect decent coffee and not some nasty stuff pumped out of a machine. We had to go out of the hotel to find decent coffee.     While breakfast and dinner were excellent, lunch was less so. The Tiki bar on poolside had a very good menu but not for lunch - nothing in the  of light snacks like sandwiches. There was an alternative menu but that was only for while you sat on your sun lounger. If you wanted to sit out of the sun in the pool-side restaurant (where no dress code was enforced and people often just sat in their swimming costumes but five star prices were charged) the snack menu was not available. Odd as the waiting staff and even the kitchen was the same! Not a big deal but worth considering if you aren't a big lunch eater.

We arrived at 12pm to find that we could not check-in until 3pm. This was bad enough without the rude, defensive attitude of the staff. There was a sign saying that we could pay 10 pounds extra for a sea view, we asked the bored receptionist if we ha a room with a sea view to which she answered no. We did not bother to pay the extra money as at the point we'd decided that we would be spending as little time as possible at the hotel, we took our bags and tried to find something to do for the next few hours. We were not even invited to wait in the lobby or told about anything we could do whilst waiting    We came back to the hotel at 2.55pm to a huge queue. The staff were still rude,  and unhelpful, and after receiving our our keys we went up the the 160 per night room. It was like taking a trip back to the 80's, the decor was extremely dated, the soft furnishing were dirty and smelled musty, the curtains were so old and uncared for that they had been belched by the sun, the wood works/furniture were peeling and warped by years of cleaning and the carpet was filthy. The receptionist had lied as we did indeed have a sea view and would have paid 10pounds extra for something we already had.    In the end, we stayed at a friends house on her sofa bed rather than face rude staff members and unclean conditions.    We will NEVER go back to this hotel again and will make sure we warn anyone else not to.

Good location, walking distance to Palma Nova or Portals Nous. Nice pool and garden area, good comfy seating and covered private areas. Breakfast fantastic with lots of choice, fresh fruits, bread, pastries, freshly cooked eggs/bacon, cava served every day, nespresso machine for great coffee.  Great garden bar with wide choice of drinks. DIdn't use the spa but looked very good.  Very good free wifi worked  at the pool and rooms. Small beach with pontoon out to sea.  Would defintely return to this hotel.

The location of the hotel is perfect, on placa Catalunya, you are just a few minutes walk from la ramba street and barri gotic. Aero bus station is also a 5 minute walk to hotel. The staff are very helpful and professional, rooms are small but clean and breakfast is ok.

Size of the room, you shouldn't expect comforness but it maches the price you pay. At night it could be a little noisy and you can hear your neighbours, so if someone has a problem with sleep, i don't recommend this hotel.

We were exceptionally happy with the hotel, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. As I said already in my assessment, Judy Chen on the reception went out of her  to help us with any request we made, such as writing instructions in Mandarin to show the taxi driver, and showing us on the map where various places were. This was my third time in Shanghai and I always recommend your hotel as the best place to stay to friends as it is so central and right in the middle of the French Concession.
I don't have any negative comments to make.

The hotel is set in an excellent location and is very clean. The rooms are a great size with a TV that offers English channels such as BBC1, BBC2, Channel4, Film 4 and SKY International NEWS.
Food and entertainment could be better.

Room modest in size but well appointed with very comfortable beds.Good insulation against street noise contributed to the relaxing environment.The bathroom was excellent with a splendid-and easy to use-rain shower.  Staff were young ,enthusiastic, welcoming,helpful and energetic.A broken bedside light was replaced promptly.  The buffet breakfast was spendid in terms of both quality and quantity.  The hotel is housed in a beautiful building immediately adjacent to public transport ,including the metro.  Relationship between quality and price was very good indeed.
Staff appeared to be few in number and despite their best efforts could struggle with volume at peak times.

At breakfast my wife saw a member of staff returning food from a plate to the buffet.  Somewhat put out she talked to the restaurant manager who became loud spoken and rude.  He explained that this was policy as the food had been taken but not eaten as the customer had declined to pay the £5 EB surcharge.  As there were traces of scrambled egg on the plate as well as the sausages this was not apparent to other customers.  We have never seen this before and will not see it again as we will not stay at an hotel with such a policy

Great staff.........very clean room and Hotel as a whole very clean too.........good food....good value for money.

Room 209 is advertised as land view, however there is a building just opposite .....big white wall.....then once in balcony to the right there is some land view....so most probably the building in question was built after the hotel was built....would offer room at cheaper price than land view to compensate for this.....if it was my decision.

Our double room was comfortable, generous size and  the same for the ensuite, great water pressure for the shower, breakfast was adequate but quite average with a limited choice, standard fare.  A very convenient location, Tube station around the corner, bus services, Tesco

Staff was very unfriendly when it came to ordering a taxi. Knowing that I have to reach the airport at the certain time they kept saying it's Sunday, so they can't guarantee I will get the cab on time. I decided to take care of the transportation myself in this case.

The trainie staff who was on the desk was very friendly and helpful (even when myself and brother couldn't work the door key). The beds and chairs in the room are really comfortable and the bathroom was clean, i can't comment on the food from here as we didn't eat at the hotel. There was no noise from outside the room which meant a quiet night sleep. Overall, I would happily stay there again and recommend it! Even the spider that crawled across my pillow didn't put me off and im petrified of them.

I had a really good stay at the hotel. After reading reviews about the hotel reception staff and the breakfasts I wasn't expecting too much but I was very impressed. I would certainly consider this hotel again if I want to revisit Birmingham.
The connecting rooms were noisy especially at night. Some of the cuttlery and plates weren't properly cleaned, but it was very busy when we stayed there.

Wonderful to arrive to smiling faces, friendly and helpful staff and to find a spacious, comfortable room well supplied with all necessities (which are totally absent in many European hotels). We would definitely stay here again.
The pool area being closed was a minor inconvenience and totally understandable as the hotel is under renovation. Amazingly this was the only inconvenience.
Excellent gym, free weights and machines as well as cardio.   Hotel staff very professional and helpful.   Very quiet rooms.  Excellent location, close to everything.
Very tiny rooms, when you sit on the toilet your legs are literally in the shower.   If you are a big person this isn't the hotel for you.
very helpful staff, excellent location
Twin beds nasty gap in middle ugh!

Friendly, helpful staff who smiled and acted politely. Immensely hard working entertainment team who helped make my children's holiday even better. Great location, good selection of food -- only rated 4 since it seemed that some of the food was recycled or simply left over from earlier meal times. But even so, the choice was varied, tasty and plentiful. They catered for a diverse clientele, chips and burgers were not prominent, fish, meats and salads were.

Noise attenuation between apartments was poor, but that would be the same for many apartment blocks. The main pool is shaded for much of the day and thus too cold to be inviting; it was rarely used by most guests. The kids' pool however was perfect for our needs, as was the small beach immediately adjacent.

after reading reviews quite worried, but pleasantly surprised, yes area is not the best but its a city centre location if you are used to world cities its fine never felt unsafe and walked back at 4am.   staff when we arrived very early morning were fantastic and that welcome made our stay, room basic but very clean and tidy, yes little noisy but again its city ccentre . hotel is 3mins from omonia metro so youcan explore very easily,  do not go off bad comments the price location and service were fantastic, yes little noisy are bit scruffy but its a city centre location not monte carlo bay so go expecting a city just like london new york or rome
breakfast ok and a bit chaotic at peak time but perfectly adequate,

Incredibly friendly staff.  It was nice to be welcomed with a cold drink and face towel on such a hot day.  Beautiful, clean well-appointed rooms which were well maintained during our stay.  Fun activities to choose from.  Large range of restaurants to choose from.  Magnificent pools.  Access to facilities at the adjoining resorts mean you essentially are staying at a hotel three times larger than normal.  I would definitely recommend this resort.
Wi-Fi availability was poor - very slow.  Restaurant prices are very high.  Better value can be obtained by taking a $5 taxi to Port Denarau and dining at one of the restaurants there.
nothing positive
every thing negative

We were upgraded to a 2-bedroomed suite, it was like living in an apartment. The furnishings were good and there was a fridge and three a/c units! We shut one bedroom off and lived in the rest. The hotel is pretty new and therefore it is in good condition, the exterior is quite impressive and the lobby too. the staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. Below I will set out the negatives, though, it did not stop us booking 3 more nights there, and yes, I would stay there again and reccomendt it as I am hoping that the management will pick up on the criticism and apply measures to amend them which will turn this (in my opinion) from a decent hotel into a very good one. On another site by the  there was mention that the Simfoni was next to a Chinese cremetorium, if there is one we could not find it...

The first thing, starting from the room is simple, but easy to fix. the TV, it has only 5 local channels and they are not tuned in well at all.  The Hotel is a good walk from town, but we are walkers and it poses no problems and the taxi is only 10 ringett if you are struggling.  The breakfast is poor for western tastes and if reviews like this continue the hotel may not attract western accustomed bookings. The staff, and there is no shortage of them, lack leadership in the dining area. the food caters for local tastes and even they must wonder at the lack of choice, One other thing, FIRE ESCAPES! There are 2 lifts, next to each other and there are no shortage of stairs in the Simfoni, the trouble is they ALL lead to locked doors! WHO UNLOCKS them in an emergancy? TAKE NOTE HOTELOPIA and MANAGEMENT. Make this the hotel it has the potential to be.
On the beach, centrally located, with clean rooms. Best water pressure I ever experienced in a hotel shower. Taxi drivers right outside the hotel. Great price!

They said the hotel was at full capacity, so they didn't have any extra towels. There was only 2 people in the room, so we got 2 towels, they changed them every day, but you had to wait or call to get the replacement towels. No washcloths, and the towels were frayed. Stayed last week in Sept., thus, offseason. Only get Wi-Fi at the hotel bar.
Lovely. Very quiet as described. Lovely staff incredibly friendly and helpful. Exactly as reviewed elsewhere highly reccomended
None - except for the crowing of the cockerels in the morning which was often before dawn but that's due to the farms in the area

- No lift for guests, its only for luggage. Have to climb 2-3 floors  - b/f is very basic, could be improved  - no assistance for city tour, guide etc from staff  - no coffee machine in room (may be not by Italian tradition)
A beautiful hotel living up to the title of "Royal" Highly recommended.

We stayed here for one night when we visited Clearwater. A room for 4 of us only cost £50.00, for what we paid the hotel was faultless, it was right on the beach, no problems with parking and the staff were extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble for them. would definitely stay here again.
Absolutely Awesome!! This hotel is definitely worth the money!! Super super cheap but really good. We have never stayed in such a nice complex!

Booking through Hotelopia was excellent value. Paid budget hotel price and obtained five star service. Reception staff efficient and welcoming. Even gave us upgrade to Business Class room which would have cost €323 for the night if booked at the hotel.  Excellent evening meal and breakfast at the Vie En Rose restaurant.  Free shuttle bus to airport. All good!
nice clean freindly

The hotel was in a fantastic location. The rooms were different but that is what I loved about it. The pool closed rather early in the evening which was disappointing-6pm. The brunch looked incredible but actually never had any food in the hotel.
I couldn't find anything negative in the hotel.  If I would I would gladly tell, but is a very good place to stay.
Very nice hotel .  Loveley position Well worth a visit. Try the weekly special meal ,good value for money

Stayed in the hotel 29 August to 2 September. Standard room shower leaking any ware but the bath( which was really cramped). Worst of all loud banging music (even though we were on the sixth floor) upto 3am. Surprised to see the Hotel achived 4 stars. I would recomend 2, and if you want to sleep then find another hotel.
We arrived at 9pm and had paid for an evening meal we were told that the restaurant closed at 8pm but they made us sandwiches and delivered them to our room at no charge.

Nowhere on there site does it say what time the restaurant closes in the evening. Hotel is looking shabby and could do with an overhaul but cheap and cheerful. If you are looking to stay in a posh hotel dont book here but if you are after somewhere for a night or two that doesn't cost the earth it's fine.
Room is comfortable staff are helpful, the free shuttle to disney is essential!
Breakfast - stick with continental breakfast, try and eat in the main restaurant not the overshoot restaurant on the other side.  Otherwise it is good value and very efficient
Real close to the beach

All the rooms located at the older part of the building, needs a deep general cleaning supervised by the housekeeping manager. Especially the carpets through out the entire property the reason I am in the hotel buisness my self a dirty hotel room is a Sin!
Room was not good even though the price was expensive..
Immaculate. Very friendly staff. Amazing location.

We spent a week here in Sept and we absolutely loved it. The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful. The hotel was spotless and facilities modern and efficient. We don't normally stay by the pool but the pool was lovely and so relaxed and great having snacks and drinks available. The main menu was very good. Leylur was extremely obliging and runs the hotel very well. We will definitely be back and thoroughly recommend it.

Our only disappointment was the half board food [set menu]. It was rather boring and tended to repeat itself, very cheap though. We ate out a few nights. I would have rather paid more for a better menu.
Took over one hour to check in, new receptionist that was finding it difficult with so many Spanish, dinning room crazy on first morning. Could tell they were ready to close areas for winter season.

Hotel is in a very good location just a block or so walk from the beach. Close to good shopping, cafes,  Restaurants and just next door to the night markets. Staff were helpful, friendly and obliging. Concierge desk  Offered good information and helpful service. The convenience store in hotel lobby was a bonus also.
Three of us staying in the room but only ever offered us two towels. We had to ask each day for more.  The bathroom is a little small and cramped although the room itself was quite adequate.
good location

Great location in Clearwater. Hotel is right on the beautiful beach.   Had a live band on the terrace on Saturday and Sunday afternoon.  If I was to return to clearwater I would defiantly stay at this hotel.
Very impressed with facilities, great value for money, would use again
Close to city centre, about 15 minutes on foot (and downhill). Good breakfast, fair choice of food and drink.

Carpet in the room needs a wash badly, not many English/international channels compared to other hotels in Portugal. Wi-Fi only available in common areas and not the rooms. Breakfast room very small, had to wait for a table to become available.

Nice location, right in the middle of the city. Close to Cadiz (10 km). Plenty of bars in the area, with excellent food. Car parking available (although a little expensive). Internet in the room, with excellent speed. Friendly and helptul staff (although speaking English was a challenge for them). Excellent breakfast!

Difficult to reach by car, as it is placed in a sqare closed to cars (but we managed to get there). You can only visit Cadiz if you have a car. Difficult to find parking (but hotel parking available).
Easy access to all the good restaurants. Ideally situated for the amenities. Value for money budget hotel.
Cleanliness needs to be addressed. Bathroom needs attention desperately.
centrally located within walkingdistance to the museumarea

ordered a room in the back of the hotel - not facing the street - but got a room on second floor facing the street (with streetcars, trams, buses, cars etc. really  terribly noisy) beds too softy, pillows impossibly thick and high, stuffed with some rubbermaterial, room very, very small, bathroom just a shower and toilet - and if you are a bit oversized  (which I am not thankfully) I do not know how you would be able to get in there in the first place.
There is an excellent advantage of this hotel is location. The strategic location let us wandering around from east yo west without worry about transport.

The room is not expected big, the photo really for illustration only. The deluxe room not much different than superior room. But the price is different. Some rate the hotel 3stars, some rate the hotel 2star. The toiletries is not complete.  The floor is made of mable, but without disposable paper slippers. The floor is extremely cold.
a little disappointed on arrival .hotel had no record of our booking and after a 5 hour flight .that's all we wanted at 1.30 in the morning..

This hotel was previously the Ramada and our taxi driver from the airport was aware of this but others were not and had trouble finding it.....The room was excellent and the bathroom, although slightly dated was massive.  The beds were easily the most comfortable we have slept in on our travels.
Pool area could do with a clean up.... not well maintained or tables etc cleaned of dust.  Smoking in the restaurants put us off eating here.

Cannot praise the New Lanark Mill enough.....Everything about this place is fantastic.  The entire area is amazing.  We had a beautiful room overlooking the river.  The staff were all extremely friendly and accommodating.  Our meal in the restaurant was superb and breakfast was lovely.
The only negative about this hotel is that I can't visit more often.  We will definitely be back

I have booked and paid the booking through Hotelopia. However, hotel receptionist Ainon refused to check me in as hotel is fully booked for the day. I have yet to get any refund from Hotelopia or Prescott. I feel cheated.
Very friendly and helpful straff. Room is clean and tidy every day. Excellent location 250 metres from the Vatican City.
Clean, modern, located on the Malecon close to Habana Vieja. Very friendly, helpfull and smiling staff. Excelent food and breakfast.
Our third stay at this hotel and again did not disappoint.  Wish I could say the same for the weather.
from the moment you exit your vehicle staff are on hand to assist.  All staff were extremely efficient, friendly
Rooms and bathrooms could do with some renovation as they are a little tired
Fab views from the 12th floor.  Excellent shower.  Great location for the Bullring and station
Swimming pool excellent.

The TV systems does not function well and over the period of stay it was not very useful especially when you have kids that want to enjoy this service.     The bath tub in the room discharge system did not function, one would expect that this would be check prior to check in. This resulted in us not being able to utilize the bath with the great scenery.    The housekeeping was not on par, papers were seen in the room behind objects which should have been removed prior to our check in.    Room provided to us was not correct as we were said that we would be upgraded to a Junior Suite, but we received the original room which was small and very uncomfortable for us as a family.    Management and staff was very helpful in trying to resolve the issues, but this should never have been issues in such a hotel which has a high level standing in the market place. This was a disappointing experience and one that I would like to forget.
Very nice room and absolutely gorgeous grounds. The breakfast spread was very nice and catered for a wide variety (no cooked options though).  The internet in the room worked very well.

Location is the biggest downside, as it requires going outside of the main part of Siena, near the railway station and up some darkish/quiet back streets (not bad while the supermarket is open, but very quiet after 10pm) - so less good for walking, but totally fine with a car. The British part of me would also have liked some milk in the room for tea, but it wouldn't be too hard to get it from the supermarket (about 5-10 minutes walk away).
The eveing entertainment was too close to oneanothe, if you sat outside you could here both lots of music
location,facilities etc very good
room allocated to us was above the hammam .The music
Amazing location
They must improve breakfast as it the same thing everyday.

Very friendly helpful staff. Exceptionally clean hotel, the rooms are cleaned every day and towels changed. Excellent position in Fira close to main square, bus station restaurants etc. but not too close for it not to be relaxing.

At night the doors banging due to the  they are made, this can't be helped but it kept waking us up and early morning staff up and down stairs to roof outside our balcony. The breakfast - plenty to eat but the same every day it needs to be changed because if you are there for a week there is no choice.
Very clean and well kept hotel.
The hotel looks amazing, the food is good and the drinks are all good brands (Becks,Pepsi etc...

This hotel has the potential to be outstanding however the are some issues that need to be sorted out first. The system for booking the a la carte restaurants is an absolute joke! You need to get up at 07:30 am to stand in a que and book Your dinner on the touchscreen computer in the main lobby, only to find that all tables are fully booked for the next 2 days. This system just repeats itself and makes your holiday a stressful rush to get to that machine (what happened to relaxing)  I was asking for a glass of merlot red wine and the waiter did not know what it was, you would think in a 5 star a la carte restaurant they would know what wines they have.
The Hotel is Clean and all  the staff members are professionals and the quality of the food are Good.....Thanx Cape Town Ritz Hotel i will call again...

Excellent apartments in a great location. Staff and owners cannot do enough for you and are always available to advise if the need arises. Apartments are spotless, food is great thanks to Ali the chef and the bar staff are on the ball!!!!
Good position for our visit to London.
A great place to stay everything on your doorstep
Very clean beautiful location
Our room was fantastic although a covered balcony would have been preferable. The weather was bad and we couldnt even sit out on the balcony because the rain comes through he wooden covering.

The food for a 5 star hotel was not good. I first of all do not like to help myself at the buffet, i much prefer to order from a menu. After we had eaten a little bit of the food on offer we asked for tia maria coffee, but were told you dont have tia maria. I really expected more. On sunday morning we went to breakfast and walked in on a staff briefing. Shouldnt that be done away from the guests or earlier. Not a good experience all round and certainly wont return.
No positive things about this hotel

Room dirty, staff not polite and helpful, food always the same, this hotel is very bad and i think you have to take out this hotel offer from your website!!
