And just a remark to customer service department . One of your employee  esther, is not very helpful and not polite!!! I was very disappointed from this hotel and disgusted
Beautiful hotel, immaculate rooms, lovely staff
Breakfast buffet - foods not replenished very often. Ran out of bacon and other hot foods. Hard to get a refill of Tea or Coffee
Direct connect to the airport so very good location if you want to stay only one night in HK for transfer.
It was in a great location and the staff were great. Food was okay for the price.

We booked through Hoteltopia picture of the room on the site did not match the room as the room was outdated and terrible. Advertised a gym which was not there also Wi FI not to every room as stated. It is not great for a family and we will not stay there again but it is a cheap hotel and you for what you get.

Hotel room was clean for hotel of this price range. Staff were friendly and helpful generally. Despite problems still good value for money  The down to earth Indian/Pakistani dishes in the resaurant were realy good but the european stufff like omlettes, croisants etc were well below standard.

Apartment had no fridge, when I complained we were given fridge which froze everything. Two electric sockets were faulty, these were replaced. Wash basin tap was loose, this was still a bit loose after being "fixed". Telephone was faulty and the button were elegible, this was replaced. While one realises faults happen in rooms, this room seemed to be neglected either by hotel maganement or previous occupants not reporting faults.   There is bulding going on accross the street from the hotel, this meant noise distruption at most hours of the day. The nature of the rooms window meant the noise was not contained by the windows.  Had to ask for room to be cleaned, which it was after our daily request. Had to request two sets of towels for two people, which I feel one shouldnt have to.  Waiting staff in reastaurant were hit and miss in there ability to understand english.
Hotel personal is very rude, and promises made are not done.
Good value with very pleasant features; the plunge pool particularly attractive.  Staff helpful and friendly
The staff was very kind and showed high Level of professionalism. They were helpful and very understanding. NB! The bed was excelent.
Excellent position good size room comfortable bed.We were visiting friends so did not try restaurant but menu looked good.Will use this hotel again.
Could do with coffee/tea maker in room.Facilities available in reception but not the same and you had to pay.
staff friendly and helpful
Hotel very clean staff are friendly and helpful.
Breakfast could have more variety went to BBQ and they ran out of food no offer of refund that was the only nagative
Intrnet is not working  Refrigirator is not working  Air condition is not working   Elevator is not working properly
Excellent location  Clean well presented rooms  Breakfast had a good selection

could not find reservation when booking in. Kept us stood at desk and did not explain to us the delay in booking in.  Apparently the name on the  reservation was spelt incorrectly but forms i signed were all with the correct spelling??
Want to come back
Hotel clean and tidy with pleasant friendly staff and great value.
Very nice hotel with nice taff and comfortable rooms. Good value for money. It must be the best hotel in Birmingham for the moment.
The quality of the breakfast could be better.

The hotel is nice and clean, and the reception staff (Eva from Slovakia) was super nice! Helpful as helpful can be! And very friendly! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again!
NA
Great location, next to NEC and Airport, just off motorway. Restaurant was very good, staff on reception, bar and restaurant were all very polite, helpful and welcoming

Spa changing room needs some attention, lighting failed when we were there. Showers area and wash basins were untidy with waste, and no shower soaps which might have been useful. Pool was good, and the steam room, just needs to get the changing area sorted.

Very good location, 5 minute walk to where the high speed boat docks. Outside terrace for breakfast was lovely, view of Hvar harbour, food selection/quality fine. Hotel public areas and our room were clean and the bed was comfortable, also inc mini bar/ fridge, hair dryer, basic toiletries. Would definitely stay here again, based on the room rate we paid for our stay, in late Sept. Our room type was their basic city view, so small and at the back of the hotel, with no balcony, but this made it quiet and cool, these rooms are fine with just the ceiling fan to keep them cool, as the front of the hotel gets the sun and more noise.
Hotel could do with renovation, but no doubt this would double the room rates and although dated, room was very clean.The pool is small, but you can use the large pool, sun beds
Great hotel in great surounding. The rooms are excellent with unbelieveble views.
Great hotel near the cliffs.amazing room
Amoung the cheapest options that are not a hostel in London.
Though cheap you do not get much space or value for the money. Old and boring hotel by looks.
No gym facilities. We had room facing road and there was no window to open in room to allow fresh air in.
Great pool area, 5 star accomodation
Staining around vent on ceiling of lovely big room with balcony.

It was a much better experience tahn I would have expect. Espacially the buffet (diner and breakfast) is just amazing. Malayian cuisine at it's best! I can more than recommend this hotel if you have a layover!
Superb location right next to sky train,  Soi Cowboy
Once you know where hotel is, it's easy to get to but initially finding it wasn't easy as the BTS has several exits
Very clean and modern.
Nice, modern, comfortable rooms. Easy parking in the area. Did not use the bar but it looked nice.

The receptionist when we checked in was completely unprofessional. She ignored us for 15minutes when we arrived while speaking on the phone. Ok I get it she was busy, but usually the receptionist can smile or nod to acknowledge the guest. She just kept talking like we were invisible. Hurried and unprofessional check -in. I gave her my business card (I work in the industry and I know hotel usually use them for networking or just for their files) and she didn't know what to do with it. She looked at it and gave it back to me. I was speechless.

Tomatoes at breakfast smelled rotten, things were running out and the buffet looked crowded and unorganized. The waitresses at breakfast were wearing dirty uniforms. I get the fact that they work with food but I work in a hotel too and our team never looks like that.     On the arrival I asked for parking. The young guy at reception said 'sure,ok' and gave us the instructions on how to go to their underground parking. He never mentioned cost or any other procedure. At checkout we found out that we were charged 9 euro per night for the parking. The very polite (but with very bad English) female receptionist said she cannot cancel the charge. The price was not too much so I decided to pay and ask to see a supervisor just to log my complains. I was told that there is no supervisor available (!?!). Decided not to make a scene and left my business card asking for someone to contact me. I wanted to keep it small and just talk to someone, but I guess I need to make a big fuss for someone to get interested.
good location next to the beach
good location, spacious interior, post-soviet aesthetic but still elegant, helpful staff, room ok.
great hotel close to the Old Town!
Ideal location. Close to china town.
Personal breakfast, good breakfast, nice pool, good food in restaurant, nice turn down service and good bath amenities.
Had to get used to open wall to the outside in bathroom - especially as mosquitos came in that . Beach-area not very nice.

When I was still in the sweet dream, I was shouted that the door bell was rang in the morning, when I opened the door, the supervisor told me he just want to supervise/check the room. Oops, my god, what a sth reason ya... I really really don't like that unreasonable service during my stay...
Excellent hotel. Great rooms. Great service. A movie was being filmed at time of stay which made the stay more enjoyable.
Wonderful setting and ambience. Well situated.
Staff interactions were rather mechanical. We got the impression we were tolerated rather than welcomed. Rooms were cleaned very late in day after we'd returned from activities.
Very central, staff excellent, wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
No lift, room 40 would be the best room if you can request it.
Nice,small hotel.  The furnitures aren't up to date,but everything was clean. Very friendly and helpfull staff. The famous Waikiki beach is just a 5 minutes walk away.
The walls aren't very thick,so sometimes we heard the tv or voices of our neighbours and the vakuum cleaner in the corridor starting every morning at 8 am.

This is my 4th visit to the hotel, which I think says something. The staff are friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel is magnificently located right on the beach just outside Marbella, with a bus ride of 10mins into the centre, which gives you the best of both worlds; quiet, relaxation and shopping and night life.

I was a little disappointed with the restaurant this visit. Although the quality of the food is very good, the variation was lacking. I really don't want to eat pork for another year! I realise all tastes have to be catered for but personally I would like to see some dishes of the region now and again.
This hotel is in a very central location, it has a good sized swimming pool the staff are friendly.

I feel this hotel can do with a bit of paint it seems very dated. I also feel this hotel is aimed at the younger market with its central location to the Veronica's area. I also would recommend hat they look at there drinks policy they state that you are only aloud 2 drinks per person from the bar at any time. However if they are some larger groups of young one they can get up to. 20 drinks provided on trays. This then means that if you are standing at the bar in the que you can be waiting some time to be served in a bar with one member of staff and with no air conditioning!
Clean specious rooms nice bathroom with high pressure hot water. Large and clean swimming pools, friendly and helpful staff.

Same variety of food everyday nothing exciting, room service skipped a few days (2 cleaning in 5 days) there are very little pool/poolside activity during the day almost no animations/attractions. This hotel has no beach yes it is on seaside but there are no sandy beaches to walk on or have your child to play with sand. This hotel is very good if you are coming from Russia or eastern Europe as 80% of customers are from there. I would not stay there again for this money
Lovely two bed, two bath room, very spacious, looking north was pretty. In same street and therefore very close to restaurants.  Great hotel.

We were on tenth floor and facing north so the noise of the Telstra building's airconditoning made the outside balcony sitting noisy and not relaxing.  It's a shame that tiny ants were in kitchen, although it didn't worry us as we didn't cook any food.
nice staff, large rooms plenty of facilities, vicinity to the beach, peace n quiet as not in the centre, 10 min on the bus to the marbella centre
some facilities crowded, dated decor

Smooth check in, only had to wait a couple of minutes.  Offered a room on the 22nd floor of Tower 1 with a great city view.  Rooms very spacious with flat screen TV and tea/coffee facilities.  Staff were extremely pleasant.  Yes, it's a big hotel and the lobby can be very busy, but I still felt that I was treated as a guest and not just a number.  Location is great for the BART (for SF airport) and all MUNI transport (buses and cable cars).  The area around the hotel felt fine, although there are a lot of beggars which may make some people uncomfortable - however, we found that wherever we went in downtown SF or Fisherman's Wharf - it's not limited just to the Hilton by any means. I would definitely stay at the Hilton again if I am in SF on a future holiday.

Only had food/snacks from the Starbucks in the Lobby as the breakfast and dinner menus were more expensive than eating out.  Starbucks was slightly more expensive than regular Starbucks, one of which was just one block away.  Other than that, nothing but a positive experience.
The room was small but adequate, staff were helpful

The meals were overpriced and the menu didn't describe adequately the ingredients in dishes, coriander in abundance in a chicken dish. Renovations were going on at the time of our visit so I'm assuming when finished will make a big difference to reception area etc
A bit tired could do with some renovation, and not enough staff in bar area

we have had many happy holidays staying here at the tuntas apartments,rooms are cleaned dairy and the staff are so friendly,they help you no matter what you ask of them,good size rooms,we shall look forward to staying there again next year

Overrated. Not as good as expected. Room not made up until after 4.00 p.m.! Clearly understaffed.  Very expensive WiFi which is included in similar hotels of this category. Charging $12 per appliance per day is outrageous (my wife and I have a smartphone each and I also use a laptop). Fortunately I was ultimately able to persuade the hotel to waive the fee, but this should not be necessary. Loews should understand that WiFi is standard these days, like electricity in the rooms and water in the bathrooms!

The hotel was great! The staff were very friendly. The hotel is in a fantastic location only a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower! It was so good in fact that we are planning on staying there again next year!
inexpensive option in Doha with buffet breakfast served on time

Had a wonderful time as did my dog Macey.  The staff was professional and kind, particularly the Amanda and they young guy in the morning who helped me find a great hike.  The espresso machine was such a great perk...literally. I borrowed one of the bikes and had fun although next time I would bring my own mountain bike.  I would stay there again and will and have recommended Summit to friends. Job well done : )

There was some construction out front and I asked the afternoon front desk person if it would be possible to change rooms since I did not want to be woken up by construction noise, she said no.  The following morning I brought it up to Amanda, she said she would see what she could do and changed my room almost immediately.
Excellent customer service would highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay.
just that the Fish my husband had was slightly overcooked, but everything else was perfect.

Your room offered no crockery, cutlery ,not even a cork screw (to open a bottle of wine) As we had stayed in a nearby   motel with the above, plus free pink line trolly travel plus a booklet of vouchers for events
The staff is very helpful and delivered promise.  I am glad that the extra bed is already in the room after we checked in  I am impressed with the freebies in the room
The pool is not well maintained
Staff Professionalism
Situated near touristy things and shopping. Good value for money.
Could have been more tolerant of kids. Pool could be a bit warmer.
Situation and swimming pool
Poor breakfast and old room
Nice houses, lots of Sunny spaces you can sit. Nice pool.Housekeeping ladies are really nice and work hard.If you need something, they do it in no time
The reception really needs to follow lessons in how to treat guests.  If you arrive, or if you go : they dont ask you if you had a good trip, dont thank you or wish you a good trip back home.
the television could have worked better, very slow.
Bathroom good use of space
I would have slept better if all the water did not have to be extruded adjacent to my room. Room typically tiny

The hotel is only about 6 years old and so the quality of the decoration and maintenance is high. The facilities are well thought out with good access, though there are many steps to the lower sunbathing and beach areas. The hotel do provide a continuous  shuttle service back to the main pool area for those who don't fancy the climb. The main dining room is spacious with loads of choice and young children are well catered for with their own buffet and dining area.  There are four themed restaurants which are available for guests on all inclusive and staying at least seven nights. These make a nice change from the main buffet, as they are waiter served - the Turkish was superb, the seafood very good, with the Chinese and Italian OK. The rooms are of a good size, though a little too "beige". The free safe, and free soft drinks in the mini bar are a nice touch. Food is always available, and not just pizza and chips - the patisserie in the main building  and the pancakes by the beach provided a nice change. Service was good and always friendly.
The nearest place to stay for people who wants to go to Istana Negara specifically for medal conferment. Nice surroundings and affordable studio suites.
The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The dinner and breakfast was really good with rich buffet and very nice food. There was also a zebra in the garden, so wonderful.
Good customer service, 24 hours reception.

Gym equipment is old and can injure someone.  Photocopies of photocopies of room facilities list give a bad impression. Same for handwritten Wi-Fi notes on room documents. They can just print something nice at minimum cost.
very big room and great cleaning service (we were staying in deluxe room) and good greek meals with variety of food (we have all inclusive option), no problem with sunbeds arronud pools.
Hotel doesn't have own beach - distance is not to far but it is not a place to spend a nice day.   Location of the hotel - there is nothing arround.

Very well situated across from the railway station and the main transport hub for buses and trams, the lake is less than 10 minutes walk away The staff are pleasant and friendly and spoke good english
location, excellent breakfast for price.Large rooms

It is within 500metres of the Deira Shopping Centre with the metro included in the complex, despite the hotel staff saying it is very far.  It is also very close to the airport although you do have to contend with the constant traffic.

The room we stayed in had a dreadful drain smell which didn't appear until the day after we had checked in.  It didn't appear to be coming from the bathroom but may have been coming through the air-conditioning system.  The bathroom is very nice but the drain in the shower should be larger to contend with the water as it ends up on the outside of the shower and soaks the bathmat.
Good atmosphere, excellent service, good breakfast, comfortable towels that can also be used at the poolside.
Streetnoise. Dinnermenu limited choice of dishes.
Basic, clean and good value for money. Very convenient for motorway which is ideal if you are just needing a stopover on a long, journey. Secure parking was very welcome. Good hot showers.
The shower  base did not adequately contain the water so the water escaped  the rest of the cubicle
position of hotel is good, nice breakfast , clean environment  staff is helpful  room is bright enough
a little bit expensive of a 4 stars hotel, small swimming pool  the jacuzzi is bad  Poor wifi connection

The chic look/style and modern facilities (such as the bathroom with walk-in shower, the flatscreen TV and very efficient air conditioning) of Hostal Domus are excellent for accommodation of this rating and make it great value for money. It isn't in central Malaga, but the bus is cheap enough to take as many times as you need in a day - plus, you can walk along the seaside path all the  into town in 30 minutes or less. The breakfast included is simple (coffee, juice and toast/croissant), but it's made freshly for you and brought out to you on the terrace.

I landed in Malaga feeling hideous after a 5am start and arrived at the hotel just after 11am but was told check-in was not possible before the  official time of 2pm - I guess this may have been because there only appeared to be one member of staff on duty, but I was a little shocked that there was no flexibility to even come back in an hour or so. I've never previously come across accommodation that enforced the check-in time so strictly.
Staff were lovely - music by the pool fantastic.  Beds very comfortable.

Two towels are not enough per room per day - an extra towel would have been good.  The milk containers in restaurant for breakfast were never quite clean where the handle and spout join inside.  Pork Bacon would have been nice also.
The locality next to the river.

Thr receptionist was as unfriendly and unco-operative as you can get. The room we were allocated had a non working air conditioner. We were subsequently moved to a room with more faults. Dinner was awful and breakfast was terrible. This was the worst hotel I've ever slept in.

A true 5 star Luxury hotel, The Residence Mauritius lives up to its reputation. The hotel itself is stunning, with glorious décor and beautiful rooms and suites. A butler assigned to each room is always available to assist the hotel’s residents. The staff are friendly, courteous and always available when needed. The hotel’s pools and beachside area are comfortable and clean, and its spa includes many services, a beautiful gym, sauna and steam room.  The dining is amazing with theme nights, a la carte meals and buffets that include a wide variety of appetizers, meals and desserts. Live entertainment is available every night with a band and singers, and some nights include Sega dancing and music, the major genre of Mauritius sung in creole. The Residence Mauritius has our vote.

very good situation of the hotel (opposite to Koutoubia mosque and next to Medina and Place Djemaa-el-Fna)  cooperative staff at the reception (change of the room and storage of the luggage without any problems)
We felt the hotel was at most a 2 * star rating and the facilities provided  Met this rating.

The hotel is in serious need of a kick of paint looks very tired and warn outside.  The dining staff had trouble managing the number of guests when we stayed our plates were snatched away as soon as we finished eating and we were hurried so they could get the table ready for more guests.  The picture advertising the hotel is deceptive
Well designed and very comfortable rooms

The decoration of this hotel is modern which I like very much. The room is clean, and the bed is comfortable.  This hotel sit at the center of Helsinki, just away from the central Railway station by 5 mins walking distance. So many shopping mall and shops gathered around the hotel, making it convenient for travelers !  The staffs are nice, very helpful.
Only one negative comment is about the breakfast : not so much food for choice.
Clean, friendly, beautiful setting,
Not enough staff around to assist with baggage, no mini barset up! bar prices expensive
Great location, very handy for the tube.
Room number 4 is right next to the kitchen, so don't expect to sleep after 6.30am
Friendly and helpful staff. Nice, clean rooms every day
Poor hotwater during peak hours during our stay at 5th floor. We were told top floors could have this problem.

Perfect location next to Little Italy and a 5min walk from the bay front. Large size room, quick internet and a great selection from the buffet breakfast. Also all the staff were very friendly and attentive.

It is next to the Trolley stop for Little Italy which run every 20mins from 04:00ish until 23:30 so expect to hear the clanging and bells of the barriers. It is bearable unless you are a very light sleeper.
Very modern, clean and value for money.  Good gym with new equipment
Spacious rooms with fridge. Lovely pool area.
Tired looking rooms.  Lifts barely working.  Maids were often late to clean.  Noisy air con units.

We chose this Hotel for its location and was not disappointed it was lovely   The staff are very nice plenty of good food very clean and peaceful at night  It was nice that you couldn't hear anything from the room next door   We didnt want to leave and will defiantly stay at the Simbad again
Plenty of sunbeds around pool but a little uncomfortable   As they had no cushion on them so very hard to stay on   Them for too long a waterproof cushion would have been   Perfect
Great position.
ordered room service breakfast and never got it. was very upset.

Nice and simple help on the reception. You can check in 24 hours. Take your sheets whit you and no extra cost. Lockers downstairs for small money to store your valuables. Also small lockers for free but you need your one lock so bring it ore buy it for 60 CR

I was in a 8 person room. Even when everyone sleeps at 12 o clock at night new people came in! There is a small kitchen in the room. It was no problem for this night because there were nice people,  but suppose some one make fish ore cook dead animals, what terrible it is to sleep then!   Also it is mixed man and women. (but maybe this is positive for some...)
Nice room with good layout and functions. Comfortable beds
Restaurant food could be better.  Menu choice poor and price high.

Rooms with paper thin walls and drunken revellers crashing through the toilet into the bed,  while tour residents return from the town to continue their all night vigil on the froint steps  of the hotel, not the sort of entertainment one had hoped for at 4 am. Can't even occupy the  mind with the internet because the hotel does'nt pay more than the bottom service rung and  uses the bad service to steer everyone with a pc towards the internet-pay-desk.....wifi for  Apple worked after a fashion. At 27 squids per night there had to be a catch.
Clean,great facilities- pools are superb. Breakfast room's location, a great  to start the day.  Very relaxing.
None except they provide you four walls, constantly disturbed by the passing train as the hotel lies next to the railway station.
Clean facilities and friendly staff
Check out is too early!

Very nice place for relax. The hotel has 3 buildings: Club, Gant and Castle, also cottages and villas are available. Every building has own style for different choice. We got a room in Club hotel - for us it was the best variant, as SPA zone and main restaurant are located in same building. All rooms and hotel looks quite new. Our room was in classical scandinavian design.   There are several restaurants and bars. We arrived quite late and try to find place for dinner (about 23:00). Bar O'learys was open, but we would like to sit in some traditional restaurant. The guys from O'learys bar helped us to find table in Le Biff restaurant - bit thanks them for that! We ordered special menu package and that was great! Especially dessets :)  Breakfast in main restaurant was well. Good choice of meal (hot and cold dishes, fruits, muesli, jogurts, special kid's table, etc.). All meal was fresh and waiters supported all assortment during all breakfast.   The main bonus with booking via Hotelopia is free use of waterpark in other case it's quite expensive (20 EUR for 2,5 hours for each guest).  Thanks a lot to Hotelopia and all hotel's staff for our pleasant stay and short relax break.

Nothing negative, just can advice some improvements:  Could be nice to have more towels and cosmetics in room (in our room was only 2 towels for everybody and shower gel, nothing else).  Please, put water and some drinks in mini-bar (our mini bar was totally empty, but after SPA water is necessary)  Sauna World open 12-21 which is not comfortable for guests who stay 1 night.
Bed was very comfortable and location was very good

We were unable to access any WiFi at this hotel. The kitchen consisted of only a microwave, sink and a fridge in a small cupboard. Not enough for an apartment relying on self-catering. Reception was understaffed, and the staff that were there seemed unable to cope with the most basic of requests, eg ordering a taxi.
very nice and clean hotel. It was near Victoria Station and the room and beds were very good.
Small room and toilet. But it was a good price so I understand that the room could not be bigger.
The hotel is in a good location minutes away from La Rambla

The hotel rooms are very small, we were unable to get to the bed with the stroller due to the small passage  that leads to the bed which in addition was blocked with furniture.    The rooms offered no facilities, wi-fi was not free and despite paying did not offer enough coverage for the room I had to stay in the lobby to browse, there was no minibar (although the cupboard where it should have been was happily blocking the passageway).    I cannot offer an opinion with regards to the food because I did not eat there.
well located in a quiet position on the Riverwalk
The location of the hotel was excellent.  The hotel itself was nice and the staff were friendly and competent.
I was misinformed about the location of our pickup bus and the staff on duty seemed to find this amusing.  Since I wasted an hour looking for the non-existent cafe I did not share their view.
Noise from the street in the night and in the morning
Room a bit noisey. Towels poor quality, only left one per person but we requested more and we got them. Breakfast finished at 9.30..a bit too early. Check out at 11am also a bit early..
Friendly no fuss staff, just how I like it. Nice sized room and very comfy beds.
We were on the 4thbfloor and in the morning you can here people having breakfast on the 5th floor above us, specifically scraping their chairs and dropping cutlery.
inspite of being a little bit far from the center of the city,we enjoyed very much in our stay there.the staff were polite and helpful.food was good.the room end facilities were excellent

I walked in to this hotel with a low expectation. How wrong was I. It was great from start to finished. We were shown on a map our exact location. We were told of things to see and do. We then were given a welcome drink. Nothing was any trouble.  The staff were the friendliest staff during my 1week visit to italy and surrounding islands. On the day we were to leave we were given a lift by the manager. We were also given a snack and to top it off he give us his own umberella to keep with us on our onward journey as the rain was so heavy. Amazing. I would recommend.  For such a low price we had amazing 5star treatment.
ideal locationfor Wembly Arena and stadium.  Bed very comfortable.

Staff were very helpful, recommending a great restaurant in town, the Dioscuri, which overlooked a picturesque little harbor.  Hotel location was private and quiet when we were there in late September.    Very good view from the balcony of the long beach stetching back towards Kardamyli and the lush mountains along the rugged coast to the south.    The best thing for us, however, was how quickly and professionally the hotel owner, Mrs. Zoubaki, sent our forgotten passports to our hotel in Athens, so we could make our flight back to the States on time.  We are very grateful to her for that!    This comment doesn't reflect either a positive or negative tone because we weren't planning to swim at the hotel's beach, but it may be worthy of note.   We were surprised that the "beach" of Cardimili Beach Hotel was, in fact, interesting, although very sharp, limestone formations instead of sand.  There is is a wooden walkway, however, that extends from a small sandy area where beach chairs are placed out across the limestone to stairs that access the water.

Arriving in Kardamyli in the evening, it was difficult to see the sign, or at least we missed seeing the sign, for the road out to the hotel, which I thought would be closer into town than it actually was (about two kilometers), so we missed the turn a couple of times before we found it.    The evening we were there, our room's air condtioner was irregular during the night, and the water in the shower was only lukewarm.
The breakfast buffet was fabulous.   The staff were kind and helpful!   Location is great, very close to the MTR, convenient shops and great restaurants.
Very hard beds.   Rooms need updating, especially bathroom.   No hairdryer abailable.   No dressing gowns.
We love staying here ( this is our third time) because it is a small hotel so everything feels so personal.  Staff are excellent !!!!!!

Although food was OK we felt it was not as good as previous stays - as far as selection etc.  Many things repeated every night just in a different form. Eg grilled fish on Monday crumbed fish on Tuesday and then fish in sauce on wednesday

Difficult to find by car even with an GPS. Had a taxi  in front to show us where the hotel was located. No streetnumber and any kind of signs at entrance which is in a kind of industrial area. Bad variety of food at breakfast and no coffeemachines working. It's not an expensive hotel, but can't recommend it.

We had  made reservations for 2 rooms only showed up as one. I don't think that was their fault i think that was Hotelopia.  There was a leak in the ceiling in the bathroom. The carpets were wavy and falling apart. The hotel need major renovations.Vending machins were either out of order or not stocked we had to outside to a convenience store to buy water.
Checkin. Longtime and not good
I can  recommend this hotel to anyone.  This is a very good hotel and the location is perfect.  The only thing I would prefer otherwise is to have better speed on the free internet (Wifi).
Nothing negative
Very nice spacious room.  good value for the money.
Elevator from carpark does not serve the rooms on the 1st floor resulting in having to carry the luggage through stairs.
Nice place to stay. I didn't eat there so can't comment on food
Fantastic hotel, clean,great location and very friendly staff ,it is a firm favourite of ours this was the 3rd time we have stayed there
Close to the city and the beach
Not very guestfrendly when we first arived, since we were so young, told ua that it was not a party hotel. We was not at a party trip either. On 4 persons we only recivde 1 keycard...
Nice boutique hotel close to the centre of Edinburgh. Small but staff friendly and room clean.

The room was small, however was a single. The handle on the inside of the shower was broken which meant I couldn't shut it properly. Fairly noisy with coming and goings and doors slamming. Also when I checked out they had no record of payment through hotelopia, yet the transaction was on my credit card statement. I had to call credit card company who then had to speak to the hotel. Perhaps thus is something hotelopia should review as it was rather embarrassing.
Excellent friendly service. Nice comfy room with lovely large white fluffy bath towels. Cannot fault  our stay.

Carlos and his staff were all brilliant and made our stay a good one.  We had breakfast in the hotel every morning and we were served quickly  The hot tub on the roof is excellent and good value 5 euros each for 30 mins the area on the roof is clean and relaxing.  the room was basic but cleaned every day to a high standard clean towels were left every day . t.v in room tuned in to English channels so we could catch up with news back home . will re.visit soon
building project going on across the street but not to much of a bother.

Firstly, the location couldn't have been better. There were U and S Bahn stops within easy walking distance, a street-tram stop right at the end of the street, and even a bus right in front of the hostel. The whole neighborhood was full of cafes, restaurants, and bars. We were walking distance from the East Side gallery and other neat things too!    The staff were friendly, helpful, and very nice. They were also profficiently bilingual. My mother felt comfortable asking them about the neighborhood even though she doesn't speak a word of German.     We booked a double room with en suite bathroom. The room was pretty much exactly what was promised on the website. The beds were more than long enough for someone six feet tall, the blankets were warm and comfortable, and the sheets were crisp and freshly laundered. It wasn't luxury, but that also wasn't promised.     Housekeeping emptied the wastebasket while we were out, too.     If you are on a budget and looking for somewhere clean and safe in a good location, this is a great place to book.

I was not prepared that our two beds would be bunk beds. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to know ahead of time.     Also, even though the bathroom was sparkling clean, there was a crack in the grout at the wall of the shower, so the shower leaked  the floor. The staff was kind enough to give me an extra towel to put on the floor, but that needs to be taken care of.    Don't bother with the breakfast. It isn't anything special, and there are so many adorable cafes in the neighborhood where you can get something much better for the same price.
perfect location. easy to go everywhere in hing kong.

Arrived at hotel at 11.30, I checked with reception what the checking in time was, and I was told it was from 2.00, we left the car in the car park and went into harrogate for lunch.   We returned to the hotel at 2.10 to be confronted with a chaotic scene, there was a large queue of people at reception who were clearly angry. When we eventually got to the front of the queue we were informed that our room was not ready due to a " large checkout that morning" we informed the staff on the desk that we were meeting friends for a party at 4.00 and we needed to get in the room to shower and change. We were told to wait in the bar and come back again in 20 minutes.   The 2nd attempt we made to check in was even more chaotic, this time the queue was larger and for some reason only 2 staff were on the desk, an elderly couple in front of us had come from a wedding, they had hoped to check into their room and return to the wedding, after 20 minutes of waiting they gave up, as there were no staff about I had to help them with their luggage back to the car.   Eventually after 2 hours we got to our room, which was very disappointing, dated with a poor bathroom and furniture.  When we checked out the following day we were again met with a large queue, the staff were abrupt and did not ask if we had enjoyed our stay  Will not be going back

No mention on voucher that is was 500m trek to collect keys, if it was raining or you had lots of bags and children this would have been a major issue.  Other small comment is noise late at night from other apartments.
We ended up paying twice for afternoon tea this was not spotted until we pointed this out. The bedroom walls are quite thin could hear conversation in the next room.
Very attentive and friendly staff, very important to me,as i'm on my own!  Stylish room decor.  Fantastic location, inspiring hotel foyer.

Noisy, my room was above the kitchen exit, and I was woken at 5.30 a.m, with things being delivered, this racket continued for over half an hour. The first morning I was woken at 7.15 a.m by a maintenance man, calling me, telling me how to use my remote, to get TV working, as when I checked in the evening before, there was no signal.Very thoughtless, as I had a big celebration the evening before!  There was a lot of noise when the housekeeping staff emptied bottles ect from when cleaning rooms. Very tight fit in bathroom, sliding door would have been more appropriate!
Public transportation, nice restaurants, bars and a Carrefour Express very nearby.

If you have a appt. on the street side of this hotel, know that you will not be able to sleep quiet with your window open, because of all transportation noise and noise from the restaurant underneith this appt. hotel. Furthermore the rooms are run down, not very clean and you get a very poor breakfast. The front office staff can only speak Spanish. You will get your keycard of the appt. and no further information of the whereabouts.
The cheeky £5 parking charge was a bit of a surprise.

Hotel very clean and nice decor.   Hotel reception staff friendly especially filip ! Staff at reception helped us and found out info for us .  Pool and sauna clean indoor pool warm . Went out of season so not many kids.  Nice well equipped gym.near to sea and lots of space for loungers.   Lots of food plenty of fruit. Outdoor pool looked nice but didn't try.   Bed was comfortable and sheets looked white and clean.  Room was in block c and trees limited view of sea.  But room was a nice size shower was ok .
The list is extensive and it would involve me reliving my experience of staying there and I really don't wish to remember that hotel ever again. Simply awful
On arrival we were met with a very pleasent reception staff member

The room was ok, there were old very stained divan beds and an old ripped sofa, i found 3 pubic hairs on the carpet which was also old and worn. At breakfast the staff were nice enough but one member of staff was more interested in playing with his hair. The beans and tomatoes were very dried out and had clearly been under the hot plate a while, second morning at breakfast we were no approched at all, we had to find our own table and track down a member of staff for a pot of tea. The breakfast room was a mess with most tables dirty, and three staff members walking around with not a care in the world. I will not be back at this hotel

The Britannia is a very dated hotel that needs a lot of work to modernize it. The Standard room we had was stuck in the 80`s complete with peeling wallpaper and a groaning, noisy Air conditioning system. It was clean however. Breakfast was a typical buffet selection but nothing out of the ordinary infact quite basic. Not sure on how it recieved a 4* billing
Great staff,very friendly and helpful. Food was fabulous   I arrived with 4 children and 3 adults and we had a fantastic stay.
small  but comfortabble, safe
indifferent to client,

It has a lot of activities which you can pay extra.  Great showers and helpful staff.  Beautiful white sweeping sand with a lovely setting.  Amazing dolphins which you get to feed for a few seconds.  I can imagine that families would love going to this place.

The eating area is a collection of add ons over many years.  Unfortunately it looks like they are adding more  the various extensions  instead of knocking it down.   They were renovating the eating area during school holidays so a bit of hammering etc... going on. The breakfast room was a very outdated, mishmash of rooms with a servery at one end.  There are several supporting poles which can get in the  of making a lap around the servery.  I had to ask for new bread as the loaf of bread had mould on it.  The second loaf of bread had mould on it too!! Mmmmm.....  I thought $300 a night  too steep for outdated accommodation.  Ive stayed in better for a lot less!!
Great location
Very nice stuff;   Sea view excellent  Located very centrally
Air plains are very loud! Comments on booking.com, that the windows would be protective is not correct.  Pool on the roof very small.   Breakfast room to small.
The staff were extremely professional, friendly and helpful.  The location is perfect. It is a beautiful old building.
The construction is old and the decor dated.
Great reception from Louise, she made us feel very welcome, and was very helpful and a great member of the team
The Noise from bathroom saniflow was a little uncomfortable just as well we knew each other very well?Also door did not close??
1.most staff can speak English and understand.  2.attentive service rendered throughout our stay.
The shower. Somehow, it's still the old type used which makes bathing not so pleasant.
Good location and reasonable price
TV picture was poor quality and there was no minibar (not a problem for me, but the website claims all rooms have it)

The hotel is located one stop away from the ATL airport on the sky train to the rental car facility. This makes it easy to find and easy get to. It also allows travelers to stay in ATL without renting a car, as the MARTA transit system serves  the airport, i.e. one stop away. I highly recommend the hotel for travelers who are departing on an early flight from the ATL airport.

Quite expensive for below-average rooms. Mine had a very strong smell of humidity as I came in. TV didn't work, trash bin was broken, shower gel was finished, bed-furniture was full of stains and the room gave the overall impression as it had been left behind after being built probably in the 80s/90s. Not really worth the stay!
Well we thought it was great, and fantastic value at the price we paid, we will be back!
This was a genuine find.. The room was clean and recently refurbished. The bed was amazing - there was a usable desk in the room. The location was brilliant - the staff were wonderful.
They were taking advantage of the accommodation shortage on the weekend that I stayed to ramp up the room rate - but so was very hotel in town..

-  Friendly services, great pool, sufficient gym facilities,   -  Nice food, breakfast and diner buffet large selection and as Half Board reasonable priced   -  Reasonable priced, small but comfortable room  -  Location, next to Sharjah Airport  -  No local taxes, when booking through the right travel site  -  Sufficient close to Dubai
Location, next to highway (noise), but not to be seen because of large trees
Wonderful friendly helpfull staff, great location would recommend and return to stay again.
Bedroom decoration could do with updating
Generous coffee and tea making facilities. Location close to food outlets.
Enterance steps a bit of a put off when arriving with luggage.
The apartment room is very spacious

Poor accessibility was the the only poor comment about the hotel. We have to walk a long  in order to access to the hotel as it is located across a major road where crossing is merely impossible.  The hotel should also provide with free Wi-Fi services since its rated as 5 star.
The staff are very friendly. The hotel is in a very good location. I have stayed here several times now
Check in 3 hours early was great after traveling in car 4hours. Pool was fantastic
Excellent location, value for money, clean rooms, large toilet, comfortable bed
Room size is too small, staff is somehow respond to request not that promptly
Room was ok, location excellent.

The staff were not always friendly or helpful. However one of the waiters was excellent always very nice so was the head waiter. It would be helpful if it was made clear that you seat yourself at meal times, we were left standing at the restaurant doors not sure what the procedure was. It would be easier to have a member of staff greeting you and showing you to your seat and explain the dining arrangements. Some of the towels during the week had seen better days and need replaced. Expectation of a 4 star hotel would imply that sheets would be changed at least once during the week, sadly not changed once. Hotel was ok however not 4 star

Very pleased with the comfort and cleanliness.  The lack of a restaurant was a bit of a blow but your front desk staff produced a sheet of paper with all the local restaurants - from which we were able to make our choice.
None that I can recall!
Very good location, friendly staff.
The best service and quality you can pay for .
The breakfast need to be improve to match the quility that's you can have in other services.
Shower over bath very badly placed and bath very slippery when wet. The hot breakfast wasn't
Value for money and rooms were clean, perfect location, staff were excellent.
Great location on the beach, nice gardens, construction of new infinity pool almost completed, close to restaurants.

One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because it offered Kids Club as we were travelling with family including 5 young grandchildren.  Our understanding of Kids Club is that staff entertain children whilst parents take advantage of other hotel activities, i.e. spa, tennis, etc.   However, at this hotel, Kids Club means that parents accompany their children to a room and supervise them playing on such equipment.as might be found in a small playground.  Very disappointing!    Three other minor dissatisfactions  -  they charge a fee for ice, they charge for daily newspapers and they do not provide umbrellas for the occasional heavy rainfall.
good hotel close to everything  only  negative, not one drawer for clothes, live out of your suitcase

excellent hotel, perfect central location, in a quiet side street, quiet being the important word. charming at reception, basic and clean.do not hesitate to stay here, and have everything on your doorstep.
Was surprised that they need deposit and accept cash only. There is no room service at all.
Scrambled eggs at breakfast not vety good, but this did not spoil the breakfast as there was lots of choice and so plenty of other options.
Location is brilliant, a little hard to find initially but once bearings are set its easy!
Only certain rooms have wifi, staff are rude and unhelpful, rooms are ancient, facilities non existing. It is what it is. A cheap hotel in the middle of town.
Not especialy.  I do not know quality of the food , because took nothing in this time.
very dusty tables ..lifts u have too wait a lot hell!!  long queues for breakfast -compact space to sit down
Excellent in great location.
Close to Chinatown.
Food is atrocious.  Restaurant staff are hopeless. Reception staff are professional.

I have stayed here several times because it is a good quality hotel located on a  beautiful beach. The rooms modern and well appointed and Armacao town is on the doorstep. Wifi in the lobby area but not in rooms unless you pay! Staff pleasant and helpful.

Dining room breakfast is self-service which is fine. The cooked breakfast ingredients however are not good quality and are best avoided. The toasting machine, one of those roller affairs needs replacing as it takes 7 attempts to get any shade of brown. It's been like this for years and there are always queues of  puzzled faces.     We booked through Hotel Opia for the first time. When we arrived we were given probably the worst double room in the hotel; no balcony, etc etc and I suspect reserved for cheapskates like me! Fortunately we had booked a twin room so were able to ask for a move. Lucky us. We got a cracker just by the pool which was brilliant.
Extremely noisy. There is absolutely no insulation for sound whatsoever!

Great hotel, and more importantly GREAT value for the money.  I got to Lisbon stayed somewhere else for two nights and was . I initially avoided this area of town because its far from the "main drag" but the metro there is VERY good. Plus this hotel is by a mall so at the very least if you need supplies its there. But the hotel is VERY nice. VERY clean and VERY quiet. Three things i always want. More importantly it was GREAT value for the money. We paid around 83 euros of it. But very happy about the place
Some stains in the carpet. Wi-Fi account is limited to 2 devices at a time (although it apparently is not enforced when we were there we had 4 devices on the account)
Martin was excellent and gave great service at the breakfast.
The hotel is cosy, but the room I had was very tiny and narrow. It was very loud from the traffic outside, and therefor problematic to sleep well through the night.
Requested a Quiet room and got a very quiet room
the rooms were very nice especially for the price
the bar area was very busy and quite messy with dirty plates and glasses all over the place

Couldn't vault this hotel - first class in every respect. Ignore any negative comments about noisy room or less than adequate breakfast- we had a room that was overlooking the Main Street on the 5th floor and the windows and shutters over them blocked out any street noise at night. In the morning when we opened them we were greeted by the sound of a man playing amazing classical music on a violin....really lovely. Breakfast was more than adequate and plentiful. It set us up well for our days of sight seeing. The room had a modern design with very comfy. This hotel far exceeded my expectations.
Good location, friendly staff
Excellent short stay hotel which was enhanced by the delightful staff both on the desk and the housekeeping staff.   Will definitely be returning
Very nice service.Perfect location and very good service!
Very pleasant and helpful staff, always serving with a great smile. Will make it a point to put you on my first choice of hotel on my future trips

We have stayed at the Menzies Glasgow on a few occasions and have found it a good hotel. It is within walking distance to the SECC and Hydro. The city centre is only 5 minutes away.  The hotel has secure car parking just over the road at a current cost of £4.00 a day

A couple of gripes this time around although the hotel was quite quiet we where offered a room next to the lift which turned out to be a disabled access room. We then upgraded to an apartment for another £20 per night and this was much better.  The breakfast is buffet style and adequate but having been going to the Menzies over the last few years there is a noticeable reduction in quality.   All in all I still have to say the Menzies represents good value for money.
easy to find,clean,staff on reception helpful.very good
none,but I only stayed there Monday 7th to Tuesday 8th.
Great location and really friendly staff.
The hotel was spotless the staff were friendly and professional all our needs were catered for.      This is a quality hotel at its best
Clean room with comfortable bedding.  food tastes good in the restaurant at reasonable price.
Enjoyable stay and friendly staff.
Fantastic hotel. Would return again no problem
Nice and quiet at night and grounds were very clean. Fairly good location, about 10 minute walk to centre of Los Cristianos.
Towels in room only changed twice in 1 week. Maids didn't come in at all on 2 days.

Stayed for a night after watching the Speedway GP at Torun Motoarena, the hotel is well situated and the food was ace.  We were allowed to check in a couple of hours earlier than originally indicated and the staff were extra helpful in sorting this out.

The only reason I didn't give full marks was that the WiFi connection was somewhat intermittent however I suspect this was due to our room being the furthest from the centre of the hotel, it was a minor inconvenience at worst!
Great location, easy to find, friendly reception staff, clean rooms, free WiFi.
Excellent variety of whiskey on offer. Good nostalgic atmosphere.
Slightly shabby appearance, our room had mould all along the skirting board and crack in sink. Breakfast took ages to arrive.
All i can say, every things excellent and perfect!
Everything excellent!
Excellent experience, great breakfast, close to Sandton City and taxi services-ask for Patrick
Excellent location and very helpful staff. It feels like being at home with a very friendly staff. Highly recommended.
Quite. I was able to sleep in a comfortable bed
Shower too small  Breakfast was cold bread old slices non edible.   At reception strong smell of insect spray
Close to the beach, nice hotel
Only few tv programs,
Average location but good value for money
Breakfast could be better

Stayed for 2 nights in 2012 and returned for a further 2 in 2013. Normally we like to stay in design hotels, but the location, pool, breakfast and amazing views brought us back again this year. The hotel is traditionally spanish in decor which is nice and the staff were very polite and helpful.  Because of the value for the money we will return here again for a couple of nights bed and breakfast without any hesitation.
Bedrooms need upgrading and the towels need replacing very soon.
Rooms are excellent, feel warm and welcome  Swimming pool is very good  Staff attentive  Hotel as a whole has character

Music swimming pool too loud  Beds swimming pool far too old, not comfortably anymore  Attention must be paid to details: we had one day no towels, no waterstop in the bath so we could not take a bath, reception promised to give information but forgot, a.s.o.
Good location, upgraded us for one of the nights

I stayed for 5 nights self catering. The complex is very secure with locked gates at every entrance. The apartment I stayed in was very spacious and open plan. Nice powerful hot shower. Also had a small kitchen with cooker, kettle, fridge/freezer and a small electric oven. The room also had a large 32" TV with the main British channels. In a nice quiet location. A good 5-10 minute walk from the beach front and local shops. Very close to the main bus station in Las Americas. Ideal for someone/ couple looking for a nice quiet break. Couldn't fault a thing.
The only slightly negative thing I will say is the beds. They were not the most comfortable.

We had our room upgraded to a triple at no extra cost. The room was a good size with a wee balcony and air conditioning. Breakfast was included in the price and was an excellent selection, room was pretty good value for money. The hotel location was also really good. Close to the old town without being right in tourist central and close to the ferry and the new marina which was handy for us as we had just gotten off a yacht and planned to travel by ferry to another island

There is a place for leaving your bags if you check out but are not travelling til later in the day, however, this is open and you don't have to go directly past reception to get to it. With so many people coming and going I would be surprised if the reception staff recognised all people staying there and it would likely enough to have things stolen.  We asked if there was a more secure place for our luggage. The receptionist agreed to store it in their office but she had her back up a bit when we said we didn't trust the standard place - my partner has had bags stolen from similar setups in the past
Very useful for early flights
Path to airport needs better lighting. We were followed by a man at 4.15 am and felt slightly nervous, although it turned out he was fine.
Fabulous location. Ample continental breakfast. Comfortable bedroom. Would definitely stay again.
Great location for the Rock and Roll Marathon   I did not eat at the hotel
Room and service of good quality with helpful staff.
Menu in the restaurant was very limited! The one fish dish was sold out and as I don't eat meat it was a hungry evening!
Friendly and very helpful staff. Good location within walking distance of Praia da Rocha and Praia da Vau with beautiful sea views and stunning beaches.

The front desk staff is normally pretty shy and thus not very helpful, nevertheless, there are some outstanding assistant- and night managers The night manager who was in charge during my stay was outstandingly helpful and friendly, he helped me a lot when I lost my bank card in China.
friendly staff, great food, upgraded rooms, a very relaxing holiday
Spacious clean apartment in a good position for beach and supermarkets. No shortage of Sun beds. Friendly staff value for money
Be sure to check sheets and towels are changed as often as they are supposed to be.Noisy Irish guests
Good accommodation and good variety of food of a good standard  We will be back

We booked a room with private pool . The pool and patio area were always in the shade which was not ideal as we had gone to sunbathe ! The hotel did move us three days later when another room became  available  . Avoid room 234 if you want to sunbathe.
Stunning beach, wonderful area and width of the property. Cool, modern look. A perfect holdiday destination. Can highly recommend!
Very cool but almost too much. Not really a business hotel but would go back for a week end visit as location is good for leisure travel.
Big rooms, great pools, close to habour, shuttle is good, staff helpful
Nothing really bad
First time at the raddison, loved it.  Lovely room, lovely meal at college! Definately try again!
Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice welcoming atmosphere. Superb value for money.
Too old, and without any wifi internet in the room, lifts are too danger to use

Personnel very kind and helpfull, rooms on first floor very clean, every day new towels, swimming pool clean, breakfast modest but OK, toilets and common parts very clean. Lot of places where you can sit with some privacy. Wifi and little bar in reception hall.  Excellent value for money !

Lot of steps (is there a possibility to install an elevator outside of the buildng near to the swimming pool ?), the chairs on the swimming pool are old and broken, it should be obligated to use a towel on this chairs for hygienic reasons.  Some rooms have the noice of the English pub nearby till 2 a.m. in the morning. I missed a drying rack for the beach towels.
Great location, minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz. Staff are super friendly. Lovely pristine room
Bit pricey, €109 a night without breakfast

Reception so bad and was lie to us. Pay for internet that we did not get. Angry and not helpfull at al. I Will never come back to this hotel. They must learn to be nice to Their customers. Cold water in the shower exept some houers in the afternoon. Hamam in cold water, feels not nice!!!! I lived in many hotels in turkey and this was the moost bad one. So learn to be nice fix the water and serve some Moore warm food and you Will have a great hotel.
hotel's staff are very helpful and hotel's decoration is so beautiful
Good location, nice large rooms and large beds, well fitted bathroom.
We stayed in room 655 the basin plugs didn't work. the room safe wouldn't set, the error light was on.  The public area carpets are very stained
Excellent room (478), good breakfast, plenty of sun beds, good location for diving
Only 1 a la carte restaurant, alcohol expensive (3.50 euro a beer), poor evening entertainment in hotel and due to location nowhere else to go
Very nicely furnished with potential to be a very good hotel.

Very poor service. If the hotel is going to flourish, it must train it's staff to know what good service, is all about.  Reasonable food just not kept hot, due to the incompetence of the staff. Luxury hotels provide excellent service not poor untrained staff, who are clueless, to what is expected of them.
The location of the hotel could have been better,as it is located to an industriel aerea.
Everything was excellent
It was expected the room untouched if a guest hang the sign of pricacy sign on door handle. However room making was perfect.
Bed and room very comfortable :)
The hotel gives an overall 'lush' impression but some features let it down like the bathroom which was rather scummy to be honest. The receptionust was a bit snotty when we checked in!!!
Staff very helpful would like to se coffee and tea making in rooms value for
All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful
Located in the city center  Clean and Confortable rooms

The hotel really needs to be cleaned and renovated!!  Our window, shower, toilet and bed was broken! The minibar was leaking at the carpets- which was not anything new. The room was not cleaned for 4 nights, only our beds were made. The blankets were dirty and so was the carpets. No ventilation. Nothing seems as in the pictures. We would not recommend this hotel. The 3 Stars must have been given 25 years ago.
tiny double room should only be sold as a single room, breakfast bread rolls and cheese only a slice of ham would be good
Very handy for exploring Venice from once you have found it.

Great hotel in midtown Philadelphia. You don´t need a bus or car you can walk everywhere. The employees were very friendly and helpful and the room was really nice. It was clean and comfortable. Another great thing was the outdoor pool in the 8th floor. Everything was great and we really enjoyed our stay in Philadelphia, especially because of the hotel. We can really recommend the Sonesta.
We were there for 3 days at the start of our honeymoon and we got upgraded to a fantastic large Piazza View suite! Also saw Rock of Ages in the Venetian Theatre which was great!

The grand canal is closed inside at the minute for refurbishment and there doesn't seem to be any reduction in the price of the gondola ride to reflect that. Knowing Vegas though it's probably already fixed by now!

Very faded hotel could do with being upgraded. And my 15 year old daughter getting propositioned by the middle aged man as she returned to her room was worrying, 50% of the equipment in the gym was missing or broken
Exceptional value for money with Hotelopia
Was cheap but I applied through a website which indicated the room had it's own bathroom, it did not.
Clean, friendly staff
Very, very small room, no wardrobe.  TV was almost all the time without signal and  Was put on a shelf high enough to not see it  from the bed.  Very small bathroom.
Good size room, clean and excellent service from housekeeping.   Best location due to close proximity to the airport, local transportation and near Auchan mall.   Definitely best value for the money.
Not a lot of other restaurant choices in the vicinity.

We booked and pre paid for 3 rooms through hotelopia. Upon arrival we were told that the booking was for 2 rooms only even though we had vouchers for the 3 rooms. The check in staff were hopeless and it took almost 45 minutes for them to correct THEIR error and provide the 3rd room. Although they then confirmed that the rooms had been pre paid  upon checking out we were charged again for each of the rooms. We then spent another 30 minutes sorting out  this additional stuff up at 5.30 in the morning.  As they had already debited our credit cards with these incorrect charges we were hit with bank credit card fees which they would not refund. We would not stay in this hotel again.
Breakfast was sensational, room and the rest of the hotel was excellent

Front desk staff need to have knowledge of the bed configuration in the rooms.  Restaurants were only open for breakfast and closed for both lunch and dinner which for us was an inconvenience to have to go to the other hotels. Room a little on the small size.  Had to ask staff at least 2 to 3 times before our request was granted
Lovely and helpful staff  very friendly
Didnt like the fact that they charge extra $45 a night for parking  djould vome with the room
Nice lobby and you have Starbucks in the lobby.
Perfect setting, beautiful view from room and hotel itself.
Location is handy to restaurants and beach. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Some noise impact from adjacent building works but this is beyond Sofitel's control.

The staff were all very friendly and happy in their work and made us feel very welcome. They couldn't do enough for us.  The facility for helping ourselves to drinks at any time instead of waiting to be served was a very good idea. Everything was just lovely. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
The location was excellent, in the center point of the city, everything is near by walking.
Nothing bad to specific.

Great breakfast, coffee black as tar, juice from sealed cartons not diluted rubbish, croissants to die for, melon slices that needed two hands, toast making machine with the right bread for toasting. The only thing I was a bit uneasy about was the amount of uncovered food and yes there were flies around. If you go for other meals you will fine the starter a meal in itself. Drinks were a bit hefty - E3.50 for a pint but I go back to the days when a pint was 100 Pesetas. I was booked as a single but was given a junior suite with a double bed (no wife pinching the bedclothes, wunderbar!). Plenty of furniture and storage space, lights and sockets unlike the hotel I stayed in a couple of weeks ago in Berlin. Bathroom well equipped, had a bidet but no bathtub. Towels changed daily. Though the room had a/c it wasn't working very well but I was cool enough at night, bit like Cyprus where I did a tour with the RAF. The covered over pool was not huge but was very private. No hotel car parking but I never had a problem finding a space along the road outside the hotel and the roads themselves are not narrow and pokey like mainland Spain cities such as Barcelona.  I haven't mentioned the staff - I found them smiling, cheerful and helpful. The ones that did not speak a lot of English still knew enough to get by with my equally poor Spanish and hand signs. Say, " No habla Espanol" to a young Spaniard and you will probably be replied to in fluent English! I cannot understand why the Jeni is a only a one star - it beats the pants off many higher rated hotels I have stayed in across Europe and I do 6 to 10 European trips a year. I should also mention that the Jeni is popular with Spanish people, always a good sign and the ones I encountered always acknowledged my presence with a smile and greeting and Gibraltar and the Falklands didn't get in the .
Nothing apart from the uncovered food at breakfast but having said that I certainly didn't go down with any of Montezumas curses!
Lovcation and friendly staff
Provision of Airport transfer and most important free wifi in the room as became international standard in 4 stars and above hotels
great location , friendly staff , easy to get to all the London Tourist sites by Bus, Subway and walking.
too dificult to find
Excellent location, nice bar, nice staff
the stuff around the pool are helpfull and happy most of the time. they organise several activities during all the day!
Some of the stuff at the reception are not service minded, they try to get paid for everything i was asking about.    the stuff at the hotel do as they want. It 's just not Professional.
Placed very central. Ideal for visting the city

Staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean, beds comfortable. We were in all three restaurants and could not fault them, wide choice in the buffet restaurant to suit everyone for breakfast and dinner, the theme nights were also good. Shops were only a ten minute walk away. Would definitely go back as our experience was good.
The piano player every night, not suitable for everyone, we were fed up listening to the same music, thats our opinion and obviously suits older people.
Great room with balcony 18th floor, good views and mice bathroom...  Breakthrough was great

Room service was slow and after realising we were missing the menu, it was more than 45 min before it was sorted- being in a hurry to get to Ricky Martin we left and got something from O Connell street instead
Very convenient location and easy to find from google map, I enjoyed my room and the pool and jacuzzi were fab. Found the receptionists very friendly and efficient. Would go back again.
Big apartment, and a very fine balcon. We have apartment to the pool area. Happyness for that, because apartment to the 25 meter street er very noissy because of a very strong traffic.
The main waiter every evening try all guest to eat at the hotel. Thats were very irritation to be  ask why we want to eat outside the hotel.
Service in the  hotell is very bad   i never come back to this hotell

Where to start! Upselling for upgrade, extortionate internet charges, very industrial, corridor to rooms looked like a hospital corridor. Breakfast just average, limited choice, poor presentation. Hotel cars charged about twice the price of regular taxi. Beds small and uncomfortable. Never again
I come 10 years to bitez and have been  in an lot of appartments and hotels in this time. And it is an verry good hotel to stay. I will be come back again!
No negative revieuws about this hotel, if you dont't like it for this price dan you have to go to an other place.
Lovely room,  excellent position to enjoy bathing in the Dead Sea. Appreciated the courtesy shuttle bus to the private beach.

Very noisy a/c spoilt what was otherwise a faultless room, forced to switch it off to try and get some sleep.  Lack of clean towels at the beach so had to make do with drying off in the dressing gown.  Breakfast was adequate but not anything special, continental breakfast, could be only on a Saturday as it was Shabbat, perhaps better on other days of the week, disappointing for price paid.
I was impressed by the size of the room, the beautiful public areas, the professional and friendly staff and the punctual airport shuttle.
Room was spacious.  Large comfortable bed.  Good views from the 20th floor.   Reception efficient. Concierge helpful.

Towels very thin, frayed and hard.  Not to the standard expected of this hotel.    Poor housekeeping in the room. - Toilet still dirty from previous guests - not cleaned properly in the 3 days of our stay.  All bathroom surfaces, carpets, and mini kitchen surfaces not cleaned in 3 days.Bathroom glasses not washed on a daily basis.Tissues, soaps and complimentary tea and coffee sachets not replaced.
Very pleased
One girl at reception with a surly attitude. Hence less than perfect score for staff
Looks like family hotel. It could be quite acceptable for 2 days stay but boring for a week.

I thought the breakfast was over priced at 10 euro, I just had a coffee and croissant and it cost me 10 euro each day, that spoiled the other nicer parts, the bar closed too early for us also and the drinks were expensive.

Excellent location, only ten minutes walk to the old town square.  Spacious room and bathroom, very clean and tidy which is value for money.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Loved this hotel and will come to Swiss hotel again.
Very clean, comfortable and very nice staff.  Good location, modern room, perfect hotel!
Breakfast very very good.  Standardroom good space and well cleaned.  Friendly and helpful staff.  We are definitly staying at this hotel again next trip.
Garden rooms can be rather a long walk for persons with walking difficulties.
It was nice rooms with seaview, clean and comfortable. The staff in the restaurant were very professional and nice. Very good with the beach in the near and the poolarea.

Our group missed to have fresh fruit at breakfast. Too much garbage on the way/stair to the beach and on the beach.  We should like that transfer from the airports to the hotel was possible. There are a lot of smaller hotels and B
Food and in particular the desserts; indoor and outdoor pools; hotel beach with sunbeds and umbrella available for free; nice and professional staff. Perfect place to relax with family.

At the arrival we were offered twice to take a room where bugs were going around the floor as well as on the furniture. Not nice when you check in late in the night after a full day at work and a 3 hours flight with a 21 months kid jumping on your legs. Anyway, after two refusals with clear statement from my end "this is not a 4 stars service at all" and "this is not an economy room, this is an unhealty room" the message was understood and we were upgraded to a clean and nicely furnished room. We appreciated this move from the management and since that moment our holiday was simply great. Bravo! to all the staff of the hotel.

Great hotel in a great location. Staff are very helpful and nothing is to much trouble. Rooms are a good size and spotless.  Food is to a high standard and a good selection available. Great pool with plenty of sunbeds.

It's a cheap but absolutly good hotel. We injoyed the bbq evening thursday night, with live music and free parrot show.  Friendly well English speaking staff.  We also injoyed the breakfast some of the morning, that's cheap but totally wourth it.  All in all very good stay!!
Very central location, 10min walk to Covent Garden, convenient close to metro station Russell Square.  Got a room towards inner courtyard - was quiet, as requested.  Room size and beds ok.

Long due for refurbishment, terrible smell in bathroom - probably mold - no ventilation.  Room ventilation by open window only.  Breakfast (English) was ok but not enjoyable, remembered me of "school diner".
A very basic place to stay after a night out with friends.  Would I stay there with my wife? NO.
Very nice location and nice view. Polite people working in the hotel.  Clean room and bathroom. I highly recommend.
No tea and coffee facilities provided in the room.
this was my second time staying at this hotel and again the staff very very friendly and very helpful. The room was  comfortable and well equipped and I enjoyed the food
While the room in general was very clean - an item of underwear from a previous guest was lurking in a corner behind the curtain!

Disappointed to be woken at 1145 pm by housekeeping vacuuming next door. When we complained we were told we should have put the do not disturb sign on our door.? Staff closed the paradise pool while we were in it on day 1 because someone pooped in the pool. Had to wait 30 minutes for a table at tropics for dinner. When we were finally escorted to our table it hadn't been cleaned from the previous diners. Their was food under the table that was not cleaned up and I sat on a fork which was left on my seat. Also felt as if we were just a number. Most other hotels we have stayed at, staff go out of their  to make you feel special. Not here. Because of the amount of guests staying at the hotel, I would estimate in the thousands, we found it very hard to relax. Hawaii=relaxing(not this hotel)
Nice atmosphere and a super friendly staff!
Location was nice, unfortunately the weather was not so good. In the breakfast a lot of fresh fruit was excelent.
The room decor is a little bit outdated and we had a big cockroach in our room, ugh

Spotless and lovely clean towels every day., staff friendly and helpful . Entertainment standard excellent.  Overall excellent value for money would recommend.,   Food was good ., we were bed/breakfast and were given choice of 4 types of breakfast.,waitress served.,the first week we had a buffet which we preferred., its more relaxing

Small room with hand washbasin in room ., not in bathroom also very small balcony., our room was on the front so if you book ask for quiet room on the back.as they are much bigger  Entertainment only on twice in the two weeks we were there which was disappointing as terrace was packed on those two nights and deserted otherwise.,

Exactly what it says on the tin - the main areas of the hotel as exquisite in their grandure and it is a pleasure to stay in a real piece of history.  The hotel shares swimming pool and leisure facilities with the neighbouring adjacent hotel.  Amazing sea views from room (we had room 310) and public areas

Queue for breakfast of around 10 minutes not welcome.  Bed not overly comfortable.  We had a family room and there was a nightlight on all night and we could not find a  of turning it off (but we did not ask).
Nice rooms and bathroom, especially one room with a window. Near to bathing on a bridge and Siracusa old town. A nice balcony outside the rooms.
2 rroms had only a door with light and no window, but for only a couple of days you can li e with that, but not for a longer stay I think.
Great position, close to water front and city.Great roof top bar with views.Great value for money.Good restaurants within walking distance
Very good position. Worth while paying for sea view. Always could get a sunbed.
Had to ask for clean towels. Apartment could be cleaner. Lots of residual hair on arrival which couldnt be mine !! Breakfast not great and went out and paid some mornings.

Really pleased with Mon Port and will stay again. Hotel staff very polite and helpful. We only had breakfast which was excellent and walked down to the port every evening which is only 15 minutes stroll, even with a walk, carry, walk, carry 3 year old.
