Taxi back up in the evening less than €5. The Hotel do rent bikes if you prefer. The pool is of three definate levels, the lowest ideal for our 3 year old who enjoyed playing pirates with daddy and could acutually stand shoulder deep most part... a little too nippy for me but then it was mid October. There is an indoor pool that was available for use with little boy on the one overcast day we had - brilliant!. All in all, very pretty surroundings in a very pretty Port Andrax which does not allow an skyrise hotels, even Mon Port is hidden from the Port in a dip and extremely pleasant staff. We would definately go back to Mon Port.

The room was perfectly OK and comfortable and reasonably up to date with a flat screen TV. Again, the bathroom was OK with an excellent power shower in the bath. Both rooms are in keeping with the classic decor of the hotel and updating to extreme modern standards would be out of character. You will have a comfortable stay.

The staff is lovely!   The girl at reception helped us in everything. She was very professional and kind.   The location is great and next to the hotel there is a lovely restaurant.   Our room was big, and also had a small kitchen full equipped.  Its ideal for young couples, group of friends or to stay alone!
A true 5 star hotel. Everything super luxurious.  A beautiful place. Wonderful staff.
great breakfast room manager.....friendly and helpful with gluten free sourcing of food    amusing slim lift    great location

The hotel is in a place MAGIC ...  The wildlife in front of our eyes ...  Caroline and Foro is a friendliness and attention to customers out of this world ...  When it came out of a place like this brings up a tear in the corner of the eye, for the rest of life.

Location is not the greatest, access is through the local petrol station to get to the hotel. The room was absolutely fine, not to a great standard but certainly nothing was wrong. It was clean, well lit and moderately well furnished, it worked as a place to sleep for the night, for which it was designed. Dining room is more an office canteen and currently undergoing renovation, Breakfast was included in the price and was more than adequate, although severely limited in choice, particularly the cooked food. Would I recommend the hotel? On balance yes, it was fine for the money but don't expect too much.
Friendly staff, near the beach, relaxing place
Very nice place to stay but smaller than thought, would stay again

The stay at your hotel was one of the most relaxed I have felt, the staff were all very friendly and ensured you had everything you required.  The atmosphere was warm and friendly, I would stay again without hesitation.
Toilet flush and bathroom sink/plug could do with being up-dated - they are not easy to use (especially for someone with a touch of arthritis!)
Great old hotel with wonderful ceramics and super location  Would stay again
Facilities good by Moroccan standards but basic in international terms
i have to pay Extra 2 nights its not good i inform your hotel and phone number also but not good reply and i stay 8 nights and i have to pay for 10 nights

I stayed for three nights in October. The room (double for single occupancy) on the 4rth floor, was very clean, with a very comfortable bed. TV has Spanish channels only which was ok for me as I speak Spanish. Free Wifi in the room. In the bathroom, shampoo/shower gel and soap. I did not have breakfast, so I cannot comment about food quality.  The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the nearest Metro Station (Monumental) and 10 minutes walk from the Bus station Nord (Bus to Girona airport). The staff was friendly and very helpful. Next time I travel to Barcelona, I will again choose this hotel for my stay.
Wonderful staff, brilliant breakfast and only sorry I didn't have time to use the swimming pool

My only niggle would be that I would have preferred a double bed for single use as I always fall out of a single bed, so didn't get much sleep!  I didn't ask to change my room so I can't blame the hotel
Good location for nec. Courtesy bus good. Have stayed twice and got great price for room and breakfast.
Had to make down kids bed and too few large towels for family of 4 (2 given)
The room and staff were excellent but a power failure and appliances not functioning were the reason for not scoring top marks. Sorry. many Thanks  Graeme Mac
Reception changed our room immediately we expressed our wish to move because of noisy fan outside. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Good location , clean hotel ,fresh food ,friendly stuff
You have to pay extra for the WiFi in the room , the food was almost the same everyday ,pure alcohol menu
Clean hotel, nice outdoor facilities, large dining area, near beach
Cold water in pool (compared to beach in October)

I've visited this place many times and that may say it all.  What I find important is there, clean rooms, okay beds, comfortable and nicely  furnished rooms. The pool area and gardens are extraordinarily   beautiful. The place is kept clean very well and is often not over crowded. Personnel is friendly and speak  various languages. I've once again, had a very comfortable stay at Las Marismas.  People truly give you the impression that you're welcome. I'll definitely come back!
Nothing Negative, one more tennis court would be nice though...
The service was outstanding. The room absolutely fantastic
Beds far to small for 2 people
Friendly reception staff didn't use the dinning facilities stayed because we were at a friend's wedding. Room was comfortable nice hotel.
Bathroom seemed like it was renovated recently, nice and clean.  Public area seemed clean and tidy.
The location of the hotel is exellent. One bedroom apartment, that we rented, was very spacious and clean, breakfast good.

The kitschen was equiped not sufficient, various items were missing, but it doesn't bother much as we dined outside. The view through windows should be better, not to the wall of other building and noise isolation also need improvement.

Despite the fact that this was one of the most expensive hotels to choose in Trondheim the weekend of October 11th, 2013 we were not happy. Good location - otherwise the hotel was quite ordinary. I had asked for two single beds rather than one double - this was not arranged for. The breakfast area was totally crowded and the room was ok - nothing special. Service level ordinary. I will look for another option next time in Trondheim.

We spent twelve nights on our honeymoon at the Hotel Dorado full board in October 2013. On the second day we up graded to the All inclusive as we thought we would make use of all the booze that this lets you have- upgrade cost €13.60 per person (not bad if you wanted as much drink as you like outside of meal times- but we did not make full use of if as we got sick of being around the hotel every day and evening drinking). variety of beers and sprits were good- as they served local and non local alcohol i.e bottles of Heineken, jameson, gordons gin etc  We saw lots of people in wheel chairs and seemed to be able to get around quite easily with all the ramps- this I thought was a great positive about the hotel and they have to be commended for this.  There was an indoor swimming pool, jacussi, sauna, steam room and the outside swimming pools- all well kept and maintained. The whole place was well kept with cleaners and maintenance people visible day and night.   Waiting staff in the restaurant  were friendly and attentive, chefs in restaurant were not.

As mentioned earlier I said we stayed for twelve nights for honeymoon in October 2013. In my booking (in the comment box) I had asked for a bottle of champagne to be left in the room for a surprise for my wife. When we got to our room late in the evening/night there was no champagne. I went down to the reception and asked the receptionist where was our champagne. He was not being apologetic or nice about it and he said that we could not get any champagne unless we paid in advance, now after spending €1500 a bottle of champagne was the least I thought we could get even if I did have  to pay for it on our bill afterwards. I wouldn't put any special requests in the comment box when booking the hotel online as they obviously do not read the comments/requests left by the guest. It seemed like you had to be a deluxe paying guest to get even a smile from the staff. Oh by the  you do get a glass of cheep champagne (plonk) on arrival if you are a deluxe guest but not on your honeymoon. Cocktails were very poor quality and not well made- definitely would not pay €5.30 or €7.00 euro for these if we were not all inclusive, as you can get proper cocktails down the strip for the same price and cheaper. All in all reception staff were not good but maybe sometimes restricted by the hotel polices. Food although we though good at the start got  repetitive and a change of scenery required after three days (again all inclusive was a waste on us). Hotel did not did not do packed lunches for day trips.  Although we did make use of all inclusive now and again, but definitely did not drink or eat our moneys worth.  Staff at the bars were ok. They did not speak much English and could not have fun with them much. They were often slow and did not know who to serve next.  I didn't think that this was a four star hotel but 3*.

We have stayed at this hotel many times over many years and still love it.  Everything is clean, well looked after and well maintained.  We think it is worth staying on the Level.  The staff are helpful and professional and 'listen' to what we have to say.  Particular thanks to David and Jacqui for all their care and attention.  We will return, thank you both for making our holiday as relaxed as possible.

Great location, 5 mins from the airport, and right across the road from the railway station, 20 mins walk from the leaning tower.. The staff were very helpful, and friendly. The breakfast was good , with a good selection. Great experience overall
Was really impressed with how close it was to the beach and also the quality of the rooms for the money we paid
Only negative I could say is the lack of outdoor area but as it's so close to the beach we found it wasn't too much of the problem we first thought.

This is totally not a hotel! Management is unacceptable! Waited 4 hours just to check in. And end up couldnt check in because the hotel management did not have my booking record from Hotelopia! Ruined my entire taiwan trip! Extremely worst hotel management!

Searched for a last minute room for a short notice night out with friends. My Single room here was nearly half the price of any other option in Brighton last Saturday. The decor was ever so slightly tired but absolutely fine for the price and the place had much more charm than one of the chain hotels. My room was small but perfectly adequate; TV, shower, wifi, phone all worked fine. Breakfast was really very good and only a few pounds when booked in advance. At this price my friends thought I would wake up with a missing kidney, but when they picked me up in the morning they were all quite surprised at the good standard.

These are not major criticisms, but for completeness and in case these things matter to you:  The hotel has some parking, but it's limited so don't rely on it.  There are some rooms with a sea view if thats your thing, but mine had no view (pipes and bricks). The non picturesque side of the hotel is most likely the quietest side - the hotel  is right on the beachfront road, not directly in the heart of the night life zone but don't expect silence. I got back at 5am and the town is still buzzing. The night manager was good at keeping reveller noise down.  Check in was slightly slow, and I had to remind them about my breakfast order. Both mistakes pretty forgivable in my view.   Overall much more good than bad and a solid 4
At cousins wedding - fantastic hotel, very good service and staff.
Very nice and modern hotel, with very polite and friendly staff.

Nice room, nice view. Clean and comfortable.   Not really excited about paying $24 per night to park our car, but I understand that's the San Diego norm....I would suggest that cost be incorporated into the room cost as it appears to be really cheesy.
The room I got was small and not according to the picture I have seen when I made the reservation

The Langham Xintiandi is a wonderful hotel in a brilliant location. The staff are friendly, professional and always ready with useful knowledge. The general facilities are all beautifully decorated and our room was wonderful. We upgraded to the club floor which meant that we had breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks in the evening included in our room cost. I would do this again if we ever manage to return! The breakfast was abundant and delicious, with a huge variety of cold and hot food. Our afternoon tea was a pleasant addition to the trip and the drinks in the evening provided an array of delicious canapes accompanied by drinks overlooking the lovely Xintiani setting.     Our room was gorgeous, modern and bright with views over the area. I loved our nespresso machine in the bedroom and particularly enjoyed the "night light" - a dim light which paved the  from our bed to the bathroom when the main lights were off, meaning there was no possibility of tripping up in the middle of the night!     The hotel was really wonderful.

The only issue, and it was very slight, that we had with this hotel was the swimming pool. It seems badly designed, with marble stairs leading from the pool to "jacuzzi". I was concerned about slipping. The jacuzzi was a little pathetic and probably not worth making the trip for. That being said the pool area was decorated well and the changing rooms left us wanting for nothing.

Shockingly cheap, in a good area (Zone 2), plenty of transport and 3 mins from Swiss Cottage Tube.    Near to local shops and amenities.    Free Breakfast and Wi-Fi.    Beds have privacy curtains, as well as personal light and power points for 2 plugs.

As it is a hostel, you really do get what you pay for.  As it was an overnight stay I didn't mind, although I haven't used bunk beds since I was a young child, and felt it very uncomfortable trying to get in and out of bed, and nearly slipped off the ladder.    So really should have wished I requested a lower tier bunk.    Also, if you aren't familiar with hostels, remember to take a towel and toiletries with you, or be prepared to buy them yourself.  There are lockers but you need your own padlock.    The rooms are ok, I admit they were a tad tatty looking, however the main thing is the bedding etc was clean, it may have been because there is a lot of traffic, i.e. a lot of people in and out of the room.    Also the rooms have the main light permanently on, so use your privacy curtains on your bed.    Can feel very stuffy and claustraphobic, the mattress was ok, but I admit it wasn't the most comfortable of sleeps.    But seriously for the price I paid, I really shouldn't be too picky - I went to London on a budget, and I stuck to it.
Just could have done with a little pool perhaps but that's just preference and its not really a negative
House keeping kept waking us up and walked in the toom
- Good C/P ratio  - Very convenient with lots of shopping nearby
- Bad housekeeping - you could find dusts everywhere in the room.  - Not Four Seasons standard
Excellent the staff were very helpful.The location was very handy and a nice safe feel to it. Would go back.
it was a very enjoyable stay overnight will use the hotel again in the future thank you very much
everything
lovely place to stay
Everthing was nice. Neli (the owner) is very welcoming and warm lady. Thanks for everthing and if we come to the island again, we will stay at this hotel for sure!
Very nice room  Very comfortable bed  Good location with plenty of shops and restaurants (although some might consider the hotel to be too far away from the city center)
Aircon didn't cool, just heat (at least when we were there)  Wifi reception is poor and speed slow  Pillows sub-standard  Surroundings a bit dodgy
Slow to fix defects like broken phone handset  Tv old and diff to operate.  No TV guide
Nicely positioned in quiet area, good pool area
The room could not have been cleaned for weeks. Full with old hair every ware and Cockroaches.

Very friendly staff, specially at the reception (Hortensia)  Good service: if you have to leave early, you can make an reservation for early breakfast (just ask at the reception)  Good location: beach
None!  (although.. wifi availibity in the room would be nice, now only in the lounge)
Great hotel and facilities.
Management  must take responsibility to do follow up on each room, if it is up to standard.    I always book at Protea hotel in Kwazylu Natal- their service are 100%
great hotel  good beach  good restaurants  several pools
Hotel was easy to find. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was new. Good range of facilities.
Parking while plentiful was an additional cost. At check in staff did not mention wifi access. Staff was helpful. Beware of misrepresentation.
We asked the reception to make a wake up call at 5h00 so we dont miss our flight and they never called us!! luckily we had our phone alarms
Rooms were a good size. Staff were nice.  Really nice place to stay. Would stay here again.   Would not have dry cleaning done here again

Rooms were not cleaned everyday.  Had some items dry cleaned and came back not pressed   and suit collar in the wrong place. The staff member didn't charge   us the $12 on the mini bar because of the dry cleaning issue that   Cost us $48  Hotel was undergoing renovations at the time that begun early
People are very friendly.
Great value and good standard for the price. Staff lovely. Had use of pool and jacuzzi which was great too.
Very nice room. The staff was kindly and professionell..

The pool was dirty and needed cleaning. The breakfast was poor I miss some eggs and bacon. I also missed good coffe. It was served in big cans and was not warn enough. It was probably a sort of instant coffe. I saw a real coffemachine in the kitchen and also a grinder for coffe. So I Think this could be a lott better for the guests.
The view! The staff were friendly but no action was taken after any problems were raised.

Not explaining that there is a charge of 1.50€ per day for the kettle, no fridge and the safe key was 20€ deposit plus 1.50€ per day, if people are budgeting, this is a lot of money outgoing before the holiday starts. Also the restaurant/bar made the rules up on a daily basis. We were actually drinking one night and they just turned out the lights while we were there and never said to us that they were closing. The restaurant owner has no concern for his clients. Bed and breakfast has a different menu to half board clients and their menu is really bad. The hotel is lacking maintenance on certain areas.
Shuttle bus to Disney park is PERFECT !!. Also parking for the car is good.  Room are looking good, big enough and all necessary facilities are their,

The cleanliness wasn't good this time. It was our third stay and the worst !!  The kitchen was not clean, several knives and spoons were disappeared and also too less glasses.  The TV did not work properly for 1 night, 1 lamp in the bathroon wasn't function and the second day os our stay we did not have the big towels after cleaning the room.  We have spend better days then this last stay. I hope the hotel will not decrease the service as we expected from some time ago.
Very friendly helpful reception. Very convenient for the Airport. Superb local bus service into central Venice.  Excellent value for money. Appreciated courtesy bus transfer back to Airport.
Good selection of food at mealtimes which was fresh and well cooked.   Hotel well situated for centre of resort while being in a tranquil location.
Bar prices extremely high,so did not use much. the price of using computer facilities also very high,so again did not use.
Hotel was clean and tidy especially love the Bright Blue yeti curtains, Continental breakfast was adequate
But what spoilt it for me was the poor cooked breakfast, all for the sake of a descent Sausage and Piece of Bacon.

I took what was described as a single room with sea view. It turned out to be a large double room with excellent facilities and kept very clean. The sea view was perfect. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would return.

A very slight niggle but nothing to spoil the holiday - the logistics at breakfast were good until you had to queue for 'fresh eggs' - perhaps an additional cook in peak times would have been appropriate. I would not want prospective clients to be put off by this comment.
Fantastic hotel, location brilliant and the views from the terrace are brilliant especially at night will definitely use the hotel again and recommend it.
The staff are excellent, very friendly and efficient
you will be satisfied to fullest.
sitting arrangement on the entry or lobby would be appreciated
Great location and the staff were fantastic
Lovely stay over the weekend with some friends. Very close to the city centre! Hotel was very nice and clean, would defantly come back here again.

I booked 5 rooms for the weekend for myself and a group of friends for a Birthday celebration. Upon arrival we were told we would need to pay an extra £100 per room as a deposit, this came to us as a shock and also we did not prepare ourselves to be spending an extra £100 per room. We were told that this was in the term and conditions and was due to the large booking we had made, although this was not explained to me when i made the booking. I felt this was quite unfair as if we had known would have book each room seperately.

The view from the Deluxe rooms' balcony on the highest floor are to die for. Very tranquill scenary of padi fields, river and mountains in the distance. Gorgeous, well maintained landscaping around hotel. Very spacious hotel grounds with lots of beautiful trees and shrubs and a joy to sit at the balcony and do nothing and just soak in the peaceful atmostphere. 2 computers are free to use in the small libary. Lots of bicycles for guests' free use - very useful since hotel is not within Pai centre (5 mins on bicycle). Free 2-way Songtheow shuttle service is also provided for guests to get into town. Rather good value considering all the facilities provided.

The superior rooms are very poorly maintained. These are all on the ground floor, just below the hotel reception and restaurant. Curtain, chair cushion cover and lamp shade are badly stained and shower room reeks of odour from poor drainage system. Table and chairs at the porch of superior rooms are very dusty. Better to pay slightly more for deluxe rooms for much better views and slightly better cleanliness. Stayed during off-peak period so room rate was attractive. Peak period rates are too high for the not-thoroughly cleaned or maintained room. This website's rate is better than the other usual booking sites for this hotel.
Location very good, close to railwaystation and plenty of restaurants.

Location negative for those having problem with noise from the street.  The bathroom in our room was extremely small, and with no possibility for using electrical appliances. The separate toilet had just enough room for a small child. Closing the door behind a grown man i almost impossible!  Wearing shoes inside is recommended because of dirty carpet on the floor. There was free WiFi in the hotel, but it worked only in the lobby..
very helpful staff   good location  very peaceful
I had the best week Ever!
The Water in the pool was cold, 18 celcius
great hotel wouldnt think of staying anywhere else when visiting Blackpool again  fantastic breakfast everything you would want
really could do with injection of cash for refurbish programme as looking bit tired  mattress a bit firm for me
Very pleased with our stay. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room clean and containing all necessary amenities. Overall very good value -  would happily use the hotel again in future!.

A very good stay apart from the woman behind the desk in the morning she had a conversation with the couple in front about how their stay was hope they had a good day when it was out turn to hand in the room keys she didn't say a word to us and was very rude. She was not professional at all we never did anything to her so was confused as to why she ignored us but happily spoke to the couple in the front.
Staff are friendly and polite.  Restaurant was interested in my satisfaction with the food and willing to go the exra mile to meet my requirements.  Room service is good.
Regarding arrivals out front of the hotel - there is room for improvement, no one to greet you on arrival.  Staff took 2 hours to provide a camp cot.  Towels were forgotten on one of the days.

Great location - on the main street but not in a noisy part, close to the Metro and all other facilities,   Room with Balcony - great room and very clean  breakfast - very good, and very good service  we enjoyed our stay in this hotel - will be back!

REally enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I  couldn't have been more comfortable.  Its location was great. The staff were very helpful at keeping our bags as we arrived early am and left in the evening time. I can't give the hotel a 5 as I didnt have any food in the hotel but it did look lovely when passing through the bar area
Over-all Good, Meals Good, Staff very friendly and always ready to assist

I stayed at a suite with large bath room and two toilets. The executive lounge is a bouns for me, where I had my breakfast, afternoon tea and happy hour in very reflex  and most importantly free of charge. The swimming pool is excellent. I would recommend anyone who are looking for a restort in Bangkok. If you book a suite or executive room, you are entitled to use the executive lounge it is worth for you to pay the extra for this option.
The bedroom was nice, adequate, and some of their personnel really helpful and nice.  La habitación estaba bien, y algunos de sus empleados eran realmente amables y atentos.
simple room with minimun facilities
Super swimming pool and saunas.    One of the best restaurants in Poland
bad quality service of staff

Our original room had a faulty air con unit.  We were moved and had a free upgrade to a suite for the inconvenience.  The staff were polite, friendly and helpful at all times.      A 20 min stroll brings you to the gates of Universal.  There are two major road crossings and lesser roads to be covered but all have pedestrian crossings.  The hotel is well placed for travelling to all the major theme park attractions.

Food served at the wedding we attended was excellent. Staff were very friendly during the course of our stay.   The view overlooking the Glen of the Down from the dining room during breakfast was fabulous.   Convient location with easy access to the Dublin road.   Garden grounds were excellent and well maintained.
Very good location within easy reach of city center.Staff very polite
Just the fact had to pay for parking but than it is situated near a airport.
The free wifi is very slow. Why to be obliged to pay for a proper conexion?  This is not acceptable for a working environment in the heart of Europe.

We loved this hotel. The location was great and the staff were very nice and friendly. We had the use of a free safe and wi fi and a flat screen tv in our room. There was free toiletries every day and the rooms were spotless.
None really
Good location, wifi excellent, breakfast good and staff friendly and professional.
Great hotel,  Terrific Scenery  Staff most hospitable.

There were more facilities than we had expected and lots of room for relaxing by the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is located conveniently close to a beach, grocery store and some interesting nights spots.

The food in the restaurant was over priced for its quality, and the water in the pool was freezing! Taxi's from the airport are expensive and unless you go with a guided tour be prepared to pay a lot of money for transportation.

????,????,???OK,???u-bahn??,??????????,????????,?????????????,????????,??????????,???????  The room was clean, decor is very new, the breakfast is OK. Hotel is pretty close to the u-bahn, and located just right in the city centre, Behind the hotel, there is the Gendarmenmarkt. You can walk only a short distance to Checkpoint Charlie, and shopping malls are also close to hotel, this is indeed very convenient.
??????????????,???????????;??????????!  Standard twin room as small as incredible, shower location is also quite strange. The attendant quality could be better...
Appreciated the quirkiness, interior architecture, views and history of this hotel.  Breakfast spread much appreciated.
With tongue in cheek - parking the car!  But it is in the Tangier medina.
Nice hotel, good location. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful - many thanks from us, particularly to Annie who went out of her  to make our stay pleasant.
The staff were helpful and pleasant.

Fantastic time at the Caribe. Food excellent with loads of choice , proper bacon and sausage and even black pudding. Lovely pool area with loads of seating and sunbeds. AI drinks superb with proper san Miguel lager.
Only negative was room balcony , we had room 103 above the entrance of the hotel , all rooms on this side had no sun all day , which was a pity. Try and get a room with a pool view !
Very small bathroom  Bath too high to enter for people with problems  Shower taps placed immediately beneath the shower head and shower fixed to wall so head wet every time.

Reminiscent of an English country manor house, the rooms were huge, as we're the bathrooms. The one we stayed in was decorated in a classical style, with a huge open fireplace. Fresh fruit, tea, coffee, biscuits
Whilst the rooms are great
prepare 200 aed = $50 as a security deposit or someting
Excellent hotel - would definitely return
great hotel will definitely be back
Everything was working well and hotel was clean and in very good place. People were friendly and service was really good.

Rooms could have been little bit bigger and have more space for luggage and clothes. Food was ok but some more variation in meat dishes, sausages, hams, cheese and  fish foods could have been good. Salads were ok, soups mainly did not taste very good.After one week everything started to taste the same and we all were waiting to get something else to eat. But overall everything was ok.
Staff helpful - freindly and price very god for London.
Very short distance to the beach. Clean room. Size of the room. Wifi 100%.
The Hotel needs a general overhaul. Also the furniture in the kitchenette in our room.  The included breakfast is really nothing. Also the space to have breakfast in the reception.
Very clean, nice location, great pools and some good entertainment (Jersey Boys)
Really amazing facilities...for a family
Food and drinks  overpriced
Nice and quiet for business travels
internet was the worse ever seen an any hotel.  Breakfast was not good. Room were not good.  Beds were hard and very light, low quality.
Very nice hotel in a quiet area of Venice; just in front of a vaporetto station
The staff and location of this hotel are fantastic.  We really enjoyed staying here.  I felt it was good value for money given the location.

This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was grubby with marks on the walls and torn curtains. The toilet cistern was leaking constantly. When the toilet couldn't be fixed they moved us to another room which was slightly cleaner, but the bed in this room was missing one of its legs and we had to prop it up with a phone book. The pool water was cloudy.
Perfect place for family.   Great food, service, pool.  Will be back next year.

Apart from a few problems with small ants invading the kitchen area our main frustratiion was transport. While the Hotel runs a shuttle service during the day this stops @ 5 PM and to get to the centre taxis must be used. It could take anything from 10mins to 30 mins for a taxi to arrive (sometimes longer if other groups were also waitimg) Prices  varied considerably for very similar journeys. I accept that much of this is beyond the control of the Hotel management but I do feel they should try to get a better agreement on service and price with the taxi operators. Alternatively could they perhaps provide a shuttle in the evenings at set times (say 7PM,
Great location.   Close to train

- Noisy. We could hear dogs barking from opposite apartment. We could hear the TV, hair dryers and people talking from the room next to us.   - Bathroom is not great. Dirty tiles and bath. No water pressure in showers. No evaporative system in bathroom.  - Room hasn't been vacuumed for the entire 5 days we were there. They were also chips on the floor from the previous person.  - Aircon not working properly.
The room was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a very good position and easy to find.
The room needed a bit of TLC  but I think they were doing it up because some of the halls and public tools were done up nice.
Beatifuful hotel and pools. Beach is also stunning. On comment is the wifi is only in lobby and there is only 1 computer if you don't have your own device. Still highly recommend.
Really enjoyed our stay, highly recommended.   Will be back!

The staff on reception were extremely helpful on every occasion I was making an enquiry especially Roy. I would certainly like to think I would use this hotel again when visiting the NEC centre. Please pass on my sincere thanks to them.
situated in a nice area on the waterfront, with shopping mall just across the road. The Royal Yacht Britannia and Princes street just a short distance away. Would recommend the Hotel
Clean room, comfort bed, nice view  Good value with self drive car

the Hotel is perfect for relaxing, it is quiet and peaceful and rounded by a nice landscape.  Rooms are clean and bright and they have a nice terrace where you can enjoy the sunset.  The beach is clean as well as the sea.

The hotel is ideal for short staying because of its isolated position. It's one hour driving far from Muscat. The beach in not good for children because of has sharp rocks and the access to the sea  is quite difficult, You need water shoes indeed.
Disgusting mosquito infested hell hole, constant Dehli Belly from mouldy recycled food, bad attitude restaurant manager, stalker excursion/salon man. Never again.

Debbie on reception was very welcoming, polite, friendly and helpful. Breakfast room staff also cheerful and friendly. All makes a big difference to the experience. Location is in a quiet side of town, Charing Cross Station around the corner and main shops within 15 minute walk. Excellent, reliable free WiFi internet.  Room was large, quiet, nice and dark in the morning so had great lie-ins. Great shower room.  Limited , but tasty breakfast, self service but that's cool with me.  A big thanks.

The hotel is very clean and the staff are very friendly. Great breakfast in the morning. It's about a half an hour walk to the centre but has a good bus route that can be accessed next to the hotel. We would definitely go back on our next trip to Edinburgh!
Amazing views and very well equipped. Clean, quite and a great location.
Had a wonderful stay, highly recommend.

Despite some of the poor reviews we booked for two nights in Oct to visit the nearby NEC.  Our room (336) was clean and more than adequate for the price we payed (Room only £88:00).  Staff were pleasant and helpful and our evening meal in the restaurant was lovely although a little  overpriced.
The corridors leading up to our room were a bit 'Tatty' and require redecorating.  Were charged £8:50 for parking which should be free parking for residents.
I have stayed here 3times good place.close ti good eateries and heeps of night cuubs.
Really nice small hotel in a great location for exploring the city.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly.
Very professional,very good quality, nice atmosphere, friendly personal, very good buffets, near the beaches, shops and promenade.
After check-out very poor facilitys to take a shower and redress. Hard to find location and a long  to carry your suitcases due to many stairs.

Although we had booked a month ahead and received confirmation of booking la Cabana had moved our reservation to a cheaper and non attractive hotel on the non attractive main street in town.  All in all we would have been pleased with the Cabana, but moving us to the lousy hotel was NOT acceptable.
Parking too expensive $30 a night.

The rooms could do with a good clean ie lots of cobwebs and dirty floor after being washed with dirty water the water should be changed from room to room rips in sheets no soap and opened ashbins outside our bathroom window which smelt room 24 used towel not bath mat on shower base as very very slippery.

Very busy breakfast room, had to wait for cutlery, cups, glasses for juice. Not enough staff on duty to cope with the amount of patrons.The food was fine,  but a wee tip , the toaster takes for ever, so make it before you help yourself to the sausage  and eggs.

Full of mosquito, food is not eatable, if you don't leave tips cooking stuff don't want to see your face, you can not enter beach without special shoes, full of rocks, working staff does not want to help you, looks like they work for somebody else but not for you to give nice holidays stay, if you come one day before your booking, do not forget that you can't book hotel from internet on the hotel and you will be charged double.
Good Location. Friendly staff.
Beach is not as good as we expected. However, it is closed to the hotel.

Yes, it is cheap, neighborhood isnt great but definitely not hostile. very close to public transport, less than 5minute walk from the metro, or less the one minute walk from the tram stop Jean Rostand.

There is an air circulation fan in the room. it is LOUD and it cannot be stopped or made quieter. made four nights of sleep really difficult. staff were pretty rude and didnt have time to deal with anyone. wifi in the lobby only which was annoying when they put you on the 10th floor and the lift broke down one day.
Very touristic.
This is the second time we have stayed in the hotel and enjoyed it thoroughly though only for one night this time.
Great Apartments. Not to far from city center.Nice swimming pool. A
A great resort for families. A lot of activities for the Whole Family.
Staff and room.,,,and parking!

Not so happy with the new restaurant-design,,,, too open and can feel noisy,,,, chair is terrible unconfortable,,,, a big miss!! Mini -ipad meny can work, but you miss personal feeling. My food, lambsteek?, was served on a small " banana-split" plate,,,,a big miss, too,,,,, perhaps a little too much feeling of micro-prepared. So, I miss the "old" restaurant and excellent food !!
Dust everywhere in the room, hot water off for 24 hrs and when I asked and complained to the staff for couple times, they even didn't say sorry.
Excellent service from entering the hotel, very clean

Suffers building noise from large developments on JBR and the Dubai Eye, both in the rooms and more so round the pool. Pool area is small and has restricted sun, limited beach access around the building works. Traffic access to the hotel is busy due to ongoing tram works.
near to kl sentral, easy to travel around.
perfect place to stay

Beautifully decorated hotel, spacious rooms. Excellent staff and service, you are being felt very welcome by everyone from Manager to porter, valet parking staff and cleaning ladies. For children very nice surprises. Good pool and sea facilities. Will certainly return.
Good position close to underground, cinema, restaurants
Breakfast needs to be improved
Location is quite convenience. 7-11 store at 1/F is good for hotel guest.
If shuttle bus can go many more places
Very professional staff.  Clean facilities.  Easy to find -- on a main street.  10-15min walk to downtown.
Bathroom feels cramped with two people, but on par with most of Greece.
Central, nice room, big tv, nice breakfast and quiet

When we checked in I asked for a confirmation that we had breakfast inc. She confirmed. Every three mornings we stayed they stopped us and told that we didnt have the name on the list. Thats not good. I came there with my 2 sons, and three times they stopped us. When they checked with the desk, it was ok. Should not be necessary at all. I must mention that the staff stopping us was friendly and did not make a big number out of it.   There was a coffee bar in the lobby. When we visited at 10 on saturday evening we met a bartender that was not having a good day. I guess so. I stop with that. I  have been around and know that service is usually good in GB. Next time better:)  By the . Wifi should be free.

Perfect location, on the Osterport station, 10 minuts walk to the Little Mermaid, 15 mins from the Royal Castle and 20 mins from the Nyhavn. Basic hotel facilities and rooms, but OK. Good value for money.
this hotel is top of the town,very well run, amazing food and service
room 3 can be a bit noisey as it is above the bar,?
Wakin at reception tried!

Air con turned off by directors decision - gave us noisy fan - outside terrace had sewerage drain that really stunk at some times of day rm 304 - toxic wasteland - ants paradise - open windows let tennis flood lights keep us awake - tasteless sparse breakfast - a joke !! - rhink hotel is run by young  - lots of shady characters hanging around - noisy tennis across the road - smokers at entrance comes up thru windows day n night - we def had worst room in hotel - beds so hard woke with sore back n hips - was told hotel was fully booked so cant change rooms when complained air con not working - but plain to see hotel not full. Told diff excuse about air con not working - the only good thing about this crappy place was Wakin - the young man on reception during the day - he tried to help and was kind - he told me a cappucino was 1.35 euros - an hour later the other guy who took over his shift wanted 2euros for same - when i challenged him he dropped it to 1.50 with attitude !! Such a jerk - he was same guy who said hotel full so couldnt change rooms - chalk n cheese they were - glad one showed up the other ! but for the fact we only stayed 2 nights  we let it go but one thing's for sure - Barcelona Olympics are long gone and over and so is Hotel Canal Olimpic - never again will I spend my money there - a complete fail by all accounts!
The premises looks run down. Everything very old....
No entertainment for 4 out of our 7 nights pool freezing cold good size though not even music around pool don't expect afternoon entertainment it did,nt happen
great location. polite and helpful staff.
The rooms very comfortable and clean.  The bed memory foam mattress very comfortable and very comfortable pillows .  The food excellent every day   Staff were friendly and vey helpful .

Very well located a few minutes walk from the city centre.  Price was very reasonable compared to similar hotels in the area and included breakfast and wifi.  Nice little bar downstairs that also sells snacks and Costa coffee.  Staff were polite.
Poo finger marks on the back of the toilet door that could have been cleaned off better.  Apart from that the room was adequately clean.
Clean and tidy.  The location is good with restaurants around.
The sound blockage is not really good enough, it is easily to listen the sound from corridor and room beside.
The guy receiving the guests at breakfeast remembered my room number the second day. The service in the restaurant was very friendly and professional.
The room was clean, situated in a very good location
There was no warm water in the bathroom and so I had to have a cold shower in the morning which wasn't very pleasant and I would imagine will be even less pleasant in winter

Hotel service on packed occasions is very bad !! Unfortunately staff made me late check in due to no availability of rooms once arrival, and didn't allow late check out once requested from them !! Room service and house keeping requires to call several times due to slowness !! Staff aren't welcoming at all and lack professionalism at work!!    Other than that facilities and room and location is great !!
A very spacious 2 bedroomed apartment. Excellent cooking facilities. Much quieter than your average hotel room
Great Room for the price. Go with the GO rooms, the extra amenities are worth the price.
Cleaning could have been better. Hallways show wear and tear, but rooms are good.
Good location. Quiet area.    A big well done to the cleaner that I asked for an electrical adaptor. If all the staff were like her then this hotel would score very highly indeed.

Some staff were quite indifferent to our needs. A request for the room safe to be opened was ignored. We were overcharged for my daughters breakfast. It inexplicably cost more for a Continental Breakfast for her than the previous nights Whole Sole dinner!

Unfortunately this was one of the most expensive and worst places we stayed in on our Europe Trip. We scored bedroom number two on the bottom floor and immediately we could smell something bizarre to which as soon as we opened the bathroom, realised it was a mouldy kind of smell from the pipes/plumbing. The bed was fine...sleepable at night with the bathroom door closed but, because of the smell from the bathroom, we felt we couldn't stay at this hotel for longer than half an hour at a time. The staff weren't that accommodating...almost seemed like they knew themselves it wasn't great but they were getting the money for it so who cares?  Not sure if it's just a paris accommodation thing but we paid a lot less everywhere else in Europe for 3 star hotels and they were 5 star compared to this one! Hopefully for everyone else's sake we just scored a bad room and the rest of the hotel isn't like this!

Room did not have a toilet brush. Insufficient vent in toilet area which was also on the small side. Upon request of a mattress topper 2 quilts were supplied as underlay. ( Uncomfortable mattress )  It helped a little.
Hotel is strategically located opposite Fahrenheit  Mall and a short walking distance to Pavillion Mall and Starhill Gallery. Staff were very friendly and courteous.
Only stayed one night but overall experience good and will be revisiting again.
Good shuttle in free of charge.  Staff are helpful
The air conditioner is hot, can only be 20 degree.  No change of shoes that during my living time.

Food was always cooked nicely in the restaurants (did not have buffet option).  Hotel staff were always pleasant and smiling, and were helpful.  Hotel is very clean.  Hotel is right on beach.  Always plenty of sunbeds at any time of day.
There are no negative reviews apart from room WiFi is a bit hit and miss when bad weather is around..
Looks and feels great. Very modern. Staff great. Very impressed with Hotel.

The breakfast, if you can call it that, was very poor. Not the only people to complain about it either on here or trip adviser. Proper hot full English or eggs is a must. Quality of food very poor. Warm milk for cereal, nice!.   Two days parking was £28. OK I know it's London etc but it's not central. Perhaps only charge when there is something on at the excell, that I could understand.
Close to the center and old city
parking for hotel residents 12 euro /night, poor breakfast
Very nice hotel close to the main streets in Valletta.  Clean, quiet rooms.
The check in and check out procedures were onerous and time consuming.
Room was better than I expected after reading some reviews , friendly helpful staff would definitely stay here again .

The only (small) cristique I have is that we called a day in advance to check in an hour eralier. While they said it was fine, when we  arrived there thery were still busy being cleaning our rooms and consequently the cleaners were rushed into finishing and missed a few spots. Very minor issue though, it was generally very clean.
Great location, near to the shops and Reading Terminal, well worth a visit. Staff friendly and helpful.
Excellent staff...very professional and helpful.  A dream hotel!
VERY CLEAN , good value of money , nice location
Very kind and helpful staff. Low budget hotel but value for money.
It lashed rain the whole evening but the underground parking worked a treat. Also it was a 1 minute walk to the lovely Yard restaurant that i had pre booked.
Great location

This is an excellent hotel that we would recommend, the pool and bar facilities are very good. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment that was great, the bedrooms and living areas were very large and well presented. The kitchen also had everything needed for self catering including a good washing machine. There was no free cleaning service or fresh linen but this was no issue for a week. There are lots of places nearby to eat out and we found the whole area very reasonably priced. Top tips, pool towels are supplied for a 10 euro deposit each so there is no need to pack any. The supermarket in the hotel is full size and has everything you need at very good prices so there is no need to search round.
Lovely staff.    Great privacy.   Everyone welcoming and helpful.     Good location
Had to keep chasing around for toilet rolls and toiletries .
Excellent value for money on our deal!! Very good location, Food excellent, Really helpful, friendly staff on reception and in restaurant. Excellent for access to Nec.

The only negatives were that our room was really warm, and being quite close to Birmingham Airport, we could hear planes coming in and taking off in the morning, but the windows were open due to the hot room.
Clean and welcoming. Close to the shops, restaurants and bars.
not really a negative about the hotel more York in general, poor parking facilities, plan ahead if you are taking a car ring the hotel a few weeks before and check availability of their carpark.
Good location, nice pool!
Old construction. Room's need renovation.
Great experience,  Friendly, helpful staff
Toilets and Showers were never cleaned and a disgrace.
New and modern style. Not far from main train station.
Counter staff is quite busy. Have been requested for more body wash for many times. Daily cleaning is not so clean.
Excellent value good location except walk to sky train is a nuisance
good plain accomodation at a  reasonable price. Very conveniently situated.
the hotel service is not so good, even the towel had a dark spot on it. Also they should refine their bathroom component, the washstand looks like it will crash some time.
Nice hotel in good position as we were moved to jury's in on scottswood road the day before our check in

We had problems when we got there has the hotel staff said the rooms which we had booked where not paid for already but they were and I then was told to prove this which it is a good job I had an email on my I phone are the hotel was not gonna let us check in
The cleanliness was excellent. Staff very helpful, would stay again. Room facilities very good.
Besides no internet, it will be a great hotel. Good location and super huge room in term of value!

Door cards reset twice during stay so had to go back to reception to get them enabled, again.  A chip under the desk (we didn't eat anything in the room).  Air conditioning made a constant hissing noise, but only had a thermostat with no actual off switch.  Only one lift worked, so at busy times lots of waiting around and it got full up quickly. Generally took the stairs from the fifth floor.  Bath drainage was broken, so it filled up 4-5 inches when someone showered. Whoever went in after had to stand in the water from the other person's shower.
Great nightly rate (through this site)  Modern Hotel  Nice swimming pool  Good Location
Occasional foul drain smell in the bathroom  Cheap fixtures and fittings - towel rail came apart launching my wash bag into the loo

Many thanks to the receptionist who managed to find us a family room available earlier that the usual check-in time. This really was very much appreciated. As was the facility to leave luggage after checking out.
Good overall facilities and nice spacious room. Food and atmosphere excellent.
No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Some things looking a little dated.

Had to ask for another room as the one we were given was unclean. Management were very helpful but the rooms were very basic and definitely not 4.5 stars. Our balcony area backed  a BBQ area and the pool area, luckily it was cold so no people at the pool but would hate to get this room in summer would be very noisy and there would be no privacy at all.

The hotel is very old and not too clean, rooms were better, but the hallways and elevators were distinctly unkept .  Washroom was ok, beds were old.  Food for the continental breakfast was stale and not many choices  Walls were thin, could hear the neighbor  Liked the size of the room and the fridge in the room.  The mechanism to unlock the room door was defective, however, staff was very pro active in getting it fixed.

Our family was really impressed with this hotel and will definitely book this hotel when in Montana the next time.  The staff was very friendly, accommodating and helpful!  From the staff to the front desk the lady in the breakfast room.  I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends. And my clients, as I am a travel agent from Calgary, AB, Canada.
Good view can see through whole Ipoh City
Great location, beautiful surrounds and overall a lovely place to stay

Had difficulty booking transfer to the hotel (which can only be accessed by boat) but all got sorted prior to us arriving  Pool needs some work - there are parts that are beautiful but others areas that need to be updated  Rooms arand facilities probably need some attention as well - mostly beautiful but there are some areas that let the resort down
Great value for money and very comfortable.
The carpet had a substance spilled  it maybe nail varnish this could have been made to look better by simply placing a rug over the area. makes what is a very good hotel and room look shabby
Friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast on the beach
Nice and clean hotel. Very professional staff.
Location, facilities, "feeling"
Facilities very good, staff very helpful. Very handy for NEC
First morning at breakfast total chaos. Seemed everyone turned up to eat at the same time. No clean glasses, cups or dishes available to get your breakfast! Second morning was better.
Will definitely return and recommend to friends.
better than I have expected
Fantastic hotel and great location for a night out in newcastle
Overall the apartment was very good.
Housekeeping department can do a better job in terms of the room cleanliness.
The hotel was excellent value for money, perfect location in proximity to Disneyland and tours.
great place,great location, would stay here again. ;-))
Nice aparment, easy check-in , well everything was allright.

The overall stay was very good, would definately return, staff very friendly, very clean, stayed on half board basis, evening meal very good and breakfast excellent. men played golf  and enjoyed their game but a very hilly course.

We had a very incompetent waiter serving us on saturday night, firstly our order was taken, we waited ages to be told that the order had gone missing so we ordered again, we asked for drinks, waited ages, asked for water twice, bread twice because of the wait, starter and mains arrived, was very good, asked if we wanted to see desert menu, never arrived, had to prompt him again,waited 20 mins for deserts, hardly anyone in the restaurant by this time, it eventually arrived, we had to keep asking other waitress's for service, which we did find very efficient, don't know what his name was but obviously this job is not for him or he needs some training, which is a shame if some training could help as he did seem enthusiastic but just wasn't with it on the night.
Well worth the money you pay for it. Excellent location and clean and comfortable.  Would definitely recommend. I can't comment on the food as we didn't eat breakfast.
The Windsor is The Windsor - it is a Melbourne icon. The staff are exceptional and the decor is beautiful.

We found the room very disappointing - bathroom was small and the bath was chipped.  Room rate included breakfast buffet which turned out to be continental only.  The range of food was poor and when we arrived at around 9am alot of the food had gone.  For the money I would go somewhere else.
Great value for money, really clean
The Wi-Fi didn't work in the rooms.
This is a great hotel for a stopover. Staff are very professional and friendly and the room is perfect for a short stay.

The check in was easy....we were earlier than the 4PM checkin and the room was "not ready" so we had to kill time before being able to check in just before 4PM. The unit was clean, pleasant, and had very nice up to date furnishings. It was a studio unit, bedroom and kitchenette area and a living room area with pull out couch that had a pull out room divider if you had another couple staying with you. Allows for privacy. Very comfortable. The staff were pleasant and professional.

The only negative I would say was the placement of the unit. We only stayed one night because we came in a day early for our timeshare unit. But the unit did not face the water, it faced the street and a restaurant. OK for one night, but if I was staying for the week, I would have been disappointed.
Good Hotel nice location and very helpful staff

Was given a top floor room as I had asked. Smallish room but a fantastic corner balcony which seemed to be twice the size of those on the floors below. Hotel away from the noise of town centre but in a good position to access most part of town and the 2 beaches. Bit of a climb thought!
Some of the staff need to remember to "smile" a little more.
staff very friendly and helpful try their best at all times
food ok but very limited menue

We have stayed at this hotel quite regularly.  Its location is very convenient and the rooms are clean.  With the complimentary buffet breakfast it is value for money.  Will surely return to stay at this hotel the next time I travel to Kuala Lumpur.
very close to most significance and interesting places ,  Piccadilly line is very close   the stuff are very friendly , wi-fi is free we recommend it as a good one
Good views of the river if not a little Industrial.  Staff very quick to attend rooms.  All Restaurant staff very professional.  Distinct lack of children....yeah.

Wi-Fi listed as free like every other Hotel in Bangkok....NOT TRUE !!!   400THB (USD$12.00) per half hour    RIP-OFF!  we were told because the booking was through an agent (Hotelopia) it did not qualify for free WiFi (what Bullsh*t)  River Dinner Cruise not available.  Air Conditioner in room stuck on 26 Deg.   Shower screen leaks badly, leaving large puddle in door . Very dangerous!  Vin Nam outdoor riverside Bar-B-Que no longer on offer.  All guests seem to use the Hotel for sleeping only, leaving the 4 very nice restaurants empty and with no atmosphere each and every night of our 7 day stay.   One gets the impression the Hotel has seen better days and is on the  out.  Penny pinching is not the  to build clientele, sorry guys.

Booked this hotel 10 days before travelling, and was surprised at the low price, didn't know what to expect.  Very pleasantly surprised, lovely hotel, recently refurbished and good quality furniture and fittings in room, better than the hilton at York, which was 5 x the price!! Efficient check in,courteous staff. A comfortable nights sleep, and the breakfast was delicious.Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

The only negative comment about this hotel is it's close proximity to the train station and the station announcements are very loud and can be heard from the bedrooms ( at the back) and seemed to start at 6am?!
Clean, tidy and quiet
Not so much smiling and helpful
Clean, nice hotel with good breakfast. All public transport very close by.  Best ratio price/quality in town.  Gym   sauna available in the price
Everything was great service food and location was perfect for things to do looking forward to returning soon

The new hotel was nice but next time I might try the classic hotel side.  This one was very modern with less Havana character.  Also I get up very early 4-5am and it seems that the hot water was off during the early morning hours.  Overall the pool and dining area and accomodations were very nice.

The staff was wonderful.  Unfortunately, my wife fell and broke her arm on the second day.  They were extremely helpful with many details, for example, reading the instructions for her medicine in Italian and translating for us.  I would rate them a10!!!
Hotel was relatively clean, tidy with a good range of food on offer. Staff friendly but nothing wow about the place!
The staff were amazing
good location, fab breakfast
room not serviced properly and room cleaners could not speak english
Great place right in centre of Frankfurt at a great price, what more can I say.
Great Location. Food is plentiful.
Cheap hostel perfect for backpacking or for a group of students, nice area that's close to Opera and Oktogon metro stations as well as trams
staff were lovely and helpful, good central location and good value with that in mind.
breakfast service was a bit hit and miss, we didn't have it included in our rate so tried it only once!
Very friendly helpful staff. Great location for walking to lots of interesting places and close to the U-Bahn as well.   Plenty of restaurants within walking distance.
Great hotel staff and management at the hotel    Board racks under the bar to keep your boards out of the sun
Very friendly staff. Excellent facilities. Rooms are very quiet despite the central location.
Rooms are large and has a minibar which might be handy for late arriving person if you dont want to go down to main building.

Staff attitude is typical for a big hotel "We are here to help you" which translates to be "could not care less". Registration staff is not capable to solve any problems. I also asked a room facing the quiet side and got a room facing pool - and the noisy pool maintenance was done till 1am. Registration also failed to check in me to the correct room type i had booked. Location is off Strip and it really means OFF.. so be aware when booking.
The fitness-studio should be opened many more hours.

The hotel is very clean and even though in a busy area of the city the rooms are quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful even when the unexpected happens, we woke up to no water on the Monday morning due to a Severn Trent problem but bottles of drinking water were provided and rooms for showers were provided in their sister hotel over the road.
Not really a negative but since I stayed here last year the lifts seem to take a long time to arrive when called, this wasn't a problem last year so not sure if they have changed something.
No service at all.and this hotel I dont give more then one star.
We had a refurbished room which was excellent.  The food was very good. The whole complex was very clean.
Too many cats in the complex.

The location of the hotel is good within the golden triangle and walkable to the sights such as the petronas towers and china town . The pool roof top looks nice with a bar although we didn't have time to swim in it.

This certainly isn't a 5 star as suggested on arrival we carried our own luggage up the ramps and to the room. The room although was large smelt like stale cigarettes .   The breakfast is pleasant but also not a 5 star rating as suggested.

Very comfortable beds.  Very clean, Bar prices are reasonable.  Location is superb.   Service was good.  Staff very friendly.  Good choice and quality of food at breakfast except for Orange juice which was watered down.
Exorbitant WIFI.  £10 per day.  .   Watered down Orange Juice at breakfast, noise from lifts.  Car Park v expensive although they reduced it to £7 per day as we were staying for 3 days
Compliments to the chef...the spa balcony rooms looked amazing and would book next time.

Very nice hotel, our room was very clean and comfortable, with a nice big TV. The toilet was extremely clean and pleasant, thank you for that. Breakfast was included in our stay which was lovely and filled up our tummies nicely before leaving. All in all, nothing out of the ordinary, but a big plus for the cleanliness of the rooms! Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. The location is also very nice, not in city center exactly but restaurants and shops can be found in the nearby shopping center or by just walking for approx. 1 km. Great bus connections to other parts of town as well. What I also liked was that it wasn't a big hotel and not a small one, but just the perfect size to keep a comfortable atmosphere, almost as if it wasn't a part of a big chain of hotels.
cheap and close to the airport with a shuttle bus every hour,would not stay more than one night,the staff try their best(i think)
Good Location near Shopping Centre, Malaka World Heritage
Excellent location, helpful staff and very good breakfast!
very cheap and near the beach.
apartments in such bad condition.
Nice personal service and great value for money.
Language skills of the personnel, hotel location
Terrible car parking place, noise from the above breakfast room
Great hotel, really nice rooms, staff was great and helpful, continental breakfast was generous, nicely placed in village.
Old tvs in the room, no indoor pool, free outdoor parking is small and was full but indoor parking is easy and affordable and they let us stay after checkout.
Fast reactions of the cleaners when asking to improve the sleeping facilities,
The breakfast sortiment not quite rich
Great location, Friendly family run hotel, clean and well presented. All staff are very helpful.
Very friendly and helpfull staff, good location, good food, nice swimming pool .
Bad smeel in rooms, humidity and canalization problems
I only stayed one night - it was adquate for the one night.The staff were friendly and courtesy.
Nice, clean hotel, great beautiful oldfashion building, big halls, high room, really good looking place.

Very nice place, frendly personel
But they do not speak english, difficult to comunicate.
Breakfast could be better. Doors were difficult to open.
Absolutely great location! Fresh fruit in the hotel room and at breakfast.
Breakfast was fine enough, but I was left hoping for more taste and drinks.
Staff knowledgeable and very helpful
Would be a bonus for the hotel to provide Wi fi to its customers instead of charging for the use.
very beautiful and large resort, and the rainforest room is nice, comfortable and quiet, make you feel really relaxed.
staff where excellent, good location, good quality food, easy parking. good size room ,
Bathroom was in need of updating some wall tiles cracked and bath had some damage with shower over bath and poor shower curtain wall radiator to close wc   room 1022.
First time and I like it very much.  It`s simple and nice,and the important for me was the great view sunshine.
Able to watch Swansea thrash Valencia 3-0 in Europa League match.
