Very good location, i get a good night sleep and enjoyed good breakfast! :) I can also recommend hotels beauty salon treatments!!! :)
nothing negative to say, i was pleased in every . :)
Nice hotel near the airport. Great when You have a long stop over
Hotel is OK but check the taxi prices and pay with CC Exchange rates are very poor
Good value for that money. Mattress are good enough and that night was silent.  Locker was easy to use with electric lock.
Somebody has drinked my juice on fridge and it was named.  One women doesnt understand alphabets ,cause she has taken my bed, so i had to take upper bed.
Beautiful old building in a nice town.
No air condition in the room. Windows could not be opened because of the noise from the street.
Very new and clean. Staff very friendly
good hotel with in-room spring~ nice staff and good food including the breakfast and lunch/dinner

Great place to stay. Nice and polite staff providing great service. The cottages are close to Legian Rd nightlife and all the shopping. Easy to walk to all locations or hale a cab/scooter. Five of us from Perth arrived in late at 2am in the morning and the reception waited to greet us and show us our rooms. 24/7 service and great value for money,  to go Adi Dharma.

Location great, near metro stations, British Museum, shopping center etc. Easy to reach the city centrum. Tranquil neighbourhood. Frienly staff. Luggage room.  The room was renovated and clean but old.

I stayed many times in this hotel and I am very pleased with everything about the hotel.Breakfast was very good and staff were very friendly.Anywhere close to a very central location,close to the Russell Square tube station was pleased that so much for us.The room was very clean.
It has not minibar in the room.

Good location and easy transportation. There's shuttle bus from hotel to city center for almost every hour. Very easy to buy ticket to nearby island in Sutera Harbour. Good service and nice room. The facilities is wonderful. Love the swimming pool, the beach and sunset bar.
Situated in an ideal location close to the main Belfast bus/train station. Staff were very helpful and informative. Food and drinks were first rate. Would definitely stay again.
Little or no signal in the bar/restaurant to access my phone network.
Apparently doesn't use allergenic-free washing powders and/or fabric conditioners when washing linen. Might be possible if requested before visit.

The hotel`s location is excellent; shops, restaurants and the beach are in walking distance. For the price Kaiser is excellent value. All the staff was very friendly, service-minded and helpful. My room was clean, air-conditioned, had good bathroom, comfortable beds, nice balcony and a wonderful view to the sea. I really enjoyed my visit and will be back there soon.
car parking inadequate  staff disinterested  heavily overpriced

You cant beat the value at this hotel. Nothing compares to its price/quality ratio. I happened to be there the day of the recent 7.2 earthquake.   There was a little lack of supervision from the staff during this emergency. I would have expected  more direction / announcements  dealing with guests during a disaster like this. I packed my things and escaped down a stair well into a garage an outside with no one leading the  out. A little supervision during this time would have been appreciated though I suspect many hotels dealt with similar issues this day. They were, however, back online with power in the hotel  within 15 minutes after the initial shock. All in all it worked out.     Alpa City Suites remains a grand value in Cebu.
A disaster recovery plan is needed to help direct guests during emergencies.
No evening entertainment in hotel
Beautiful grounds and views and pool areas.
No aircondition
There is not dry staling for hear. It is very important for woman.
The room itself was spacious and clean, very close to Wembley arena which I wanted, did not eat there but think they do a 3 course meal for £14.95 all in, only bought a vodka and coke for £4.85!!
The house keeping was excellent - room very well cleaned with fresh towels
Not enough dessert variety for vegans apart from ice cream
Beautiful position right on the best part of chaweng beach.  Staff at pool and beach very good.   All staff very friendly.  Music by dj Paulo is excellent.  Spacious room and balcony with good views.
Breakfast not great choice and although the staff very friendly you do have to ask for everything including coffee as nobody came and asked.

The proximity to the beach, center, restaurants, shopping, and night life was excellent. The hotel was ok overall, room was decent with nice, clean interior.I was very happy with the balcony and the sea view from it.

Where do I start? On my first night there was a rain storm. My room was on the top floor and it started leaking rain water directly above my bed. I asked to be moved to another room. The night receptionist said hotel was booked up. As a result I spent the whole night in the lobby only to find out at 6am that they had had a room all along available on another floor. In my opinion, staff were either totally indifferent to customers' problems or they did not comprehend English enough - they always smiled and pretended they had understood when in fact, I am certain, they did not. Other issues were: Sheets and covers were never changed during my whole stay of 1 week; WiFi connection in the room was almost non-existent - either poor or not working at all; The size of the pool was infinitely small- more like a dipping pool rather than a swimming pool; Food was not varied; There was no shampoo in the bathroom, which is unusual for a 4 star property; It is true that the all-inclusive rate was very low but it all came with the above 'extras'.
New, close to airport.  Free parking.  Very friendly and proactive concierge.  Tried their best to arrange early check in.
Far from city centre.  Small room.  Poor room arrangement - not offered adjoining rooms, preferred views even requested.
Receptionist when available were very helpful.
Large room, extremely comfortable beds, very clean, quiet (facing inner courtyard), balcony (although it was very dirty)
Neighbourhood slightly run down and with dodgy (but not frightening) people hanging around
The location is good and friendly staff,and i like the Garden,when you get up in the morning,you can see many birds in front of your room.
There is much ant in the room..

No brochure telling the rules of the room: when the cleaning team comes, where should the towels be left for changing (as we left hanging on a chair, dirty towel was not changed). Some distance to the sea and not easy to walk if a person is old: a sandy hill to walk down.  As we had "studio"- the plates were not very clean in the shelves and they were dusty
Hotel is simple and clean, staffs are helpful, good value for money.

I feel most people would be happy with a simple breakfast of fried noodles,fried rice, toasts, hot /cold drinks and some local fruits. The milk was diluted and food did not look like food except for hard boiled eggs.
Hotel is situated, close to the C.B.D., and is within walking distance.

Rooms extremely small. I had a view of three concrete structures. Some of my bed linen had stains on it and I found hairs on some of the bed linen. The mattress of the bed was very old and sank in the middle causing a severe backache!  There was no porter's in service or assistance leaving me to navigate and negotiate my baggage to my room. This was difficult as I have a disability.  Finally I was told. Upon check out, and in a loud voice for all to hear, that I would not receive my bond until my room was checked for any damages! I felt like a messy teenager.
clean bedding  and good tourist location

I have booked 2 bed  room with the shower and toilet  but when arrived i was told i will get a 6 berth prison cell and the shower was not working - although I have been told the problem with the shower was reported the day ealier , I had to change the room for another  6 berth  cell and guess what the room next to me was the one which I have booked   and empty - 2 proper beds. No explanation was given why i wasn't offered that room in the first place - the whole issue is I had undergone  a neurosurgical  operation on my back and cannot get to bank bed, I have only made reservation on-line after seeing the photos of  the  2-bed room - otherwise I would book  another hostel- why there is no mention to begin with that the 2 room beds are only serving as the bites for the tourists ? when you actually arrive then you have to take what is there  and believe in the receptionist's stories that all the room were already taken - then it means there were actually overbooking  and wehen I was placing my reservation on line there was a message saying there a 2 twinn bed rooms left , so please please, make sure from the beggining of your arrival at this hostel you are getting what you have paid for.
Unsafe location, tiny rooms
friendly staff  rooms are neat and clean
roms are too small and cramped
The staff were very friendly and helpful going the extra mile after an incident ... I would totally recommend it close to the metro spot on
had a great time staff were wxcellent
Public areas were very smart and the staff were very friendly , helpful and polite.

The bedroom didn't resemble the photo on the website and was particularly dirty. The bed sheets looked very clean though the carpet was so filthy that we didn't want to walk barefoot. The decor was old and tired with dirty wallpaper and holes in the walls where fixtures had been removed. During the following morning my wife and I discovered plenty of bites over our bodies.    The breakfast was also a bit limited.    Shame really as the hotel has lots of promise but would never stay there again.
Well located with seaview.  Good WIFI in the lobby.  Delicious mails.  Clean rooms.  A good place to start and/or to finisch a holliday in Turkiye
Close to the Disney parcs, nice room, great breakfast
The first morning we had to wait more than 30 minutes before we could have breakfast because only 1 of the breakfastrooms was open. Luckily the second room was also open the other mornings.
near the beach and centrum

We did not get any other hotel and since pictures of the rooms were not bad, we chose this place. But in reality it was not like the pictures wanted us to imagine. The room was not clean and the beds were terrible. I got a back ache. I saw staff only once during my stay. We had paid for five nights, but stayed only four. I will never choose this hotel again.
Well situated, very good facility, good food and service.
Immaculately clean room and grounds/pool. fantastic friendly staff. Totally wonderful
We arrived very early
Staff at reception very pleasant and efficient. ease of access by car especially when leaving is perfect.
Booking on line should be improved.  Does not give you the cheapest price and does not allow for Senior discounts.
The staff were friendly and helpful, the food was ok, pool was clean, nice ladies by the pool to give you a massage at really reasonable prices! The location is good and not too far from the beach.
The shower temperature - burning hot or cold!
Excellent service and nicely decked out hotel. Very clean and a nice touch to have a complimentary mini bar
Bed was a little awkward to get in and out of.
situation in the city : excellent in the neighbourt of busses, taxis, walk facilities to places of interest  breakfast excellent  silent rooms and god beds
The roof top bar was giood with lovely views of the city.  The staff all spoke English well which was useful.
None of the taxis knew where it was.  This made it difficult at night as the roads are very dark
The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Alicante. I've stayed here twice this year and each time the hotel has been spotlessly clean. Great value for money.
No Taxi queue around hotel.  Most Taxi drivers do not know the hotel location.  Noise from the door close/open all night.  No restaurant.  No glass to drink water in room.
very clean hotel  sevice are good
Well situated. Staff very attentive. Rooms very good. Good choice of breakfast food.
No tables free at breakfast so had to go to lounge area to eat
It is a very pleasant experience.
Beautiful hotel, stunning roof garden, cosy lounge, excellent customer service, delicious breakfast! Will definately be returning!

A guest accidentally set off the emergency alarm at 7am, which was an unexpected wake-up call! Of course, this is of no fault of the hotel or its staff, although while trying to find an emergency exit, there was no staff around who could of helped us. We understand that there is very few staff on duty at this time, however it would have been reassuring to see a member of staff when we weren't sure what was happening! The alarm was quite scary with instantaneous images of the place burning down (which it didn't of course!) but apart from this, a very positive experience.
clean room, nice quiet part of the town.
noisy music outside
Great location and polite, porfessional service.  Excellent facilities.  Great selection of food at breakfast.  Very good bar service and food.
The first room offered, although non-smoking, smelt strongly of stale tobacco.  Room was changed.

We booked another hotel with same name and facilities near centre. So were mdisarusfied before we went. Woukdnot trust or book with Hotelopia again. We were misled and missold and when we phoned to try to rectify sitaution were told very oatronisingly by hotelopia staff that its very easy for people to make mistakes when booking on the internet. I book 3 to 5 trips a year using internet and this is the first time i used hotelopia and ghe first time i had a problem.     This hotel was ok but too far away, too remote and no staff for information. A setious minus.quality of the apartments themselves was ok but we wouldnt go there again or recommend it to others.
Beautiful, old interior. Very helpful personnel. Later noticed doublepayment was solved quickly. I`ll be back.
This hotel is all about location! Fantastic access to Universal Studios, within walking distance
Nothing to say that is negative... Possibly the only 'niggle' was not always having English breakfast tea replaced in the room daily... Camomile kept popping up!! But after a call to reception

Very central to all the sight seeing at Athens. Renovated rooms are clean and well maintained. Free WiFi and pretty fast for all your communication and uploading of photos. Airport bus is just a 5 minutes walk up the road and cost €5 and takes 50-60 minutes.
Very limited choice of breakfast food given. Bacon is not crisp which I really hates.  Bathroom is a bit small with no room to put your toiletries.
Fantastically equipped apartment with ample parking and access to hotel facilities. Easy access from Faro
Pool very small, area around apartments a bit run down.

The location is great, there's a cheap bar like in? or atleast next to the hotel which servers 0,5L beer for just over an euro (27 ck). Within 10 minutes walking you'll be in the 'real' center where drinks will quickly rise up to approx 3 euro's. So if you're gonna chill here with your mates you can have some good 'pre-drinking' unfortunately I was with my girlfriend so I had to behave ;P The staff is friendly, I think most of the visitors come here with AAA taxi cabs from the airport. This hotel will NOT call AAA Cabs for you when you leave because their manager has some deals with other taxi company. This is no problem since you can just walk outside the street and pick up your AAA Taxi (and hand them over your 47% discount voucher)    While some hotels make a problem if you bring 'guests' in your room, I highly doubt they will even know who your entire group is. Since the staff changes quite frequently. So if you're out clubbing and wanna bring someone along big chance it will not be any problem.    You can reach all sightseeing things here by foot, the clock, bridge, castle etc. We requested a room on a higher floor which we also got (we got a room on topfloor) thats because we heard you can hear alot of noise from the streets. This wasn't too bad from our room to be honest..you just hear ALOT of police (not during nighttime tho strangely enough)    They will guard your luggage in a special locked room the day you leave and have to check out.

The included breakfast isn't really worth getting up for, I believe breakfast is served from 7-10am. We went about 9...  Breadroaster didn't really work, eggs were cold, bread was dry... your better off just having some extra rest and paying for a decent breakfast in the city somewhere...unless you are really tight in your budget of course :)    There is no refrigerator/mini bar..you can call them for some snacks which you can check out in the lobby.     Beds aren't thát great but great chances you'll be so tired from all the walking you'll fall asleep quickly anyway    The minuses mentioned above here had little value to me...so if you think you can sleep on an 'okay' bed...and afford good breakfast elsewhere and cope without a minibar. Don't let these things hold you back. For me it was just an alright place to stay during the night.
Friendly staff, great location, tasty food
Need bigger bath towels, wider tv channel selection, better lighting in corridors, hair dryers with longer cords - cord too short to stand in front of mirror
Poor very little room with broken equipment . Overall a 3 star Hotel with beautiful location.
Staff was very friendly, and spoke english. Breakfast was allright.  Working airconditioning in the rooms and enough space to place our bags.
Sheets and towels were smelly and not clean. Rooms weren't cleaned during our stay and beds weren't made. The streets around the hotel are very dirty and buildings are in bad condition.
A good location ,besides,breakfasf tases well ,it is convenience for us to look around the city.
Close to the beach spacious and clean apartments would go back again
improve the air
Fabulous Hotel in very beautiful, unique location complete with wonderful staff and service

Nice room. Very comfy double bed. Lots of desk space. Double wardrobe. An iron, ironing board and trouser press attached to the wall was very handy. Bathroom very nice.  Shower gel provided, no shampoo, so had to use as both which was fine I guess. The inclusive gym was very handy. Lobby nice. Restaurant nice, small portions but well presented and delicious. Breakfast was great. Bar is good.

Shower kept randomly turning very hot unfortunately, received no response to the service form I left. Gym is small, fits up to 6 people, but it's not used much so I always had a space when I went in the evening; could do with more mirrors to make it look better and air con.
We had a Great experience during our visit and will definitely stay there again.  The staff was very courteous and attentive.  The hotel was very clean and the room design was wonderful!
None really.
Hotelopia got booking wrong and we had a double bed room, the hotel sorted us out immediately wit a twin bed room which is what we had booked.  Staff were all friendly and helpful.
Great location buses 450mt  banks sercurity great staff went out there  I got hand written messages passed on from my aunty the cleaning staff asked any special needs
Smoking in their coffee room speeds in to the eating area bearable

Our room was on the -st floor of the Bauer Casa nova . It was in itself nice and spacious, but so dark we needed all the lights on even when the sun was shining .We arrived to the hotel in the evening, and were given a room on the 1st floor and there was no view in the Casa Nova building, we told of our concern about darkness but the receptionist appeased us by saying there were 4 windows.  Well there could have been more windows it would have changed nothing to the fact this room was Dark and gloomy and gave on to a wall .
This hotel was an awesome value, and a SUPERB location. I would definitely stay here again! Room size and mattress comfort where good!
rooms needs to improve
Lovely ancient building good basic breakfast
Bed very hard , towels dreadful , sheets and towels not changed in 4 night stay , only 2 towels
The breakfast needs some more stuff ,vegetables and fruits
Good food at The Island hotel
Nice and neat hotel with all that you need for a weekend in Melbourne. Value for money and great location. Staff were helpful with some printing needs and general information

Quiet inside... pools.lovely..  ...restaurant well managed...variety of food very good .  Music in disco finished about 10 .30 pm .Staff  polite and worked hard.Problem with shower dealt with immediately.

T.V. not working ,(No problem for us )..electric socket by dressing table too low so could not plug  our equipment in there..There were 2 others though  Only one of four lifts working whilst we were there.Our room 3007 in La Valette was too near the "disco room/bar"so could hear the music at night.As senior citizens would have preferred a room further away normally.. though  as no music after 10.30 pm.ish   didn't need to ask to be moved tho' I believe  it would not have been a problem if requested.
Excellent breaksfast; good shuttle from/to the terminal/rail station
Cliing it an airport hotel when it is situated in the cargo areasime miles away seems too much

The Hotel Algarve is generally a lovely hotel, very clean and the breakfasts are excellent!  The pool is massive and being able to walk down to the beach easily is a bonus.  The Sunset Bar is well worth a visit to catch the daily sunsets which can be stunning and the bar staff are all very friendly and welcoming.
My only negative comment would be that some of the reception and restaurant staff can be rather brusque at times and could do a bit more to make guests feel welcome.
These guys made incredible job by turning the villa into hotel, every detail has been worked on. Very clean and very comfortable. The beds are little bit hard.

Staff is very impolite, even rude. The cleaning lady openly asked for the tip (she called it "present for me"), and insisted on it several times, even forcing herself into the room while we were there in order to receive it.  The man on the entrance is also trying to get the tip, or to organise you the taxi 100% over the price in the street, and when we declined, he charged us extra money for keeping our luggage in the hotel room until our flight.

Very luxury hotel, very good value for money. Nice gardens, nice lakes, nice beach. Good meals. They even serve more expensive drinks on the the bars on the pool and hotel (not on the beach though).  The beach is clean.

Nothing really. They gave us curtesy room to take a shower while waiting for the flight - with no towels/soap in it, however.  If you are trying to get information about the connections to Havana, trips etc, it is a maze, staff is not really adequate.
Very nice little "jungle" of the gardens. Bungalows are good, very nice idea. Gardens are well kept. Room is nice.
Curtesy room while waiting for the flight.  Nice beach.
Beach is not really private. Alcohol is of the lowest level. Bad food. We have been to better hotels in Cuba for the same money.
Very big room. Nice view form high floors. Very good breakfast.
Good Location, Relaxing
Resort needs an Upgrade / Maintenance  Buffet Food average  Golf Course in Poor Condition
Staff was great,nice clean rooms,great breakfast and close to highway and walking distance to Old Town. We would definitely stay there again!
Very warm welcome, staff most helpful. Stayed in the boat house, very cute, nice room. Lovely food.

The hotel room we stayed in was large, nice and clean, bathroom well equipped with towels, bathrobes incl etc.  Breakfast was excellent buffet, everything very fresh, we have stayed in this hotel before and we will be back again, it is one of the best in KK. Excellent location to centre of everything.

Staff could not communicate in basic English.  When asked for assistance, they will reply they do not understand or read English.  We have them to check our departure terminal, they gave us wrong terminal and told the cab driver so, caused us to nearly miss our flight!

Nothing was to much trouble for the staff. some real positives was the availability of a drop off service, The best was that on the day we checked out there was no one checking in so they allowed us to make use of the Villa for the day at no additional cost,
nothing Negative
Well located hotel with friendly staff. Good value for money.
Although booked and paid for room for 6 nights it was not available on first night. Sent to another hotel which was of inferior quality.

Room was shabby  Shower was dangerous as the water didn't drain away - no cubicle and no sloping floor. The bathroom had disability access but was badly designed.  The room was not worth the cost - particularly with the additional car parking cost.
very central to all amenities
Great location, beautiful grounds, polite service staff
The rooms are in need of repair, especially flooring and lighting
friendly staff, right on the beach
We were made to feel really welcome by a helpful receptionist
I was in a room near to a door that seemed to bang all night and the mattress was very soft.  my friend also commented on the softness of the mattress
Really small
The quality of the hotel for the price is second to none. Location, room and breakfast were all superb. Have paid 3 times the price in the past for hotels not nearly as good.

Very good sized rooms with fridge kettle and hotplate.  Family room took three beds and a cot and still had room to move around. There was also a separate lounge with kitchenette, table and chairs, settee and two arm chairs.  Breakfast was very enjoyable with plenty of choice for adults and children.  Nice swimming pool and children's pool and a small play area.  Staff happy to order taxi's and offer advice about places to visit.  Excellent location for beaches and restaurants in easy walking distance.
You can get wet going to breakfast if it is raining.

We have stayed at this hotel 5 times. The decor is a little dated but it is quiet and clean and comfortable with large air-conditioned rooms with patio doors and balconies looking  the mountains and/or pool. The ground floor rooms lead directly  the pool via gated fences. The rooms all have fridges and microwaves, the breakfast (usually included in the room rate) is substantial and varied with home baking. The pool is a good size with lots of loungers and chairs and tables and is open until quite late in the evening along with the jacuzzi. The hotel is at the Indian Canyon end of Palm Springs so a good 1 1/2 miles (40 mins walk) to the centre of Palm Springs (there is a regular bus service) but there are places to eat locally too. It has a small laundry and gym too and free wi-fi. There is always lots of parking available in the shade. Basically we feel you get a lot for the low price that we have always paid. The staff are very friendly and helpful which is one of the reasons we have returned so many times.
The hotel was very basic but clean and perfectly habitable.  The staff were friendly. Fridge in the room...  I'm clutching at straws here!

The pool was constantly in the shade of the hotel so was rarely used by anyone, other than the stray cats!  The room was very basic but perfectly clean and habitable, we were given twin beds instead of the double we booked, we were offered a different room with a double but it wasn't up to scratch.  The 4* rating is a bit of a joke really, it was in need of renovation.  No jaccuzzi as advertised and the sauna cost extra.
Room very old , staff no any service. The breakfast buffet is rubbish.
Good location downtown Brussels
Room service left the window wide open and my room was in the ground floor, I was out all day and someone could easily have climbed into my room from the outside.

Booked a last minute deal at a reasonable price.  Room only and we ate out for all meals as we prefer using local eateries.  We had a very good stay at the Excelsior. The location, pools and Gym facilities are very good.  We paid to upgrade our room to one with a balcony. The room was identical and the upgrade a bit pricey but we thought it worthwhile.
The pool restaurant/bar is closed in the evenings so there's no outdoor dining/drinking area.
We enjoy the stay, like the surrounding of animals.
Our opinion of the price of beverages and food, are to high and expensive for the average South African. Feeling is that there are only catered for the international tourist.
Breakfast was good,plenty of choice.friendly staff,good location
lighting is poor, made the hotel seem dull,even in the rooms, small car park

Everything seemed to be fine until the moment when everyone were moved to another hotel! Hotel staff told us that hotel is almost empty (200  people) and the owner decided to close it and move everyone to another hotel without even asking.

Check in - very  efficient, we were shown to the apartment and all the facilities in the apartment were checked and explained. Staff very helpful.  Apartment - fantastic, luxury, spacious, fabulous view over the marina. Late check out available for a small fee.  Security - outstanding, fully staffed 24 hours with security gates. Safe in room.  Location - excellent, quiet part of the marina yet only 5 minutes walk to the heart of the V
Location is very good
Hotel for a long time, you need to renovated bathrooms in particular
Very good! The hotel is situated close to the Bodrum center and Gumbet. It's clean, well runned and relaxing.

small rooms  terrible breakfast overpriced
Staff were extremely polite and helpful. Room was spotlessly clean. Free and large carpark with a subway station just a five minute walk away to take you into the city centre
Travelling with friends for a 3 day city break, hotel's location to the main station is ideal for travelling and only 10mins walk to centre. Lots of eating places close by.
beautiful classy hotel, great swimmingpool area.  Excellent friendly staff.  Buffet is very good

We have stayed here twice now. Both times towards the end of October because we were running The Mallorca Marathon. This hotel is great, a real nice place to stay and quite cheap at this time of year. The location is stunning, especially if you get a sea view. We will more than likely stay there again, depending on price?

I heard some rumours that the hotel has a bit of a bad rep, due to being close to the Magaluf Strip? Maybe it is quite lively in peak season? I was also told that next year it is supposed to be a family only hotel? Lastly the hotel is up a steep hill! Did not bother us, as we were there to run the Marathon. Could hear noise from the other rooms when we were trying to sleep.
Comfortable overnight stay in an attractive sea-side resort

The hotel was very clean. The amenities were very well taken care of. Lifeguards were on duty during the pool opening hours. The cabaret in the moonlight bar was of a high standard. The housekeeping service was excellent. I would definitely return.

The only negative aspect was the noise - due to the structure of the building, the night time noise carries further - eg. parties on the 7th floor were very audible to those on the 1st floor. We were offered an alternative room, but it was my choice to decline as I didn't want to move all our belongings. Staff were very sympathetic and understanding when I complained.
Staff were the best - very helpful and friendly.

No tea or coffee making equipment in the room which was different to the last time we stayed but not informed of this until we entered the room.The bus to the park were not as frequent as advertised and took over an hour on the first day to catch one after that we paid the money and used the car.

Has all the facilities you will need excellent kitchen breakfast bar . Beds were very comfortable . Local 24 hr store next to hotel . You can can use the beach area of the hotel across the road and tikki bar . Swimming pool was great open till 10 pm . Staff very friendly And helpful we will definitely be staying here again when we return next time .
It's about a 15  min walk to the main shopping and resturant area but taxis do run a 5 dollar service anywhere on the front .

Convenient location for a stop-over before an early morning/late night flight from KLIA or LCCT.  Free scheduled shuttle from KLIA.  Onsite restaurants with a good choice of dining options.  Limited but adequate buffet breakfast was available before 5:00AM.The full buffet breakfast being prepared looked impressive.  Free internet was available.

No Free shuttle from/to LCCT.  Limited free scheduled shuttle from/to KLIA.  Early morning/Very late night airport transfer can only be made via the comparatively expensive Hotel mini bus (there was a distinct lack of external Taxis - which would have been dearer in any case).  Isolated location from any major shopping/food center.
Excellent location, breakfast substantial and varied. Rooms clean and a good size.

Hotel had not booked the correct number of rooms but this was resolved after a while. Make sure you take a confirmation of your booking as it was only after we showed this that they admitted their mistake. Room key card only worked occasionally and had to be reset every day with no explanation or apology. We were accused of keeping the key card  next to a mobile phone which was not the case as we did not take the phone out with us and purposely kept it separate from anything else. We also paid for the 12.80 zloty city tax with a 50 zloty note but only received 7.20 in change. This may have been a genuine mistake but worth checking your change before leaving.

NEED TO PAY CAR PARKING, NEED TO PAY FOR INTERNET, BREAKFAST NOT ON THE 4* LEVEL... This was a previous IBEROSTAR hotel and previous it has a really great service, I would say that this hotel is more a 3* than a 4*.
Very friendly and courteous staff.  Great location in downtown Kobe in Sannomiya, right in the heart of everything!
The shower is quite small; barely enough room to even turn around, but there is great water pressure so it's possible to take a relaxing shower.
This is a very beautiful resort and it was a pleasure to stay in.

The building, lobby area and grounds are quite grand and have so much history to them.  The views of the sea and Malecon from the outside bar terrace are amazing.  There is a free mini museum near the outside bar terrace that explains the Cuban Middle crisis.  The staff were generally friendly.  Tour desk and currency exchange desk in hotel lobby were useful to have.

No hot water for some of our showers.  Charge of 25CUCs each for any meals - buffet dinner was appalling and they don't let you charge to room.  Room was dirty, smelly and despite asking for the towels to be changed, they had just been hung back up on the towel racks and turned around (we had tipped housekeeping 3CUCS so extra disappointing).  Internet at $10 USD per hour is ridiculous for a supposedly 5star hotel.  Although they have a gym, it wasn't made clear at any point that you have to pay 5CUCs per person per visit and they don't even have complimentary water in the gym let alone in the rooms.

Every single member of staff made us feel very welcome.  Absolutely fantastic with our dog.  Great walks from the grounds of the hotel.  Superb food in the Abbey Bistro.  Thank you for a brilliant stay.
Can't think of anything...  We will definitely be back.
It is near the lake, the swimming pool and wellness area are great. Every room has it's own balcony.
Quite loud because of poor building materials.
The stains on the wall  should have been clean, room generally quite clean
It's a very good value for money hotel in a nice neighbourhood in the Medina. The staff was very friendly, helpfull and hardworking.

We didn't understand that there were two part/riads for orangers d'alilia. We read on another bookingsite that there was a swimmingpool. This wasn't the case in the Riad were we stayed. Unfortunately, because with 30 degrees in the afternoon it would be lovely for our girls to get a plunge in the pool. The last day we discovered,  30 metres of our Riad a 5* hotel (les Jardins..) where we could make a package deal for lunch and swim.  The room was charming, clean, but a little bit small. The breakfast was plenty but every day the same.
Very good breakfast. Room was excellent, clean and comfortable. Best shower in Europe! Location is good just out of the loud hustle and bustle of la rambla.
You get what you pay for. For the money this is a great deal. I paid $80 US a night inclusive, Beaches very nice, food was fine, the restaurants good.
Fantastic staff. The most serviceminded staff we have ever met. The beach is nice and clean and really clear water.
It would got ful pot if it had wi-fi, but that I know is not the hotels foult so.....
Nice to stay at . We stayed in second block separate from hotel only 5min from beach. If you stay in the main hotel use the roof top super views and a sun trap.
Kitchen needs an oven or at least a grill. Two ring hob , microwave and toaster is all we had to cook on.  If we had an oven we could not ask for anymore .
Very nice hotel, perfect location and helpful staff. Will definitely go back
Good and convenient location. Near shops, food and mrt station.  Although room is small, it is very clean and has required necessities for good rest.  Bed and pillow very comfy.
No bar fridge in the room. No wardrobe which is not really a problem if there are sufficient hanging hooks in the room. There are only 2 hooks in the room
We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It was very central to the sancatry and shops.

Hotel was amazing! Would reccomend to anyone. Perfect location ony 2 stops from Dam Central taking around 12 minutes on the train. Hotel has a great pool, sauna, gym and steam room on the 2nd floor. Awesome hotel. Very good helpful friendly staff. I stay at a lot of hotels in business and this is up there with the best of them. Would stay there in a heart beat.
Excellent reception - Grace was very helpful.
Hot water out of the cold water tap! No cold water with the effect that water was frequently too hot to use in the shower.
Nice surroundings, close to transports, easy to find!
Well positioned from airport. Though buildings are old and the hair dryer did not work it is clean. Good room service from hotel restaurant.

Limousine service was not booked when requested to take me to   Air Asia airport. When it did turn up it was a shuttle bus. I was not informed of alternatives and mislead by service that operates from hotel lobby. To top it off the driver kept asking for a tip. A taxi is much cheaper, or alternatively if flying Air Asia you can catch the hotel shuttle (free) to the "New Airport" then get on a shuttle that will take you to the airport where "Air Asia" operates from (cost 3 ringets) which takes approximately 20 minutes from the "new airport".
Friendly staff and great location

Central location, good humor and great service from the staff. Great breakfast and lovely spa area. No noise from the outside, despite the central location. Comfortable beds. Good that we could borrow a kettle and got refills of coffee powder daily. The neighboring restaurant Edel-weiss is highly recommended :)
The pillows; one tiny(30 x 30cm) and one far too big(60x60 cm).  A medium sized pillow would have made our sleep even better! We missed a safe in the room.
Excellent hotel overall.Gym and tennis facilities very good.
Towels were placed on sun beds at 6.00 am by some people! Clients were older on average!
Nice hotel in good location. The Born area is great with many small and excellent restaurants and bars.
Bathroom need improwntt. People Talking loudly in public aera in the evening.
Very helpfull and Friendly staff  The hotel is near the sea  Definately will come again!
Very good location.
Didn't have much choice of TV channels.
Staff were very efficient and helpful,  food was ok.  Leisure centre looked great but didn't get the opportunity to try it out.

Rooms in serious need of modernisation,  and redecorating quite old an shabby looking. The car park was a joke after being told to come back in an hour for the third time gave up and parked on the street.
Good location  Nice new design   Nice facilities -top roof pool and jacuzzi.gym and spa.  Very serviceminded and proffesional staff
Difficult to find transportation from hotel area.  Not taxi stand in area.  Lots of constructing work all around the hotel

This hotel was amazing for children and our experience was fantastic. Great value for money and I would highly recommend it to all families going to disneyland :) I would go back in a heart beat. Drinks where a bit over priced but apart from that every thing else was superb
The balls pit in Main lobby needs to be padded around edges as my two year old got a back eye from this which was bad enough.
Very good hotel. Had everything that one could expect.
The location

The restaurant is massively overpriced - the pizza on the menu that they charge £11.95 for is a frozen Chicago Town one which costs £5 max in any supermarket. I understand that hotels are generally more expensive than bars/restaurants etc but i find that very excessive.    But it served its purpose
The location.
Bad quality-price ratio. The staff is not so helpful and the hotel has no parking so you have to leave your car in a public parking (40 ch a day)
They had vacancies
Slooow help at the counter.  Loose toilet in the room.  Half the lights didn't work.  Expensive.
we were on the first floor next to a very busy main road looking  russell square it kept us awake most of the night even though we closed both outside and inside windows.
No fridge in the room
Great location!! Ocean front rooms have great ocean views
Rooms are old and need refurbishing, especially bathrooms, no character.

Great hotel to stay at! the staff were incredibly helfpul and friendly and the room even though it was teh standard room was spacious and very comfortable. And the bed was extremely comfortable! Would definately stay here again.

Friendly hotel. Ideal location. Value for money if u get a deal. We have stayed many times and the price really varies. This time we were not so lucky. Superior rooms still only have a standard double bed. We have been told by staff the only diff between standard and superior are the two bottles of water that reception sell for £1 and wifi.. However the difference in prices for the two rooms can be steep....   Overall a good hotel that we will use but cld do more with making the rooms reflect their sometimes high prices..
Lovely hotel in a beautiful location.Room lovely staff very friendly and helpful.Food beautiful.Will definitely return for another stay.
Exceptional customer service, rooms and Rib Room Restaurant is excellent - best hotel in London
Friendly staff brill location in middle of broad street and bullring

When we arrived another couple were checking in infront of us, but immediately another member of staff appeared and checked us in. When they realised they couldn't fit us in for dinner at the time we wanted they phoned a local restaurant and made a booking. The hotel was hosting two parties and two coach trips they they made sure our room was well away from the noise.  This is a good place to stay, we have used it a number of times, the beds are great, the showers superb and the staff well trained.

They still have a smoking area outside the front of the hotel but at least they have moved it away from the doors so the smoke doesn't float up into the bedroom windows. Still better to ask for an odd numbered room.

Hey!  I and my boyfriend stayed at Narcia Resort Side from 10/11/2013 till 10/20/2013.  We had a nice stay. Everyone who worked there from the reception,bargirls/barmen,waiters,cleaning workers,animation team were so nice and give good service!  When I came to Antalya my baggage was still in Amterdam but came to Hotel two days later. The reception help me call to the airport and it worked out just fine!  Good food and I was also part of the Sultan show one evening!  Memories for life!!  With kind regards     Monika Beitland  Norway  NB! I was the only guest from Norway by the  :-)
The hotel was in a great location, the staff were friendly and helpful .The bar was great ,fantastic cocktails and staff were  lovely. Would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone.
We were on the top floor and it was skylight windows so had no views.
Hotel nice and clean everything you need just DON'T book by hotelopia as when I got to the hotel there was no reservation in my name and my card had been debited you have been warned
the hotel is lovely the staff on the whole are great. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the gardens are beautiful and very well kept.It is a lovely place to stay in a beautiful location.
the pool service was very slow and the bar in reception was useless, we gave up a couple of times we went for a drink before dinner and left with out getting one!!
It was a lovely large room,very quiet with a lovely comfortable bed and a beautifully renovated bathroom and was located centrally to everything so it was so convenient.
The carpet had bad stains in it everywhere and desperately needed a steam clean which really should be done asap as it mkes the room look dirty.
Nice view , in center of town, very good hotel
Everything was perfect! Excellent variety of food, very clean and the room was very nice! Would definitely consider going back!!

It was really a wonderful experience staying at Palais dago Hotel, Bandung. It is more than a hotel with all comforts and hospitality. I really enjoyed the stay from 21-25 October, 2013 and my other colleagues who stayed in other hotels envied us so much. I would love to come back again to Bandung and stay at the hotel again.
Comfortable and convenient
Beautiful setting and rooms. Warm welcome. Stones throw from everything to see in York.

Cooked breakfast costs extra and not really worth the money ontop of the continental breakfast rate. Valet Parking costs 20 quid and your waiting for them to bring it back when you check out. Staff were busy when we left but made a massive difference, complained about the room being too hot and noisy throughout the night and just felt rushed not the same nice welcome we had before. Concierge was blunt.
fantastic location.   Easy and very pleasant walks to shops.  Excellent restaurants close by.  Enthusiastic staff, very keen to assist, always pleasant.
Central position but seaview supplement essential. Modern room. Lovely spa, reasonable prices, free pool, sauna and steam room.

The web site said there was a sauna and indoor swimming pool however there was a solarium and swimming pool. Very disappointing. The view out my very small window was the exhaust of a car in the car park as the rooms are lower than the car park.  (he paint was peeling on the windows and there was mildew on them in the restaurant there was a hen party on the Saturday night which was directly above our room. It was so loud I had to complain. It did get slightly lower but was not the ambience I was expecting.  However the outside grounds of the hotel were beautiful the room was very disappointing for the cost of it. I would not stay there again.
Was reasonably situated 15 min walk to tube  Or 5 min drive free parking a plus

Arrived early after a long journey from Manchester driving   (11.30) just wanted to check in and relax for a while  Was told check in was not til 2:30 either leave your bags and come back  Or pay £15 extra per room(2) what a choice not happy about that
Afordable hotel with Spa facilities
Swimming pool good. Clean and food delicious.
Reserved room not available so change to another room type but with no seaview.   Transportation to Patong is not convenient. Suggest to increase hotel shuttle bus frequency.
The staff were very friendly and helpful - in particular Kwanele at reception, and Shillar in the restaurant. Lovely hotel, centrally located, secure property
Safe not working, and room service access would have been nice
We ate Italien buffet one night, the food taste, quality is good. Price is reasonable.
Beds are not comfortable, I stayed at least 5 other Hilton hotels, and the beds were very soft and comfortable.
The room was generally comfortable and the staff efficient. The wine was excellent
The dinner, by comparison with the excellent breakfast on my previous stay, was dull and exepnsive; the pate was tasteless and the duck both tasteless and tough. The sauce was too subdued
good location. nice and helpful staff.
Staff seem to be efficient, room cleaning every day(requested), cleanliness is okay.  Worth the money for the three stars. Security is strong probably because of the surrounding area - little india
Location is very

The staff has to start working on their service skills and be trained how meet customers.  Check in  cant not take 30min if the rooms are prepaid....Time work on process and speed up the check in.    We will not stay and recommend this Hotel to anyone.
Impressive entrance: courtyard with fountain. Grand foyer. Pleasant room. Not comfortable for any more than one night.  Breakfast (food) was satisfactory. Easy access to the West End: huge advantage.

Check in staff seemed stressed. Same member of check in staff had no recollection of my previous stay on 11 October. Breakfast service poor. Had to go up to coffee station to be noticed. Only then was I served. Member of waiting staff complained that I should not have been sitting where I was seated!! Unbelievable comment.

We had a wonderful 3 night stay in this hotel.The breakfast was 'world class' and the evening meal was real 'fine dining'.  The staff were very professional and friendly . Location from the airport was very accessible just 20 mins in taxi with  lovely marina views on one side and beach views on the other.  The weather was mixed but on the rainy days we used  the lovely indoor pool.  We would definately go back.
i was up-graded to a recently renovated room and this was nice,,
the staff are either  or act that , the service was that bad that i left the hotel for another hotel although i had paid for the stay.   my complaints were ignored and decided to leave
What a great Riad. Beautifull en friendly staff. Breakfast is very nice. You can sit on the terrace roof. Would stay here again.

Friendly helpful staff. Had a swim each day and the changing facilities were excellent. Bar meal was excellent value and very tasty and breakfast was excellent too. Could not fault our stay and was extremely good value for money. Would definitely return and would recommend. No problem parking  having found the hotel easily by following instructions on web site.
GReat location for our requirements.  Beach is only a few metres away with lots of restaurants and convenience stores nearby.  Pool is great and with the slides, kids would have a great time.
I have stayed your hotel already 4 times and I was expected everytime little better than last time.  Basically your staff cooperative and polite ,particularly Breakfast room girls are excellent.

I stayed room 311, first of all, bath room particulary in toilet,  I found hair on floor, under Weight scale    Additionally, during night time I guess there were party on 4 th floor, and foot noise was very dirturbed.

Staff were so friendly and helpful. Had a problem with my room card on arrival and it was sorted so quickly by the lovely staff. The hotel is so gorgeous. Such an old-school glamour which is still warm and inviting and really topped off my fun weekend!
Great hotel will deffo return!
Not close to a tube station but there is a bus stop outside the door
Great location, good standard of hotel, staff very helpful would stay here again
Smell of smoke in our room was rather off putting especially as supposed to be a non smoking environment.
Room clean,good facilities,near to we're we needed to go,
Nice Hotel, close to the beach and shops, friendly staff.

The rooms were old style and dirty  The beds terrible  The Spa very dirty and old  Almost broke my foot on this old woodenfloor  the sealing in the pool area was very dirty and things fell off    In the steemsauna the floor was broken    Very disappoint for a 4 star hotel  I only would give it 2

Great hotel well placed in the middle of broad st. The room was very good great facilities very modern. Stayed on the 15th floor great views of the city. Great breakfast in the morning as well.  Would definitely stay there again
The only negative thing is the cost of the parking of your car for £10

Citadines is an ideal place to stay if going to an event at the Barbican. It is also very close to the tube although we chose to walk everywhere (it takes approximately an hour to walk from Victoria station). The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful and the room was clean with all facilities. The kitchen area is ideal for longer stays too. We would definitely return.
the hotel is good, near the beach, only 5 minutes to the mushroom beach.
Staff were very friendly and helpful
The room we stayed in was in need of reburbishment
Very pleasant stay, comfortable, clean and spacious, with friendly and courteous staff. Convenient to central Melbourne, and we would definitely go back or recommend.
It's only minor, but nicer complimentary tea and coffee sachets would be an improvement.
- Hotel Location is very good.  - Room is clean and beautiful.  - Bed is comfortable.

- Management is very bad because we found wedding party at nigth that stage is near our room and make straining noise through the night. We called to hotel staff twice time at 23:00 and 23:30 but they told that they do not know when the party finish. Finally, They cannot control the volume. We have to sleep like we are in the party too.  - Breakfast is not various to select.  - Fitness room is small and difficult to find.
Good facilities, excellent value for money
very pleasant

car parking fees. not told beforehand that parking would be extra. why should  it be? also not advised about driving difficulties reaching hotel. we had to back out of a narrow street and take a long time finding the only  in. big cars are not suitable

This hotel was in a great location, 5 min walk to Jordan mtr and 2min walk to temple street night market. We stayed in the family room which had plenty enough room for myself, wife and 2 teenage daughters. The roof top pool was relaxing after a day out, with amazing views. There is a 7-eleven and Starbucks over the road which can save on hotel prices. Overall would recommend this hotel- it maybe a bit pricey but so are all hotels in Hong Kong and remember this room can accommodate 5 people.
Good value Hotel ,good location with Gym. Food was plentiful of average quality.Gym available not no sauna.
Staff could be more engaging.
staff very polite and helpful.Good parking.Excellent breakfast.

Paper thin walls and very noisy neighbours until 3.30am.When reported staff reacted immediately but unfortunately the girls in the adjoining room took no notice.We were left unable to sleep most of the night., but for £35 we could not expect much more
Excellent position. Plenty of hot water. Good breakfast choice.
No cards for Internet. Noisy air-con. No windows. Needs some TLC.

Grounds and gardens lovely,nice pool,rooms nice all facilities bath and shower,nice walk to beach approx 40mns,girls cleaning rooms friendly Lovely friendly staff in the reasonably priced hotel small supermarket

The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times from management through to cleaning staff. Length of time for breakfast was generous and food was always available and regularly topped up. This is a small hotel and quite old it appears to have had a sort of makeover but some time ago. Fresh towels provided each day.

We stayed for a week, there was no wardrobe to hang clothes, nowhere in the room to put luggage for the week, had to live out of the suitcase, not impressed. Room was not as advertised, nowhere to sit and relax, not even a lounge area as an alternative to the room. Air conditioning was good in room but not so great in the rest of the hotel. Bathroom was not great, very small and very poor drainage in the shower requiring us to put towels down to soak up the water each day. Room and bathroom not well cleaned, particularly behind doors and under beds.
Valet parking good.if pricey.
Bathroom dirty und loo rim and bottom of bath and soap dish,extractor fan not working,lifts so slow.

We had an absolutely wonderful stay at Hotel Vila Lumbung. The staff were lovely and very accommodating of our needs. We stayed in the hotel rooms, not the bungalows. There were a few marks on the walls and a couple of marks on the bed cover but otherwise it was perfect. My second floor balcony overlooked the pool which I enjoyed. The breakfast was simple but more than adequate. The pool area was clean and there were always sun lounges available. We had a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Only negative was that the reception staff were not overly cheerful.

For 2 adults and 2 kids, we were given a very spacious room with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.   We extensively used the free shuttle service provided by the hotel for the main city attractions.   The swimming pool on the roof offers a great view on the Downtown skyscrapers.  Interesting choice for the breakfast.
The free wifi was only available in the lobby and relatively slow.
no water and water too slow.TV transmission so poor.
A very charming hotel and clean.  Personal is very helpfull and nice.  Very good positon of the hotel, near of Alhambra on a quiet street  Very good breakfast with many choices

The beds are very unconfortable.  The space of breakfast buffet is very small, closed. If many people (5 people for ex) near buffet, we have to wait that they are served, otherwise we can't move around the buffet...
Lovely room, bed really comfy!!! Ideal place for walking into the city
This is a great little hotel perfectly located for both down and uptown. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful.
The hotel room was spacious, the restaurant food was nice good breakfast,  staff were very friendly and helpful.
The leisure centre was very disappointing the pool was very basic. Also there was not enough seating to cater for guests in the foyer area. Check in is not until 4pm which is rather late.
Absolutely fantastic. Its perfect for families. Everything you could ever want and need from a hotel, especially when you're with children.
Very good value for money. The staff were very good.
Central location to bus stops and train station. Close to town center
Good location  Lovely view of pool

Very modern room facilities (in relation to the beds, linen, bathroom, tv, free room wifi, air con, kettle) and all in good condition.    Great location just off the main street in the old town - means that it is easy to come back to the hotel during the day if necessary (eg drop off shopping, pick up a jacket, etc) and easy to get to the hotel at night if you stay out late.  Yet no problem with street noise when inside the room, even with the window open.  Easily walkable to the central train station for the airport.
cant think of any.
Welcoming and friendly staff from receptionist to the waiters/bar staff  Room was quite spacious and very clean
Took me awhile to find te hotel but apart from that nothing negative to say
good location and value for money

We had a described as a single bed studio with full kitchen.  The kitchen comprised a sink, toaster and electric jug with cutlery and crockery for 2.  Table for 2, double bed with TV mounted on wall at foot of bed and air-conditioner above the bedhead.  Just enough room to walk around the bed.  The bathroom was fine.  So it is probably best described as a passage expanded in the middle to accommodate a bed and minimal eating area.  There was a lap pool, but only 1.1m deep so not very enjoyable. We did not use the small gym.  Possibly our experience would have been better if we chose multiple bedroom suite as the building is relatively new a looked as if it would be well appointed.
clean and good facilites

Stayed for just one night while on vacation from Bonnie Scotland. My hubby, kids and I loved the hotel and wished we could have stayed for longer. Staff was very pleasant and private beach is all you could ask for. My little one loved the pool at early o'clock also.
Had to pay $10 for parking when it should be free to guests of the hotel.
Location, vews from the room or restaurant, the room was very big and confortable. Staff was kind.
The parking was 22 euros each day. Very expensive in my opinion.  I would suggest to add more things to the frigo-bar.
Stayed there with my daughter '7yearold' she loved the water resort the only reason you should stay here

I had three nights here and have no complaints. Two impressive people - the man who checked us in could not have been more friendly or helpful, even though we were more than three hours too early, and the guy running the restaurant did everything right, making us feel very welcome. I'd go again
All rooms have aircon, but you might need to ask for the remote control!
Great location. Friendly and helpfull staff.
Limited continental breakfast.
The quadruple room was large and the reception area clean and receptionist friendly.

The "full English" breakfast was not that - it was a platter of sliced meat and cheese, two cereals and white sliced toast with jams and the orange juice was more like squash than juice.  It was fine but not what we were expecting from the website.
close to the beach, balcony, plenty of local information, ideal if you only need the hotel as a base to sleep and store your clothes,

the hotel advertise a Wi-Fi facility which you can pay for however if your apartment is on the beach side of the road you cannot get Wi-Fi    the hotel is split into two separate locations the beach side has no Wi-Fi or private pool you have to cross a busy road to get to the pool.   their are bars situated directly underneath the first floor apartments which are open until late so if you have small children or you like to relax in the hotel of an evening this is not easily achieved. The rooms have a good spacious bathroom not of very good quality the water is heated by an emersion heater so if you have more than two people staying in the room you have to wait for the water to reheat between showers.  their is a fridge , microwave, Kettle and hob provided , the hotel provide towels that are not changed regularly we stayed for four nights and had no room service over the whole stay. they also provide a tea towel and dish cloth and a small tube of washing up liquid and one small toilet roll to begin your stay. their are plenty of supermarkets around the hotel however if you are on a budget it may be worth shopping further away from the hotel, take a shopping bag with you because their is a charge for carrier bags and they are not very good quality. hope that this information is of use.  televisions are also provided which have 3 British channels and various other channels.   the hotel is approximately a 2mile walk from the centre of Salou and 3mile walk from cambrills and a bus ride to port Aventura so you could say it is ideally located. you can get public transport from outside the hotel and their are taxis available.
The girl on reception was lovely and even upgraded me to a better room than the one I had booked.  She was pleasant, efficient and helpful.

On the first evening I stayed I went into the bar to eat something.  Two men were serving and I said to each of them at least 3 times that I was ready to order food and each time they brushed me off.  After 20 minutes no one had taken my order so I walked out.  I went to Centra next door, bought a sandwich and ate that in my room.  I told all of this to the lovely receptionist who apologised on their behalf.  If they continue to run the bar in that  they will go broke.

hotel is well located in the middle of passig de gracia, close to a metro station, not far from plaza catalonia. the room are modern and spacious, equipped with a nice lighting system, bath is spacious as well and always clean. 62 will be one of my top option if i am going again to barcelona.
there no much negatives about this hotel, i would say if they have more tv channels will be nice. a proper concierge as well.
Food in restaurant was excellent, service a little slow, but a big function in other room, so understandable,
Rooms are a little small, but got everything you need in there, and beds were very comfortable.
Very nice room. We had a  great time in the hotel.
Very expencive hotel
Staff is lacking of experience   Bed sheets and towels changed everyday though the eco responsible hotel policy
Within walking distance of mainline  railway station (Santa Just a) and airport bus stop opposite hotel. Also close to Nervion Centre (shops and cinemas)
Not within walking distance of cathedral and other sights
Cigarette smoke and sewage odour in the room. Old durty carpet.  We were invisible to the bar personnel and took our business elsewhere.
Good location, nice and clean hotel
When you book the economy room you don't know that there are no windows until you pay  The air ventilation system did not work fine and it was like in a sauna

The place is very clean and comfortable, and right across it is a tram stop where you can reach Munich Hauptbahnhof in 3 to 6 minutes. The kitchen facilitiies is great.  A good place to stay during the Oktoberfest festival since the site is a walking distance
No table if you cook your own food
Lovely staff, clean room, good location close to MTR.  The hotel was good value, and I would recommend it.
good value close to every thing  that a tourist would enjoy
Room was very spacious , clean and comfortable.  Staff friendly and helpful, quiet central location
Internet never worked during my stay, but not uncommon in Libya only worked once in 3 different hotels.   Food average
Very helpful, friendly staff especially the ladies who service the rooms,     brilliant variety food and drinks selection    4 pools so no overcrowding

(1) Horrible view of dilapidated buildings behind Copacobana and the building site generated so much dust that went everywhere in the room    (2) WIFI is extremely slow and kept freezing / logging off all the time and at 4 Euros/ day it ain't worth it    (3) whole family came down with a mysterious upset stomach and vomiting bug a few days into the holiday    (4) the luggage holding area in Acupulco needs redesigning and to be made more secure for individuals storing their luggage in there...some lockers perhaps    (5) Reception area could be better organised and demarcated properly with different aisles for check-in , general enquires and excursion bookings etc    (6) Better information could be given about the timings or seasons so that travellers [before they book!] know when certain activities are available (eg barbeque and children's entertainment)    (7) Difficult to locate the staff responsible for booking guests into activities ( I briefly saw one man in all the 8 nights I was there)
the hotel is very well situated

not once for the 4 days we were there did we see the reception nor the breakfast staff smille it was as if they just did not want to be there.The choice of t.v. channels was non existant you had one english speaking channel and that was bbc world news that repeated every 30 minutes. Now after a long day away from early morning touring and sight-seeing you would like after dinner at night to have a nice shower and relax by watching something on t.v. you had no choice in this hotel as everything was in polish.Best western need to keep up with the times we are in the digital era sky t.v ect.
Very friendly and helpful staff, overall very pleasant stay and excellent value.
Fine decor and wonderful pool areas

Staff very inatentive at bars, particularly pool bar, left standing while bar replenished with either cups glasses etc. only pool bar open during day so if the weather wasn't good it meant a trip of about 200 meters to get a drink!
The price was totally OK.
There was just nothing outstanding. It was so ho-hum. Most of the staff were quite adequate. TV was terrible. Would it break the bank to add a couple interesting channels?
a  simple hotel at a good location. close to the shops and the beach.   friendly staff , who like to give you the feeling you're at home.  was here before and will come later again.
tv receive is not so good and i missed a channel with music or a radio.
close to metro station and in heart of Bur Dubai, free water bottle and news paper

Poor maintenance, owner does not wish to spend a single penny on maintenance or refurbishment.  No in room tea or coffee facilities  Poor or rather filthy bed linen, towels carpet, curtains, lightings
the hotel was very clean and bright. the staff were very helpful. it was extremely quiet despite there being a lot of guests staying there. it was very close to the theatre which is what we wanted.
restaurant for breakfast was small for the number of guests staying there. we were allowed to take breakfast to our room, which we did, as i was not feeling well.
Breakfast was simple but fresh. The bedding was clean and fresh.
I booked a double room for me and my daughter, i got a room with four beds. I booked transfer from airport to hotel but endup taking a taxi at 1.30am, because transfer never arraved to pick us up.
Great location, very cheap and clean, bed was comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Free Wifi in lobby and 24hr bar with very reasonable prices.

I had stay 4 days in this hotel.  As I had booked 2 nights in superior room via package and 2 nights in standard room via hotelopia,  I had told the receptionist when I checked in.  I told her we dont want to changing room so we could stay in standard room for 4 nights and the receptionist said its ok,  we could stay in superior room for 4 nights.  I double confirmed with her and she said we dont need to change room.  However,  after 2 nights,  when we hang out around 10am.  The housekeeping said we need to check out today and we go straight to receptionist to ask and she said its ok we dont need to check out and change room.  However !!!!! When we back to hotel at 11pm,  we found that the access card was not work and found the receptionist to ask the reason.  The receptionist said we need to chang room !!!!  Thats really a bad impression and i think no one could stand this.  We changed room finally.
Staff is awsome.They always make sure you are nr. 1 and give you 100% securities.
No WIFI at the room (but they will arrange it for you on requests.) Food choice at breakfast is poor, also to much asian food. Closets in the room needs improvment and more space.
Good room, good staff, great location.
New, clean , convenient , free shuttle bus
very good nice place ..near the shops near the sea...:) :)
Spa facilities were excellent.   Bike hire available which is ideal for exploring local area.

Location of hotel.  Not near any restaurants Car essential to get about.  First night we spent over half an hour trying to find somewhere to eat, that was walking from one end of town to other.  Not many places open on Sunday evenings out of season.

Vicinity to beach restaurant and bars was excellent, staff very friendly and helpful, rooms light bright and airy - nothing negative to say at all and would definitely stay there again, in fact just about to book again for next year
Very relaxing great ambience from room
Stag need training. Device up and down

The hotel is beautiful with a real family feel to it. Lovely and helpful staff. Situated in the heart of Side and within walking distance to the beach and shops not forgetting the historical parts, you can't ask for anything better.
Could maybe do with extra plug sockets in the rooms.
Close to Disneyland, staff were very helpful when having to transport 16 bags to the bus stop.
- streetside rather noisy  - small television, few non-spanish programs, bad signal  - shower enclosure doesn't close well

We upgraded to a Harbour Club room.  This comes with a breakfast (You do need to ask for the menu for cooked options such as eggs, for some reason it is not freely offered) and a truly magnificent view from the club lounge of the whole of Victoria Harbour.  The teatime and cocktail snacks were excellent as was the cocktail selection, which also included mocktails, European beers and ciders, wine and spirits.  The rooms were comfortable, and the glass wall to the bathroom is swiftly dealt with by using the electric blind!  If I ever do return to Hong Kong I would happily stay again

Service in the Club during breakfast and cocktails was very slow, and replenishment of buffet items at breakfast was not great, it was annoying to wait 20 minutes for an egg order only to find that the bacon you were going to have with it had run out for the time being.  Given the quality of the rest of the hotel this was a frustration
The matras could Be netter, I could feel the springs in my back

This hotel is in a really good location for getting to all the main places to see in Philadelphia, and is also really close to City Center bars, restaurants and shopping.  The room we had was nothing too fancy but was clean and had all of the basic stuff that you need, including coffee that was restocked daily.  We were really impressed with the staff who were always friendly, and one in particular went out of his  to offer tips for local running routes when he saw us heading out for a jog one morning.  The main thing about this hotel is that if offers you good value for money in a city center location in a really cool city!
On the Saturday night some of the other guests were being particularly loud in nearby rooms.  Not the hotels fault as such, but might be worth considering if you like the quiet life!
a well run hotel, very clean and good standards. a very comfortable hotel. staff friendly and English spoken.  Central located for the beach and the town for all the amenities
No parking without a 14 euros a night charge, on street parking difficult, but public parking area nearby

Easy to get to from the airport (Airport bus 21, Hotel Linda stop, price 3 Euros as at N0V 13). Near nice clean beaches, restaurants and supermarkets.    Front desk not manned 24/7 but contact can be made via the bar next door.    I also arranged car hire via hotel with rent a car 2011 which is next to the hotel.Car hire cost 50 Euros for 2 days (   you had to pay for petrol used)
The Bathroom was very dark, also the plants outside the balcony of 153 were very obstructive would be a better outlook if maybe the plants could be trimmed.
Comfortable, big room with easy-to-regulate air-condition system. Good to get heated rooms when you travel off season.   Excellent breakfast.
Lovely spacious spotlessly clean room. Staff were exceptionally accommodating.  Very welcoming personable staff. Hotel has a great location. Easy to get to on foot or tram from city centre.

Very clean and spacious room for a single person. No bath but powerful shower. Reception staff helpful and professional. I`d read some poor reviews so wasn`t expecting much but it was really nice. Lots of couples and families. I took a cab from kings cross but caught the bus back as stops right outside. Would definitely stay again.
Only thing I mentioned to reception was that there's nowhere in the room or your key card to tell you breakfast  and checkout times but they do tell you verbally when you check in.
Staff very helpful. Good big bedroom.  Good location
No lift.  No grab handles in bath/shower making it dangerous for older person to shower
Amazing unique hotel inside the fort.

English breakfast included ( 15,00 P. extra ) is not good because you have to make a choice from the menu for lat's say 4,00  P . The furniture in the room was completely worn-out , to little and to small .
centrally situated.nice views of the river.very comfortable bed.easy access.great for a one night stay.

If you pay for parking( £10) it runs out at checkout - 11 am.We arrived for a late check in after coming from the airport, so it wasn't worth paying for,- we parked free at the riverside then got up at 8 am to move the vehicle.The nearest NCP only opens till 10.30pm, and as we were going to a concert, we would have been locked in.Best value for earlybird parking is the NCP behind the station (not at the station).  Had problems changing channels with the remote, and had to request an iron and ironing board from reception.  On the whole a pleasant stay though.
Nice location and SPA though a little tired is a nice touch.
Bed was very small only 4’6 when we are used to a kingsize felt very small and also it was sloping to the middle which was very uncomfortable.
Near city center and well connected
Near bad reputation locals
The rooms are very modern and clean.

I had the single room, it's closer to the size of a cupboard but perfectly acceptable for one night sleeping accommodation (bathroom door only partly opens before it hits the bed, there's no room to use the chair at the table either)     More importantly, the £10 charge for the secure carpark is total rubbish, the carpark is waste ground in the dark at the back of the hotel in front of derelict garages.  I was luck to have a 4x4 since you have to bump over a high curb to gain access to parking.  Since it is not gated, I was told there is monitored CCTV (reply to me saying I was uncomfortable at leaving my car on waste ground in the dark behind the hotel which as full public access) however when I left the hotel at 05:15 the 24hour receptionist was snoring on the sofa in the dark, which is probably why he didn't make my alarm call either.
Excellent location and value for money.
Great hotel, great staff and good location ideal for theatre and station would stay again

The staff were not fluent in English and when we wanted our breakfast, the meal times kept changing. The bathroom had a leak around the toilet seat too. We mentioned this to the staff and it wasn't sorted. Next time ,will definately pay a bit more for a better hotel.

This hotel is very nice and a good location for budget travellers. Staff is very professional, friendly and helpfull and make you feel very welcome. Rooms are clean and they change your sheets and towels every day unless you ask them not to. AC is fully functional and a good friend to a traveller in Dubai. The hotel is not in the fancy part of town but next to a major transport point from where you can easily get everywhere wich is very positive as there are many cheap, quality restaurants and grocerie stores nearby so for s/he who is not looking to pay six times as much for the very same things in Dubai it's a great location as Dubai is a city where prize depends on location

The only negative things about the hotel is that the wi-fi is not free, you get a 20 mb download quota a day and elseway have to pay a lot for internet access. Also it is not fair of them to say they have a swimming pool as it is in another part of town at a sister hotel. You can go there and dip in for free but have to pay for transportation. They do however offer you transportation to the pool and back with access to the gym at the other hotel plus lunch for an extremely fair prize so you don't really feel cheated by the whole thing.
