Also it is a non-alcaholic hotel but they didn't seem very strict on that if drunkardness was not followed by bringing in alcahol

Stayed in the hotel 7 months before, food and services for breakfast buffet became worse and less choice, painting on bath tub peel off like powder during bathing. Many ugly stains accumulated on gap between tiles around bath tub, no cleaning. Over-aged in-room facility.
Staff changed room when requested
Worn out decorations not changed for at least 9yrs since my last visit, curtain falling off, breakfast room too hot, quality of breakfast poor, chilled cabinet in dining room with noisy motor.
The staff were all very polite and helpful, particularly in the restaurant. Both the dinner and breakfast were of the highest quality
Reception staff very helpful.
Breakfast not the best quality

Lovely view from room of ships. Able to open the window for fresh air.  Breakfasts were sensational, lots to choose from and high quality.. Had lunch at restaurant which was good value and delicious. Location was close to city centre and tourist spots.  Tram stopped right outside the hotel.

Gym was pitiful in size and equipment. Only one running machine, one cross trainer, one bike and one other machine. A few loose weights and a bench.  Hotel guests including us were queued up to use the gym at peak times. Considering we had been To the Radisson in Warsaw prior to this, helsinki needs to learn a thing or two about providing a decent fitness facility for a hotel this size.
This a very clean hotel and was a value for money one night stop over
Great accommodation if you intend to spend all your time at the hotel and use all the facilities such as the slides, pool, beach umbrellas, grotto bar etc.
Room appeared somewhat outdated. Main pool was under repair.

could not fault anything it was great upgraded our room free of charge ,spotless ,staff polite .food great,drinks at the bar cheap , location ,location ,location,  tip have a room facing the harbor sun all day after 1pm booked for February 2014
wanted to stay longer
The staff is friendly and helpful
The courtesy set in the room is really poor. At the bar the staff speak a very little english. Rooms are ok, but for a four star hotel, honestly five stars are too many.

After booking 4 standard double rooms at this hotel I started reading reviews, a lot were negative and had me worried for weeks as the check-in date got closer.  The main theme was tiny, unclean rooms.  I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived, the rooms weren't massive but not as tiny as reviews had made out (I have stayed in plenty of places with smaller rooms).  There was adequate space for two suitcases without having to climb over the top of them just to get to the toilet.  The staff were friendly and accommodating with queries.  The breakfast buffet was busy but satisfying.  The location, just across from the train station, was most convenient for us and the centre of Munich is only a 15 minute walk away.
The only problem we encountered was football yobbos chanting up and down the street until 3AM one night, this was out of the hotel's control so I don't blame them at all.
Good location, near BTS station. Comfortable room with spacious bathroom.

Concierge was unhelpful and inattentive - only had 1 person on duty and had to approach him numerous times to get things sorted out. Initially approached him to help check availability for reservation at local establishments and was quickly dismissed before even trying to call in.
Great hotel with very kind staff. The room and service was awesome!
Staff are very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was amazing.
Not what you expect from other reviews. Hospital like.
room too small for 3 persons. 1 bed was partly placed under a  table

They were very obliging when we arrived in the early hours of the morning. The staff were friendly and polite.the room was clean. Provided the weather was good the rooms were fine for just sleeping in. The dining room had a terrace and an attractive view of the harbour.

Initially our quad room contained one double bed and a four foot bed which was insufficient to accommodate four adult sized people . When asked another bed was delivered.furnishing was very spartan . The chairs in the room were not really large enough to sit on.
Good location, nice and large room, noiseless and cosy, well organized hotel transportation system.
beautiful...all you could want for a relaxing holiday
rattly air-con and lack of information about transport
Lovely hotel and staff.
Nothing negative to say

we arrived at the hotel at 6.30am knowing check-in was at 2.00pm the staff were very understanding and let us in the room straight away we were able to rest.The room was great lots of space and very clean,modern.The pool area is a great place to unwind and for my son to play in the pool was great for him,the staff were very professional and courteous.The hotel was within easy walking distance to fantastic shopping and transport will definately recommend this hotel
i understand that it is a predominantly muslim country but some sort of refreshing alcholic drinks would have been nice
The rooms were very comfortable.  The Reception staff were extremely helpful and service at breakfast was excellent.  I will definitely stay here again on any future trips to Oxford
Bathroom and towels looked tired and need replacing.

This is a great hotel, it is always clean in all areas, all the staff are courteous and friendly, the rooms are of a very high standard . We also enjoyed the entertainment on an evening I  stayed here in the summer too and the selection of foods at breakfast was great. It's a lovely hotel with a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.
Perfect , within walking distance to universal so you can enjoy a few beers  Fridays next door is good of the main menu, however the breakfast although cheap is poor.
Noisy and busy road adjacent so I would not like to stay longer than a few days
Laura and her staff were excellent and certainly went the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable!
Great family hotel, big rooms with all facilities.  Great staff, very clean, great food (breakfast and 1700hrs kickback) great location.
Free wifi acces to the room with strong coverage. It is what most people look up to these days. Please keep it!
The room is too small for the price if booking directly with the hotel.
Nice plays, near bye the city center, quiet i the day, nice pool and staff, free parking i garage. Always avilibel sunbed. Food shoop an resturant under the hotel.
Some noise in the nigt from the city senter, they hang up used towels when they cleand the room.
Hotel is in a Great location. The rooms have the potential to be very grand with large fireplaces, high ceilings and good views across the green. Bathroom and bedding were clean.
Had a bit of a bedsit feel about it.  Bathroom had a nasty smell inside  Mattresses were too springy and not firm enough
sheeets are clean, location si fine ratio price is good, staff is nice and welcoming

the floor is stained, bathroom's got dark spots of humidity here and there,  it's not extra clean without being profusely repellent as many places around,  it's one of the best spot in this range of price for casablanca
Still the best hotel in Cairo, for me. Staff very professional and friendly. Always feel welcome and safe there
Convenience of the hotel to the downtown was really good.  We walked to the ACC in approximately 15 minutes.

The hotel is under renovations so there were messy areas.  The parking garage is a pain, too few spots and difficult to navigate with a larger vehicle.  The room was dated, i.e. torn sheers and spots on the curtains.
Location, very helpful staff, spotlessly clean room.
First visit to Italy so can only compare it to other 4* hotels i've stayed in,  in other countries.  No tea/coffee making facilities in room.  Lack of drawer space(none).  Overpriced, like Gelatto.
Friendliness of staff.
Attention should be paid to the maintenance of hotel rooms.
An all round great place to stay, very helpful staff and nice clean rooms.
Top
Top
Top
Top

We went to London for the weekend and wanted to stop overnight.  The room was clean, small, cozy and functional. We enjoyed a good night sleep in a comfortable bed and there was plenty of hot water in the shower. Breakfast was adequate. Overall we can't complain.  We got good value for money.
A small compromise is the office building which overlooked our room. Not really a problem if you're a weekend visitor.

The hotel was an excellent choice from the start of our holiday to the end the staff were very courtious and gave us their full attention. The hotel was spick and span very clean and tidy. excellent value for money, perfect location and all we had to do was enjoy ourselves which unfortunally was'nt long enough. We will certinally be returning as soon as we can.
With the exception of a blackout one night when all the lights in the hotel went out, which was a bit of fun I can not find one fault
I've stayed at several 3 star hotels but none were as bad as this one. Do not plan to stay at this LaQuinta location again.

Nice experience to be there. After a hard day of shopping was really nice to get in the sauna and the jacuzzi.   About staff professionalism we were very happy and the value for money was ok.   To get there from London Victoria by train, takes about 10min to East Croydon. From East Croydon station 5min walking to the hotel. Easy. Other side of the road is a shopping center.
Very positive feedback about everything the hotels offers. Excellent breakfast! Perfect when you bring children.
Kids activities starts at 9 and is very loud. Not really suited for kids. But it is optional to join.
The room and the environment is nice. the staff also quite friendly.
Too many ants, spider.   Too less facilities.  Too less variety for foods.

Im sorry I didnt eat at the hotel, so not able to give a precise score, so Ive relied on what the food looked like and the presentaion of it while I was looking around the buffet, ie, it was clean, smelt good and folk seemed happy?  Altogether I think this is one of the most professionally run hotels Ive ever been in.

Crazy windy passageway to reception, nearly blew the 2 x women I was with into the bushes? Also Im a lighting designer, and you should have employed one for the hotel rooms, as they are all a bit wrong, but most people wouldnt know unless I pointed it all out?
Excellent staff and really good price as booked  in advance
Air con noisy and light flickering in bathroom on mirror

Stayed here once before on a similar trip and had no hesitation about selecting it again. Had an issue with finding it first time around and stated so in a previous review. This time no such problems. The rooms are modern ,clean, bright and comfortable. It is a pleasure to stay here. Plenty of choice for breakfast. Public transport right outside the door.
nothing positive.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. and on our 2nd night, me and my partner was about to check out because we have some situation going on back at home so we called the front desk to check us out in about 30 minutes. And then, we have handled the situation and called the front desk again to cancelled our check out that night in less than 30 minutes prior to what we have said. and they charged us for $150 . equivalent for 3 nights! my partner doesnt wanna argue with the staff and just paid. for me, its not fair! im not gonna stay in this casino anymore. no considerations! they just want $$$.
Overall a pleasant experience.
Only negative was that I had to go and find some one to serve me with a drink in the bar.
No refridgerator, lots of nois from the street
very nice hotel, very reasonably priced.. overall stay was excellent i would stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.
Room was flooded. Staff at made alternative arrangements and paid for taxi to other hotel.
very good hotel large rooms and beds short walk into town centre all round very good value
breakfast not as good as before had to wait for staff to keep bringing things out  and response from waiting staff when asking to restock thing not what it should be

Excellent location - near beaches, with great view and close distance to Gozo and Comino islands. Very nice garden and swimming pools. Water sports club in the hotel with reasonable prices. Cantine with nice terrace. Nice bars in the hotel. No traffic nor crowds near the hotel.

Free internet access - a complete disaster. We lost a lot of time trying to send some emails or browse internet. In 4* hotel wifi should definitely be free of charge all over the hotel and with reasonable performance. Very nice hotel room, although TV was small and old with limited number of available channels.
Very small rooms, and no heating, room was cold, left an item in room, called to enquire,member of staff was gong to check with housekeeper but haven't heard anything wouldn't stay here again!

Arrived here after driving all the  from England so was quite tired.  Was therefore disappointed to be put in a room right next to what looked like the aircon hot air expulsion units for the entire hotel.  These were incredibly noisy and so I didn't sleep all night.  Though I had a two day booking because of this I told them I would not be staying the second night and to their credit they apologised and did not charge me for the second night.  I then drove along the lake and found a quieter place to stay.  Whilst the hotel has its own facilities for swimming, etc., it is quite a significant distance from the lake, even when you are there with a car, so it's not for me, I'm afraid.

The location is great, but other than that I don't have much positive things to say. The sheets I was given to make the bed was moist. The room was dirty and smelly. There was no aircon or fan and the room was superhot at night. I had booked a female dorm but was put in a mixed upon arrival (in the mixed room was only men at the time). The receptionist said that a request for female dorm is "subject to availability". It didn't say that on my booking and clearly they were unable to deliver what I actually had paid for. The receptionist was not handling my complaint in a good , he got irritated and was not customer-friendly at all.

The proximity of the hotel to the beach is an advantage. One could easily have access to the beach and either swim in the sea or walk on the pavement along the beach. The interior of the hotel  is very good and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The food is excellent. Certainly, in the future we will choose again Arsinoe Hotel for our short vacation.
Helpfulness of the front desk personnell was great. Shuttleservice to outlet mall and
Facilities, location with fantastic view. Good service in restaurant.
It was the end of the season so we felt that some of the staff were rude and unhelpfull. This was at the beach and at the water park.

The hotel parking is shared with hatten square, the parking was full during my check in time (maybe due to public holiday).  I was told to park at next building (mahkota hospital) and in evening to try parking again.    As such, suppose is free parking for guest but need to spend few hours for parking fees   additional time to manage this.
Found the staff very helpful, appreciate there help regard Taxies where I get one after stay with my sister.  Able to relax- nice.  Kindest Regards  Peter J Barr

Brilliant location, short walk from the beach. We opted for one of the high level rooms on the corner which had a view of the sea. Very comfortable beds and lots of space. Would definitely stay again.
Niggles only: having to pay for the safe but knew about this beforehand and had to hold the shower head as it was positioned at odd angle.
Clean big room,very good breakfast,enjoyed our stay overall.peaceful and quiet.would definitely stay agin.

Bar restaurant was very slow in serving us,oder coming with half of what we ordered.food was ok but not happy with the service from the restaurant.wouldve been nice if there was air conditioning in our room.
Nice hotel for some days of relax.Also good food is served.Few meters away from the promenade and from the main square area.

The indoor pool is suppose to be part of the SPA facilities. Apart that it was over crowded, there was no supervision, very noisy and you have to be careful where to stay as someone might jump on you although it was not permitted to jump into.
Two lovely embaressed receptionist who tried to sort out the problems for us. oh and our free room upgrades if our where upgrades god knows what our initial rooms would of been like.

Firstly being told you only have one room when booked and paid for two is not a good start. on arrival and finding hotel you then need to walk to another hotel to check in. and if you want to eat the same applies. i personally will not be staying again.

Very well communicated with the City Center with Metro Line 14 and also RER. Commuting takes only about 15-20 minuntes. Transport to Airport is also good. Rooms are correct with clean and new bathroom and confortable beds. Overall, very good value for the money if you are staying over the weekend or Bank Holidays since it is focued as business Hotel and I imagine fares go up strongly during week days. Considering the prices of hotels in Paris there this is probably one of the best options available
The room needed painting around the window. There seemed to be some humidity problem that made the paint peel off. Probably due to lack of adequate ventilation
Excellent in everything!!
So close to the city !

We arrived at 7 pm but had to wait to go to our room until 7.30 because the hotel staff had no record of our booking. I gave them the paperwork but they would not confirm the booking until they had made numerous calls to ensure that payment had been made. This in spite of having presented them with the print outs of both the booking and the receipt. We were not impressed and had to arrive late at a function.
Very friendly staff. Excellent location.
Car parking in adjacent car parks is pricey. No reduced fees for hotel guests
Terrible quality rooms, dirty, smelly, bugs and the phones didn't work
Receptionist was very unfriendly and that set the tone for the stay. Very average hotel.

Hotel is central,  has its own taxi rank and the security staff at night make you feel safe. The rooms are well presented and ideal for a weekend away. The staff are polite and always willing to help. I have stayed here before and whenever visiting Newcastle in the future I will stay here. I would recommend the Jurys Inn hotels and use them where possible.
Unexpensive, easy to find.
Leisure facilities were the best part. Pool steam room and jacuzzi lovely

We had an incessant noise in our room, housekeeping came to check it out and consequently stunk our room out with the cig she must have just enjoyed! Springs in mattress non existant. Chunks of ladies hair in the showers by the pool even after the cleaner had been in. Jacuzzi didnt work on our second day there
Good value for money; clean and comfortable for travelling with friends. Great pool
Location is not ideal - you have to take a cab to go out (road outside not ideal for walking)  Didn't like the fact that the toilet and shower are separate
The beach and the room oke because of the rain we  feel desolated,  And have to move earlier

The jaguzi didnt work, no coffee in the room, the machine was broke, some lamps where broke, also outsite in the  to the restaurant,  The garden flowers are exotic (alien) so the indigenus hummelbirds can feed themse6lf. And to led a cat free walking and eating the animals is very bad, so kill it!    With more creativety and renovation the is a good spot with good potention, the baech is great.
Location very good and the common areas are well taking care of.

The staff wasn't helpful because we had a problem with the reservation and they got angry at us on the phone. Also one waiter at the breakfast was very rude, he didn't want to put tables together for six people and made us feel uncomfortable. However the reception staff was friendly and helpful when asked about indications on how to go to Lisboa, Cascais or where to eat.
Mattress was awful had all the springs popping out I still have back pains now.

We were extremely pleased with the Sunset Beach Club. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed.  We were self catering and the kitchenette was well equiped, with fridge, small electric hob, oven, toaster, kettle, microwave and all necessary cutlery/crockery. The only thing we would comment on was the design of our room (8th floor) - there was a step up into the seperate bedroom, which although had a warning strip and permenant lighting, could possibly be a hazard.
Staff so friendly....especially the Restaurant staff..and couldn't do enough to help.  Beds very comfortable and we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay.  Def would stay here again!!
Bed was very uncomfortable and the 2 bedroom suite  didn't have an attached bathroom which made it very inconvenient.

I booked the room by looking at the rooms on the website. The room we got was no what in any  the same as the pictures on the website. When we queries this we were told that the room we ordered was an upgrade free of charge but the staff member at reception gave us the option of moving into another room (standard room that we had booked). However again the room was in no  like we would have imagined. The fixtures and décor was outdated and did not resemble what we had imagined we would have booked into by looking at the website. I would prefer if the rooms were advertised on the website the  they are. Very disappointed with overall stay even with the room upgrade. May travel to Kinsale again but will look for alternative accommodation :(
Great location and facilities , friendly staff .
Room was only cleaned on one occasion during our stay which was for one week .

Our room had a seaview and was cleaned everyday and towels changed no complaints  The quality of food was excellent their was plenty of choice and you could always find something you like.  The staff were always very pleasant and helpful especially at reception.  The hotel facilities are excellent even a private secluded beach not far away  Have been twice would not hesitate to go back

There was some virus going arround at  the time  my wife caught it but it did not spoil our holiday  This can be caused by one person carrying it and spreads due to large amounts of people   There were hand sanitisers available to sanitise anytime you wish  There was no problems with the food  or cleanliness in Hotel  Enteertainment was not very good except for the karaoke it was very good

For what you are paying, you're getting excellent value. Neat, tidy, spacious rooms and a variety of cold meats and cheeses and pickles and eggs and fish and lots of other good things for breakfast. One of the few places that can make scrambled egg properly. Service very good, and staff extremely helpful and welcoming. The hotel’s only idiosyncrasy is the wobbly handrail up the stairs.
Poor booking in experience and rude reception staff
I have already sent a review to you
takes 30 mins to check in.

Central location, nice to be by the park, always plenty of taxis. Great view from park/harbour view rooms. Good to have wifi included in the rooms. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff Very  helpful and pleasant. Shuttle bus service was comfortable and good and the bell captain was very efficient and helpful with the luggage. Bar was comfortable, staff very pleasant and happy hour a bonus.

Lifts not adequate long waits, a nightmare at peak times. Room size small. We had requested a double non smoking room and paid for a park/harbour view. (We had booked 2 double rooms) The only. Double room available was smoking and up a flight of steps after the last lift floor and without a harbour view. We we're put in a smoking room with twin beds pushed together but the light  then stuck out over the bed and we kept banging our head on it we did have a harbour view if we could get to the window, the room was so cramped and unacceptable. When we complained we were told we could move to non smoking double rooms with harbour views the next day. We did move the next day, the staff were very helpful and the move went smoothly.
I would recomend this hotel to anyone. Facilities
Good location, close to Rosehill Racecourse.
it was one of the best places ive ever stayed at , I recommend this for any kind of travellers

Well situated........an easy walk to everywhere.  Helpful friendly staff, who even found me a phone charger in their cupboard !!!!! Also looked up bus times to Coto Donana Natural Park to make the day as successful as possible.  They managed to fit two of us in for an extra three days, after initially thinking they were full .

We were warnly welcomed at the Bar Bensouda by the manager who couldn't have be more kiind, helpfull and accomodating.   This Riad is has been lovingly renovated respecting the local style yet offering lovely large rooms/baths right in the center of the Medina\!!! The Raids common rooms are big, open and inviting and the roof deck is worth a visit and a bit of time with a book and nibbles and wine. Great view  partuclarly at night.  Staff was friendly and accomodating. Breakfast were continental.   We had enjpyed our stay and I would hestiate to recommend it particularly to those wanting the full experience of the Medina!!!!

The Fez Medina is located on a hill and this Riad is smack in the middle of the Medina so no matter which  you go you are eventually coming back up a hill. A bit of a challenage in the hot weather. It started  to feel like I was doing the Grouse Grind once a day. So not for the faint of heart or the infirm.    Expect to pay 10-20 Drh per trip to guides to get in and out of the Medina, its a rabbit warren of alleys and takes a while before you start to find your  back.
The hotel staff couldnt do anymore for us ,really kind and helpful. The cleaner was so nice.I would stay there again close to everything.
Lovely room. Great location.

As we had an early morning flight, at check-in, I enquired as to whether there was a wedding being held that evening. As the answer was yes, I asked to be put in a room far away from any noise - which the receptionist said had been done. We were about 5 doors away from the main reception and wedding guests shouted, laughed, joked and slammed doors up and down the corridor until at least 1.30am. We had to get up at 4.30am. Noise not hotel's fault but we could have been placed somewhere else.

A very nice hotel away from the bustle of town. The breakfast was superb. Although dinner is not served, there is a little square about 20 metres from the front entrance with four fantastic and reasonably priced  restaurants. The rooms were excellent and the staff efficient yet friendly. The hotel had a quite luxurious ambience.  An unusual hotel, built on a hillside where the front entrance is on the top floor and most rooms below. A little gem!

The car park is separate from the hotel and the main hotel entrance is a 50 yard hike up a steep hill. If you go into the car park first, you cannot get out on foot without knowing the code for the gate ( we luckily guessed 1234 and escaped.)   Best to go to the main entrance first, drop off any infirm members in your party and get the latest drill about the car park.  There needs to be clearer signs regarding the parking system for people like us who came across the car park before the hotel entrance.  There is a beautiful indoor pool but it is not heated and was too cold in October so empty.
1. Very centrally located around the major shopping malls!  2.  Accessories provided, e.g. good hairdryer
1. Lifts seems to take forever to come  2. Queue for breakfast is very long.  3. Should have more rooms with double beds.

Did exactly what it said on the website. For what we paid we were very happy. Nice surprise was the small lounge area in the reception which had a TV and computer/internet access (pay as you go). Went down every morning to get a brew and it was reasonably priced, even got a cardboard cup carrier. Could leave luggage there before official check in for £2, which was a great help.

There is a small control panel (not sure what for) that has a green light on it in the room. This meant the room wasnt properly dark, but didnt cause a real issue.   Windowless room, gets very hot and stuffy. Need to ask staff to alter aircon settings so you can make your room go colder. Had to have it on all night which was a bit noisy.
Staff very friendly and efficient. Good value for overnight stay.

Perfect location if you want a decent hotel without the cost of staying at a Port Aventura hotel. The Dorada Palace is a pleasant 15 min walk away from the theme parks. It is also only 5 mins to the beach.
Restaurant food is lacking in appeal but is edible.  This was the most disappointing aspect of our stay at this hotel but certainly not bad enough to prevent us staying here again.
Perfect location for what we wanted.  Friendly, clean all facilities as promised.  We will definitely go back

Quiet garden with pool although pool very cold .nice sitting out area for meals.buffet food mostly good.design of hotel is attractive . Rooms quite spacious and good value for money,particularly half board.Worth taking even if eating out occasionally.
Standard of food and service can fall when there are groups in the hotel.centre is a taxi ride away and requires bargaining for fare.
- Almost a 10 minute walk from the city center  - Lovely Indian restaurant (Bombay Masala) opposite the hotel  - Friendly

- Pricing was ridiculous - I was asked to pay extra for the internet, which is not acceptable in 2013 !!!  - Breakfast was average - limited choices for vegetarians  - Overall pricing is high compared to competitors (within ½km radius), i did check
Fantastic location! Apartment was exactly as described
None! But could do with cereal bowls in apartment as had to use a cup! Restaurant was closed as visited at end of the season - but these are just comments for hotel to see, certainly not negatives!
No own private beach
It was a perfect gateway for me and my partner-removed from the hustle
The only problem was the access card when coming back into the  room took minutes to open. The toilet
Quite near to Kuah town and Jetty. Ample of parking space.

The room not vacuumed especially the sofa and carpet floor. The breakfast was nightmare as insufficient space to sit (some forced to eat standing) and run out of food easily. We skipped the 2nd day breakfast as no place to sit.
The rooms are big but looks a bit old.  Food was good and serving time was good too. Swimming pool with children facilities is excellent
Minimum kitchen facilities. No cutlerries. Should have door mat or slippers.

The food was great. i especially loved the breakfast as there was so much choice.  The hotel's located in a very quiet environment surrounded by nature making it ideal as a getaway from busy city life.

I was very disappointed with the  the reception staff as well as their Manager handled my booking. They could not verify my booking stating that there had not been any information exchange between themselves and hotelopia. In fact they claimed not to know about hotelopia and so suspected I had not made the payment. My family and I were made to wait for over 45 minutes before we could be allocated a room. I was very inconvenienced and never even got an apology for this when they eventually verified my booking.
Low speed in the room with internet connection
Good price and breakfast. Tidy though small. A number of restaurants around.
Staff do not speak English. They are not attentive and professional to customers' request.
Lovely rooms , sweet staff (very nice cleaning ladies), plentyful breakfast. Loved staying there!

The MUSE Pub on the ground floor was pumping out music at full volume on Saturday and Monday nite when we were trying to sleep 2 floors above. The music could have been half the loudness. We had a 4am flight to catch on 5/11 and as a result of the MUSE club got very little sleep. I would not stay at this hotel again.
location and friendly staff
unfortunately saw a cockroach in the restaurant and in-room
We found the staff really pleasant and professional.
convenient location   helpful staff   clean room
internet charge applies  room tax, additional 24 euro not disclosed at time of booking

A little far out of Dubrovnik.  Staff would ask you to vacate dining room when food service is over, also when having a drink on the terrace our glasses were taken from us and we felt obliged to leave the terrace area as early as ten pm.
Clean and very professional and serviceminded staff
Had booked 2 two bedroom apartments and only 1 came up on check in front desk staff took quite some time to find another apartment and did not explain what he was doing while i waited.
The staff is very kind and helpfull,

This was our 3 stay in this hotel but also our last. Is seems as there wasn't anu maintenance since last year, it is is overall in a poor state.   After a week our bed looked cleaned, but it wasn't clean...we got bedbugs...!!!  (Yes, we became another room without any discussion.)  The breakfast wasn't good as before, it was everyday the same, Not enough yoghurt, only a few days some fruit but not enough for everyone. Coffee and hot water should be available during the hole day,,,often cold and the water was like coffee...
Near the train station with many restaurants around. Nice staff. Nice bathroom.
Very bad reception from the receptionist. Not helpful at all
Really value for money even though the hotel is quite old. Even they have a bathtub in the bathroom. Will definitely stay there again,
Quite far from the town centre
Fabulous position, beautifully maintained with exemplary, courteous and attentive service.    Fabulous!!
impractical. No shelf in the bathroom and a microwave in the kitchen. No irons and ironing boards.

Staff were more than helpful and very friendly, nothing too much trouble  Room was very large and clean, with good views.  Plenty of wardrobe space and separate toilet from bathroom was ideal.  Ideal situated right next to beach and shops and restaurants. Within walking distance of most places.  Breakfast times were brilliant from 5am-11am.

The lift doors did not give you chance to get in or out, especially with a wheelchair, and on a number of occasions doors shut and had to go up to the next floor before getting to relevant floor.  No coffee or tea making facilities in room, Breakfast was varied, but all food was only luke warm. Normally most hotels serve you tea/coffee at your table but not here.  The pool was absolutely freezing so therefore unable to venture into the pool.  No entertainment or information on hotel facilities, only facility was pool. Would not rate this as a 5 star hotel.
No positive revieew i will recommends no body lives here
very dirty room, and dirty floors, no value for money, no air condition and when asked about it I was told that all rooms do not have a/c. no good breakfast, nothing nearby.
Horrible, dirty, smelly, noisy, depressing dump.

Baggage handling excellent from taxi to check in.  We arrived early, thus room not available for several hours which is a bit of a drag, however, is understandable.    Once room available after 2 hours, all went well.  Mine was a quiet room, thus no complaints.
I believe in this day and age, wi-fi facilities should be available in all rooms, and also at no charge.

Stayed at Cay Beach with my 17year old son for a 5night self catering holiday. Hotel was very good, clean and with good facilities. Staff at reception were friendly and very helpful.  I haven't rated food as we were self catering.  Only comment to improve facilities would be to extend gym opening hours beyond 5pm to 7/8pm when we would have preferred to use it.
It's cheap, and the location isn't too bad. The staff are friendly and quite helpful.
Some of the staff were amazing.
Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff.
It is close to Cenang beach, looks new and have wide car park

Room insulation is not good, could hear people spoke loudly. Got mosquitoes in room. Pillow provided is limited and room not big. Breakfast choice was horribly, like eating vege only, till have to go out cross the road to take local food. The appearance of breakfast also not attractive, not worth for money. If want to stay this hotel, better take without breakfast, do not waste money. The service in room also slow, requested for making up, until 6pm also did not clean up. While towel not being renewed. When request, staff said not yet dry and will send later. Till check out also never being delivered with new towel. Not a good hotel, discourage.
Location (close of shops, RER Stationa and Disney Shuttle Bus Service)  The One Bedroom Units are good for two people (not for four)
The Studio rooms are cramped  The Studio Beds are settee beds
Good location, Close to the old town.. Spacious and clean rooms. All in all a good hotel.

The day I arrived Hotel got a booking from the office in Bangkok said that I have only one room booked which definately wrong. I made the reservation 2 weeks in advance for 2 rooms with 3 adults. For some reasons they got me only a room and the hotel staff do not capable of fix the problem.
Fantastic food! Much activities all day round.
The hotel had a fresh modern appearance. It was conveniently situated 10 minutes walk from the central station and in close proximity to many of the key sites of interest.
Marble in the bathroom and near the hot drinks facilities in the room could have been polished more vigilantly.
Fantastic location value for money nice Bailinese hotel with very friendly smiling staff. Will stay there again.

Great location, easy fast check in, read some reviews on line that were very picky. We were very happy with our stay. Stayed during Melb cup week. The place is slightly dated but room was nice and big and clean and comfortable we were very pleasantly surprised. Would definitely stay again.
Lift a little slow and some of the bulbs behind the buttons broken
The facilities were good and the environment was excellent.
Upon Arrival at the reception, the staff ignored us for awhile before speaking without lifting up their heads to welcome us. i found this annoying as it is suppose to be a 4 star hotel.
Although old and a bit tired in places, it is a classic beautiful building.
Staff varied from upbeat and polite to downbeat and polite.
Is a long  out of the city centre. Hotel would not order us a minicab either

Really nice hotel in a silent sorrounding, away from the centre where you can rest and enjoy the beauty of Falesia Beach. Good connections to main roads if you want to rent a car and travel through Algarve. Friendly staff, clean rooms, cheap price for accommodation - everything's perfect!

Really nice hotel close to the centre, but where you can rest and enjoy the beauty of nearby beaches like Marinha. Good connections to main roads if you want to rent a car and travel through Algarve. Friendly staff, clean rooms, cheap price for accommodation - everything's perfect!

Great value for money. Near to the beach, Wallmart (if u need 2 buy groceries), city centre and shopping mall. Friendly staff, complimentary breakfast. Clean, freshly decorated rooms; fridge in the room.
Very small swimming pool area but hotel supply u with beach club entry in Cabo Villas. Try it- it's great...just take some id in order to rent beach towels.
Location,quiet area,sun all day if you get a room facing to the south/the sea.Value for the money.
Not up to date facilities,you have to pay extra for wi-fi,television.Lack of maintenance. Furniture is worn,bad and noisy beds.  Some traffic noise around the pool.

I was very impressed with all of the staff they were helpful, informative and very happy professionals. The room was very well appointed and the bed probably the most comfortable I've slept in. The continental breakfast was excellent with a superb selection of fruit.  Only slight grumble was the lack of fresh vegetables for my personal taste on the dinner menu.  Many thanks for a wonderful stay
Charged a daily fee of $14.00. Ridiculous just another  to rip people off, I got in at 1a.m. And left at 7!
Loved the rooms as always when I stop at the Raddison Blu with a good view of the river

I have only given a score of 3 for value as the room was acceptable for a city centre hotel but the car parking was very very expensive £20 per night. In future I would look for somewhere else with either discounted or free parking when visiting Liverpool again.
Simple, but clean room. Really nice and helpful staff!
Perfect for a weekend stay, central location with most things within walking distance.  Staff very professional and helpfull.   When back in Dublin we will be staying at this hotel again.
Very outdated. The current were dirty. Stains everywhere. Even when the maid cleaned she kept the dirty sheets on the bed.
Lovely view over the harbour
Too many stairs , carpets  badly stained in rooms, hotel needs upgrade to be class a 5 stars
Food disgusting. Lots of foul mouthed contractors boozing it up. Poor on-site parking.
Hotel is outstanding, so futuristic. I recommend the plasma room. I didnt comment on value for money due to bar prices.
Ridiculous expensive bar. £37 euro for 2 gin n tonic.   Mini bar in room has a great selection but only if your willing to pay a fortune.  Go to local supermarket
staff friendly, tried their best to help and please

I have read some bad reviews of this hotel, but found no real problems. Room was spacious and clean. Television was quite old, and not many channels available. Bathroom ok. The breakfast included was fairly basic; if I remember properly, think it was 2 eggs
good location, spacious room, well equiped.

Had a room in basement - very poor signage which was irritating but not a major issue.  Bed was of poor quality, it creaked badly all night and the mattress was uncomfortable, pillows not good either - attention to these issues woudl tranform the experience.
The best hotel ever

The hotel is really good location for Disney as you can catch the ART buses to Disneyland.  It's two blocks away so it's easier to get an ART bus pass.  Good location to food stores as well.  I was really impressed about room size.  It's a really good value hotel.  They can even look after your luggage on your checkout day as well.  I would definitely recommend staying there.
The only negative about the hotel is that sometimes the hot water takes a while to come through to the west side of the building.

Excellent location if you don't want to stay right in the city centre. Very close to metro station just around the corner. Also very close to a very large shopping centre called Diagonal Mar which had many different restaurants on the top floor. Rooms are of a good size and very clean. Will definitely stay here if I return to Barcelona.
-Breakfast staff and bell boys helpful and friendly.  -American breakfast good.  -Great view of downtown and southbeach (our room).

-A/C is noisy and wakes you up in the night when auto activated for cooling.  -Also unidentified noise from the outside which resulted in a sleepless night. Request for other room was granted and second room was less noisy from the outside.There seemed to be no real understanding at the frontdesk about the noise complaint. Therefore I consider this issue not properly solved.   -Rooms need to be renovated to meet the high standard Hilton quality.    Complaints were discussed with Front Office manager. Renovation seems to be scheduled for next year.
10 min. walking to the train station, near to Little India.  Comfortable, very clean, nice pool, nice gym.
Very bad wifi, really bad.

-As a guest of this hotel you can use the beach facilities of the Ritz-Carlton beach resort using a shuttle service.  -Self parking facilities as well as valet parking.  -All staff friendly and helpful.
location is good, and BF is good.
Staff was very helpful, meeting all of my requests efficiently and competently..  The breakfast buffet was exceptional.

Being right across from the train station was great. They also provided us with a transit pass and good information. English wasn't a problem. Breakfast was good. Hotel was clean. Switzerland is expensive so good value for money is relative.
Quiet and comfortable hotel. Wireless internet available in the lobby and restaurant.
Basic breakfast was very expensive. One member of staff at checkout was unfriendly.
The location was briliant, close to everything and very easy to get around.

The musty mould smell in the first room we were given,requested a change of rooms and the first 2 front counter staff were very unhelpful. After waiting 2 hours for them to get back to me I finally escalated to the duty manager and we got moved within 15 minutes.  The second room was nicer but the bathroom was very small. The whole hotel has a musty damp smell all the  through it.
Very friendly and helpfull staff. Good cleaning of room. Nice rooms with plenty space.
Entry to parking place quite difficult.
Great hotel in a good location with an ace concierge called Marina.  She was enormously helpful and recommended two excelent restaurants.

Have just compliments thoughts to convey reachability of this hotel everything from service to the supply of food and dryck.Bra facilities for kids with water park and games room with various games and bowling.Hade a great family vacation.
Value for money. friendly and helpful staff. Convenient to city centre
Takes a while to get the lift
Warm staff, easy communication, efficient service. Breakfast opened earlier for those of us with very early flights.
Except the rooms everything SAS nicej
Hard and bad beds
The hotel was comfortable and the room we were in had 2 sun-drenched balconies; breakfast at the other hotel was plentiful and delicious as usual
Stunning view from our waterfront apartment. Handy for eating places and bus stops to Valetta or up the coast.
Very clean, pleasant and helpful staff and the rooms were really comfortable and well presented, they had everything that I required. 5/5

Very friendly staff. our seavieuw bungalow was excellent and we stayed there fot the third time. Candi Dasa is a perfect place for exploring the real Bali . There are several good restaurants and White sand beach is lovely and only a 10 minutes drive from Candi Dasa. The hotel has a nice pool with seavieuw to relax.
Great Location for Nia and Canal side
None really

This hotel is definitely not a boutique hotel. The pictures on the website are a far cry from reality. This hotel is in dire need of a renovation. It is NOT worth the USD 150,-- per night. I was very disappointed and will not stay there again, unless they do an entire overhaul.

The hotel is amazing! It is an incredible building and setting and you feel to be set back in time. The staff was very friendly and the food was very good. All in all a very nice stay - almost like in a fairy tale.
The rooms are a bit outdated. One can say it fits into the flair, but they could do with some new refurbishment.

I booked well in advance and got an excellent rate, especially as it included breakfast.  15 minutes walk to the NEC means you can leave your car in the carpark and not pay the NEC rates.  Breakfast was good, decent selection and the hot food regularly replaced.  Free Wifi was decent enough.
Lovely spacious hotel, friendly staff and great location for NEC.
The hotel was lovely. Very friendly, yet professional staff, lovely clean rooms and lovely food, an excellent breakfast.
Excellent value for money and right near the MetroMover station
Location is good.  Some of the staff are very formative, but some certainly need more training.  Future guests should be informed that the Princess

Although the rooms were very clean, the bathrooms are very very old.  I had trouble turning the shower on and also the water wasn't going down the drain.  I had to call housekeeping, who came to check and in turn had to call a plumber to rectify the situation.  Internet very poor and non existant sometimes in the room.  This should not happen considering its part on the daily Resort Fee charge.
Pretty clean, cheap, warm welcome, convenient locations
Room not well maintained, night stand had shelf half hanging off of it and one of the beds coverlay had stain on it.

Hotel rooms are definitely not 5 star.  If you have stayed at other 5 star all inclusive resorts you will definitely be disappointed with Ersan Resort.  Rooms are small and claustrophobic feeling.  When I arrived it was raining and food was serves separate location to drinks which was one floor away I was told to go get my drinks myself.    I made a note in the booking that is was our anniversary nothing was arranged.  When I mentioned all this to customer relations nothing was done.   Food there is alot of variety but nothing worth eating as it all does not taste any good.  Not all water slides were open and the ones that were were a rough ride.    Me and my family were very disappointed with this resort.

Poor Hotel Room, reasons:  1) Small room  2) Bathroom door would not close  3) Went to bed at 10pm the first night, could not sleep due to - 1. The noise of the next door shower being used. 2. The noise from the toilet flush in the room upstairs. 3. The noise from next door. I GOT TO SLEEP AT 1.30AM!  4) The next morning 9am, I was woken up by painters in the lobby outside my room (loud talking and joking). I asked myself who at the hotel (management) authorised this painting and decorating at this time in the morning!   5) No pen and pad provided. I expect 4* hotels to provide a pen and small pad in the room. Kensington close seems to be an exception, when I called guest services the lady kindly advised the hotel don't provide.    I spent a little over £200 for a double room two night stay, I expected something in return!.    Dont spend your money here, go elsewhere.    I won't be staying again.

Santa Isabel was the first of the small private hotels in Old Havana.  It is situated in Place des Armes, which was the first square to be built in Havana.  It is absolutely in the right place.  The open courtyard (which does not have music constantly playing unlike some other places) in the centre of the hotel is a lovely place in which to enjoy a drink and the bar is excellent with prices that are normal for the area.  Almost all the rooms have a patio and look  the square, which has a daily market of second-hand books (in many languages) and other memorabilia. I really cannot think of a better place to stay in Old Havana.
Good location close to the subway.
Breakfast : You could barely finish eating before you were asked to go
Thought the breakfast was pretty good and not a bad variety of food   Handy to the train line   affordable
centrally located to kl sentral and monorail station

old fashioned rooms - stained towels -lousy breakfast - worst of all on check out we were asked to wait while a security guy went up to the room to check if we did steal sth. like s/o would steal their dirty towles - disgusting!

* tax charged at the end of our stay at hotel (4 euro per person/day), no clear information about that at accomodation time  * no bar at the hotel; after breakfast ( after 10 a.m.) no possibility to drink tea in the hotel; coffee from vending machine at main lobby only
Excellent hotel no faults had a brilliant time would recommend highly.

Good beds, nice clean room, breakfast is OK, very close to Blue Mosk, Aya Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. Quiet street. friendly personel, very helpfull. The roof terrace is very nice to have breakfast with a beautiful view!
just a suggestion, breakfast could be more international maybe. Not veryebody loves olives, tomatos etc. in the morning   bathroom smells a little, I think this is a general problem
nice hotel,   beautiful view sea,and city  good food,  nice staff  good location
things outside urgently need to be refreshed (seats and  more parasols at pool), stairs to sea, platform, utilities downstairs near the sea

Ptarmigan was perfect. We were visiting from Australia and the position was central to everything and everywhere. Staff were lovely and helpful. We will definitely be back. Thank you for a perfect holiday
Nice beach, nice room in bungalow
Too many drunk people, also seen one puking in swiming pool
was in a horrible room with no view, claustrophobic. Expected massively more from a Radisson
Great spot and the reception greeting was great.
the exhaust fans did not work correctly and no clocks beside the bed.
Clean and roomy accommodation, friendly staff
Nothing negative
Great central location in Maputo. Staff are very good and friendly.
Nothing. This is good value for Maputo.
Staff very welcoming
Reliable Lifts would be really good

Rooms and bathrooms a decent size, and our room request for twin beds was accommodated with no issues. Superb breakfast and very efficient, courteous staff throughout the hotel. The location is excellent with some great eateries close by.
Even though the hotel is on the older side, some areas particularly in the bedroom are a bit shabby(particularly the woodwork)
Had wonderful stay in hotel, staff friendly and v efficient  Will definitely be back :)
Underground carpark is not fun!!!
Great location for all parks. Good parking. Great views over lake. Nice big pool. Helpful staff on desk and ticket sales desk.
Only got cleaned once. Were booked for two cleans but second one never happened.
the bus transfer (free) from the hotel to the city and back, and also from en to the airport!  the friendly staff.
the rooms are very noisy, you could hear the neighbours speak and do other things...
A very nice and clean hotell.  The rooms very good.  The breakfast, we did not miss anything on the tables!  If we og to Warszawa again we will use this hotell.

I'm never the kind to give bad reviews but I would not feel right with myself knowing information and not sharing it. So I will break down each area:  I've been in many of resorts and I am accustomed to all of the fees but just be aware that you will pay a resort fee ($18.00), suite tax (3.00) outside of the base prices and all other taxes that were included on the site. The problem I have is paying a resort fee that goes to the property but isn't maintained as well as a 4 star resort should be maintained. I paid a suite tax towards a suite that had water damage on the ceilings, dirty grout on floor and shower and a refrigerator that I couldn't use because if I break the seal to store personal items, you will be charged. Also, just be prepared that on top of all that they hold 100.00 on your card and not released days later. so you pay 200 total plus a night (discounted price) for a suite that is outdated, an elevator that reaks of something indescribable and parts of the grounds that's not kept to the standard of what it should be. I've honestly had a better room and stay at a regular hotel for less than what I paid this weekend. I'm still disappointed 2 days later.
£100 security bond fee is ridiculous considering the overall cost for the night was £49 between 3 of us.
Great staff , Great hotel, Great location nice and quiet definitely nice hotel to relax.

my only problem here was the room service glasses weren't polished which had water marks which didn't  look good. Also the sliver cover to keep the food warm had the same water marks it seems like they never polish them. plus my morning breakfast was cold.
excellent staff. very clean with the maid service everyday. Excellent location and excellent pool facilities.
Outdated and in need of an reburbishment
lots of prizes and great cost for food at buffet.
smoke smell is very heavy inside the casino.
Good Hotel with a very convenient location. We took the free shuttle to KLIA then a 10 Ringitt express bus to KL Sentral for  dinner in Little India. We will use this Hotel again.
Beautiful lobby. Rooms were nice with comfy beds and pillows. We had a nice view of the pool and the golf course. The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

We had bed bugs in our bed!!! I felt itchy the first night. When i woke up the next morning I saw a bug and killed it immediately. I called housekeeping and they sent someone who collected the bug and put it in a plastic bag. They said they would change the sheets and fumigate the room. I wanted to change rooms but unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked.  I still felt itchy the following nights. When I got back home, I counted 34 bites on my body, which was located mostly on my arm and neck area.  I didn't expect this from a 5 star hotel!!!

You have to climb 3 flights of stairs to get to the front door of the hotel  Some staff members were not pleasant to talk to  Breakfast listed as 7-10:30 but they were never ready before 7:30 and kept us waiting with no apology.
Nice hotel in a good location.

There was something wrong with the floorboards. They were incredibly loud so when the people would walk in the room above me, it actually woke me up. I could even hear it through my earplugs.   I was also disappointed to not have a bathtub.  They also did not follow their own towel policy where you don't wash them if hung up. I find this annoying as they claim to do their part for the environment but they don't really...
Great price for place that is no frills but still relatively comfortable. Good budget choice for those wishing to do it cheap.
Its pretty old and worn out
Breakfast is only bacon and egg and some toast! No ham / cheese at all.
The hotel was clean and the location is near enough most areas around Union Square that you can easily walk 4-10 blocks to find some great places to eat and event venues.
The room is quite small, pricey, and very few amenities. There was also dust in the air that made it a little difficult to stay in the room for long periods of time.
I booked a family during midterm break when we arrived no family room available instead they gave us 2 rooms.
DREAM HOLIDAY    During our stay (26 october-3 november), every single day of our vacation has been of sun
Very comfortable 1 night stay, easy reach of the airport.
Crockery mugs and plates would be better than polystyrene when heating up soup!
It is not good that WI-FI is extra in a business hotel. That was the only negative point.
Very convenient location for quick Metro access to Kiev City Centre.    Comfortable beds.
Clean Room, good services, nice food
Location. Does not have any malls within it 1km radius

we have stayed at the hotel several times before and understand that it is a two star hotel therefore our expectations have been according. the rooms have been clean and the staff always friendly and willing to help. we use the hotel as a weekend getaway.

after this weekends experience we will defiantly not be returning again!!! the room was small, no bath, bathroom was dirty the carpet full of tea stains. there were tea making facilities but no tea bags/sugar or milk. the noise from the toilet flush/shower from the room above was incredibly loud (louder than the ones in our own room) which kept us awake during the night and very early in the morning. having stayed several times before this will defiantly be the last. we were left wondering if these rooms were allocated specifically for the hotelopia as it was the first time we used this site. i do hope not!!
Had a problem with room allocation ( booked 5 but only got down as 1 ) but soon resolved, excellent staff, spotlessly clean, relaxed atmosphere, breakfast plentiful and relaxed, will be using again

Delighted with our stay in the Carlton. Finally we've found a hotel in Dublin that we actually like! Staff delightful, room perfect, and about the same price as other hotels that were nowhere near as pleasant. We'll be coming back here.
Good value for money in central location
The lunch and breakfast were very good

Despite asking 3 times had  1 milk despite 3 people  in room  No towel and facecloths  Stinky drain in basin and bathroom is open plan  Extractor not working in toilet   Outside seating sofas filthy, I wouldn't sit there.  Although in decor industry not impressed with complete look of hotel, my son asked if we staying here  because  its cheap as iindustrial look a bit  shabby

I have to give top ratiung in every category for this hotel. Whilst the room was clearly "budget", they are priced accordingly and are therefore excellent for the money. The customer service: this is a family run hotel and the husband and wife team made us so welcome. They were always helpful and friendly and I felt they would do their very best to make our stay a good one. We had a first floor sea view room with balcony, and with the marina and the mountains outside this was lovely. The Eolo is at the very centre of the town, so several restaurants and cafes were just a few steps away. We came on a cycling holiday and the owner was happy for us to lock our bikes up near the reception desk; he was also interested in and encouraging about our rides!

Nothing is negative about this hotel given the great service and price, however guests should decide what they want from their hotel. We wanted somewhere very central and at a good price. Central means some road noise, some noise from people when the bars turn out, and also noise as the street cleaners work in the early morning. All this is fine by me as we want to be at the centre of things, and we enjoy the smaller independent type of hotel. If you want quiet, go for an out of town hotel, of which there are several. You may get bigger and better rooms, a pool, and many more in-house facilities than at the Eolo; you will also pay a lot more and have to walk/bus/taxi into town.
Parking was very convenient and was in a good location? Receptionist on 2nd was slightly more friendly.
The hotel reception were not very welcoming when we arrived.  During the night my boyfriend was unwell and receptionist would only give me 1 small bottle of water which I had to pay for.
bedroom to hot and when opened window was very noisy were at front of hoell
Great ability of the staff to adapt to the guest demands. Good quality standards. Very convenient hotel IF you have to attend any event in Yas Island, only IF.
It might sound silly but not having automatic doors to get into the hotel in the outter layer it makes the guest a little difficult to deal with the baggage and the glass door
Amazing hotel ! Great view, location, nice staff.
Clean, spacious, modern, convenient location, friendly and very helpful staff.
Nothing negative at all
first time I have stayed there. from checkin to leaving all staff very polite.rooms very clean
It can be a bit noisy as the walls are quite thin and the rooms either face the bars area or the main street. No sleepers neither gowns in the room.
friendly staff , clean and modern hotel in a convenient area within walking distance to Camden market and the tube station . Overall a pleasant stay and would definitely return in the future .

Very convenient place for shopping in Leeds. Love the swimming pool and leisure facilities. Staff always pleasant and helpful. I have been many times before and probably think that this is the best hotel to stay in the city centre of Leeds.

To be nit picking I found the decor in the rooms somewhat dowdy. I suppose it was chosen for a businessman's stay, it was very masculine, and there were a few grubby marks on the wall.   My biggest bug bear was the restaurant. My 2 daughters and granddaughter arrived for breakfast. There was no one to direct us to our seats, so we just sat down, and waited, and waited, so we decided to just help ourselves as it was a buffet, but we still wanted tea and coffee, which required someone to serve us. We had to ask 3 times before we actually got any.  We came to the conclusion that if we were down and out in Leeds this would be a great place to come, because nobody asked us for our room number for payment. As it was we had already paid. There needs to be someone in overall charge of the guests when they arrive, and that they are attended to. There weren't any plates, the cereal bowls ran out., it just wasn't properly organised.  The breakfast however, was very good. The fried eggs were very nice, which is difficult in large quantities.  Just not organised properly.
Great location for shopping, visiting, airport. Very friendly and professional staff. Ideal.
The room had a great view of Downtown Disney and Epcot.  It is an easy walk to Downtown Disney.
The room we had a funky smell and the carpet hadn't been vacuumed.  Also, the beds are double, so they are small.
Good price for room, but I eoyldnt probably go for updated rooms if staying for a week

when we arrived the receptionist welcomed us at the door in a friendly and welcoming manner. everywhere was clean. I was made up with the fact there was parking.   single rooms are a tad small but they suited us as we only needed a bed to sleep in as we were out all day and gone straight after breakfast. the twin room was good size but my son found the ceiling and doorways a little low as they were in attic but again they were very clean.

breakfast was ok, but we were disappointed that a full English was advertised but it was only a sausage an egg rasher of bacon some beans and mushrooms, cerial was available and there was fruit juice toast.tomatoes and hash brown would have bulked out the full English.
This Hotel is located about 20 minutes from HEATHROW  AIRPORT Terminals 1,2,3 BUS 285.  Terminal 4
Hotel is in process of renovating some floors.

I booked double room n I given twin room, room was not cleaned, including bed shit, wash room was extremely dirty n no heater or ac working n bad odour in room, floor tiles was not clean, toilet in very bad condition   I won't recommend this hotel I saw some nice n clean hotel near by beach  Never go to this hotel again

Our room was very clean. They made special accommodations for a family member with medical issues. They did a great job. Parking was good. Good hotel for Anaheim convention center. The staff is very helpful and accommodating.
It is a small hotel, so the fitness center, pool were small. The staff were young and slightly unprofessional, but very helpful and accommodating.
Lovely room with balcony overlooking beach. Inclusive breakfast was lovely! Evening bar guy was very friendly and helpful.
Aircon in room was very intermittent, had to ask reception to call maintenance twice.
Attention by staff excellent at all times.
Water not always hot enough for a bath in early evening.
The rooms need makeover
Central, easy to. Quick check in/out process. Quiet room despite being in the middle of Broad Street.  Value for money.

Breakfast  - eating area was only a little better than a Little Chef and if you have been to one of those recently thats not a high compliment. When I phoned to ask about car parking the receptionist found it hard to explain how to get to car park, kind had to figure it out for myself.
warm and friendly on arrival, helped with all my needs, nice to have car parking provision, even at £5.00 per night was money well spent
the restaurant has funny opening times and not much of a menu
Very new with nice design
Noisy air vent. But staff tried to do something about it. But all rooms had problem
Very cheap price, and there is everything you need.

The staff were very nice and very very helpful.  The location was great for wandering around, not far from the center but parking still available.  Breakfast was good and the pool looked nice although we didn't go swimming.

If you're looking for character, this probably isn't the best choice.  Also if you're a light sleeper bring some earplugs because sound travels like crazy- footsteps on the tile floor as well as water in the pipes.
Central location , well organised hotel and food was great
No air con in hotel so need to keep patio doors open at night . Often woken up by noise on the street in the early hrs .
Good value, decent location, ideal for access to central Dublin and the Aviva Stadium.

After reading some comments I was a bit worried until I arrived there the hotel was very clean rooms were lovely and we were greated with smiling faces and booked in with ease restaurant staff were always helpful and you could have a laugh with them.wine in restaurant was brilliant you serve yourself out of bottles which was really good tried to book for two weeks in July but was told fully booked no spaces at all hotel must of been 3/4 full and yet service was not altered
Very clean and fresh. Contemporary decor. Felt safe and secure (the city is very dangerous, do not under estimate!). Fellow guests are professional respectable people.
Very close to NEC, Birmingham International Airport and Train station. Hotel has ample car parking facility. Also, has a good restaurant.
Ideal location for stay before our cruise. Near to cruise bus pickup point. Short walk to La Rambla and easy metro access to other points of interest. Very helpful staff.
We were on the first floor and the only view from the window was of a  high quadrangle of walls and windows of other rooms so felt the need to keep window
good location
Nothing is hoped ... except sleep.

I had a happy stay. The room was small but I only spent the nights there. I slept with an open window.There was no excessive street noise which kept me awake. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise - quite a variety.  The location is good - near the central city and near transport routes. I found the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful and will surely recommend this hotel to other travellers.
Great Hotel and for my 2 day stopover, excellent location for BUs services to/ from HEATHROW Airport.  Train to London.  Hotel located 20 minutes from Airport on 285 bus from T3.
No omments
Close to railway station - about 20 steps door to door  Extremely comfortable bed  Clean room of adequate size  Efficient reception

Be careful when parking - hotel car park is NOT well signed, even though I was given instruction by reception I accidentally parked in station parking area and had to pay (an exorbitant sum!)  Might have been too many staff in the breakfast room so actually less efficient service than it might have been - things were cleared away before they were finished!  Coffee was brought to the table ready made in a cup - no choice given as to style of coffee preferred  Two faults in room - very noisy bathroom fan and room centre light not working
good value bed very confortable shuttle bus to airport

Hotel staff all very good . All polite and helpful . Hotel location was great and easy parking at rear .  Rooms adequate allthough small and breakfast was excellent quality .  The hotel had a lovely feel about it being a charming old building with lots of character . A beautiful real fire in the reception/lounge was always alight creating a warm cosy atmosphere . No major complaints at all .

No negative reviews just a few suggestions . At breaklfast the tea/coffee service was slow , NOT the fault of the restaurant staff , perhaps leave a pot on the table for the guest . Also i was carrying alot of luggage due end of trip abroad , very difficult negotiating lots of stairs to room .
Ideal location for everything! Easy to get to shops
The only negative I have would be regarding a towel which we had in our bathroom it had dirty marks on it.The cleaner was informed
The day excursion to Pretoria we asked about at the concierge desk suddenly moved to a higher price as we started the tour the next day.
I work as a manager on duty at the intercontinental hotels in the usa this is the worst hotel I ever stayed in my life

Amazing hotel. Looks like a little village. To all reviewers complaining about staff-moodiness, don't forget that morocco has a tip-culture. You have to tip the hotel staff, it's a sign that they do their work right. Staff was fine to us. Room was spotless clean. Cleaners cleaned the hotel every hour. Perfectly clean. Pool area was nice. Great value for the small price we payed. We did not expect it to be this good considdering the price and the fact that it's in a third world country. So low price, still so perfect. We feel amazingly lucky with having stayed here. I recommend it to all!
Close to shopping and attractions. Helpful staff. We received a warm welcome and found the hotel to be ideally situated for shops, entertainment and restaurants.
Safe and clean.
Need to improve the housekeeping scheduling.
Room and bathroom are spacious and everything functioned The beach, although you have to cross aroad is great.
Staff seems uninterested Diningroom is depressing. The whole buildingcomplex is not in a shining state.
Excellent location and great value for money
The only remarcable things is the restourant: not so bad....
Cleanliness completly absent...no room structures maintenace...  quality-price is 000000000000000000
Nice staff, perfect location
Strong wifi connection even thought we were out of the hotel.
Check-in and check-out could have been a little quicker with less waiting time.

I guess this is cheapest hotel in Varadero, its close to beach, bar 24 is down in the hotel and there is also store across the street. For this price you got good room and breakfast. They dont know how to prepare good food, but that is all around Cuba (mostly)
Rooms are smaller than I expected and little dark, but except that it is good place to stay.

Absolutely perfect location on the 'golden mile' for eating and drinking out. Pool view rooms much more preferable to mountain/street view rooms. Love being able to hire pool towel and get a nice clean and dry one every day, saves on the packing! Also love being able to choose to sunbathe at either Med Palace or Cleo Palace pool depending on whether you want activities and games or peace and quiet. Free safe in room a nice touch too.

Rooms need a complete makeover! They are nowhere near 5 (or even 4) star standard. Maybe back when hotel first built 25 years ago, but not up to modern day standards of decor or facilities. All furniture/bed linens/drapes need updating, old style tv's need replacing with flat screens, fridge should come as standard in 5* hotel rather than having to pay extra. Overall, they just need a complete overhaul-looking v tired and dated and need to be brought up to date with what you expect these days when booking a 4/5* hotel.

The hotel is excellent, facilities and staff are excellent. Foid at breakfast and in the restaurants was simply excellent. The value fir money is excellwnt and I thi k they have the best hotel rooms in Malta.    I would recommend rhis hotel to anyone.

the cleanliness was superficial,  I took a shower to discover hairs which were not mine. There is a church directly opposite some rooms, the bells ring every 15 mins. It may be worth requesting to be located away feom these if you are a light sleeper. I complained and was mived the next day.    I have marked the food down as in my final morning I ordered breakfast in my room.  The cooked breakfast was dreadful and the presentation was poor!     The staff on the whole were great, courteous and efficient. Ive marked diwn purely because I dont think the service is quite what I woukd expect from 5*.

There was a fridge in the room but no kettle or facilities to make yourself a cup of tea, the only facilities were drinks machines inthe downstairs lobby. The beds were wrapped in rubber covers making them very sweaty to sleep in and it wasn't even hot. Very poor 'continental' breakfast.
Very good access for the NEC Exhibition Centre
Very helpful as we were leaving before breakfast the following day. We suggested a continental which only included cereal and toast
Maybe put on website what time breakfasts start as we missed out    We suggested a continental which only included cereal and toast
Excellent Hotel.   Nice large room with well appointed bathroom.   Great breakfast  Spa
excellent facilities good entertainment great location will definately go back
Great hotel very close to radio arena for an event ,superb
Room was extremely clean and prefect for one night. Nice big power shower. Room bit on the small side but honestly who dances around their room anyway?! Would stay here again. Good location.
Great location  - right on the beach, use of the two restaurant pools, and connected to kartika plaza
Very tired room, awful colours, faded, mouldy, dirty. Shower not work properly. No soap.  1 star should suffice this property.
The hotel is as you would expect, its clean, comfortable, friendly service
If i was going to put something negative it would be that the hotel room has very few facilities but for the price i wasnt expecting more

This is a great place in which to stay. And especially for a first time visitors for safari's. Good grounds, nice facilities and things to do. Breakfast, dinner and one game drive(morning or evening) per day were included in my rate. Other options available too. Very convenient. The restaurant is great. Buffet. Good food and a good view. The Hide was fantastic. With some patience I saw Elephants, Zebra, Kudu, Wildebeest, a warthog, birds and small lizards all in one afternoon. The game drives were real good too. Two thumbs up on the Kwa Maritane.
Facilities in the room. Nice patio for breakfast
Too far from the city centre for a city trip... (About 15 minutes on foot)
Best situated hotel in cordoba, next to mezquita en close to restaurants and shops.
Nothing. Tip: park your car at the other site of the river for free and walk in 10 minutes to this hotel!

We had a rainforest chalet, which was situated very well, giving us complete privacy, so that we did not have to draw the blinds - I love looking out on nature! The room was very clean and spacious, and it had all the facilities we needed, including a fridge, so that we could buy some drinks, keep them cold, and sit out on the balcony and enjoy the peace and quiet there before dinner. Perfect!

Getting the shuttle bus back and forth from our room was annoying, especially if you happened to forget something, but really only a minor setback - I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to family and friends.
The hotel whilst outdated was very clean and the staff were very attentive, in particular the waiters. They were excellent.

This was a bit basic in terms of food choices and the rooms were quite in need of an update. We arrived late and went for a swim and the pool is very poorly lit for evening swims. Also our corridor smelt very badly of a strong chemical smell - took your breath away when you opened the door. For a few nights it does the job but for any longer I think it's worth spending a little more and going somewhere less "cattle" like

Hotel very central to locations in legian. Staff very friendly and polite and accommodating. Room was very big and bed was huge. Never had such a massive bed. Like two double beds together. Balcony spacious all with pool view. Was very happy with hotel. On day of booking out (12pm) I was extremely ill. Staff were very helpful and let us stay in room for longer until I felt better to travel to next destination. For this I appreciated their concern for me and helpfulness to make it as comfortable for me as they could. Thankyou.
Breakfast was adequate but for price we have stayed in other hotels with more selections and variety each day. Was only thing I found as a negative but not a biggy.
