Friendly receptionists and housekeeping staff.    A sufficient amount of shower gel in the bathrooms; unlike some hotels that insist on providing miniature bars of soap that dissolve during the first shower.

The lighting is not sufficient. Fluorescent lights are needed in the rooms.    The carpet in the whole building needs to be removed; it is dated. Wooden floors would be more welcoming and hygienic.     The insulation in the room was horrible because of the old wooden windows. I suggest that a glass screen needs to be added to keep the draughts out.    The bathroom needs to be heated since it is a bit of a shock to the system to leave a relatively warm room to go to a chilly bathroom to use the toilet.
Nice hotel, very helpful and friendly staff, right next to the beach with lovely views, good value for money

Excellent hotel, well located in a quite area. But close to everything.  Friendly staff, good breakfast. Large, clean and very confortable room.  Highly recommended hotel.  We had a wonderful time.  Regards to  staff.
Nothing to point out.

The good thing about this hotel is mainly it's central location. Quick access to the subway and city center - possible even on foot. People at the check in desk were helpful and nice. The room clean and equipped with a TV and fridge. (this is about Convencion hotel in Madrid)

On the flipside it was quite expensive to start with. No WiFi in the room in this day and age is a complete failure. To use the internet you need to go down to the main hall for WiFi or pay 4 euro per hour to use the PCs that are located in the same place. The hotel needs refreshing - especially the corridors on the upper floors as there are stains on the carpets older than the piramids.  (this is about Convencion hotel in Madrid)
Nice staff. Very clean. Nice and big balcony.
Same food for both lunch and dinner and everything tasted the same. Old rooms with some parts falling apart. Lunch started at 1, we thought that was to late.
Good rooms and very good location for business and shopping.
Only spent one night there and the electricity got cut off twice in the evening and took them quite a long time to fix.
I would give a -5 for the above and advice guests NOT to choose that hotel.
Good location, good staff, quote good value for money    But rooms nice and clean
Great location at the lakeside.
Rooms very old and the look is 70's
More than friendly staff, clean rooms and pretty central, great value.
if you dont mind shared bathrooms this is perfect.

close to the center of Corralejo, 5 minutes away from the bus station to move around the island and from the touristic harbour to go to Lanzarote, it's the right place to stay both for surfing or not. A very nice place with big confortables rooms, there's also a swimming pool, but you'll always be on the beach! :)
Very easy to book and use very nice hotel lovely rooms

Simple, clean and everything worked. Great location for shops etc. breakfast is simple and possibly the most efficient system I've seen. It's self service with everything clearly labeled above sections so you don't have to go back and forward. Lovely eating area. I felt quite happy even though I was on my own. Staff really nice and friendly. I used bag storage and this worked perfectly. I've already booked for my next trip.
Outside area around hotel is not as nice as others. If you get past this bit it's perfect.
Very comfortable hotel and  room, nice swimming pool. The food in the restaurant was super. .

In the centre of Old Havana - which now has had a lot of buildings done up.    Note that the Valencia is connected to another hotel.  Checkin, breakfast, and reception were done in the Valencia while my room was actually in the connected hotel.  The other reception was unmanned.  We were told by our guide that all these old buildings are being done up and managed by one of the Government Agencies with the money we spend being used to continue the restoration of Old Havana.
Very nice and friendly staff that made us feel very welcome, especially the manager. And we would love to come back to one of her studios, or this in particular.
Very good location. Perfect balkony

The rooms in the tower building are great, spacious, with a balcony and geat views.  The Manager took ownership of the issues we had with our check-in process and the quality of the rooms we were initially allocated to.  The qualityof the food in the restaurant is outstanding, enjoyed the live entertainment at the bar too.

We had sent emails with requests and questions to both Hotelopia and Moana Surfrider, months  before we left. Neither responded which was disappointing.  The check-in process at Moana Surfrider was a poor experience, trooms not ready, no accountability for not responding to emails, even blamed booking through third parties. The manager took ownership and we were very happy after our rooms were changed to the Tower Building.    In the traditional building, the rooms are very small, with no balconies, not a great experience for Hawaii.  I don't recommend staying in this building,    I would stay there again, in the Tower Building and book direct, they took no accountability booking through a third party.
Great location. Easy to find, great value for money.

Was not properly instructed about parking, took a while to figure it out. Lights in the room weren't easy to operate at 2 in the morning, should have been told at reception that they were not the standard room key card type.
Good airport hotel, no problems would stay again.
Things were clean and fresh even with the age of this grand hotel!  The persons working there went out of their  to make us feel welcome and were helpful in every .  Great stay.
Nothing negative
Location location location  Waitress, luggage staff and male manager were super friendly.  Food delicious.

Way over priced, the location is awesome but a thousand other properties there also have that view. The rooms need a serious refurbishment.  Never have we met a more unfriendly female hotel manager. Did not make us feel welcome at all.
nice location, nice building, easy parking, friendly staff (we're in Cuba!)
Brilliant location, service and rooms all at a reasonable price.
Fantastic food at the restaurant (a la carte) and friendly, proffessional staff at the hotel. Great location, in the middle of the city centre, within walking distance of the night markets etc.

Not a high end 4/5 star hotel- the rooms appear to be a bit dated. We had gone for an upgrade to the executive club and had access to the executive lounge- the pre-dinner drinks and canopes were disappointing (compared to those that we have experienced in the Far East). Not value for money considering the cost of staying at the hotel.
New, slick, with great management. Wonderful welcome, fab room
Niggly negatives like - why hide the ground floor bar away? Lifts take too long to come. The room cards (which you need for the lift) needed to be revalidated frequently (very annoying).

This hotel is in a central position in Ubud and has all restaurants and shops outside this resort. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is basic but nice. The pool has a nice outlook over the rice fields .         The WI FI worked in our room. Overall  the resort is a good relaxing place to stay whilst in Ubud. Would stay there again.
The staff went out of their  to be super hospitable . I travelled alone (lady) whilst visiting friends, and felt safe and welcome. Wonderful, can't wait to go back!
located at the old town  big swimming pool
dated room furnitures and equipment

Ideal for Business Trips as the hotel is very close to the airport. Hotel offers Shuttle-Service. Very service orientated and friendly staff in all areas as reception, bar, restaurant. We were very surprised about the excelent food in the restaurant.
We have stayed at this hotel quite a few times,and always find it good.also very accessible from the station.
Rooms are looking quite tired now could do with a make over.
Clean and tidy.
Swimming pool closed.  Small bar, always empty and closed very early.  Very old building.  Staff was unable to provide guidance apart from the very basics.
Good value for money if you are looking for a reasonably-priced bed for the night in an expensive area. The breakfasts were excellent.

The hotel rooms are somewhat 'tired' and could do with refurbishing.  The carpets weren't vacuumed during our 3-night stay but the beds were clean and fresh towels were put out every day.  For the price we paid and the amount of time actually spent in the hotel, overall we felt it was good value.

I have stayed here a few times, and it's been just OK. Rooms not that clean, and staff a bit rude, but great location!  But the last time, I had a CONFIRMED reservation with acknowledgement from the hotel, and when I came at 3:00pm, they told me they had no room and they were overbooked.  They wanted to put me  down at the end of the soi at their dirty sister property, the Royal Asia.    How can you rely on a hotel that doesn't honor a confirmed reservation, at 3:00pm nonetheless!!  I spoke to the manager over the phone and he basically said too bad! Really unprofessional.

All staff is very gentle, the hotel is very good located. There aren´t a lot of people so it is comfortable.   The beds are ok (not good, not bad), the air condition functions well.  The wood behind the hotel is beautiful.
The bath is small, it doesn't have pool, but you can use the pool of 2 hotels that are located 1 block (club almendares) and 5 blocks (Hotel Kolhy) away.

The hotel is within a 5 minute (if that) walk of the station. It's off the main road so everythig is close by but it's quiet. The staff (on the day shift anyway) were very helpful and polite. They made us aware of all the facilities available and made check in and check out fast and hassle free. The room was small but very cosy. Perfect size for a couple or friends staying for a short break. There's hangers with the wardrobe, a kettle, a tv that actually works how it's supposed to, shower gel. even a dock station so everything you need. I always stay there and I'm always happy with my choice.

although reading some reviews on this hotel and being surprised that some people were disappointed with the customer service, I have never really had any problems however on my last visit it was finally brought to light why people felt this . The staff that served me during check in and check out were extremely polite however after a night out to a restaurant. me and my friend returned to the hotel and as we walked through the lobby the people at reception stopped us and questioned our presence by asking us hat we're doing at the hotel and if we have a room. They even had the cheek to ask us which room we are staying in and after that they just went hm alright. not even an apology or a polite approach. It was as though they were trying to imply that just because we're young we couldn't afford it... I found it extremely rude and offensive. But it was only 2 members of the staff. The rest were extremely polite. Doubt couples would have any problems just youngsters, be prepared to get interrogated aha.
A lovely room and very enjoyable dinner.
central location, accomodating, access to wifi and a computer, good breakfast buffet, great decor
Good location, 5 mins walking from Bayswater metro station at nice, ellegant and quiet street. Comfortable bed, generally quite place outside the windows, luggage room available.

Lack of adapters in reception that almost caused 3 days without mobile phone. When we asked receptionist for some help, she sent us to some shops in the city. In 4* hotel, I would expect something more, as well as free water. Rooms are nive and fancy, but they might have more space at this price.
Good value, nice room, friendly staff (except for one at reception), decent breakfast.
A little noisy. Situated directly at a busy intersection does not help with the noise level.

1= No customer care. I requested three week before arrival to arrange pick up from air port. no body even replied my mail.   2= I have forgot  my SAMSUNG MEGA cell original charger in room. I would appreciate, if I get it back.
The decoration of the room was very attractive. Very good design that creates warm feelings. Also the room was big enough and very clean.
It was beautiful and probably one of the best hotel I've been to.
Lovely hotel, well situated, nice staff, great breakfast, enjoyed our stay
The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and customer focused. We can not fault the hotel on their customer service

The hotel needs a definite refurb. Very dated. Damp on floors and furniture,swimming pool was so cold we couldnt get in it. The sauna had wood from the 1800's. No obvious reception from the outside, wandered around not knowing where to go. I felt it was a great shame to have such fantastic staff in a fantastic area with a hotel that was crying out for some tlc. Lovely area,lovely people but the hotel standards let it down

Great hotel; well located and generally clean and well presented.  Front desk staff excellent and always greeting nicely.  Very helpful and accommodating.  Room was clean and as expected; free use of safe and wi-fi.  No real complaints just the odd tweak as below would push to 5 for all.

Breakfast is limited to continental style;   Toaster is a bummer! We have to wait.  Would be nice if kitchen staff were ALL in uniform rather than casual tee shirt as this is otherwise a 4 star hotel.    Guests have to pay for use of leisure facilities.  It's my opinion that should be free for guests staying there.    This was our second visit there and again booked in March for a further stay.
not all in
Excellent food,-a 50 years celebration - ,suited for children, very beautiful pink sky when we woke up and a nice view from our window.

We had booked a family room, supposedly sleeping 4. There was one double and one single bed. There were no other rooms available, and no trundle beds. We had to squeeze the kids into a single bed. We received an apology and were told we would get a refund. I gave full contact details, never heard back.  Air conditioner outside window went on and off all night long, with an audible thump every time it started.
Very good Location. Clean, very quit. Breackfast until 12:00.
Very small bed room
Nice hotel, clean well decorated room and friendly personnel.
The clock on the wall didn't function. Merely a matter of a new battery I guess.
Very friendly and helpful staff  Clean and tidy room  Good connection to the underground  Close to bars and restaurants

On arrival I was surprised to be given a double upgrade to a spacious 1200 square foot oceanfront suite with a separate bedroom and two full bathrooms.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  A wonderful stay.
Parking not within the grounds
Awkward entrance when arriving by car right on a very busy junction and no onsite parking available.
great location,helpful staff
Great all round experience. Good hotel for business travellers with own transport.
Not located in touristy area so more suited for business traveller.
The resort is superb...I enjoyed my stay there and would recommend it to my friends as well...keep up the good work guys...Cheers
We stayed here because it was 2 mins from ikea... Great location
The room was a bit shabby, chipped doors etc the heating wasn't on and there was no extra blankets provided
It´s very well located, very close to edgare road where theere are many buses throughout London.    Bed was quite confortable and good shower.

There were problems with heating in our room. We were given an electric radiator, and staff the first day denied there was any problem at all.    The english breakfast is very peculiar: just bolied eggs, cheese and toasts. Forget any other usual components of an english breakfast!
Nice to have the free of charge guided walking tour of the Alfama neighbourhood
- location;   - the garden and the pools;   - the view;   - activities.
- same breakfast everyday;   - unfriendly reception staff.

A great hotel for a shirt trip to Nice. The staff was fun, gentle and nice but not very useful. The room was nice, very cool old style (vintage design), beautiful pictures on the walls. The whole hotel is a nicely equipped villa with a lot of french charme. The only minus point was the temperature in our room. Since weather turned worse it got about 10° C outside and below 18° C inside. badly isolating door and windows.
From the moment we walked in everything was great staff rooms foods.
Lifts are a little confusing.
Awesome Hotel, would totallly recommend it!

The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The hotel had a very good and clean surface and the rooms were cleaned daily. Gym facilty was amazingly good to be at a Tunisian hotel. I was very happy with that. Short distance to the Marina was a good thing too.

Food is so and so... Not a lot to chose from, but taste was okay. They did although have a few problems knowing what kind of meat etc they had. Saying that some meat was turkey when it actually was red meat is bad! Also the fact that room keys (cards) had to be recharged more than once during a week stay is not cool. Some rooms had more problems with the key than others.
The hotel is situated close to Kensington park, Paddington station, close to bus stop of bus 23, which goes to Liverpool station
The hotel does NOT have a storage room, so if neccessary to leave the luggage for some time, it can be left ONLY in the hall, unattended, the hotel staff will not be responsible for it.

We'll positioned in queen street.Valet and concierge service high standard however the room was very bad with Air conditioning unit not working and positioned straight opposite a pub .Despite telling staff I was not happy about it  they really did not care and telling me that they could not do anything about it as they were booked up (a bit p.. Off when you have booked for 4 nights)

Poor room opposite a pub withA/C not working for 48 hours . Asked if could  be change to another room no sympathy from front reception saying they were all booked up .Knowing that I have booked 4 nights at a premium price  ( exclusive suite) I felt very disappointed and would not call that good service more an we do not care attitude.Regarding the A /C unit after complaining to reception and felling like I was a moron because I could not use the A/C properly as per instruction they send me a technician and guess what they needed to change a part of the unit .After changing the part all was ok for A/C however no sorry or apologized from reception for being Ina 38 degree room most of 2 days !!! not Happy
friendly staff, lovely large  quiet room, really comfortable large bed.good quality towels

Cleanest and most inviting jury's inn I ever stayed in, rooms were spotless cosy and warm. Staff were friendly and very helpfull especially the bar man we met from cork. Great location in the city Newcastle just 5mins from central station.

Stayed two nights in November and only sampled the breakfast which was great. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. Fresh towels daily and a great location from which to travel in to central London.

We were in the downstairs bar having a quiet drink when a wedding party descended on the bar.  The staff rescued us from the scrum and really looked after us when they didn't have to which helped the wedding party and us.
good hotel and location for nightlife and shopping
Lovely Hotel...Got engaged and they give us a bottle of buddly on the house. Expensive but worth the money.
Well trained professional reception staff, Location and size of room,
food and facilities, lack of training of restaurant staff
Didn't seem to be a phone in the room. Very small point and had no need to contact front desk, but would have had to leave room if I did.
Amazing view on down town Mahmutlar and the Med.Sea.  Staff very very friendly.  Quiet rooms/environment.
Quite a distance away from the main road and shopping centre.
Very friendly staff, a nice room set in a beautiful garden and an astonishing view on the two-color river from the two restaurants
Bathroom was very small and not as clean as I would have liked but it was usable
Parking is a little difficult (take your car away) and expensive.
Excellent location and beautifully presented.
Floor Dirty. Bathroom shower broken, Air Con Could not control. TV Not working properly. Food Terrible will never stay there again
Excellent service by staff. Smiles, professionalism and efficiency. Two thumbs up!
Rooms and facilities in rooms are dated. Limited TV channels. Time for a renovation and upgrading job?
Located in strategic location ... Near to beach and easy to get food..
The Comforter is stained and the floor mat in the toilet is dirty...there is no sound proof.. There's a couple  Arguing in front of my room for 30 minutes and we can hear what they argued clearly

This hotel was fantastic. The staff are very friendly, hotel location is perfect....everything is right on your doorstep. We ordered room service twice and the food was gorgeous and reasonably priced for Moscow although the portions could have been a bit bigger. The room was superb, very comfortable bed, very big room and nice and quiet.  Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if we went to Moscow.
Nothing negative to say about this hotel.
Spotlessly clean.   Friendly staff.  Ideal position for beach, shops and restaurants.
Rooms were cold at night
Location is convenient.  Food is better than expected.  Suffice it to say, totally money worth.
Clean room, friendly staff, good location

The internal soundproofing is not particularly good. I was in a room next to some young girls and perhaps they were a little noisy but in fairness, you could hear them talking at a normal volume as well as hear all their music and doors opening/closing. Wooden furniture being dragged across tiled flooring could be heard very often and often woke me up / kept me awake - god I sound like a moany old man! This was my only complaint!
Breakfast could be improved, but I'd say it is high average quality for Cuba.

Great hotel. The staff were very professional and friendly and most spoke English. We chose the location based on ease of transport to Yongpyong and access to Lotte World.  The bus to Yongpyong left from outside the hotel. Every question we had about Seoul were answered by the concierge staff, brilliant. The hotel presents as 5 star, the room was very comfortable and a good size. I would recommend this hotel.
None about the actual hotel, Lotte World is over rated. If you have been to Disney World, then Lotte World looks like it is lost in the 70's.
This Hotel is in an excellent location on Legian Beach.  Easy for shopping massage and many good restaurants!  I would stay here again:)
Really nice room, very comfortable bed. Staff really friendly.
Accessible, clean, has good food, staff were professional, and rooms were capacious.
All was perfect: the staff, the breakfast, the rooms, but most of all, I was feeling like at home. If I will return to Krakow, this will be my first choice.
Good location, very friendly staff, clean and tidy.
Very noisy due to heavy traffic to the main beach. No free Wi-fi.
Lovely location with a great breakfast.
Additional charges for parking.
excellent location. pricey, but all Kilkenny appears to be concerning accommodation. staff fab
I have stayed there more than 8 times this year and still have not received a loyalty card after applying 3 times???

The Deauville is really well located on the Malceon, close enough to the sights but far enough away that you can get away to relax. Roof top pool and bar = great after a long sweaty day in Havana! This hotel was really well priced and one of seemingly few mid price options. Havana has lots of expensive fancy hotels and some questionable looking hostels, so this was a great in the middle option. Would definitely stay here again.
Not fancy, but that wasn't what we were expecting for this price!

they charged me MAD 40 as taxes even though when booked all charges were included.  They would not listen to me and insisted i pay the tax.  you may take this issue with the hotel so others are not affected

Bad booking and follow up arrangement by Somerset Olympia Makati.  I booked and prepaid the stay at Somerset Olympia Makati for 2 nights, however, when I checked in, they told me only 1 night stay was confirmed; the hotel was fully booked and not able to offer my second night stay.  And they would made arrangement and transferred me to another hotel.  Somerset Olympia Makati had no confirmation for the transfer arrangement until the very last moment around 2pm of the second day afternoon; and without any choice.  They then transferred me to Berjaya Makati Hotel which is located in a not convenient location, and the hotel quality is not good.  But I had no other choice at such last moment arrangement by Somerset Olympia; very bad arrangement by them.
The resort has a lot going for it.  Great location.  Great Staff.  Great Food.

It is as if the management has deferred spending on the resort until the Marriott group moves in.  Not enough beach umbrellas or shade provided for the lounges.  Old wooden based lounges and mattresses need replacing.  Beach side staff not proactive in taking orders for food or drinks, etc  Beach towels need refreshing.  The two restaurants basically have the same menus for lunch and dinner, if possible it would be good if there were greater variety between the two restaurants.    The resort is doing itself a disservice by missing out on a range of small things that take the gloss off a truly 5 star resort.    We thoroughly enjoyed our week at the resort as none of the items listed above really took away from the positives the resort offers. My comments are more aimed at little things that hinder it being a 5 star resort.
Excellent location. Very handy for the NEC, rail and airport.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Charged for parking but £7 for over 24 hours was great value.

they Take me two times money from my credit card and do not like give me back this money. They propably never give. I pay for hotel by Hotelopia but not accept this and I pay two times by hotelopia and this another compny   So please find some solution for this and try to force them that thay give me the money back. Also no english this polish people. Also they do not know haw to service for 5 star hotel. They mast go to Asia to lern little for service to coustomers
Good service from entering the door on our arrival until we left. Staff very helpful and friendly will stay again
Good central hotel with helpful staff. I would stay again
Currently in the middle of a large amount of building work.

Nice place,very central,very friendly staff,special special Yasin and Ebru the help us in everythink we ask.The pool it was fantastic and warm!!! Also the person who is takecare the pool,sauna,gum he was very kind and very proffecional.Thanks Time Hotel for nice holidays!!
No really just the next time i hope i will have better view room.So preety Ebru the next time 701 room and no 702!! Thanks everybody there

I help my family book a Pool Villa x 2 room , ~they don't speak any english, air conditioning off automatically at the mid-night, non-stop switch for about 30 minutes before repair. they order BBQ package service... BBQ package food not same in the menu (no prawn) , because there have VIP book the private party. Also hotel have a big problem~ before i send the email ask the BBQ service , they reply mail did not say anything will affect the BBQ, my family order 4 price BBQ package, they say because have a vip private party, they will pick up the food to room, but hotel give the Total rubbish FOOD for them ,this hotel provide have a soup,rice to my family. Totally not a . BBQ package food , and then the staff say does not charge a one BBQ package price, this hotel totally rubbish. I think hotel lied to us..this hotel not value 5
Good value for money. Friendly staff. Very accommodating.
Rooms are Very Compact. One can still stay there. If you are very particular about the room size then this is not for you.
Very friendly and professional staff. The bed, pillows, shower, aircndition and mini bar is good. Close to the BKK airport. 7 eleven and bar right next to the hotel.
Poor soundproofing. Slamming doors woke me up several times during the night
Be sure to read about hotel parking policy very expensive

This hotel is really fantastic, both in terms of location and of luxury. The room has some really cool little touches that we didn't expect given the reasonable price of the hotel. It is located right in the city centre, not far from Raffles and the marina. The hotel lobby is something to see, particularly when you look up and see the atrium stretch up beyond where the eye could see. We only stayed here one night on our arrival prior to leaving on a cruise and would happily have stayed longer. We have also stayed in the Marina Bay Sands and the rooms at the Pan Pacific impressed us much more! Will definitely be back.
Really good hotel, a long-ish walk to the centre but an interesting one. A very enjoyable stay in a hotel with a charming character and very friendly and helpful staff.
room,parking service, staff all good,bed was really comfy
Close to Queensbay mall, which was the main reason I chose this facility.
Apartments look dated and needs an urgent makeover.
Lovely hotel the standard of our room was exceptional, modern, clean
The hotel is in a fantastic site right in the centre of Madrid ,2 mins away from airport bus stop - 5. Euros from the airport and really regular service a real positive
I read reviews and they mentioned small lifts but that was my only negative  and the position right in the centre far out ways this one fault
Just a Great Place to stat in Vilnius. Free WiFi and TV Channels from many countries with different languages.

Its pretty nice hotel and clean equipped with a shopping complex around the corner but the problem is very limited parking space and small. My opinion is that, since it opened until now, this hotel is already well known in and outside the country, especially Brunei, why we did not think to add or make more parking space with more sophisticated facilities for visitors who want to stay overnight?

About the negative reviews, I have a little problem with 'Air conditioning' in the room. It is not cold at all and I feel unhappy about it... But I did not know whether it was just 'air conditiong' in the room only or all rooms in the hotel.    I hope the hotel management would be able to monitor the air conditioner in the room. For the record, I stayed in room 1510 on 16 November 2013 and I can not slept well that night because I felt uncomfortable at all that night.
Operator's responce was kind and on time.  Doorman activates  quikly.
Friendly and helpul staff  Very close to Sawgrass Mills  Free parking  Free wifi  Fridge and mucrowave in room  Nice beds  Indivudual setting A.C.  Free baby cot.  Very good iron and ironing board.

Full cover carpet in room and all hallways, why? Room therfore unhygenic and smells of damp cloth.  Fixed shower tap (no hose and handle), how to get a proper wash off of soap?  Noicy fridge.  Limited space for bagage, only one foldable suitcase rack.
Very modern and nice hotel. Professional and service-minded staff. A super conference hotel. A nice pool and a lot of space for relaxation.
A bit too long trip to center of London. You have to understand the system of trains and underground very well.
Very good position.
The beds are uncomfortable. Poor kitchen.

If you are happy to walk around half an hour to the centro this is a good location as right near port area and bars/resturants. The staff were accommodating. The twin seaview rooms were spacious and great views.
The rooms were neat and tidy.

I specifically booked this hotel because of the outdoor pool on a beautiful sunny adelaide weekend.  I was bitterly disappointed to find a note on the door of the pool saying it was closed.  I spoke to the staff about it and said how upset i was.  It was due to an unbalance in the pool, the staff seemed to be trying to balance it but it wasnt happening.  What i dont understand is why wasnt there a note on  the booking form for this hotel to say the pool was out of order?? and why wasnt a professional called to fix the pool. I will never stay here again!!!
this is my fourth visit to Honolulu in the last five years, and have stayed at two other hotels , and this was the best for living space. I felt safe and secure , as I was by choice travelling solo

I thought the $15 a day resort fee, should only apply if you wished to avail yourself with the services offered, as I could not work out how to use the DVD entertainment system , I feel I wasted $210.
Staff welcoming and helpful.

A bug bare for me was no plug sockets near bed to charge phone or laptop and use them whilst on bed.  Bathroom floor looks great in slate but very very slippery when wet, pretty but not practical.  If I had children I would have been concerned.  Basin plug was permanently closed even when pressing plunger to release it, I fixed it myself by adjusting screw at end.  Bath plug the same but no release plunger present at all, I had to use credit card edge to release plug from hole.  Light in hallway not working was completely dark at night time used my key ring torch.  Room 21 was ground floor almost opposite main entrance, no smoking inside building so all smokers used pathway outside entrance opposite my room, as a non smoker it was the worst part of my stay it stunk the room out.  For a 4* hotel I've stayed in better 2* to be honest.
great value for money, given the location and ease of getting to and from Sheremetyevo airport
It is a great place for someone who is looking for tranquility and rest.  The owners and staff make one feel very welcomed but at the same time, respect one's privacy.  I will return, definately.

I've stayed at the Metropolitan for 6 nights. The room was clean and it had everything I've needed (mineral water and coffee are provided). I've had a problem with the internet and when it was not solved I was given another upgraded room. The staff was very helpful and nice, especially Jinam at the front desk, who really helped. When I'm next time in Toronto I'll probably try to book this hotel first (if the price is right).

thank you wery much for esenhotel the is hotel wey nice  staf wet frendly nice  room good price  good location   the is hotel 24/h free driking hot and cold driking  the is hotel better my  house  realy room sea view boshphorus  very clean room same catagori  room anodher hotel  it is very expensive
The staff at this hotel are really great, probably one of the best things about the hotel.  They are good humored and very helpful.  The food is expensive but very very good.

The breakfast was not good and very over priced at £17.95.  The free shuttle bus to the airport was also a bit of a disaster.  We waited over half an hour.  The manager was not very helpful pointing out it was a free service but it was advertised as being available and one of the reasons we had booked this hotel.
Location is excellent if you're going to spend time near the beach road

After reading some of the negative reviews about this hotel I was a little concerned. We found the hotel room was large,comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and I would not hesitate to book again.
Very helpful reception staff, and driver
Poor breakfast,  out of fashion hotel need some renovation,
This hotel is amazing! We loved everything about it, the staff, the location, the rooms and the facilities.

This is an amazing place. If you are looking for a piece of paradise away from crowds this is the place. Staff are so gentle and genuinely nice.  I spent 4 days there with a friend and on my last day staff made me a cake as they found out it was my birthday.  If you are looking for some great food near by be sure to eat at Warung Apple best place to eat in Lovina and prices are unreal (Really Cheap)
Great airport hotel. Kind and enthousiast personnel.
Great value for money and the location is excellent for walking into town.

They make you give your card details on arrival even though you have paid for the room. I asked why and wasn't given a satisfactory answer. It turns out there is a mini bar in the room. No mention of the requirement of card details on booking so I was annoyed with this.
Very friendly staff and beautiful poolarea.
Not free wireless wifee in rooms, lobby and poolarea, a big minus. Little variety in breakfastbuffet.
power water,location
the room is small and a little crowded
Counter staffs are very helpful and professional. Hotel location is convenient too. Maybe hotel management should consider to start their renovation plan. :)
Very clean hotel, fantastic food, all staff very friendly and helpful

the atmosphere was pleasant. The hotel does have character, you could say grandeur crumbling at the edges. The double room was very spacious, furniture was all antique and the bathroom was a fair size. The women at reception were all very friendly and went out of their  to be helpful which could not be said about the male receptionists. Breakfast bar was excellent.

The staff in the breakfast room were not up to speed at all. Every morning I ordered cappuchino which I only received half  through my breakfast. Also the background music in the breakfast room was the same CD all week - trance music?!

Very welcoming staff. Everyone from the receptionists to the assistant food and beverage manager was helpful and polite. It is an older hotel but very well maintained and the views from the deluxe rooms were superb. Excellent swimming pool. It is one of the few hotels we have encountered lately where the room is made up early morning. We return regularly and always enjoy our stay
Nothing negative to stay. We would highly recommend this hotel

All staff were very helpful and my stay in this hotel suits my needs perfectly for business visits - I am very happy to book through Hotelopia again on the basis of the most competitive value offered for loyalty of custom.
High level of service, warmth and professionalism.  If I ever visiting Jakarta again this would be the place to stay.
Well equiped room. Location is central. Close to shopping  and close to U Bahn.
Night shift staff are nice and helpful   With lift elevator
Day shift staff are impolite and not willing to give help  Worms on the wall  Construction site near hotel and noisy until 12mid night

Lovely,friendly helpful staff make this hotel a "must" for those who value a homely feel over a more polished standard of presentation. The big,comfortable rooms are in need of a face lift but then...so am I!

You can't fault the Tabaiba centre. We had a top floor studio apartment at the back and it was fantastic. The room layout was functional and the balcony had sunshine all day. We didn't use the free shuttle service as it was a nice walk to the shops and beach. The staff were friendly and the resort was quiet and relaxing.
Staff very good. Position excellent,rooms and linen ckean
Very nice hotel 4 stars are well earned!
Excellent location. Nice big rooms with big windows and views. Very comfortable beds and pillows. I stay there whenever I am in KL. And still will as I am comfortable there.

Bit disappointed in the staff this time. No-one to help with bags. Arrived early because of last minute flight change......unlike many other hotels I have stayed in, they were unsympathetic although I had flown all night with no sleep they made me wait till 2pm although there were many people checking out and I offered to pay extra.When I expressed my disappointment they were nicer and more helpful.....but still had to wait!
In a great location, the staff are very helpful and friendly, room was comfortable and warm, {we were there in november}
Cant complain about anything as you only get what you pay for

We were upgraded to a suite on arrival, staff are very helpful and friendly, great location within walking distance to Times Square and Empire State Building, plenty places to eat nearby. We had a pleasant night in the hotel lounge, the two Irish guys were very nice and friendly.
The aircondition unit could not be closed and there was always a draft blowing through.

we stayed for a week the hotel is a unique piece of history and very pleasant, the room facilities TV, fridge,cooking equipment ect are a little dated, rooms are always clean staff are friendly hard working and polite, we had a harbour view which was great entertainment, we recommend the seafood bake night on Fridays it is mouthwatering and takes place on the quayside in front of the hotel, we didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar as we were out and about, but we can recommend the mad mongoose Falmouth harbour (5 mins walk) for food and drink, also if you are looking for a nice beach (15 mins walk) pigeon beach,and if you are adventurous take the number 17 bus from the gate into St john's for the day, all in all a great stay, Brenda and Claudy on reception will help in any  they can "lovely people"

Stunning hotel and location, very well designed for relaxation, beautiful surroundings, exellent and friendlly service,staff could not do enough for you, exellent food with show cooking,unforgettable experience.
Location of the hotel is excellent very central, with in walking distance to shopping and the main square. Staff were friendly and always helpful.
Breakfast was good and plentiful, the only complaint is the fruit offered was not ripe enough to eat and the eggs were very salty each morning.
Staff were very courteous and professional on the reception desk.

Woken up early by scaffolding work and paint removal, nothing usually wakes me up but even the light fittings were shaking. Nothing the staff could have done but would have been nice to know in advance as I would have stayed somewhere else or for the works to start after 9 at least.
Clean, good shower facilities reasonably priced
Basic but ideall for overnight stay
Situation
I thought the hotel was in the perfect place just walk out the door and your 2 minutes walk from city centre
My room could have been cleaner. There was a lot of dust around

Staff not very friendly, room not up to standard , beds are old and noisy , This was the 2nd time I tried Mantra hotel , and If this is the type of service I will get , then I wont be staying or promoting it to friends . Iam a bussiness man and I travel a lot .
Nice layout inside, with a mini-garden
Nothing good nô activité everything out of order
Realy bullshit hôtel nothing good u realy loose your money if you go There
Atmosphere. Staff.  Sunbeds on beach.
Well situated for our trip to haddock park racecourse. Friendly staff.
Nasty odour in room which staff said that they would investigate further. Food and drinks were expensive, but no alternative venues nearby.
Simple and quick check-in, good sized room, fantastically comfortable bed, very quiet and relaxing night, good breakfast
bathroom slightly dated, shower a bit disappointing
Bedspread grubby and window looked out on scruffy yard with rubbish which could be tarted up without a lot of money
Beautiful apartment, very nice helpful staff especially the security staff

The car park is so huge a map showing my parking bay would of bee a nice touch. When entering the building from the marina side they e are not named and look the same so had difficulty finding mine. The exit out to the front of the building was on level 3 but this wasn't marked on the lift and I wasn't made aware of this, the security guard had to show me.

The staff were all friendly and very helpful. There is no safe in the room but the safety boxes at reception were free to use. Everything in the room was in working order and the additional space of the suite makes the stay very comfortable.

Excellent value for the price.  Staff are smiling and attentive.  The bed quality is very good.  Food served 24 hours which is great because I arrived after midnight very hungry.  I enjoyed the gym, pool and jacuzzi.  I highly recommend.  Internet surcharge though is high.
Rooms need a complete renovation!
Excellent location, well placed for earls court and Olympia just a few minutes walk away! Massive tesco next door so you won't go hungry.
Room tempature a little cold wen with additional heaters, difficult to find cutlery (it's in a secret drawer under the dishwasher)
Stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious and comfortable. The food is very nice and fresh with plenty of choice.

Whilst it didn't really bother me, the staff aren't overly forthcoming, particularly in the restaurant. It could for example take time for a new table to be set or someone to take a drink order.  Also the pool is extremely cold and I hardly saw anybody using it, probably for this reason.
Excellent Very attentive and helpful
Food could be a little better
Clean rooms, good staff and a good breakfast.  The rooms are good and the location is perfect.
Good location but not to be confused with Jury's Gateshead.  5 min walk from train station.  Great value for money.

Very close to beach, to shops, bars, very good swimming pool. Fantastic place - may be little bit used (compare to 4* hotels in EU) but for this money very good! 3 years old child was sleeping very good - actually I was afraid of noise, the others warned - it was very quite, may be as we had pool view rooms we did not hear the noise. We all were satisfied with living in playazul and we will return there next year for sure. The money we spent for rest of family of 5 persons for 11 nights was the same as for 2 persons in 4* hotel for 6 nights.
Lovely hotel on the seafront with lots of shops and bars nearby. Beautiful top floor rooms with plunge pool very nice.

Got to the hotel and was advised it had been over booked and we had no rooms even though we had paid and had booking confirmation and they transferred us to another hotel - 15 minutes away from where we needed to be with the rest of our party!!!!
The location of the hotel is good, close to medina and there is also a pharmacy across the street.

The service was very bad, everytime when i ask about something they say 'NO' to me without explanation, also the food was not good, really i stay before in 2* and 3* star hotels but the service was good and the food more better then in Zodiac. I don't want to come here again
Rooms immaculately clean and well equipped
Booking in procedure was very slow and drink prices in the bar were very expensive

Ideally located for everything in Birmingham City Center. I stayed for shopping and night out and was happy that the Hotel was walking distance from the shops and nightlife.  It was clean and the room was very spacious. Great value for money.
Huge area with variety of facility
Arrived to the hotel at midnight and got a room that smelled mold and had windows open only   8 degrees in the room tried to change the room directly, but it could not be fixed for the next day

I like it very much and have lived by You many times.  I should live by You, KOKA, in 3 march, 21 one nights. Booking ref: 6453768. I really would like to live in the mainbuilding because it´s very dangerous outside the small KOKA-buildings in the nights.
Its ok for one or two days no more .... Location is allright other  wise nothing spécial....
No facilités att all no wifi and no service att all .... Even breakfast i had to put many on it even though i hade it included .....
The room was exceptionally clean and spacious enough. The food at breakfast was great as well.
The connection between reception and cleaning staff wasn't always excellent.
Great Hotel, staff very attentive. We got a free upgrade to a junior Suite with a jacuzzi bath which was a real bonus.
Would have like tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Some of the evening entertainment was a bit naff.   The Spa was not included for guests and was expensive.

The staff was very friendly and very helpful the stay at the hotel was wonderful I really enjoyed it the breakfast could have been a little better but over all it was worth the money. Would stay at  tropikist anytime again
Excellent friendly hotel. Extremely clean with good service  and good food.
Lift out of order.  and no telephone in room . felt quite worried if I should have needed help during the night..   Traveling from the M42 I found getting to the hotel a but tricky.
Was a great stay, food was divine and the service was excellent.

Its close to everything, palace, plazza mayor in 10 minutes on foot  and pouerta de sol is 2 minutes on foot. The hotel is in Gran Via and next to it is big dipartment stores like cortes igles, fnac, food chains, restaurants etc The room was very clean ant the staff very helpfull highly recommended!!!!!
Hotel is ok but a bit far from airport . Breakfast very expensive  at 17 pounds , and had an evening meal which was very bland at best .
Easy to find. Short walk to subway station.
Not much to do around the hotel at night.

Made feel uncomfortable on arrival by staff members. They were aware of the reservation however wanted cash payment for room then when explained to them that stay had been paid for they requested credit card details 'just in case !'    I had to produce proof of my payment albeit I told them the onus should have been on them to confirm with yourselves !
staff were very friendly

1. off-white carpet in room stained with black marks. dust in places  2. Stingy breakfast-no buffet meal and no real choice. only one choice of alacarte when other hotels offer generous choices in their buffet set up.  3. Very expensive, yet not money's worth  4. Very bad discriminatory pricing- between foreigners who pay in forex and locals who pay in RM
The communal areas are very attractive and the honesty bar is a great facility.
The rooms we had were a bit tired and the bathrooms from a previous era.
Good place to stay
room was great - clean - spacious -- bedding was very comfortable
hotel under construction - need to work on their signage for finding the building where your room is located
Really nice friendly hotel, brilliant location for   Shopping and loads of pubs and bars nearby, lovely   River views
Poor soundproof,i was hearing every sound from   The corridor outside the room.
Lovely hotel, busy and good atmosphere.
Pool area needs a face lift. The ceiling is discoloured and the Jacuzzi was not as clean as I would have expected for a four star hotel.

Personally greeted by the owner/manager of the accommodation.  A welcome pack was waiting for us which was really appreciated. Beautiful rooms very spacious with all modern facilities which enables you to self cater should you wish. Extremely clean and maid service excellent. Accommodation situated in a great location at Paynes Bay and close to Holetown.  Fabulous sea views. Pool area spacious, plenty of sun beds.  Gardens manicured.  No bar as such but 'The Hut'  serves breakfast snacks and lunch.  Manager's cocktail party a must if staying on a Thursday evening.  Cocktails on the roof terrace some days. All in all fabulous and would return.
One or two apartments may experience road noise during some times of the day but this is not a problem during the night and shouldn't affect quality of sleep,

Found staying at the Sanur Beach Hotel a great experience.  Loved the fact so many exremely comfortable decks on the beach, and the water so clean.  I will be visiting again next year.  Great experience with no negatives.
For sure I will go again for more days when I have time.
We had connecting balcony rooms on the top floor and it was absolutely amazing!

Great location right beside the main shopping area. . The room - for three people was spacious. We had an issue with a sofa bed, which was resolved without any fuss. The staff at Reception were very helpful and friendly. Because it was winter the hotel was quiet, but the price was correspondingly very attractive.Car parking is available - at a daily charge - below the hotel. If returning to Salamanca, I would once again use this hotel.

I want to marry this hotel and have babies with it. My boyfriend literally had to drag me from the room when it was checking out time. Stay here for the towels alone. Oh, the towels! As Agnes from Despicable Me would say, "They're so fluffy I wanna die!"
Very helpful and pleasant staff.
It's been a very nice experience and a good value for money.
Great location in St Julians but positioned on a street behind the main road through so still quiet, very helpful and friendly staff, very clean hotel. Great value for money overall
The pool was out of action, but then we went in November so that was always likely
Staff not interested in good customer relations. Too many times they popped out for a cigarette.

Room big enough for 2. Cleaned perfectly every day and complimentary bottles of water really appreciated. The bathroom is modern.  Walking down the street, the tram is just 5 min away. 15-20 min from Grand Bazaar. Breakfast really good, lot of choice and good quality. Coffee with milk delicious, first time in a hotel...
Could hear some noises from neighbours.   If you're tired at end of day, the hotel may seem hard to reach on top of the street.
Neat and Tidy room.
Below average service. No greeting upon arrival, no eye contact. It appeared as both receptionist did not want to be there.
Room is big and clean.
IT service is poor. No wifi service password provided until 6 ppm.No room access due to access key problem. Check in only after 3 pm.  No tooth brush provided.
Excellent hotel - smart, clean and in a great position. The staff are brilliant - very friendly and attentive.
Room was small but clean. Well laid out and lots of storage space.
Only one thin blanket was provided in the room, the pillows were very thin and slightly uncomfortable due to lack of neck support.

Very friendly and helpful personal. When we checked in we were given a presentation of the city and sights by the manager. We had a deluxe room with the most beautiful view over the sea and at the Blue Mosque. Breakfast could be eaten on the terrace on top floor with the same magnificent view. Remember to bring hotel address for the taxi drivers.

The location of this hotel is great, you are within walking distance of the main area, especially the old town. The design of the courtyard is really nice and in Spring / Summer, it must be very enjoyable to sit there (I was there in November). The clarity in the room was nice especially in the bathroom (natural light coming from above). I did not quote the food as I did not try it.

Given that is a 5 star hotel, I was expecting to be provided with at least a complimentary small bottle of water in the room...this was not the case. The Spa area is nice but rather small and limited in facilities.
Clean , Conveniun , Easy go to Subway.
very good location  value for money  something different from the usual standard hotels
Overall very good stay.  Good location and close to motorway and easy access to Birmingham city centre.

Car parking space not enough if there is any function.  Has been ask to park at NCP nearby, which is inconvience.  Also, some of the hotel reception staff need training.  Check-in and check-out time too longer than anticipated, eventough with a valid documentation.

WOW! - Absolutely perfect honeymoon destination. Staff were incredibly friendly and attentive- my wife and i couldn't have asked for more. The personal butler service made it feel incredibly special, and the welcome by the manager, the sparkling wine on arrival, the fact it was adults only, the beaches, the room, the location and the staff who all knew our names all combined to make it a holiday of a lifetime. Thoroughly recommended!
Third time I have stayed here on vacation. Could not do better elsewhere.
Exellent position for Haydock Park Racecourse, stay here every year for the November meeting.
Prices at the bar are to expensive
Fantastic view.  good location

Gym was so hot that it was virtually useless. until fixed you may say you do not have a Gym.  2 of 4 elevators were out of order so waiting  time 10 min to get up or down between 7 and 11 was an exercise of patience
Central located, lobby spacious,  swimming pool version clean and tidy. Facing South China sea. View excellent.

Great modern, welcoming hotel with spacious and very comfortable rooms.  Loved the mood lighting options in the room and the rain shower.  I booked another stay at the hotel online during my first visit, and will definitely stay again next time in London.  The no. 44 bus across the street passes every ten minutes or so and reaches Victoria Train Station within five minutes for underground connections to all of Central London.

Firstly remember this is Havana Cuba - with that in mind this hotel is fair.  Grand building reminiscent of a former golden age; sadly now in decay and almost of Cuba survives on day to day basis.  Main asset are the lovely staff so friendly, helpful and happy to help. Rooms basic very large and clean- stunning views of Havana. Great location. Food was poor but reflected again Cuba and the embargo that Cubans live with.
No hot water - shame as the rest I was ok with as added to the magic and adventure that was Havana.
Not bad, we came with low expectations I guess, so we were pleasantly surprised by everything. Bed and bathroom was clean and comfy.

Breakfast was fair - they had roti canai and curry which was good, the other food were just average, nothing stood out. Hotel location was not walkable to anywhere. Cab or drive to nearest mall is City Square which had many variety of food.
bad service in main restaurant  rooms need reffresing
The Rooms were massive,tidy and clean. Close to the town and the station. As for value for money it was really a bargain. I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel and staff were very lovely and helpful.
Nothing negative to say the hotel. Just Brilliant.

Charming hotel. I had a room at the top of the building with a nice view. The hotel has lots of courts and yards that you can relax in. The location is superb and close to the cathedral and the Alcazar. Children would probably love the place as it is a warren/maze. Lots of space to explore.
There is wifi but you can't use it in the room. Only in the public areas.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location, next to Komtar bus terminal where you can take the free city shuttle bus. Surrounded by 3 shopping malls. 10 minutes walk to open air good street at Lorong Baru. Hotel has free shuttle to Golden Sands Resort at Batu ferringgi.
Hotel not renovated for quite a while.
Very good service, nice restaurant, very good communication to the airport...
Good Location, excellent choice for breakfast, friendly staff.
Rooms looking a little tired, not very good selection of TV channels, no hotel directory in room.
The room was perfect for us, I spent the time with 3 daughters and it was everything we hoped it would be and even better!
Brilliant from as soon as we arrived until the morning we left all the staff could not have done any better 11out of10 in my opinion

A beautiful hotel in an ideal location close to everything.  All the amenities were excellent particularly the Deck on the third floor which had the pool, spa, sauna, gym and steamroom.    Everything at your doorstep with the Crown Complex and Southgate  and walking distance to the exhibition centre, aquarium and a quick walk over the bridge to the city.  The Crown complex has four hotels so the place is always busy with cinemas, shops and so many restaurants, cafe's and everything in between.  We stayed for three nights and it was perfect. I would definitely stay there again.

If you have a room with window is not too bad (no window room is a torture, so be careful when you book as it is not clear, it seems that a standard room is one with no windows), though there's no proper shower (you shower in the toilet, splashing water all over the place). Internet is good and they gave the code to us for free (not sure is that is to everybody as on the paper slip with the code it showed a price). There are some bus connections that takes you to metro stations and some areas of interest. Swimming pool was pretty good.

Staff at reception VERY unfriendly, with no sense of customer service (In fairness maybe 1 or 2 were average), but the rest of staff were awful, had to change 3 times to a different room and they were very unhelpful about this and send us with 4 heavy suitcases up and down the building. Cleaners were very friendly and helpful (certainly more than any other staff in the hotel), though they were a bit noisy at odd hours when cleaning rooms, you could hear them on the hall). No Metro station near by so a bit of a pain when trying to get around (Be aware, taxi drivers in Singapore are in their majority very rude and sometimes don't want to take you to where you want to go, or they take you but they seem very unfriendly, we have never experience this anywhere else). Also we found it difficult to find friendly people open to help tourist in the whole of Singapore (Except from BHS shop where they seem to train their staff on customer service) (Go to Malaysia or Hong Kong, we have been there in the same trip and we liked it better).
Overall fair price for a good hotel.

Really nice room, amazing roof swimming pool overlooking the skyline of Kuala Lumpur, comfortable beds and pillows, modern. Staff friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend it as it is great value for money.

Breakfast could have been better for the standard of the hotel, location not the most central but 5 minutes walk to Rail station (would take 20 mins to reach town centre). TV only had one channel you could see as antenna didn't seem to be working (Though we were not to bothered about it so we didn't even mentioned it to reception).

Nice hotel, good location, great views and very good roof swimming pool, it is bigger than it looks on the picture and with views of the skyline. Good value for money. internet connection good. Very good breakfast.
Room very small but it seems that space in Hong Kong is a luxury.
A beautiful hotel in a great location, especially for shopping!
The only negative was that the water was not hot enough in the shower

This resort has beautiful rooms with sensational views of the Agung River and forests. The staff go out of their  to help. The breakfast was very good. Apart from the room service food (see below) the rest of the services were first rate and I would definitely stay there again

the room service food I thought was average and reasonably expensive for what you got. The Asian dishes were quite good but the western food was quite small portions and not what I would call great quality.
Great hotel and amenities. Professional staff.
Blood on bed sheet, unmotivated staff, shower not working properly, broken equipment, unclean room.
Poor, at best limited breakfast for the category. Overall on the expensive side.
Staff were friendly and helpful. The position is great for most places in Copenhagen and for travelling further in Copenhagen and into southern Sweden. Wifi worked very well.

The room was very small, so we had to upgrade and even the junior suite was small.  There was no safe in the room, which we think is a must these days and  in our experience most hotels of this calibre all over the world have one.
Clean and well situated hotel
Centrally located at Cape point so it allows one easy access to all major attractions. Warm

Old aging infrastructure, carpet was wet in certain areas of the room safe not working furniture falling apartI it may need to  be revamped in the near future I won't mind paying more to stay at the  hotel, because it is situated in a prime location.

Very friendly and helpfull staff in all depts.incl.massage ladies  only a few steps from the sw.pool,a few more to lamai beach  indeed very good value for your money,food ok,a lot to choose from  only 10 mins.walk along beach to lamai center  quiet
A very steep climb up to the reception,however a good excercise for a minute or so

A period building full of character features in a very good location. Across the road from Hyde Park, a 10 minute walk from Lancaster Gate tube and 15 minutes to Oxford St. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

The room we had was very small with a bathroom that looked dated, but it did have a view of the park and character features. There was a good breakfast selection but all of the "hot" items were only like warm.
Lovely building, superb friendly professional staff at Reception, Valet etc Christmas decorations made the lobby and building exterior very inviting and magical. All staff very friendly.

No Spa treatments whatsoever available during our stay, Food at Perrotts not great and definitely not as described on menu in all cases.  Despite pointing this out, items remained on bill.  TV channels in room really need to be upgraded and a mini-bar would be nice.  Otherwise a really special hotel.
The hotel ground was big . Rooms  are big. Breakfast was good. Staff was wonderful. Service was good
The hotel's location is very good for the city centre.

The check-in was quick but neither key worked the lift or the room door. We were room only but someone was taking breakfast and quoting our room number. We then had problems sorting this out with the reception staff. The room was pretty basic considering what we paid. The hotel has no parking and doesn't offer a discount at either of the two nearby long term car parks.
Perfect location. Very nice and service minded staff. Every Sunday afternoon beach bar party with live music a positive contribution.
Golf course grass and greens temporarely sub-standard.
If you don't like cats don't have ground apartment as many come to visit during the day. Probably because visitors feed them.
Close to everything, perfect location. Lovely
The best thing about the Celeste apartments is the location which is excellent. The staff are very helpful and friendly also.

Rooms are very dated and need refurbishing badly. Compared to other properties i have stopped in these fall well below the standard, the interior of the apartments seem to be stuck in an 80s time warp with poor quality finish. The hot water system was very poor due to having a very small immersion heater which was barely strong enough to provide a shower!! I would not stop at these apartments again when there are much better equipped properties for the same price or not much more expensive.
This review is for Delphin Habib.
Excellent staff,great location,very comfortable highly recommended
.Some staff were great, some not so good. Great location for restaurants etc
Some staff were great, some not so good
The Chinese restaurant was outstanding although some of the dishes were not available by 830pm. The rooms are generous in size.
It's located in the old Havana.
We didn't like it all. Some off the staff are nice. But unfortunatelly the hotel is too expensive and try to sell you so many eccursions etc. We stayed for 6 days and that was to much.
Great location  Funky loft style bedrooms  Good value  Great rooftop pool and sun deck
Small rooms  Must book premium - bed downstairs versions very cramped
good view and good service
electricity off at some time  air condiction is broken
All the staff were very friendly and professional. The shuttle bus to the waterfront was very convenient. We only had breakfast which was superb. We really enjoyed our stay. Thank you

No free wifi. Cost to purchase in the room is very expensive. Poor quality breakfast- flies all over the fruit etc. location is around 20 min by taxi away from Hua Hin. Not suited for young travellers as nothing to do in the area and v quiet at night!
Perfect location, great room, cheap hotel, fantastic food and all good,  will go again   thanks
Modern design, close to Silom Road, gay friendly
Failed to give us King Size bed, just two singles joined together, receptionist very intrangient.
Great hotel. Excellent service, breakfast and bar food of a high standard - bar food excellent value for money. Generally a good atmosphere.
My room was very hot and I did not get the radiator control right until the second night.

The Hotel is very centrally/conveniently located in the Brussels City Center, with Metro Stations as well as Railway station nearby. The upkeep of hotel is very good. The staff is very polite and helpful.
A good hotel for a reasonably price in the neighbourhood of NEC.
Convenient location,close to restaurants,supermarket,on bus line. Enjoyed free mai tais,evening events were entertaining. Loved the fireplace by the pool at nite.
The hotel is in a nice area, close to the airport. The ground floor facilities are quite nice.  It was unusual to find an Iron and ironing board in the room. That was welcome.
Very good value for money, and centrally located especially if you want to drive further to Auschwitz as I did.
Sits on a very busy intersection. That didn`t bother me, but for some, might put negative spin on it.
Hotel is focused on the basic needs for private travelers.   A perfect location in the center of Wan Chai district. Train
Size of the regular rooms!  Breakfast is very simple (if needed)  No changing room at the pool!

This hotel was very reasonably priced and in a perfect position for cardiff city center and the motorpoint arena. The staff were very nice and always happy to help. And my room was clean. And my room was basic but there wasnt anything missing that I needed. Ok so if you want fancy then dont come here but if you want real value the big sleep is the place!!
very good will stay there again,apartment very clean, and great views.

The Staff at Metropolitan Hotel Toronto did not hesitate to spend the extra time with us to share their knowledge or information on great places to dine and also the entertainment available to us within walking distance. The Staff was very helpful to us.
Please do not put large groups of single men next to family rooms, very noisy.
Great location, near tram station and taxi stand right outside hotel
Cheap and cheerful! Excellent location for Motorpoint arena. You get what you pay for and the room has everything needed for a basic stay with no frills.
For the price we paid it was very good. and had nice aeshetic. Good sound proof walls and in a very good location.

Sadly, upon arriving there was a mix up from the staff. We gave them the voucher (we had booked planning on paying at the hotel) but the receptionist thought that we had already paid. It ruined our evening because we were wondering what happened after all. The next morning everything was arranged by a very likable (different) receptionist.

The staff were excellent and very helpful. They knew were everything was in the city and if they had not heard of something they were very happy to look it up and give us directions. It is very central in the city which makes access easy. I would happily recommend it to anyone.

Hotel is in an excellent area the beach is outside the back gate .you can walk to next resort along the beach front .The pool area is very large and the pool is excellent for swimming for all the family.You can find lots of bars and restaurants in a beautiful area.
Great hotel, top location, amazing staff, super comfy bed, excellent breakfast, fantastic value for money. Go!

No lessons are given how to greet your customers extremely curt staffe . I won't say service was bad but never felt at home  I have stayed in many good hotels in china and I never felt so unwelcome. I will definitely not stat in tho hotel again
What a fantastic place. Top marks for service, quality, food, location. Visit this hotel if you can.
Very good value for money, excellent location for city centre, and m.e.n arena. very nice room and large shower
Breakfast a let down, poor choice of cooked items, very unorganised self service system!

Beautiful hotel and stunning rooms. The staff have their work cut out when the weather turns bad and the resulting problems it can cause but they do everything in their power to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Food was wonderful and we thanked the chef for his hard work.

Problems are relative to the country so I can't really fault the hotel. The staff did everything they could for us during our stay. It's a beautiful and modern hotel right on the sea front (the Malecon) - which was closed most of the time we there due to waves pounding the coast.
Near to Heathrow Terminal 4, Hatton Cross underground,

I have stayed in this hotel many times since 2002, alone or with groups of up to 30 persons. I love this hotell! It is Cuba! It is situated close to Havanna Vieja and in the popular area of Centro Havanna. It is cheap. But above all the staff is marvellous! You feel like in a family: a kiss on the cheek every morning, they ask you about your plans for the day, what you did the day before. There are Cubans staying at the hotell so you can talk to normal Cubans. I know that many guests think this is a terrible hotell so if you want to stay at fancy 5-stars hotell with  other rich tourists and very professional staff (without any personal interest in you, only in your money) El Hotel Lincoln is nothing for you.
Good location for red Dragon centre
Charge a fiver to stay in car park overnight when other hotels in same area dont
I can't say enough nice things about this property. Very clean rooms and public areas, wonderful and attentive staff and a great exercise room!
Staffs were kind at the first day, but not kind in the secdond day morning..

Well if we actually stayed in the 'Hampton by Hilton', which we actually booked, we would be able to give a review, but unfortunately when we arrived at the hotel, (early may I add so not anywhere near check in time) they told us they were fully booked and had to move us to another hotel!!  Unbelievable, especially as we had booked this at the beginning of October, and had researched and picked this hotel specifically for it's location, ie within walking distance to NIA, christmas markets and shopping centre, we weren't happy about this, and it also delayed our start to the day, because we had to go back to the car and drive around again to try and find where we'd been moved, which turned out to be a walking distance of 15 minutes further away from everything than our original hotel choice, not what the receptionist at the Hampton told us! Fortunately the hotel we were moved to we have no complaints about, other than the fact it was further away from everything, but we do feel we were unfairly treated, as we had booked this within plenty of time to be told they were fully booked, plus the payment had already been taken at time of booking!!  It will definitely make me think twice about booking there again!!
Price is high, superior rooms need to be renovated as they are old.
Rooms very modern, staff very friendly and welcoming, breakfast beautiful
Horible drain smell in room, paintwork in room starting to wear, couldn't switch the tv off using the remote and staff didn't know how to either!
Hotel location good
Easy access to shops  and restaurants.

This is a lovely hotel with large rooms. Although about 2kms out from the resort there is a walkway on the seafront for those who enjoy walking. The local bus stops outside the hotel. I would recommend All Inclusive which appears to be taken by the majority as it is such good value. Entertainment is laid on and is a variety suitable for most!  We travelled on the third week of November so generally only children under school age. As this is a very large hotel it perhaps could be different in school holidays!
During our stay there were no negatives.  We had a very enjoyable holiday which we can only thank the hotel and there team for-nothing was too much trouble.

Staff were so friendly and professional, from reception staff to room maids and gardeners, everyone had a smile for you.  The hotel has one of the best hotel pools we`ve seen. It had seats and lying-in-water areas so that if wanted to be immersed but not actually swim for a while ,you could ! Plus a swim-up bar.   The hotel also ran an hourly shuttle bus for the 10 min ride into town  for only £1 pp, but you needed to reserve.

Not a big negative but we thought that in these enviromently conscious days it wasn`t really neccessary to change bath towels every day and bed sheets every 2 days. The rooms had 3 level a/c so had no need to be sauna-like causing sweaty sheets !  In a similar vein, pool towels could be left for new arrivals in their room with a request to use for 2-3 days before renewal,all reducing laundry, and detergent use.   Couldn`t think of any real criticism !

I can't really comment about our stay at Hampton by Hilton as it never happened!!  When we arrived to book in we were told the hotel was overbooked and that we had been moved to another hotel.  I was extremely angry about this as we had chosen Hampton by Hilton purely because it was based on Broad Street, Birmingham, within walking distance of the Symphony Hall where we were attending a concert on Friday evening.  The hotel we had been placed in was not within walking distance of Broad Street so we also had to spend extra money on taxis to and from the venue in the evening.  Hampton by Hilton staff obviously never tried to contact yourselves to advise you they were overbooked so that you in turn could contact us about this.  All in all my stay in Birmingham was ruined by this experience and I would never book to stay at Hampton by Hilton or book another hotel through Hotelopia again.
Parking is not good, car park next to hotel full
V nice hotel, worth a visit.
Entrance appears to be in the wrong place.

Lovely welcome from reception staff, in particular Francine, was so helpful and polite.  Excellent turn down service in the evening.  The barman on duty that day and evening was most helpful, particularly in organising lunch in the bar for our family and reserving a larger area in the bar for our evening pre-dinner drinks.  The Hotel is in a fantastic location.

We had a nice evening in the Lyttleton restaurant, but thought the selection of just 4 main courses was very limited. The portions were rather small, however the food was of an excellent quality. It was most fortunate that we were allowed to chose some dishes from the bar menu. Some music would have helped with the lack of ambience.
Great pool and nice room.
