Stayed here for 1 night only as part of my granddaughter's Xmas shopping treat. Very good hotel, location fine, although not being used to driving in Newcastle we took a few wrong turns! Not the hotel's fault though. Staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful. We ate in the restaurant which was pretty good but might have liked room service. Not keen on the idea of "tray service" where you carry your own food back to your room. Overall a great place for an overnight, triple room was spacious and we weren't falling over each other. Spotlessly clean and comfy beds, great shower.
No room service and very difficult parking.
I have stayed here previously and the hotel is in a good location, though not centrally located on the strip.  The rooms are clean and I had a great view of the mountains from my room.
There are not enough places to eat in the hotel, but do not let this put you off as there are many places to eat at nearby.

This hotel was very good value and was very convenient for the centre of Birmingham and its various attractions and shops.  The bedroom was a good size and spotless.  Breakfast was nice and the staff helpful.

Check which room you are getting as our friends ended up very close to the number of discos/night clubs in Broad Street meaning it was very noisy at night until they closed and the patrons had dispersed.  The breakfast. although nice, was extremely busy and one thing which could be improved is there was no room to place your tray whilst you were helping yourself to various items - this meant a balancing act was required unless you went back and forward to your seat with one thing at a time.

2 night stay which was fantastic for NEC visit and chilling out in the pool/spa. Great location, room was quiet despite the road outside. Food at the bar was good, generous portions and all the staff that we had contact with were very friendly. Hotel was in a good clean state. Excellent choice at breakfast. Excellent value for money.

Not so much negative as 'could do with some improvement' - decor and some furniture is a little dated, especially the carpets. At breakfast it would be good to be able to have choices of coffee, ie latte, americano not just tea and instant coffee

We enjoyed the décor and cleanliness of the hotel but absolutely loved the location. The staff were very kind and allowed us to have a late check out which suited our needs and explained why when we checked in there was still cleaning and room service apparent in the corridors. This did not affect us and we would like to stay again next year.
The shower doors were in need of adjustment to actually close but my husband managed to do that so we were fine and the shower was great.

Very clean. Friendly staff. Room has to of space and cooking area useful

Its called the airport hotel but it will cost you 10 pound to get there by taxi I tried to walk but you cannot cross the motorway on foot this hotel is located at the wrong side of airport in relation to the terminal building.  don't believe the b/s about a shuttle from the train station it wont be there?  the restaurant was completely understaffed it took 1 hour 22 min to get a chicken burger and a pint of beer.  the room was fine except it was underneath the function room which had a party till 2.30 am the music was so loud I had no  sleep at all ******* this hotel is a total washout********** my advice" run a mile"   ***********

Room 403  The walls are paper thin - and was almost a participant in the nightime activities of the couple in the room next door.   I book a room mostly to sleep..  the bed is one of the worst I have ever 'slept' in. Consisted of two single divans with a mattress overlaid. Unfortunately, the beds were of different vintage with the result that I was sleeping na hill and got quite bad back ache; I only realised this later.  But the BIG issue was that there was a big party scheduled. okay - no problem - except that my room I was given was on top of the ballroom where this 'do' was going on until 2am - getting louder and louder; I complained, but they were hardly going to take notice of one guest when 300 others were also having a good time. Being by then extremely tense it was maybe 4am before I got some sleep   My beef is that the hotel was half empty - and yet I was given this room on top of where this event was planned - is ridiculous and insensitive. And makes me extremely angry. Basically I paid for two bad nights sleep - including one no nights sleep.   Probably the worst hotel experience i can remember. I stayed at a $50 a night hotel in Krasnodar the previous 5 nights - whom could teach Marriott how to run a hotel properly.

although I request for non-smoking room, the 13 th floor still smells of smoke and it comes in from the ventilation to the room and takes a while to clear. I suppose there isnt any non-smoking floor. Also although the pillow cases are changed they still smell like they havent been aired for a while. The restaurant ( dinner) : The food was fairly good , but the accessories were very small or incredibly small portions . For example , toasted salad ( 1 tablespoon) mashed potatoes ( 1.5 tablespoons ) meaning "child portions" .  I 've stayed at the hotel several times , but there are 2-4 people who eat dinner.  It seems to me that , if there is a customer that he / she " get charged " and therefore go " all out" to dinner .  This place goes to " twice" , it is " first and last " because prices are so high that scares the customers. Prices are 70-80 % higher than they should be.    Lobby Bar:  Last time I stayed at had the vodka, 3 ml whiskey , 7UP and coffee. This time it was 7UP and coffee. Both times I asked Gin and tonic.  The answer was ( both times) : " Then you must go to restaurant ." This must be the only hotel with four stars who have not Gin .      Restaurant / Dining :  The food was fairly good, but the accessories were very small or incredibly small portions. For example, toasted salad (1 tablespoon) mashed potatoes (1.5 tablespoons), meaning "child portions". Food quality is sometimes very good, but the accessories and price are only eligible for two stars, and Lobby bar is a total 1-2 star.  Breakfast:  Ukrainians complain about the breakfast, but I eat continental breakfast, so for me the breakfast was OK.  However, they should replace the coffee machine for coffee is not hot, it is lukwarm, and it was also 2 months ago.  Finally, this is probably the only hotel I 've stayed at where breakfast is from 08.00.  Kaare Lindbaek (member of: Châine dês Rotisseur)

Positives  - Very good value for money.  - The hotel was comfortable and well equipped for the price we paid.  - The room was well sized, although it must be mentioned that we did get a free upgrade to a triple.  - The hotel was quite centrally located with only a short walk to the old town.  - The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English.  - The room was very clean and well maintained.  - The breakfast was an extra expense at 50 zl per day but it was good quality food and therefore good value for money.

Negatives  - NOISE. There was both internal and external noise pollution which negatively impacted the quality of our stay at the hotel.  - There were multiple hostels on the same road as the hotel, therefore it was usual to hear noise from drunken people returning to their hostel in the middle of the night.    - The hotel was located on a busy road with a tram line at the front of the hotel. Whenever a tram when past, one could feel the whole hotel vibrating. The trams did not run during the night but they did re-commence at approximately 6 AM.  - There were also shops next to the hotel and therefore there was noise from early morning delivery vans.   - Inside the hotel, there was very poor sound insulation between the rooms. One could easily hear the conversations of other guests through the walls, even when they speaking at a normal volume.  -  Parts of the central staircase were not carpeted. Some areas of the central staircase where bare stone, meaning that loud footsteps could be heard in the middle of the night.   - Other guests often returned to their rooms in the middle of night talking loudly and they woke us up. Kraków has a busy nightlife so it is normal for many people to return to their rooms very late. Usually this is not a problem for us but as I said before, this hotel had very poor sound insulation.     Conclusion  - There are a lot of positive factors about this hotel. But unfortunately, we would not stay there again because it was noisy and this lead to a poor sleep experience. I would rather spend extra money and stay somewhere quieter.

I booked this hotel based on price and location. I received my voucher advising me that I would have to pay the price quoted at the hotel which was 64 euro and 10 cents.
