Staff there were great in particular Jason
Great sunbeds at the pool, great reception area you can drink and listen to Cuban music

The bedrooms are not worthy of been a 2 star standard.I have stay there 3 times in the last 6 weeks,on two occasions the bedroom quality has been shocking.Clarion you wont be see my EUROS again.STAY CLEAR!!!

Choice of two restaurant and a bar/cafe to socialise in on sight and a large breakfast area as well.  Staff were very welcoming and quick to respond to your needs.  I was very please with the breakfast team as well as the variety of food on offer as well.    I had an executive room on the third floor for the duration of my stay (5 days) and it was nice and quiet and the rooms was cleaned every day.    I ate at the Parkland Restaurant (the on sight restaurant) twice during my stay, and found that the food was of a good standard.  There was one occasion when I asked to speak to the manager and made my comments to him about their new menu, which looked very good.  He was very receptive about my comments and even when I made a comment on how they might improve on their layout of their menu, he was very professional in how he handled my comments.    I will definitely visit the hotel again
No negative comments. This is my second stay at the hotel in the last couple of months and I have enjoyed my stay each time.

Nice room, brilliant location, quick and timely checkin. Breakfast was a good however very busy but as it was near Christmas this was to be expected. Would gladly use this hotel again for any stay in Birmingham especially if you want central location and easy access to Broad streets night life.
No negative comments from my stay or my 5 friends I booked with.

Lovely place, peacefull and quiet.  We were there in end of Nowember, less of People. In the resturant did we have dinner just alone one evening.  The pool was clean and the staff was very helpfull and smiling . Nice bungalow to stay in.   Nice for couple who like to read, swim or just relaxs.
It is aside of other hotels and resturants, you can not walk to other Places. But take a shuttlebus or taxi.   It felt some days almost to alone.......
Room space very goog, very clean room. Friendly staff and we enjoyed the food. Make sure you go to the tapas restaurant at least once!
We paid for wifi access, unfortunately we had only wifi signal by the main pool and not in our room. But since we have spent the whole day by the pool this was a minor issue for us
Great location
One more elevator would pay off.
The male reception staff were nice, friendly and very helpful. Good place to stay.
Greeted poorly and rudely by female reception staff at check-in after an overnight flight- greatly unappreciated. A fair walk from the main streets of the city
Everything was perfect. Great beds, great bathroom, lovely pillows.
Very beautiful Interior
They did not have Any management   I Would never go back to This hotel

In this price range, convenially located and reasonable managed hotel. Staff is friendly and services are run as in the rest of Havana. Recommendable hotel for a experienced traveller who is aware of the fact that circumstances in Cuba do not always allow to maintain western standards. Spectacular views towards Malecon and over Havana from upper floor rooms.
Shower/Water pressure in the upper floors is weak - will require some management/adjustement in morning routines.
excellent value for money.  Clean and comfortable.  Would go back.
Family room for 3 but only towels and cups and saucers for 2.
Everything is perfect

i have always found this hotel in a good location.  comfortable and feel very safe here. i have stayed here quite a few times now. i have also recommended it to family and friends too. and will stay here on my next trip to orlando.
rooms are a bit dated now. but always stay here. had to remind housemaids to change beds atfer one week.. they were fine with that
Very nice rooms, well appointed with all you need. Particularly liked the washing machine in room, large shower, good and large bed.

Nothing much. Some issues with the afternoon manager who was rather rude and showed no concern for guests and treated his own staff badly. However, other staff were excellent and did well in everything.
position in Copenhagen
Hotel is fantastic, clean, modern and staff is professional. I didn't find chance to fast any food.
Its 2 km away from terminal 1. It does provide shuttle every half hour.
Good location walking distance to everything room were really nice no dramas no hassles
Clean and cheap hotel. Good location off Broad Street. Simple breakfast available too. Helpful and nice staff

This is a Superb Hotel set in the most wonderful environment where one can relax and enjoy both the countryside and the sea! Sunset in this hotel are not to be missed . Food was excellent and the selection of sweets at the Buffet Dinner on Saturday night were simply exquisite. Well done and keep it up!!
Great room great location. Easy parking surprisingly quiet.
Beautiful building, clean rooms, amazing breakfast, helpful and friendly staff
A little far from some of the attractions however for us (younger couple) not an issue at all

Amazing hotel and great service! Cannot believe this hotel is only 3 star it should be 4 star. It's so clean and the staff are very professional. Ordered a taxi to take us to the clothes show and we were provided with a Mercedes. We felt like VIPs. Will definately stay here again next year or anytime I need to be in Birmingham!
My sisters allergic to feather pillows and no one seemed to know if they were or not. Only minor and wasn't an issue but would be handy to know next time

This is a very good hotel in a very central location. The hotel is very American like and has old world charm. If you like modern, chic hotels (W style) this is not the place for you.    I recommend the hotel for demanding business travellers and couples who appreciate top quality hotels. The room is spacious and the marble bathroom is wonderful. There is a lovely bath tube and a separate shower corner in the bathroom.     There is a spa with steam room and turkish bath at the hotel but please notice that there is a separate fee of 25 euros each for entering the spa premises even for hotel guests (not for suite guests). This is disappointing.      There is a lovely bar at the hotel. It was very popular during the Saturday evening with many locals as well.     Buffet breakast was very good and highly recommended.

There is a spa with steam room and turkish bath at the hotel but please notice that there is a separate fee of 25 euros each for entering the spa premises even for hotel guests (not for suite guests). This is disappointing.
Lobby was very nice and the location of the hotel .
The parking should be included in the rate , better or more pillows and a working minibar .
No free wifi. Location a bit far from centre but shuttle is provided by hotel.
Convenient to local 'attractions'. Would stay again and recommend the hotel to others.
Room was Ok the double bed was very small though, nice view and great bathroom

No were in the preview about the hotel does it tell you the pool is at the hilton 100 meters away and that you have to leave a £10 deposit if you wanted to brave the rain and wind to get to it. Our room was not booked even though we had confirmation so got a family room with far to many beds and not much room to move about. No mirror near the very few plug sockets. Had to boil the kettle on the floor as lead did not reach the plug. Couldn't use the largest bar /Cabaret room as private function on. Paid £58 for all the facilities it offered and couldn't use any may as well of booked a £25 bog standard room in a smaller hotel. Very disappointed in the very false advertising spoilt our plans and night away.
excellent cuisine, excellent service, excellent location for business travelers not interested for see beach

should be installed boards with instructions how to use Sauna or the Swimming pool to keep hygienically this facilities or to organize related educational  classes for the Russians for the next 50 years.  Or build a similar hotel just for Russians.
good location, lovely room, good staff
slow in the morning at check-out  expensive drinks
Receptionist was not very welcoming, on arrival we were not told about facilities or about the restaurant even though we were asked if we had stayed in the hotel before which we had not.
rooms good size and all different. breakfast had large variety. helplful staff and central location
building work was on and we weren't warned in advance of our stay

Not in the main tourist centre if that is what you are there for so a 20min walk (which is not bad really), small lounge /bar area, breakfast was busy due to small number of tables......so nothing too negative really! If you want good value and not too concerned about lots of extras / high level comfort (eg leisure facilities), then this is an ideal hotel to stay in for a short break as we did (4 nights).
Very accommodating. For the price it was very good value. Duty desk manager was very polite and helpful
car park a small problem although it was a busy w/end with the toy run,good location will return.Thank You

convenient for us visiting relatives in the area , easy to get around using bus and tube . walkable to kings rd , very close to beautiful battersea park . rooms well equiped to prepare breakfast or light snack but many cafes etc nearby . quiet , ( our room was at the rear ) very clean and very comfortable . all staff pleasant and helpful .

First of all the scent over the corridor and  public  area is amazingly great!! Keep that aroma for travelers stay relax and at home    Stayed in the smallest room   Location - convenient to stay around Bugis area  which offers lots of nice foods and shopping  Access by car - carnparknismeasy to access by taxi etc and it is standing art corner of the big streets  Room - small but utility  function very well can view MBS dip from the room, beds are comfortable   Security - cannot  only press room floor was the latest  Staff response they response email within 12-24 hours!  Water server, include hot and cold plus ice machine was great with Japanese jug to keep it as is.  T

Small washing zone   busy check in area but cozy sofa and tv will make us less stress that is smart  Might be same in any singapore hotel but when i put food on desk small ants came.. Keep your food in dustbin on each floor out of the room
Excellent location  Good facilities  Large room with good amenities  Good restaurant area
Too many Russians and Easter European clients, therefore F
unbelievably no wi-fi!!!!!!!
Very well presented 1 bedroom apartment in a large high quality development. We had the place virtually to ourselves being early December. Staff very helpful

Excellent customer service, the staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. The overall safety nod relaxed pool and beach areas were great for our 9yr old girl to explore.     We were able to relax and enjoy all the fun the resort had on offer. Would stay at the resort again for sure
The staff was quite helpful, polite and well mannered.
Air conditioner in my room needs improvement. Did not find it very effective.

I was not given the room I paid for. When I asked to speak to a manager I was told that managers are not available at nights and that I would have to wait into the next morning. The next morning at check out I asked to speak to a manager and was told that managers are not available in the mornings. I was told that a manager would call me regarding a refund for the error on my reservation. It was been 3 days and no manager has contacted me. When I called them, all they said was that a manager will call me back.
The price and it´s near the centre of the city.
The heating system is poor and the  hot water isn´t warm enough.
Excellent location and staff were very friendly and professional

There were only two lifts and two days running the lifts were broken at breakfast time.  We stood 25 mins one time waiting for a lift as the only lift working was used by staff.    Like other hotels the prices went up during Thanksgiving weekend.  It cost $282 dollars per night when normally it can cost as little as $124.

Right on the Carihuela, a fantastic position overlooking the sea.  Easy walking distance to bars, shops and restaurants.    A very welcoming lounge area with attentive waiter service.  Lots of choice at breakfast.  Free wifi. Bathroom spotless.    Spa is a real bonus, and treatments are good value.  We had hired a car and there was a small inside car park next door, where hotel residents got a discount down to €10 per full 24 hours. This meant the car was safe.
No rugs on the floor so can get a little noisy if someone above you is walking around or moving furniture.    In room safe was chargeable rather than free.    Otherwise a great stay and recommended.
We found the staff helpful, the stay was very good and the location excellent.  Melbourne is a very easy city to get around and the location could not have been better.  Good value for money.

Location is nice. Hotel is near Aquapark and Kleopatra Beach.   Around the corner there is a nice market called Migros.   Only 15 minuts walk to harbour area.   If locations is important, this hotel is a good choice.

Rooms are old and scuffed. The smell of tobacco is everywhere.   There was a fridge in the room but it didn't work.   Water is heated only with solar power and during my stay in December there was't any hot water in shower. Maybe same thing in the summer time if there are cloudy days...?
Ideally situated in City Centre yet away from noise. Staff welcoming. Breakfast was very good with an extensive range to choose from.
Very clean and comfortable.basic In room,with no kettle but fantastic location and also rooms cleaned everyday
The staff were so friendly,even with busy breakfast times nothing was too much trouble
OK location. Some of the staff was ok and did give us good service.

The facilities in general, simpel food, small rooms, small breakfest areas, almost no place to rest or relax but in the room, the staff gives you almost nothing attention and one of the small indian restaurant just around the corner could not be thrusted for the price for the food and turned out with a much much..higher price for dinner..Most things can Get better, but is was ok. Next time we will put more money in better hotell.
Fantastic location, fabulous view from room, first class breakfast. Would recommend.

excellent hotel 7 min walk to termini 10 to 15 min walk to centre of rome for attractions great size room with large king size bed. room cleaned everyday with fresh towels.lovely power shower large bathroom. great selection at breakfast cereal eggs cheese ham fresh italian bread, cakes joghurt juices and lovely fresh choice of coffee.staff was friendly and helpful and went out of  to accomodate what we needed starightaway. again great hotel in quiet area of rome would stay and book here again
there is nothing negative to say about this hotel
Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great with wide choice. Room was basic but clean every day.
Construction on carpark next door but you can't have everything....
Great location, friendly staff and I loved the quiet gardens, gazebos and the choice of pools.

Loved it. Wonderful and welcoming staff. Nice atmosphere that made you feel right at home (classy without being too posh). Clean and fresh, noticable that they've undergone a renovation. Good location which will be even nicer when the park opposite of it is done. We would definitiely stay again if going to Miami.
In general the staff here need to embrace customer service more highly
Beautiful hotel with lots of facilities.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Great location.  At approx £50 per night for two half board it's got to be a bargain.

On our previous trip the choice of food was better.  Tea and coffee facilities in the room would be nice.  Wi-Fi could be free for what it costs the hotel.  Food (buffet)could and should have been hotter.
-Friendly staff  -Nice and clean room with air-condition  -Nice looking hotel
-Breakfast was really boring and a few a choose from  -takes 45 minutes to the city center
Good location near of station
Good location. Big room. Very clean.
Hard bed, outdated linen. Poor continental breakfast. English sockets. Must buy or bring own adapter.
Good position, Nice view, enough to do,good cook.
Shop lady not really interested
So good location and the bungalows were nice. I could see my self and my family next time in the same hotel. Thank you for a good and relaxing holiday :)
Staf were helpful but not very workorienteited..maybe an cultural issue..some of them did not understand english..only spanish.
Fantastic location and staff could not have been any better!
None really, would have been nice to have had a proper bar rather than the self service thing, but other than that nothing!
Hotel, Staff, Food and Location all Very Good.
Very good seaview. Relaxing resort.
Poor transportation. Staff is not professional and not very polite. Many flies on the breakfast salad. Few facilities and limited choices on restaurants and foods.
Lovely Lanna atmosphere and comfortable bed.
Food at breakfast was of very poor quality. You need more fresh ingredients and a good choice of healthy foods.
Included breakfast is simple but adequate.   Not bad for a cheap place to stay.
Don't provide adequate bedding, air con
The staff were almost all very charming and friendly. The gardens are well maintained and the access to the beach is great. The sun loungers are comfortable and there are beach umbrellas.

Our bed had the most awful badly sprung thin mattress so no sleep for the first two nights. We asked for an upgrade that we were happy to pay for. Unfortunately there was no availability. Eventually we got a better mattress and could sleep. We also requested a kettle 5 times which was never supplied so we gave up.   The breakfast service was chaotic with a struggle to get a cup for coffee. Some days the selection was good on others there was little choice. We only had one dinner there because it was so disappointing. The food outside the hotel in local restaurants was much better. The fact that we had to pay to have the use of a safe in the room and for internet access was a bit mean considering that we had paid the full rack rate for our stay. Other hotels nearby were less expensive and included both these services in their rates. We plan to go back to Kotu which is lovely with beautiful people but not to this hotel. We do realise this is Africa and this is not our first time to an African country or the third world. The outstanding plus is the people.
Clean room, but too hot!  staff welcoming
breakfast although provided was passable but missed bacon and poached or fried eggs, i hated the scrambled. yak!
Location, good facilities, comfortable beds

Short opening times of the bar / restaurant, room service only in the evening.     The hotel disperse a scent into all public areas (inklusive rooms), which works with fragrances / flavour. This not only smells unpleasant, but can also have have health consequences for many sensitive people. I hope that the hotel turns off to disperse a scent. At least this should be featured on the homepage and the outside of the hotel.
Definatly can do with some renovation as the hotel is aging
The rooms are very spacious and well maintained. Confortable beddings and pillows. Nice view.

The food at the restaurant Chatterz is average. The freshness of food is not tip top. Due to high human traffic, the staff had a hard time maintaining cleanliness and tidiness.   During breakfast, the salad greens are not really fresh, you can see the edges of iceburg lettuce turning brown. The food items were not topped up in time to manage demand.   During buffet dinner, the items served for seafood hotpot were not fresh too, the meat were dry and hard. Seafood were not cleaned properly. We had to even wait for long time for soup base from initial to subsequent top ups.
nothing at all

They didn't even know about my booking and that was on a Sunday. They told me to call back reservation on Monday 9am while my booking and arrival was on a Sunday night!  The blow dryer in the bathroom seriously needs to be changed, I think they had that since 1970!

"We liked the apartment and location enough the first time that we went back for a several visits, which we rarely do and enjoyed it as much as the first time. Out of season it really is fabulous value. The kitchens have 2 hobs, microwave, electric kettle, toaster and fridge, plus dishes, glasses, utensils and pans; bring small bottles of dish washing liquid and cooking oil rather than having to buy huge bottles when you arrive. There is a dining table for four in the apartment and a plastic table for two on the balcony. The bathroom is large, with bidet and bathtub/shower. Some bedrooms have twin beds and some have a double bed plus the two sofas in the living/dining room become single beds. The heat pump (10 euro deposit for the remote control) is in the living/dining room not the bedrooms which can affect comfort if it is very hot or cold outside. The TV has a few Portuguese channels, good for finding out the weather forecast and BBC World News. The Continente, Lidl and Aldi just 10 minutes walk away are very useful. While I find Portimao and Praia da Rocha to be small enough to walk everywhere, my wife does not but the city bus service Via e Vem has stops on Rua Jaime Palhinha just 10 metres from the front door of Mirachoro II.

This is supposedly one of the best hotels in Conakry. For such a high price it anyway should be. It's dirty, things are missing anywhere, the taps, the flush, etc..... and hardly any internet at all. Although we had paid by your site, the hotel answered by phone that there was no room for us (although we had already the booking confirmation....) until finally we could get our rooms. Normally there should be a shuttle, but arriving at Conakry airport, they asked me to take a taxi because of the heavy traffic....all by all a bad experience....
convenience in the town.
The double room was too small , can't find a  place to sit  at room !!

Hello, the hotel can not too pretty from the outside but very comfortable and great for the whole family up to 6 and 7-aside. Apartments spacious and really clean. Every three days staying exchanged towels, linen and cleaning of the apartment. The food at the pool restaurant excellent and highly recommendable. In contrast, pure water heated in the winter is great. The reception staff in particular deserves recognition because it is very helpful. He can provide all the information you need for just what especially thank you.

For the negative things I can include only three things - the lack of a playground for small children and the lack of inside the hotel felt I mean corridors-gutters when it rains the water then pouring everywhere and no inside these corridors garbage , which must be outside the hotel for the other side of the road. But it is not that inconveniently. For wanting nothing difficult so this third negative do not worry. The bigger problem may be the location of this hotel on a hill. When we go to the city is great but the return may be hard for people not to walk lubjacych. My family and I like to walk so it does not pose much of a problem even with shopping and a little child 2 years. I would recommend this hotel to everyone because at Tenerufie in Los Cristianos rarely rains and playgrounds are on every street so and so children can play. The other hand, is priced cheaply for comfort. Regards and recommend to all.

Probably the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. The whole place is spotless. My only complaint was the size of the bed which was a small double, it's not something I would expect in any hotel and meant our sleep wasn't as good as it should have been.     It's in an ideal location with the Arndale, Printworks and main shopping street all just around the corner.    The breakfast which is included in your price is very nice and sets you up for whatever you're doing that day. Would definitely stay again despite the size of the bed.
We had a suite for 4 adults which was excellent
Very clean  Helpful receptionists and waiters  Good breakfast  Pleasant restaurant
Small rooms and bathrooms
Beautiful room with five star location. Pool and sauna was great and the lady looking after the area was very helpful and pleasant
Concierge service was only available from 11am and for a few hours only. This is pathetic service for a top hotel.
Very friendly staff, warm welcome and helpful throughout.
Bathroom door didn't fit so couldn't be closed properly, breakfast area was very busy, noisy and cold
The central location, the beach is perfect there; most members of the staff were really gentle and professional
The kitchen staff usually looked upset and disgusted, as doing their work against their will, no wonder the food was so bad, even for normal Cuban standards

Super friendly staff at all levels; housekeeping especially efficient. Excellent buffets. Great hotel location for most activities, if one likes being in a city center area (Kowloon). Convenient access to metro, buses, trains, ferries. Hong Kong hotel rates are much higher than 10 years ago, but this one is still a good value.

The staff was so friendly and helpful at all times! Always smiling and so wonderful. They really made us feel welcome. The room was cleaned twice a day. We were given several free water bottles every day and good beach towels every time we went to the beach or stayed at the pool. The food was good and one night we had a wonderful BBQ-party at the hotel.

The hotel has it's own beach which was very nice. No screaming kids or people who try to sell you domething. Just peace. But the minus side was that the beach was a little dirty. I think some of the garbage comes from the water and it's impossible to collect it all, but if someone could check the cleanliness of the beach once or twice a day, then it would be perfect!
nice hotel with pleasant bars
mix up at check in...took some time to sort out
staff is just terrible  first i had breakfeast included and then the other day i had to pay
Had a fourth time. Always get a great vacation and only positive emotions! Thank you very much!
Very basic room facilities for this day and age. Tired 80s feel. No iron, fridge, shower gel. For the money I'd expect more. Guess you pay double for Central(ish) London.
- location (city centre in walking distance, groceries shops, restaurants..)  - airport express bus stop just in front of hotel  - food of very high quality
- some rooms are very noisy (you can hear your neighbour word by word)  - even in non smoking rooms you can smell cigarette smoke through ventilation
Character, history, culture, quiet in room but right in centre location minutes away from the Ann Frank House on adjacent to Dam Square
we had problems with our original first room, problems were very quickly solved by Staff through upgrading seaviewroom
No wifi in the rooms
Big apartment with nice terrace
Everything cost extra, tv, internet, childrens meal seat,
Wonderful clean and classy hotel!
very nice and clean hotel with enough facilities
Literally ' in the middle of nowhere'  except for the airport, 30 minutes   traveltime to anywhere, poor public transportation
Very nice and professional staff. Big rooms. Good situated ( near old souk )

This is a modern hotel (about 12 months old, I believe), with good sized rooms and well appointed rooms. Nice touches include such things as the en-suite toilet have a separate door, thus avoiding waiting while one's other half is using the bathroom.    The breakfast is buffet style and caters for a wide range of tastes. Not 5 star, but what one would expect from a hotel of this standard and very acceptable. Food in the restaurants is very good - a la carte as opposed to buffet selections are very clearly freshly prepared to order - and again has a wide enough range, including a limited "fine dining" range in one of the outlets.    The swimming pool and gym are both very adequate.    The staff are amongst some of the most friendly I have come across and are very keen to assist. Two of them told me how proud they are to work for the hotel, a rare thing.    Overall, an excellent hotel and we would stay again.

Although it is close to KL Sentral, getting there on foot is not easy, nor is access to the old KL station, from which it is possible to catch the underground. I had not realised this when booking, though the hotel does offer a free shuttle to both KLCC and KL Sentral.     Room servicing (e.g tea
Fantastic hotel with modern funky rooms....super comfortable beds and pillows. Loved our time there and would definitely return. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.
Breakfast was a buffet but was exactly the same every day. A slight variation of options would be nice.
very convenient
We never stayed here because when we turned up you hadn't made the booking.You did put us up in a different hotel but we really could have done without the hassle.
Fabulous staff, they really could not do enough (keep this up it makes such a difference!) the cleanliness of the hotel and my room could not have been better super!
The staff were friendly, and the massage chairs (paid) in the lobby are great. Lobby is very clean and modern. Cleaners there are nice ladies. A/C is fantastic.

The rooms were old, "dirty" and smelly.  The bathroom was tiny and I didn't want to shower in it but had to because of the duration of stay.  Parts of the room were dirty, like behind the fridge/drawers and inside the cupboard where the spare toilet roll is kept, there was a lot of dampness (the roll was soaked for a moment I thought someone had done it on the roll).  The rooms smelt like really heavy dust - esp near the curtains, and near the A/C there was mould on the ceiling.  The beds are comfy but I took my own pillow cover as they were stained a bit.  Looks much better in the pics than reality.

The room was clean and looked new. Had a good nights sleep and was looking forward to getting my breakfast. Although I seemed to be the first guest in the restaurant I was meet by a lot of loud chatter. I didn't understand where it came from until I realized it was from the staff. I assumed that that things would quiet down now as the staff would realise that the first guest had arrived, but sadly not. I was asked if I wanted tea and coffee and that was that. Anyway, the management should have a word with the staff to turn the volume down a bit.
Very polite staff and very clean hotel.
Hotel was excellent value for money and the staff were superb.   I have previously stayed at an Indigo hotel which I enjoyed and again I wasn't disappointed

The staff at the hotel are very friendly and professional. The beautiful female waiter at the breakfast on Dec. 12 with the blonde hair was very service-minded. The hotel should be very happy employing such a good waiter. It was indeed a pleasure staying at the Mercure Centrum Hotel, and will definetely stay there when coming back to Warsaw.

We stayed in a 2-bedroom apartment. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The kitchen had all amenities we needed, such cutleries and cooking equipments. The front desk Assistant Manager, named Marie, was very friendly and helpful in providing us with maps and tips on where are the best places to eat and shop. Overall, it was a splendid stay and we will definitely revisit this hotel when we are in Perth!

The hotel was in an excellent position, just a few minutes walk from central station and Tivoli Gardens. Breakfast was  good, lovely very fresh bread.  Reception staff were friendly and the hotel had a nice feel to it.  Although room was quite small, it was clean and had a flat screen t.v. and tea and coffee making facilities. I would stay again and recommend it to other people.
The bathroom did not have a shower tray and no matter how hard you tried the water flowed over the floor thus making the floor wet through.

Location was good for us, as we were visiting Notting Hill. The frontage / reception is pleasant and the staff were welcoming and helpful.very little noise from other rooms / the corridor (helped by our room being at the end of a corridor). Cheaper than other hotels.

The room was basic and tired. It reminded me of student accommodation - especially with the basin outside of the ensuite and practically next to the bed. After flushing the toilet, there was a small leak from the ceiling, dripping on the floor (which can be quite disturbing when everything else is quiet.
Very cold, small pool. Closth nerly the whole week. No garden, nothing to do in hotel, the bar mostly clost. Our flight was erly and we had promise to have light breakfast whit us. But, no.
Staff all v professional and helpful. Quick check in and departure   Even though some rooms overlook station you can't hear any trains if window closed
Excellent hotel, would stay there again.
Hotel food/drinks prices need to be competitive as many option available within short walk outside. Need to ensure standards kept up.
Overall the staff was very helpful and pleasant.
My only negative comment is that the cleaning staff did not replace toiletries on a regular basis.
Great hotel, location, rooms, staff, food etc... you name it.
A bit noisy sometimes when they have weddings/parties on the grounds...

Amazing views of the city especially at night. Had friends staying in a two bed apartment and the views were equally spectacular. Room a fair size with floor to ceiling windows. Great bathroom with walk in shower and separate bath and toilet very modern. Food in one of the restaurants Neuvo 37 fantastic have been there twice.
When we first got there a bit of a grey area about where to park but once the hotel advised us about using DFO car park and getting a discount it seemed logical.

The staff were very attentive even received a bottle of champagne and chocolates for my hens night. Had a great time wish we could've stayed longer. It is part of the crown casino so we had fun all night then it was a short stroll up to our room.
The view from the window wasn't great
Great friendly staff , good location, staff v helpful
Clean and warm.
a really great stay, booked early and got a good deal, but very nice hotel extremely comfy bed and would definately return
i think the staff on reception could have been more friendly and welcoming
centrally located
tv reception bad, lifts were very slow, funny odor/smell at the pool level
The Staff is really very friendly and the hotel is situated on the right spot.
Really excellent breakfast buffet, especially for vegetarians as everything is so clearly labeled as either vegetarian or non-vegetarian. This is the first hotel I have seen that does this... Bravo!

This hotel is pretty good, and probably very good by Cuban standards from what I've heard.   I found the staff polite and helpful.   The shuttle bus into the old town is very prompt and efficient, running four or five times a day.  The internet is a bit frustrating, but mostly usable if you just want to check a few emails or something like that. (That's about as good as it gets in Cuba from what I've heard.  It's 5pesos/half hour (about $5/hr)).

I guess you should expect a few minor grumbles when travelling in Cuba, and mine were pretty minor, but here they are:   (i)   Check in is not at 12 midday as stated on the site - it is at 3.30pm  (ii)  Rooms aren't allocated according to what you booked, but what is available when you check in. If you booked a room view, or a room in 'the levels' (aka 'servicio royale'), then make sure you get it.  (iii) I paid extra for a room in 'the levels' or with servicio royale, paying about 30% extra for this.  However, most of the additional services listed on the melia site didn't happen.  This didn't bother me too much, as I was mainly only interested in the free wifi, but is a bit annoying.    (iv) The gym isn't very good.  There are no locks for the lockers, only two running machines which are mostly occupied, and only a few light dumbells.

Good value for money room nice and clean spotless white bedding very comfortable. Breakfast good plenty of choices.nice quiet area of London. Good transport links very good dining places around the hotel.will certainly book again
None that I can think of our travelling partners own a b and b which is very good and they thought is was fine and they are hard to please

ideal location for anyone wishing to go to Wembley arena or stadium.not too far from Wembley park underground station.staff very helpful and curtious.room was lovely and warm.food was first class.will visit this hotel again in the future.
hoped to get a car parking space not told when we booked that you had to pre book instead we were told to go to a ncp car park which cost us 23 pounds   for overnight parking
Love staying at the crown, best resort facilities i have encountered. Great restaurants, great food (dont rate rockpool though)  I feel great when staying at trhe crown
Can get very crowded in hotel lobby and surrounding, entertainment areas on friday, saturday night.  Pool and spa staff/management a bit spaced out and unproffessional.
Staff were extremely professional and helpful
No real ale at the bar
Staff especially on the reception were not nice at all, very unfriendly.

The pool area was really clean and a pleasant temperature, sauna and steamroom very clean also.  The breakfast was one  of the best I have had cooked in a hotel for a while with good sausages!  The room was clean and whilst a bit basic was perfectly adequate and comfortable, bed was comfortable too.
As with lots of hotels price of wifi was extortionate and should be included.

Poor check in, I was not informed about the wifi nor was I informed that my parking ticket has to be verified at reception before going out. Verifying the parking ticket in itself is an inconvenience.  Pool was dirty and uninviting
Fantastic for our stopover on the  to the south of Spain. Three course dinner including wine on Special Offer made for a very economical stay. We will use again and recommend to others.
Temperature in the bedrooms a little too low for December.
We were very pleased indeed, staff were friendly, price reasonable and breakfast in the morning was good..

Very friendly staff   Very clean room  Tea coffee in the room  Checkout 12 was perfect   10 min walk to a lovely Xmas market in front of the castle  Plenty of resturants and cafes take always in the area
Staff was pleasant and professional. Beautiful resort and beautiful guest rooms. Very comfortable bed and many in room amenities.

Checked in at 4pm room wasn't ready till almost and hour later but got a higher floor than expected. Room phones were terrible and didnt last more than a few minutes without dying. Many stains on carpet and furniture. Freezer drawer on fridge was busted. Took  too long to get ahold of anyone through the phone
Close to Hyde Park and Queensway Station. Clean rooms, good breakfast included, good value for money.
Room was close to the reception so lots of noise from other guests.

Special location in the water, on the beach, and in the middle of the little center, el Medano. Superior room with perfect view and sun on the balcony. Large room. Clean room and clean floors without carpets. Good value for money with half board. Friendly hard working staff.
Not the newest rooms and furniture in the bathroom, but it did work. If you don`t like the sound from the waves this isn`t the place for you. Slow and unstable wifi.
Great location by rushcutters bay and marina. good clean rooms and excellent staff on reception nothing is too much trouble for them, with special mention to javier !
Very professional reception staff, Jimmy who attentively attended to my queries.
Nice environment and large resort

The room had strong bad smell and not very clean, even so after we changed to another room. The spa and steam heater didn't work. The buffet breakfast was aweful and very limited variety. The villa and spa suite area was very far away from the main resort and felt like ignored and isolated from the hotel. Experienced twice that the water supply stopped while I was in the middle of a shower. Complaint twice and then was told that the hotel would stop the water supple and the fix the water pump every night. Was furious. The hotel should have notified the guests in advance during check-in.
Great well located hotel. Beautifully decorated for Christmas. Will be back

The Betsy is a beautiful hotel with a great historic facade, located at the end of a strip of amazing hotels and bars.  The location was perfect to be able to walk the strip and enjoy the nightlife of South Beach, but far enough away to feel that you had escaped from the madness into this classy enclave of sophisticated elegance, with excellent service and superior food. The quality of the dinner at BLT Steakhouse was beyond our expectations, and would highly recommend it to anyone whether they are staying at The Betsy or not.
excellent position for Lowry centre and outlet,very handy for tram into Manchster
modern building, modern shopping centre where it's located; modern interior, but scrappy after closer look.

no usual things available in hotels such as hairdryer, iron. You have to ask about everything.  My bathtub didn't have a plug for baths.  Quite cold inside although both radiators were on max in my apartment.  Worst was slight noise coming from the ceiling even when the hotel card was not inserted into activation system. It was excruciating

Thank You IBIS Malioboro for making my stay an excellent one!  The hotel location, the helpful staff, the food are incredible!  Staffs are friendly, hotel/rooms are clean, the nearby shopping mall and facilities are wonderful!  Will recomend others to stay at IBIS Malioboro! Thank You!
Great place to stay - we would definitely stay there again.
Wifi is not free. It would be perfect if hotel could provide free wifi for customer.
This is our 3rd visit we really enjoyed our stay . Staff very helpful ,friendly .Rooms very modern
Had a meal in the bar which took almost 50 minutes to arrive and was stone cold when it did. Certainly not good value!
A beautiful resort beach hotel - clean, very comfortable, great staff.  Got an EXCEPTIONAL price for our stay from Hotelopia!  Folks in Trinidad could not believe the price I got - Thank you!
Good location, scenic sea view
Hotel is getting old and needs refurbishment. Mattresses are hard, sofa and carpet soiled.

This is a little gem, within easy walking to the centre but trams and buses available also.  Nice atmosphere and a great calmness around the place. Will definitely be back. Thank you to all the helpful and friendly staff.
Good facilities etc swimming pool,decoration
Too far from main road.  Have to wait until 4.00 p.m to check-in..late 1 hours.  Furniture old fashion and hotel exterior not so clean.  Located on main land not pulau pangkor as per address.
Convenient as in shopping n food
Good location from Paddington station. A short walk to Hydepark. Very sentral.

I am annoyed by the fact that a $50 charge is taken from your credit/debit card on check in  to cover use of the refrigerator I assume, and after one week, this money still has not been returned to my account. I can understand the reasoning behind this charge but why does it take so long to return my money to my account.
Great family location, lots to do, and having all those pools made it not so busy.  Very good place to take family, will go again.
Staff/cleaners need to check all crockery for cleanliness.  Nearly everything we got out of the cupboard was dirty, had to wash before we used it.
very good location, fine rooms, helpfull staff
No facilities for food but available in the immediate area
Lovely corporate feel hotel

You don't at all get a disney feeling, very corporate feel with circus stripes . No circus entertainment at all and lots of coin operated rides but would be very expensive to stay with rides at 2 euros each.
The location was really good. Just next to Hyde park, close to underground stations.

The hotel offered NO cleaning at all (only if you stay for more than 1 week) and wastebuckets have to be carried out yourself. Besides the bed was soooo small (120 cm x shorter than 2 meters) and you hear every sound in the house.     There were many details of the hotel that we could not see on hotelopia -for instance about the cleaning, bedsize, that you have to pay 5 pounds to store your luggage after checking out and so on. Hotel staff claims that everything was stated clearly when we booked the hotel, but all of these things are not listed in hotelopias webside. Then they claimed that hotelopia forced their  into their webside, and because the hotel did not have ANYTHING to do with hotelopia, they could not help what information hotelopia showed and did not show. I'm not buing that!   If you are fine with a really small bed and no cleaning, then the hotel has a good location. But for that price I will choose another hotel next time I'm in London;-)
No free wifi on all spots. At least at public areas I.e restaurants   Free wifi only at the lobby.
Breakfast selection could be better.  More tv channels required.

House keeping needs some attention.  We requested towels and pillows on our arrival as we were 4 in the room and they only provided for 2.  We eventually fetched towels ourselves but never got the extre pillows that we requested daily.  Basin drain was blocked.  Was reported on Friday but not tended to.  Safe was not working, reported on Friday but not tended to.  Stairs from the parking area to reception was littered with take away containers and chips packets from our arrival on Friday up to when we left Monday Morning.  Security at complimentary parking serves no purpose.  We drove in and out without being stopped.  Doubt that we'll make use of this facility again.

The hotel is modern and the rooms were very nice. The decor of the hotel brings a nice welcome (due to the Christmas season). The rooms were nice and the layout good with a nice view of the mountains. As it is near to the MTR station, it was easy to get around as well.
Apts and surrounding areas kept clean. There's an option to go A.I for a reasonable price of €19 per day whick includes all meals and local drinks.
A little bit worn around the edges, but staff warm and welcoming
Staff can't good advice about the city's attractions.
The staff are generally helpful.
I heard a couple fighting against each other a night.

I went with my 2 daughters, 11 and 13 years old. We were most satisfied with our stay, and the facilities on the sight.  I have been in Kyrenia several times, and this was a nicer stay than we explored at an other hotel on a stay before tatying at Malpas.

Can not see that I noticed anything very negative at al. The staff were most helpful, and polite in deed, and this matter to me and my family the most. The room were clean, bathroom, and the food was actually very good. The only negative remark, might be the entertainment, singing when eating - it is sometimes a bit to loud for my taste.
Hotel was in a good location and clean
As lime most hotels too warm and there is also a humming noise all night
You had to pay extra to use the gym, and that the receptionists were rude.
Excellent views of the ocean room was nice,comfy bed
Me and my husband both got food poisoning from the one evening meal eaten here,the reception staff do not smile or make you feel welcome.
Great Location and beautiful views
Hotel Staffs are very professional.   Keep up the good service!  Well done!
We stayed for 2 nights and the hotel is value for money. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel is closely located at the centre of the city and the tram and metro stops are very nearby.
Greeted by friendly staff
Foods and place of interest within walking distance........
The pool

No safe, we asked them to lock up passports in safe and a diamond bracelet when we came back and 10pm and asked for them they were sitting on the counter still. Booked 4 rooms for 14 people 3 quads and 1 triple asked for single beds, they gave us 3 mattresses on the floor about 3cm thick, the showers were cold. The stairs are dangerous to walk up and down and are outside and broken, the driveway is full of motorbikes so have to walk around the long  all the time and carry luggage out. The tiles around the rooms on the outside are so slippery went wet the kids kept falling over. Would never stay here again. No kettle to make a cup of coffee, the pillows dirty, mouldy hard

the hotel is very nice and modern, staff is helpful and kind. I liked my room very much, and had everything i needed for my stay there. bathtube, tv, comfortable bed made my night in the hotel perfect. the room was clean and the price is also fine, compared to other hotels close to airport. Airport is 5 mins away and there is good transport possibilities by busses that are not expensive and take you to the right terminal in heathrow airport.

air condition works very fine, but is loud which makes sleeping difficult. there is only 30 mins of free wifi connection, after that you have to pay. what i also didnt like was that i got a drink from the hotelbar in a dirty glass. Or else the hotel was very fine to me and i could recommend it to everyone.
Live music in evening. Easy to park the car near the hotel. Situated near the center of the city and even then a quiet area.
We only had dinner. Very good food, but perhaps not very varied. (the fishmeals and the potatoes with very often only fried potatoes).
Staff are very helpful and room was keenly priced
Hotel is great. Clean, friendly staff and close to everything! Bar staff friendly and expert in cocktail making.

Breakfast service and food were woeful! If you serve breakfast until 10am then everything should be available and hot, even if you arrive to eat at 9.45am. Shame this part of the hotel is not as good as the rest.
we enjoyed our stay. In a good location . The pool was very good after a day of sight seeing
There are charges to use the gym unless you are in a premium room
The hotel have free pick up so it is very good for people 5hat need to go to airport. The room is ok for a night,good services.
Good location, easy to get to with public transport.  Staff friendly with good English.  Hotel clean and welcoming with good facilities in offer even though we didn't use them.
Good deal in December - excellent location.

Staff were very helpful,  offered wake up call and assistance with times for the Heathrow hoppa  bus.   The H4 is the bus you need for terminal 1 and 3.  It goes every 20 mins from around 430am.   Shame I missed breakfast, starts at 6am as the pastries looked nice.  Any chance of a coffee and pastry to go service from 430am?
best valeu for money-spacius rooms -clean- very nice staff-in center-close to the sea
lots off steps-no internet in the rooms
Very nice hotel, ideal location, great value for money
room was very clean,  fantastic location. breakfast was good but the sausages didn't taste very nice. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. and we will certainly stop there again.
Extend breakfast area or transfer some of the facilities down stairs in the restaurant area?

The hotel does not look a lot from the outside but the room, which was a superior room, was very large, and had air conditioning..  Always plenty of hot water which was a bonus.    We have no complaints taking into account the price we paid.  The area roundbout in the Latin quarter was really lovely.
christmas market food was excellent and staff were extremely helpful and pleasant
Excellent for the price and very clean. Staff very friendly.  Had breakfast at the hotel cafe,no complaints anywhere :)

Friendly reception staff, surprised to be accomodated in the Annex, but was pleased  at the high Standard of room, and felt very secure with the doors and Card System of accessing room. Excellent Location when using the one of  many shuttle buses from Airport, and Sightseeing. Would recommend to anyone on a Budget . Good value.
I ahve been already 4 times in this hotel. never had an upgrade...
Staff are helpful and well trained.
Hard beds.  Our room was on the 4th floor on the St George side and there was a lot of noise after 10:30 pm each night.
Really excellent position for all the amenities of Puerto De La Cruz. Brilliant restaurants on the doorstep.

However  there was still building work going on in the room above, so if you wanted to sleep in, no chance.  When we told reception but they did not help much, we were told floor 12 and below were fine.
Hotel still refurbishing rooms above 14th floor, noisy in the morning and afternoon
good location  Quiet  Good bed
Lack of experience from staff (not always friendly with customer)
Great Location. Easy to use Hotel Hoppa Bus. Great Price.
It was a place to rest our heads and was acceptable for one night. The staff were nice but not overly professional.
The shower didn't work properly and kept turning itself on. The floors were cracked and peeling and they charged more than we payed for the room to do a small amount of laundry.

The cleaning were awful - they took my passport and then they say "it fell inbetween my beds" WHY DID THEY TAKE IT OUT OF MY BEDROOM???" I had a panicking end of my holiday in Agadir...and then they came to me in the reception 5 min Before I was going to Marrakesh...Will never again live at this hotel....

We requested a room with a view as our stay was for a special occasion and we were treated to an amazing room with a great view and a complimentary bottle of wine with a lovely card wishing us a nice stay. Pleasant, professional and helpful staff at a modern, clean and well situated hotel.
Bar prices are a bit steep but to be expected in central London. However, the additional bar service charge of £1·50 was cheeky considering we were sitting at the bar!
Good view and good service.

Was very good.  Clean and nice Staff.   Very Helpful when I called ahead of coming.   We were picked up at the Airport and brought to the hotel.  They also provided for us to go to the Pier to get on the Crown Princess and did not charge us for it.  Some of my family stayed at the Princess cruises facilities and had to pay from the airport and also, had pot and drug dealers in the hotel along with noise most of the night.  They were not happy.  I went with Comfort Inn and the Hotelopia and could not be anymore pleased.
very clean and spacious room, has good access to shops and shopping malls
Very good location and room had a nice bay view. Room very comfortable for just 1 or two people. Good selection of TV channels
Wifi was an extra charge of 350 pesos per 24 hours and for two adults and one 4 year old child no extra bed was provided. Hotel lobby area lacked seating and sometimes very difficult to get a taxi.
Many russian people, a lot of them got drunk or took too much from the buffet without eating it.  Drinks from the bar in plastic cups.
- Cleanliness  - Budget Friendly  - Good location  - Very good facilities

- I needed orientation for the bus station to catch the bus for the airport and only one of the staff members helped me being oriented and be at the airport on time.  - There should be some shower gel, cotton buds, shower caps and things like this provided for the guest in their rooms.
The personale at reception were mostly professionel and friendly.
The other personal (cleaning, in kitchen) were not so professional.  You have to ask for, every time the soap is finished.
Excellent breakfast, close to a variety of places to eat, within walking distance of tube into Washington DC.
Efficient staff, clean, modern, well situated
The hotel condition has detoriated from what it used to be.The receptionist. Was unprofessional
very clean and well presented. breakfast buffet very good,
no free internet, pool not heated in december as hoped for. walls very thin, need a car to stay there
Fabulous central location close to the river with lovely views of the bridge.
Great room but best was the sun deck and view that comes with it.

We arrived at the hotel to be greeted by two smiling faces.  The reception was very welcoming and after missing a connecting flight, it was wonderful to find out that the location was away from tourist and very quiet.  I was born in Cuba and it was my first trip back in 27years, and I was travelling with my husband who is Australian.  I would highly recommend this hotel and thank you to the people at reception.
There is nothing negative about this hotel.
the room design and facilities are very good. the balcony is also great.

one bad thing, really a bad thing, is the noise cancellation by the door is very poor. every morning i wake up early because of the footsteps, door slam, talking ... and every noise you can imagine in the corridor.
Conveniently situated near a park intersting shopping.

Nothing negative to say about the hotel, but your website leaves a lot to be desired.   Too complicated and lacking essential information.   Will not use your company again, more easy and user friendly ones available.

cafe staff attitude are bad especially the man with spec.disappointed breakfast ,the food only refill when it empty. not much variety . not convenient place, no hawker, no restaurant , unless you want to spend more and eat in the cafe with the lousy food.  bed bugs , ants etc on the beds. my son whole legs with all the ants and bed bugs bites .  cabin - dirty, ants, bed bugs, mosquitoes etc. not suitable for family. and not worth of money.  tree house- think like giving children hv gd experience staying n tree hse , but end up gain a lot of bugs bites.   this is our first and last stay in permai. will not come back again.  this permai not the right choice to stay..regret of choosing it.   my advice, pls avoid ..and think twice if u really wanna to choose these resort for your holiday. you will get suffer instead of enjoy.
Very helpful staff, excellent food and great rate.

This hotel is very good value for money. The rooms are small but big enough if you are just sleeping there. The cleaning of rooms was of high standard and towels and linen were good quality and changed regularly. Very good shower with nice hot water every day.  Breakfast was fairly basic (from Western point of view- eggs, cereal and toast but no fruit and yoghurt) but staff there very helpful. Fanny looked after us very well.
Friendly staff, clean modern hotel
Great location, front of house staff professional and friendly

Second time I've stayed as first time round I was delighted. Disappointed this time with the room considering the price. Bath battered and tired and a very very slow filling loo. Staff said the hotel is going through a referb next year. The price would have be very good for me to go back.
Staff were helpful. Would definitely stay there again.
poor room service and destroyed bathroom. also cold water in bathroom and the heating was very poor.
Nice clean place, quality peaceful stay. Can do a lot better
Too many mosquitoes and the food is very bad

Hotel is not new. It is one of the oldest hotels in town.  This is shown in rooms and facilities.  However everything is clean and well preserved.  Very friendly staff and manager.  Food delicious.  Felt very welcome and at home. Guests behave as if they are family.  Every afternoon free tea/coffee and pastry for all guests !  View over harbour and town OUTSTANDING !   Situated in one of the most lovely places in town.  Near to shops, harbour, beach.

Only one little thing is missed a littlebit : evenings there is really nothing to do, no animation at all.  Maybe it would be nice if they could arrange some nice, not too loud, live music or something.  Just to entertain the guests a littlebit while they are having their last drink before going to bed.  That would be very nice. Now you have to go outside to other places in town.
Room lacked basic facilities such as no shelving, no electric socket in kitchen for kettle, and whole bathroom flooded after shower.
very noisy (and unnecessary ) music around the pool area.    Grab a pool towel when you can - they are rare!!
It was a pleasant stay. rooms were spacious and clean. The Jim Thompson room was very nice.

If you are driving the signages to the hotel is very  BAD. Something needs to be done to improve that.  The breakfast was yummy but a selection would have better. As in a buffet. For the price if RM70   I expected more from breakfast.
There was nothing negative, everything was just as expected.
Très propre (Very clean), Proche du centre-ville   Facilité d'accès à pied (Closed to the center   Easy to go there by walking), Wifi gratuit (Wifi for free).
The tour bus stops right in front of the hotel, which is a plus if you plan to have a city bus tour.

I understand that this is a very old hotel and has not been renovated at all for decades. However, at least they need to maintain the place 'clean.' I cannot understand how they've received that many stars. The hallway of the second floor was really dirty and almost felt like a haunted house. The rooms were even worse. The windows did not close and had power outrage. We were moved to another floor with better--I mean with power and closed window. The worse part is the buffet. No hotel flavor at all.
Fantastic experience, every member of staff were very helpful and nothing was a problem (special thank you to Monika from restaurant and Maria from reception).
Beautiful room however it didn't have a proper shower but only shower attachment. Restaurant little bit over priced.
Good location breakfast good
Parking to tight and to dear
Nice resort, friendly staff, nice quiet place. Villa has infinity pool and small kitchen
Nice touch Gluhwein for christmas.
Hard to find!

Room not cleaned patio filthy not light in fridge, no window in master bath,poor lighting in kitchen, bedding not changed hair in bed,no phones in room except for master bathroom stayed in room 110 then kicked out and put in the supposed show room 120, lost 1 full day, poor attitude when the problems were brought to their attention. I should get a full refund instead of dishonest apologies with lack of concern. Not even a gesture to rectify the situation.

Unclear directions as where you are supposed to check in, took us an extra 15 minutes to find right building. Staff not friendly or professional. Better accommodation in the London Bridge area for similar price.
The IN hotel in Penang. Good location.Good service . Spacious Room.
The first thing we noticed about The room was how Very Clean

Unfortunately there seemed to be a problem with the plumbing at the basin because the water drained slowly.  There were younger children staying in the room next door, and at times through the night loud sounds could be heard through the wall....very annoying when you are trying to rest/relax/sleep.
The room was spacious.
Great position, great discount  rates, paid parking available and buffet breakfast really varied.

Lifts can be confusing -especially when trying to get to the car park, it would be simple to resolve this with a few notices inside the lifts to explain use of card keys, which floors are reception and car park levels and the 'no exit to car park' in one lift,
Fantastic breakfast, proffessional and attentitive staff
I good hotel, centrally located in San Jose, i
The hotel is central, I wouldn't go out around the hotel at nite,safer to get taxis that to walk.

Food was nice, selection fairly reasonable and the staff in restaurants and Cuba bar were good and very professional.   Location is good, there are other restaurants and shops around.   Beach is beautiful!

1) Extremely bad experience with booking via Hotelopia as the room booked was not in the main body of hotel but across a busy street in separate building with no access to beach, pool or anything else. This was not indicated during the booking process!!!  This problem has been resolved after escalation to the hotel's general manager.  2) Hotel needs urgent refurbishment, it is definitely not 4* but in Europe this would be 2-3* at best.   3) Staff at the reception needs training in Customer service care.

the room was very cold - the room card key also is used for the electric so the heating is only on when the room is occupied. We stayed on a very cold night in December and it was obvious the room had not had any heating for some time it was so cold - the heating system was very noisy. There was a electric fire in the wardrobe which we pulled out and used to try and get warm.  The mattress had seen better days and sagged in the middle - One of the worst nights sleeps I have had at any hotel I have stayed at.  There is no parking and the car park they recommend is further away than expected we were lucky it wasn't raining.
Friendly staff, highly recommend
The breakfast buffet need to add more food selection
service is good, clean, comfortable, location very good!
Funky interiors and spacious.  Staff all delightful.  Well located.  Hosted wine evenings and coffee mornings a great idea.
Very nice rest time!

the hotel was in a beautiful riverside location not far from city centre and travel links.  our room was superb with fabulous views over the river, baltic art centre, sage theatre,  millennium and tyne bridges with views across Newcastle. all of the staff went the extra mile to assist us and they were most professional and friendly.  there was ample secure parking and access to main roads was very accessible.  it was certainly value for money as we got an excellent rate through the travel agent on line.  we will certainly return in the future and recommend the hotel to friends and family - a most enjoyable stay wish it had been longer !!!
Park Royal is very good for a 4 star hotel as during our recent visit to Singapore, we stayed in a couple of 5 star hotels as well and were able to compare.

The hot water was not available for one whole day, of course a mishap, but staff were not able to tell how long it would be before we got hot water.  My wife was not pleased. Some sort of compensation, other than offer of free breakfast, would have been more welcome as we stayed 7 nights.

The Location of the hotel is very convenient. The apartment is big enough for a family. The staff at the reception were very friendly and helpful. We got right information about the city. The hotel is quite clean and has good facilities.

The sofa bed was not such big for kids over 8. For an extra bed for kids we should pay 160 MYR per night, which is very expensive for one kid. The quality of the breakfast is not goog, but value for the money.

Enjoyed our stay here. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable and serviced each day of our stay. We like the location for its ease of access in and out of the city by car and its convenient site so close to the Waterfront.A excellent choice for someone who wants a no- frills place to stay in Cape Town

Our only negative was that the Hotel had been told by Hotelopia.com that we would pay direct to Breakwater Lodge  when in fact we had payed by credit card at the time of booking so there was some minor confusion which was dealt with very easily.
The Breakwater lodge is conveniently located with easy access to the V

Currently the restaurant facility was being revamped so breakfast was held in an alternative location, most days the hot breakfast was barely hot and on some days it was cold. The only other issue was the return shuttle service ordered to return to the airport seemed not to have been booked even though it had been confirmed prior and on the morning of departure.
The room smelled like cat pee. The toilet did not work at all (even after feedback) -- had to use bucket to clean up after. However, this is not very exceptional in Cuban hotels.

There are no positive comments to say about this hotel, all nh hotels just rip your money apart, the invoice say pay 416€ at the hotel and ended up paying 490 € because of the city tax and the 50 € deposit you have to make which is not specified in the description for the hotel. Not worth your money

Really pleasant welcome and very friendly staff. Perfect for what we needed everything very clean and breakfast was excellent. Never seen my daughter eat that much in one sitting. All very good and will use for business in future.
Beautiful beach , nice pool and bar , very good food . Large Room with seaview  and modern bathroom all recently refurbished.  Beach restaurant on the beach very nive and excellent food
Very disppointing italian restaurant, decorated like an Ibis hotel,empty most the time . Very slow and non professional service.  The Indigo restaurant has very good food but looks like a canteen.

This was a most memorable stay for all the best reasons. The hotel is stylish and exceedingly well run. The staff without exception were friendly, helpful and professional. We can certainly recommend it without hesitation.
The area in which the hotel is situated can be rather daunting at night. However, the hotel can arrange taxis without any problem and it is very centrally situated for the Old Town of Montevideo.

The signs to the hotel are terrible in the dark.Our satnav could not find the hotel it lead us to about 3 Holiday inns on the same road?Our room was not quiet and it faced the main road .The carpark charges £12 is unfair for guests-although we found a nice space it is a pain to find a space at 8 pm .
A friendly owner who does try to be helpful. The rooms were very clean.  Close to the bus station. (Be aware, the trike trip to the hotel should be only PHP 20, not PHP 50 as we were charged)
We were expecting views, we were confronted with a cliff face.  Better value in the township area or for a little more you could stay right on the beachfront.
The staffs arr really helpful. The location of the hotel is strategic. Lots of thing to do here. Lots of food too.
The breadsheets are too old.

The position of the hotel is beautiful, the sad thing is this could be an amazing facility if the hotel had good management who ensured that the staff were trained.    The rooms on the whole were fine but the linen and pillows need to be upgraded, the idea of a blanket being used over and over again is not very nice.    The cleaning staff in the rooms were very pleasant as were the gentlemen who helped with the luggage, unfortunately this was not the same in the restaurant and on the front desk.    The Christmas Eve dinner was nice.    We love Mauritius having visited it many times, but we will certainly not be rushing back to the Indian Hotel and Spa.

The staff at reception were not welcoming at all, we waited for 45min before being given our room.    The staff in the restaurant were very unhelpful, and dismissive. There was a distinct lack of management around, so the service was very very poor.     The food was poor, the only meal that was good was the Christmas Eve dinner.    I think that the Mauritius travel board who gives hotels their rating needs to re asses this hotel as it is NOT a 4 star hotel and should not be marketed as one. If it were marketed as a 2 star hotel then people would go there with no expectations.
The hotel location, staff collaboration was very good. value for money. Will be visiting back again for sure.
English not so good for communication
Very close to bus terminal.  Great beach.  Close to public transit to the 5 star strip.  Ideal for backpackers or people that want to go to various other places in Cuba.
Staff were super friendly and helpful
friendly and helpful workers. lnternet connection in the rooms is good
Staff and facilities were very good.
The room seemed to be fitted for a single traveller -e.g only one dressing gown, This was a slight disappointment

Good deal.(under the half price of what the other 5 star hotels in Belek offer.) The  place is clean

Light sleepers, beware! There are two mosques in close vicinity. Their loudspeakers are excellent, so the call to prayer before sunrise will certainly wake you up. If your room faces Abdali Square chances are that nightly activity will keep you awake when the flee market is being set up (happens Thursday or Friday night, depending on the time of year I expect).    And for those who would like a drink: they don't serve alcohol. There are plenty of hotels in Amman, which do.
Located very near to the Tri-Rail/Amtrak and I-95. There is a Walgreens a block away. Nice TV with HD channels. Comfy beds. Right next to the city of Boca Raton.

Besides the desk, staff was not very friendly and barely spoke english. Elevator is old, slow and very hot because the a/c is broken (I really hate that elevator). There is working WiFi but at dial up speeds.... very slow. They never changed towels, just folded them nicely (although they clearly needed change). It is located very close to Boca Raton... but it clearly isn't Boca... not very decent people around at night.

Our family stayed on 26 and 27 December 2013.   We were very impressed with all the hotel facilities and especially the staff, who were very helpful.  It seemed tone a very happy working environment and we were very taken by the helpful, positive and friendly attitude of the staff.  I recommend it most strongly.
Good location, close to shops, restaurants and beach.

Shown to my room by an older gentlemen and a child (young girl about 8 year old).     Hotel rooms need to be maintained, carpet in  the bedroom is dated, wallpaper coming off the walls, room was not cleaned before my arrival. A lot of furniture for a small room  On arrival the shower was dirty, no toilet roll or  waste paper bin in the bathroom and TV did not work.Staff were notified and this was resolved within minutes- very good!! ( 2 teenage girls came to my room , only one cleaned the other just came with her and did nothing ).     Unfortunately my room phone would not accept incoming calls and I informed reception , this was fixed, then the following day  again when I had friends trying to call, they were informed I was unavailable when I was actually in the room , but the phone did not work.. I informed staff it was not working again ,I  was told they would fix it..they never fixed my phone. I was woken out of bed one night by a knock at my door , informing me  to come to reception for a phone call!! I would not go to reception. I think this is unacceptable-they should have fixed  my phone!!. On my 3rd day ,I did have to ask to have my room cleaned, more toilet roll, clean towels  and for my bin to be emptied, and this was done -which I was happy about.  Overall a nice hotel staff are OK, I guess you get what you pay for , so it was a pleasant stay at New York Hotel Lara, but unlikely I would return.

The pool was very disappointing since it is tiny and can only accommodate a fraction of the guests. Actually quite ridiculous and really needs attention since you cannot frequent any other pools if you are not a resident of that hotel, leaving little option but to live without a pool in the middle of summer!!
Nice appearance and location

The hotel is in bad state of maintenance!, the pool is very cold and the water not clean, loose tiles on the floor.  Breakfast is bad! Fitness extra costs(no dumbells etc).  Advice to book only logies...
Nothing negative to report

Nice hotel for the Price. Close to Shopping mall and High Way.
Everything great, gave 4 on food because there's no such thing as perfect

great location and very quiet for city centre hotel. Nice evening meal and lovely breakfast. Staff polite and helpful.

We booked in August a total of four rooms in this hotel. However, we had looked at the location wrong and I tried to cancel the booking, understandably, it did not fit. Hotelopian I talked to the clerk and they agreed that the rooms are available to paid weeks. Otherwise, they would have been able to recover 90% of the money if you do not already have charged your card to my room. I do not understand why they had charged the money because the website clearly says that "only pay the hotel." We decided to book a hotel in Barcelona city center for three days and then go to the Costa Brava, hotel maria del Mare. I called on Tuesday and inquired about them but the rooms were no longer!? So, we paid about 1600 € for nothing .. Hotelopia is not responsible for inquiries how did this happen! And the review in the link was getting really difficult!  IF YOU WANT TO get rid of your money, BOOK THIS HOTEL!
some staff were welcoming
some of the staff were efficient ,patient and courteous

I booked the room through hotelpedia but was told initially that my booking was not in the hotel's computer/database , only upon checking with the former were  we confirmed and checked into our room. we have to endured a long wait  after a long journey, not a very ideal  to start our trip. Also on the second night , we told the reception that our room cannot be open (due to the metal hinge ,not the smart card ). we request the lady in attendance to asked maintenance to rectify it as we were going out for dinner,3 hours later the problem wasn't solved and we asked the reception/maintenance all over again . Apparently the lady forgot our request, again tired and frustrated .

Fabulous hotel with very hospitable staff for the eleven days of our stay. Facilities are outstanding, gym, sauna Turkish bath, pool, jaccusi and pool lounge area. Fabulous massage by Maria who is an excellent therapist. This is a gem of a hotel amongst the most awful surroundings. The positive thing is that it will not be forever. I will come back when the downtown area is completed. I think I will have to book well in advance!

Hotel is surrounded by massive amount of construction hence very noisy. The staff tried to accommodate us as best as they could but we heard contractor noise all day and night in our room. Room service was a bit inconsistent.had to ask for the sheets to be changed after 7days into our stay.Often the room was not made up until late afternoon /evening. Not really good enough for a four star hotel. However, we are always aware of being Eco friendly particularly with towels and did not expect them to be changed daily.

Large, very pleasant, beautifully-kept grounds. Large, well-maintained pool. Most of the staff were very friendly and efficient. The food was generally good and plentiful. We were only here for two nights as part of a longer holiday. After being put in a musty smelling room right next to the disco on the first night, complaining and not sleeping well, we were moved to a much better room on the second. This was very pleasant with a nice balcony.

First time at an all inclusive and won't go to one again - not because of this place in particular as it was generally fine for what it was, but just not really our thing. We were put in a musty smelling room right next to the disco on the first night and didn't get a decent sleep. The whole resort was too big and could have been anywhere in the world, but I guess that might be true of all such resorts. Meals were served to hundreds of people at a time in the large dining area and sometimes it was necessary to queue. The food in the fake 'Italian' restaurant was like school dinners. Music in the pool area was too early and too loud for my personal liking and other guests seemed to feel the same. Good value if you stuff yourself and get very drunk but otherwise expensive.
