Although there was a delay with check in, they more than made up for it by upgrading my room to a fabulous ocean view without me even requesting any form of compenstion. Very apologetic and very professional throughout. The breakfast buffet was fabulous, lots to choose from and I had one of the best meals I'd had during my two weeks in Cuba in the gourmet restaurant. I found everyone very friendly and it was endearing to see how the hotel staff interacted with each other, a great testament to the Cuban people. The pool is amazing and even though the hotel was busy there were always sunbeds to be found.

The lifts but this wasn't specific to this hotel and something I had expected. A little patience is necessary but no big deal. It's a little far out but after a cycle tour of Vinales I was glad for the getaway. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is within minutes of a bus stop where you can catch two buses to Edinburgh City Centre.  Buses are very frequent but make sure you have correct money for the bus, as they do not give change.  The Hotel is in a peaceful area and there is car parking at the hotel which is a plus.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the food good.  Hotel directions which are on their website are very good.

We had one of the smallest rooms in the attic and the stairs to the attic were very narrow.  No lift.  We also found out a single person was in a much bigger room next door which rankled a bit.  The Menu is a bit limited and only on our last day was the soup changed on the Specials board.  Otherwise it had been the same for three days.

The hotel was spotlessly clean and the room was cleaned to a good standard.  I cannot comment on many of the facilities as I visited over the New Year so, of course, a lot of the facilities weren't open.  The staff were all friendly and professional.

The hotel is about 6 years old but the decor is circa 1970's, beige, brown and cream all over with dated looking fittings.  The standard bedroom was small and again the brown and beige theme which made it very depressing, the bathroom was adequate.  There was nasty cheap child sized  plastic furniture on the balcony,  not good enough for a 5* hotel.   The mini bar in the room was a joke, an old fridge which was warm and contained 3 bottles of still water, 2 bottles of fizzy water and 2 cartons of fruit juice, no beer, pop, crisps or nuts.   Again not 5* standard.    The food was well cooked but there was an abundance of chicken and turkey cooked in various disguises, OK if you like these meats, personally I don't.   The gala dinner on New Years Eve was inedible, and judging by the amounts left on plates many people thought the same.       All drinks are local even though it does say on the hotel web site that there are some imported drinks available, whether this is just for the summer season I don't know.  But I would expect it to be the same all year round.    The choice of cocktails is very limited.    This is certainly not up to a 5* standard hotel in many ways, needles to say I will not be visiting it again.

Some of the employees at the front door were so mean and not so helpful. We had a lot of bags when we were going to go home and we asked one of the employes if they could help us and the answer was "no i dont want to go out and catch a cold", he could just had hold up the door. But like most people in new york he was not nice. And also the cleaners, we had two signs on the door that said "do not disturb" but still they knockdd on our door twice and opened it up when we still were in the room and we scremed "no thanku".   The bathrooms on the floor that we stayed in were horrible. There were holes in the cieling and the showers were terrible and disgusting, we could not shower there. We had to go down to the lockerrooms to be able to shower and go to the bathroom. Because the bathrooms were soo disgusting, words cant describe them. And the wifi that was supposed to work never did. Even though the info disk sayd that there were nothing wrong with it, but it didnt work to a lot of people. And our room cards stopped working all the time, we had to go to the info disk to change them at least 3 or 4 times. The bunk beds were hard, we got back pains from them. They were like normal teo beds that they had just screwed up on the other one so they didnt feel so stable. But you get what you pay for. But ive paid less for hostles before and they have been much better than this.   We also didnt get any information when we arried we just got our keys and room number. They did not tell us about the bathroom code or the gym or store or lockeroom, wifi etc.   So our experience was not nice and we couldnt wait to get out of there.

She was extremely helpful, and very knowledgeable, she gave us some great advice for our day of sightseeing in the city. The hotel is only a 20 minute walk in the centre of the city, with a fantastic view (if you're on the right side of the building) of the sea and the snowy mountains. Very fast check in, staff were polite and helpful. Quality of room was great (At first) view over the airport kept the kids interested. Food from the bar was tasty and the breakfast was more than adequate.     If we ever need a Heathrow airport would stay again.

Room key for elevator was difficult to use (hit or miss). The hotel is in a great location, in the centre of all the action in Causeway Bay. The room was kept clean and fresh towels were delivered daily.

We were in room 509 and the functionality of the room was not thought through very well. Rather than a bathroom, we had a wet room (toilet, sink and shower all in the one area), meaning if one person had a shower, the other needed to wear shoes into the bathroom if they didn't want wet feet, same goes for at night with pajamas on.     The exhaust fan in the bathroom when turned off still moved, but moved in an opposite direction, so rather than air going out, it came in, we constantly had a smell of McDonalds coming into our bedroom and also in the middle of winter it was brining in the 10 degree air, rather than keep the warmth in.     The lifts were probably the most frustrating thing of this stay. They are old and programmed to always go back to the Ground floor when not in use, meaning you always needed to wait for a lift and when you wanted to get the lift up, you had to go down to Ground and then up again.

For me, the main advantage of staying in Two Seasons Boracay is location!  Located on the northern part of the island (Station 1), you are only a few steps away from the best beachfront in all of Boracay.  Their rooms are simple, yet functional and clean.  In terms of value for money, they are not as pricey as some of the bigger resorts or hotels in Station 1, though it can be quite expensive especially around the Super Peak season.  Their restaurant (Bar Lo) offers excellent food, and their happy hour which starts as early as 1pm is simply awesome for those who want to start partying early (try their mojito).  They have a fairly good-sized pool (though never swam), and the airport transfers though a bit expensive was on time and organized despite the busy season in and around the ports.

Being a very busy time (around New Year's), the staff appeared at times overwhelmed by the crowd.  There were a few instances that they forget our order, and we had to follow up a few times.  Maybe they need to staff up during the Holidays?  But no big deal, as the staff is very friendly and they try their best.

For me, the main advantage of staying in Two Seasons Boracay is location!  Located on the northern part of the island (Station 1), you are only a few steps away from the best beachfront in all of Boracay.  Their rooms are simple, yet functional and clean.  In terms of value for money, they are not as pricey as some of the bigger resorts or hotels in Station 1, though it can be quite expensive especially around the Super Peak season.  Their restaurant (Bar Lo) offers excellent food, and their happy hour which starts as early as 1pm is simply awesome for those who want to start partying early (try their mojito).  They have a fairly good-sized pool (though never swam), and the airport transfers though a bit expensive was on time and organized despite the busy season in and around the ports.

Being a very busy time (around New Year's), the staff appeared at times overwhelmed by the crowd.  There were a few instances that they forget our order, and we had to follow up a few times.  Maybe they need to staff up during the Holidays?  But no big deal, as the staff is very friendly and they try their best.

Turkish 5 stars means in this case 4 minus. A lot of food but poor quality. Exotic groups and conferences make this place  look and feel like a busy railwaystation (at least wintertime). If you look for a quiet place to relax forget it....

Very friendly and helpful staff, even saved us some money on their own initiative. Actually closer to the beach than many large hotels that claim to be directly on the beach. Also wery easy to vary the "all inclusive" with other places and restauraants, since it is in the villige of Varadero

Generally try to stay close to native Cuban food, it is a tropical country so the cooking of meat is not always what one is used to. If you got favorite spices, bring them with, the food is rather blend, at least to a Swede.     Although it has nothing to do with the hotel itself, stick to the yellow state taxis until you know what the cost should be. It also saves on the enviroment. And, if you are booking yourself from Europe, stay away from London and Canadian Air, especially in combination. It did cost us to days in airports, instead of on the beach!

We enjoyed our three night stay in this hotel.  We liked the hotel and loved the courtyard with the orange trees and the twittering of the many birds nesting in the large evergreen tree.  They sang first thing in the morning, before they decided to fly off for the day and return in the evening when they commenced their concert again.  The breakfast was very good, with something for everyone.  The location I would recommend as the hotel was in a quiet back street with easy access to local shops, bakeries, the fabulous food market and cafes.  I plan on booking this hotel for my son and his friend for a birthday treat, also my husband and I plan on returning next time we are in Seville.
We did not decide to eat our evening meal in this hotel as the dining area was ideal for breakfast but not private and cozy enough for an evening meal.

December 2014.  We had a lovely 5 day stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel, the position of the Hotel on the beach and rooms were excellent.  Every one of the staff were so friendly and helpful.  We loved the little touches like the towels folded into different shapes each day and the chocolates left when our beds were turned down for the night.  Also the home baked cookies each night were delicious.  We would definitely go back for another holiday there and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
A chair or small table in the bathroom to put clothes on whilst in the shower would be the only thing I would recommend, everything else was great.

It was a new modern hotel near the airport with free shuttle so it was perfect in this . Even because it is located outside Abidjan is good.   Good but expensive breakfast.

Rooms were small but it would be OK if it was better organized. There was not enough space for everything, for your bags, for example, just a chair and small table. There was also a bench but if you put it there the bags had no place to sit on.  There was no curtain but than sliding wall to the balcony and it was not really successful solution.  There is no bathroom, sink is directly in the room, shower cubicle with vitrified door so you have nothing private when you wash and showers, you could say. If you do not close the wall towards the balcony while you wash and showers, all can see one and that is not good.  The shower is not good either, not hand shower is it, but a giant shower up on so you get completely drenched. Halt on the floor, it is also, no wash bowl in the cabin either so you have to put soap on the floor.  The room is cheaper if you book it via Hotelopia. We booked then one room to have the night before departing back home and it was 20 EUR more expensive, oddly enough. The price through Hotelopia was already too much, but this other was unreasonable price.

Since it's "all inclusive" there's a few younger guests drinking all day by the pool and maybe not beeing the niciest to staff and other guests.

Reception was not so helpful. We booked on our own and maybe if you book via an organisation you will get more information. There's only one computer for internet and it is slow and expensive. The hotel is located in the "begining" of Varadero so not so close to the main streets which menas you have to walk a bit or take a taxi/scooter to see something nice outside the hotel. Since it's "all inclusive" there's a few younger guests drinking all day by the pool and maybe not beeing the niciest to staff and other guests.

There is a shopping center attached to the hotel with a number of restaurants and there are a number of Thai restaurants close by. WiFi internet is provided free of charge. Location is reasonable for access to the rest of the city. Plenty of secure parking if you have a car.

The so called American breakfast was not up to standard and neither was the service of the cooks on hand. I waited at least 10 minutes to be served and I was second in the line. Thai people were favored first rather than who was in line first. I wasn't the only traveler finding this out. My stay was for a total of 15 night with breakfast. I only ate there for the first morning. I was so disappointed with the breakfast and service I found another cafe' restaurant to have my breakfast at. This is supposed to be the number one hotel in Ubon and for that reason I did expect more staff to be able to speak English. The room was nice and it was clean, but as for the rest of it, very ordinary!

There were not any full length mirrors in the rooms.  The first evening there,we went to the restaurant at 7.30 and there was hardly any food left and everyone was very dissapointed in the quality of what was offered.  After queing for more than half an hour to see the customer relations representative who told us to be there at 10 in the morning, the receptionists who was aware that we were all waiting decided to let us know that the representative was at a meeting and wouldn't be there until 12.It completely wasted a morning and many people were not happy.  In the bar,the men of our party were standing up as there were not enough seats.They were told that they couldn't stand and to go to another room which was cold so stayed where they were.The bar staff were not helpful at all and were quite rude.  On the New Years Eve gala night,we were told to go down to the ball room at 7 but had to queue outside for quite some time and were very dissapointed not to be offered drinks or appetizers as is usual on such occations.
The rooms were comfortable.

Value for money in this hotel is great! But don't expect the service or quality of a 5 star hotel, this hotel would rate 2 stars in Europe. All inclusive includes Efes beer on tap, red and white wine, raki, vodka and whisky (turkish brands), Coca Cola and Fanta. The hotel was clean and in a good location near la rambla, but still "on the other side of the tracks." The room was very modern and unique compared to other hotels we've stayed in, and would have been good for one night (or to bring your lady of the night).

More negative than positive. This hotel was very loud for somewhere you would expect to have soundproof walls. There was no storage in the room for clothes except for four hangers, so we couldn't really unpack for our five nights there. There were no plugs/outlets anywhere except the bathroom, no bedside table or clock, no table or chairs or furniture of any kind. Not the place to have an extended stay. Finally, the rainfall shower (tho nice) flooded the entire floor each time we used it and soaked our clothes and bags (which were on the floor cuz there was nowhere else to put them). Also, the hotel cleaning staff was very loud and unprofessional in the mornings, and the front desk gave us the wrong advice on a couple questions.

seaview room: noisy~  no window room: air not good, noisy~  we had asked for late check-out for the last day when we booked these rooms, but they didn't inform us they could not free for it even we checked-in. The hotel was beautiful from the foyer through to our room.  The room and bathroom were spacious and the bed was comfortable.  Great location close to shopping area and tourist sites.  Breakfast was good with a wide variety of foods from cereals to eggs, sausages, cold meats, cheese and fruit.  Highly recommended.

Breakfast was good with a wide variety of foods from cereals to eggs, sausages, cold meats, cheese and fruit.  Highly recommended.

When i arrived at the hotel i found my apartment was very close to the rest of my family & friends who had arrived four days previously.The apartment was spotless & well equipped. The public areas were very clean & tidy. Food was varied & there was something for everyone. I was only in for the evening entertainment on one occasion & thoroughly enjoyed it. Winning 120 euros helped! Staff are very friendly & helpful. Food tended to be cool but there was a microwave available if required. I would certainly stay here again.
Not really a negative but a handrail for the stairs down into the hotel would be useful. They tend to get slippy when it rains.

Absolutely the worst management I´ve ever met in a hotel! The behaved aggressive and even violent we we informed that we had other plans than celebrating New Years eve in the hotel. They pushed out our prebooked taxidriver out down the stairs and when one of our youngsters came back to the room 1 am. someone had stolen his iPhone from the locked hotel room. When he turned to the management for assistant to report the theft the would´t help him because the phone was not kept in the safe.   In one of our rooms the safe did´nt even work!

I can't find fault with the hotel or my experience there. The staff were professional, welcoming and helpful at reception.  They handled my enquiries competently in English. If you are at all interested in architecture or just being in a nice place, the hotel is stunning. The bedroom was equally as stunning. Some lovely design features, luxurious, and a view of the telecom tower from the window. The bar did happy hour for cocktails in the early evening and we were also able to use the sauna with gowns provided for no additional charge.    Great location, 1 minute walk to the station, loads of cafés, restaurants and bars.     The best value hotel I have stayed in.

We booked three non-smoking rooms on for our family (from 21 to 24 Dec 2013) but to our surprise, the whole floor and bedroom smelled like guests were smoking at this level. Given the Cuban standards, this was really a five star hotel.  However in europe, it would qualify as to 3 stars at most, the room painting and the power switch, plugs, etc were not 100% correctly installed but it was fully functional and looking beautiful with a hint of caribbean authentic inproperness. The resort at all was great really!
Only negative is the food. There is plenty of it in all inclusive stay, but its almost never tasty :(

We arrived late at night after a long flight to be told our room had no electric or hot water . We then had to move to another hotel across the road. I honestly think they had overbooked  and had an arrangement with the central park hotel.  We returned in the morning and no room was available . We returned at lunchtime with our cases and still no room . We returned an hour later and with the lift out of working order had to carry our cases up six flights of stairs. There was no sign of help from the porters. We were only in Havana three days and by this time had lost half a day. The lift did not work then every time we wanted to go to our room had to climb the stairs tome and again and when you get to the bottom and find you have forgotten your camera is not fun.  The hotel did not have WiFi there was no sign of our paid for complementary drink and we went in the bar and the barman gave me the dregs of a bottle of red wine and when I said it was terrible he just took it away and went back to the kitchen.  I would never stay there the central park hotel is far superior.

- Very good value for money: all inclusive including breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, drinks (water, alcoholic, non-alcoholic)  - Fantastic location  - Friendly staff

- Room was in reasonable size but the cleaning staff didn't do a very good job. I stayed for 6 nights and there was some hair from previous guests and a leaf on the floor that were never cleaned even when I checked out. They seemed to be very tight with supplies as well, as I was provided with only 1 towel per day and the shampoo was never replaced after I used up mine after the first night.  - Food provided in the buffets was basic. Taste was ok. All inclusive but do not have high expectation.  - Had to wear a bright orange wristband for them to identify hotel guests from the moment of check-in until check-out. There is no way of taking it off. I was forced to wear it for 7 days even when I was showering, sleeping, sunbathing, eating out and clubbing. I raised this to the staff but I was told I wouldn't be able to enter the hotel if I took it off.

From the moment the front desk people smiled at me, I felt very welcome at this hotel. Very easy to find, and parking is a breeze.   My reservation was prepaid by internet site Hotelopia, and registration went smoothly.  The soaps and natural lotions and potions provided were excellent, no need to carry these things from home (TSA can be a pain about that.)  I forgot a corkscrew for my wine bottle, but the barman at the Hub restaurant was pleased to open it.   Great room temperature controls, wonderful bathtub.   Free high speed internet.  Fast printer in the lobby allowed me to print my documents rather than lug heavy paperwork on trains, planes, and automobiles.  This hotel is great !!!

On arrival I was told that there was no rooms available and that they hotel had been fully booked for 4 months.  They could not offer a refund due to me not booking directly. They did find me another place to stay which was absolutely horrible in comparison.  After trying to contact the online booking company hotelopia they have also not responded. So all in all I paid for a room and a service and received nothing. In my opinion the whole experience was unprofessional and I would NOT recommend hotelopia or Parklake hotel Shepperton. Not good enough.

This is about the 5th time we have stayed here.  This time, because of the exchange rate we had a junior suite.  Room and room facilities were very good.  Staff as always were very helpful.

The only real negative is actually a big one.  There is no free WiFi.  After much discussion I was given a few hours free - well done the manager!    In this day and age WiFi must be provided free.  In the future it will be absolute deal breaker for me.  No free WiFi - no stay at that hotel.

we arrived at the hotel to be checked in quickly, professionally and with a smile.there were also freshly baked cookies and popcorn for us to take if we wanted( and the cookies were great)these were on offer most days.  room was a good size with flat screen tv ,microwave, fridge, ironing board, iron and coffee maker.great sized bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries.bathroom also has a hairdryer.house keeping came in every day and did a good job.  theres a laundry room if you need it and the outdoor pool is heated.  breakfast was very good and constantly being topped up. there was juice, tea,coffee, milk, yogurts,cereal,fruits,eggs,sausage,ham,toast,bagaels,waffles,pastries and muffins.  there was no in room safe but you can get a safety deposit box at reception.  there is a walmart about 3 mins drive away and some restaurants within walking distance.all in all a clean, spacious, friendly and comfortable hotel.

The lift is very slow and it always took up to 10 mins for it. The construction work nearby woke us up every morning at 7 am and even when we made a complaint with the reception the staff attitude seems to be sick of handing all the noise complaints and told us to bare with it and they do not have any other rooms for us to move to and they cannot do anything about it. The guest complaint handing definitely needs staff training for the future improvements. Moreover we were not given a tablet throughout our stay as the previous guest have cracked the screen of the room tablet and staff did not follow up and organizing another tablet for us which is a bit disappointed.
Everything is clean and tidy within the hotel and most importantly it is very new.

The lift is very slow and it always took up to 10 mins for it. Awesome room and balcony! Unreal view of the valley below. Nice pool and bar and sitting areas. The travel guy in the lobby during the day speaks perfect english and is friendly.

No one at the front desk speaks english. It's ok we have a phrase book and can get by, but really, no english, and you work in international hospitality? Why pay the extra to stay in a fancy hotel? Front desk guys are really miserable. I'm not sure they like their jobs which is weird you would think they would be happy to even have good jobs and it's a nice environment. Went to the restaurant as it's the only one near by as this place is on a hill. They were out of most food and the food that came was the worst quality of food the entire trip nothing compared to how bad it was. They should be embarrassed as this hotel was not cheap. Casa's are the way to go people.

Booked to stay for 4 nights.check-in Monday and to check out Friday. Wednesday night just after I fell asleep, heard banging on the door. Got up and headed for the door and saw that someone has already unlatched the door open with a tool in their hand and tried to come into my room. I think it may have been the hotel night manager and security man. when i got to the door and asked what was happening, one of them just said no one was suppose to be in this room and that i was to have checked out at 12. Then the man said "sorry" and left.I thought he would go back to his office and checked it all out and that would be the end of it. But, no, when he got back to his office, he phoned me up in the middle of the night to ask me what was my full name and i felt like I was being Interrogated.I gave him my full name and told him I'm very tired and sleepy and I'm only due to check out on Friday. If there's any errors it must have been made by their hotel staff so checked with them. After that I couldn't get any peace of mind for my remaining holidays. I was worried they may also go disturb my parents who are in their 80s and staying in the adjoining room. I don't know why they cannot approach the guest during the afternoon or evening If the check out time is at 12 noon.Instead they choose to force themselves into the guest room while the guest is asleep.There must be some kind of rights for the paying guest.  The other issue was my room hot water wasn't hot enough. I reported it but there was no change.

Very close to the Garden State Parkway, this is a convenient place to recharge and refresh your travel weary bones.  The front desk experience is a pleasure.  My fifth floor room was clean, included refrigerator and microwave plus coffee pot.  My king bed had four large very soft pillows for comfortable sleeping.   I enjoyed the free internet and was able to take my memory stick to the lobby for printing.  They gave me a coupon for a free breakfast in the first floor restaurant, which tasted absolutely wonderful, with delightful service from pretty ladies.  The night time bar was friendly.   The American newspaper USA Today was free, and the hotel gave me oranges and apples to take on my way.  time During my stay there was also a large group from China there who seemed to be very happy with the hotel as they received special help with their mountain of luggage.  One outstanding person at reception is called Philomena, and I wish to give thanks to this fine lady.  What makes this hotel extra special are the many kind thoughtful people who work there.  I will be back....

Just came back from a week long stay at Liki Tiki. Overall had a great stay.    The staff were all pleasant, helpful and very nice when you needed help. We declined partaking in the timeshare pitch and were not pressured at all.     The resort itself was nicely kept. Lots of activities for the little ones. We played mini-golf, rode the paddle boats, the surrey bike etc. Went to the movie night for the kids one of the evenings. There were activities every day that we could do on the days we weren't in the parks.    It was a little on the cooler side the week we were there so we didn't use the water park (it is indeed not heated and quite chilly) so the few days that we went swimming we used one of the heated pools and it was quite nice.    Location wise, it's about 10-15 min drive to Disney and 20-25 min to Universal. I would only recommend staying here if you have a car rented for your vacation as not much within walking distance, but there is everything you could need along the 192 in minutes with a car (restaurants, grocery stores, Target Super Store etc.)    Overall it was perfect for the price we paid.     I'd definitely stay here again.

Not entirely negative but we had asked to be put in one of the upgraded buildings but unfortunately they did not have any rooms available when we checked in. We were instead put in the 1200 building in the back of the resort. While I agree with some other reviews that the older rooms appear a bit worn, they were clean and really big so we had no issues.    If you're expecting a 5 Star resort with immaculate rooms you won't get that. But you're not paying 5 Star Resort prices. On the flip side you're getting more than you're typical hotel by having separate rooms, full kitchen etc.

Good location, close to the public transport and supermarkets. Good rooms with daily room-service and full set of kitchen equipment. Two swimming pools, one of them with very nice view, but cold.    This is a good location for families with small and not so small kids. I would visit this hotel again.

Cockroaches in the room - we killed a big one every 1-2 days, this is the reason why I give Fair for cleanliness. The room itself was clean, but they were coming mostly from the ventilation in the bathroom and it should be possible to do something to clean them there. The "heated" swimming pool was actually quite cold.     It is about time to start thinking about renovating some of the room equipement.    The wirless internet is expensive - 5 EUR per day is crasy. However there are many free wifi acces points around in coffees.   Spanish hotels should awake for the competition - every single hotel in Greece offers free wifi to its clients.

Nice moorish/colonial architecture with wings of pre-revolutionary history. It's situated perfectly between Habana Vieja, Centro Habana and Malecon. The pool area is great for beeing this central in town. Nice swims!

The first room we got was small, smelled of molds and with a view directly into a brick wall. We asked to change it, and we got a very nice, spacious room with a french balcony towards the Prado.  Evidently, they've got bad rooms and good rooms for the same price. So take the advice if you're not satisfied with the room, change it! They might say the hotel is fully booked, but just keep on complaining and you'll get a nicer room.  Maintenance is rather poor all over, so be prepared of disfunctioning (and flowing) WC:s, showers, hair dryers etc. The janitor will try to solve the problem, but only temporarily.

Glad we stayed as the hotel is so close to the ruins and is set in beautiful gardens with decent bird watching but something just was not right. The stiff, awkward service in reception and the restaurant did not help and it felt like the place was always trying to up sell. The menu did not help as it excluded tax which was added when the bill arrived.    We had lunch, dinner and breakfast and all the food was fairly good which was a bonus.    The room is quaint and rustic, comfortable enough though for a nights stay.    The hotel arranged a guide for the ruins which cost about £37 for the two of us plus the £9 entrance fee each and it was far better than just wondering about wondering on our own, it did bring it alive.    The hotel is fine for a stop off but does need to update the service to a more relaxed style and possible update the room interiors.

Heating / air conditioning not self explanatory.   Curtains difficult to open / close due to mechanism being broken.   Damage to plaster on corners of some walls.

Hotel appeared to require much TLC. I can see that it was a good hotel in its time, but we had to ask for many things to be fixed which I shouldn´t have to do on holiday. We had the Honeymoon Villa with pool, but the pictures on the website paints a much different picture to what it is in reality.  The staff were lovely, however not very efficient, couldn´t help much with queries on the surrounding area, and had a habit of forgetting what you had asked within 2 mins of the request being made.  It is a shame as the you can see what the hotel was like years ago and with a bit of attention it could be good again.

This hotel has a range of facilities, however the facilities are located far away from one another. In order to get to these facilities, one must catch a buggy. Buggies are very irregular.

Bad service...Not a hotel for those with walking problems as transport buggies do not come as regularly as they should and do not transport to rooms. The complex is very large. We had a triple room that was booked months before our stay. We were booked at this hotel on two separate occasions - on neither occasion was the third bed made up despite the manager clearly saying that they were. On our second stay the sofa bed collapsed and was propped up with a coffee table underneath. Certainly not a 5 hotel. The food in the general dining room was buffet which was cheap quality. I would NOT recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.

They always say that first impressions count on they really do in this case.  The staff where professional but warm and friendly.  Quick checking in process and up in our room in 10 minutes.   The buffet breakfast had enough choice to suit all and the staff where wonderful.  When asked for a map, they give us good directions and good places to visit.  Do not know what they put in the water here but all staff where absolutely wonderful.     We have booked again for the end of February.

We where on the 3rd floor overlooking the pleasure beach which was good but we could here them working early in the morning so not good for those who like a late rise.  I would presume that the bedrooms on the front would be much quieter.  Though the kids will love watching the rides go by.  It did not spoil our stay.

Upgraded to suite beachfront 801 and quite honestly it doesn't get any better than this!    The room was nothing short of spectacular.    Make certain you tip Lacell properly for all of his hard work and dedication.    All personnel at the front desk are fantastic but Jordan in particular shines like a star.    I'll be returning for a second night tomorrow before setting sail on a second cruise but to be honest I rather regret not simply staying put at the Atlantic Resort & Spa for the duration of my vacation.    You just can't go wrong with the AR&S. I've stayed at the Hilton, Ocean B and several other Fort Lauderdale hotels but I can designate the Atlantic Resort and Spa as my absolute favourite. Going forward this hotel will be the one I choose for all of my future vacations.

Although we booked in the Monsoon Lodge we were upgraded to a Beach Villa as routine maintenance was going on in the Lodge area. Staff were great and really cared for us. The resort is secluded and in a great spot with plenty of natural wildlife.
It is isolated and you would need transport or a driver to get around but if you can accept that for a few days then definitely book here.

1) Standard Room is considered spacious even for a family of 3.  2) Very clean and nice themed room.  3) Hotel is linked to shopping mall with Supermart Giant as anchor tenant.  4) Designated free parking lots for hotel guests.  5) Staff was responsive. When we realized that shampoo needed to be replenished, it was done within 5 min of our request.  6) Nice functional pool (although not that big) and gym.  7) Good security. Lift access to different levels of hotel is through room card.  8) Wi-fi is acceptable.  9) Price is considered very reasonable for a purported 4-star rating hotel.

Breakfast service was chaotic with staff not knowing what they should be doing.Coffee was usually served cold, tables had missing cutlery and condiments whilst tables that had been vacated still had dirty plates etc and staff just walk past without clearing away. This is the fourth time in the last 5 years we have stayed here and it appears that increasing the outdoor eating/drinking area has had a negative impact on the level of service at busy times. The hotel seems to be focusing its priority in favor of conference guests at the expense of tourists.

We guested with my husband for 4 night in the end of January'14 and  it was very amaizing staying in Himalaia Soldeu Hotel. We've got cozy clean room and bathroom equiped with all necessary amenities,free WI-FI with good signal,amaizing lobby with soft sofas and lobby bar,good restaurant with excellent cuisine, relaxing SPA that was specially important after all day skiing! All staff are friendly,attentively and courteously. Special thanks a lot to receptionist beauty blond IRINA for the kind support in booking return Novatel bus directly from hotel to Barcelona El Prat airport! Sure we'd stay in this excellent hotel again!
Only one small remark: it needs for the plastic blind for the bath due to avoid of water splashes on the floor.

Decent large place with nice decorations, quite clean and tidy.  Room service was not bad. Same goes for the breakfast.  Most of the time the staff were prompt in the delivery of the service. Buggy service was also prompt to bring us around the resort.

Lots of mosquitos and left my young daughter bad bites! I need to get the staff to come in and smoke the place with mosquito repellent incense every night but still it was not totally effective. And after smoking the place up I was tearing abit from the smokiness..  Was planning to cook simple porridge for my young daughter but the kitchen had no cookery at all. When I asked the staff to get me a pot and cookware. They replied that the kitchen is 'just for show' and we are not suppose to do any cooking at all. The staff were prompt to bring me a microwave but was not able to advise me on the plates or bowls that are microwavable.  Our private pool had a lot of dried leaves and twigs in the water and we called in the staff to clean the pool for us to swim.  Its a self contained villa resort located 20 min away from town, sea and beach. Hence location is not good.

Decent large place with nice decorations, quite clean and tidy.  Room service was not bad. Same goes for the breakfast.  Most of the time the staff were prompt in the delivery of the service. Buggy service was also prompt to bring us around the resort.

Lots of mosquitos and left my young daughter bad bites! I need to get the staff to come in and smoke the place with mosquito repellent incense every night but still it was not totally effective. And after smoking the place up I was tearing abit from the smokiness..  Was planning to cook simple porridge for my young daughter but the kitchen had no cookery at all. When I asked the staff to get me a pot and cookware. They replied that the kitchen is 'just for show' and we are not suppose to do any cooking at all. The staff were prompt to bring me a microwave but was not able to advise me on the plates or bowls that are microwavable.  Our private pool had a lot of dried leaves and twigs in the water and we called in the staff to clean the pool for us to swim.  Its a self contained villa resort located 20 min away from town, sea and beach. Hence location is not good.

This is a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location. The food staff and service were excellent. We had a sea view room on the top (3rd floor no lifts in this hotel) with a balcony which was wonderful to sit out on in the evenings watching the sunset over the ocean.  We actually got married here and the staff made the wedding and our honeymoon fantastic.  Our special thanks go out to Joy and Monica who both went that extra mile to make our wedding day so wonderful.

There are just two negative points to mention the wine in the restaurants is very expensive if you are buying a bottle every night.  They were around £40 a bottle they did have cheaper bottles on the menu but they didn't ever to be available.  So most people ordered bottles of water in the restaurant which was a shame.    The other negative point was the free wi- fi system which did work once you could get into the system and put the password in which you had to do every 24 hours which was a bit of a pain but I understand that the hotel is looking into addressing this.

Got a brilliant deal through Hotelopia for a double room and then an even better one at the hotel itself when we upgraded to the Presidential Room. Staff were very friendly and helpful and both rooms were well appointed - the Presidential is a beautiful room, huge bed with curving walls and a massive bath and walk in shower, lovely views over the park, definitely worth paying a little extra for. The hotel itself has lovely lighting at night with different coloured lights down the walls and the trees lit up with fairy lights - quite magical.

The hotel is stated as 4 stars hotel, but I would give max 2,5 stars. The resort is old, needs a lot repair works. The elevator was never working, during our 2 weeks stay we could use elevator only twice! Shower water was never stable, either it was too hot or too cold. Showering was really bad experience. Dining area was quite unpleasant, as there was seen mold on the walls. Food quality was fair, nothing special. The coffee was good only in lobby bar, in dining area only instant coffee was offered. So-called a la carte restaurants didn´t deserve a la carte name, as the food and service were so poor. Reception was sometimes very unprofessional, we had to wait 4 hours, as they couldn´t find our booking! When they did, no appologies were heard. So, I´m probably not going to stay in Palma Real again, as it certainly is not worth the money.

The receptionist was absolutely brilliant!! We stayed for a concert but were running late so upon checkin she offered to ring us a taxi if we rang down from the room when ready. Then she directed us to the nearest off license when the taxi driver proved useless! She gave us advice on the best bars etc she was just brilliant, really went out of her way to help us any way shape or form! I had to tip her she was just so great!

The bar boasted great cocktails only to have no cocktail mixture upon arrival. Apart from that all staff were excellent and the hotel was great value for money, im a clean freak and couldnt fault it so definite thumbs up and would highly recommend! Parking is on street though and its free from Saturday evening and all Sunday so then would be the best time to stay for drivers!

Its mainly about the view. A postcard out every single window. Like many of the hotels in cuba this is a faded beauty.  Mainly geared toward the European bus tour clientele, the food is......stable and reliable. For all the great coffee I had throughout Cuba, I had trouble finding a good cup in Vinales and Havana.    A great base from which to explore this beautiful and friendly region of the country.
The regular third world thing; lumpy beds, inconsistent water supply temperature. But hey, you're in the third world what a ya expect?

Excellent value so near to the centre of KL    We were very impressed when we arrived, very smart and professional reception. The room was average size and contained everything that we needed for a few days stay in KualaLumpur. It was very clean and well maintained, the maid "made up" the room each day with clean towels and sheets. The inclusive breakfast was good - fruit juice, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage,beans, scotch pancakes, toast, jam, tea and coffee. There was also a selection of Malaysian dishes. Free WiFi was available in the room. Easy to walk to KLSentral, the hub for the various train lines. Cheap and frequent trains to all the popular tourist sites within 10 mins.  The only downside is the area of "Brickfields" around the hotel is a little untidy and run down. However we wandered around at night, walking to the local restaurants and never felt uneasy or threatened. The local people were friendly and helpful. In a more salubrious area the hotel would command much higher rates. We would certainly stay again.    If your arrival point in the city is KL Sentral, follow these walking directions to the hotel:  Take the left hand exit which is next to the KLIA ticket office. Then turn right following sign to Brickfields and Monorail. Take the down escalator on your left and at the bottom do a 'u' turn and walk along in the same direction as the traffic. Follow the pavement around to the right to a cross roads, you should now see the hotel ahead, Summer View Hotel in large letters at the top. Cross straight across this road and keep walking past YMCA. The hotel is on your left. It is less than 10 minutes walk from KL Sentral

This hotel is so well located near the main art galleries of Madrid:the Prado, Reina Sofia ( I could monitor the queues for free entry evenings from my hotel balcony)and Thyssen-Bornemisza  the botanic gardens and the magnificent El Retiro park; the convenience of Atocha Railway station across the road means you have access to the excellent RENFE trains which enabled me to undertake day trips to cities/towns of note eg Aranjuez and Toledo which lie within a hour's travel from Madrid.   Buses outside the hotel took you right to the doorstep of Plaza Mayor, if you chose not to use the Metro. And any tourist  65 and over can purchase a concession card (with proof of age- Passport)and travel on trains in Spain very cheaply. There is also a Tourist Information Van parked in the plaza adjacent to Sofia Reina (and literally 'next door' to the hotel), staffed by young English-speaking Spaniards, who are extremely helpful in providing maps and information about what's happening in Madrid, at the time of your visit. Hotel staff were also courteous and helpful. This is my second stay at the Hotel ( I was there for a week in May in 2012) and I would highly recommend it, for all the above reasons and its excellent value for money, compared to other major hotels in the area.

The hotel pretends to be a 3 star establishment, nothing could be further from the truth. The place is disorganised, the staff unprofessional, the waiters are unable to take breakfast orders and the food when it arrives is unappealing. On arriving the receptionist claimed she had no record of my booking but after 15 mins managed to find it. The room was quite small and even though i had booked a room for 2 people, i was only provided with 1 towel ! the bedroom had chewing gum on the floor and the bathroom was filthy, getting the room was a challenge. The safety box was also broken, the staff simply shrugged off these complaints. The omelette for breakfast was greasy and the coffee simply tasteless brown water.   Avoid this hotel at all costs, there are better options.

Having travelled to NY a number of times before this was our first stay in Fitzpatricks. It has a Super Location across the road from Grand Central station,10 min walk from Times sq. The staff were very friendly and helpful and Mr. Garfield the concierge could not do enough for us during our stay. The room was spacious by New York standards and very clean and comfy. We grabbed dinner and a few drinks in the wheeltapper bar next door and could not fault it, great atmosphere in the bar at night. The rooms are very good value for the price and will definitely be staying there again.

Some small things I wouldn't mention if it were a budget hotel: the remote controls only worked if we stood right in front of the television/ the shower screen and grouting looked shabby and needed a scrub, our waitress forgot to take our hot food order and once she had, it took half an hour to arrive (two other couples who came down after us got there food before us) and what we'd ordered was slightly wrong/ the lovely aromatherapy associates shower gel in the bathroom appeared to have been used already/ the furniture in the lounge wasn't really made for relaxing on/ parts of the room were a bit dusty/I had to park on the street or be blocked in a space but if I'd arrived earlier on the Saturday or midweek I wouldn't have had this option due to parking restrictions/there was an Agatha Christie book in the room entitled '10 Little Niggers'.

Since its been taken over by Hilton from Waldorf Astoria the standards have gone down, the standards of the pool area could have been renewed and freshened up, I was looking forward to staying here as I did last year and Im disappointed as this is a 5* rated hotel and it was when Waldorf Astoria had owned it but now very disappointed as standards of luxury have slightly gone down. Down to the smallest details as the glasses in the rooms were gorgeous last year but this year they are like something you would find in a Holiday Inn. If you have stayed in this hotel before when it was part of the Waldorf Astoria chain and are going back I wouldnt expect the same standards as before and if you would be going here for the 1st time it may be different as it is still a lovely hotel. The breakfast you get is also quite bland and boring, you will get your usual few bits but nothing special so I would recommend making sure you have planned lunch. It gives you the info of there being a games room but when we have stayed there it has always been closed. There are also lights around the glass shields on balconies and some which are not working properly and flashing which looks like a motel out of an american movie.

What a fabulous hotel! Nothing was too much trouble. All the staff were professional, friendly, and so helpful. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the extra touches that were provided in addition to a lovely letter from the guest relations manager were most appreciated. Yana deserves a special mention for excellent service. Many of the staff spoke very good English and were able to help us with information and directions which really helped us make the most of our stay in the beautiful city of Moscow. Great location situated so close to Red Square and metro. We feel very fortunate to have stayed at the best hotel in the city!
Nothing negative to mention all positive!

We had a 1 night stay in february.  Lovely beach front locaton.   Very comfortable and warm room with sea views. Clean public areas, room and bathroom very clean and well presented.    Added bonus was to have a fridge and good sized flat screen tv.  Sauna, Hammam and indoor pools were lovely with sea views from the windows.  All in all a very nice hotel, and very good value for money in the winter months.  Maybe not what we would class as 5* but definitely a good 4*

Our room had an adjoining door, which meant we could hear the neighbours quite clearly.  At check in we were not given any information as to what time meals were, directions to the room and general hotel info, we had to ask on every point.   Hotel is somewhat remote, no nearby bars, shops or restaurants. Lovely spot on the beach though, so this kind of ruled out the lack of other amenities.

All the staff were excellent - welcoming, alert, enthusiastic and helpful. We stayed two nights enjoying the Valentine's menu on the first evening. Parking on site was useful, and the location was excellent just below the bargate to explore the historic part as well as an easy walk to all the shops. A bus stop is just outside and a free bus links dock and railway station, going past the art gallery and seacity museum.

With more investment in the interior design and upkeep this could easily be the 4* hotel it claims to be. As it is, in a standard room, the tiles in the bathroom and the woodwork around the windows are showing mould, and the corridors all show chips, scuffs and marks in the relentless mushroom grey paint which may nod to history but makes the public areas of the hotel seem rather dingey. However, the walls display a nice arrray of photos of Southampton, and the Jane Austen suite where she celebrated her 18th birthday, now bookable for conference or wedding reception is attractively papered in pale blue regency stripe.

Counter lady staff provided a free extension of 1 hour for checkout at 1pm. However, the next shift counter staff reneged on the promise and requested me to "depart" exactly at 12pm checkout time otherwise pay the extended hour charge. This tells alot on their level of customer service.    In addition, alot of items in the room was not functioning well or cause discomfort. This includes a faulty safe, easily choked floor trap in the bathroom, faulty downlight, big and small cockroaches running around in the room.    If you could bear these inconveniences, then it would be a good deal.

Stayed for two seperate nights (Friday and Sunday.) Check in was efficient. Staff were polite and helpful. Communal areas were clean and tidy and there was ample space for the number of guests.Rooms were practical but well equiped and clean. Breakfast was basic but all very nice, with lots of choice and well cooked and presented. I had a problem at the end of the day and the staff were very keen to help. Excellent value for money and great location for shops, culture, nightlife, dining etc.

On the Saturday morning when I checked out i realised I had left my second suitcase in the room and had left some small items of clothing and a new pair of jeans in the drawer in the wardrobe. I rang the hotel to ask if the items had been found and was told that they would check with housekeeping. When I returned to the hotel on the Sunday nobody had checked. On the Monday morning when I checked out housekeeping came up to see me to let me know that NO items had been handed in from the room. The person who serviced the room on the Saturday was not at work that day so the housekeeping manager took details of the items lost and my mobile number and said that he would ring me back the following day (Tuesday) when he had investigated. It is now Thursday and no call. Therefore, it became a very expensive weekend as I had to purchase a new suitcase, pair of jeans, socks, underwear and small clothing items! My fault I know for not checking the wardrobe before I left but as housekeeping are meant to keep any items found in rooms in lost property I dont know how such large items could have gone unnoticed. Also am disappointed that the housekeeping manger who was so lovely and helpful to my face did not call me as promised even if it was to say they items had not been located. That said the hotel is such value for money that it would not put me off staying there again. (Third visit this year so far.)

Staff were exceptionally friendly, especially to my young daughter.  They will make pasta or fries for your children if they .  Room was very clean, a nice size and with wonderful views of the village of Wengen, the Jungfrau and up the Lauterbrunnen valley.  The bar and lounge area is very cosy, especially when the fire is blazing.  They will pick you up/drop you off at the train station when you arrive/leave and make you a packed lunch if leaving early.  It is easy to see why people come here time and time again - this was my second visit and if I return to Wengen I will stay here again.

It is a little bit of a walk from the centre (but provide a lift when you arrive/leave), childrens play area is downstairs in the basement and was dark and unloved, it would be great if this moved upstairs into the reading room (though there is a table football there)

This hotel does what it does very well indeed! I could not fault rooms, service, cleanliness, facilities. The food is not 'fine dining', but is fresh, varied and plentiful and always available, and who can argue with a 7 course Brazillian meat banquet for no extra charge! The Spa facilities were delightful, a chill out 'cave' and steam room, again included in the 'all inclusive package' with only treatments  as an extra cost ( and quite reasonable). The 11pm finsh for all inc. meant everyone went to bed, so a lovely peaceful night. All in all an excellent choice for a short break. We would definitely go back, excellent value for money. Very impressed! Brilliant facilities for children up to young teens, tots water slides and indoor soft play with their own Jungle themed restaurant.

I know its a minor gripe, but I cannot stand wearing all-inclusive wristbands!! If everyone is A.I. why bother?  Some re-furbishment of pool area, but minimum intrusion from builders/noise. There is plenty of room to get away from them. Dont let it stop you visiting.  The evening entertainment is very old fashioned cabaret ( as is often the case in hotels). But you don't have to watch!

There is nothing good to say about this hotel. I don't even know where to begin in describing how awful this place is. The rooms are described as beach huts, they are not. They are corrugated tin sheds that are not sealed. You will be given a padlock to lock it, which will show when you are out and could easily be broken into. In the description it says "air conditioned rooms" we had a fan, that didn't work. The toilet is just attached to the back of your room (shed) and it has lizards and Mosquitos everywhere. Don't bother trying to flush the toilet as it will just shoot straight back out at you. This was one of the more expensive hotels we booked on our travels and it is the worst place I have ever been in. I would have probably been safer sleeping on the beach. I'm not over exaggerating I've backpacked to a lot of places and never have I seen anything as bad as this place. Stay well away,

This is a very nice hotel, staff are very helpful and friendly. I was there in February so most of the activities were not available. The food is very good and the variety endless. I have been to many hotels in that region and this is one of the best as far as value for money.

It would be nice if the free WIFI was available in the room as most of the other hotels have. I saw pool/snooker tables under a canopy outside covered with plastic, why not put these in the "outdoors" "closed" dining area during winter so the guests have some entertainment in the evening or daytime.

We had an excellent stay at the Table Bay hotel - the room was big and had the most fabulous view directly looking out at Table Mountain.  I doubt that we will ever get a room with such a superb view ever again in our lives.  The hotel is a fabulous 5 star and the facilities were all in line with our expectations.  The position right in the waterfront and attached to the shopping centre cannot be equalled and I would recommend this hotel over any other in the area.  We felt the deal we got through Hotelopia offered a fantastic deal at this fabulous hotel.

The staff at reception could be a bit snooty on occasion and needed to be more "customer service" friendly.  The buffet breakfast, whilst superb, could be improved by having honeycomb - which we'd had previously at the Michelangelo in Sandton City.

I have been at this hotel before and it is extremely pleasant and friendly. Always well catered for and looked after by the staff. The rooms are very comfortable. I was able to watch Liverpool FC game live on television from the comfort of my room. What more could I ask for?  How impressive is that? I have been in the swimming pool and I enjoy taking my breakfast poolside every morning.   The hotel is well situated and they have a private beach area with sun loungers only a short walk away. I would rate this hotel very highly.
I have no disparaging remarks whatsoever.

Staff is very friendly, everything is clean and good. You get your private room with your own entrance and little terrace. Don't book this hotel if you are very fussy, because the shower maybe is not that well decorated, and some of the pavements are not maintained well, but everything else there is very good. Great value for your money. And it is ALL inclusive. They have a pool and a nice beach. And the lovely Santa Maria beach is only 3 stops away with a local bus.

The food is ok, but is the same every day, so after a week we were not that keen on it anymore. Almost non of the staff speaks English.. but that is all over the Havana, not just this Hotel. I was attended to by Heidi when I checked in & she was extremely helpful & patient. Service at all times experienced within the hotel is brisk and efficient with a smile. The room decor & amenities gave a luxurious feel to the place & it is much more convenient than any other hotel in Sentosa as it situated right behind imbiah station & needs no travelling time. The breakfast buffet was also tasty and a good mixture of different kinds of food.
There were limited king beds so I got a twin bed room when I requested for a king bed. But they rectified the issue by converting it into a king bed.

Expected much better from Ballys.  If we ever come back we will not stay in the Claridge tower.  Painfully slow dirty elevator. People we met in elevators were all complaining about their rooms  Dirty hallways.  Dinner room service took 2 hrs.  45 min hotel lobby check-in.  Hotel desk promised someone would come up to room & hook-up ipad to free Wi-Fi, but they never showed up.  Final straw was $45.00 tab for a lousy breakfast for two.    Ballys and other Atlantic City casino hotels better wake up.  We have a right to expect better when paying premium for a Saturday night

What a fantastic venue for a wedding. Stayed for one night for a family wedding and couldn't fault the hotel, service, staff, facilities, grounds for photos what a great hotel. The rooms were clean and had the usual facilities we needed. If I had to pick at anything it would be the getting in and our of the bath/shower round the sink which was awkward. Over all would definitely recommend this hotel as a good venue, although a bit out in the middle of nowhere but that didn't matter to us
There is nothing to say, it was a great setting and a lovely hotel

Overpriced breakfast at £11 with cold food that was meant to be hot, limited options, overcooked eggs, undercooked bacon, mashed baked beans, no choice of bread or rolls, toaster didn't toast bread - just warmed it up even after two turns through restaurant toaster, no choice of jam or marmalade, soggy cereal.  No staff to advise re. breakfast system or options  Dark bedroom - low level lighting, even in the bathroom!

The beach is great and the sunbeds and beach huts are better than at some of the quite good resorts in playa del Carmen and Tulum (Mexico).   The buffet lunch and breakfast were excellent - especially the grilled on request seafood and crepes!  Some of the best and most enthusiastic staff worked in the buffet restaurant!

The room air conditioning did not work on arrival and had to ask twice at the main reception to have it fixed. Once the repair man came few hours later, it was sorted quite quickly. Then the bath tub (over which was the shower) did not drain but once we reported it was fixed as well.   Our room was supposed to have a garden view - it looked at a fence and an empty field beyond it. There was a water channel passing just under the balcony but unfortunately these water channels were almost empty except for a few dirty puddles. Probably few years back, the place looked quite amazing - now it doesn't look like a 5 star property it's advertised to be.  The music at the hotel was mostly western pop - it was disappointing not to hear some Cuban rhythms especially when Cuba has such fantastic music!

I expected hell as I had read some terrible reviews on other sites. I was pleasently suprised that I was put, it seems to me, on a renovated 16. floor with new carpets and paint work. Still, you can not deny that it is an old building, but this is.a three star hotel and you can't expect paradise. Tje pool is fantastic and has a nice view to KL Tower. I dont think any three star hotel in city area has a pool. And trust me, it is better than the pool in 4 star hotel Melia where I stayed just before Radius. It is close to everything. It is a bit noisy during the night,l but I didn't mind it. I even didn't mind noise coming from the room next to me. It seems the couple coldn't control their passion :-))). The walls are a bit thin.

Some of the staff don't act in professional way. For example, I was in a que waiting to be served, and some people were jumping the que and were served before me. Four people were served unfairly before me when I went off and started to yell at the receptionist. She looked so unmotivated. And a few times when I asked for some help from some of the staff,they didn't respond appropriately. All they had to say was OK. No smile, no action, no assurance that help will come...just OK.

This is a very good quality hotel in what was part of County Hall and apart from mistaking it for its even better quality sister around the corner, was excellent.  Our group had a studio with a little area with another TV, settee and kitchen and another double room which also had a microwave, tea making and crockery.  With a convenience store just around the corner towards Big Ben, this could make a good base.  The rooms on the 13th floor were quiet, clean and modern with a choice of pillows. The TV had a fair range of channels including Sky Sports.    Will be going back next time we are in London as the little extra cost for this hotel was well worth it for location and quality.

This was our second stay at this hotel and like the first visit , we stayed in the Garden Rooms with terrace, which are terraced single room + bathroom. These are away from the main Hotel complex.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. The furniture is old fashioned and  you have to stand in the bath to use the shower. We have not stayed in the new modern rooms as we like the character of the  garden rooms. The breakfasts are excellent with plenty of choice. The heated pool in the gardens is nice, if small with views out over the sea, harbour  and town. Residents have access to the larger pool in the hotels sister establishment. This is accessed by a lift. The lift also takes a lot of effort out of walking back from Funchal town of an evening, otherwise you would have to tackle a steep hill. The place has a genteel but classy   feel. The staff are excellent. If you don't want to use the hotel restaurant there are several excellent restaurants just  minutes away. We have enjoyed our stays and will use this hotel again. we did our first Levada walk and hope to do more.

Hig cost of food and drink compared to facilities outside.   Because of this, restaurants in the hotel were rarely used.  Rooms at front of hotel can experience  noise from traffic.  Beach was severely eroded during a tsunami and the sand has not yet been replaced - not the fault of the hotel.

Bed provided was a sofa-bed but I was not told this at the booking or when I booked in.  I have never been to a hotel where the only bed is a sofa-bed (and yet there is space in the room for a bed and a sofa-bed.  In addition, the timber supports to the bed were broken so it was very uncomfortable. (I have photographs)  On checkout I was offered a better bed next time!  When I complained by email I was told that I could have 20% off the next booking - I eventually had them reduce my payment for the room by 20%.

DO NOT HESITATE TO STAY AT TRYP CAYO COCO!!!    I just came back from an amazing holiday in Cuba, stayed at Tryp 3 nights and 1 last night before flying back to London.    I have to say that it was a bit of a challenge to find the rooms at first... The rooms that we got were almost excellent with everything in order and large in size but what I have to highlight the most is the amazing staff that work at the resort. We had the pleasure of meeting Arais (Buffet Waitress) who was amazing at all times. I have to mention as well the waiters at the snack bar Mario, Yosvani, etc which were again excellent.    We had every night a show which was very entertaining and we got to meet some of the dancers who again were very friendly and informative, unfortunately I cant remember all the names but to name a few Jorge, Keylan, Claudia, Diana and some more whose names I cant remember.    Overall this made our trip a 10 out of 10 and Im already saving money to go back to Tryp Cayo Coco ;)

I booked this hotel for a surprise birthday trip for my husband this and other requirements were stated at the time of booking in. On the day of arrival we served at the desk by Amy who was very rude and no good customer service at all, I asked her if about the requirements made at the point of booking and she advised these could not be honoured and could only offer us a room in the 10th floor as opposed to one on a higher floor. She was so abrupt and very quick to want to get rid of us. We were give a room on the fourth to realise to our horror it was a smoking room and my husband is asthmatic, at no point were we offered whether we would require a smoking or non smoking room. This woman clearly needs some back to basics on customer care.

The staff are extremely hospitable and want you to enjoy your stay; their attitude, whether in the dining areas, the beach or poolsides, the bars, the animation team or reception management team, were all highly commendable. The gardens leading down to the beach and marina are very pretty and well maintained, with further improvements ongoing.

The hotel bathrooms are a little tired. During our stay i was surprised by the number of Russians, expecting a more mixed international group, which in my opinion was detrimental to the hotel; particularly noticeable in the bar with the level of smoking restricting access and  the early morning acquisition of sun loungers with their towels!

Forget all your preconceived ideas about an airport hotel. This hotel was superb. Very quiet and great facilities on site as well as in the airport mall next door. If you're a business traveller to Zurich, don't bother with staying in town. Everything you need at the end of a long business day is right here and best of all, check-in for your flight is only 3 mins walk away which facilitates a little extra time in bed if you have an early morning flight.

Although not cheap I think the Wynn is a great place to stay. After the Wynn we stayed at the Bellagio and I wouldn't say we where disappointed with the room in the Bellagio but I think we were spoiled by the interior of the Wynn tower suite and therefore felt the Bellagio room was a bit dated.
The only thing I can think of is the location. It is quite a walk to the southern part of the strip but on the other hand a taxi ride is very cheap.

This was not an hotel, but a B&B. It's situated in a street that hardly anyone knows in Rome, even the taxidriver had to look several times if the adress was correct. And because the confirmationpaper I received after the booking, only mentioned the name of the street and not the number, we couldn't find it. In the street there was no sign of the B&B, and at none of the more than 50 appartments,  we could see the name. So eventually, after three searching, and a huge taxibill, we haven taken another hotel.

Value for money, only paid Australian $84 for 2 rooms for one night. Rooms are very fresh and clean. Drinking water provided on each floor from a water dispenser, cold / warm and hot water available at any time of the day. Towels, shower cap, soap provided in room. Many eateries nearby offering a lot of varieties - seafood /Taiwanese /Malaysian /Chinese restaurants all within a few minutes walking distance. Friendly and efficient staff, check in only took a few minutes.

Very small room, sufficient for one overnight stay but may not be good for family with kids. Breakfast of limited choices and taste very ordinary. No face clothe, no toothbrush, no slippers provided in room.

When we arrived at the Royal I was told it was over booked and that  they had booked us into the hotel over the rd called RC Victoria and if we did not like the room then we cold move into the Royal the next day. We said not a problem and we would spend the 2 nights in the Victoria. I had said it was our anniversary so it was lovely to find a bottle of Cava, chocolate and rose petals over the bed. As compensation they gave us free parking, wine with our meal and lunch on the day we arrived. We had a lovely sea view so was lovely to sit in sun and read our books for a while. The hotel is great for the old town of Benidorm as it only takes a couple of minuets to walk and it's lovely for a stroll along the prom. Food was great and lots to choose from. Next year we will try again for the Royal but would be happy to stay in the Victoria again.

I had some troubles while trying to find an accomodation in Algiers - there were either cheap and dodgy options or really expensive hotels. Dar El Ikram seemed to be in between, so I booked it and wasn't disappointed. The hotel has a very good central location, next to Sacre Coeur church and just a few meters to one of the main streets - Didouche Mourad. I felt very safe there even when walking at night.  The hotel itself is modern and clean - cleaning ladies clean the rooms every day. All staff was extremely nice, helpful and friendly. There's a breakfast included in the price. Besides all that, wifi was working very well, and rooms are equipped in tv with plenty international channels.

The only disadvantage I noticed was not a very nice smell in the room - there were probably some problems with the pipes in the bathroom (but maybe it was only in my room). Otherwise, I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Hotel did not look much from the outside to be fair. On entering there was a sign directing me to reception on the third floor. Once at reception, it was quite busy with other guests checking in, so had a bit of a wait until I was warmly greeted by one of the staff behind the desk, the check-in process was very efficient and welcoming despite the wait.  My room was on the 17th floor and had quite a view over the city. Everything about the room was great, air conditioning, free wifi, quiet, tastefully furnished and most comfortable, spotlessly clean too!  The bathroom had only a shower which for me was fine. The mirror was not of the 'heated, steam free' type which surprised me, as so much thought had gone into everything else for the comfort of guests. That would be my only negative point, although it is a personal preference!  Breakfast was tasty with plenty on offer to suit all tastes. All in all a short but enjoyable stay, if i found myself in Birmingham again, I would most definately return here.

Very well run family Hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful and it was a nice change from the worldwide chain hotels.  The location and general atmosphere was very good. We did the All Inclusive deal and were not disappointed as this included a pass for all buses and ferries which made getting around the island very easy and value for money.

The only negatives are you have to pay for Wi-Fi but this does seem to be the norm currently in Bermuda and that with the flight form the UK not leaving until 8pm, having to check out at 11am makes it a long day without your room to use.

Upon entering the room saw a tray of goodies from truffles, chips etc, then noticed a black box picked it up to figure out what it was on closer inspection and it was an intamcy kit. We laughed about it at first and set it back down (unopened) on the tray, although if i had children with me and they picked it up wouldve been very inappropriate. so that was a problem for me, but it wasnt until later another guest informed us that should you pick up any items on the tray after 20 seconds it has sensors that detect its removal and youll be billed automatically on your credit card. I was extremely annoyed, because there was no sign in front of tray to make guests aware of this. Luckily i called and they took the charges off but the fact of having to deal with this was a pain and made me angry esp when your here to have fun. Apparently at check in theyre supposed to inform you of this but didnt. Ive stayed in many hotels in Vegas and not once had this sensor tray. maybe its catching on in a few now, but i didnt like it so i will stay somewhere else cause the Venetian i think is taking liberties, most guess do auto check out and wont realize until they get home and check theyre billing statements and find charges for items not used. However this was my only issue, other than that a great hotel but passing on this info to others if planning a first time stay here.

The hotel we usually use was booked for the first 5 days of our holiday so I looked at other hotels and thought this was the best available. How wrong was I, this was far superior in every way. From 5.30 - 7.30 every evening there are free drinks and dips and nibbles the breakfast has so much choice the rooms are spacious they have a separate bedroom area and a lounge area which has a dining table, fridge,microwave etc. This hotel was that good I cancelled the last week which I managed to get booked at our usual hotel and booked to go back to embassy suites. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We will be back again next year

I would like to be positive. However one would expect a 187 room hotel to have the ability to provide sandwiches and/or light snacks teas/coffees etc during the daytime. I was directed to a pub down the road at 3pm in afternoon.

There was a dripping noise in my room from the moment I arrived this caused me a sleepless night. At 4.30am I demanded a complaint form and was directed instead to a comments form. At no time did the night porter try and find out why I was angry and upset. An absolute lesson in how not to run a hotel. A complete disgrace and a hotel group I will never use again. No food or drink until 5.30 in the evening is another example of how not to run a hotel, this was juxtaposed with numerous signs banning guests from bringing food and drink into the hotel, a further insult. All in all an utter disgrace.
