Yotel is a very popular hotel situated around about a five to ten minute walk from Times Square. Although it comes under Times Square be aware that it is not right on top of it it's situated in a place called Hells Kitchen but it is a short walk away from everything including subway, Times Square, Empire State Building etc. The rooms are tiny but they are clean and when in New York you won't be in your hotel room much anyway. Breakfast consists of coffee and a muffin, the blueberry muffins were yummy! There is also the option to pay for a full breakfast which also looked lovely. The staff are very helpful! Yotel generally feels like it has a different approach there is no need to tip staff every two minutes at Yotel or they just do not expect it as much where as other hotels such as Westin will click their fingers at you. Overall basic but nice!
No negatives. It's basic but most importantly it is clean. Small size "cabins" (rooms) but that's the idea with this hotel!

One of the many hotels which feature of the langkawi map. Just take the name at the airport and the cab can take you there. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly. Basic facilities like swimming pool, massage, restaurant and bar, in room safe etc were all provided. The breakfast spread was also good. Tours can be booked via the travel desk in the hotel.  The distance to Tengah beach is about 1km. Cenang beach is a little farther than that. You can walk to the beach or take a cab, which will cost you 10RM. Sunba, the famous club is also a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, which I believe is quite walkable.

I experienced poor service trying to buy a drink, was delivered a meal that I didn't order and when I told front desk on check out, the girl shrugged her shoulders and said have a nice day, as she processed my payment, not even, I'm sorry to hear that!.  I have stayed in this hotel many times, this may well be the last.  There are others just one block away, which are cheaper and give better service I hear.

The room had No; hot water, handles on the bathroom door, air conditioning and there were wires hanging out of the wall as well as a radiator grill hanging off. In the bathroom there was no shower curtain so the floor flooded. Breakfast was meagre, a couple of little quasonts.  And what you don't see on the adds is that the hotel is in one of the roughest areas in Buenos Aires (Constitution),  There are prostitutes and vagrants are on every street corner around the hotel.  There is dog poo everywhere and also wrecked and burnt out cars in the streets. At night it is noisy with dogs barking and cars and bikes revving their engines.  I was warned not to go out at night by two locals  but had already decided to move to a better area and hotel.  You get what you pay for!!

Fabulous location on the edge of the Muirfield golf course.  Stunning views from the room and the restaurant.  Excellent easy parking and located by so many golf courses and great beaches North Berwick etc) East access to Edinburgh by train from nearby Drem.   Nice old fashioned hotel furnished in a traditional manner  Nice big room and en-suite with lots of hot water and always replenished clean towels.  Even in cold weather always warm throughout  Notwithstanding the negatives below we did have a nice comfortable stay.  If the negatives were resolved I would happily give 5 stars

Sometimes haphazard service with staff working hard and too much dashing about to be relaxed. It appears that all the staff do all the jobs so it was difficult to see who was in charge and who was responsible for what which probably accounts for the inconsistences in housekeeping. En suite had unacceptable black mould on many of the white tiles grouting.  Main stair carpet was threadbare on the edges.  Most of the hotel mirrors needed cleaning (not looking for faults but so obvious!!)  The hotel needs a manager to be about checking what is happening and checking on standards.

Hotel is looking very tired.  There was no pool service at the big pool.  When you did get it you had to wait ages for what you ordered.  The room that we booked was supposed to be a luxurious garden bungalow and I had put in a special request for a room with a double bed.  We were given a room with two single beds that was also extremely small room.  I complained and said I had put in a special request, they first tried to get us to put the beds together but after saying no we were shown to a much larger much better room.  I felt that they were trying it on by giving us a lessor quality room first up. We have stayed at this hotel 3 times before, but we now find that it looks a little run down and the big pool area is now very run down and cluttered.  It is definitely not a 4 star hotel anymore.  We had a pleasant stay but I will not stay at this hotel again.

Arrived at the Louis King Jason hotel quite late and tired to find the receptionist was waiting with a lovely tray of nibbles and fresh orange juice--nice touch !    That was followed by a young man who helped us with our cases and showed us around the bedroom / apartment.    Please note that there are some ground floor rooms available which ( if necessary through mobility problems) need requesting for, as otherwise there are stairs,-- no lift.    The following morning the same young man who was also one of the waiters, showed us around the dining room and where to get our various breakfast needs.    The breakfast was excellent, varied choices including a Cypriot table. fresh eggs cooked in various ways on demand with a very pleasant cook.    A spotless hotel with fresh towels daily and bedding changed twice in a 5 day stay.    There was a shop on site which had home baked bread, and a friendly owner who spoke good English.    In fact all of the staff spoke fluent English.    We stayed B & B and ate out every night but there was a full kitchen in the apartment and a supermarket directly opposite which sold everything you needed.    Although the weather was not too hot and rained for 2 days out of 5 days  the hotel had an indoor pool, and 2 outdoor pools with exercise equipment actually in the water.    All in all the hotel was 4 star and maintained those standards, not too big and therefore there was a very personal touch to the hotel.    The staff were all helpful and friendly from the Managers to the cleaning staff.    I would definitely book again without hesitation.
Difficult to find ---- needs better signage  Need a car /taxi to reach the resort proper and to enjoy the surrounding tourist areas.  Massive shopping centre nearby.

I came to the hotell after travelling 30 hours. The older woman at the reception was first ok, but then she asked me to show her my money. Why, I asked. SHOW ME YOUR MONEY! she ordered. I did, because I was to tired to guarrell. Give me 5 pesos, she asked angry. I gave 3 and then she ordered me to give 10, so she will give me 5 back. I gave and tried to get 3 pesos back but she did not give it. She gave me one coin, it was 1 peso, I noticed later. It was first time when I saw cuban convertibles. If this all was for safety box, she did not say it and first she asked for 5 pesos but stole 12 all together! Very strange episode.

Great location for a family ski holiday.  Truly a ski-in, ski-out apartment building.  While the Sherpa grocery store at ARC 2000 is fairly expensive, the SPAR in ARC 1950 is very reasonable.  The free cabriolet between 2000 and 1950 makes going to the SPAR very easy.

The position was great.The people on the front desk were quite helpful especially the girl and the security guard was good too.

I have stayed in a lots of hotels but this one was just weird. Okay I had expected tiny rooms but they were so tiny that if you had two suitcases one had to put in the shower when not using the shower. The bathrooms are in the bedtroom with clear glass wrapped around them. It might be trendy but we all agreed it was just plain weird. Especially if you were sharing a twin room. It was like a prison cell where the toilets are in the cell. I don't want to watch anyone on the loo or if I am sharing with anyone watch them shower. Talking of showers on the last day I used my sister inlaws shower and it flooded everywhere. I would say book it if the price is right for you and you are a couple but as friends sharing a twin - no way.

Very clean rooms, polite staff, really helpful when asked questions, choice of self serve breakfast items, including all you need for a full cooked English breakfast, if you want it. Beds fairly comfortable. Good location, close to the middle of town, shopping centres and leisure facilities. Car park opposite the door, you get a code to get in and out and pay reception at the end of your stay (£10 per full day and night). Xscape is close by (10-15 mins walk) and has great facilities for snow skiing, snow boarding and even indoor sky-diving. Good value hotel overall.

Bathroom got very steamed up - the extractor is on a ducted system and the room we were in didn't get much of an outflow of damp air going. One hot shower and you couldn't see in the mirror for ages! Air conditioning in the room seemed to be permanently set to heat, not cool or auto, so couldn't cool the room quickly, even when turning the temperature right down. Staff did offer to come and have a look and they may have fixed it, but it was our last night so we left it and opened the window instead, which was fine. Restaurant for breakfast was good, but staff did leave plates piled on the table and weren't too attentive at clearing.

Staff always very friendly and helpful. Room very spacious for 2 people, perhaps would be a bit cramped for 3 or 4, very clean and tidy. Pool area nice and relatively quiet. Short walking distance to nice beach at Playa de la Arena and very interesting town Los Gigantes (marina with both tours up coast and to see whales/dolphins).  Bus stop directly outside hotel with regular buses to Los Cristianos (south) and Los Gigantes/Puerto de la Cruz (north) and supermarket about 50m away. Can highly recommend a small bar called Juanitos next to the supermarket, which sells cheap drinks and simple but tasty home-made tapas.

This is a wonderful hotel.  Its situation, the quality and design of rooms and public areas, the range of facilities, the sheer number of staff on hand and the ambience...fantastic.  What a place...and oysters for breakfast!!  It is, by any standard, a 5* hotel, from the welcome, to the check-in, being shown around your room, the swimming pools, the garden, the cinema (!), the original art work, the beautiful bar and public areas...any criticism would be very minor.  Staff, with only one or two exceptions, were wonderful, so pleasant, helpful, solicitous.

The menus of both restaurants don't appear to change and although the quality of food is excellent, for us, as people who don't eat meat, the choice was limited.  So, simply ring the changes a little and have more vegetarian options.  Otherwise, the food is first class.

The absolute best thing about this hotel, and the main reason we keep returning to it, has got to be its fabulous location! It is exactly where we want to be both during the day and of an evening. Out the front of the hotel you step straight on to the centre of Av. Las Americas (the 'golden mile'), and out the back beyond the huge pool area is the lovely Camison beach area with a lovely walk which takes you all the way through to Los Christianos.  We also really like the pool towel service which enables you to get a nice clean and dry towel each day and also helps free up some much needed suitcase space!

The hotel interior (from bedrooms to bathrooms to public spaces) needs a complete overhaul.  There is no way the bedrooms are of the size or quality expected of a 4 or 5 star hotel-they are a 3 star at best. They are compketely dated with old fashioned, bordering on useless, facilities such as tv and hairdryer. I also don't agree with having to pay to hire the fridge in your bedroom-again, surely not a sign of a 4/5* hotel?! There has obviously been no upgrade to the bedrooms since the hotel was built 25 years ago and it is such a shame as they really are a disappointment. The hotel seems to be reliant on their fabulous location being enough to satisfy guests, and up to a point it does-afterall, we go there around 4 times a year! But to really be of at least a 4 star standard they need to refurbish the bedrooms and bathrooms as the entire place looks dated and tired.  All of that said, however, I will still be returning due to the fab location of the hotel!

" , her answer " how should I know , I've never been upstairs in this place "  The room had discolured , flaking paintwork and a worn dirty looking carpet also very drafty as the window would'nt close fully , We had to ask to be moved .

Courteous and helpful service, comfortable, easy administration, nice and convenient location.

Wi-fi was not available more than half of the time I was there.  Apart from specific technical issues, there are too systemic problems here: 1) impossible to connect most of the time from certain rooms, forcing the guest to go back and forth to the lobby; 2) when internet became available altogether, staff gave access to the office (with cable), which was helpful though not a very practical solution, but otherwise said that technicians were due to come the next day and nothing could be done the same day.  The second problem is unacceptable.  Repair services should be immediately available when the problem arises.  Internet nowadays is an indispensable feature.  It has to be reliable.  This explains the above rating.  Without that problem I would certainly return to the hotel, now I am not sure.

An excellent hotel in the heart of Bangkok. I have stayed here a few times and the location is perfect, having a connection to the bts skytrain at Asok via a covered walkway. It costs less than half the price of the most excellent Sheraton Grande opposite. The gym is well equipped and little used. The toilets in the room are American Standard and have a bidet function and heated seat and are well worth considering for export back home.

After reading average reviews of the hotel I was not expecting anything half decent.  But was pleasantly surprised,  the room was new and clean.  The staff were helpful and the complimentary shuttle to the airport which is across the road at 5am was fantastic.
If you have a car there is not enough parking for all the guests.  Luckily after checking in and going out to eat I returned the car to the airport and walked back to the hotel.

If you have a car there is not enough parking for all the guests.  Luckily after checking in and going out to eat I returned the car to the airport and walked back to the hotel.

Had a 4 bed and 2 bed for a group of 6.  The 4 bed had 2 sets of 2 bunks and had en suite toilet and shower as well as ample storage space including padlocks.  The room was quite spacious and the location was excellent for going to a gig at the O2 and is also within walking distance of the City Centre.  Lots of fast food places nearby and right next to a Lidl.  We stayed one night and the hostel did exactly what we were looking for at a great price of under £12 each.  If staying with friends for a night out or a couple of nights and you want value accommodation then I would definitely recommend.  Facilities were clean and better than what I've seen in some competitors e.g. Travelodge.  I'll definitely use them again, excellent if booking for a group of friends.
If you're looking for a City Break or travelling with the hotel being a big factor then this isn't the place for you.  It serves as value accommodation when you want to have a bed for the night.

The hotel was within easy walking distance of Ilford station.  I was given a room in the main hotel as requested.  I was greeted by a friendly staff member on arrival who took payment and advised me the times for breakfast 06:30 - 09:00 on weekdays.  A full English breakfast buffet was on offer, good quality hot food but no bacon (only a minor detail).  The room was cleaned daily on my 3 night stay.  I found the hotel to be excellent value for money booking with www.hotelopia.com and only 20 mins from central London.  I would recommend it to a friend.

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  There were very very few people at this hotel--maybe 5 or 6 cars at most.  They demanded a $25 cash deposit for possible damage to the room which I could get back in the morning.  Why was this necessary with such few people. I am 78 years old and I did not have a dog.  I did not feel safe.  I did not feel that anything was clean.  I stayed for 5 hours after I returned from dinner.  I left before 4:00 AM because the bed was terrible and I could not rest at all.  The hotel is hidden behind a gas station next to on-going construction.  Although I had mentioned my handicap (I use a cane) they still wanted to put me some distance from my car.  I insisted they had to have something closer by because I could not carry anything that far.  A totally BAD experience!!!!!!!!!!

We have stayed at this hotel twice now for the following reasons!    - The service is EXCELLENT  - Every member of staff is polite  - The house keeping is immaculate  - The breakfast is yummy  - The pool is on the 5th floor so excellent views  - Attached to the mall so very easy access to hundreds of shops and restaurants  - So quick to get a taxi  - Lovely views over the creek (when staying in a creek view room)  - Can use the facilities (including pool and loungers) of the InterContinental next door, so plenty of space to sunbave and swim  - You have a bell by the pool in which you can press to order a drink/food  - Everywhere is so clean
No negative reviews just a few FYI's.    - The hotel is used lots for business people, I wouldn't have said it is the best hotel for young families.

This without a doubt is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for customer service, facilities, choice of food and breath taking views from the 11th Floor. We will be returning and recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing break away, enjoying being pampered and luxury in abundance.

Wow if I could have given this hotel 6 out of 5 I would have. From the moment we arrived at this hotel we felt like and were treated like royalty. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they are all so courteous and friendly. Our room was beautifully decorated and the sea view we had was simply stunning. I would definitely recommend anyone staying here to upgrade to gold level as the benefits received more than make up for the extra cost (private check in, afternoon tea, cocktail hour with canapes, etc). The beach and pool areas are amazing. Frevo (brazilian) & Ba (chinese) restaurants were our favourites. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Dubai.

It was good value for money.  Our room was well furnished and equipped (even morning tea kit, which is not standard in Cyprus).  The pool area is attractive and the restaurant really good, both for food and service.  They can handle large groups very efficiently.

The manager on reception was surly and arrogant, which made a bad first impression (though the restaurant staff deserve praise).  The rooms are arranged on terraces up a steep hillside, with a lot of steps: not for anyone with limited mobility, and compared to some other places it felt a bit claustrophobic.

I recently stayed at the Sydney Hilton on a business trip. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Sydney. It is close to public transport and it is easy to catch the train from the Airport to Town Hall station. There are many restaurants located within walking distance. The room is compact but had everything that I required to continue doing business if required. I would recommend this hotel whether you are travelling for business or pleasure.

These apartments are an ideal location for a central base near the town, beach and with the Monticastillo Centre next door you don't need to walk far for anything. Great place to use as a base. There is entertainment and a bar on site but so near everything else we didn't spend much time in the complex.
Rooms are getting a little tired and the furniture could do with replacement but for the price we paid we have no real complaints.

It was by far the best hotel experience in all my years of travel. The staff was amazing. Very friendly and so helpful. Our flight from Dublin was very early so we arrived several hrs before check-in. Luckily our room was ready and we checked-in early and were able to have breakfast at no extra charge. We got free wi-fi access for 2 devices which as perfect. It was a very easy bus ride to the center of town. Several buses stop right in front of the hotel. You can take the 35 bus from the airport and it lets you off right in front of the hotel.It was an 1 hr and a half bus ride but it gave us a chance to see the city and it only cost 1.50 vs an expensive cab ride.  Across the street is a mall, a movie theatre and a great hiking/jogging trail. The free breakfast was excellent. Much more than just cold cereal. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an nice hotel to stay at while in Edinburgh.
I don't have any. This for now on will be my go-tol hotel when I stay in Edinburgh.

Great gym for a hotel, good location in relation to south bank and the CBD, day spa is an added bonus, and breakfast was a great spread... Of course at $38 I would expect nothing less than a great spread

My rental car was damaged whilst in the care of valet parking at $50 per day, an the lack of empathy an referral to "take the matter up with Victorian police" as the only option if I didn't want to take the duty managers word as gospel, "we have reviewed the footage and we are not at fault" was a very disappointing and sour note on stay. I simply asked for an appointment to review our car entering and leaving the car park without damage. As for the room, I guess if you like listening to your partner in the toilet as there is no privacy and your ok with your car bringing damaged, at what could be Australia's most expensive valet parking... Then yes this us a hotel for you. Personally we wont be back or refer it yo our friends and family... If only the duty manager on nights was maybe a little more capable of showing empathy and working through issues, this review would never be necessary. The staff professionalism typically Australian 4 star so if you want to be treated like every guest is a priority and personal conversations can wait until after work then maybe pay extra and stay elsewhere.

Surprised at how good this place was for the money we had to pay. Simple but clean and well run and the breakfast was generous and of good quality. Reception staff were helpful and efficient.  From the hotel it is about a 10 - 15 minute walk into the lovely Old Town, not difficult and there are plenty of trams. But just over the road from the hotel you are into the old Jewish Quarter where there are many very cheap, interesting bars and restaurants serving very good food and drink. It is also an interesting area just to wander around - full of narrow streets and quiet corners and well worth a day's exploration.

This is a beautiful building close to all the main sites to visit in Old Havana.  Features a beautiful stained glass roof and has a lovely roof-top terrace.  Although the hotel has a Jewish style to it there is no religious issues to adopt.  The staff were very pleasant and helpful.  A lift is available which is not the case in several other hotels where we stayed in Cuba.

Although the rooms were cleaned satisfactorily there was  slight evidence of neglect.  Main meal that we had one night at the hotel was lacking in availability of basic ingredients on the menu...maybe we were just unlucky that night.  The area immediately surrounding the hotel is still in need of redevelopment but within a couple of minutes walk the area is full of interest.

We booked a superior room and were given a room in the basement.  Although the size of the room was decent, it lacked any atmosphere or comfort with no natural daylight (small windows at ceiling height) and curtains needed to be kept shut as people outside constantly walking by.  Bizarrely, the room had three tables with lots of chairs, almost felt as if it was being used for storage.  Room was also next door to the housekeeping / laundry room so a lot of noise early in the morning so no option for a lie in or relaxation.  There was also no wardrobe space, only two coat stands with two hangers.
Great location, very close to train station and five minute walk to city centre.  Staff were friendly and helpful.

We booked a superior room and were given a room in the basement.  Although the size of the room was decent, it lacked any atmosphere or comfort with no natural daylight (small windows at ceiling height) and curtains needed to be kept shut as people outside constantly walking by.  Bizarrely, the room had three tables with lots of chairs, almost felt as if it was being used for storage.  Room was also next door to the housekeeping / laundry room so a lot of noise early in the morning so no option for a lie in or relaxation.  There was also no wardrobe space, only two coat stands with two hangers.
A modern and clean hotel. Close to the airport. Everybody was very friendly and helpfull.  A nice pool on the roof and a very good Spa.
The have to put the name of the hotel on the roof. It's hard to find.

The staff were all friendly. The pool area was clean and we'll kept as was the reception area. The breakfast was very good. Plenty of choice either hot or cold. The courtesy bus was very usefull and was free of charge . The bathroom had both a bath and a separate shower with plenty of hot water.

The rooms were clean but lacked cooking equipment. I.e no kettle. It was a pain having to use a saucepan every time we wanted a hot drink. Also the rooms were large but sparsely furnished and not very homely. A little rough around the edges.

The hotel's position can't be beaten - in a quiet street but convenient for everything - 10 minutes from the Old City and Ben Yehuda. The rooms are very comfortable and spotless. The dining room is fantastic - great breakfasts and extremely well run. The manager of the dining room was particularly welcoming and efficient.In fact all the staff were excellent. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel and stay there again.

Some of the information given to us by the concierge was not accurate, particularly in terms of travel advice. But we learned quickly to double check this. Also because the hotel is popular it can be crowded and sometimes a bit noisy, but this was really minor. It would have been nice to have had free wi fi throughout.

I loved my suite. It had lots of space with a seating area, huge closet. It was decorated to make the stay convenient.

Hotel doesn't have iron and ironing board in the room. When you request one, you need to get on the waiting list. I find it very strange especially while they cater to business travelers.   Also double bed is formed by 2 single beds with 2 narrow comforters. These narrow comforters make it difficult to stretch and relax.

The hotel was great. Fantastic room, really helpful attentive staff and great central location - could walk to everything from there. Even had free in room movies. Best of both worlds with both room service and own kitchen. We really enjoyed staying at the Oaks and would definitely do so again when visiting Melbourne.

Only tiny negative was that the TV kept playing up. The hotel staff did try to help fix it but it would act up again after a bit and we didn't want to keep calling them up to the room to fix it everyday. Just fiddled with it ourselves and it worked, but it was a bit annoying. Sure it could be easily fixed.

The deluxe room that we were given is on the 20th floor with city view ;). WOW! The view was fantastic and we were pretty happy with the room and the amenities that were provided. About 10 minutes walk to central station where u can get onto a monorail into the city center.  Breakfast which was included in the rate was pretty good. Nice varieties available for every ethnic group.  Shuttle provided by hotel but time given are pretty far apart & you need to book for a place.

Rooms are nothing fancy but very clean and spacious with TV, tea & coffee making facilities, hairdryer and plenty storage space for luggage / clothes. Very helpful & professional reception staff - especially David.  Our booking hadn't been passed on to the hotel properly but David took the time to search for it and rectify the issue straight away and was very apologetic - even though it wasn't the hotel's fault!  Food in the restaurant was very good - really good meal deals too.  There was a large selection available for breakfast too.  Plenty of free parking available and free wi-fi throughout the hotel.  Hotel is def value for money and we will def book this hotel again when staying over in Glasgow.

The room was, even though small as we asked to have 3beds in one room, it was nice and clean, it was cleaned daily and there was nothing we could not be happy with. Room and breakfast were great very convenient for travelling from limerick. Bar staff were great and also other staff members great it was reception left it down.

When we arrived the staff member could not find our booking and was insisting we take a double room the only room available. I had already booked and paid for 2 single rooms so this wasn't an option, we decided to have lunch inthe restaurant which was fish and not great fish had been over cooked and very chewy. After lunch we went back to reception and he had found the booking I also gave him the reference no I received when booking and he said it was no use to him as it was not their ref no. No apology was given and no reason for the mix up all he said was he had found it and it was sorted and we were given our keys. It was a Monday night so not exactly hectic.

Hotel was quiet most of the time, with friendly staff. Nice pool and pool furniture.  Cleaners cleaned the rooms every day and there is wifi available to everyone (albeit it's a very temperamental connection) but who goes on holiday to just stay on their phone/ipad?

Unfortunately, there is currently a new build going on right next the hotel which was quite noisy. This isn't really something that can be helped though by the hotel.   For anyone with a group of 3 or 4 staying in one room, the pull out sofa bed is dreadful. At times I considered laying out the cushions on the marble floor and sleeping on that instead! This is the only bad thing I can say about the hotel though.

I thought everything was excellent and I would recommend it. Cool décor, especially the bathroom and the rocks in the lower ground floor wall.  Lovely and warm despite very cold winter weather. Through Hotelopia and Trivago I obtained a good price and as a bonus I had sole use of a double room, so it was very good value too. Just off main street and only 10 minutes walk to centre, plenty of places to eat on the way. Bus collected at hotel for excursions. Don't miss visiting the harbour-side glass opera house for a coffee and the views over Reykjavik from the higher floors.
I would have liked tea-making facilities (and hot chocolate!) in the room, for when I returned frozen and wet.

Hotel very ornate and classy. We were very pleased that due to high capacity we had been given an upgrade to a suite with a terrace. Lovely to have the outside space (although not much view). We were able to arrange a late check out at 6pm for 1500 pesos which was useful as we had a late fight home.  The pool area is lovely with towels provided, a swim up bar and pop music playing. Lots of foliage, an oasis in the craze of the city.  Breakfast choice was overwhelming with an incredible amount of choice from all over the world. We were happy to be informed that there was Happy Hour before we left 5pm until 8pm. All drinks 241.  We had a pizza in the bar which was delicious.  Doormen and reception were very friendly and helpful.

When we got to the new hotel they booked our new room under the managers name after finding that out we weren't able to check in early without paying another fee.       Staff spoke just enough English to get you checked into a room and that's about it. I kind of expected that from reading previous reviews but having at lease someone who spoke a little more English would have been nice.
The most positive thing about this hotel was that it was so close to the JR line literately a walk around the corner and up some stairs and you were there!

During our stay there the hotel had experienced a water leak and had to relocate half of the building which meant us.. And thats when we had the awesome adventure of trying to relocate to the new hotel. The front desk arranged the transfer via cab to the new hotel. When we got to the new hotel they booked our new room under the managers name after finding that out we weren't able to check in early without paying another fee.       Staff spoke just enough English to get you checked into a room and that's about it. I kind of expected that from reading previous reviews but having at lease someone who spoke a little more English would have been nice.
Loved this hotel, the location was awesome, rooms were clean, staff were friendly and view was great.
Loved this hotel, the location was awesome, rooms were clean, staff were friendly and view was great.

I found two hairs in my breakfast. I didn't complain as I was traveling with my partner and it was the last morning of our holidays before traveling home (to different countries), so I didn't say anything, but it was far from ideal. Also, they definitely weren't mine as my hair is blonde then hairs were thick and black. The bed room was small. The hotel isn't in walking distance of anything.....poor location. They provided transport to the airport (and other places) but their prices were very expensive. They charged 35JD to go to the airport, so we booked our own taxi, which cost 20JD and collected us from the hotel.

Not a hotel to my taste. This hotel is clearly targeted to those who want to take all inclusive package and stay at the hotel for all their vacation. There is nothing else close to the hotel. Hotel taxis are 3-4 times more expensive that normal priced ones. Hotel staff is reluctant to let non hotel taxis to pick you from the main door. You should walk to the outside gate to meet the taxi you have booked. I have mixed feelings about this hotel but after all I would not stay here again.

We spent one week in Hilton Allamanda with my wife in October, 2013. The best things about the hotel were:  - The staff was really very nice and helpful.  - The hotel room looked newly renovated with modern interior, and it had a convenient size balcony as well with breathtaking view on the ocean.  - The restaurant was also great, there was rich variety of choices for breakfast. Also for dinner it seemed to us to be a good option - the 'a la carte' menu is rather short, but whatever we tried was delicious and good value for the money (compared to few other restaurants except 'take aways').  - The area is very calm and quiet, there is hardly anyone on the beach.  - The gym is equipped with good quality cardio machines, like thread mill.

I cannot really say a bad word on the hotel. Maybe only the location:  - When we were there (October), the beach was too wavy, and we could not swim in the ocean. It might be different in other seasons. We tried it only once, the other days we went to other beaches, or swam in the pool of the hotel - by the way, the pool also had a nice view on the ocean.

I have no negative comments on the hotel, but you need to be aware that drinks in the bar are very expensive £7.50 for a Gin and Tonic. There is also a £12 charge per day for the car park.

Comfortable room, always re-stocked with tea and coffee making facilities and fresh towels each day so what you'd expect for the money comfortable beds always made up on return, breakfast was satisfactory not a huge choice but plenty to eat just make sure you are early as space is limited.

Shower was good but only seemed to be hot water at night, either tepid or very cold in the morning and toilet was backing up for some reason.  Noise easily carried through the walls so if you are a light sleeper you may want to think about ear plugs, TV worked picture was fine but no sound from the speakers.

The hotel is now the IDEA hotel, it was an Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is about 1.5 km from Sondria metro station, an easy walk or 3 stops on the 43 or 81 bus.   The hotel is close enough to the city centre to be convenient, but far enough to be quiet during the night.   There is a small Mercedes shuttle bus the runs from the hotel to Sondria in the morning. The driver is a safe and friendly driver.   The staff were efficient and friendly, speaking English, German and French.   There is a superb restaurant in the neighbourhood called  il borghetto. There is a supermarket over the street.

There is not much to complain about;  1. The shuttle bus only goes to the city, you have to find your own way to the hotel. No collection.   2. Internet: if you rely on wifi, this is the biggest irritation. It seems that the overall bandwidth in the hotel is limited, so in the evening, when all the guests log on, the connection is snail slow to stuttering and basically unusable. Maddening.   They force you to have 1 login per device and offer you 2 login codes. So if you are a couple or family, with smart phones, tablet, etc. you are limited. We did ask for 4 logins and they happily gave codes.

The room we were given was great, large and clean. Location great

Check in staff were poor, no information about the hotel, not even where the lifts could be found. Our room was not ready at 1450, no problem, we'll get a drink .wrong! The bars closed. Asked a member of staff for a drink, go to the bar he said, we have, I said. So he went to check and came back to tell us the bar was closed . Eventually ordered 2 g/ t from a older gentleman, bill £28. Top tip, if there is something going on in the Liberal club next door, which is part of the hotel, go to ur room or go for a walk because every part of the hotel becomes a no-go area. Breakfast was good, however we were seated in an overflow room, my wife nearly passing out from the temperature of the room, ice room. We had breakfast in our room the next morning, £10 supplement .  Nice experience, but I'm afraid it will only be once.

Staff command of English language is very poor.  Pool is not big enough for size of hotel and water gets warmer as the temperature goes up so there is no cooling off. Room was by far the smallest we have stayed in. It had a tasteful and bright colour scheme but our view was into a large white wall. There is renovation/refurbishment work being undertaken which we weren't advised when booking. We'd had an early start on out first morning due to an important meeting and had hoped to get a long lie in on our final day. However this was not to be as the hammering and banging started on the floor above us before 9am. Our peace was shattered. Spoke to the GM and were offered a complimentary coffee. Not really sufficient compensation.

A bit more knifes and forks and wine glasses would be better also.

I can't fault this hotel for the price range, there are more prestigeous hotels in Birmingham, but that is reflected in the price.  We regularly stay at this hotel, as it is value for money, central for amenities, meaning we can have a relaxing break without worrying about taxis. Very convenient for Haymarket station, but still easily in walking distance of Edinburgh proper.   The staff were very polite and accommodated our special requests for an iron and ironing board in our room, which was very handy.   The curtains in the room were fantastic! I had no idea what time of day it was when I woke up in the morning, the curtains kept the light out brilliantly! I want some at home.

Although it was a double room (room 24), it was very small and the bed was in a corner. This meant that it could only be accessed on one side and the configuration of the room was such that the dressing table was immediately at the foot of the bed, so it made getting into and out of bed very difficult for me (who was stuck with the wall side of the bed).   The shower was VERY temperamental and rapidly increased in temperature until it was hot enough to cook you, but if you tried to alter the temp it went cold and you had to turn it off to reset it. Very annoying!  Generally there was a lot of noise in the hotel from guests going up and down stairs, and from the plumbing in the adjacent rooms. If staying again I would request a room away from the main thoroughfare.

Family of 5 travelling from UK. Booked 3 rooms at Hotel Duran as a stopover. Can only give high praise for this hotel which is easy to get to close to the motorway and has signs showing the way as soon as you hit the town. Park outside (reserved drop zone)  to drop your bags and then transfer your car 50 yards to a convenient & secure underground car park (spaces small & limited but we managed to get the people carrier in). Our rooms were spotless and of a very good standard beating expectations. The receptionist was lovely and spoke English to us. Breakfast was normal Spanish self serve set up with very nice selection of cheeses, cold meats/hams, fruits, cereals, bread & toastmaker etc., We did not eat dinner at the hotel as we arrived late & wanted to have a beer near the square and experience some local bars and pinchos (tapas). Duran menu looks lovely and would definitely have eaten here given another day. Would definitely do this again and stay here.

Polite and efficient staff on reception always makes a good start to a hotel stay. The room was nicely decorated and apart from the bench under where suitcases are presumably meant to sit was very clean (routine vacuuming here needed). The bed was comfortable and the linen nice and fresh.  The WiFi was reasonably fast and we had good reception on the 8th Floor.  We would go back to this hotel and do recommend it to others.

We had two iPhones, two iPads and two laptops that need to be charged overnight. We know we weren't the only ones suffering from a lack of sockets. We use our portables as our alarm clocks and also like to listen to the radio last thing at night and first thing in the morning having no sockets whatsoever by the headboard was inconvenient.    Seats in the lobby were few and not comfortable - meeting up with others need precise timing.

On the plus side, if you get a good rate then the hotel is very good value. It is also well located for My Son, Hoi An and Marble Mountain. The food and drink is also well priced. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The rooms are nice and clean and quiet and the beds are very comfortable. Mosquitos were not a problem. The concierge/ tour desk were very helpful. Management were quick to respond and rectify when there was a problem with our room at check in.

On the downside. There is limited food selection for lunch and dinner. Cocktails are inconsistent. Service is very slow. Tea and coffee service at breakfast has to be requested for each cup, no-one is available. There is no service round the pool or on the beach.

Although the hotel was reasonable value for money as in Central London, we weren't very happy with the food or the facilities - we paid for continental breakfast and I don't think I have ever had a poorer breakfast in a hotel.  It was difficult to find anything edible - only toast, cereal and cheap swiss rolls.  The facilities in the room and at the hotel weren't great either - no tea / coffee making facilities, no bar, nothing really.  This hotel is reasonable if you intend to spend very little time in it and only using it as a base but would be very depressing otherwise!

Lack of info on what is actually included when you book. e.g. there's a BIG difference between All Inclusive and Full Board (Not only does Full Board exclude ALL drinks even the soft drinks at 2euros each can add up by the end of the week.. However, Full Board also excludes access to the indoor swimming pool/fitness facilities which you had to pay 10euro's per visit. With the outdoor pool being pretty cold due to the moderate Easter weather, the kids couldn't spend too much time in the out door pool.     Labelling of vegetarian / variety of food - was quite repetitive. Some members of our group were vegetarians & struggled as there were hardly any veggie options. A lot of items were incorrectly labelled as not containing meat which could have been quickly corrected by putting a green "V" against the labels.. Even the mixed salads contained meat/fish. With improvisation & friendly staff, everyone still had a great time & would visit again but would be wiser with our booking..
Good, calm atmosphere. Nice kiddies playground with free on site child supervision we weren't expecting :)

Le Meridien Abu Dhabi is a long established hotel, We first stayed there over 20 years ago, the décor and interior has changed little, however it now has an old world charm about it. Ok it may not have the very latest in high tec and amenities but it is clean and tidy although a little worn around the edges, but the service is excellent. Very good value if you want sunshine, a nice pool to sit around during the day and next door to the Abu Dhabi Mall where you can get all your shopping and food if you don't want hotel restaurants
The mobile phone sellers who are outside in the next door car park (once you leave the hotel confines) that pester you every time you walk out to the shops or restaurants

This hotel was much worse than I was expecting. Although relatively cheap in comparison to hotels in the uk for a similar price it is far below standard. The room was grotty, sheets and towels were clean but cushions on the bed were filthy. We had a family living outside the window so didn't really feel comfortable opening the curtains.   The most annoying thing is that it advertises a pool and the pictures show lovely rooms, but when we got there, the pool was empty and the room was nothing like the picture. We didn't sample any food so can't comment on that. Lobby bar is as pictured and very nice. Location is great and when we did look out the window we did have a sea view.   If you are looking for a budget hotel with no facilities in a good location then this hotel is fine, just be aware it is not how they advertise it.

The hotel is located off a narrow street if you walk from the Termini. The entrance is very bright and we were welcomed by the Italian reception staff. Our room was very new and clean with everything you wanted including bedroom slippers, a nice touch. To our surprise the bed was electric allowing for various setting including watching the TV. Breakfast was a very generous an great choice of hot or cold food to cater for most tastes. Real Cappuccino coffee was available on request. A delightful typically Italian stylish hotel, you will not be disappointed.
We have no negative comments to make.

The hotel in located on a remote part of Phi Phi island only accessible using a long tail boat. If you   Want to go to the main city, plan on spending $1000 baht each way. But if you want remote, quite, and away from everything, this is your spot. Ideal for older couples.

Hotel was always very clean and although it was very busy the staff still tried to get you drinks and are always willing to help. When asked for a room they did there best to get the required room and even acknowledged my note saying it was a suprise 21st birthday and they supplied a cake which was very good. I booked a boat trip with ETS in the hotel and I must say it was really good.  The jetty which leads out to see was amazing with so many different kinds of fish and if your lucky you may even see dolphins.

They had loads of choice of food but I felt for a 5 star the quality was not great, there was also a lack of toilets when around the pool area during the day. I do advise getting a red flag from reception as you have a lot of people from the hotel trying to sell you spa and diving etc. when asked to play pool they said its 8 euros for 1 hour which again for a 5 star I think is really bad and throughout my 2 weeks I did not see anyone in there.

Great hotel with amazing views over the marina. Good walking distance to a number of restaurants and Fethiye central. Room was clean, modern and comfortable for the stay. Staff were friendly and courteous throughout, had a slight issue with the reservation which they cleared up with minimal impact for us. Breakfast had a good buffet selection and you could request eggs to be made fresh for you. Had some friendly waiting staff that made you feel welcome including Ali who was always on hand to have a friendly chat and offer recommendations. Would definitely recommend a stay at Alesta.

Excellent accomodation in a great part of Glasgow. We travelled with 2 other couples and rented the 3 bed penthouse. Each bedroom had its own en suite in addition to a main bathroom meaning getting ready for a night out was hassle free. The kitchen was really well equipped if you want to cook ( we just did breakfast in) and even had a dishwasher. Staff were all really friendly. Will be returning.
Only very slight negative is that it doesn't have its own parking but very few places do in the city . Parking is at a reduced price of £6 a day on the NCP which is on the opposite side of the road.

The staff was really warm and friendly, all of them. The hotel had a classy feel, with impressive architecture. Some little attentions gave the extra touch: a welcome drink while the luggage was placed in the rooms, free parking, Easter eggs with Easter, free breakfast package at the room door before 5AM on check-out day,... Excellent value for money.
Minor remark: we often had to wait long for an elevator (3 elevators, 379 rooms, 9 levels), probably because of full-capacity in the Easter week.

This hotel is the best value for money I have experienced and I have been a business traveller to 5* hotels for over 10 years! A small and totally dedicated team make this family run hotel a totally enjoyable experience from check in to departure. Beautiful big clean pool. Ample breakfast catering for the international clientele and excellent evening meals from either set menu or a la carte. Lovely peaceful setting with great mountain views. Easily accessible to Kyrenia with nearby bus service. I highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent location 30m off Taksim Square and thus in walking distance from Istiklal Ave (sp?) and the subway station. Hotel was clean and given the pricing of surrounding properties, very good value for money. Breakfast was quite ok.

Maybe it's a Turkish-culture thing but friendliness and service mentality are not something the hotel really stood out with. Forget about sleeping in past 8am....somehow they have staff phones placed around the place with the same annoying ring tone that keeps going and going and going...every morning. Lastly, rooms are somewhat small but then again we are not paying for a suite either :-)

Staff on reception, notedly Renee  who was a trainee but was really knowledgeable and helpful. Yvonne in the breakfast place was totally lovely and helpful.   The  Seaworld quick pass was fantastic and a real advantage  The room which was a delux was spacious and  comfortable and the toiletries were Aveda! ( bonus!)  Excellent value for money as a quality and even better if you wish to visit Seaworld.

Being picky, the early morning staff in Starbucks were possibly the most unfriendly bunch from Starbucks  I have ever  encountered. And I drink a lot of Starbucks!  Poor attitude and a real lack of engagement. Not massively overwhelmed By the guys in the bar opposite either which is a real shame.   Wifi in the room is expensive and so is the water.  The 20 dollar deal may work if you have kids eating breakfast but was not a good deal for us. Especially as it has to apply to the whole of your stay even if you arrive late  and leave early as we did.   Finally and as I say I am being picky I know but I guess I am the one who is paying .... we had a room that connected to another. Great if you are traveling with family. Not so great if you are not, have had an early morning and a long flight and there is an excitable family of five next door still being excitable at midnight. Sound proofing or an adults only floor would be a real selling point!!

I stayed here at Easter with my 7yr old and my dad. We had 2 rooms in Sahara block, my dad's single room was on the 5th floor, perfect size for one person with a fantastic balcony. Our room was the floor below, the room was on the small side but perfect for us. The food at meal times was varied with lots of choice. The staff at every part of the hotel were excellent, reception, bar staff, dining room staff, cleaners all were pleasant and happy to help

The first rooms we were given were in the Nubia block, the rooms were small, very scruffy and the mattresses on the beds were extremely uncomfortable, also the room doors were not secure, given a had enough push anyone could enter the room. When I asked to move rooms, the man at reception helped me right away

N also, on my second night, I came back from shopping at about 11pm, there were no electricity, even when I've inserted the hotel card into the slot. We had a generally good experience at the Quality Inn (formally called the Comfort Inn). The staff were helpful and pleasant. Whilst geographically central, you will need a vehicle to get anywhere (including shops and restaurants etc). The need for a vehicle seems to be something that is common to a lot of the Phoenix.    The rooms are clean and well maintained. There is tea, coffee and paper cups provided in the room, however there are no milk/creamer, plates or cutlery. The front desk seems happy to oblige with any requests for these types of things.    The room service appears to be provided by a third party. It was a little expensive, but the food was tasty and portion sizes large. The hotel breakfast had a reasonable range of food selections. My partner enjoyed the pool and spa.    For the price we paid, we feel we got value for money here.

Room & hotel in general: Excellent! The room is clean and spacious. I had a pool-view room and the views were lovely! the garden is nice too and you can just sit and relax there. There's international dance performance in the evening on Tuesday and it's a great show.  Staff: The staff from the reception to the bar were all professional, helpful, and cheerful.  Food: The breakfast and dinner were great! There's a large varierty of food to choose from and the quality is good.   Location: It's not in a busy area and is quite 'remote'. But here is a bus stop outside of the hotel and the bus will take you to Protaras, Ayia Napa, etc, in 20-30 mins for EUR1.5 per way. There's also a restaurant outside and the food is good.  Sports: You can ask about the scuba diving tour at the reception or you can rent a bicycle for EUR10 per day. The pool is very pretty too.    I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Internet: Since I stayed there in April (not peak season), the hotel staff let me use their wifi for free. But it would be great if the hotel could provide their guests with free wifi (even just an hour of access each day) in the future.

I really enjoyed the clean environment and the helping, friendly staff, especially my full-time counter friend who checked me in. I have forgotten her name.  The hotel too is well equipped and provides a very relaxing atmosphere.

I think you have to improve on your breakfast to include baked beans, fried eggs or fried bacon at the least. Breakfast was rather very poor, compared with the previous two hotels I had stayed in Mallorca before coming to you, and my general hotel experiences in other countries. In my previous two hotels, their breakfast was very rich to include fried mushrooms, fried eggs, boiled eggs, scramble eggs, ham, fried bacon, bakings, baked beans, suasages, veg. etc.  You don't have to do even half as much because those hotels were more expensive and more stars than yours., but just provide the basic ingredients to go with bread. For some reasons, my room was not as warm as I would have wanted it to be. May be this was only a personal experiences and did not affect thoer people. In that case you may not need to warm up rooms.

Very unreliable WiFi internet connection in common areas. Didn't work on 3 days of our one week stay.     Most of the indoor swimming pool was blocked by an Aqua Fitness Class from 11am to midday everyday. During our stay it was too cold to use the outdoor swimming pool.     Charges were not transparent at time of booking. Towels and bedlinen were extras, we did not even get one free set to start with. The TV was extra and had to be paid for separately.     The charges below must be stated clearly on the website at the time of booking:    Bedlinen                   8 Euro per person per set  Towels                      8 Euro per person per set  Television                 42 Euro per week  Final Cleaning          57 Euro per house/ 100 Euro per apartment  Daily Cleaning          17 Euro per hour

We booked this for just one night on our way back from further East. Apart from us, everyone seemed to be on a package holiday. The staff seemed stunned when being addressed in Turkish and even my English-speaking partner was continously being spoken to in German. Dinner was devoid of anything Turkish. Do people really want to eat stodgy German food when on holiday? That said, there were lots of salad choices. Unfortunately, another hotel decided to play very loud cheesy music from 10 pm onwards - even earplugs didn't help much. Russia Today was the only English TV choice - certainly provides an 'interesting' world view.

Had a great holiday, staff friendly and helpful plus spoke really good English.  Good choice of food and plenty of it in the restaurant, good choice of drinks in the bar.  Pool very clean though a bit cold due to it being April.  Would use this hotel again and recommend to a friend.

Would have given a higher score for cleanliness if I had not found used false nails in the drawer, also under the bed was a full of dust and fluff. Other than that bed and bathroom ,spotless.  If I was to be picky I'd suggest they vary the menu in the snack bar, though the kids loved having chips and chocolate   do-nuts, followed by pizza and nuggets.

Great location and very friendly staff.  Had a drink "on the house". Brilliant hotel located right behind the Las Vegas strip. Arrived here with 4 friends for a few nights in Vegas, and were immediately impressed with the professionalism of the staff when we arrived. Our room was massive, we paid a bit extra for an upgrade but we probably didn't need to! Hotel is joined to the Bellagio, so gives you great access to all the surrounding hotels/casinos/bars/restaurants etc. The Cosmopolitan is a short walk (less than 2mins) and has a fantastic selection of restaurants, shops and of course the casino.
Lack of proper restaurant means you have to go elsewhere for a good meal, but with the selection on offer within 5mins walk its really not that big a problem at all.

Stayed for one day only but great location, about 15 mins walk to the Old City. An improvement would be free wifi in the rooms, you have to sit in the lobby for that but in the round a good hotel for the price.

we have stayed at the Murmuri previously and it doesn't get any better in Barcelona.  this kelly hoppen designed hotel is perfect in every way.  it is better than the majority of the 5 star hotels and being a sister hotel of the Majestic  you can use its pool and facilities which is only a 5 minute walk away.  the Boca Grande fish restaurant down the side of the hotel is wonderful and a hidden gem,  2 blocks down on the right the Catalana tapas bar is buzzing with a great atmosphere and great tapas.  a wonderful part of Barca to stay in away from the tackiness of the Las Ramblas!

We booked Crown Palace, 2 double rooms. We arrived in the middle of the night ( 03,00 ). There was nobody who could speak english. We didnt get our rooms. They said that we ought to be in Crown Serenity. Even if I show them our papers, where everything was Crown Palace. After 1 hour and many german speaking staff, they throw our passports to our faces and told us to go to hell out of here. We had to go 10km to Serenity hotel which is cheaper hotel and in the middle of nowhere. In serenity it took 1 hour to fight our rooms...because we didnt had vouchers...only  Hotelopia´s paper with our booking to Crown Palace. It was 6,30 in the morning when we got our rooms and had a rest. We never go there again. I think its a criminal thing to lie people, and send them where ever they want. I hope somebody from Hotelopia or Crown Hotels contacts  me and tell, what the hell was going on.

The hotel is in a good location with attractive views out to sea. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I had a superior room on the 6th floor and it was spacious, comfortable and clean. The single bed was very comfortable. Pleasant grounds with large attractive pool (which I didn't use as it was too cold) and plenty of sunbeds. Decent sized heated indoor pool. Gym has two treadmills, two cross-trainers, one rower, all in working condition. Easy parking near the hotel. Free wifi in the lobby.
The gym needed a "multigym" piece of apparatus to be really good. The heaviest weights available were 5kg which isn't enough to get a good workout.

There are shops walking distance and eateries close if you dont want to eat at hotel. Beach is across the road and tours are easy to arrange at hotel..The hotel has a great relaxing atmosphere.We would definitely come back here next time.

A few of the hotel managers were extremely helpful, as were some of the staff. The location of the hotel is excellent, it's perfectly positioned to explore Playa Blanca on foot and two nice beaches are a few minutes walk away. The hotel has a very convenient back gate which saves u walking all the way around to get to the beach or high street. The night life of the hotel is wonderful! The hotel lobby just seems to come to life in the evening. There was entertainmemt for children, live music and a section were elderly people were dancing, which was brilliant. And another hall were families were watching another live band performing popular hits. I abosolutely loved the hotel and am in the process of arranging to return again next year this time with the children.

A few days before we were where due to fly out I received an email saying they had overbooked the hotel and were transferring us to their sister hotel down the road. I put my foot down and refused to leave and was eventually allowed to remain at the Lanzarote Princess. I think better organisation is needed to avoid this happening in the future, as I've heard this has happened on a few occassions. The hotel they try to move you to is nice but is not as well positioned, so it's a bit unfair to do this to customers.

The breakfast was plentiful and tasty    But the thing that made this hotel great was the staff.  They could not do enough for you.  They were friendly and super helpful and your every need was catered for

Very central location just a few minutes walk from Liceu underground station and Las Ramblas. Staff were very friendly and helpful and let us use the dining room on the morning of my birthday so I could have a champagne breakfast. I bought cakes and drinks but we had access to coffee at no extra charge.  checking out is 12;00 noon which is ideal as it means you can still enjoy a few hours in the Boqueria market, just round the corner or a leisurely stroll along La Rambla if you are catching an early flight out from El Prat.  We had a large walk in shower and everything was very clean.  Free wifi was available in our room.
no tea/coffee making facility in room itself, only on the ground floor lobby (Tassimo machine) at 1 euro per drink. But really, positive features outweighed this one negative

Having booked for a special birthday celebration weekend, we were very disappointed that our room did not have a splendid view of the Tower Bridge or London skyline, as indicated by the advertising speak. We were faced with a concrete tower and brown peeling paint...

The room was quite compact, but fine when not spending all day in your room. The bonus was it had a kitchenette and a door onto a tiny balcony for fresh air and to see what the weather was like. It was very clean, which was top priority and beds were comfortable. As Fraser's is down a lane, there is little traffic noise. It is centrally located and we found it within easy walking distance to the shops and other CBD attractions. I would stay again and I am fussy about my accommodation.

The negatives were few. The rooms are not completely sound proof from the hall way, which only bothered us one night out of eight and there is only one chair in the room - bit annoying when there are two people.

We stayed here for just one night as we were attending an event at the nearby NIA, which is just 10 minutes walk away from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean and adequate for our needs. The room which was on the 6th floor was very quiet, and although being told that the hotel was full that night, we had a very quiet nights sleep with no disturbances inside or outside the hotel. The buffet style breakfast is of a very good standard, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Another plus point is that the bathroom has a great shower and all the toiletries you need provided.

The car parking is a bit vague, we missed the hotel car park as it wasn't obvious despite having a sat nav .We parked in a car park which was just next door, and was cheaper than the hotel car park. As we didn't know Birmingham city centre, we decided to have a meal in the hotel before the concert. We asked for a menu at the bar, and we were surprised to find only 3 choices on the menu. These were 2 kinds of burger and chilli con carne, we opted for the latter, and sat alone in the dining room for the entire time we took for our meal, which wasn't particularly tasty. However when we left the hotel we understood the reason why the menu was so limited, there is a wealth of restaurants and bars on the doorstep. The other little gripe is not enough tea/coffee/milk facilities in the room.

The staff were friendly and saw to our needs promptly. They were also apologetic for any mishaps that may have occurred. We called to request for teaspoons to be sent up to the room for us to make coffee/tea and they were prompt. They even called to check if we had received it. Excellent job! We will definitely be returning to this hotel again.

Upon checking in at the hotel, we had to wait an hour for a smoking room, although it was already requested through our booking. When we got into the room, we noticed small blood stains on the quilt cover and gel like or water stains on the bed sheet. We called for housekeeping to get the sheets changed and my boyfriend was watching. He also noticed more stains on the mattress protector. The staff were very apologetic and changed the sheets and mattress protector for us. Overall though, we had a good night's sleep and a great stay.

there was a young man names adam at breakfast time who was brilliant .Nothing too much trouble fantastic customer service thanks .Made us feel welcome.On check out a lady named Beata was very much the same very cheerful ,great checkout experience.The room was lovely we were upgraded to an executive suite as they could not find my booking

On arrival we were not greeted,we had just had a 3 and a half hour journey and were tired.we usually stay at the best western up the road from here and we are always made to feel welcome there.So we arrived and were not greeted by a man named Andre.I said hello and we would like to check in,no smile no hello .Just looked at my paper i presented and began to type on the keyboard.After a few minutes i asked if there was a problem to which he said he could not find my booking...i said would you like me to call hotelopia? he said yes we dont use them i have never herard of them ! i was a bit fed up at this point and so was my husband.I began to dial ....andre then asked if it could be under beds? we dont know we dont work at the hotel! after a few more minutes i asked have you found it ,he said yes to which i said you could have let me know !! im really not happy at this point.They did not have the room we booked so we ended up with an executive suite.It was a dredful check in and he was completely rude i wouldnt book again because of this we were not made to feel welcome on arrival and it just topped our day off really,unpleasent start to our weekend break

I booked 1 night after staying at Jumeirah beach as my flight was early morning. It's very cheap, I only paid £37 as I wanted a base for the last day. Check in efficient and service was impeccable as always in Dubai. Although the pool area was a little basic, towels were provided and it was nice just to have a chill out before the flight home. Rooms very basic so wouldn't recommend for long stays but for the money it was what I expected. The hotel offered a complimentary bus to various places so I made most of this and went to the mall and Burj Khalifa.  All in all a pleasant stay and would book again.

It's not in the best location although they have the shuttle service there wasn't anywhere in the immediate area if you wanted to eat out. Taxis are so cheap in Dubai though so getting out and about isn't an issue.

Big pool and the location was perfect right on the beach, we had no trouble getting a sun lounge around the pool at any point of the day however it was little harder to get one at the beach.

We were unaware that we had originally booked the part of the hotel that was across the road and not near the pool or beach but were lucky enough to upgrade for $20 a night which was worth it to be closer to the pool and facilities. Make sure if you want to be on the pool/beach side that you book the standard room.  Every night the hotel had activities/dancers/shows that started at 9:30pm and the music was so loud that we could feel it vibrating through our room. If like to sleep before 10:30/11pm or have young children that are in bed before then then you will have a lot of trouble sleeping.

It is a very bad hotel. Not clean. Very old building. Not renovated. Even my room did not have a single light. They were all broken. Unlike reported in your website, there were no fridge, tea or coffeemaker and iron in the room. You should not exagurate hotel facilities in your website, though  this hotel did not have any facility. The hotel is situated in the 4th floor of an old building without any lift or elevator provided for guests (There is a lift, but for private use of Mr. owner!). A disgusting smell of sour air is all over the stairs and corridors. The bed in the room was broken and it made a horrible noise by a tiny movement. I could not sleep properly on that bed for two nights during my stay in the Hell Suvenir! Actually, I am very upset about Hotelpedia. I trusted you and then I found my vocation ruined! I feel so used. From now, I will never trust you again.
The only positive thing about the hotel is that it is close to city center

It has everything that we want. It is in a superb location, maybe 5 minutes to Krakow's Main Square. Closer are the central railway station and the impressive Krakowskie Shopping Centre.The breakfasts are superb with a large range of hot and cold food served as a buffet. The staff are helpful but discreet and all speak perfect English. The rooms are great with high ceilings and large windows that can be fully opened. The hotel was always quiet and a haven of calm.
Rooms do not have air-conditioning so be prepared to leave your windows open overnight in warm weather.

Probably one of the better buffets we have experienced. Lots of choice and quality was very good. AI Drinks with some premium brands such as Jim Beam, Bacardi, Martini, Smirnoff as well as CruzCampo bottled beer and bottled Coke and Sprite. Found the staff very friendly and did not experience any of the negativity reported towards Brits in previous reviews.  Lovely little Bay with stunning views and waters.

Entertainment is in an outside area and the design of the hotel means that it carries throughout so as with previous reviews if you want/need an earlier night it isn't quiet. Noisy neighbours with loud TV but that isn't the fault of the hotel. Rooms are OK but not 4 star and beds are quite hard.

The rooms on the 2nd floor is nice - bigger & with balcony more of a suites. The one on the ground floor is smaller, worn out and no balcony. I stayed twice in this hotel one week on the 2nd floor and couple days on the ground floor when I came back from Tobago. Ask to be transfer to the 2nd floor when there is availability and you won't regret it. Good value for the money, near to small market store & restaurants (McDonalds one block on the other side - if you like), centrally located. Most of the bldgs. in this area are old so this is no exception but its well maintained and clean. Wi-Fi weak inside the room but strong outside hallway & lobby - just like any big hotel. No breakfast here so prepare your own breakfast there is a stove, microwave & refrigerator. I rather have no breakfast than pay more for breakfast I may not like & repetitive. Make your reservation early as it get filled up by locals. Safe surrounding, I walk around 10:30pm coming from the restaurant by the Queens Park nothing happen no suspicious activity observed, and check out at the hotel at 4am. I refute those dangerous comment! Travel 101 don’t attract attention, keep your profile low and leave your valuable at home, and don’t stay late alone.

Excellent homes.     Booked 3 bedroom, got 4 double bedrooms. House was very clean and quite big, located in a very well maintained gated community named 'emerald', 5 minutes from disney and 15 min from outlets stores.
Minor things in the house. Homes are privately owned and some items in the house were a bit outdated. But overall still very good.

The self contained bungalows were great for a few days to stay in either if you wanted to self cater, or go half/full/all incl. Modern poolside area with plenty of loungers/umbrellas (although we were there at a quieter time). Good quality free wifi when outside of the bungalows or by the pool. Free shuttle down to the beach.

This is only a negative for me in that the complex is very family orientated so many kids around and I'm not a fan of family orientated poolside entertainment. To be fair to the entertainers they did a very professional job but sometimes i just wanted to lie there and chill and not be bothered.

I had booked on line from South Africa - my credit was debited in full at booking this accommodation. I was already on holiday in Turkey when I luckily enough had free wifi - only to see an email that the hotel was fully booked. We were advised to go elsewhere. Unfortunate that this booking site is happy to take your money but then send email a few days prior to us arriving that we are no longer booked into the accommodation. I had done research and wanted to stay in that accommodation - surely there is something on the booking system that says they are full; thereby advising that there is no available accommodation.

Hotel was close to union square & most other facilities. Staff were helpful & the security staff made you feel safe when arriving back to the hotel later in the evening. I guess for the price you couldn't expect too much more.

We stayed in a double room with our 3 year old son. The hotel was older than what was shown in their pictures, but I guess good enough for what you pay. It is located in the tenderloin which we would have preferred to avoid exposing our son to. There was a stain on the wall & toward the end of our stay our toilet blocked - this was fixed as soon as we advised them of the issue. The elevator was out of order for our whole stay (6 nights), so being on the 4th floor became a bit tedious toward the end of our stay.  There aren't any laundry facilities close by, which is also inconvenient when travelling with a child.

I would return to this hotel if I return to the city again.   I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.
We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis.  The breakfast was good, however I have had better breakfasts in lover starred hotels.

Excellent hotel, apartment and studios are clean and well stocked kitchen. Maid service everyday and clean sheets/towels.  Staff very helpful and polite. Gardens and pool area beautifully kept and the hotel is in a great area, only 25 mins from the airport and in reach of bars, restaurants and nightlife if you want it, but because a 10 minute walk to this area, it is quite around the hotel which is lovely.
Don't go around Bank Holiday time as lots of Stags/Hens and it could spoil your holiday, especially when you have children and want a quiet relaxing time round the pool.

Having stayed here a number of times in the late '80's/early '90's I was pleased that so much of what made Hatta Fort Hotel great, is still the case. The bathrooms have clearly been recently refurbished & are excellent. The rooms are spacious & well appointed. The locale, grounds & pool are delightful. Great development of kids/family pool well away from main pool so it's very quiet there. Completely relaxing. Shame the archery is at extra cost - would be nice if that was included. But great now has free wifi in central areas & pool.

Quality & choice of foods has dropped - very generic now, used to include many more middle eastern/asian type food which was much better. Menu's could do with an upgrade - style is very outdated. Only negative about the rooms is that they need better lighting (& always have done) as they are a bit dark, especially at the 'dressing table' area, but that is a fairly minor gribble.

Stayed here previously with 1 friend so chose to come again. Good decision as the stay was as good, if not better, than it was first time round in all aspects. The staff were friendly and accommodating -  we arrived before check in time but nothing was too much trouble. Reception staff checked to ensure our room was ready and accommodated us without issue. Room was comfortable, clean with a great range of toiletries. Sea view was breathtaking. Just the one issue was the overlooking of the fact we had booked for 3 and supplies in the room (robes/towels etc) were for 2. Breakfast the following morning was good standard and relaxed promenade view. Courtesy room was offered to help us later on in the day prepare for our trip home. We will return!

The service is excellent, the staff are very helpful,   The hotel has a beautiful 1970s feel.  All the furniture in the rooms have solidly built furniture.  The staff are all (old school), so they know how to run a hotel.  My car was valet parked for me and my luggage was taken to my room,   A service that is probably only available at the Ritz!   Excellent value for money.
There is nothing negative about this hotel.

When booking the silver room (cheapest) website states 2 singles OR double..This is false, when I arrived I was told double beds are not an option for this room type..I had to pay extra for the upgrade..they did say that wifi was complementary with the upgrade due to the inconvenience, my brothers upgraded to king size beds, both being over 6ft tall only to find out when they went to bed it was just two singles pushed together...so beware when booking king size beds. Overall i enjoyed most of the experience but when i return i will stay elsewhere.

It's a good hotel equipped with necessary facilities, and have professional service staffs.  It locates in downtown Shanghai, and convenient to meet with clients and customers.  There is free WiFi in lobby area, and no need to use password to connect.
There is a business center, but if you want to use it you have to pay for it.

Beautiful hotel. The staff just can't do enough for you, they are so courteous and helpful. The pool area is lovely and you get a nice sea view, with Atlantis in the background. The breakfast is very nice, though a bit limited. The beds are amazingly comfy. Overall it is defo a 5* hotel and I will surely visit again.

It's a bit far from the airport and the main city centre so had to rely on taxis. We used the metro on a few occasions but even that is a 15min walk away so had to get the bus. The lifts are very slow and there's not enough of them. The wifi doesn't give very fast connection so they should invest in a faster service.

Staff were really friendly, rooms were clean and looked to be recently refurbished, food selection was pretty good, location was ok as only a bus journey away from Dubrovnik old town. Due to it being part of a chain of hotels (Valamar) you were able to use the facilities at the other hotels, which was a bonus.
The only negative is the evening entertainment, it was pretty non-existent or maybe just a singer/band at the bar.

A modern hotel from the Spanish chain which has only been opened a year.  Good location in the business area on the dock and only a short walk to central station and direct trains to airport. We were on the 11th floor which had a great view over the city. We only ate breakfast there but offered a good choice. Staff friendly & polite. Whilst at breakfast a member of staff visited each table to check everything ok and what plans people had for the day and could she help with anything. She kindly offered to book a dinner reservation for us that evening at local restaurant and rang me to confirm. Would definitely recommend the hotel. Watch out for the cyclists!

Overall I could not fault this Hotel. Centrally located, and excellent value. The receptionist even wished me a happy birthday for the previous day.

We have stayed here a number times over the years since it opened. The hotel is in an excellent position for all the terminals at the airport and especially for terminal 2. It offers good value especially with car parking deals. The hotel is in the process of being totally refurbished with now all the public areas and the superior rooms and business class rooms having been completed

We stayed in a standard room which is looking tired and dated. The superior rooms on floors 6 &. 7 and the business class rooms on floors 8 & 9 have all now been totally refurbished and we had a look at one and we were very impressed . The business class lounge manager Ali Karsan showed us around and was very helpfull. There is an excellent business class club lounge on the 9th floor. The standard rooms on floors 4 & 5 will all be refurbished over this summer.
